<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I disagree with the statement that professional athletes should deserve lower salaries than now for the reasons I have mentioned above. <TR>First</TR>, millions of people can be happy because of famous athletes. <TR>Second</TR>, only a few athletes who experienced fierce competition could get high salaries.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right.  The second paragraph assumes far too much about the stressful lives of people without giving much proof.  Also, even though a few star players get an astonishing amount of money, the other professional players still get a pretty big paycheck, even if it isn't as big.  Your argument seems weak to me.  Try to make your thesis statement into one strong statement, and don't just repeat yourself in the conclusion.

column1: 86&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People should not pay to use public transportation.
column3:
<IN>It is evident that in our current society government policy has tremendous importance in our current life. Some people think that making public transportation free will cause a huge financial loss for government. <TS>I, <TR>however</TR>, believe that government should make public transportation free for citizens. There are several reasons for me to discuss my arguments so I will limit to the two which I feel are relevant to the topic: the concepts of efficiency and environment.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR> the most important reason for me to think this way is that government will use taxpayer’s money efficiently.</MI1> <SI1>It is imperative for government to allocate and use limited resources in country wisely. <TR>Thus</TR>, it can be said that it is better to make public transportation free because it will increase work efficiency of people who use public transportation. <EX>A recent news report I read on Korea Medical News Network revealed some interesting findings. <TR>Essentially</TR>, people who uses public transportation to work had lower stress level compared to people drive their own car to work. In the study in the article, many people driving their own car claimed that traffic jam causes a lot of stress. <TR>In the result</TR>, they experienced distraction and could not concentrate while they are working. This example clearly shows that government should make public transportation free in order to increase work efficiency. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR> another reason which proves my point is that using public transportation will play a significant role in solving environmental problems.</MI2> <SI2>If government make public transportation free, the number of people who drives their own car will decrease. <TR>As a result</TR>, air pollution caused by car emission will be reduced and air will be cleaner.<EX>A really good example can be seen in Pittsburgh, a city in United States. The city made public transportation free to promote clean air in downtown in late 20th century. Individuals happily participated because not only was it free, but also they knew it was for the environment. The number of people who uses public transportation instead of their own car has been doubled. This contributed to reduce greenhouse gas, primary causes of air pollution. This indicates that government should make public transportation free because of environmental issues.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All these things considered</TR>, with the reasons I mentioned above, I believe that I have sufficiently and adequately explained my position on the matters regarding this topic.</CO>
column23: Great essay!  This is a very well-defended and well-organized argument.  Please try to turn your thesis statement into one strong sentence.  Also, it is a good idea to summarize in different words the basis of your essay in the conclusion.

column1: 87&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds, cats, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Dogs have been one of human’s closest friends for thousands of years. It is not only that limited to dogs, but birds, cats, and other animals as well. Some people even raise snakes in their houses. <TR>In addition</TR>, when their pets die, people feel sorrow as their parents have died. <TS><TR>Consequently</TR>, having a close relationship with pets allows people to feel stability, not ruined, and gives energy. </TS></IN>
          <BO1><MI1> Having a close relationship with pets helps people to feel stability.</MI1> <SI1>People can actually release their stress just by looking at them because pets act cute. <EX>I once saw an article about benefits of having pets. The article said that pets help people to release stress by being friends to humans. <TR>For example,</TR> when a person is in sorrow, pets know that and consulate them.</EX> Everyone might know that it feels like the world is going to end when they are in grief. <TR>However</TR>, it helps a lot when somebody, for instance, it can be dog, cat, bird or anything, stays with them. <EX><TR>Furthermore</TR>, there was a research held by a university to know if pets are influential to a person’s life. They gave dogs, pigs, and cows to children who have mental illness. By playing, feeding, and being friends to each other, the children’s mental diseases were almost alleviated. </EX></SI1></BO1>
          <BO2><MI2> People know the value of themselves when they have a close relationship with pets.</MI2> <SI2>This is especially true to some people who are living alone and old. Most of the old think they are old enough and feel ruined. <TR>However</TR>, when they raise pets, they are raising someone who needs their attention. By raising the pets, people can know how valuable people they actually are. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I was in depression when I was in high school. I cried everyday for no reason when I was at home with my dog, and I felt like I am ruined. <TR>However</TR>, whenever I cried, my little dog came to me and played tricks on me. I was really annoyed at first, but by responding to my dog, I thought I must live since someone, my dog, needs me. This is my experience, but I heard about many other people who were in same situation I was in, and overcame with their pets.</EX></SI2></BO2>
           <BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, having a close relationship with pets is good for gaining energy.</MI3> <SI3>Usually, the animals we treat as our families are very small. By looking at them, people feel like they are looking at their babies’. Some people who do not like pets might oppose to this idea, but their mind will change if they raise pets. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my family first started to grow my pet, Sky, even though I did not like dogs. My mother did not like it either, but all of my family members except two of us liked it, so we chose to raise her. Before I took her from the pet store, I thought I would have tough life. <TR>However</TR>, it was not. She always encourages me when I am at home and just by looking at her, I could gain energy. This is only in my case, but other people who did not like animals at first but changed their minds by raising them would think as just as I think.</EX></SI3></BO3>
           <CO>Animals are best friends to humans. Although animals and humans have different languages and appearances, they can communicate by spirit. People having a close relationship with their pets can have positive impacts on both humans and pets. Pets can live without concerning their predators, like those living in the wild. <TR>In addition</TR>, people can feel stability and would know they are valuable people. Having a good relationship with them also gives energy. To be physically fulfilled, it is better to have a close relationship with their pets.</CO>
column23: A well-organized essay with good points and very heartfelt examples.  You express yourself well.  Excellent job!

column1: 88&Parents should not allow their children to watch television so that they can do well at school.
column3:
<IN>We, human being, have never had something more influential than television throughout the history. Since its invention, television started to spread out through all over the world, with developing technologies improving its quality. As it influences on the entire world in short period of time, many side effects such as television addiction, violent or sexual contents, and health related problems started to appear, and parents started to worry about their children’s watching television since they are susceptible to television addiction and violent or sexual contents, and it can hamper their school works. <TS><TR>However,</TR> television can be educationally beneficial to children when it is used correctly, so parent should allow their children to watch it.<TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, television has so many educational programs that help children’s learning academic things that are directly related to their school.</MI1> <SI1>Most parents only focus on negative aspects of television, <TR>however</TR>, and if they stop their children watching it, the children will miss many benefits. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in Korea, there is a broadcasting station called EBS (Educational Broadcasting Station), and it has only educational programs for children and teenagers. Since the lectures in the programs follow the standard school’s curriculum, students can watch them after school. From watching that programs, which are mostly lectures, children will definitely get help in understanding and learning things that are related to school. Additionally, teachers of the programs sometimes can teach watchers better than school teachers since they are more experienced and qualified.</EX></SI2></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, programs like news, scientific documentaries, and debating programs, not directly related to schools’ curriculums though, can increase children’s overall intelligence and can give diverse information.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Before my preschool, even though I could not understand perfectly, I watched so many scientific documentaries that deal with many kinds of studies such as geography, biology, ecology, and sociology. I could get much information and general knowledge about the subjects from watching television, and understood school’s lectures so easily when I entered preschool. <TR>Furthermore<TR>, even now I get many chances to think and learn about politics, and social problems by watching news and debating programs.</EX></SI2></BO2>
column23: This is an excellent essay except for one thing: where is your conclusion?

column1: 89&Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that it is better to stay quiet and keep a friendship by letting a friend make a mistake. <TS><TR>Nevertheless</TR> I strongly believe that the friends should prevent each other from making mistakes even though there is a risk of losing each other, because friends are suppose look after each other, and if a word of advice ruins a friendship then, it would eventually be ruined someday.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, Friends should worry about each other and move forward together in a positive way.</MI1> <SI1>A friend who just let the other friend make a mistake is not a true friend. As Martin Luther King Jr. said “Nothing in the world is more dangerous than the sincere ignorance,” ignoring is not helpful for anybody, especially for a friend. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was in high school, I decided not to go to college and to start to work right after the graduation. Everybody in my class whom I considered as my friends knew about it, but no one said anything about it. <TR>Back then</TR>, I thought I made the right decision. <TR>Yet</TR>, one of my friends from other class has heard my situation and came to convince me to go to college. He said that I can see the bigger world and achieve more if I go to college. I eventually became convinced and now I go to Princeton University and study economics. If it were not for that friend, I may be flipping patties at McDonoald’s.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, a friend who turns his or her back because of a sincere word of advice would not stay as a friend for a long time anyway.</MI2> <SI2>A True friend rather feels grateful about the advice and the friendship even strengthens. <TR>To be specific</TR>, according to research conducted by the National Research Foundation of Korea, about 80 percent of the people answered that they want true words from their friends when they are taking foolish actions. <TR>Moreover</TR>, 75 percent of the people said they might feel bad at first, but would thank the friend who has given an advice consequently. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people do not have to worry about destroying their friendship over giving helpful advice.<SI2></BO2>

<CO>Some people do not prevent their friends from making a mistake for some reasons. <TR>Nonetheless</TR>, friends should look after each other in any circumstances and should not be afraid of giving correcting friends because true friends acknowledge advice. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is better to be brave and stop a friend from making a mistake than to let them suffer from making a mistake. </CO>
column23: Your thesis statement is very strong in this essay!  Good job!  Your second paragraph is also very strong - you use a very good example and even add some humor.  That is wonderful.  The third paragraph is a little heavy on transitions, but overall it is quite good too. Also, your conclusion is stronger than some of your past conclusions. Very nice job!

column1: 90&Some people like to travel with a companion. Other people prefer to travel alone. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>Travel is the best way to refresh one’s mind and soul. By getting to know different places and people, we create memorable moments that will be remembered for the rest of our lives. <TS>Although some people may assert that travel is to have personal time alone, I firmly believe that the trip will be even more enjoyable with a companion. Not only does make our trip more meaningful, but also it leads us to easier and relaxed journey.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can experience more when we travel with companions.</MI1> <SI1>Since everyone has different preference and opinions, we will discuss with each other while we travel. <TR>Therefore</TR>, a companion’s different ideas and knowledge will allow us more opportunity for new experiences. <EX><TR>To give you an idea</TR>, here is an example from my own experience. When I was on a trip to San Diego, I had to wake up early in the morning to see a sunrise since my fellow traveler urged me to. I was complaining and irritated but when I saw the sunrise, it was the most magnificent sight I have ever seen. I might have missed it if I was traveling alone.</EX> <TR>For this reason</TR>, it is better to traveling with a companion whom we can exchange ideas with.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, travel is more efficient with fellow travelers.</MI2> <SI2>When we are alone, traveling can be exhausting will all the work we have to deal with. Such as making plans, driving, booking hotels and all that sort of things. But if we can share our duties with others, it will be a lot easier. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when my family decides to go on a trip, my mom makes plans. <TR>Then</TR>, my dad drives us to the place. <TR>Finally</TR>, I become a family photographer and took everyone’s pictures. <TR>That way,</TR> our family gets to enjoy our trip without being overwhelmed by work.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In Conclusion</TR>, I think it’s a great idea to travel with companions rather than to travel alone. It not only allow us chances to have different exprience, but also lightens the load of work during our trip. <TR>Consequently</TR>, I prefer to have someone when I travel.</CO>
column23: Great essay! You have very good points and your examples defend them very well.  Great job.  Your use of transitions in the 3rd paragraph is excellent.  I suggest making your thesis statement into one strong statement and taking out one of the transitions in the conclusion - you don't need two.

column1: 91&What is a very important skill a person should learn in order to successful in the world today? Choose one skill and use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is evident that the introduction of the Internet ushered humanity into a new age of technology. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, internet is essential in modern society and has enriched and facilitated our lives in various ways. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, in my opinion, internet skill is the most fundamental skill people should learn in order to succeed in the world today.</TS></IN>

                 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, most of the work requires internet skills.</MI1> <SI1>There is no question that internet is connected to almost the whole part of a person’s life. Such as banking, shopping, job searching, booking a flight and so on. <TR>Therefore,</TR> even if the job you want is not specialized with computers, basic internet skills are necessary. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, you might think you don’t need internet skills to be successful as a cook. <TR>However</TR>, you may have to introduce your restaurant or purchase ingredients online.</EX> Now that internet has facilitated so many things in our lives, not knowing how to use it will be a huge disadvantage.</SI1></BO1>

                 <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, you can connect to the people all around the world by internet.</MI2> <SI2>Letting people know about you is very important in information-oriented society. If you have more people interested in you or your contents, you will have more chance to be successful. With your blog or through other websites, you can easily advertise yourself. <EX>One example could be PSY. He’s now a worldwide star with his big hit music video, ‘Gangnam Style’. He’s song wasn’t intended to target the world market, but it got so famous on Youtube, well known video sharing website. The video received more than 16 billion views and now he is having a world tour this year. Nobody would expect situations like this will happen if there was no internet.</EX></SI2></BO2>

                 <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, internet is an inevitable change in present day society with its great use. Internet skill is a basic quality most of the job and will provide you a chance to inform yourself to the world. <TR>Therefore</TR>, in order to be successful in this competitive society, we should be interested in learning internet skills.</CO>
column23: Another very good essay!  You make very good points and organize your thoughts well.  Try to avoid using more than one transition in the conclusion.

column1: 92&Many parts of the world are losing important natural resources, such as forests, animals, or clean water. Choose one resource that is disappearing and why it needs to be saved.
column3:
<IN>I think everything in this world is important. <TR>Therefore</TR>, choosing only one resource depends on personal philosophy about what is the most important. So the resource that I am considering as the most critical one in this world is forest for humanity. I suppose that many of people thinking about this topic may choose forest. I am going to talk my overview about this topic with two reasons.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, forest is first and the most important species of 'chain of prey'.</MI1> have you ever heard of 'chain of prey'? <SI1>it means that if A species is disappeared, B species which consider disappeared A species as prey will loose their prey. <TR>Therefore</TR> B species will die as soon as A species is removed. all these explanation about 'chain of prey' is to talk about how important forest is. Let's apply forest to explanation of 'chain of prey'. Imagine that there is no forest due to result of human activity. following the situation, every species, have eaten plants such as grass, known as harnivorous in this world will be disappeared due to no preys. as next stage, every species which have eaten harnivorous will be gone because of disappearing harnivorous considered as prey. <TR>At last</TR>, every forest and animals will be endangered to extinction.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, forest have provided us fresh air which is the most imperative element for human being since the globe was born.</MI2> <SI2>disappearing of animals as a prey for people is less worried than air. because we can get much more output like rice from agriculture than before due to development of technic.<TR> however</TR>, there is no technic to substitute from air pollution to fresh air. <TR>moreover</TR>, as air pollution is getting worse, many people are getting bad respiratory disease. it shows that importance of forest made fresh air is increasing. According to the article treating many NGOs that try to guard amazone forest as a heart of fresh air, we can suppose how important forest is for us and how big impact forest have on us.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all</TR>, even though I insist that the impact that forest have is the most important, every nature and resource such as fresh water, animals are also  important for humanity. <TR>therefore</TR> I believe that if we love every resources remaining still and use them for waste, we can live in better world.</CO>
column23: This essay has so much potential, but it needs a lot of work.  First of all, there is no thesis statement.  Second, you talk about a lot of ecological stuff, but it is pretty garbled.  You need concrete examples. Follow the food chain from a tree in the forest to what eats the tree to what eats the animal that eats the tree.  Your current explanation is too general and doesn't really have much to do with the forest at all.  Your second point about the forest as the lungs of the Earth is solid, but you need to make your supporting points stronger and use good examples.

column1: 93&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Always telling the truth is the most important consideration in any relationship.
column3:
<IN>Some people might think that people doesn't always need to tell the truth depend on the situations. <TR>However</TR> I have different opinion. <TS>I believe that always telling the truth is the most important consideration in any relationship for the following reasons.</TS></IN>  

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, Once you lose your trust from somebody, it is difficult to restore the faith.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, relationship is like a glass with full of faith: when the glass get break, it's hard to put it back together and impossible to make as same as it is before. <TR>Of course</TR>, a single lie won't break the relationship right away in some special relationship. <TR>However</TR> the lie will make a crack in the relationship and it will eventually break the glass. <TR>Therefore</TR>, there is no acceptable lie when it comes to the relationship because faith is hard to restore to its original state.<SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, relationship is long-term thing not a instant.</MI2> <SI1>Some people might think lying is sometime better than telling truth because it's easier. <TR>However</TR>, like I mention before, relationship is not a instant thing. It's more like long-term thing. If you lie to someone for your convenience, it might feel easier than telling truth but once the lie turn out it will make the situation more worse than you imagine. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, telling truth might be hard to say but it is way better choice if you consider the further future.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, relationship is all about the faith. Some people might think that a single lie are acceptable in some situation but it is not true. It is because even a single lie can break the faith and it is harder to back it originally and also it will eventually make the situation worse in the long-term. <TR>Therefore</TR> I strongly believe that we should tell the truth in any relationship no matter what.</CO>
column23: You are saying some good things in this essay, but your arguments would be stronger with examples.  Also, your second paragraph is swimming in trasitions.  Try to cut a few out.

column1: 94&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that it clothes are not related with people's behaviors. They insist that whatever clothes people wear, they will act according to their own characters.<TS> <TR>However</TR>, I do think that wearing different clothes affects our behaviors for two different reasons. <TR>First</TR>, uniforms make you act in a certain way whatever they are made for. <TR>Second,</TR> different clothes have different materials.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Uniforms are made for their own purposes, and saparate a certain group from the others.Therefore, people wearing an uniform automatically follow the group they are belonged to.</MI1> <SI1><EX>Let me take my experience as an example. When I was in high school, I had to wear a school uniform. Whenever I was wearing it, everyone could know where I was from and even what my name was, so these eyes made me be careful and behave in the way how students should be.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2>We all know that clothes are made for different purposes and have different materials to serve that purpose. Formal dresses are made for fancy events. They are usually formal and fabulous, but we don't wear these clothes in daily basis; it is hard to feel comfortable in them compared to our pajamas. Although they are not as fancy as formal clothes, there is no clothes as good as pajamas for our bed times. It was reported that the first thing most people do after thay get home is changing their clothes to rest.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion, at first glance,</TR> it doesn't look like our behaviors are related to what we wear. <TR>However</TR> I strongly insist that our actions are depended on the clothes we wear for the reasons I have mentioned above. When we wear uniforms, we act according to the group that our uniforms indicate, and clothes made out of different materials make us act in different ways.</CO>
column23: This essay needs a lot of work.  The thesis statement needs to be shortened into one strong statement.  The second paragraph needs more substance.  The third paragraph has no part that I could call a main idea!  What is that paragraph trying to prove?

column1: 95&Some people believe that success in life comes from taking risks or chances. Others believe that success results from careful planning. What's your opinion?
column3:
<IN>There is a debate on whether success is resulted from plan or chance. <TS>I strongly believe that success is caused by carefully plan.</TS> This is because plan help people make a specificly purpose to be and cause people to be motivated.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, meticulously planned purpose help making certain way to achieve.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For instance<TR>, I have ever red book about person, named as Park Won Hi, who has admitted to enter Harvard school. From early age, she has planned to enter the school and make a fitted schedule on entering the school. She has planned to get high score on SAT and TOEFL so that she could get enough score being a student of harvard school. Finally she could be a scholarship student of Harvard school.</EX></SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR> making a exact plan to let dream come true is the most important step.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, specific plan trigger people to get motivated.</MI2> <SI2>What I mean is that making certain plan help people feel that dream becomes emotionally reality. In addition people are able to get fulfillment seemed like achieving dream in advance through plan. <TR>Therefore</TR> making plan must be a motivation to people so that they will be more likely to try to get success. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, people waiting luck or chance for being successed dont' try to come true dream. This is because their belief about success is not from effort but from chance.</SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR> exactly making paln for success is more helpful for people to come true.</BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all</TR>, without any efforts to let dream come true, There are many people waiting for coming chance to get success. <TR>However</TR> they will not feel fulfillment through success even if when they finally catch good chances to success.</CO>
column23: A lot of grammar, spelling, and semantic errors.

column3:

They insist that whatever clothes people wear, they will act according to their own characters. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I do think that wearing different clothes affects our behaviors for two different reasons. <TR>First,</TR> uniforms make you act in a certain way whatever they are made for. <TR>Second</TR>, different clothes have different materials.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1>Uniforms are made for their own purposes, and saparate a certain group from the others. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people wearing an uniform automatically follow the group they are belonged to.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Let me take my experience as an example.</TR> <EX>When I was in high school, I had to wear a school uniform. Whenever I was wearing it, everyone could know where I was from and even what my name was, so these eyes made me be careful and behave in the way how students should be.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>We all know that clothes are made for different purposes and have different materials to serve that purpose.</MI2> <EX>Formal dresses are made for fancy events. They are usually formal and fabulous, but we don't wear these clothes in daily basis; it is hard to feel comfortable in them compared to our pajamas. Although they are not as fancy as formal clothes, there is no clothes as good as pajamas for our bed times.</EX><SI2> It was reported that the first thing most people do after thay get home is changing their clothes to rest.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, at first glance, it doesn't look like our behaviors are related to what we wear. <TR>However</TR>, I strongly insist that our actions are depended on the clothes we wear for the reasons I have mentioned above. When we wear uniforms, we act according to the group that our uniforms indicate, and clothes made out of different materials make us act in different ways.</CO>
column23: Poor use of transitions, did not have a strong feel for moving from one section to another.

column1: 97&If people cannot say anything nice to someone, it is better not to say anything at all.
column3:
<IN>Different people have different opinion about the statement that commenting nothing is better when people do not have anything nice to say to someone. <TS>I strongly believe that the idea is true because of the importance of human relationship and reducing stress. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, due to the human network, saying nothing when one does not anything nice to say. As the society is becoming colder than before, many people find it hard to build new human relationship. Thus, it is crucial getting good social skill. Therefore, people should know that one should not say anything when having nothing to say for a comment.</MI1> <SI1>In such situation, one would have high chance of giving inadequate information that can cause a misunderstanding between one and the other. The misunderstanding can result bad effect on one's human relationships. <EX>When I and my best friend was having a conversation about presentation that she made for sociology class, there was not much thing to say for a response to a question, 'how is it' from her. I said it looked okay, and she thought that her presentation was not good enough. Even though I did not mean to say that way, she understood it in the way that she thought at that time. After this event, we both stopped talking each other for several days. </EX></SI1>Considering the human network with other, people should recognize that it is more sensible to say nothing when they have nothing to comment for a response.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, when it comes to reducing stress, saying nothing when one does not have any idea for a response is expected to be more efficient.</MI2> <SI2>As the society is getting increasingly complicated, the number of people suffering from the stress, but the problem is that it is hard to find a proper way of handling the issue. <EX>For me, after experiencing bad result in a relationship with my best friend while dealing with a similar situation, I got to decide not to respond when i am in such situation again. In this way, I could reduce a lot of pressure and stress that I would get when facing such problem.</EX>Avoiding it could be a way and the best solution to this issue can be waiting properly for something nice to say before one talk to the other. According to a well-known sociologist, people who choose to say noting in such situation would achieve the goal of reducing stress in an efficient manner. He goes on to say that it will generally take long time to have same effect if people opt to say something when they have nothing to say.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Taking all these into account</TR>, we should agree with the idea because of the significance of human network and alleviating stress in dealing with such problem. There is no doubt in my mind that this will bring benefits to people's future.</CO>
column23: Grammar and structure affected clarity

column1: 98&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The only way for the governmnet to encourage energy conservation is to increase the price of gasoline and electricity.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that we should increase the price of gasoline and electricity to encourage energy conservation. <TS>But i don't think that. This is because gasoline and electricity are limited resources, we should look for other resources that can be instead of gasoline of electricity for limited resources and gasoline and increasing the price of gasoline and electricity can bring side effect. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> we should find some other resources that can be instead of gasoline or electricity. Just incresing the price of gasoline or electricity can't be fundamental solving.</MI1> <SI1>The gasoline or electricity has limited amount. Some years after, gasoline or electricity are dried up. When that times come up, our lives are in confusion. We should deal with this problem to enjoy our life. For effecive energy conservation, we can develop alternative energy that can use forever. Improve technology about alternative energy can be basic solving of energy conservation. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> increasing the price of gasoline and electricity can bring side effect. </MI2><SI2>Gasoline and electricity are some of most popular energies. When increasing the price of gasoline and electricity, not also normal people have more difficulty to live that use less energy than major companies that use more energy and have lots of money and are willing to pay the cost of gasoline and electricity, but also the price of overall goods will increase. Because when we make and move products, we use lots of gasoline and electricity. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think that increasing the price of gasoline and electricity for energy conservation can not be fundamental solving for the problem and bring side effect. <TR>In these reasons,</TR> i think for the energy conservation, we should not increase the price of gasoline and electricity, we should develop alternative energy.</CO>
column23: Did not directly address topic, it did so in a bit of a roundabout way.

column1: 99&Do you agree or disagree that progress is always good? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>When it comes to progress, it usually refers technological and scientific development. In terms of technology and science, progress is significantly beneficial for many aspects of human lives. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I do not agree that progress always is good because progress sometimes lead to negative effect and induce people to cheat. </TS></IN>

<BO1>Everything has good and bad. Science has always moved forward but some are skeptical about it because it also comes with bad side. <MI1>One of the reasons is that science and technology become dominant, consequently reducing quantity and quality of human relationship. </MI1><SI1><EX>Let us take the development of smart-phones as an example. As smart phone use became prevalent, many people became concerned with decreased time of person-to-person communication. Children prefer playing games with smart-phones to conversing with their parents. <TR>Also,</TR> the number of loners who use smart-phones alone at home and fail to develop social relationship has increased dramatically.</EX></SI1> As these examples illustrate, the progress of technology and science can bring about dehumanization of human world.   </BO1>

<BO2>            <MI2><TR>Another reason that I disagree with the statement is</TR> that the purpose of progress sometimes drives people into the corner.</MI2> <SI2>Many scientists and researchers have pressure to come with a significant outcome to change the world and the pressure is so stressful that people sometimes give up their morality. It is not uncommon to find that scientists and researchers lie about their projects and even cheat at times. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> researchers in psychology department at Harvard University manipulated their data to have significant results and lied that their study was successful.</EX></SI2> I do not think the individuals were immoral in the first place, yet their moral rational became numb as a result of high pressure of progress. </BO2>
            
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> it is obvious that progress has allowed the world to prosper and advance, progress sometimes results in negative effects such as dehumanization of the world. <TR>All things considered,</TR> I do not concur with the statement that progress is always good. </CO>
column23: Some grammar problems but otherwise is a fine essay

column1: 100&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Today, people only do a few things well.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that today, people only do a few things will, <TS>But I don't thnk that. <TR>This is because</TR> today's people are smarter and have more time to develop their ability than past people. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people in today have more time to learn than people in the past who should waste time to do agriculture things to live.</MI1> <SI1>Even if, when they want to learn about something, they can't do that. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> My grandmother is only good at household. She wanted to learn and study about something but she could't do that. </EX>This is because there are not enough time to learn about something. <TR>But in present,</TR> people can invest there time to learn or develop their ability. Because they don't need to spend their time to do household because there are lots of machines that help them do household to live easier and faster. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that,</TR> people in present are living in smarter environment.</MI2> <SI2>There are lots of studies, university, institution and education that help people be smarter in diverse things. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> in the past, there were no nice lab or studies. People in the past couldn't be goot at lots of things because there are little infomation or knowhow.</EX> But in present, there are great environment and skill to upgrade or share their ability to do something diverse. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclude,</TR> people in present are good at lots of things because of enough time to upgrade their ability and smarter environment. In these reasons I think that people in the present can do lots of things well.</CO>
column23: Grammar issues hindered reading and understanding.

column1: 101&It is more important for people to spend their time at work than with their families.
column3:
<IN>People nowadays live in modern society where challenges are everywhere, everytime and they strive to seek for a job spend most of their time dealing with their work. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, it is more important for people to spend their time with their families than at work for several reasons : people are going to be with their family forever and the quality of work is likely to increase.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people will continue living with their families no matter how they are busy with their work. <TR>Whereas,</TR> people are going to leave their work some day in the future. Therefore, it is important to spend more time with families.</MI1> <SI1>When workers are back home they will be spending time at home with family members. People will be feeling more comfortable if they have things in common, things to enjoy together, creating beautiful memories. All these cannot be done with other strangers. Families have their own unique sense and it is crucial to continue a happy life with them. As spending time together makes people bond tightly to each other, it will be important to be close with each other in early stage by spending time together. <EX><TR>To be specific,</TR> some worker-holic people tend to regret the fact that they had treated their work more precious than families. Recent study done by Seoul National University shows that working people are trying to have more focus on family not to regret in the future and also to get help from them as family has a special kind of unique power that gives strength and couragement that other strangers cannot provide no matter how they are close to each other. </TR></SI1>This implies that it is crucial to have a close bond with family as they are going to live together for rest of their lives helping one another.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> the work quality is likely to increase and be beneficial for both work and family if people spend time with their families.</MI2> <SI2>Families can give help at anytime, anywhere if one really needs. Families know one another much better than others do. <TR>Therefore</TR> it is more precise and accurate for family memebers to diagnosis and give advice if one has problems. Family also helps to reduce stress which leads to an improvement in any work they are doing. People have certain limit to rely on their companions and friends around them when they are in trouble. <TR>However,</TR> on the other hand, family is always there, waiting for them and as families are aware of how the one is like and watched as you progressed, it is easier for people to depend on their families. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> if one has trouble with his boss, it will be much safer and relaxing to tell families what is happening as they can forgive if one has done something wrong and if not also they can dicuss the problem seriously and they will feel more relaxing and comfortable, reducing stress level leading to a better working performance as one need not to worry anymore.</EX></SI2>
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> spending time with family is more important as people are going to live with them for a long time of period and it will be more comfortable when they are close with each other. 

<TR>Furthermore,</TR> family can be help to each other by listening to problems they have and will have a decrease in stress level leading to have a better work performance as they need not to worry about problems.</CO>
column23: Mostly well written with some grammatical errors

column1: 102&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? With the help of the Internet, students can learn more effectively.
column3:
<IN>Since an increasing number of students who use the Internet, a controversy has arisen whether the Internet is just a distration and the best way to learning is the book. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> the Internet is a highly valuable tool for two reasons ; it allows students to conduct research easily and quickly and it makes online class possible for the students with busy schedule.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> researching through the Internet encourages students to find materials with ease just in a matter of minutes.</MI1> <SI1>This is largely because, unlike the past, prior to development of the Internet,students have to go to the library to search resources that are needed for their homework, now, they can go online to find information what they want. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was a freshman in university, my professor gave me a homework to write a report on the peculiarity of the modern Chinese in Chinese literature class. I didn't learn about that in the past, so I was embrassed. <TR>Therefore</TR> what I need was the references. I decided to utilize the Internet for my report. With one mouse-click, I was able to find all information in books or magazines. Due to the Internet, I could finished my homework in just short time. If there were no Internet, I would have gone to the library,and spent scores of time to research. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> taking online class via the Internet plays a significant role in accessing education for students whose schedules are busy.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that today students are covered with the piled works such as going to schools and academies.So they don't have enough time to get what they have to or what they want to. <TR>Thus,</TR> online class which take regardless of time and location is helpful to students.<EX>For example, when I lived outskirts, I really wanted to learn a photography, burt there were no places to learn that, only had the places for cleaning the land.I wasn't willing to go to the places where teachers teach photography skills because there were so far about 2km distances from where I live as well as I didn't have time to go there. Accidenty, I saw the advertisement on the photography online class. Fortunately I could listen to the lecture at home at any time which is very convinient and saved me a lot of time. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> the Internet enables us to look up information with less time as well as provides busy people to listen to the class at home when they have the time. <TR>In this regard,</TR> I firmly believe that the Internet is useful tool that assist to students' learning for their future.</CO>
column23: Overall well-written but some occasional spelling and grammatical errors were distracting.

column1: 103&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>The reason that we go to school and study books is that to learn theories, terms, and etc. in order to use those knowledge in the real field. In my case, I'm taking up engineering courses, and I'm also trying very hard to learn as much as possible from the books for preparation of being an engineer. But I could not deny the fact that the knowledge learned from the book is not everything when i had my internship program in an engineering company.</TS></IN>

<BO1><SI1><EX>From the books, I learned how the bearings, shaft, and other assemblies of a machine generally look like, but when i was given a task to disassemble a machine and have the main shaft replaced with new one, I couldn't even find where the main shaft is at the first time. Because books only contain general concept of machine stuffs.</EX></SI1> <MI1><TR>Therefore,</TR> it was really hard for me to grasp the point in the real field work which is much specialized beyond the general concept.</MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The knowledge from the experience however, does not give me any idea of how to be precise on predicting motion of a machine while the knowledge from the books makes me able to calculate how it would work. </MI2><SI2>I realized that when I was curious of how far a shooting machine can shoot a ball. I could easily figure it out with some calculation, which would be impossible by just looking at the machine.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>But, even if those theoretical calculation is also necessary, i suppose those can also be learned in the field work. Field work, on the other hand, has no way to be learned but exclusively through experience. With my experiences and that point, I think the knowledge from the experience is way more important than that from the books.</CO2>
column23: Transitions were rough.  The thesis for example wasn't quite clear, the topic seemed to very loosely follow the question without quite locking into a definitive answer.

column1: 104&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are enormous amount of knowledge and information must be taught before a person becomes an adult. And when it comes to teaching such, I doubt if my parents can teach me those. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I still say that parents are the best teachers for certain reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>They are the ones who always can stand right beside us and correct us if ever we made mistakes.</MI1> <SI1>Although they may not be able to teach us some expert knowledge, they mainly teach us such as ethics and conscience, which perhaps are more important than other knowledge for living, And those teachings come from true heart of our parents, because they love us and there is no reason for them to lie to us. Even though there are some teachers lecturing the same virtues as our parents do, they wouldn't be able to deliver the message as true as that of our parents.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I was around 7 and i really liked PC games. But my mother did not buy me any game CDs for educational purpose. So one day, I took some money in her purse while she was sleeping, then I bought some game CDs. Of course my mother found it out, but ironically she cried, saying that I did something very evil. Looking at her with a wonder, then I could realize how bad I was. If it weren't my mother but another common teacher, he would definitely have made me pay for stealing, which wouldn't make me realize. This realization was only possible owing to my mother's true love.</EX></BO2>

<CO><TR>Therefore,</TR> I think when it comes to best teaching, it must be something truly from one's heart. And I believe any parents would do such for their own child. So i firmly believe that the parents are the best teachers.</CO>
column23: Overall it was a fine essay as it covered the topic well.  However the second body paragraph didn't introduce any ideas and really should have been the "Example" section of the first body paragraph.

column1: 105&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Watching television is bad for children. Use specific details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>Nowadays, watching television is becoming close to us in our daily lives. Some people presume that watching television can bring us good effects. <TS>It gives us pleasures and interests I, On the other hand, agree with the idea that watching television is bad for children.</TS> This is because, it allows many children to have negative and harmful impacts.  </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> most children once start watching television they can not stop watching it ease on.</MI1> <SI1>It is inimical for a myriad of children to have balanced emotional and physical growth. These days, children have not enough time to play with their precious friends and families because they always are very busy doing their homework and receiving private lessons. In this regard, watching television makes the time shorter to build up sensitively good relationship with other people. Also, it can make less active and gain weight. Gaining weight lead to a number of serious health conditions.</SI1> <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is harmful to promote social skills and have not health bodies. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> watching television includes violent and brutal effects.</MI2> <SI2>Children are exposed generally adults shows while watching it. In additon, most children have difficulty time restraining themselves from stimulating program especially when they are alone at home. Children tend to mimic that they saw in spite of movies and dramas are very different from reality. <TR>In addition,</TR> they can easily become more impulsive than adults because they have a shortage ability of control. These wrong effects deeply influences the way children behave.</SI2> It enables them to be in a dangerous and undefended situation.</BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In the conclusion,</TR> I firmly advocate with the idea that watching television is harmful for a lot of children. This is because, it obstructs children's developments by taking the time. It is impossible them to get a long with their peers. <TR>Moreover,</TR> it contains a multitude of detrimental elements through not permitting programs for children. For these reasons, I strongly support that watching television is wrong for growing children.</CO>
column23: Overall it's a well-written essay.  But some spelling and grammatical errors caused it to stumble now and then.

column1: 106&In order to stay well-informed, people shoud get information from various news sources.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that it is better for one to stick with one source, since the one quality information has a greater importance than diverse resources, and even an overflowing number of information would rather confuse him. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I disagree with this statement and sincerely believe that the more sources of information the one explores, the more valid, useful, and helpful knowledge he gets.</TS> In this essay, I will present a couple of rationales behind my logic in depth and detail.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> no one would dare to deny the fact that by absorbing knowledges from numerous sources, people get the ways of thinking critically and logically, and can widen the range of their thinking.</MI1> <SI1>That is, as there are a variety of resources that people can access, there are also various aspects of looking at one particular event. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> two different articles could express different opinions on one social problem, and even they cast doubt on each other's assertions. If it were not for the endeavor to learn something from diverse aspects by searching several sources, one could not be well-informed and left to be biased and isolated from other aspects.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> it is not an exaggeration to say that while people are exploring various sources, they can acquire the skill to sort out proper and useful informations for their research topic from others which contain false and extreme opinion, which would be an advantage for one's life.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, as technology develops, more and more sources are being created in a daily basis by people varying in ages and the levels of knowledge, and it often takes place that people put out their opinion on the Internet where people usually get information without any approving process. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is necessary for one to have an ability to select expert understandings on a certain topic in the modern society, and learning from various sources would be a great help for improving this skill.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> not only do various sources contribute to widening people's thinking horizon, but also aid them in growing skills to select the proper knowledge from the vast flow of information on the Internet. When all is said and done, I am for the idea that acquiring knowledge from various sources is an efficient way to be well-informed.</CO>
column23: I didn't see a big enough difference between body 1 and body 2 to warrant to separate paragraphs to cover them.

column1: 107&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? First impression tells a lot about people.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that people can know what other people's characters like from first impression. This is because habitual facial impression shows their value towards the world. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, people can't not be judged by first impression for two reasons; to tend to be misleading and not to show real personality.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> making decision on people's characteristics according to first impression is likely to be erroneous.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that appearance doesn't reflect inner qualities such as attitudes, values, and personality. <TR>Therefore,</TR> people need to take more time to get to know each other. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I entered high school, I met my best friend, named Harry. At first time, when I saw him, I wouldn't have thought that I would be closer with him like now because his appearance looked very scary and cold. <TR>However,</TR> after having some discussions and group presentations, I realized that he is warm-hearted and considerate. If I had made my mind on his character by first impression, I wouldn't have had chance to know his real personality. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>What</TR> is more, first impression doesn't reveal people's real characteristics.</MI2> <SI2>This is because, first impression varies depending on people's moods, and it may gives rise to make a wrong decision. A person could be depressed at the particular time that one meet first time, although he actually has really outgoing personality. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> When I studied in ESL class in Canada, my classmates told me that i had very bad first impression that I didn't know at all. They told me that at the first class, I was being very cold minded and not sociable. This is actually because, I had argument with my host family in that morning, I wasn't quite in good mood. However, after spending time together for a long time, they said they could chance their mind that I'm very good and understanding.</EX> This shows that people's judgement based on first sight isn't equivalent to people' actual character.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that people can not be judged by first impression because of its in accuracy and misunderstandings. All in all, people should try to take time to get to know each other, not being base on their looking, mood, or tones.</CO>
column23: The two arguments in the bodies didn't seem very strong.

column1: 108&Schools (universities, colleges, and high schools) should teach students about specific careers and jobs instead of general subjects.
column3:
<IN>Schools are often successful at educating their students in a large number of different topics. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I believe that it is more important to teach students with more practical classes related with their future careers and jobs.</TS></IN>

<BO1>             <MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> if schools focus on career education, students do not have to waste of their time taking some classes that they do not need to.</MI1> <SI1>Schools usually require many subjects to students so that they can graduate but the subjects are not necessary or helpful for all students to develop their own future plans and specific careers. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my brother wanted to be a cook but his school didn't offer any opportunity to develop his dream. During then, not many people were willing to be a cook so there was not enough information and chance to learn the professional skills of cooking. His school did not care about student's future plan but obligated students to take general classes which was not helpful for my brother's career.</EX> By focusing on specific subjects that students will be need for their future, schools can eliminate unnecessary classes.</SI1></BO1>
             
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> students will be more professional about their future careers quicker.</MI2> <SI2>If students get education which is related to their future careers, they will be more used to it when they actually start it as their job and it will be easier for students to do something that they did at least once. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my friend worked as internship in the hospital during the high school year, and she could adapt to the hospital easily when she actually became a nurse. Also, her experiences to help nurses motivated her to strengthen her goal to be a nurse.</EX> Previous experiences about students careers show students path for their future and they learn practical knowledge.</SI2></BO2>
<CO>             <TR>In conclusion,</TR> I support schools should offer education focusing on students future careers. By doing so, they do not have to spend their time studying unnecessary information but instead develop themselves related to their future plans. This is why I believe teaching core subjects connected to students jobs will be more efficient.</CO>
column23: Overall a good essay with occasional grammar errors that caused it to stumble.

column1: 109&Visiting museums is the best way to learn about a country.
column3:
<IN>Many people say that visiting museums is the best way to learn about a country because it can tell what a country is like. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, visiting museums is not a best way to know about a country for several reasons : other than visiting museums, there are other ways to learn about a country and museums do not tell us everything about the country.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> there are many other interesting and easier ways to learn about a country more deeply.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that modern technology has developed and we can make use of it. To be specific, by either Internet or television we can have a view on a country broader. We even can find out more specific information about a particular subject and have a better understanding of it as those information can be gathered in a mother-tongue language. <TR>However,</TR> if we visit museums, we would probably have some difficulties understanding the contents fully as we will not have enough time to look at every single content to understand them. <EX>According to a survey done by Seoul National University, people were asked whether they get enough information to learn about a country by visiting the museums. Most of people answered that although they were able to understand a brief background, there were limits to learn about a country more deeply because of the time consumed in the museum is limited and there were difficulties understanding the explanation even if they were written in mother-tongue as words used based on the culture were not familiar.</EX> This shows that people would learn about a country better when they use Internet or television to study instead of visiting museums.</SI1><BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> museums do not cover everything about a country and this limits the understanding of a country.</MI2> <SI2>Museums usually covers on certain specific area or interest such as art museum and stamp museum and even when people visit museums that tell us about a country like history museum, it will do only a little help to learn about a country. When people try to learn about a country they will probably focus on nowadays trend and flow in that country, the modern culture instead of a history a long time ago. <EX><TR>To be specific,</TR> when foreigners want to know about Korea, they tend to find more about things like K-pop or Korean dramas in order to learn about a country rather than doing research on the history. This can be also explained by foreign students in my school. They were asked how they learned about this country before they come. They said that they looked for the newest information as those information taught them how the people are like and what their life style is.</EX> This implies that it was easier for them to find those information out of museums.</SI2><BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> there are other better ways to learn about a country instead of visiting museums. Finding information on Internet and television will provide more detail and specific ones and also other than museums, through other materials from a country will help us understand more about modern culture.</CO>
column23: Overall a good essay, but grammatical errors slowed things down.

column1: 110&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Twenty years from now, students will no longer use printed books.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that twenty years from now, students will still use printed books. <TR>But i don't agree with that statement.</TR> <TS>I think e-book is more convenient and environment-freindly than printed books. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> E-book is more convenient than printed book.</MI1> <SI1>E-book is not heavy. We can shate page or note taking with friends by E-book. But using printed book, we should carry many heavy books everytime. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> students should carry their textbook everyday. But, with using E-book, they just need a equipment to use E-book, and be able to share their note takings easier by using E-book.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> E-book is more eco-friendly than printed-book that is made of papaer.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example,</TR> using printed-book, when they don't have to have the text, the text become some trash. But when using the E-book, there are no waste when they don't need to some text. They can just press the 'delete' button. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> When we use E-book, we can use the book easier, more eco friendly. In these reasons, I think that twenty tears from now, students will use E-book.</CO>
column23: Some grammar issues but overall a well-written essay.

column1: 111&Childhood is the most important years in life for their intellectual development.
column3:
<IN>Some people might says that childhood is not the most important period in life for their intellectual development because they think that although a person's childhood is not good to develop one's intelligence, he or she can learn if he or she do his or her best. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I am convinced that the most important time in life for people's intellectual improvement is childhood.</TS> One thing is that people will learn how to learn about something in this period. Another thing is that what they learn in this period is basic knowledge. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> I think that when people are children, they can learn how to learn everything. So, If they do not learn this way in their childhood, they will have difficulty to learn later on.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> my uncle do not have the opportunity to learn the ability to read and write. So, he is illiterate, yet. Also, he are poor at learning other language because he do not have enough ability to learn language.</EX> This example clearly shows that the childhood is very important years for people's intellectual development.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> childhood is the most crucial period for intelligence because what they learn in their childhood is fundamental knowledge.</MI2> <SI2>We cannot learn more about something if we do not have basic knowledge. <EX>Imagine that you did not learn how to use your spoon. You take it for granted that you cannot use spoon. In this case, you cannot learn how to eat food by using your spoon because you do not know how to use the spoon at all. If you learnd how to use it, you can learn how to eat by using it soon because you have a basic knowledge.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is hard to say that childhood is not particulary important for intelligence.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> the above reasons, I strongly agree with the statement taht childhood is the most crucial time in life for a person's intellectual improvement.</CO>
column23: The supporting arguments for the thesis were not very strong.  There were a number of grammar and spelling issues.

column1: 112&Self scanning checkout.
column3:
<IN>The reading and the lecturer talk about self checkout machines. The article says that this program have a lot of benefits. <TS><TR>However,</TR> the lecturer says that there are not only benefits but also problems.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TS>First,</TS> the reading contends that the self-checkout machine makes shoppers more convenient because the machine help them avoid waiting in lines and monitor what they buy and how much is it. <TS>In the contrary,</TS> the lecturer disagrees with the argument. The speaker claims that it takes a longer time to checkout the things in busy days like holidays. </MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TS>Second,</TS> in the reading, the author says that this machine is great because the machine give shoppers ads or information related to products which they buy. <TS>In contrast,</TS> the lecturer counter this opinion. The counter argument is that there are a lot of worker who can offer ads or information associated with products. </MI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>The final point made in the reading is that this system can be solution about lacking of labor and cutting labor costs. <TS>On the other hand.</TS> the lecturer contradicts this point, stating that retailers should pay more than regular cashier.</MI3></BO3>
column23: There are almost no supporting arguments, simply main ideas listed.  There is also no conclusion, just a third point.  It seems to be nothing more than an outline of what the speaker has said.

column1: 113&Some people think that the family is the most importnat in fluence on young parents. Other people think that friends are the most importnat influence on young adults. which view do yu agree with?
column3:
<IN>It is depended on thought each person has about that question. In my opinion, <TS>Family is much more important for them.</TS> This is because family, especially adults of them, can give them a advises and have ability to earn more money than them. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> young adults are able to receive many efficient advises from their parents.</MI1> <SI1>What I mean is that adults of young adults have undergone every difficulties, included raising children and earning money, that they are likely to face so that they are able to give them appropriate advises to overcome each situations. <TR>Therefore</TR> receiving  advises from adults is better than from friends. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my relative got married at early age due to pregnance they don't want so that they were in confused situation. At that time, parents of my relative had given them a lot of advises to overcome the situation such as saving money and requesting help to relatives. As a result they could greatly maintain their family and they are staying well now. </EX></SI1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> parents of young adults is able to give them help of money.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, young adults generally don't have a lot of money and workplace that give them high salary. <TR>However</TR> their parents clearly have better ability to earn more money then them. <TR>Therefore</TR> they can be given economic help. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> their friends are also young so that they normally don't have enough money to help them. Requesting money problem to their parents is better than to their friends. <EX>According to the article of journalist, approximately eighty percent of young adults don't have capacity to maintain their family. It means most young adults are in danger that their family might be broken due to economic problem.</EX> In this case, asking to parents will be the best solution to solve the problem. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> as young adults are drastically growing nowadays, their problem is being issue. <TR>Therefore</TR> government should hurry to make a good way to solve the problem and ask young people not to get pregnance without any purpose or capacity to remain family.</CO>
column23: A lot of grammar and spelling errors.  While the topic was somewhat focused, it did deviate a little bit towards the end.

column1: 114&Professional athletes do not deserve to the high salaries that they are paid.
column3:
<IN>People enjoy sports game all year around. In particular, thousands and millions of people enjoy watching MLB(Major League Baseball) in summer, and NBA(National Basketball Association) in winter. <TR>Likewise,</TR> watching sports are just a part of human lives. <TS><TR>Consequently,</TR> it is certainly right to say that professional athletes deserve to the high salaries that they are paid because they give laypeople to have recreation, they are the hardest working people, and their lives are put at risk. </TS></IN>
           
<BO1><MI1>Professional athletes deserve to the high incomes that they are paid since they allow people to have recreation watching the games.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In fact,</TR> spend one’s weekend or spare time with family at the stadium helps them to release stress. <TR>In addition,</TR> people as well as many companies are willing to invest their money to see those games. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my city is famous for soccer team named Manchester, and since that team is popular among people around the world, they come to my city to see the game or to just see the stadium. A lot of them come to watch the game with their family, which not only that release their stress but which can spend a great time with family as well. </EX></SI1></BO1>
           
<BO2><MI2>Specialized athletes deserve to the high salaries that they are paid because they are one of the hardest working people in the world.</MI2> <SI2>Athletes have to sacrifices some of their needs such as what kind of food to eat in order to participate in regular train. Along with self-sacrifice, they have to retain the best condition to play well, even though they might have difficult times getting adjust to new environment, especially when playing away games. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> soccer players have fixed schedules that they must follow to be trained. By undergoing the fixed schedule, they cannot eat certain food, and they even have limited time to have spare time. </EX></SI2></BO2>
           
<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> it is right to say that professional athletes deserve to the high salaries that they are paid since their lives are put at risk.</MI3> <SI3>Most sports have some possibility that the players could get injured. Some of them die while playing the game. <TR>Consequently,</TR> if people think of their lives put at risk, it is fair for them to deserve such high salaries. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a lot of wrestling players get severe injured while playing the game. In addition, one of the most famous players who died in the play is a marathon player named Kurth Jensen. He partook in the game of 100km competition, and he died of dehydration while he was running. </EX></SI3></BO3>
           
<CO>Some people say that professional athletes do not deserve to the high salaries that they are paid because they believe their duties are easy to do. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> they are misinterpreting players’ duties since they are one of the hardest working people in the world. Their training and self-sacrifice requires much more diligence than ordinary people. <TR>Moreover,</TR> professional athletes deserve to the high salaries since they give enjoyment to people, and many people are actually willing to pay for the expensive rate of the game. With the fact that their lives are put at risk, it is definitely right to say that professional athletes deserve to the high salaries that they are paid.</CO>
column23: Overall it was a good essay.  Transitions between the introduction and bodies 1 and 2 could have been stronger.  There were some grammar issues.

column1: 115&In your opinion, should high schools ban students' commuting to reduce trafic and tardiness problems?
column3:
<IN>In modern days, many people suffer from the traffic jams and auto accidents. This is true for even high school students. Many poeple suffer from not only the traffc jams but also the noise of the auto vehicles. <TS>While others still would allow students to drive to their schools, it is the best for many people to ban students from driving to schools and their commuting. By taking an such action, people can reduce the risk of auto accident, the tardiness problems/traffic jams, and the disturbance from the auto vehicles. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>If people ban the students from driving to the schools, people can make school ground much safer place.</MI1> <SI1>The majority of students/teenagers has a tendency to drive faster than adults do, causing the higher potent of the accident. The research shows that more than 30% of the auto accident is cused by the teenage drivers. People can lower the risk of accidents by banning students from driving to their school. There will be fewer auto vehicles around the schools, resulting less frustration to other drivers. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>By banning students' commuting , people can reduce not only the auto accident risk but also the traffic jams that cause the tardiness problems and the disturbances.</MI2> <SI2><EX>During 6:30 to 8:00 every weekday morings, peope my experience the "rush-hour" near by the schools. Because of this situation, a number of adults may experience the frustration in addition to the fury, and they mght be late to their final destination. In some cases, there may be some students who attend school late or leave school early. Most of the time when this situation occurs, the students in the classroom may be disturbed by the noise from the vehicles that those students utilize in order to get to their arrival point.</EX> <TR>However,</TR> these problems can be also fixed by banning students from driving to their schools- less the auto vehicles, less the noise. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>There are many benefits that people can persue if they ban students' commuting and force them to take the advantages of the public transportations or the school buses. It is true that few students may experience the inconveniency from this action; <TR>however,</TR> many major concerns/problems of United States, such as high rate of auto accidents from teenagers, can be soften. Peple can enjoy teir morning drives and be on-timefor their schedule if students are o be banned from drivig to teir schools. <TR>Moreover,</TR> the students can have a study session or a class without any distrubance. <TR>Therefore,</TR> people should ban students' commuting to reduce not only the traffic but also the risk of te ato accidents.</CO>
column23: Thesis lacked punch.  Transitions leading into the body paragraphs weren't very definitive.  Grammar and spelling problems.

column1: 116&Students are influenced more by their friends than by their teachers.
column3:
