<IN>In adolescence teachers exert immense influence on students but it is still less influential than the same-age group that students encounter. <TS>In school, students tend to spend more time with friends than anyone and accordingly affected by certain peer pressure that force them to fit into a group.</TS> It is also true that at the center of academic performance is the interrelationship of students in school.</IN>

<BO1><SI1><EX>I can confidently say that notwithstanding the considerable influence of teachers and parents, friends went always first before them for my student life. Since they belonged to a same age-group and most of the time were spent with them, I experienced a lot of peer pressure in trying to assimilate into the coterie. As a young student, I was forced to imitate certain behavior and ingratiate myself to friends in a group in efforts to get along with them.</EX></SI1> <MI1>Often friends understood me better and had closer emotional ties with me having gone through same experience.  </MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The development of students also depends on interpersonal relationship with their friends.</MI2>  <SI2><EX>I could not have done a successful academic performance without the help of my friends. They assisted me with my homework, answered my questions, and gave me a useful tip for exams. Also, I competed with my friends to get a good grade and tried to stay on the right track. Teachers taught me about various subjects, but it was friends who substantially stimulated a true endeavor toward academic achievement.They could become my companions and contestants at the same time. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Teachers and parents are undeniably at the center of student's development, but I would emphasize the effect of social groups on them. Students belonging to certain age-group can reciprocally enhance the emotional experience and academic achievement in adolescence. Without the help and competition with their companions, students cannot possibly achieve personal growth and academic development. </CO>
column23: Main points were lacking.  It was hard to discern main points from examples, if there were any.  Examples, supporting info, and main points all seem blended together, and made it difficult to follow the flow of the essay sometimes.

column1: 117&Children should begin learning a foreign language as soon as they start school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3:
<IN>It is often said the earlier students learn a foreign language, the better it is. This is because children have more free time to study and they learn faster than older. <TS><TR>However,</TR> In my opinion, children shouldn't start learning a foreign language at an early age for two reasons; to develop creativity and not to lose interest in studying.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> children can enhance more creativity by playing.</MI1> <SI1>Learning more means children can know more but, restrictions are also pushed on them. <TR>In contrast,</TR> if children play more, they may find things interesting in their playing and raise many questions such as " why does this happen?" " Can I invent it for me later?. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> one of the greatest inventor Edison, he wasn't a quite good students in school. he was likely to play with what he was interested in rather than studying boring subjects. There is popular episode on him. One day, he was curious about how to hatch eggs. and he wanted to know if he can do or not, so he sit on eggs for whole day. However, his mom later told him that he cant make it in that way. By playing with eggs, he could learn more about natures, and developed creativity more. If he had studied at school, he wouldn't have invented great things that led us to huge contribution.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> children may lose interest in studying if they start learning a foreign language.</MI2> <SI2>As many students are aware, studying a foreign language is quite monotonous repeated task.  There are a wide range of things to memorize and concentrate on such as grammar, vocabulary, writing skills. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> children like to play. Even if parents push them to sit on the table, they wouldn't be able to concentrate on studying. This will give rise to lose their interest in studying since they think they study for their parents. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> if children play at an early age, they don't have any bad memory on studying.<TR>Therefore, later,</TR> when they grow up, they are likely to focus on studying because they assume they study it for themselves.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that parents and school shouldn't push children to study a foreign language. This is because children may not be interested in studying and lose chance to enhance creativity. All in all, education system should provide  more free environment that can children enjoy at an early age. </CO>
column23: The second body paragraph lost focus a little bit and seemed to get a little muddled at times.

column1: 118&Why do you think people attend college or university?
column3:
<IN>Many high school students usually hope to attend college or university after their graduation. This is intriguing in that even though the final decision these students make is the same, their reasons might vary depending on the individual perspective. <TS><TR>As for me,</TR> I believe that there are two key reasons that why people go to university including preparing job careers and developing social skills.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> universities provide students with plenty of courses on different fields.<MI1> <SI1>It is common that students are required to have at least one or more majors during their college lives. This can help them prepare future career paths. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> in Korea where seven or eight out of ten high school students move on to the universities for higher education, university graduates are reported to have more stable job positions and get paid about 1.7 times higher salaries than those of high school students.</EX> It can be infered from this fact that university education brings people with better job opportunities. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> people can have chances to develop their social skills through the campus lives.</MI2> <SI2>When just entering universities, most of freshmen face with utterly strange environments and new friends with different backgrounds. <EX><TR>In my case, for example,</TR> I have to leave my hometown as entering university. It was a bit stressful at the first time. I tried to get along with new friends and positively participated in class activities. These helped me improve my social skills. Before long, as a consequence, I enjoyed my campus life.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> attending university has become essential for every students in order to prepare future careers and make better inter-personal skills. I believe that these reasons are essences among a variety of reasons why people attend university.</CO>
column23: Some grammar issues but otherwise a good essay.

column1: 119&The government should pay more attention to health care issues than environmental issues.
column3:
<IN>Since an increasing number of people who die from sickness, a controversy has arisen wheter government should put more a high value on health care than the environmental issues.
<TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> government should pay more attention to the environmental issues than health care issues for two reasons; environmental spending is more and more decrease recently and environment is very related with the health. </IN>
         
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> government's decision to spend money on environment is less than health care problems.</MI1> <SI1>There have been proposed budget cut for environmental agencies, in compare with the skyrocket investment to somthing related with health. Thus, many environmental agencies are upste about this recently governments' decision.
According to the Association World Finance, there are many countries. <EX>Especially, Korea and China are the represent country which place a high value on health care. The differnce spending on environmental issues with spending on health care issues by 15 percent.</EX> This imbalance in allocated funding is likely to result in more environmental problems in the future.</SI1></BO1>
         
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> mending the environment is well related with the lives.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that today, many children of developing countris such as Africa and South asia die of lacking clean water. The polluted water comes from the environment problems.Thus government should recognize the importance of environmental issues.
<EX>According to UNICEF, 5000 children die every day because they dont't have clean drinking water.we can clean up the world's water resources so that people will have water that is safe to drink by increasing funding for environmental agencies. Then, we'll be able to avoid millions of preventable deaths.</EX> This'll lead to also decresae funding for health care. </SI2><BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> funding for the environment is not equal that of health care and many people will be able to live safely by fixing the environment. In this regard, I firmly believe that it's important fot the government to emphasize the environment rather than health care right now!</CO>
column23: Overall a good essay with occasional grammar errors that caused it to stumble.

column1: 120&TV programs and movies are obliged to show that good people are rewarded and bad people are punished.
column3:
<IN>There are different opinions among people whether TV should play a significant role in discouraging criminal by showing that a good person are rewarded and a bad person are punished eventually. <TS>Although it is true that some people are required not to be judged adversely even if they are guilty, I totally believe that if bad people are not punished on TV, it will greatly have some negative effects on our society.</TS> In this essay, I will present a couple of reasons to support my idea. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> children are the ones who are not firmly mature, so they will be affected by most contents shown on TV.<MI1> <SI1>Specifically, children are likely to mimic plentiful behavior by people on TV because they lack the ability to discriminate good behaviors and bad ones. Due to bad people's nice suits and impressive images made by TV producers some illegal behaviors may seem very cool for children even if not following the rules and putting people's lives in jeopardy. <EX>According to recent news by BBC, sad accidents happened last week. Some children hit other kids who live in their neighborhood but different apartments. They said in police that they just wanted to be shown as a gangster that they saw on some movies.</EX> <TR>In this regard,</TR> TV should know influential and duties to educate children in a good way. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> some TV programs and movies do not have the intention that bad people eventually will be punished have something to do with increased crime rates.</MI2> <SI2>To specify this, some people can misunderstand that a few illegal behaviors are not always punished and even do not cause people who did pay for fine. This gives rise to high crime rates recently. According to recent research conducted by the police department, a certain amount of crime has been broadcasted on TV or was the topic of famous movie. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> 'Ocean’s Eleven' that features many famous actors was considered as a main reason why accidents related with robbing of bank can be founded at many times lately.</EX> Therefore, TV and movies should realize their potential threatening on society and have a tendency to make programs and scenes to encourage sound behaviors among people. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> if TV do not show that guilty people are punished by law, not only will children have misconception about their behavior that they will have but also crime rates will absolutely be soring. In conclusion, I insist that TV and movie produce many programs to help people know that their good behavior will be praised and their bad conducts will be excluded from our society.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph wasn't a particularly strong argument.  Transitions at the start of the two body paragraphs lacked punch.  Grammar issues.

column1: 121&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A teacher’s ability to relate well to students is more important than his or her ability to impart knowledge. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN> A large number of people might assert that a teacher's ability to impart knowledge is more important than his or her ability to relate well to students. <TS>Contrary to the popular belief, I agree to the statement that a teacher's ability to relate well to students is more crucial than the other ability for the following two reasons: lower level of stress, and higher study efficiency.</TS></IN>

<BO1>        <MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> a teacher's ability to have good relationship with students is more important than the other ability to deliver knowledge as the prior ability enables students to have low level of stress.</MI1> <SI1>The positive relationship between students and faculty members can create more comfortable and relaxing environment. This helps students to be prevented from getting excessive stress that many students already suffer from. As teachers can easily communicate and discuss class materials and even private events that students might want to share with them when they have excellent ability to relate well to students, students can find ways to release their stress. Stress is huge factor that influence students as it can often make students to have ADHD or other mental illness. <EX>According to Ministry of Education of Korea in 2011, there was a significant difference between two groups of students in stress level. Students in Korea generally don't have much opportunities to relate with their teachers as teachers in Korea manage more than 40 students in a year as a home room teacher. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> students in Switzerland typically have more opportunities to relate with their teachers as the teachers only manage 15 students in a year. <TR>In addition,</TR> elementary students in Switzerland visited parks or amusement park at least four times in a year. The researchers found out that the stress level of students in Korea was 59 percent greater than that of students in Switzerland.</EX> This indicates that teachers' ability to relate well to students helps students to get less stress.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2>        <MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> a faculty member's ability to relate well to students is more critical than the other ability to confer their information to students since the first ability renders students to study with higher efficiency.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that when the students have good relationship with their teachers, they can easily ask questions about their class materials, which greatly expands their knowledge. <TR>Also,</TR> the teachers with the ability are likely to engage in active class discussion or presentation as these activities or performances help them to relate well with students. <EX>The researchers in Seoul National University showed that students with teachers who possess the ability have better academic achievements. In the experiment, there were two groups of high school students. Students in group A had a friendly teachers, while students in group B had a strict teachers who rarely related to their students. 85 percent of students in group A were accepted to university they desired, but only 61 percent of students in group B were accepted to the university they wanted.</EX> This suggests that the teacher's ability to relate well with their students creates student's higher study efficiency and academic performance.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>        <TR>In brief,</TR> a teacher's ability to relate well to students is more crucial than his or her ability to deliver knowledge because the prior ability lowers students' stress, and increase studying efficiency. All in all, the importance of teachers with such ability cannot be underestimated in order to make students with no mental illness and poor academic achievements. </CO>
column23: The thesis lacked punch but was otherwise a good essay.

column1: 122&Do you agree or disagree with the followiing statement? Technological advances and automation are bad for creating job growth.
column3:
<IN>There are different opinions among people regarding whether the job creation is hampered by the development of technology and the automation. It is true that technological advances and automation process have helped people to live more comfortable and also there are several minute parts of production where people can only manipulate. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I strongly believe that in terms of the creating jobs, the development of technology is more likely to bring people more difficult circumstances to get a job.</TS> In this essay, I will present briefly two reasons to support my idea.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> as the machines have supplanted people in working, the work force of people has become unnecessary.</MI1> <SI1>To be more specific, a lot of machines and new technologies replace peoples works. Not only harsh and dangerous works they do, but also general works instead of people, such as driving the subways. This invariably eliminate the position which the workers stand on. <EX>Like the orchestra, which thrived in the silent movie era as the background musics, had declined and lost their jobs with the advent of technology making sound movies, any workers also can lose their jobs with the new technology and automation, which renders hiring people to work unnecessary.</EX> In this regard, the development of technology and automation does not provide people with career chances, rather deprives them. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> the machines tend to be more preferred to people in the work places.</MI2> <SI2>The thing is, the use of machine does not require for employers to pay salaries to workers, and this allows them to save their money and lessen their expend. In other words, as foreign workers are preferred because of their lower payment, machines are also the same, so the employers utilize machines rather than employ people as workers. <TR>Similarly,</TR> in the case of people, they can get sick and be absent from their office for several reasons including family events. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> the machines do not so, and can be operated for 365days, everyday, as long as there is not a serious problem. <TR?Therefore,</TR> much more efficiency and the chance to save money of utilizing machines causes employers to use it, not to hire people as their workers.</SI2></BO2>
column23: Lacked a conclusion, and the second body paragraph was a little cluttered.

column1: 123&Some people prefer to work for a large company. Others prefer to work for a small company. Which would you prefer?
column3:
<IN>This is very interesting issue that is taking place nowadays. This is because most people graduated from university have tried to enter enterprises. <TS>In my opinion. Entering small companies will be better for people with several reasons such as low competition and good atmosphere like family.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> There is no heavy competition in small company.</MI1> <SI1>What I mean is that, as company is small, there are no many employees in company so that it will be easier for employees to get promotion in company. Therefore employees can stay longer and earn more money. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> employees working in big company have heavy competition to get promotion. This is because there are many people who want to get promotion and their speck is so good. As a result, their possibility to be fired by company will be high with no promotion. In addition earning a lot of money from company will be hard too. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> small companies have a familiar atmosphere such as family and friend.</MI2> <SI2>This is because there are no many laborer so that it may be easier to get familiar with others. As a result, being easier to be friend each other help workers to have a happy life in company and their productive will be better. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I have ever been to company my relative works as employee. Even though the company is so small and there are a little members, I can feel familiar with one another. They were having meal together with happy atmosphere. I believe that small members in company is one of the many reasons why they can make good atmosphere.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> entering good and big company is a dream everyone try to come true. <TR>However</TR> the most important thing people should think about is not entering big company without concern about their personality but going to companies that are suitable for people. <TR>Therefore</TR> I hope people not to enter big company without purpose following others.</CO>
column23: Overall this was a good essay, only marred by occasional grammar issues.

column1: 124&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The need to use land for farming, housing, and industry takes precedence over the need to preserve the habitat of endangered species. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might assert that the need to preserve the habitat of endangered species takes precedence over the need to use land for farming, housing, and industry. <TS>Contrary to the popular belief, I agree to the statement that the need to use land for agriculture, resident, and industry should be prioritized over the need to save the habitat of endangered animals for the following two reasons: importance of human life, and economic merits.</TS></IN>
            
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the need to employ land for farming, housing, and industry is greater than the need to use land for preserving endangered animals as the human life is more valuable than that of endangered animals.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that human is a superior entity than any other animals, even if the animals are endangered. While human's living standard can be significantly improved by employing land for farming, housing, and industry, employing the land for animal cannot contribute to benefiting human's life. By building infrastructures, farms, houses, and factories, people can create more places to rest, and work. <EX>According to the Ministry of Budget Management of Korea in 2011, 54 percent of available land in Korea was used for industrial, agricultural, and residential purposes. On the other hand, only 12 percent of the land was remained as 'Green-belt Zone'. The zone is a special area where sophisticated construction and hunting is banned.</EX> This indicates the greater importance of land use for farming, housing, and industry over the land use for saving endangered animals.</SI1></BO1>
            
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> the need to exploit land for agricultural, residential, and industrial use is more crucial than the need to use land for preserving endangered species since the farming, housing, and industrial land can more contribute to economy than land for animal protection.</MI2> <SI2>As contemporary society is becoming increasingly globalized and competitive, the importance of economy has increased. Land for farming can help economy by producing crops such as rice and corn. <TR>Also,</TR> land for housing can benefit economy by promoting money transaction. In addition, land for industry is significantly advantageous in economy by producing goods such as computers and cars. <TR>Nevertheless,</TR> the land for preserving animals cannot much contribute to advancement of economy as the land cannot be commercialized or invested by any business entity. <EX>According to the Seoul National University, there was a huge difference between two countries in GDP and GDP per capita. Two countries are Japan and Congo. 64 percent of Japanese land is in use for agriculture, residential, and industrial purposes. On the contrary, only 13 percent of lands in Congo are in use for the purposes. GDP of Japan was 830 percent bigger than that of Congo. Also, GDP per capita of Japan was 430 percent bigger than that of Congo.</EX> This suggests that the land for the purposes contributes to development of economy for both nations and individuals.</SI2></BO2>
            
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> the need to exploit land for farming, housing, and industry far outweighs that of land for protecting endangered animals for economic, and human's life. All in all, the importance of farm, house, and factories cannot be underestimated in order to have affluent and comfortable life.</CO>
column23: Well-written essay, just has some grammar issues.

column1: 125&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is fair for each group member to be given the same grade after a gruop project.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that it is fair for each group member to be given the same grade a group project. But, i disagree with the statement. <TS>While studying in group, there should be gap between group members by their gap of ability. <TR>In addition,</TR> even if With best partnership and teamwork, there are some students who don't participate a little bit.Accepting the gap is more fair than ignoring it.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> there are gap of student's ability to do project.</MI1> <SI1>We should accept the gap and reflect to the grade to recognize their weekness and make up for the weak points. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when i did a group project, there are a student who assigned to make presentation. But she couldn't make PPT, i should make the PPT while doing my another task. At that time, i thought that these gap between students' ability should reflect to the grade not only to be fair, but also to regonize their weekness themselves and make them to remedy their weakness.</EX> </S1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of,</TR> there are students who want do nothing. <SI2>Even though we have a great teamwork, the students who want do nothing is very difficult to persuade to do project together. It is almost impossible. <EX><TR>For instatnce,</TR> they don't keep in touch with other teammates, come to meeting. When such students are in the group with me, i really don't want get the same grade with them. It is unfair because they did nothing.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclude,</TR> we should get different grade in group project. Because it can makes the students who has inability recognize their weakness, the students who did nothing are underservedness to get same grade. In these reasons, i think that it is unfair to get same grade in the group project.</CO>
column23: The Thesis wasn't very strong.  There were spelling and grammar issues.

column1: 126&Advertising can tell you a lot about a country. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that advertising doesn't play a role in learning about a country. This is because advertisement tends to be fiction. <TS><TR>On the other hand,</TR> in my opinion, people can learn about a country by advertisement because of cultural reflection and chance of exploration.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> advertising is a reflection of custom and culture. advertising varies from country to country, relying on particular convention.</MI1> <SI1>People can obtain general understanding on each country with a ease. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in advertisement of Kimchi, which is traditional korean food, the background is likely to represent the best atmosphere of kimchi. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it would contain a variety range of korean traditional things such as Korean traditional house, Hanbok, korean traditional clothes, and the way of making kimchi. These help other countries' people to have overall understanding of Korea.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>What is more,</TR> advertising give more opportunity to explore about country.</MI2> <SI2>Once people become curious about a country because of advertising, they are willing to search about its country to know more. The more people deeply explore about it, the more they have a chance to visit there someday. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when i was a freshmen in university, I saw one advertisement about Pattai restaurant on Television.  It seemed like noodle but I didn't know exactly what it was. Although i asked my friends who saw its advertising together, they had no idea as well. Therefore, I searched it on the internet, and found out it was one of popular noodle in Thailand which tastes like spicy and sweet, <TR>Moreover,</TR> I could realize there are plenty of flavored food in Thailand, leading me to travel to Thailand with unforgettable memories in that year. If i didn't watch it, I would have never had a chance to travel and enjoy Thailand culture.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that advertising plays a pivotal role in being aware of country. Not only it gives the knowledge of culture, but also people have more chance to know about country. All in all, each country should develop more advertising technologies to attract more people to visit.</EX>
column23: Second body paragraph was a little weak.  Some grammar errors.

column1: 127&It is better to learn about foreign countries from newspapers and magazines than to visit those countries.
column3:
<IN> A large number of people might assert that it is better to learn about foreign countries from visiting those countries than from reading newspapers and magazines. <TS><TR>Contrary to the popular belief,</TR> I agree to the statement that it is better to learn about foreign countries from newspapers and magazines for the following two reasons: expanding one's perspective toward the world, and economic benefit.</TS></IN>
               
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> learning about foreign countries from news articles and magazines is more advantageous than learning from visiting the countries since the prior method enables people to more broaden their horizon.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that the articles and writings about the new places contain details that cannot be obtained by actual visit. As the articles are generally written by professional travelers or journalists who design the travel with experts for a long period of time, the articles are highly likely to include detailed information about the locales. <TR>On the contrary,</TR> actual visit only offers limited information to the visitors because vast majority of normal visitors have limited time and money to travel or experience the countries' culture or custom. <EX>According to Hana Tour, a travel agency in Korea, its’ articles regard foreign countries are typically composed by three natives and two professors who mastered the visited countries culture in university.</EX> This suggests that learning the countries from newspapers and magazines are much more helpful in broadening one's perspective.</SI1></BO1>
               
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> learning about foreign countries from newspapers and magazines are economical than the alternative learning method.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that acquiring the documents or papers are easier and cheaper way to comprehend foreign countries' culture or history than visiting the countries to achieve the same goal. To illustrate, visiting the countries generally costs plane tickets, hotel, and tour guide expenses. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> buying or borrowing the newspapers and magazines cost only the price of the articles. <EX>According to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism in Korea, there was a significant difference between two groups of university students in financial status. Students in group A visited foreign countries fourth times during university life to learn about the countries, while students in group B only learned about the countries through accessing to internet and reading journals. The researchers found out that the savings of group B was 93 percent greater than that of group A.</EX> This indicates that learning about the countries from newspapers and magazines are more economical. </SI2><BO2>
               
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> it is better to learn about foreign countries from newspapers and magazines than to visit those countries due to its merit in widening perspective and saving money. All in all, the importance of newspapers and magazines cannot be underestimated in order to have broad knowledge.</CO>
column23: 2nd body paragraph's main point isn't very clear.

column1: 128&People today would be happier if they have fewer possessions.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that people would have a happier life if they have fewer money. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I believe that people should have higher possessions so as to have a happy life for two reasons: to stay mentally and physically healthy and to have a good quality of life.</TS></IN>
               
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> having a great deal of money allows people to keep in health.</MI1> <SI1>This is mainly due to the fact that money guarantees a stress-free life, while having less money can stress people out by making them worry about how to make ends meet. <TR>Moreover,</TR> stress is one of the main factors of diseases through weakening the immune system. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul University of Korea in 2010, a test on mice showed life span was shortened when they regularly underwent a series of electric shocks. Interestingly, the researchers found a link between this and human beings who suffered from periodic stress. This implies that high stress levels coming from the lack of money can negatively affect humans, resulting in a shorter life span.</EX><SI1><BO1>
               
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> possessing a adequate amount of money enables people to have a good quality of life.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that money tends to represent their ability to obtain whatever they want ranging from fancy cars to even trust in relationships. This is especially true given the fact that modern society runs on materialism. <EX>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2008, there was a huge difference between two groups of employees in happiness index. Employees in Group A owned a house and those in Group B rented a house. The researchers showed that the level of happiness in Group A was much higher than that of Group B. Moreover, more than 60 percent of employees in Group B underwent severe depression. They had to constantly worry about paying rent in order to maintain a roof over their head. This shows the money makes life easier and more comfortable.</EX></SI2><BO2>
               
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> although having fewer possessions would offer people some benefits, the advantages of possessing higher havings far outweigh those of having less money. All in all, the importance of owning a great amount of money cannot be underestimated in order to succeed in life.</CO>
column23: Thesis lacked punch.  Many grammar and semantic issues.

column1: 129&A teacher's abilityto relate well with students is more important than the ability to give knowlede.
column3:
<IN>Since, an increasing number of accidents which teachers hurts students when they punishes, a controversy has arisen over whether teacher must put the mor priority on getting along with students mor than conveying knowledgy.<TS<TR>In my opinion,</TR> teachers should think that giveing knowledge is more important than relating well with their students in class, for two reasons; it helps students to get a job in the future, and teaches responsibilities.</TS> </IN>
              
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR> teachers who focus mainly on conveying knowledge allow students to get a job easily.</MI1> <SI1>This is because, unlike the past when most economies were based on agriculture and manufacturing which were mainly labor-oriented, which that day was cooperative each other, now, we are in the specialized and competitive society which today's job markets require job candidates with a high degree of expertise in their majors and language skills. Thus, teachers shoule spend most of their class time to make it for students to correspond to today job markets requirements.
<EX>According to studies conducted by the National Job Market Association, those who can speak English, a global language have an enormous competitive adventage over those who can not. Also, studies pointed out that most of presidents of company said " we'll continually increase the number of employees who can speak global languages such as Chines, and English to follow the trend of global world. This implies that it is important for a teacher to pass on knowlege to students for their success future. </EX></SI1></BO1>
          
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> teachers' conveying knowledge in a classroom plays a significant role in improving students' sense of responsibility.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that gaining knowledge from a teacher requires responsibilities such as arriving on time, managing schedules wisely, meets deadlines and observing regulations. In contrast, teachers who more consider closing to students often results in student's irresponsibility.
<EX>According to research by the National Youth leadership Council, students who study under the strict surroundings do better academically tan thier peers who do with friendly teacher. because they know how to handle multiple tasks and responsibilies and can also abide by the rules of class. </EX></SI2></BO2>
          
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> the principal fuction of teacher is that students are equipped with the expertise to get the work and with a feeling of responsibility. In this regard, I believe that the role of teachers to give information is more important than that of theacher whose students feel friendly for thier successful life.</CO>
column23: Some grammar issues.  The main points were speculative.

column1: 130&Today, young people do not help their community.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that today's young people help their community because living standards have been rising. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I believe that they don't care about community for two reasons: modern society want people to be more competitive and makes people stressful.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> modern society makes people aggressive to each other.</MI1> <SI1>It is due to the fact that modern society only want the best regardless of how one can achieve it. Thus, people want to be more competitive without considering their community. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in a high school, I had a friend who gave me attitude every time I asked for help. He always said that he didn't know what the answer is or he is too busy to help me. He was very competitive and winning was everything to him. In fact, he was doing a lot to prepare such as getting private tutoring and spending much time doing research. In the end, he got the admission to Ivy League.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2></TR>In addition,</TR> people are too stressful to take care of community.</MI2> <SI2>It is obvious that people who are concerned about oneself tend to ignore problems of community. Thus, the more stressful young people become, the more they become indifferent. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in Korea in 2008, there was a huge difference between two groups of students. Group A consisted of students who had higher stress level than Group B. In the experiment, students are required to solve problem which is a little difficult to them. The researchers showed that students in Group B solve problem more wisely while helping each other. Those of Group A didn't talk to each other and tended to solve problem alone. In other words, contributing factor was cooperation. </EX>This implies that today's young people who has higher stress level tends to behave without caring each other.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> today's young people don't care about their community because they live in modern society that emphasize competition and increase people's stress level. All in all, our society will become more brittle and less humanitarian.</CO>
column23: Some of the ideas supporting the Thesis weren't very strong or directly related to it enough.  Numerous grammar issues.

column1: 131&People learn more by watching television than reading books.
column3:
<IN>There are positive and negative effects on people in terms of watching TV more time than reading books. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is controversial that people can more learn from television than from books. <TS>I agree with this statement because people spend more time watching TV than reading books and TV contains lots of useful information.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> people spend much more time watching TV than reading books.<MI1> <SI1>They can listen and watch a lot of information from TV. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> as far as I’m concern, people usually watch TV when they have spare time because it is easier than reading a book which we should buy from a book store or borrow from a library.</EX> Also, although you often read a book, you cannot gain much information. That means that you can usually learn certain range of knowledge and this is very small amount compared TV has.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> TV has also a lot of useful and advanced information.</MI2> <SI2>Nowadays, TV deals with more and more diverse range of subjects from advanced science to philosophy since TV has many channels. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> since I was in elementary school, I liked documentary channel such as Discovery Channel. As all we know, Discovery Channel has great amount of scientific programs. I have learn many things from that, and it was very helpful for me when I had an interview to enroll to my university.</EX> So, I definitely think that we can learn more through TV than through a book.</SI2><BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> although some people argue that we can more learn about things from books than from TV, I strongly believe that we can learn about more things from TV. That is because people usually spend more time on watching TV and TV also has lots of useful knowledge.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph doesn't really prove anything.  It simply states that people watch more TV than books, but doesn't necessarily illustrate that that is better.

column1: 132&All high school students are required to study a foreign launguage.
column3:
<IN>There are different opinions among people regarding whether a foreign language course should be included in curricular of all high school. <TS>Although some people argue that high school students can reap benefits focusing on other academic subjects, such as science or math, I totally believe that advantages that students can have by learning a foreign language outweigh disadvantages.</TS> In this essay, I will present reasonable reasons to support my idea.</IN>
            
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> as the world is getting closer and closer, learning a foreign language is a great attribution to success in ones’ life.</MI1> <SI1>To specify this, students are likely to meet a number of those who are from other country when making out into the real world and have a job in days to come. In order to become much more competitive, certain amounts of knowledge that students study from their major is not enough. This is because lack of ability to speak second language may deprive a person of chances to show his or her great performances in the fields. <TR>Therefore,</TR> high school are required to attempt to encourage students to get used to a foreign language to a certain extent. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my high school have magnificent language programs to encourage students to improve their English or Japanese. My friends tried to study very hard to become proficient in both a second language and academic subjects. As a result, those who are equipped with an advanced level of language are now showing a great performance in their field and enjoying their successful lives.</EX> In this regard, a foreign language learned in high school is considerably helpful for students’ future. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> it seems that high school students will not have sufficient time to study and get involved in a foreign language course because they have to spend their time reading their major books and doing assignments in university.</MI2> <SI2>To specify this, some people can say that university have diverse education programs associated with teaching a second language. <TR>However,</TR> it is likely that university students are so busy with their major that they do not have a room to concentrate in a second language course. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when being asked about studying a foreign language, every university student said that they try to take part in that kind of class, but cannot help but go to the library to study their major. <TR>Therefore,</TR> high school should take an appropriate action to give students chances to exploring a foreign language that they have wanted to learn. Probably, for them, high school life is a last chance to indulge themselves with learning a second language, so they need to receive a foreign language class, even if it is a basic course.</EX></SI2></BO2>
            
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> it is essential for every high school student to study how to speak and read a foreign language because not only can they become much more competitive with ability to talk to foreign people but also because they do not have enough time to study it when they are in university. <TR>In conclusion,</TR> all high school should provide a foreign language course for students’ bright future.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph becomes a little incoherent.  I had a hard time following what exactly that second paragraph was saying.

column1: 133&Because environment issues are very complex, individual people can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>Nowadays, thanks to industrial development, people can enjoy lots of convenience but on the other hand, environment issues, such as global warming, are seriously menace us. <TR>Therefore</TR> we need to consider what to do to solve this problem. <TS>Although some people think that they have nothing to do to revive environment condition, I strongly believe that small efforts can be a great help to make our environment better.</TS> I have several bases to support my argument and they would be written below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> as lots of bricks are comprise of a big building, our small efforts can build up great impact on our environment.<MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> if all people use tumblers of their own instead of paper cups which we can use for only one time, huge amount of trashes can be reduced. To be specific, let’s assume that a student drink 3cups of water a day in school and there are 500 students in a school. If they only use instant paper cups or plastic ones, daily 1500 paper or plastic cups are thrown out and when it comes to annual basis, the number of wasted cups would be more or less 500,000.</EX> We can easily find this kind of situations from our routines and therefore we should not overlook small amount of daily garbage that we unintentionally desert.   </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> individuals can make up organizations to recover our nature.</MI2> <SI2>That is, little interests of many people can be added up together, constructing tremendous scale of environmental projects. Nonprofit institutes like UNESCO or UNICEF must have begun their activity from a person’s precipitation and by summing up more and more peoples such efforts. Like this, by continuously gathering many people who are willing to precede environment related activities, individual efforts will not be ended up as just a person’s doing but rather will result in visible effect on our nature. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in university, I belonged to photograph club. One day, one of club members suggested us to do some cleaning activities, complaining lack of proper place in our campus to take any picture because of too many garbage from here and there, and we began to picked used bottles up in our campus and we posted notices that warns people not to throw any trashes out on the bare road. Since then we could feel that campus is changing. I suppose that if I or that member did so alone, this kind of radical change could not have occurred but group power composed of those of individuals enabled to bring success up.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> individuals efforts to revive our environment are very important not only because that those, themselves, can affect our nature in tremendous scale but also because group power from personal powers can bring about bigger results than those of simply summed up of individuals. <TR>Therefore</TR> we ought not to ignore individuals’ great impacts.</CO>
column23: Overall a very well-written essay, with some grammatical errors.

column1: 134&Some people trust their first impressions about a person’s character because they believe these judgments are generally correct. Other people do not judge a person’s character quickly because they believe first impressions are often wrong. Compare these two attitudes. Which attitude do you agree with? Support your choice with specific examples.
column3:
<IN>In many cases, people tend to judge others when they meet them for the first time. <TS><TR>However,</TR> such a judgment could obscure the real characteristics of a person.</TS></IN>

<BO1><SI1><TR>Interestingly,</TR> according to a survey, men feel attraction of women only in a few seconds. In this case, they may judge women depending on a visual attraction, such as stature, facial expression, and her style. Of course, it matches with her personalities to some extent, but the real personalities might be hidden under the positive portion. <EX>When I meet a person, for instance, I make an effort to know about a person, not only his or her external feelings but also the internal and hidden characteristics because it is very important to “know” about a person.</EX> When we say that “I know about the person,” it does not mean that “I just know the person’s name, face and stature,” but know about the person’s ways to think, when they feel happy and what they are like. In the case that a person shows himself to others for the first time, it is clear that he will introduce only about his strength and positive facets. This applies to an example when an employee has an interview. Today, as the relationship with others has become important, many companies have applied more different recruit strategies than before. They do not hire employees at the first interview. They interview employees many times to know about them specifically, checking and comparing with other appliers and then hirer will make a decision to hire the appropriate employee.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Not only that,</TR> when people suffer from difficult situations, in most cases, the first positive impression ends up in false.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Frankly, I sometimes use odd methods to test whether people’s first image matches with their true personalities. The method of assessing a person, for example, is to make arduous situation such as spilling a cup of coffee on hers’ clothes. If she dealt with the situation with proper wisdom, I would conclude in mind that the person matches with the first impression, and consider her as special person to me.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> as we can see from my personal cases above, the first expression often goes wrong.</CO>
column23: The essay was fairly well-written in terms of language, but it suffered from a lack of strong main points, which made it difficult to follow the flow of thought.

column1: 135&Young people enjoy life more than older people.
column3:
<IN>Since an increasing number of elders who enjoy thier life as taking a trip, a controversy has arisen over wheter young people are more able to enjoy lives than elders. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR> people will be happier when they get older for two reasons ; young people have to get a job compared to older people, and older people generally have more money than youngers.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin</TR> with young people have to spend most of their time preparing for their job market, which makes it harder for them to enjoy thier lives than older people.</MI1> <SI1>This is because unlike the older generation whose economies were based on agriculture and manufacturing which were mainly lobor-oriented, the younger generation is living in the information age. Thus, they are involved in sedentary life to prepare for exams and interview to enter the company.

<EX><TR>For example,</TR> my younger brother who strive to get the work is always in library and spend most of his time there except sleeping and having meals at home. So he doesn't have time to play with friends even if he really want to it. In contrast, my eldest sister who already have a job have a lot of time to enjoy her hobby such as watching movies after work as well as take a trip with friends on holiday.</EX> This implies that young people have little time to enjoy their lives in order to get a job in the future.</SI1></BO1>
              
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> elders' having a much money plays significant role in being more happier.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that enough money offer a wider range of options to improve quality of life. Therefore money is essential component to enjoy life. Imagine about it, If you don't have enough money, then, is it possible to do what you really want? <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my grandmather wanted to travels overseas especially in France to go to the art gallery for a long time. Because her hobby was about art work to speak of. When she was young, she didn't have enough money to go to there. also due to her house's lack of circumstance. <TR>However</TR> she always had a deream to achieve what she'll certainly go to the France in the future. After all, she travels after her retirement spending money which she saves as working. So she feels more satisfied with her life to its fullest.</EX></SI2></BO2>
             
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> young people have difficulty enjoying their lives because they have to develop skills for the future and have less money to enjoy what they want. In this regard, I firmly believe that older people have the freedom and opportunity to enjoy life more than people who are younger.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph seems to have been divided in two.  Some grammar and spelling issues.

column1: 136&People can benefit more from traveling in their own country than traveling to foreign countries.
column3:
<IN>In globalized society, it is believed that people can get more advantages by traveling in their own country than traveling to foreign countries. Some people advocate that people who tour in their native nation can have more memorable memories. <TR>However,</TR> I disagree with this view. <TS>I firmly believed that traveling another county can more be good for them than taking a trip to their own nation.</TS> <TR>This is because first,</TR> people can have several experiences that they have never done in their own country. <TR>Second,</TR> travelers who go abroad can be more independent.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> they can have new experience by going abroad to trip.</MI1> <SI1>To be specific, each country has their own traditional. If he or she travel around the world, the person can learn about another traditional that they have never experienced yet. So they can have precious memorizes. <EX>At that time, I met many new friends and went around a lot of memorial halls. Through this experience, I realized that I can learn a lot of things such as other countries’ languages, traditional and history by traveling another country even for a short period.</EX> <TR>Hence,</TR> this shows that having a time to trip foreign nations can help people to have new experiences.</SI1><BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> people, especially students can improve their spirit of independence.</MI2> <SI2>In other words, since foreign countries have different cultures and languages, people have to solve their problems by themselves during traveling. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> according to a study done by the New York Times, it revealed that traveling around the world makes opportunities that travelers solve their troubles by themselves. The study indicated that because the native people talk in languages the travelers can’t speak and there is no one who knows them so they should try to make the difficulties right.</EX> Thus, it is legitimate to say that going abroad for trip aids travelers to stand their own two feet.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is my belief that traveling other countries aids travelers to get some benefits. <TR>To sum up,</TR> going another nation brings chances to not only have various experiences but also motivate them to solve their problems on their own. <TR>Therefore,</TR> people who are going to travel should consider going on a trip to another nations.</CO>
column23: Supporting ideas were not very strong, and it was hindered by grammar and semantic problems.

column1: 137&It is better to choose a university whose graduates have good job opportunities than a university who has famous professors.
column3:
<IN>Getting a fine job is hard today since the population of the world is swiftly increasing. In order to get a job, many students attend a university whose graduates have good job opportunities. <TS>On the other hand, it might seem like pursuing idealism but it is better to choose a university who has famous professors because students can guarantee high quality of education, and studying under renown professors gradually help students to get a job.</TS>  </IN>
          
<BO1><MI1>Students should choose a university with famous professors since they can have high quality of education.</MI1> <SI1>A true education is acknowledging the information with high quality, and this knowledge will allow them to be a wise person. <TR>Moreover,</TR> famous professors are famous for at least one reason. In fact, most of them are famous for their teaching skills, and leading students to be open-minded. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> many renowned professors are famous for stimulating students, leading students to have a true education, and make sure their students do not studying just to have job opportunities. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I once had a chance to audit a lecture of Chul Soo Ahn, who is well-known for inventing vaccine for computers and disseminating it for free, when he was a professor in KAIST. I only audited two hours of lecture, but it was very impressive and moving that it made me to invent various vaccine programs, not for money but to have a positive world.</EX> Likewise, famous professors allow students to do something they are majoring in, not ruining money and time in a university like many other students. </SI1></BO1>
              
<BO2><MI2><TR>Finally,</TR> it is better for a student to choose a university who has renowned professors since studying under renown professors would gradually lead to have job opportunities.</MI2> <SI2>It is true that many companies are looking for people who achieved higher quality of education to ensure they chose the right person for their company. When applying to have a job opportunity, companies would have the information of each university, and would also know if the university if famous for getting a job or to make sure students truly studied the subject. There is also a policy in every company that how much proportion of people they are going to hire from each university approximately. It is, thus, easier to get accept from the company for those who studied under famous professors with high quality of education. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I attended Seoul National University in South Korea, I majored in electronic. <TR>However,</TR> although my department did not have many good job opportunities, I could get offer from the highest company in my country thanks to my famous professor.</EX> This is only in my case, but many people who attend university who has famous professors also got a chance to get a fine job. </SI2></BO2>
              
<CO>People still look for university whose graduates have good job opportunities, which is a very short-sighted decision. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> by choosing a university who has famous professors would allow students to have a true learning, and stimulate students to do hard in the field they are in. <TR>Needless to say,</TR> attending a university with renowned professors would eventually lead students to have good job opportunities since companies would know the university's characteristics. <TR>Consequently,</TR> it is better to choose a university who has famous professors in order to be open-minded, and to be a wise person.</CO>
column23: The thesis and main points were weak, and the supporting ideas didn't seem very firm.  Ideas were expressed well but the ideas weren't strong.

column1: 138&Today, life is easier and cozier than it was when our grandparents were young.
column3:
<IN>Teenagers in the modern society complain that they have too much works to do and too many subjects to study. Some of them envy their grandparents and say that their grandparents had much easier life when they were young. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I strongly believe that the children of the current generation are having more comfortable lives than that of their grandparents for two reasons: advancement of technology in many different sectors and abundant food.</TS></IN>
           
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> technology has developed significantly and it made people to enjoy much easier lives.</MI1> <SI1>In last five decades, numerous developments and inventions have been made. These achievements allowed not only all the industries but also all the teenagers to do their works more efficiently. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> the computer has been invented and helped students to do homework efficiently. When writing a research paper, past generations first had to visit a library to search the needed information. They had to spend extensive amount of their time to actually go to a library and find the related books. When they found enough information, they had to write the research paper on a sheet of paper with a pen or pencil. When they made spelling errors, they had to erase the errors with an eraser. All those processes are very difficult and irksome works.</EX> <TR>However,</TR> with the help of a computer, students in the today’s world can search the information they need online and write the paper with documentation software, which they can write and erase without any burdensome works.</SI1></BO1>
           
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> the children living in current timeline do not have to worry about food shortage.</MI2> <SI2>About 60 years ago, there was a war that took place. Many people died from being bombed for getting shot, but more people died from lack of food. Everyone in Korea had to worry about what they were going to eat for the next meal. Most of the people ate only one meal a day. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> no one in the modern society suffer from starvation. Many teenagers think about what they are going to eat next, but it is not because they do not have any food left, but it is because they have too much to choose from. According to the research conducted by the National Foundation of Korea, food production in Korea has increased more than 700 percent compared to the food production in 1950. With the more food produced, young people in today’s world are living cozier lives ever before.</SI2></BO2>
           
<CO>There are some difficult obstacles which children in contemporary world are facing. <TR>Yet,</TR> I still strongly agree with given statement because of the development of technology and increase in food production.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues but otherwise a good essay.  Conclusion was a little weak.

column1: 139&The ability to write and read is more important now than it was in the past.
column3:
<IN>It is evident that in current society education has a tremendous importance. Some people think that reading and writing skill is less important than in the past others do not. <TS><TR>I however,</TR> believe ability to write and read is still important in our lives.</TS> There are several reason that I could discuss to support my position so I will limit my point to the two that I feel are the most relevant to the topic. <TR>First,</TR> it is basic skills to have success. <TR>Also,</TR> it is more efficient.</IN>

<BO1><MI1>The most important reason for my feeling this ways is that reading and writing is the basic skills which need to succeed.</MI1> <SI1>Even though, our society quickly changed over the new technology, basic skills likes reading, writing, speaking, and listening are essential to have success. <EX>A really good example can be seen in the Steve Jobs who is former CEO of Apple. I read this story on his biography. This describes the reason why Jobs success likes IPhone and IMac. I realized that he not only had has computer skills and creative problem solving skills, not also communication skills. He can persuade his product to the customer because he had communication skills based on reading and writing skills. This example clearly shows that basic skill is related to success.</EX> This brings me to the next reason which I mentioned in the next paragraph.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The second reason which proves my argument is efficient. If people have a ability to read and write, they can work efficiently.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Take my co-worker Jonathan, for example, he works very efficiently because he has a good writing and reading skills. He always finish his work before deadline. Unless Jonathan, my another co-worker Tom has poor skills to read and write. Thus, he usually pass the deadline and there are many errors in his report. This is because he spend a lot of time to read the material and to write report.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> it can be said that having basic skills such as reading and writing is very important like past.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things I considered,</TR> with this evidence above I mentioned, I believe that I adequately and sufficiently explained my position that ability reading and writing skill is important regarding the topic.</CO>
column23: The thesis and main points were not very strong and actually did not quite address the exact question that was asked.

column1: 140&Getting a university education is the most important for success in life.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that getting a university education is the most important for success in life. <TS>But i disagree with the statement.</TS> I think that there are lots of CEO who earn much money without going university, and university education can't give the students a real experience.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> There are lots of people living successful life without going university.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> i know a man who get much money. I wondered how he get the money. He have worked at a small factory and have got lots of money.</EX> Except him, there are so much successful people who didn't go university. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> university education can't give the students a real experience.</MI2> <SI2>To success in life, the real experience in very important. This is because it is more practial than theory that university gives students. But the students can get the real experience by only practical working. University study are not useful than students' expecting. </SI1></BO2>

<CO><TR>In short,</TR> there are lots of successful people without going university and university can't give the students a practical experience. In these reasons, I don't think that university education is neccessary to successful life.</CO>
column23: Thesis and main ideas were not presented very strongly.  Supporting ideas were weak.

column1: 141&Art and music class should be required in young children's school like science and math class.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument whether young children need to have an artistic experience in school. <TS>I agree that schools should offer art and music classes and help students learn to value the arts.</TS> It is because art allows children to learn two critical skills: thinking originally and relieving academic stress. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> students can improve creative thinking skills that are essential for learning and success in life.</MI1> <SI1>In art and music classes, students are encouraged to explore how to express their own thoughts in their own ways while appreciating and understanding a great painter’s masterpiece or an excellent piece of music; that brings out students’ creativity and originality. Art and music classes also provide them with thinking flexibility they will need in other classes including math and science class, and even in their life. Since the world has become more complex and increasingly specialized these days, it is hard to solve a problem within knowledge of a certain field. <TR>Therefore,</TR> people need to cooperate with others from various fields and think flexibly, so that they can find out the better answer for a problem. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> participating in art and music classes relieves students’ academic stress.</MI2> <SI2>Since the dawn of time humans have drawn pictures. It is more natural than putting on a sock, to describe one’s feelings by a drawing. Especially for young students, drawing is an effective way to release emotions and relieve the stress because drawing does not require difficult skills; less stress allows students to achieve better grades and have healthier minds. <TR>Therefore,</TR> providing quality art education to young students is very important. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I agree that schools should offer art and music classes for young students to teach them creative thinking skills and help them relieve the stress they get from studying.</CO>
column23: Good essay, though the conclusion could have been stronger.

column1: 142&What change would make yor hometown more appealing to people your age.
column3:
<IN>There is a debate on what change would make my hometown more appealing to people my age. as I am young, things or place making people become fun will be appealing to people my age such as a facility for sports and good date course. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> making a varied stadium for playing sports in town will be fascinating to people young age.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific,</TR> young age like me love playing sports like soccer and balling. <TR>Therefore</TR> more facilities playing sports like playground and stadium there are, more young people will be there to play sports. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> as I am a students of university, I have ever been to many universities to interact each other so that I realize that almost universities have their own playgrounds and sports facilities for their students. It means that as most of university students are young people, young people prefer playing sports.</EX> Therefore building sports stadium at hometown must be appealing to young people. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> building fantastic date course for couple will be a good way to be appealing to young people.</MI2> <SI2>According to the instigation of newspaper, most young people prefer to having a nice date course in their hometown. This is because most young people are interested in love and have their girl/boy friend so that they need cool date course to enjoy their meeting. <TR>Therefore</TR> erecting many fascinated date course will be charm to young people. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was middle school I had a girl friend. However there is no fascinated date course in my hometown so that I went to other region to enjoy our meeting.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> for making hometown be appealing to young people, preference should be found first. and since building a stadium of sports and date course is their preference, those will make a hometown become appealing.</CO>
column23: The main idea of the second paragraph really should have been the thesis.  Because the thesis was basically missing, it was difficult to get a bead on the flow of thought.

column1: 143&People should carefully plan activities for their free time.
column3:
<IN>Many people become more serious about their free time in their lives. This is because there are manifold types of pastime activities that help people to release their stress from works or study. <TS>I believe that people should spend their time to plan for their free-time activities because the time they can enjoy is very limited and they can select the best preference one in same price or time rather than boring activities.</TS></IN>
                
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> people should make their free time plans carefully because of its limitation.</MI1>  <S1>It cannot be said that all of the free time is limited, but normally people have to work or do other things regardless of their age or job. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my brother’s story comes to my mind. He always desired to go camping, but he was working and it was too hard to get a vacation at that time. <TR>Therefore,</TR> he gave up to go camping, but he carefully planned it for the future. When he got a vacation, he went camping and had a great time in a limited time, like he planned.</EX> Likewise, for experiencing a great free time, people should plan for limited free time period by making plans.</S1></BO1>
                
<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that,</TR> it is pragmatic to make a plan for free time activity because people can choose the one they want to do.</MI2> <SI2>As I mentioned at the above paragraph, the time is limited and also the money for free time is limited as well. If people think and concern about their free time activities carefully and do the most interesting one, they could enjoy their free time effectively. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I have read a journal from a holiday magazine. The journal said that many people felt the most fulfillments when they achieved or performed what they wanted to do during free time.</EX> Obviously, making plans will give a great time to people and make them feel satisfy with what they did during the free time.</SI2></BO2>
                
<CO><TR>Overall,</TR> preparing or making plans carefully for free time activities are important to have an unregretful free time. As many people enjoy their free time, it would be more significant to make plans seriously because of the limited time and money. ­­­­­­</CO>
column23: Overall good essay with some grammatical and semantic errors, but the conclusion could have been stronger.

column1: 144&Movies tell a lot about a country.
column3:
<IN>Some people believe that movies have nothing to do with reflecting about country, since they are merely fiction. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I agree with the statement that movies help us understand country.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Above all,</TR> there are always heroes and villains among a movie characters who maintain the upheld value of society and do not keep it. By examining the behavior of the heroes we can learn the country’s moral characteristics.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> the superheroes such as Spider-man, Super-man, and Iron-man, do not hesitate to save the weak and punish the evil, which shows the country’s characteristic which praise the volunteering people and active citizens.<.EX> <TR>On the other hand,</TR> studying the behavior of the villains we can learn the taboo of the country. <EX><TR>As an example,</TR> the villains in the movies such as Joker and Vane commit lots of crimes killing people and ruining the social systems, which shows the out-law that the country sets.</EX></SI1><BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> movie depicts the social structure and historical events of country.</MI2> <SI2>Even though the movies are pure fiction, the stories of them are based on the real events of yesterday, thus we can learn about the history of country from the movie. The Movie which has background of the early 1900 of the United States, clearly shows us the social structure and events at that time. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> the pronoun movie “gone with the wind” clearly show us prosecution and black society, which was the main issue about the United States.</EX> <TR>As a result,</TR> we can learn the structure of society and history from the movies.</SI2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> although the movie does not tell us exact truth of the country to us, we can learn not only the upheld value of country, but also the history of it from watching movie.</CO>
column23: Overall a good essay but the conclusion was weak and there were some grammatical and semantics errors.

column1: 145&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? University students should take classes in many different subjects. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that students only have to study subjects that is related to their major. In the "real world," studying seemingly insignificant subjects not related to their major is considered a waste of time. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I definitely believe that students should study many subjects at the same time because it is helpful for them to find their jobs and to build up their personalities.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> taking courses in various subjects will help students find their dreams.</MI1> <SI1>To be specific, they have much more chances to realize what they want to be and what they are good at by studying many different subjects. <EX><TR>To illustrate this,</TR> my cousin was a student who didn't like to go to school and had no future plan. <TR>However,</TR> he became a famous soccer player in a professional team after he took a physical education classes and started practicing soccer everyday for more than two hours.</EX> <TR>Likewise,</TR> students can draw their own blueprint of their future life by experiencing diverse subjects. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> studying different subjects foster students' morality.</MI2> <SI2>While mathematics and english play a pivotal role in improving students academic achievement, they will not be successful in their lives without studying other subjects. This is because, when they miss the classes such as history as well as philosophy, they also lose their chance to build their personalities. <EX><TR>The best example of this is</TR> a politicians' moral hazard.
