Although they are people who studied at the prestigious universities and earned a large amount of money, they are not respected by the people because of their lack of moralities.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize,</TR> universities should give wider options to students to choose subjects they want to take, to make them to realize what they want to be and what they have to do. <TR>On the whole,</TR> students can reap numerous benefits from studying many subjects.</CO>
column23: The supporting information for the second body paragraph was not very strong.  There were some semantic and grammatical errors.

column1: 146&If your friend need extra help in schoolwork, suppose you are good at the subject which your friend needs help, it is better for your friend to ask you for help than get help from a professional tutor.
column3:
<IN>Everyone might have once experienced whether to ask friend for help or to professional teacher when they were struggling with a schoolwork. In many cases, even they know the fact that their friends are good at the subject, they get help from a professional tutor because they believe tutors are better than the students. <TS><TR>However,</TR> it is better for students to ask their friends for help when they need help since students know the best way to be easy to understand, person who needs help would feel free to ask questions, and they can prompt each other to study more diligently. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>People should ask their friends for help when they need extra help in schoolwork because their friends would know the best way to be understood.</MI1> <SI1>Friends are in similar age, so their ways of thinking would be same. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in high school, I was could not understand the concept of algebra. Whenever I asked my teacher for help, he just told me the way the formula and the way to solve the problem, using difficult words. <TR>Consequently,</TR> I could not solve my questionnaires. One of my friends noticed this, and she said that she would help me. I could then understand the concept and ways to solve the problem because my friend and I had same eye level of looking at the concept.</EX> This is only my experience but likewise, people could easily understand the material when they ask their friends for help. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>People would feel free to ask all questions they do not understand if they ask friend for help.</MI2> <SI2>In Asian countries including my country, it is rude to say bad things although it is true. <TR>Accordingly,</TR> students cannot say that they do not understand the material since it can make teachers angry. They tend like they understand everything teacher said in order to be well-mannered. In a research, students said that, when they ask an extra help to friends, they feel free to ask all questions and ask them repeatedly if they do not understand when they do not understand the concepts their friends explained. In contrast, they suggest that it is more awkward to ask their teachers for help. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> it is better to get an extra help in schoolwork from friend because students can prompt each other to study more diligently.</MI3> <SI3>They can stimulate each other by showing them the fact that they study. This is especially effective way to study in South Korea since schools want their students to be a positive competitive companions. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in middle school, one of my friends asked me for help in Language Art since I won the first place in Language Art previous semester. The questions he asked me was difficult quesitions, and I thought I should study harder.</EX> Likwise, asking help to friends can lead both of them to study harder and have better consequences. </SI3></BO3>
 
<CO>Many students ask their teachers for help when they need an extra help in schoolwork. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> it is better for them to ask their friends for help since it can lead to effective studying. By asking friends for help, they could be good rivals, and they would also feel free to ask questions in all parts they need help with. In addition, they can better understand the materials. <TR>Consequently, in order to be bring good results, students should better ask their friends for help.</CO>
column23: Body paragraphs 1 and 2 didn't open with transitions, which might confuse the reader/listener of this essay in some cases.

column1: 147&The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong.
column3:
<IN>People make innumerable decisions throughout their lives. Sometimes, they make wrong decisions, but many people believe that those wrong decisions are made when people make decisions in a short period of time. <TS><TR>Neverthless,</TR> I strongly disagree with the idea that the decisions that people make quickly are always wrong for two specific reasons: some decision makings are easy and do not take much time to come up with right answers, and numerous problems do not have one definite answer.</IN>
          
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> not all the briefly decided determinations are wrong because some matters do not take a long period of time to come up with a right answer.</MI1> <SI1>Most  of them are extremely obvious that do not even take a second to come up with a right answer. This is because people learn know-how by making similar decisions repeatedly. People face a number of similar decision making problems everyday. When they repeat the problem they learn to decide quickly and come up with correct answers at the same time. <EX><TR>As a perfect example,</TR> there is a problem of deciding what to wear for the day. People wear clothes everyday to decorate themselves or to express who they are. It is a tough decision to make when people first face the problem.</EX>    <TR>However,</TR> people create their own standards and learn social norms throughout their lives and it becomes one of the easy problems to come up with right decisions. When there is a special occasion, it becomes even easier to decide what to wear. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when there is a funeral, people decide to wear black suits; and when there is a sports event, people wear jerseys.</EX> According to the research conducted by the National Foundation of Research of Korea, 90 percent of people spend less than five minutes to choose what to wear and they are satisfied with their choice. <TR>As this research reveals,</TR> quickly made decisions are not always wrong.</SI1><BO1>
          
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> some problems do not have one definite answer.</MI2> <SI2>Unlike math questions, many problems of real life do not have one perfect answer. Most of the right answers are usually the decisions people make. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> making a decision in choosing a field of career do not have one perfect job. Doctors, lawyers, and C.E.O.s are widely and socially considered as right answers for careers. <TR>Nevertheless,</TR> not everyone pursue careers in those jobs. This is because people value many different aspects in deciding their occupations. Some people find their interest to be the top priority, some people find salary to be the most valuable aspect, and others may think the place of work is the most important factor in choosing their professions. <EX>One of my friend who was attending to one of the most renowned medical schools in the United States has quit the medical school and decided to become a singer. Everyone, including me, advised him to change his mind, but he did not listen. As a result, he is now in a band and does not earn much money, but the most importantly, he says he is happier than ever now. His decision may be viewed as the wrong decision to other people, but it was the right decision to him.</EX></SI2></BO2>
          
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is wise to take some time to make an important decision; <TR>Yet,</TR> that does not mean making decisions quickly always end up being wrong, because some decisions are very easy to make, and some problems do not have one right answer. </CO>
column23: Overall this is a very good essay.  However the first body paragraph was a little long, which made it feel like it was dragged on just a little bit.

column1: 148&Learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that learning about the past is a waste of time for present. This is because in this rapid changing society, people should focus on present to survive. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, people should learn about the past for two reasons; not to make the same mistake and to predict future.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> being aware of the past helps people not to make mistakes again.</MI1> <SI1>One significant reason is that people can obtain lessons by experiencing their behaviors in the past. In this sense, when people deal with similar situation in the future, they can know how to handle problems. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in second year of high school, I and my close friends were planning to go to travel to Japan. I was in charge of making a reservation for accommodations. <TR>However,</TR> when we arrived at the hotel that we reserved, I realized that I booked on the other date. I was so ashamed on myself, and felt so sorry to my friends.</EX> From this experience, I could realize the lesson that I have to double check and never made the same mistake anymore.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> we can prepare for unpredictable event by analyzing the past.</MI2> <SI2>It is definitely evident that past events are primary sources to predict the future. Researchers can find the common phenomenon that happed in the past and this helps them to prepare for future. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in Korea, the institution of geologic research had studied a series of occurrences of earthquake in Seoul for many years. They researched and studied a wide range of past information such as reference book and old document from Chosun dynasty. With these, they reached the conclusion that there were huge earthquake every 300 years. This allowed government to prepare for next following catastrophe in 2010 by evacuating people from dangerous area. If researchers didn’t study for the past, people in Seoul wouldn’t have been able to avoid numerous deaths.</EX></SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that learning for the past play a pivotal role in modern society because people can have a lesson and predict what it will happen in the future. <TR>All in all,</TR> people shouldn’t neglect the importance of the past information. It will lead people to have a bright future.</CO>
column23: The main ideas of the first and second body paragraphs are very similar, and could possibly have been combined.

column1: 149&Cell phone use should be prohibited in public transportation.
column3:
<IN>The development of cell phone has been rapidly processed since 2000s. Now it is common that all most every person have a cell phone for each. With development of Internet and smart phone technology, cell phone used in multi purposes, not just calling to someone or text massages but also listening music, search something through Internet, watching movies, making a note and even more things that we can hardly imagine. Cell phone is the most important device for modern people.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>However,</TR> as cell phone widely spread, it sometimes causes some social problems.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> if someone speaks loudly in subway, every single person who stay in same train will be bothered because of his voice. It can lead huge problem in society, but it is not enough to be the reason for restriction of cell phone use in public transportation.</EX> It is because the problem arises by the person who do not follow the fundamental rule, etiquette, not by the person who actually need cell phone use. If cell phone use in the public transportation is prohibited, there is no way to manage quickly in emergency.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> cell phone is made to be use in mobile circumstance wherever it can get a service signal.</MI2> <SI2>It is because we can use cell phone regardless of the place, we can save times and extend our working area. <EX>Imagine that one business man is waiting for an important phone call from his client, but at the same time he need to move somewhere with public transportation. And how would he be frustrated if he miss the call because of limited use of cell phone in public transportation? This innocent victim is not supposed to be sacrificed of irrational rule.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> people should be allowed to use their cell phone in public transportation. The prohibition of cell phone use in public transportation may leads another problem and brings about guiltless victim.</CO>
column23: There was no thesis.  This essay seemed more about the general benefits and problems of the widespread use of cell phones than specifically the topic requested.

column1: 150&It is better to work at the same company for a long time rather than change jobs several times.
column3:
<IN>Many people in modern society usually think that a broad knowledge and experience is needed. So they agree that changing jobs frequently is helpful for themselves. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, working in a same company is better than working in different jobs.</TS> It is because it can learn more deeply and skillfully about specific technique or knowledge. Also, people think a person who changes jobs many times of being unstable and unreliable.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> working in same company allowed workers to learn technique and knowledge more in detail and deeply.</MI1> <SI1>It is due to that most of technique and knowledge needs time for learning. It is just the case when type of working is very highly technical and arduous. Modern society is abundant of mass information and working in company is more and more difficult and time-consuming. In contrast, changing jobs frequently can’t allow people to have more professional technique because it isn’t much time to learn the technique.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> too many changes of jobs reduce the reliability and stability for person.</MI2> <SI2>It is clear that company regards person who change jobs many times as unstable for doing work and even have some problems about human relation. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my friend wanted to have many experience through change jobs. <TR>However,</TR> after changing jobs several times, he couldn’t get a new job because no any other company didn’t want him because his career. The company thinks that he might change jobs as soon as possible when he lose interests about work in our company.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> working in a same company give a change to learn technique and knowledge more in detail and give a good reputation to the company because they do not move frequently on another place. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I strongly insist that working in a same company is better than changing jobs several times.</CO>
column23: In body paragraph 2, it would have felt more complete if there was an added line that summed up the lesson to be learned from the example.

column1: 151&Students are influenced more by their friends than by their teachers.
column3:
<IN>Most people believe that students are influenced by their teachers than their friends. This is because teachers usually have more experiences and knowledge than students do. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is often said students likely to follow teacher's advice rather than their peers'. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I believe students are susceptible to their friends for the following two reasons: First, students spend most of their time together and second, they are vulnerable to peer-pressure.</TS></IN>
         
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> students are more influenced by their friends because they spend most of their time together at school.</MI1> <SI1>They help each other with school works such as preparing exams and doing homework. <TR>Also,</TR> they give advice each other on their problems. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> when I was in high school, I have always struggled to understand mathematics. No matter how long I put in to solve the problems, I barely got the right answer. Therefore, my friend Eunjung, who is math-genius, used to help me to teach mathematics. Also, since she was not good at exercise, I have tried to run with her after school. We were so happy that we could help and motivate each other.</EX> Thus, friends have a huge impact on each other's lives.       </SI1></BO1>
         
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> students are affected more by their friends because of peer pressure.</MI2> <SI2>It is obvious that students in adolescence tend to put highest value on what others think because they want to fit in. They want to belong to the group and feel secure when they are part of it.  According to the research done by Harvard Universiy in 2007, 67% of students in teen years between age 14 and 18 willing to listen to their peers than their teachers. They feel more accepted within social group and like to be popular amongst them. Thus, firends have better impact in teen's life.</SI2></BO2>
         
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> peers are more influenced by friends than by their teachers. Students not only spend a great deal of time with ther friends but also are easily persuaded by peer pressure. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I believe students are more vulnerable to their friends than teachers.</CO>
column23: The main idea and the supporting information of body paragraph 1 didn't tie into the topic of the question as much as it seems.

column1: 152&Food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that preparing food in a ease has a negative effect in modern society. This is because fast food  make people's health worsen. <TS><TR>However,</TR> In my opinion, People improved the way they live by preparing food in short time for because of women's satisfaction for working and self-development.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> It contributes to the entry of women into workforce.</MI1> <SI1>In the past, women had to stay at home in order to do house chores ranging from preparing food to washing clothes. <TR>However,</TR> Thanks to development of home appliances, they don't have to waste much time for food, it allowed women to go to work. Now they can have great reward of satisfaction by working. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I live with my parents and my grandmother. In my mother's case, even though she married my father, she was able to keep going out to work because  development of technology enable her to reduce time to prepare food. In this sense, she could achieve her dream being a teacher. In contrast, My grandmother always wanted to be a lawyer. <TR>However,</TR> she didn't have a good environment that supports her dream. she had to work for house chores for her family.</EX> This difference shows that preparing food easily had a great contribution on women's social achievement.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> people can make a good use of time for self-development instead of making food.</MI2> <SI2>Developing abilities for oneself is one of important factor to be successful. by reducing time for cooking, people can improve various skills such as studying for foreign language, working out, and reading books. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> One close friend named Jung soo, he often ate fast food or frozen food for a meal when he lived in dormitory in university. he could have free time by using those types of food. If he had prepared for normal food, he could have spent more than 30 minutes a day. Development of food encouraged him to study English every 30 minutes, and This resulted in excellent score in TOEIC 6 months later.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that reduced cooking time enable people to have better life. Not only could women go to work but also people can make a good use of time for themselves. <TR>All in all,</TR> the advantages of these benefits cannot underestimated in modern society.</CO>
column23: The supporting arguments aren't very strong.

column1: 153& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? With the help of the Internet, students can learn more effectively.
column3:
People think that Internet is for game, so it is not suitable for study. But i think the Internet can make student study more convenience. By using the Internet, we can take lots of information about subject more easily. 

First, Internet offer tremendous range of resources. By the internet, billions of Web pages, articles and books available on the Internet. Even though, You can take abroad data by using Internet. For example, i found data on the Internet that i couldn't find in any libraries.

Second, I can find appropriate material easily. I can save time and energy on research when i use Internet. For example, when i have to do research for my assigment in little time, i don't have to go th libarary for reserch. Just with using Internet with several click in my room, i could make a nice report.
         
Of course, you need to ability to dealing with internet and searching. But by the Internet, we can find and take lots of information and data very easliy. So, i think it is very helpful for students to using Internet when studying.

column1: 154&Learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>The debate whether students should learn about history of a society is a heated one. Some people say that learning history benefit student because it plays reflective roles in viewing and comparing previous generations with the present. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think that learning about the past is not useful for the reasons below.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> we are living in a generation that is always changing. In other words, learning history may only useful if the characteristics of a generation has been repeated.</MI1> <S1><TR>However,</TR> after the revolution of industries, almost all things including economics, society, culture and politics have been changed because the paradigm of a society is shifted from agricultural basis into the economic and service market. With the advent of capitalist society, people should make money, which is the power in the kind of societies, to live and succeed in their life. Such a trend of society enforces people to compete with each other, and the structure of the society has been changed and varied. Today, those who are stagnant in a fixed thinking cannot live in a community such as companies or economic fields. <TR>Thus,</TR> people should make effort to make a difference every day. <EX><TR>In a company, for example,</TR> most of the presidents require subordinates to think differently from others.</EX> It seems that there is no repeated history that is useful today. As a society become complicated more and more, it might be impossible to predict not only the generation where we are living, but also even the event of tomorrow.</S1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> even though people who have historical thoughts say that history is the mirror of the present, history is just the story of winners in those days.</MI2> <SI2>Learning about the past events that many people experienced and underwent is not a simple one. Both of winner and loser exist in the real history. <TR>However,</TR> it is very difficult for us to view the generation and timeline impartially because the past was written from a perspective of winner. <EX><TR>In some stories of American history, for instance,</TR> Native Americans are appearing in a negative point of view, making conflicts with other new arrived Americans, whereas the policies that were enacted by the new arrived American are decorated with seemingly reasonable explanation.</EX> <TR>However,</TR> we should filter the history by ourselves, with efforts not to be prejudiced by the story and to care about absorbing such a history. <TR>As a result,</TR> there is no best way to learn know-how from the past, but we can learn only from our own experience right now with effort to make a difference.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think that learning about the past will not benefit us living in the present, and rather we should free ourselves from the past.</CO>
column23: Thesis was weak, and the topic seemed to stray a bit.  The essay lacked focus.

column1: 155&Children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so.
column3:
<IN>There is a debate on whether children should be required to help with household tasks or not. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> children should not help with household.</TS> This is because working household will take time for study and might be in danger through working. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> working household will get grade of students down. To be specific,  As, nowadays, competition is very high among students even elementary school to get a good grade, Their ability to compete with others will be diminished by working. because working household will take time to study away. Therefore they will lose their interest about study. For example, when I was at elementary school, I had a friend whose both parents have working. Therefore he should work most of household alone so that he don't have enough time to study to get good grade. Finally my friend loses his interest about study.

Secondly, children might be in danger through working household. What I mean is that children are not familiar with working household so that they must be clumsy. As there are many hazard things in house, it might be possible for children to be in danger. For example, my brother is elementary school so that he is not good at working household as young age. One day, my brother try to make a food to help mother and he get injury on finger by sword. 

All in all, even though there are some merits children can get through working, we should rethink about their competition of grade and being in danger. Thus, it will be better for them to help their parents with household when they are grown enough.

column1: 156&People in the past ate healthier food than people today.
column3:
<IN>Assertion that people in the past used to eat healthier food than people today is a valuable contention although I would like to challenge it. <ST>People in the past may have lived in a more simple, cleaner environment, but this fact will not disprove the truism that modern people are nourished with a better quality of foods.</ST></IN>

<BO1><SI1>In the past, people were vulnerable to many food-borne illness that modern people rarely experience. There were no refrigerators or ovens for ensuring the health and safety of food and knowledge about potentially harmful microorganisms. Modern people would forestall the propagation of microorganism by keeping food at a proper storage place at a moderate temperature. As a result, the food stays fresh for a long time and pathogens are killed before serving the food. Either heating the food to a high temperature or storing it at a low temperature will ensure the safety of food.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Due to the development of genetics, we are aware of how to harvest a better vegetables.</MI2> <SI2>People in the past were not sophisticated enough to manipulate the growth of vegetables with a variety of methods. As modern genetics burgeoned, it helped us to get a fresher, healthier vegetables and even more vigorous hybrids. The use of genetics also facilitated obtaining fresher and good-tasting milk from cow. Those things would have been inconceivable in the past without the knowledge of modern genetics. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>Due to a variety of cooking methods and knowledge, we can afford the foods of supreme quality at home and restaurant.</MI3> <SI3>FDA and all regulations control the processing of food in stores and restaurant, so anyone can buy a standardized, safe, and nutritious food. The method of serving healthy, delectable foods in restaurants have been developed over a long time that we enjoy the foods of best quality in modern days.</SI3>
 
<CO>People commonly imagine the food in the past to be cleaner and healthier, but nothing can be further from the truth. Consider the immense development of food culture, science, and other specialized regulation that brings food to the table today. People in the modern society are served with superb qualities of foods thanks to the method of food processing, storage, and practice of genetics. </CO>
column23: The essay was almost completely lacking in transitions.  The thesis was weak and the main ideas were weak or missing.  So there seems to be a lack of bulletpoints that you're going to and from, which made the essay a bit difficult to read.

column1: 157&Some universities require students to take classes in many subjects. Other universities require students to specialize in one subject. which one is better?
column3:
<IN>There is a debate on whether students should take classes in many subjects or only one subject in university. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> students should take a classes in many subjects.</TS> This is because taking classes in many subjects has a lot of merits such as finding new talent or interest and meeting new friends who will be helpful for a whole life.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> taking variety subject's classes helps people to concentrate on class better.</MI1> <SI1>What I mean is that listening many subjects indicates that they are able to get variety opportunity about what is their own talent and interest. If they find out their real talent and interest through taking many subjects, they will concentrate on their study more than before. According to the research of experts, 60% of university students change their major due to interest. In this case, taking varied subjects will be a good solution to solve the problem. This is because varied subject will help students find their own talent so that they are able to focus on classes</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> people listening varied subjects can make many opportunities that can make new friends who can be helpful.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, through taking varied subjects, students can meet varied students who major different subjects so that they are able to have variety relationship. It must be very helpful for students for their whole life. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when my father was students of university, my father had taken varied subjects for 4 years. One of his friends my father met at that time is doctor so that our family can be cured by him with cheap price. If my father try to listen only one subject, he might not meet the friend who becomes doctor.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> for whole life, the most important thing we should make is, in my opinion, opportunity to live well and meet good friends. and taking varied subjects can help us to make such opportunities in our life. <TR>Therefore</TR> we should take varied subjects.</CO>
column23: A lot of grammar and semantics issues.

column1: 158&Movies tell a lot about a country.
column3:
<IN>In most countries, the movie exist, but they have some different names. <EX><TR>For example</TR> the movie which is made in India is named ‘Bollywood movie’. Also we call the American movie as ‘Hollywood movie’.</EX> They are all movies but we call them each different ways. Why this phenomenon happens? <TS>I think the answer is the movies reflect the country which is made in.</TS> There are three reasons why we could know much about the movie making country.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> by the ‘subject’ used in the movie tells much about the country.</MI1> <SI1>In many countries uses the specific historical incidence that happened in only its country. <EX>Korea frequently uses the North Korea and Korean War for making movie. America uses Cuba invasion in the movie. By watching movies using the specific historical event, people could know that in Korea there was a war between the same territory, and in US, there was a secrete invasion.</EX> When people know the historical event that had occurred in the country, they could understand the country much well.      </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> even the movie is about the typical event such as man and woman’s love story, there have some difference between countries.</MI2> <SI2><EX>In Korea, much of the love stories episodes are about the permission of the wedding that each parents and even the whole family like uncle do not agree with. Of course a few American movies have the episode, but that is not that frequent or serious as Korean’s. So by watching Korean movie, people could know that the parents and the whole family’s permission is one of the most important thing is man and woman’s wedding.</EX> In other words, they could learn some traditions of the country.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> beyond the movie’s subject, the background elements show the typical things about each country.</MI3> <SI3><EX><TR>For example,</TR> the eating scene of the movie, Korean movie shows people using chopsticks and use spoons on the same pot. That is the scene only can be captured in Korea. The menu of the eating could also tell about the countries which are made in.</EX></SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>As a result,</TR> by movies we could gain a lot of information about the country because many movies reflects their historical events and situation and even in typical subject there are some countries specific point that tells about the country. Also the background elements that movie shows make watchers to understand the country. So I think watching a movie is same as traveling the country.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantics issues but overall a good essay.

column1: 159&Do you agree or disagree with the following statment? It is desirable for students to to take classes in many subjects rather thatn to specialize in one subjecet.
column3:
<IN>Opinions might be divided over whether it is desirable for students to take classes in many subjets rather than to specialize in one subject. 
<TS>I strongly believe that by taking many classes students can get well-rounded education.</TS> In addition they can discover their strength easily. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> students will have knowledge on many different topics.</MI1> <SI1><TR>However,</TR> some people maintain that taking various classes wastes time. <TR>However</TR> there is an example against the argument. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was a freshman ,my friend who took variety of classes in university know a lot in many areas. <TR>moreover,</TR> He used to help teach his freinds who major in other classes.</EX> Thus, students should take many classes as possible as they can. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> If students take a lot of classes, they would find their hidden potentials.</MI2> <SI2><TR>However,</TR> some people say that it is waste of money for students to take multiple classes. <EX>This becomes more envident through my experience. when I was a sophomore, I spent days agonizing over whether what to choose my job. That is because I always changed my mind for my prospective career. <TR>However,</TR> in order to decide my job, I took several different classes. By taking lots of coureses I could find what I like and I perfom better so my problem about choosing my career was solved. </EX>
<TR>Therefore,</TR> when studnets take many classes, it can be more beneficial in finding their strength. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> taking various classes is better than specializing one class. this is because students can know a lot of information and knowledge in divers areas and can find their potentials. I hope all students will take many different classess.</CO>
column23: The thesis doesn't necessarily address the topic.  The question is if it's better to take many classes, whereas the the thesis simply acknowledges that taking many classes provides a well-rounded education without actually   evaluating whether that's a good or bad thing.  The many transitions in the first body paragraph made it seem disjointed.

column1: 160&Why people want to go to college?
column3:
<IN>There are numerous reasons that make people attend college. It could be that students may want to experience larger community through college life or education. <TS><TR>However,</TR> the reason why I think people want to go to university is because first, the existing harsh competition in the world rendered high school graduates go to college. <TR>Second,</TR> they presumably want to receive higher level of education just to pursue deeper knowledge in whatever field they are studying.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> competitive circumstance within the world made graduates to go to college.</MI1> <SI1>Vast majority of people within any community are required to work in order to sustain their lives. <TR>Consequently,</TR> it is inevitable that counteless people will have to get hired by companies, and only some portion of the people who outperform others will be hired. <TR>Therefore,</TR> since erudite people with higher education are the ones many companies are looking for. Most people are in rush to receive a college diploma. This is one of the major reasons why students from pre-college courses are eager to go to university.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> college education symbolizes a place where students can learn any type of study in depth.</MI2> <SI2>Since most colleges are able to furnish students greater resources which are required for students to do their research on whatever topics that they are looking at. <TR>Also,</TR> with the greater amount of resources like library and better facilities, students are greatly encouraged to seek higher level of knowledge. <TR>Thus,</TR> it is essential for people with greater desire in learning to go to universities.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>The chief reason to why people nowadays want to go to college is that the harsh competition established by today’s society, pushed graduates to attain higher feats which, in this case, college education. <TR>Also,</TR> the reason can be that people merely want to pursue greater or higher level of education in order to achieve better standard in their realm.</CO>
column23: Some practical examples might have helped the strength of the essay.

column1: 161&It is necessary to inform others who are influential or will employ you in the future of your strength and achievement
column3:
<IN>It is commonly said that modest is the best virtue. <TS><TR>However,</TR> my view is that it is important to tell others who are influential or will employ you in the future your strength and achievement for that reasons: success in career, healthy and relationship.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> when people inform others who will employ them of their strength and achievement has a direct correlation with success in career.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that when people concentrate most of their time on showing their strength such as a good communication skill, responsibility, and honesty, they can attract employer. This is especially true given the fact that as modern society is becoming specialized and competitive, today's job markets require job candidates such qualities. According to the Ministry of Labor of Japan in 2012, the employment interview was the most important component, taking up more 80 percent of the final call. The interviewers looked at applicants’ knowledge and skills mostly related to specialty. The contributing factor was that the more interviewees appeal their specialty, the more interviewers     looked at their resume. This implies that presentation of strength is a secure way for people to prepare for the future.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> when people do not inform others who are influential of your achievement, it deters people staying healthy.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that while people interact with others who have a great impact on their life guarantee a stress-free life, lack of showing their ability can stress people out by making them feel isolated. <TR>Moreover,</TR> stress is one of the main factors of diseases through weakening the immune system. <EX><TR>In a study</TR> conducted by Stanford University in 2012, a test on mice showed that life span was shortened when they regularly underwent a series of electric shocks. Interestingly, the researchers found a link between this and human beings who suffered from periodic stress.</EX> This implies that high stress levels coming from lack of appealing of their strength could negatively affect humans, resulting in a shorter life span.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Last but not least,</TR> informing people's strength of others can contribute to building a stronger relationship.</MI3> <SI3>This is attributed to fact that taking their ability related to their achievement other people who will employ them can create a comfortable atmosphere in which people can bond and have a good time. Otherwise, people who are influential or will hire you hardly have the chance to know about you. <TR>Therefore,</TR> through light-hearted conversations, they can be easily connected. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I first met my president of my company, I was very shy and had nothing common in with him. However, taking about my experience such as got prize not only helped me to relax, but provided some intimate shared experience. To be specific, we bonded by having a shares of personal strength. Such intimate communication easily opened up out hearts to each other.</EX> </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> advantages of good communication about your strength and achievement far outweigh those of disadvantages of lack of informing others for the reasons I have mentioned above. All in all, the importance of taking about your strength cannot be underestimated in that it can catch two bird with one stone.</CO>
column23: I am a little unclear about what the second body paragraph has to do with the topic as a whole.  Many grammar and semantic errors made reading awkward now and then.

column1: 162&Parents are the best teachers agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>Many of the proverbs emphasize that parents are the biggest factor in raising and educating their children. It is presumably because parents are the legal guardians that children rely on the most. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I disagree to such thoughts because parents nowadays are too occupied that they hardly have any time to spend time with their kids, therefore children rarely learn anything from their parents. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> kindness and generousity that parents used to symbolize and taught their children with are all eclipsed by the increasing child abuse rate within today's world.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> vast majority of children base and mirror their behavior from watching and witnessing ways that adults behave.</MI1> <SI1><TR>However,</TR> most parents recent days are too busy taking care of their tasks at their work, therefore children are mostly entrusted to people such as babysitter or teachers at school. This trend enables children to learn most of their behavioral attitude from people who are spending most time with them. <TR>Thus,</TR> it is highly probable that parents no longer exert the greatest influence on their children but teachers at daily care may have profound effect on what the kids may assimilate.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> parents recently are becoming highly incompetent in leading their children to good path.</MI2> <SI2>Due to the highly stressful and competitive environment within the world, parents nowadays are both mentally and physically burdened and stressed out. This phenomenon renders parents to be somewhat abusive and harsh when they are to communicate and instruct their children. As parents are being discuss as one of the perpetrators in child abuse on media, it is highly inefficient and even risky for such parents to deal with their kids all day long. <TR>Therefore,</TR> parents cannot be the best instructor to youngs.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> parents are often regarded as kind and one of the few people who can truly lead children to positive perspective. <TR>However,</TR> due to many problematic factors present in today's world such as stress and competition, parents are no longer very desirable teachers to their kids. Many dads or moms barely have any time to spend their time with children therefore a babysiter or teacher plays the biggest role in educating kids since children are mostly at their attention. <TR>Also,</TR> parents may be sometimes very abusive to children due to the outside factor affecting parents psycologically, thus the best way to do here is to let teachers ,who are the expertises in teaching, instruct children.</CO>
column23: The thesis was dragged, so lacked a definitive punch.  The main ideas were not very strong.

column1: 163&Because environment issues are very complex, individual people can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>Polar bears are dying out by the glacial thaw, which is generated by the increase of greenhouse effect. It is not only that confined to problems of polar bears, but animals in Amazon rain forest as well. <TS><TR>Likewise,</TR> environment issues are very complex, but there are a lot of things that individual people could do such as turning off the air conditioner and heater while windows are opened, by reducing the use of disposable products, and by recycling.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>People can turn off the air conditioner and heater while windows are opened in order to decrease environment problems.</MI1 <SI1>Many people are unaware that it is extravagant to commit these actions. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> the government in South Korea realized that there are a lot of people who ruined the electricity by turning on the air conditioner with their windows opened, so they made a law and enforced citizens not to turn on the air conditioners with their windows opened. It is a law in South Korea but every person in other countries where there are no laws like this should turn off their cooler machines when the doors are opened. If individual people do this, they will reduce the overall use of electricity and eventually, this would alleviate the problem of urban heat island.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Individual people can engage in the ease environment issues by reducing the use of disposable products.</MI2> <SI2>Many restaurants use disposable products like disposable cup, for example. In particular, some kids are not matured enough to have any idea about saving the energy, and they think the disposable cups as a toy, consequently playing with them. Individual people, owner of the restaurants, should realize how serious problems using disposal products can cause environmental issues, and stop using them in their stores. By the help of individual people of the restaurants, there would be much less fuel burnings, which could, at last, help many animals to endure life in Amazon.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> although environment issues are very complex, individual people can do something about them on their own such as recycling.</MI3> <SI3>A lot of people are annoyed to recycle, and just throw away their trash in a single trashcan, without recycling. <TR>However,</TR> if people recycle their trash, these trashes can be used again to make other products. <TR>In addition,</TR> recycling can save the money spent on burning trash, which can save the money government spent on it. <TR>Consequently,</TR> recycling is not only that helps to guard polar bears and animals in Amazon, but it guarantees the reduction of air pollution. This less pollutant of the air would bring cleaner air which humans breathe. </SI3></BO3>

<CO>Some people claim that there is nothing that individual people can do about environmental issues on their own since environmental issues are very complex. They allege only government could do something to save energy and reduce environmental problems. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> it is certain that there are various things that individual people can do on their own even though environment issues are very complicated. By turning off air conditioner and heater with windows opened, they could save both electricity and prevent urban heat island. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> people can help the environmental issues to be alleviated by reducing the use of disposable products, and by doing recycling in their own houses. If everyone all over the world observes the things like these, there would be much less air pollution. <TR>Consequently,</TR> it will eventually slower the rate of environmental problems.</CO>
column23: The thesis lacked punch.  With no transitions leading into each paragraph, the flow of the essay might be confusing depending on how it's read.

column1: 164&Exams encourage students to learn.
column3:
<IN>We are used to take any kinds of exams during the school time. Taking exams brings positive effects and negative effects as well. <TS>In my opinion, it is better to students to take tests for encourage them to study more and effectively.</TS> This is because they can study themselves with their own purposes and also the results would make them feel responsibilities.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> students would prepare to tests by studying themselves.</MI1> <SI1>Normally, students get huge stress from their results of exams and it effects to them to prepare exams by themselves. It seems like forcing students by taking exams, but this is the one way to make and encourage them to study. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my first year at the high school comes to my mind. In that time, I wasn’t able to find the reason why I studied and what was it for, even my parents told me that I had to study. However, I had no choice to study because of the tests from the school. As time went by, I found that taking exams made me study myself. I didn’t want to see some bad results on my grade and anyway it was helpful for my future.</EX> Likewise, taking exams excite students to study themselves.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Consequently,</TR> student can feel responsibilities about their results from the tests.</MI2> <SI2>It encourages them to study and shows which levels they are. As many reports said, a responsibility is one of the most important aspects for students to study. They could see the results they made on exams and probably feel that they have to study more.  <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I read an article from an educational magazine. The article said that some students who have more responsibilities than others are able to get better results from any types of tests. If tests make students feel responsibilities, it is definitely encourage them to study.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Overall,</TR> I believe that exams encourage students to study. Not only it makes students to study themselves, but also it gives responsibilities to students by showing their results from tests.</CO>
column23: A lot of grammar and semantics issues that slowed the essay down.

column1: 165&People will have spent less time cooking or preparing for their food than they do nowadays.
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might argue that people will have less time cooking  or preparing for their food than they do nowadays because modern people live  in a society which competitive and thus have less time to cook. <TS><TR>Contrary popular belief,</TR> my view is that people will have spent more time cooking or preparing for their food than do nowadays for two reasons: socialize well with others and responsibility.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> it improves a sense of responsibility when people spend time cooking and preparing for their food.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that cooking requires many obligations such as managing cook time wisely, abiding by rules, cooperating with others. <TR>Therefore,</TR> through consequences that arise from negligent actions, they can learn the importance of obligation. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my youngest brother used to be lazy and selfish. He has changed little by little after he started cooking and preparing for our food at home. He realized that his laziness could negatively affect everyone by delaying every step to provide good service. Naturally, he became more punctual, played his part well, and even encouraged other family members who seemed to be goofing around.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> cooking and preparing for food can contribute to building a stronger relationship.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that doing fun activities together such as preparing for home-cooked meals can create a comfortable atmosphere which can bond and have a good time with loved ones. Through light hearted conversations, they can be easily connected. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I first met my boy friend, I was very shy and had nothing common in with him. <TR>However,</TR> cooking many delicious foods for him not only helped me to relax, but provided some intimate shared experiences. To be specific, we bonded by having a share of laughs. Such intimate activities easily opened up our hearts to each other.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>In brief, although cooing and preparing for our food takes time much, its advantages far outweigh those of disadvantages for the reasons I have mentioned above. <TR>All in all,</TR> this trend will continue and pass down to the next generation.</CO>
column23: The thesis was weak and the support ideas lacked punch.

column1: 166&High education should be available only to good students
column3:
<IN>It is often said that high education such as university and college needs to be accessible to all the students. Some people may be opposed to this statement because students with bad transcript in high school wouldn't show diligence in college. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, no matter how good score is, every student  should be qualified in high education for two reasons.</EX></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> open admission policy  provides students with equal opportunity to achieve their dream.</MI1> <SI1>this is because it allows students to explore a wide range of knowledge and fields. This encourage students to find their dream and aptitude. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when my older brother was in high school, he didn't have good overall grades because he wasn't interested in studying. <TR>However,</TR> after he entered college, he realized that he is really into mechanical engineering, and he became so passionate in learning that field. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> he got excellent GPA even get scholarship in the college. If open admission policy were not for, he wouldn't have been able to find his passion.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> high education enables students to learn about understandings of life.</MI2> <SI2>One of goals for education is to have open-minded to others. Unlike high school and middle school, college and university are where people can meet many different kinds of people. students can enhance social skills by sharing opinion with others who have different backgrounds. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> According to Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010,  70% of students in Seoul university indicated that university life had a significant positive roles in widening point of view and understanding others. They could interact with a wide range of others by joining sports club, extracurricular activities and doing volunteering jobs.</EX> This shows high education provide students with improved view point and understandings.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> I firmly believe that open admission policy should be adapted for students, because students are able to find their dream by experiencing many different fields  and improve understanding of others. All in all, the advantages of open admission policy cannot be underestimated for better education quality.</CO>
column23: The main points of the two body paragraphs don't really support the thesis.  It talks about the benefits of education, but doesn't really go into why it should be available to everyone and not just the good students.

column1: 167&Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Comparing between modern life and medieval life, many people might point out the invention of automobile because it enables people to do tons of things that was impossible before. <TS><TR>However,</TR> Automobile has caused many problems in societies as well.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> since the invention of cars, the environmental problems, including noise, and air pollution, have become significant.</MI1> <SI1>Especially in a metropolitan city, air pollution is so serious that it seems that it will not be recovered even though many people are suffering from diseases. When automobile emit the exhaust gases, which were made up of carbon dioxides and sulfur dioxides, many kinds of trees become dying, accelerating the pollution of the air. <TR>Not only that,</TR> the composition of buildings also become rotted, so buildings’ outer wall should be repaired. <TR>Moreover,</TR> noise problems make people crazy today. People who live near in a congested road are stressed out, and seriously, they sometimes bear handicapped babies. <EX><TR>From my experience,</TR> I did not care about the air and noise pollution when living in a mountain place. <TR>However,</TR> after moving to the city of Busan, the 2nd port city in Korea, I realized that too many automobiles make the environment become dying.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> car accident problems rose up in modern life.</MI2> <SI2>With the construction of road system, people have been living with cars. Now we cannot imagine the city without cars. <TR>However,</TR> seemingly beneficial products that human being created harm and even take out the lives of people. In many countries, it seems that humans are not the first on the road. <EX>Cars are the first. Many drivers do not speed down even though there are people who cross the road. According to the survey conducted by the Department of Traffic in Korea, the dead rate by the car accident already exceeds the average level of the rate of the world.</EX> This kind of problems not just magnifies the anxiety among people in a society, but also should be solved and dealt in the sphere of overall society.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> even though the breakthrough of technologies helped people do many things, automobile have made much more serious problems in a society.</CO>
column23: The thesis and conclusion were a little weak but overall this was a good essay.

column1: 168&A person should not make improtant decisions alone.
column3:
<IN>It's often said that people can decide important decisions much better when they decide by themselves. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, people should make decisions with others.</TS> First, it is possible to get a best answer adding other's ideas to your decisions. Second, you can save time instead of wasting time when making decisions.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> it's more likely to do best decisions by getting advices and sharing each other's opinions about that.</MI1> <SI1>When deciding something important on your own, it could be restricted and less objective. By adding various perspectives to your decision, your decisions can be more objective and you can attain best answer. <EX>A recent Forbes reserch has shown that companies can gain more pofits when workers decided important decisions by communicating and sharing ideas regularly. Reserchers divided subjects into two groups. One group spent lots of time on sharing ideas and they introduced rules to comment other worker's decisions. In  contrast, the other didn't. After three weeks, the net profit of each group was different. The group which communicated often got more profit than the other by 89 percent.</EX> This showed that how important it is to share ideas and advise each other when making important decisions.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> people can reduce struggling time when making decisions .</MI2> <SI2>When you collect various kind of perspectives from others, it would be much easier to find solutions. This means that you have a various ideas you can refer to. Without other's advices, you should spend more time in  thinking which is better decisions and it could be a waste of time. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was a high school student, I couldn't choose which major in the university is better for me. At first, I tried to decide by myself, because it is my problem. <TR>However,</TR> I considered it was waste of time, so asked friends, parents and teachers to help to choose. I gathered all of advices from them and then choosed  which major is the best one for me. If I didn't get advices, I would spend lots of time struggling on my own.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> it's better to make decisions with others, because it is possible to make the best decisions, as well as it takes less time to make decisions. For these two reasons, I think that a person has to make important desicions with others.</CO>
column23: Thesis could have been a little stronger but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 169&Earning a lot of money makes us successful.
column3:
<IN>There is a controversy over whether earning a lot of money makes us successful. <TS>Different people have different views because of their respective angles. As far as I am concerned, I would disagree with the argument.</TS> My view can be greatly substantiated by the reasons addressed below.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> what makes people feel successful varies depending on their characteristics.</MI1> <SI1>This is because people have different desire. Having a spouse of dream could be the most important factor of success for some people, whereas traveling alone all around the world might matter most to other people. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> what matters most to me is having a peaceful and happy family. For the sake of my family, I would be able to give up my career path. A colleague of mine, however, disagreed with my opinion. In traditional Korean culture, he says, men are responsible for earning money as much as they can to nourish their children and to support their family. He didn’t say that I was wrong. Instead, he just admitted that his way of thinking is a bit different from mine.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> when it comes to self-consciousness, having a lot of money does not necessarily make people feel they are successful.</MI2> <SI2>Some people may surmise themselves as not successful even though they are reach. <EX>Professor Lee, highly respected and well-know professor at Seoul National University, recently conducted a survey that asks people whether they think they are successful. He recruited 102 people and divided them into three group. The first group were the people having money more than one million dollars, the second group were people with money less than 50 thousand dollars, and the others who do not belong to the two groups were the third group. The result was interesting. The survey showed that the third group of people, who have money between one million dollars and 50 thousand dollars, felt most successful.</EX> This result appropriately proves my opinion. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>All thing considered, although this issue is not a black-or-white one, I would disagree with the argument that earning a lot of money makes us successful. The reasons are that what makes people feel successful is different according to their characteristics and that having a lot of money does not necessarily make people regard themselves successful.</CO>
column23: The thesis lacked punch, and the conclusion wasn't very strong.  But otherwise a good essay.

column1: 170&Many students choose to attend schools or universities outside their home countries. Why do some students study abroad? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people believe that choose to attend schools or universities inside their home countries. It is comfortable for students to attending schools or universities nearby their home. This is because it is close to their home.<TS>But I firmly agree with the idea that attending schools or universities outside their home countries for their study.</TS>The reasons are as follows.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> Study abroad is helpful for a lot of students to learn various languages.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>From my experience,</TR> I went to New Zealand to study for seven months three years ago. I learned British English by foreigner teacher at language school in Auckland. After class I read and repeat English book many times in my room every day. Then I studied English grammar and speaking with friends of mine who came to here for English study. We helped each other to improve English writing, speaking, reading, grammar skill themselves. Also we could meet diverse foreigner people who live in New Zealand .We could talked to them in English. Our English skill can gradually advances through variety ways. It was meaningful time for me to study second language in English.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> To study outside their home countries is allow to travel many places such as mountains, river, lake, ocean where we have never ever seen before.</MI2> <SI2><EX>To be specific, When I studied in New Zealand I went to the tekapo lake consist of a glacier alone. There is so beautiful view and lake’s color looks like emerald. It is the best wonderful place I have ever seen before. I could visited various place there. Then I could have precious times that can thinking of my life of future and a lot of things. In addition, I enjoyed many things such as culture, food and people there through visited variety place in New Zealand.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR> travel is important for many student to have valuable times and we can learn tradition, delicious food, many kind of people. Also we can get plenty of experience. It is so useful for student to live their fantastic life in the future.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I strongly support with the idea that attending schools or universities outside their home countries is better than studying inside their home countries. What it comes down to is that it is a lot of advantages for many students to their research. It can learn various foreign languages by hard study abroad. <TR>Moreover</TR> It gives us abundance experience to live actively our great life and could feel many things through we visit many place in abroad. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I warmly agree with the idea that studying abroad is more beneficial than studying inside their home countries for their admirable research.</CO>
column23: The thesis doesn't actually express an opinion about the topic.  The supporting ideas were entirely examples, and lacked objective evidence.

column1: 171&Is technology helpful the world?
column3:
<IN>Some people may think that people can enjoy their life with the help of technology. They hardly need to spend their time to contact each other and travel. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I strongly believe that technology have negative effect on the word for two reason such as people and environment.</TS></IN>
           
<BO1><MI1>One reason is that technology makes people feel lonely easily.</MI1> <SI1>Before people using computer and their smart-phone they tend to have conversation or relationships with other people frequently. Thus, they could share their news and have companionship easily. On the other hand, people block their communication by using advanced technological material. As a result, people can be isolated. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> before the developed smart-phone my family used to talk each other. <TR>Thus,</TR> I hardly feel lonely. <TR>However,</TR> nowadays, all my family uses their smart-phone or computer to talk their friends and shopping. So, I think that I lose my relationships with my family even though share my time with them.</EX> For this reason, people would be lonely due to the technology.</SI1></BO1>
           
<BO2><MI2>The other reason is that technology destroys the environment.</MI2> <SI2>People using the natural resource for maintain their life. <TR>Thus,</TR> they have got rid of the shelter of animals. <TR>In addition,</TR> they make pollution by using their cars. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> when I was young, there was forest near my house. I used to see the birds and bugs on the tree. <TR>However,</TR> due to the construction of the apartment, people remove the trees and wild animals. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I have to stand the pollution which is occurred by using vehicles.</EX> With this aspect, the technology hardly has positive influence on the environment.</SI2></BO2>
           
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I firmly believe that technology is harmful to the word. Even though it let people enjoy their life without huge difficulties, people will be able to feel isolated easily and suffering from the pollution and spend their money on the recover the damaged environment.</CO>
column23: Good essay, the supporting information could have been better with statistics and other objective facts.

column1: 172&Because environment issues are very complex, individual people can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that due to the complexity of environmental issues, a person can not do anything about them. <TS><TR>On the other hand,</TR> in my opinion, individual people can affect the environment issues.</TS> There are several reasons to support my argument so I will limit to the two that I think most related to the topic. <TR>First,</TR> individual activities have positive effects on people's thinking and activities. <TR>Also,</TR> there are many campaigns for change behavior of individuals.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> if a person behave eco-friendly activities which looks beneficial or interesting, other people may follow such activities;thus, this has effects on the environmental issues.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that people tend to take actions which are beneficial to themselves. <EX>This reminds me of my eco-project which I took when I was a university student, The project was comprised of simple rules: if a person behaved eco-friendly activities then took photos and sent me them, I gave them 'eco-point' which can be used as money for my garage sale. I showed eco-friendly activities such as riding a bike and separating garbage to people and noticed the project on a university bulletin. Lots of people participated in the projects to gather the points and I received many photos for eco-friendly activities. After all, thanks to people's participation, I completed the project successfully,</EX> This means that if individual eco-friendly activities look beneficial, other people tend to follow the actions. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2></MI2><TR>Also,</TR> there are many environmental campaigns to change individual people.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that to solve the environmental issues, it is necessary to change a person's activity. In Korea, there is a proverb "if samll things gather, they will be a big thing." which means a person's change can be people's changes. According to the Ministry of Environment of Korea in 2003, there were many campaigns for environmental issues. Most of campaigns focused on individuals not on social groups or companies. <EX><TR>Actually</TR> in Kyungju city, a campaign to ride a bike was successful because the government focused on a person and promote them to it by imposing reduced tax. <TR>After all,</TR> the air pollution level in Kyungju city became lowest in Korea.</EX> This implies that individual change with campaigns can solve the environmental problems.</SI></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> although complex environmental issued can not be affected by a person's activities, such activities can affect those of people which have effect on the issues for the reasons aforementioned. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I surely think individual people can do many things about environment issues.</CO>
column23: The main ideas weren't very strong.

column1: 173&Parents should not allow their children to watch television so that they can do well at school.
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of discussion at hand is whether or not parents should not allow their children to watch television so that they can do well school. The answer to this question can very greatly depending on individual perspectives. <TS>Thus, the jury may still be out, but as far as I am concerned, I firmly believe that parents let children to watch television.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows. First, by watching television, children can relieve overwhelming stress. Second, children can closer to their friends by sharing the information after watching television.     </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>First,</TR> children can find relief by watching television and thus they can concentrate on their study in school.</MI1> <SI1>These days, children suffer from high-levels of stress caused by studying overtime. By watching television, children can temporarily forget about problems at study. In this respect, watching television is a great stress-reliever, which helps children can study well in school. <EX><TR>To illustrate further this point,</TR> let me use as an example the case of my brother. He has to not only complete more tasks now at school, but also has to interact with many people in order to prepare group presentation. When he comes home, he tries to refresh his mind and body by watching television. Through watching television instantly provide an excitement. For a short time, my brother seems to forget about problems he has had at school and gains enough breathing space to look forward to studying the next day.</EX> As a result, parents should encourage their children to watch television.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> children are able to become closer to their friends, which helps children can study better in school.</MI2> <SI2>In today’s competitive society, it is difficult to forge strong ties with their friends. Aa a result, they may feel isolation not only from family, but also friends. In this context, watching television can help children to combat these social trends by enabling individual to have fun with others. According to the Korean Gallup Poll, most of surveyed respondents indicated that watching television is a great way to strengthen with friends. The respondents said that they are able to laugh out together and talk about performances afterward. Indeed, children can overcome awkwardness that may exist not only among strangers, but also among acquaintances, which will be invaluable to children because they can adjust well in school. Therefore, parents should not prevent children to watch television.  </SI2></BO2>
   
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I strongly argue my standpoint on account of the two reasons mentioned above. Thus, the verdict may still be out, I personally believe that the two of my rationales above are sufficiently convincing encough to the represent to the viewpoint of a majority of people who are favor in my claim.</CO>
column23: The main ideas in the body paragraphs were not very strong.

column1: 174&People today would be happier if they have few possessions.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether people today would be happier if they have few possessions. <TS>I agree that having few possessions would make people happier for two reasons. <TR>First,</TR> desire for more possessions causes serious environmental problem. <TR>Second,</TR> having too many possessions will make people stressful.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> environmental problem can be occurred by desire for more possessions.</MI1> <SI1>Some people might say that people today would be happier if they have more possessions. <EX><TR>However,</TR> let me show an example to prove why having few possessions is better. Human beings are currently experiencing the warmest temperatures in history. It is true that global warming has a negative effect on mankind throughout the world. Floods and landslides took countless people as well as placing affected areas at health risk. European nations were no exception. Many areas were flooded and suffered wildfires. Sadly, it was extremely costly to ensure that all victims were put their lives back together. Carbon emissions from cars and factories are largely responsible for this environmental problem. Desire for more possessions requires shipping by cars and producing in factories and it will release a lot of carbon emissions. <TR>Therefore,</TR> if people need more possessions, it will draw more environmental problems.</Ex> This shows that people will be unhappy with many possessions since it occurs global warming.  </SI1></BO1>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Second,</TR> people will be stressed out if they have too many possessions.</MI1> <SI1>A growing number of people want to live in the countryside since many of them are not satisfied with urban life. To be specific, there are many attractive goods in the city. So, people are easily tempted to buying those products such as cell phones and fashionable clothes. In this situation, people are pushed to buy new items when they are released since old items can’t meet urban people’s needs. <TR>However,</TR> people are easily under stress because it requires a lot of money to purchase those items. Also, if people don’t purchase those possessions, they are not only hard to stay in healthy mentally but also difficult to socialize with people in the city. <TR>Consequently,</TR> many people recently have moved to the countryside since there are not many possessions. People lived in the rural area says that they can relieve their stress and socialize with many people more easily without newfangled items. This proves that today’s people couldn't be happy with many possessions since they generate too much stress to people.</SI1></BO1>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,<TR> I agree that having few possessions would make people happy for the reasons I have mentioned. <TR>First,</TR> environmental problem can be occurred by desire for more possessions. <TR>Second,</TR> people will be stressed out if they have too many possessions.</CO>
column23: A good essay for what it was, but I think the question was more about individual happiness.  So the second paragraph might not quite be on point.

column1: 175&Games can teach us valuable lessons about life.
column3:
