<IN>There are many games in our society and many people claim that games are useless and harmful to people, because they cause a variety of problems. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my opinion games have benefits which can help people to develop the ability of making a plan, and they can also help children learn rules in our society.</TS></IN>
              
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> games teach us the ability to develop a strategy.</MI1> <SI1>People cannot live without planning because they would never know what will happen in the future. So people have to prepare the future by developing a strategy. To do this, people should learn what will happen if they behave in a certain way, and make a plan to achieve a goal. Games teach us the ability to make a plan. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in a chess game, players should be prudent when they make a decision, because one mere mistake can bring serious problems which can lead to lose. <TR>Consequently,</TR> the player need to predict the next step before acting and make a strategy to win the game.</EX> This predicting and planning can be applied in real life. In a negatiation, one can predict the next claim of other and prepare for proper reacting. </SI1></BO1>
         
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> games are one of good ways to teach children rules.</MI2> <SI2>In our society, there are many rules which people should follow and children need to learn those. They do not know the importance of rules yet because they are still young. Their parents and teacher can teach rules and their importance by words, but this is not enough because its impact is weak and its way is boring to children. One way to teach them rules is games. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> children love to play games and they are eager to achieve their goal in a game. By playing games, children get to know they should behave in a certain way when playing games, because they cannot achieve their goal by not following the rule. They also can learn what the result will be if they violent the rule because they will be receive a penalty for their violenting.</EX> In this way, children can the importance of rules naturally. </SI2></BO2>
         
<CO>In conclusion, there are several advantages in games. <TR>First one</TR> is that people can raise their ability to make a strategy in life because games require that ability. <TR>Secondly,</TR> children can learn rules easily because they love to play games. In this regard, I firmly believe that games teach us valuable lessons to people.</CO>
column23: Overall a good essay, though the first main point was a little weak.

column1: 176&One can learn a lot more about a person from the type of friends that he has.
column3:
<IN>An ongoing debate exists over whether people can more obtain information about a person by observing the person’s friends. Some people believe that the common quality between a person and the friends give something a person has because a person spends more time on being with them. <TS><TR>However,</TR> contrary to the opinion, I maintain that determining a person by being base on friends a person has is wrong.</TS> This is largely because it is an indirect approach to a person. Moreover, many people are apt to being attracted by those who is different from themselves. </IN>
           
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> it will be an indirect clue to know friends a person.</MI1> <SI1>As a result, such a clue will mislead people to perceive a person. <EX>In my case, when I was in high school, I regard a student who has violent friends as violent student. Later on, I found the student very kind because I ask the student for the help of solving some problems and then the student didn’t complain my asking and helped me.</EX> As the example shows, as far as a person’s characteristics are concerned, it is not bad to determine the person by what friends looks like.</SI1></BO1>
            
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> people are likely to be attracted by people that have what they do not have qualities.</MI2> <SI2>So friends will offer the data that does not match the qualities a person has. According to a study conducted by a team of many researchers at Harvard University, more that 80% responded people said that they usually made friends who have diverse backgrounds that are not similiary to them. The study indicates that people have their friends with the goal of support their drawbacks.  As the study shows, due to the incline to make their friends who are not analoguous to them, friends is not a good way to understand a person.</SI2></BO2>
            
<CO><TR>To summarize,</TR> the awareness of a person’s friends does not give a greater opportunity to get information about a person on the grounds that it is not a direct clue, which will mislead people. <TR>In addition,</TR> people are inclined to be attracted by people who have different quality.</CO>
column23: Some grammatical and semantics problems but otherwise a good essay.

column1: 177&People can learn more from watching TV than from reading books.
column3:
<IN>Many people, especially adults often say that there is nothing to learn from TV, arguing that rather it would be better to read a book. <TS><TR>In fact,</TR> there is anything to learn in entertainment TV programs, but not all TV programs are not like that. There are helpful contents in TV.</TS> So I would like to talk about benefits of watching TV, in terms of learning. </IN>
         
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> TV helps people learn by evoking a variety of sense.</MI1> <SI1>Documentary programs treat a wide range of knowledge including flora or fauna, history, and natural science. This is like a book of encyclopedia. <TR>However,</TR> one different thing between two is that TV documentary programs convey knowledge to people by using image and sound. And this brings people's interest more by stimulating people's various senses. <EX><TR>From my experience,</TR> I loved to watch National geographic, Discovery and History channel when I was young. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I came to understand the related books better in school, and this brought me high grades in subject such as natural science or history.</EX></SI1></BO1>
          
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> people have hard time understanding by just reading a book.</MI2> <SI2>When people read, they use their imagination which is unclear and opaque. <TR>Moreover,</TR> this imagination can be different from real knowledge, which can lead people misunderstand. On the other hand, TV convey a clear and obvious image or sound to people, which can help people understand better. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I often have hard time understanding the outward appearance of a certain animal or the interaction of chemical integration by reading a book, because its demonstration is abstract. <TR>However,</TR> I can understand much better by seeing the real image of that animal and the computer graphich of the integration of chemical elements.</EX> </SI2></BO2>
         
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> TV helps people learn and understand better than a book does. This is because it brings people's interest by giving the image and sound which have great impact on people. <TR>In addition,</TR> they can understand well by watching TV because it gives clear image and sound which help understand abstract depiction well. In this regard, I believe that poeple can learn more from watching TV.</CO>
column23: The thesis didn't quite address the topoic.  It only addressed whether TV programs taught anything or not, it didn't really compare it to what you can learn from books.  The comparison didn't quite come together in this essay.

column1: 178&Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than with a teacher. Others think that it is always better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer?
column3:
<IN><TS>Even though I see many individuals who are successful by self-education, I think that it is better to have a teacher when you try to learn something because it is faster, more effective and getting a better result than teaching oneself.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> if you have a teacher, you can learn faster than studying by yourself.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> when you study a history of social science, it will take a lot of time reading all kinds of history books. <TR>However,</TR> if you learn it from a teacher by listening the lecture, you will be able to understand the whole picture in a shorter period.</EX> In other words, learning from a teacher is similar to reaching the destination by using an airplane; on the other hand, studying alone can be compared to lonely walking a long journey on feet by yourself.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> having a teacher when you learn some tasks is a more effective way than teaching yourself.</MI2> <SI2><EX>One of the examples for it  is when you learn how to cook. If you start learning the cooking skill by yourself, you will have to get through a number of trials and errors to master it. Sometimes, you may burn flour and eggs as well as other ingredients by ill-controlled temperature on the stove. <TR>However,</TR> by learning from a professional chef or seasoned cooks, you will reduce mistakes or ruining the dishes. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> besides the fast learning and effectiveness, it is most likely to have a successful fruit, compared to self-learning.</MI3> <SI3><EX>The best example of this can be applied to learning a foreign language. It is not only hard to master the second language, but also get a successful result if you teach yourself. In contrast, if you learn it from a native teacher who speaks the target language, you will be most likely successful in several ways by achieving a good grammar, natural pronunciation, and fluent speaking. </EX></SI3>

<CO><TR>To recap briefly,</TR> having a teacher when learning some tasks is even better than learning by yourself. It guides you to learn what you want to know at a fast rate, effectively and successfully.</CO>
column23: The thesis and conclusions weren't properly defined.  The supporting information was all examples; it could have benefited from better explanations of the ideas themselves.

column1: 179&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Access to the Internet enables students to study more effectively. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There is a controversy over whether internet is helpful to students or not. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> using internet is one of the most effective way for students to study better because depending on internet, they can study efficiently with tremendous information.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> with using internet, students can study more effectively.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to that fact that they can study and finish several assignments while walking only if they can have a cellular phone. Most phones released recently has a great accessibility to internet at rapid speed. Not only that after downloading certain apps, students can write their reports similar to ones that is done in computeer.

According to a study conducted by Seoul National Univerty of Korea, more than 75 percent of high school students have 2 hours of spare time in school or on transportation. So this means that using cellular phone internet in such spare time is the most effective to study and search information needed to major subjects.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> students can find more academic fact, exploring numerous websites.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that there exists more enormous information on the internet website than books. Since internet was develop in 1989, immense number of website has been created with various information. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> there is a web site called "Wikipedia". On the website, people can search for 17000000 of academic terms and jargons that we cannot easily find books in library. Moreover, only typing a word on keyboard, we do not have to waste of our time in struggling to find correct book in library.</EX> This implies that internet is virtually worthy for students to study better with large amount of information. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>In brief, while most people think internet is only deleterious to studying, I am certainly sure that it can make student study more efficiently with huge information, not having a problem in finding exact books in library  </CO>
column23: The main idea of the first paragraph is basically the same as the statement that you are arguing supporting.  Wikipedia is probably not a good example of a research tool because it can be edited by anyone.

column1: 180&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents can no longer control their children because of the effects of television, movies, and other outside influences. Use specific and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that as today's parents are likely to join the work force, they cannot keep their children from distraction, such as television, movies and so on. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that it is not impossible for parents to control their child because there is a way to attenuate the problem and it is less serious than we think.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> parents are able to restrain their children from being influenced by outside impacts.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that as the saying goes, 'out of sight, out of mind.' This indicate that if it were not for TV or other distractions, children will not think about it and be gradually less dependent on it. <EX>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2006, there was a huge difference between two groups of children in the degree of dependence of TV. Children who had no TV was classified as group A and those who had TV in their house was classified as group B. The researchers showed that the level of reliance on TV was much higher in those in group B. They tried to keep watching TV all day long even when they were seriously tired.</EX> This implies that based on the fact, parents can control the effect of badly-affecting source, getting rid of it's existence. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> contrary to common idea, the level of impact of TV and other divertions is not more serious than we expect.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that their harmful impact are pretty much exaggerated by parents themselves. By doing so, they want to control their children's dependence of such TV or others. According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2001, the effect of movies and drama is overstated actually. Based on the report, more than 80 percent of children who spent over 3 hours a day could concentrate on their study after watching TV. While studying, most of them did not think about contents of them. This means that parents can control such outer influences sinse it is not that much detrimental to children.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> as I described above, parents can supervise a harmful influence by removing the source of influence because they overestimate its impacts by themselves.</CO>
column23: There were some grammatical and semantics errors but otherwise it was a good essay.

column1: 181&People learn more from their friends and co-workers than from their teachers and bosses. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN><TS>We can learn great things from someone who are not supposed to be a good teacher such as friends and co-workers. Living in this modern world, it is sometimes very helpful to listen to advice from them. This kind of situations make some people oversimplify the assumption that we learn more from our friends and co-workers than from teachers and bosses. I do not agree with the idea based on three reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> friends and co-workers do not exist to teach me.</MI1> <SI1>They exist not for my study or research. The role of them is to do their best for their own. Sometimes there could be some situations that they can teach me, but this does not mean that we have to learn more from them than teachers who actually are responsible for teaching us. <EX><TR>As an instance,</TR> if one of my friends is very good at mathematics, he or she could help me learning some difficult problems and it surely could be very useful. <TR>However,</TR> it does not mean that I have to learn more from him or her than to learn from teachers whose major is mathematics.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> teachers can teach us much better than my friends or co-workers.</MI2> <SI2>One of the crucial roles of teachers is to teach their own special knowledge to others. We can learn much knowledge from teachers suc as mathematics, history, and computer programming. <TR>Also,</TR> teaching skill is totally different between teachers and friends or co-workers. Since teachers have trained how to teach others effectively and efficiently, most of teachers have good skills for teaching others. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> most of ordinary people who would be our friends or co-workers do not learn these sort of skills, hence few people would have a good skill to teach others. Therefore, it is clear that learning from teachers are better than friends and co-workers.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> in case of bosses, they are not teachers but we can learn various knowledge from them.</MI3> <SI3>If I have a boss, it is ordinary that my work is directly related to the boss's work. My boss would have many experiences about what I am doing now because he or she would have experienced the same or similar job before. What my boss gives an advice to me can be very helpful for many situations when I encounter several problems. <TR>However,</TR> learning from friends or co-workers are mostly limited to a certain boundary which is mostly not helpful because most of friends would not be involved in my work. Co-workers are often related to my work but it is usual that they do not have much experience than my boss so they would not be more helpful than my boss. I am pretty sure that this kind of situation about the relationship between my boss and I, and the relationship between my friends or co-workers and I can be easily adapted to general cases.</SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> friends and co-workers are sometimes helpful to learn something but they are not basically teachers. Teachers are the ones whom I need to learn from. Teachers and bosses are much better than friends and co-workers because teachers know how to teach much information efficiently and bosses have many experiences than co-workers.</CO>
column23: It was unclear on what part of the first paragraph was actually the thesis, so therefore it lacked punch.

column1: 182&In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Do you think this is a good idea?
column3:
<IN>Many people may think, because of the jobs, teenagers are hard to concentrate on their studying. As a result, parents would worry about their children’s score of their classes. <TS><TR>On the other hand,</TR> I firmly believe that teenagers should have jobs while they are students.</TS> What they can learn from their jobs is not only the value of the money but also broaden experience of their future jobs.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> they will be able to get wide experience from their jobs.</MI1> <SI1>It is hard to have lots of knowledge of their future jobs for teenagers from school. So, having jobs could be chance to learn various aspects of the jobs. <TR>In addition,</TR> they can get experience as intern. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was middle school student, I considered teacher as piece of cake. <TR>However,</TR> through my experience as a private teacher when I was high school student, I recognized it is really hard to lead student to understand notions.</EX> In this aspect, I think having jobs is chance to get broaden experience for teenagers.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> they can learn the value of the money from their jobs.</MI2> <SI2>Most of teenagers may get allowance from their parents. As a result, there is no chance to know the value of money. So, some of them spoil their money useless things such as computer game or expensive accessories. After they get their jobs, they will become to know the way to spend their money wisely I think. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> before I earn money, I usually spend my money to buy new clothes and do not save. <TR>However,</TR> because of my experience, I had learned how to spend my money effectively.</EX> For this reason, teenagers will be able to learn the value of money from their jobs.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I strongly recommend that teenagers should have jobs while they are students. It can be obstacle to spend their all time to studying. In contrast, they can have experience which would be helpful for their future job which they cannot learn from school. Also, having jobs allow them to know the value of their money which is really important to their future life.</CO>
column23: Some grammatical and semantics problems, and the thesis could have been stronger, but otherwise a good essay.

column1: 183&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person should never make an important decision alone. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>We often face moment of decision making, and regardless of importance of situations, most decisions should be decided in a short time. Some people make conclusion communicating with others whereas there are the other idea that it is better to make a decision on by own. <TS>In an important decision, I think that people should decide by themselves.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> one would not regret his decision in the case that he has made his own decision.</MI1> <SI1>Most people have enough insight to make a decision, so if a situation was badly resulted in the end, it is hard to overcome regret about the decision making. <TR>However,</TR> even if the aftermath goes bad and it was decided by themselves, there would be no more regret about the decision. <EX>In many companies such as Samsung or Apple, for example, people who make decisions are positioned in high places, endowing enough power and responsibility for their decision. Most of the members in the company respect CEO’s opinion and follow the person’s way and his own decision. Of course, it could goes to a bad situation, but results originating from a person hardly make the company collapsed or dishonored.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> own decision making can save time, by diminishing unnecessary time that can happen in the process of opinion developing.</MI2> <SI2>The more important decision making, the shorter the time remaining to make a decision is. According to a survey, one’s ways to think about some problems are similar comparing to others’ thinking. It represents that we do not have to spend much time adjusting opinions from others, which could be time wasting, even in the situation requiring to make a decision in a short time. <TR>Therefore,</TR> without communicating with others, when a man should make a decision, he can show the best and efficient result and, in addition, save energy and time.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> even in an important decision, one can make more efficient decision than with others.</CO>
column23: Conclusion could have been stronger but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 184&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Reading books about real events is better than reading books about fictional events. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There is a controversy between realistic books and fictional ones over which books are more helpful to today's students. It can look as though fictional book is childish and not informative. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that is is better because it can be a help for dealing with stress and improving creativity.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> fictional books are better than realistic ones in terms of stress.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that since fictional book tends to consist of more interesting and entertaining contents compared to realistic one, it enables students to lower their stress by reading. Such simple and quick escape from the reality may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2009, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in managing their academic pressure. Students in group A who spent seven hours a week on average reading fictional books were more satisfied with their school lives than those in group B who rarely engaged in such activities. The reason for this was that students who reading fictional books got less stressed out by such intensive school classes. On the other hand, those in group B were involved in dangerous activities, such as smoking, drinking, and stealing to cope with their stress. This implies that reading a interesting fictional book can be a effective and safe way to let off stress.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> reading a fictional book can contribute to improving creative thinking.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that most fictional books are written by creative person with such creativity. Thus, it is not an exaggeration reading fictional books is the most efficient way for students to develop their creativity.  According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2002, there existed a huge difference between two groups of students in creativeness. Students who liked fictional books were classified as group A and those who were interested in academic books were classified as group B.

Later on, researchers measured their creativeness by certain test which is customized to check the level of creativity. The researchers found that the level of creativeness in group A was much higher than that of group B.  Not only that, it turn out that those in group A had a more potential to solve academic questions with higher creativeness. This means that unlike our common thought, fictional book is more valuable than realistic ones because they can play a significant role in enhancing students' creativeness.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> some people presume that when it comes to getting knowledge and information, realistic book is better than fictional books. Of course, it is not untrue. <TR>However,</TR> fictional book has also it's value in terms of lowering stress level and improving creativeness. <TR>Therefore,</TR> we should not underestimate the merit of fictional books.  </CO>
column23: The evidence in body paragraph 1 was weak.  It proved that people who read books experienced less stress than those involved in dangerous activities, but it did not prove that those who read fictional books experienced less stress than those who read nonfiction.

column1: 185&People learn more by watching television than by reading books.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that TVs are just as good source of information as books. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I strongly believe that books are more capable of making people more wise and smart.</TS> Since video formed information is not detailed as much as books do. <TR>In addition to this,</TR> one can preserve books over a multiple of decades, a attribute that made books more affective media of information throughout time.  </IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with,</TR> I think books are more capable of conveying information, because video formed information is not detailed as books.</MI1> <SI1>Since books are formed in myriad of words, so the information in contains are elevated, which enables books to portray details that TV programs can't immitate. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a famous lecture 'What Is Justice?' conducted by Michael Sandel, who is a professor in Harvard University, contains less specified information than published edition of same lecture. When I read that book, What Is Justice, illustrating many cases, examples, and persuasive argument, I got the impression that books are genuinely capable of conveying specific details than the video lecture version does.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> people can learn more because one can preserve books for many years.</MI2> <SI2>Video formed information is relativey hard to convey generation to generation because of the machines that used in playing video is chainging due to an advancing technology. One can't guarantee that some DVD of documentary one had once bought can be endowed generation to generation, because there is a possibility of DVDs will be obsolete, and forgotten. <TR>However,</TR> books have existed over a few thousands years and will exist henceforth. <TR>Therefore</TR> One can pass books generation to generation, provided condition of books is fine. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I'm going to show my kid my first english book, Harry potter. I read Harry potter in english when I was 13 years old.</EX> 
So I'm planning to offer the same experience to my kid, just as I had. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> many people may consider books are obsolete and boring. <TR>However,</TR> as shown in above assertion, I think it is books that can more effectively convey informations, not television.  </CO>
column23: The I/B/C format wasn't perfect and there were some grammatical and semantic problems, but overall it was a good essay.

column1: 186&Developing many different skills is better than focusing on one skill in order to succeed.
column3:
<IN>As our society develops, a wide variety of specialities has been developed as well. Thus, since one specific skill is easier to master, many people claim that developing only one skill helps you to succeed in the future. <TR>However,</TR> I do not agree with this idea. <TS>I rather think that it is much better to aquire many kinds of skills as possible as one can.</TS> </IN>
         
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> investing in one skill has a great risk.</MI1> <SI1>There are many specialists in the world and it means that it is hard to be the best in one certain field. <TR>In addition,</TR> it is risky to focus on one thing. This is because if one fail in this field, there would be no other way to which one can resort. <EX>In the Finance, there are the word diversification in the portfolio theory. It suggest that one should not invest all efforts in one field, instead one should invest several fields so that he or she can diversify the risk.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> I think many kinds of skills are more helpful than one skill. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a friend of mine who put all his efforts on the CPA, accountants, in 10years does not achieve his goal yet. Moreover, since he has been failed several time and he does not have more time and money to support himself, he is deperate now.</EX> </SI1></BO1>
         
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> a person who is talented in many parts succeed.</MI2> <SI2>Although it is hard to be the best in one field, it is much more possible to be the multiplayer in many fields. Our society needs a person who can do well in several area, not a best in one skill. This can be proved by the fact that many companies prefers one who can do many fields such as a performance in his or her department, skills of his or her profession or even human relationships. And this brings more possibility to promote in a company. <EX>I have read a economic newspaper which states that most CEOs in Korea, did well in many fields. They did well not only in their department -whether it is their professional fields or not - but also in the relationship with co-workers and bosses.</EX> </SI2></BO2>
         
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is true that a person has more possibility to succeed when he or she is talented in many area. This is because it is less risky than investing all things in one field, which brings more possibility to be ruined. And our society need a person who can perform well in many fields. Thus, I agree with the statement that developing many skills is better than developing only one.  </CO>
column23: A few grammatical and semantics errors but otherwise a good article.

column1: 187&Nowaday people put too much emphasis on personal appearance and fashion.
column3:
<IN>When I see TV commercials, newspaper advertisements and ads on the Internet, I can easily realize the fact that people put weight on appearance and fashion of people. <TS><TR>However,<TR> this is not a desirable phenomenon because it can create a variety of side effects. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I have a negative perspective of this tendency of emphasizing the outward appearance.</TS> This is because, people spend too much money on their outward appearance. Moverover, people are susceptible to evaluate others with their appearance.    </IN>
         
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people waste their money on the outward characteristic.</MI1> <SI1>People spend excessive money to buy cosmetics and clothes or to get a plastic surgery. They even invest more money in the outward appearance than the necessities. One study has shown that people spend more than 30% of their earning on enhancing their beauty. Especially, there are people who get a expensive plastic surgery or buy luxury clothes, even though they are unable to afford those. <TR>In addition,</TR> this study concluded that this phenomenon can bring an excessive consumption tendency from the people. I think it woulb be better for them to spend their money to help the poors or develop themselves. </SI1></BO1>
         
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> people evaluate people more with their appearance.</MI2> <SI2>I think people's inner side such as their personality or talent is more important when it comes to judge others. <TR>However,</TR> people usually put more emphasis on the way how people look, and evaluate others with their outward appearance. <EX>I have read a economic newspaper article which states that most corporations in Korea put more weight on the interviewees' appearance in the interview site. The interviewers usually prefer applicants who have neat and nice appearance to others who are plain but more skillful and talented.</EX> This article suggested that this tendency brings negative impact on the company because the company can overlook the true qualification of applicants who can be helful to the company.  </SI2></BO2>
         
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> people should not waste their money on their appearance, because it can bring excessive consumption habits. And the tendency to evaluate others' with their appearance can make people overlook others. In this regard, I agree with the statement that people put too much emphasis on the appearance. </CO>
column23: The thesis was not very definitive, but otherwise it was a good essay.

column1: 188&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Loans between friends can harm the friendship. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that borrowing money from friends can be detrimental to their friendship. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I am certain that rather, it can be helpful to enhance relationships between friends because such loans make people feel the value of friends and keep in touch with more frequently.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> making loans among friends enables debtors to feel thankful to loaner.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that most people who make a loan from their friends are likely to be those who need urgent money but they cannot borrow it in other ways. In such circumstance, if they are ablt to get a help from close friends, they cannot help but to thank their friends for it. <TR>Moreover,</TR> such thankfulness is one of the main factors to enhance friendships. According to a study conducted by University of California at Los angeles of the United States, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in friendship. The researchers divided students depending on a degree of thankfulness they have felt in relationship. As we can easily expect, the result showed that the strong friendships was able to be built in proportion to the level of feeling of gratefulness. This experiment implies that friendships reinforced by such loans can be maintained better.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,<TR> borrowing money from friends make people contact each other more regularly.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that most of friends who borrow money tend to have financial problem. Thus, friends who lend money to them is inclined to make a phone call and send massage more often because they want to know how the matter is going. Such contacts is one of the most efficient ways to maintain solid relationships. According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2002, a test was conducted in high school students for investigating the relationship between frequent phone calls and consolidate friendships. The researchers showed that the more phone call is made, the strong relationship is built. This implies that such contact made by loans between friends is a effective way to strenghten friendships.</SI2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> it seems that between friends, making a loan is dangerous to soften their friendship. <TR>However,</TR> in my opinion, it is actually overestimated. Rather, through such affair, they can make more consolidate friendships and maintain it longer, feeling thankful to each other.</CO>
column23: Specific examples that illustrated the experiments would have helped.  Overall a good essay.

column1: 189&Some people live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a bit city. Which Place world you prefer to live in? Use Specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people prefer to live in a small town, because of beautiful landscape of nature and clean air, while others prefer to live in a big city. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> I advocate that living in a big city is better because it gives me numerous opportunities for my life.</TS> My reasons for this are that I can get high quality education and huge public transportation. I will explain them below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> a big city provides various educational chances  going through diverse experiences.</MI1> <SI1>A big city has many universities of high quality and professors who received higher education. The universities give me a valuable and meaningful education and then It is good for me to focus on research. <TR>In addition,</TR> living in a big city helps people to acquire a variety of experiences. It is useful to study for many students by visiting many educational places in a big city such as movie theater, historical, art museum and opera house. It can learn history, music, biology. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I went to New York City, I went to natural history museum and I watched fantastic musical. Also I visited Lincoln center and I listened perfect harmony of orchestra there. At the same time, I learned various history and music. Then I spent more precious and instructive time. It was nice for education. Practically New York University uses all of Mahattan city for campus to their education.</EX> If you living in a big city, you can receive high quaility education preciously and you can use all facilities of big city for your study.   </SI1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> a big city offers a wide range of public transportation.</MI2> <SI2>Public transportation is convenient to our busy daily life. Usually most people commute to school or company by train, bus every day. Public transportation can shorten commuting time a lot. A big city has gigantic public transportation more than a small town. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I studied for seven months in small town of New Zealand three years ago. When I studied there I did not have a car. I had a difficult time going to school. After I moved to Auckland that is the biggest city of New Zealand, however, I could commute to school so easy everyday by transportation. The buses came my home frequently at intervals of 15 minutes. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it was more handy for me to commute to school. Transportation was important to my daily life. It provided a comfortable way to go to school, shopping mall and anywhere.</EX> <TR>Moreover,</TR> you can save your valuable time than living in a small town thanks to public transportation. Today, gas prices is rising gradually. In this regard, using public transportation instead of using car can save our cost of living. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> When we move anywhere if we buy metro Umlimited tikets it bring more economic fares. It is cheaper than we spend to using our own car.</EX> In these circumstances, if you living in a big city, you can make your life more efficient and convenient.   </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I support the idea that living in a big city is better than living in a small city. Living in a big city offers numerous education opportunities and all of facilities to use for research. <TR>Moreover,</TR> living in a big city gives us profitable public transportation. It can make life more beneficial and fascinating in terms of time and cost efficiency. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I strongly agree with the idea that living in a big city provides many merits than living in a small town does.</CO>
column23: Some grammatical and semantics errors but otherwise a very good essay.

column1: 190&Do you agree or disagree? Modern technology is creating a single world culture.
column3:
<IN>Basically a single world culture can be a type of globalization. <TS>Based on this assumption, I agree with the statement that modern technology is facilitating the world unification.</TS> Even though the phenomenon of globalization has steadily progressed from the beginning of this century, the development of technology especially such as computers and Internet is playing a significant role in creating a single world culture. In this essay, I am going to present how the world is getting unified with a single object. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Above all things,</TR> nowadays more and more people in the world are creating a single culture by living under a universal language: English.</MI1> <SI1>With the development of modern technology, computers, the population speaking English language is increasing, the various kinds of languages spoken in different countries have been giving a way to the lingua franca, English. <EX>The most common computer language used today or software packages are written with English language. Almost all of computers are using a keyboard with roman alphabet letter. No matter where you are and no matter which language you speak, we are using the same kind of software like Window Operating System.</EX> It means that we are getting a single group. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> our life style is getting unified with each passing day with a modern technology of Internet being used in almost every corner of the world.</MI2> <SI2>All sorts of information we are getting provide us with a unifying knowledge worldwide. The similar kind of internet pages such as Google, MS Explorer make us getting closer one another. <TR>Besides,<TR> those portal web sites have same faces all over the country. Wherever you live, we see the same images on the first pages and share our ideas based on the world-wide websites. <TR>Moreover,</TR> people all over the world are creating a single family through the Internet Face book. Each one is getting closer and closer beyond national borders and distances. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> the modern technology especially such as computers and Internet development brings people worldwide together, and making the world getting a single culture.</CO>
column23: Some of the supportive information wasn't strongly defined.  Overall a good essay.

column1: 191&Parents are the best teachers.
column3:
<IN>Some people agree with the statement that parents are the best teachers. because they think that parents love their children more than anyone else. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I do not agree that parents are always the best teachers for their children.</TS> There are two reasons why I feel this way. One reason for my argument is that parents are too emotionally attached. the other reason is that they expect too much of their children.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Firs of all,</TR> parents cannot be the best teachers because their emotional invovlement gets in the way off the effective education of their children.</MI1> <SI1>It is a teachers` objective feedback that can help students to learn by showing them where they need improvement. <TR>However,</TR> it is not easy for parents to offer honest assesment. because they are too emotionally attached to their children. <EX><TR>for example,</TR> when their children failed to win the contest, although it is jufitable process, some parents repute the results.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason that</TR> parents think that their children can perform anything involved in.</MI2> <SI2>parents tend to overestimate their kids` ability. It is sometime a big burden to their children , which can cause harmful effect on their growing period. and they also expect their children to make the same dicisions that they would. because they are certain that it is a good way to make children ideal person who they expected. <TR>However,</TR> this action can prevent children from thinking themselves in the future. Even they deicide what they need to do, parents cannot encourage their decision not corresponded to what parents want. All of these things makes children dispressed.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I strongly believe that parents cannot be the best teachers for their children. They are too emotionally involved in their children`s lives to view them objectively as a good teacher should. <TR>What is more,</TR> as parents only expect their children to be a person who they wanted</CO>
column23: The thesis said what you do not agree with, it could have helped if you specified what you DO believe.  Some spelling, grammar, and semantics issues.

column1: 192&In today's world, the ability to cooperate well with others is more important than it was in the past. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>Cooperation with others is considered an important factor for human beings all over the world because people are social. <TS><TR>However,</TR> many people think cooperation is more important factor these days than prior periods, which is not true due to two reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><EX><TR>First and formost,</TR> I think the period that cooperation with other people was the most pointed out was the agricultural period during mankind history, much more than now.</MI1> <SI1>When human beings' first period was to raise crops, cooperation was extremly important because a person or two cannot finish the whole process of agriculture. Since the technology was not well developed, machines for rasing crops did not exist and people have to do their work by their own hands with just simple tools. Comparing with these days which agriculture is not required many people but required only many machines, helping each other for crops was not an optional but eccential. Therefore, the ability to cooperate is more important during agricultural period than these days.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> there are so many things that can be done without any help of others in modern society.</MI2> <SI2>Many companies have required to do employees' job at office during prior periods. <TR>However,</TR> these days working at home becomes widespread. It does not mean that all works can be done at home but the occurance of working at home is clearly increasing these days, reducing the importance of cooperation with others. <EX><TR>As an example,</TR> computer programmers are one of the best examples that the cooperation is getting less importnace. Computer programmers had to learn about new programming skills, discuss with each other in order to build a new system. The lastest trend, however, is all changed. They learn new programming skills not by studying together but by studying with online lecture. Also they do not discuss with others but rather get their own assignment and just do what each person has to finish. Instead specialists are employed for building a new system and assigning a role of each person.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Although interaction with others is important and how people cooperate with others are one of important abilities, it does not mean that these ability is specifically considered to be important these days. Throughout the past periods, cooperation is always considered to be important and the tendency is getting weakened these days due to the modern technology and changed working environment.</CO>
column23: In the second paragraph, the entire argument seems to be an example.  There should be more of a direct point stated which the example would illustrate.  Spelling and grammatical errors.

column1: 193&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to have friends who are similar to you than to have friends who are different from you. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people are likely to presume that making friends similar to me is better than having friends who are diffrent from me. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that the advantage of having various friends far outweigh that of having analogous friends because it can be more helpful in life and the relationship lasts longer.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> making different friends enable people to make their lives eaiser.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to fact that all people have different knowledge and skills from each other. Thus, having different friends can give numerous helps, living in complicated modern society. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was a freshman on Engineering major, I got stress out too much because the subjects related to Engineering requires other knowledges in mathematics. However, I was poor at mathemtics and I ended up getting helps from my friends who were majoring in mathemathics. Judging by my experience, having friends different from me can be helpful and effective way to solve problems by getting an advice.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> having similar friends can lower the possibility to sustain the relationship for long period.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that always doing the same things everyday without making changes, they can be easily bored with each other. With such situation, they finally ended up wanting to make new friends who are not analogous to their own characteristics. <EX>According to a study conducted by University of California at Los Angeles of the United States, there existed a huge difference between two groups of students in friendships. Students in group A were classified for their similar characteristics and those in group B were classified for their different ones. The researchers showed that the period in which friendships last is much higher in group B than group A. Those in group B kept in touch with one another after they graduated from school.</EX> This implies that making different friends is better because it last longer than having similar friends.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>In brief it, at first glance, making friends who is similar to their own is better. <TR>However,</TR> I think by making different friends, we can live a more effective life through getting helps easily without worrying about maintaining the relationship between friends in long period.</CO>
column23: Some semantic and grammatical errors but otherwise a good essay.

column1: 194&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The ability to cooperate well with other people is more important now than it was in the past. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people presume that cooperation is one of the most important component in academic and work fields. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that unlike our expectation, cooperation is not significant in modern society because it is not much helpful to get good jobs in the future and also it's importance is far much too greater in the past.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the ability to cooperate with others is not crucial to live a successful life.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that nowadays, most of companies consider more importantly an individual's ability, such as comleting project on time, meeting deadline, and observing work regulation thoroughly than cooperation. This reflects the importance of cooperation dose not outweigh that of work ability. According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2008, the individual's capacity is the most significant factor for hiring in practice, taking up more than 70 percent of the final calls. The interviewers looked at the job applicants' skills and knowledge, mostly related to specialty. This implies that capable person tend to have more chance to get better jobs rather than cooperative one.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> collaboration is rather more important in the past.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that as modern society is becoming increasingly indivisualistic, the importance of collaboration has been decreasing at a rapid pace. Not only that, with a thought that collaboration can decrease effectiveness of work, the value of collaboration is more decreasing. According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2009, the number of collaborative projects which includes more than two academic majors in the university has decreased by 28 percent over the past three years. On the other hands, project that can be done in one particular resource were spreading drastically. This indirectly shows that even in academic fields, not only in work place, the collaborative work is not recommendable.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> collaborating to do some taxing projects with others seems like great and attractive sufficiently. <TR>However,</TR> it is not that much helpful for people to be hired by famous companies and actually it's importance is lower than it is in the past. <TR>Therefore,</TR> we ought not to put the importance of cooperation on the top of other factors in life.  </CO>
column23: Some specific examples of the research that was provided would have helped put things in perspective.  But other than that it was a good essay, with good research.

column1: 195&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The complexity of modern life makes it necessary for young people to have the ability to plan and organize. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that the more complicated modern society is, the more necessary it is for people to prepare to do their work. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>contrary to such common idea</TR>, I firmly believe that the complexity of modern society life is not that much related to the necessity to plan and organize <TR>because</TR> there is also easy way to do work and most of people have an ability to improvise another way.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, <TR>in spite of the complication of modern life</TR>, there also exists several way to achieve their goals and live their lives.</MI1> This is more possible <TR>given the fact that</TR> not all people is living their lives based on their plans or other alternatives. <TR>Logically</TR>, if complicated present life makes people live a planed life, all people should have their own plans. <TR>However</TR>, the true situation is not such. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2009, the researchers investigated people about how much of them live their lives with plans. The test result showed that 65 percent of the people were just subsisting, having no plans.</EX> This counterevidence implies that even if modern society is becomming increasingly complex, today's people are able to subsist without plans.</BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, all people have a potential to extemporize.</MI2> <TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> there actually exists certain area to be charged with improvision. <SI2><TR>Thus</TR>, people who do live with no plan can manage to live their lives and ahieve their dreams. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, since I was in fifth grade, I have wanted to attend Seoul University of Korea in 2009. <TR>However</TR>, I only studied all subjects and did assignments without a thorough plan. <TR>Instead</TR>, I studied and finished various report on a whim. <TR>Finally</TR>, I could made my dream come true to attend the University.</EX> <TR>It means that</TR> by my experience, without planing, people can accomplish their goals and do their work well.</SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I certainly support the idea that complicated modern life has not correlation with such necessity.</BO2>
<CO><TR>In brief</TR>,  It means that <TR>although</TR> subsisting without plan looks like dangerous in ordinary people's view point, it can be one of the ways for people to survive in modern life <TR>because</TR> there is always alternatives and many people are living actually without plan. <TR>Also</TR>, people can improvise another way immediately. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should not relate the complexity of modern life with such necessity.</CO>
column23: BO1 lacks SI

column1: 196&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Grades(marks) encourage students learn. Use specific reasons and examples to support you opinion.
column3:
<IN>Students learn much knowledge, information, and skill in the school.<TR>But</TR>, we don’t know how much students have learned without grades. <TR>That is</TR>, grades show that how much they made efforts in class or study. <TR>Also</TR>, it can be stimulant to students to learn, and have effect on their futures. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, I agree that grades encourage student to learn.</TS><IN>
<BO1><MI1>One way grades encourage students is that they are result of endeavor</MI1>. There are various test methods like essay, practice, or quiz. But, it doesn’t’ matter to get good grades. <SI1>If they don’t have will about learning in class, grades will be dropped. <TR>This is because</TR> every school tests are based on topics covered in class. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if students realize that effort results in good grades, they will study harder in order to get grades they want.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Another way</TR> grades encourage students is that they can be stimulant to students.</MI2> <SI2>Any students can receive a shock by getting dropped grades. <TR>And then</TR> they try to study harder to recover them. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>when I was high school student</TR>, I neglected study in short time because of basketball. <TR>After</TR> finishing one semester, my grade was gone down. <TR>After all</TR>, I was shocked, <TR>and then</TR> I did more concentrate on class to recover it.</EX></SI2></BO2>
<BO3><MI3><TR>The last way</TR> grades encourage students is that they can have influence on students’ future.</MI3> <SI3>When students get bed grades, they don’t affect for now. <TR>However</TR>, they will be problem in entering university or finding jobs. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, high level universities require not only their own test, but also high school’s grades. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if you don’t get good marks in school, these problems will be happened.</SI3> Students will study harder and get grades that they are satisfied with in order to their future.</BO3>
<CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, grades encourage students to learn. Grades can play an important role in life. <TR>Thus</TR>, students study harder with doing their best, and teachers should give a grade to student impartially for their future.</CO>
column23: The student starts out with a weak thesis, but has decent main ideas to support it. However, SI1 lacks relevant examples.

column1: 197&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person should never make an important decision alone. Use specific reasons and examples to support you answer.
column3:
<IN>People make a several important decisions such as entering university, marriage, and finding a job in living the life. <TS>When making these decisions, I don’t think that people should never make an important decision alone. If deciding alone, there are positive points like preventing conflict with others, catching good opportunity, and feeling accomplishment.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can prevent conflicts with other people by making a decision alone.</MI1> <SI1><EX>When the decision which I make with other people results in bad situation, it is completely my fault. This is because a performer who takes a decision is me.</EX> However, we tend to shift responsibility on others who helped us make it. In the other hand, if we come to a decision alone, it will not happen.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, if other people help us make a decision, we can miss the opportunity to best choice.</MI2> <SI2>Because of much advice which is to conflict or be various, we can be indecisive. <TR>That is</TR>, our judgment will be confused, and then the time and resources in making and decision will be increased. <TR>But</TR>, when we take a decision alone, we catch the opportunity to better selection quickly without confusing.</SI2></BO2>
<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, we can feel a sense of accomplishment by selecting an important decision alone.</MI3> <SI3>To take a decision by ourselves, we need to find information and to analyze what decision is better. These endeavors will result in satisfactory decision. <TR>Thus</TR>, we can fell pleasure about solving the important issue by ourselves. <TR>Although</TR> we succeed in making better decision with others, the accomplishment will be less than choosing alone.</SI3></BO3>
<CO><TR>In short</TR>, these are positive points when people make an important decision by themselves. No matter whom you talk with – friends or family- you should keep in your mind that it is possible they sometimes can damage your choice.</CO>
column23: The student has a clear thesis but fails when trying to support it. SI2 and SI3 both lack evidence, relying only on generalizations.

column1: 198&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Many teachers assign homework to students everyday. Daily homework is necessary for students.
column3:
<IN>Almost all teachers give students assignment on a daily basis at school. Assignment can be a burden to many students because it requires time and efforts. <TS><TR>However</TR>, it is really necessary for students to improve their academic performance and creating good habit for studying.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, students can improve their academic performance through their homework.</MI1> If there is no homework from school, it is for sure that most of the students don't study by themselves. Homework makes students study, and studying is the most important and fundemental duty of students. <SI1><TR>Even if</TR> students do their homework unwillingly because they merely don't want to be punished, homework can help students' development in their academic achievement. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I had to do a lot of homework when I was a high shcool student. <TR>At that time</TR>, I didn't like to do homework, <TR>but</TR> I could come to know about difficult equation that I could not understand well in mathmatics class by doing homework.</EX></SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2>In addition, doing assignment is good for creating studying habit.</MI2> Growing good habit is one of the most important factors to succeed in one's life. <SI2><TR>However</TR>, habit is not able to be formed in a short time. It takes a lot of time. <TR>In this regard</TR>, doing homework everyday can help students make good studying habit.</SI2> <??><TR>Moreover</TR>, once students have good studying habit, they can get great grades and reach their academic goal easily.</??> <EX>According to the recent research conducted by Seoul National University, most successful people have strong and good habit for studying. They have a fever for studying and read books almost every day. Studying habit is their one of the biggest characters in common.</EX></BO2>
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, homework is very important and good for students to improve their academic performance. <TR>Also</TR> students can have good studying habit by doing homework. Homework can be a key factor for students to be a good example at school.</CO>
column23: SI2 has no examples; BO2 seems to have a second MI or SI?

column1: 199&Some people believe that universities should require students to take classes on ethics, whereas others believe a school should focus only on academic issues. Which do you think is better?
column3:
<IN>Usually universities do not require ethics classes to their students, emphasizing on practical academic subjects. <TS><TR>Personally</TR> I believe that now it is time when educational institutions should be aware of the urgent importance of morality and require all their students to take classes on ethics.</TS></IN> 
<BO1><MI1>The first reason for supporting the ethics class in the university is that it will help reduce the increasing social crime rates.</MI1> Apart from a recent shooting incidents at an elementary school as well as high schools and universities, <EX>most of people know that serious crimes have been growing all over the country. <TR>Ironically</TR>, the rates of the highly educated and enrolled in universities have been also steadily increasing thanks to governmental funding aids and affluent life. </EX><SI1><TR>And then</TR>, what will be the main reason that the crime rates have increased exponentially in the abundant educated society? It may be the education system that has focused only on knowledge. <TR>Now</TR> if universities are aware of the relationship with two increased rates and realize the importance of ethics in their programs and start to educate students, it will help increase well-rounded personalities and form a peaceful society with less criminals.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason</TR> that universities should require students to take classes on ethics is that it will help reinforce the sense of moral.</MI2>  <SI2>One of the most significant reasons for committing crimes, hurting others, and confusing an orderly society can be blamed for a lack of morality and humanity around the places. <TR>Putting it differently</TR>, the paralyzed morality can lead to selfishness and disrespect sociopaths. When considering most of the serious perpetuators and criminals are allegedly young adults, <TR>it is no doubt that</TR> the required ethics class will play an important role in reinforcing the paralyzed moral senses.</SI2></BO2> 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, it is better for universities to require students to take ethics classes rather than focusing only on academic issues. It will help to reduce serious social problems and increase safety by reinforcing a sense of morality.</CO>
column23: Examples for SI1 come before the SI is stated

column1: 200&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The best way to ensure a good future is to plan carefully when you are young. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that sucessful people usually are those who had plan to achieve their goals since they were young. <TS>I firmly agree with the opinion because planing is effective way to do study and also young students have more potential than the older.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, planing since young age increase the chance of succeeding in life.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that almost all young students have more intellectual power. Thus, they can easily memorize numerous things at once and even their brain is able to keep them in long-term memories. This is what does not always happen in old people. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2009, there was a huge difference between two groups of people in memorizing. Middle school students was classified as Group A and adults were classified as Group B. An experimenter showed a series of pictures and required subjects to keep them in mind and remind after an hour. The researchers showed that middle school students were able to recall more than adults by 30 percent.</EX> This implies that young aged people can easily learn by heart on account of their higher brain function. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if people plan to accomplish something in early age, they will have more possibility to make it come true.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, planing enables students to do various works more efficiently.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> when people plan, they always think about it's priority. <TR>Thus</TR>, by doing so, they end up focusing on impending work, remaining other works to do later. Such procedure allows students to study more effienciently, not letting them do unnecessary things which is not related to their dream. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my youngest brother used to lazy, living his life without plans, which caused him to have poor grades in school. Since he attended class named 'effective planing', he has changed little by little. He realized that planing is important component for living a successful life. <TR>Later on</TR>, he performed higher in school and got better grades because of such realization.</EX> This implies that planing in early age can contribute to success in life.</SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, some people presume that everyone can be successful without any plan if they are capable. <TR>However</TR>, I certainly believe that planing since early age is the most efficient way for student to succeed in the future.</CO>
column23: MI1 is more or less a reiteration of the statement students are asked to agree or disagree with, not a new argument.

column1: 201&High school students should be allowed to choose some of their classes.
column3:
<IN>There are different opinions among people regarding whether it is proper for high school students to choose subjects that they want to learn in their study. <TS><TR>Although</TR> it is true that they could enjoy their school lives if they choose and focus on studying they like to learn, I believe that it is more beneficial to have a variety of courses in high school.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons to support my opinion.</IN>
          <BO1> <MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, with various knowledge they learn in high school, students can learn and understand a lot of things that encourage them to find out their real potential and abilities.</MI1>  <SI1>Specifically, if they choose what they want to study, some of them couldn`t have opportunities to study how materials surrounding them are made not choosing science. <TR>However</TR>, if they were given many courses such as history, math and physics, they could know whole things related to them above and find out which field they can prove their potential in. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in my case</TR>, I liked to learn and study history, so I had dream about becoming historian. I hated studying and memorizing weird science things. <TR>But</TR>, as being exposed by science world for several times in high school, I realized that not only did I have a great potential to get great grades in chemistry, but also I can work in chemistry sector. <TR>As a result</TR>, now I am studying chemistry engineering in college.</EX> <TR>In this regard</TR>, high school students should try to learn entire courses that high school provides.</SI1></BO1>
          <BO2> <MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, high school student aren`t mature and sensible to decide what they study, so they may make wrong decisions related to their study.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In particular</TR>, they don`t know and understand why these courses are require do take and why they have to memorize this equation that seems unnecessary in their future. <TR>So</TR>, if they were asked to choose whole subjects whatever, they would not lose chances not to study challenging subjects, which results in bad consequences that few students are going to choose that kind of difficult courses. </SI2><SI?><TR>In addition</TR>, school need to compulsory educational courses for their students. <EX>Most high school students don`t like to stay in high school with their reference books and take a 50min class listening at teachers. Once school provide them with chances to choose what they want which means education they receive are not mandatory anymore, they are able to have rooms in their mind and lose motivation to study harder.</EX></SI?> <TR>For these reasons</TR>, choosing subjects are not acceptable because mandatory educational system is more effective for high school students.</BO2>
           <CO><TR>In conclude</TR>, I totally agree with this statement that high school students should not be able to choose what they study <TR>on account of the reasons above</TR>: they need to experience a variety of study which make them become men of more ability and they are not qualified for choosing courses they study for their immature.</CO>
column23: This student uses some awkwardly-phrased SIs that are too specific. In addition, I feel that the way that they interpreted the prompt, while a valid interpretation, is a bit strange and not what was intended.

column1: 202&Young people nowadays are more willing to help others than those in the past.
column3:
<IN>There are a substantial number of people who think that young people nowadays are more willing to help others than those in the past. They insist that there are a lot of news that young people helped unfamiliar others. <TS><TR>On the other hands</TR>, I think that young people nowadays tend not to help others because the moral education in school lacks and also they are very busy for their own work.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>To commence with</TR>, the young would not want to help others recently because they have not learned how they have to do when they see a person who are in trouble from school properly.</MI1> <SI1>In general, children get learned the moral attitudes as a social member from their parents and the school. However, recently this moral education tends to disappear in school because the school concentrate on the students' academic result like getting a famous university. <EX>The research, has been conducted by the Korean Times, states that more than eighty percent of university students answered that they got morality classes less than 2 hours a week. It is impressive comparing more than seventy percent of adults who are older than 40 answered that they had three times more classes.</EX> Thus young people nowadays could not get a moral education enough to have sympathy with others.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that</TR>, even though they want to help others, they can not do because they are very busy.</MI2> <EX><TR>From my experience</TR>, two month ago I had a problem in my research assignment. I thought that my classmates could handle it, so asked them to help me. However they were sorry for that they can do that. They also had a heavy workload too. One of them had to take six courses a week and participate the research project which were conducted by his professor. In the end, I did not have no way except handling that problem myself.</EX> Hence, I assert that young people too busy to concern others.</SI2></BO2>
<CO>For these two reason, I maintain that the young people tend not to help others than those in the past.</CO>
column23: This essay addresses the topic with a strong thesis and supporting examples, though more examples would have been nice. Also, there were some grammatical errors that were common, like with articles.

column1: 203&Drivers should be charged for congestion when they drive in areas with heavy traffic. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>People who have a car would feel the same frustration these days when they drive their car. Because too many cars on the road, congestion problems are ordinary phenomenon and it is not easy to solve the problem. <TS>Some people try to solve the problem by charging fees to heavy traffic, but many people oppose the opinion. <TR>However</TR>, I think this is actually one of the best solutions based on two reasons.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, price differentiation is one of the efficient ways to solve the congestion problem.</MI1> <SI1>If there is high demand and low supply, it is ordinary that the price go higher than before. This is natural situation in nations which are based on capitalism. <EX>As an example, movie tickets in weekend are more expensive than those of weekdays because more people want to watch movies and tickets are limited.</EX> <EX>Another example is the price of hotel. Even if people stay at the same night in the same hotel, the price of rooms is different based on the location of rooms; rooms with better scenery charges higher than ordinary rooms.</EX><TR>Likewise</TR>, charging higher price to something that is more popular than others is not unreasonable. In this manner, charging with higher congestion to drivers is surely reasonable decision. As the price goes higher, fewer drivers would drive the area of heavy traffic, finally reducing the traffic problem</SI1>.</BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, based on the revenue that drivers paid due to the congestion, governments can invest to intrastructure for solving traffic problems.</MI2> <SI2>Since governments have to distribute their budgets to many kinds of problems, using much money to enhance the heavy traffic problem would not be easy. <EX>If governments can charge for congestion, they can not only reduce the traffic problems but also gain fees. Since these fees are gathered by drivers, there is no reason to invest the money to problems other than the congestion problem. Drivers who paid for congestion can easily understand if the money they paid is used for improvement of traffic problems.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, charging congestion fees to drivers would be a good way to both reduce the traffic problem and earn money for investment to the traffic problem.</SI2></BO2>
<CO>Heavy traffic problem is not easy to solve, but there may exist a way to reduce it. Pricing to drivers is one of them. It can reduce the traffic based on the theory of supply and demand, and the money that is earned by the fees can be used to improve the traffic condition, which can clearly enhance the traffic problem.</CO>
column23: The thesis gives a clear argument, but the reasons for that argument should be included as part of the thesis and not left to be mentioned for the first time later. Overall, the essay is very good, with good examples used to support the thesis.

column1: 204&Television advertisement directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that there is nothing wrong with television advertisements aimed at yery young children. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, television advertising directed toward children younger than five years of age should be prohibited.
