My reasons for this are that children at that age can become endangered, and they will feel a false desire to buy useless products.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, children of that age group can become endangered by misunderstanding the intention of commercial advertisements.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, children of a youg age cannot distinguish if the advertisements are just intended to sell products, or if they're informing viewers of facts. <EX><TR>According to a news report</TR>, a child had an accident recently due to an advertisement he saw. The child was only four years old, and had seen a TV commercial for a superman costume. In the commercial, an actor was shown wearing the costume and flying with the help of special effects. The child bought the costume and tried to emulate the actor by jumping out of a second story window, resulting in a broken arm.</EX></SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, young children can be easily persuaded to desire unnecessary products.</MI2> <SI2>They are often convinced by TV ads that they should have things they don't really need. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, My young cousin often nags my aunt and uncle to buy him the toys that he sees on TV. <TR>However</TR>, after they buy those toys for him, he gets bored with them very easily, and ignores them or throws them away after only a short time. if he had not seen the commercials on TV, he would have asked for those toys in the first place.</EX></SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, children younger than five can endanger themselves by misinterpreting the purpose of commercial advertisements, and can be influenced to desire useless products. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I agree with the statement that we should not allow television advertising to target children under five years of age.</CO>
column23: This is an excellent essay. The student has a clear opinion which (s)he expresses with a fairly advanced range of vocabulary and a high level of grammar proficiency.

column1: 205&In order to stay well-informed, people should get information from various news sources.
column3:
<IN>A lot of controversies exist over whether we should get information from various sources or just one sources. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I think we are just fine with one sources because, for example, internet can provide us various information, and because looking up information via several sources costs time, and is tiresome.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, I think using internet is just enough to get information.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Modern days</TR>, provides many information with many shapes-for example, radio, TV, newspaper-, but since internet can provide us various forms of information, there is no need to look up for information from varying sources. The internet can provide us information with many forms like video, sound, image, words. I think this aspect of internet solves every redundant media of internet(well, at least for young people like us). <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, a research conducted in Yale University by professor John Holstein indicates that forms of information have changed along the change of generation. For example, the graph of the paper showed that our parents relied upon televisions, and radios, and newspapers as a source of information, but our generation can get information only from the internet. This need for various media is being reduced, which concurs with my point.</EX></SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I think we don't need various sources to get information, because I think 'foraging' for information from various sources are just waste of time and waste of energy.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is because</TR> we have to add up many information from various sources to picture decent quality of information. But if we use one source information, we don't have to work on adding up informations. You might ask that the information can be biased, but I think the internet can solve this problem either. The internet can save time and energy. <EX>For example, I was reaserching about various taboos related to food, which is about cultural enthropology. I had to look up dozens of books to get accurate informations, but when I searched about taboos of food in wikipedia, it provided me purely condensed form of information, just what I needed. So looking up internet helped me greatly saving all those times and efforts I would have spent foraging for informations from books.</EX></SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I think getting informations from one source is more beneficail because,<TR> first</TR>, we don't have to look up information from various sources and <TR>second</TR>, getting information from one source can save energy and time.</CO>
column23: This student makes good use of examples to make his/her point, but they could use more work with vocabulary and grammar, as there are many malformed, strange-sounding sentences and phrases in this essay.

column1: 206&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Success is the result of hard work rather than luck. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>Some people might say that luck has much influence on one's success rather than hard work. <TR>Virtually</TR>, there are people who succeed through his or her luck, such as winning a lottery. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>as far as I am concerned with this topic</TR>, I strongly believe that hard work is way more important than luck, for such following reasons.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>First and the foremost</TR>, hard work is way promising than luck.</MI1> <SI1>There aren't many people who have won a lottery. There is only one person who can get hugh amount of money through lottery. Not only a lotteryy,but also in other cases. there aren't many lucky people. <EX>If there are many lucky people around the world, there wouldn't be any social failures, which is 40% of today's society.</EX> <TR>On the other hand</TR>, one's success in practically guaranteed, for those who worked hard. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I worked hard on last year's final exam, and I got all A+, which made me realize this fact.</EX></SI1></BO1>   
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, There is this well-known saying, 'No pain, no gain.'</MI2> <SI2>I am adhered to this maxim, since I realized that it is true. <EX>When I was in middle school, I didn't study hard. Sometimes I even failed the exam. <TR>Then</TR>, when I entered a high school, I devoted myself to studying. Until then, I had a fixed idea that I can make a good guess on the test, even if I don't prepare for the test. <TR>However</TR>, It was not true, and I realized that studying hard is the best solution for me in getting higher score on the examination. I studied really hard. <TR>Eventually a years later</TR>, I could be one of top 5 students in whole grade.</EX></SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>For the reasons above</TR>, I strongly believe that hard work has to do more with success rather than a luck. Even if one is lucky, If he doesn't work hard, he would consequently fail. What is success? I think it is a mixture of having a flair for the thing that you are doing; knowing that it is not enough, that you have got to have hard work and a certain sense of purpose.</CO>
column23: The student has ideas that are related to the topic but aren't as closely related as they could be.

column1: 207&The government should pay more attention to health care issues than environmental issues.
column3:
<IN>There are different opinions among people concerning whether the government should consider much more seriously to solve the environments problem rather than the health care issues. I partly admit the importance of solving health problems in our nation because there are so many people who are experiencing very harsh diseases, <TR>however</TR> <TS>I believe that the environmental issues has to be considered as a priority that government officers should take care of.</TS> In this essay, I will present two main reasons to support my opinion.</IN>
           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, environmental issues are severe problems that it is too difficult to solve in a very short period.</MI1> <SI1>If the government delays solving that kind of problems until as long as they can, it would have no choice but spend astronomical time, money and efforts dealing with environmental issues. <EX>According to recent survey from one environmental group, to restore environment of today require millions of years.</EX> <EX>In order to get rid of pollutants from water, it takes about 100 years even if most of the governments in the world would try to eliminate something make water dirty, which means that children who are lack of clean water to drink have to wait for more a hundred years.</EX> <TR>However</TR>, it is not too late to fix the problems.<TR> Although</TR> it is true it needs a lot of money, time and resources now, we can save such a huge amount of them by concentrating on solving the environmental problems now.</SI1></BO1>
           <BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, by solving environmental issues, the governments are able to handle the health problems at the same time.</MI2> <SI1><TR>To specify this</TR>, most of diseases are caused by the pollution of environment. Some of that didn’t exist in the past when people were able to enjoy their lives in clean surroundings and there was no pollutant at all. <TR>However</TR>, these kinds of whole health diseases whether related to the pollution of environment can be cured by paying attention to clean and eliminate the pollutant in environment. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, AIDS are the most critical and fatalist disease that most people think it cannot be treated. But, recent study shows that developing hygiene of where people who are suffering from AIDS have very appropriate effects on curing that disease.</EX> <EX><TR>In addition</TR>, An expert from WHO said if a number of government from the world try to clean its air, ground, river, mountain and sea, it can reduce the finance for people who are sick about 50%.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, the government can have opportunities to get health issues resolved very much by focusing how to handle the environment and develop nation`s cleanliness.</SI2></BO2>
        <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, environmental issues are considered to be the most important matter compared with the health issue for the reason that I mentioned above: if the government doesn`t think of environmental issues as the most critical problems now, it would spend numerous finance and time and by trying to solve the problem about environment rather than the health problems, the government can solve two problems simultaneously.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay could be more specific, but the essay is good overall. There are adequate examples and evidence given to support the argument being made.

column1: 208&High schools should make economics basic courses.
column3:
<IN>An ongoing debate exists over whether high schools should require students to take economics as basic courses. Some people believe that economics is not designed for students’ basic course as making economics basic courses can deprive students of rights to choose their subjects. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>contrary to the opinion</TR>, I maintain that economics should be mandatory courses. <TR>This is largely because</TR> these courses help students manage their money. <TR>Moreover</TR>, today’s job finds employees who have economical ability.</TS></IN>
 
           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, economics allow students to have the ability to control the use of money.</MI1> <SI1>This is well-known fact that those who have knowledge of basic economics can more make economical choice when choose products. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one of my friends wastes his hard-earned money on buying products without thinking their prices. After he took economic classes and learn many economics, he can make great choice about product by using the most use of the knowledge.</EX> <TR>As the example shows</TR>, basic economics provides a greater opportunity to learn economical concept. </SI1></BO1>
          <BO2> <MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, today’s employer wants to employees who have economical ability</MI2>. <SI2>Almost all jobs are related to economics such as calculating and estimating. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by a team of researcher in Harvard Universities</TR>, more than 80% of enterprises prefer to people who deal with tasks well which is associated with economic.</EX> <TR>As a study shows</TR>, the talent to be knowledgeable in economical things is beneficial in getting good jobs.</SI2></BO2>
           <CO> <TR>To summarize</TR>, high schools have to make economics basic courses on the ground that by doing so, students develop their economical ability and manage their money. So they will get lucrative job.</CO>
column23: This is a strong essay- the thesis is clear, as are the main ideas and the student's supports for those ideas.

column1: 209&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Success is the result of hard work rather than luck. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that although not doing their best, lucky people end up being successful in life on account of their luck. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I firmly believe that the possibility of success is more dependent on their effort, not luck because people working hard is more recognized by superiors and luck is applied for only those who are ready for.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, <TR>as you expect naturally</TR>, the more people work hard, the more chances they have to succeed in life.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that person's characteristic is also important component in work place. Such personalities tend to represent their way to live life and most of supervisor are likely to be interested in such workers. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2009</TR>, workers' characteristics was more significant factor than others in promotion, taking up more than 70 percent of the final decisions. The staffs in the personal section looked at the applicants' personality such as doing their best, working hard, and feel more responsible for their work. Among such personalities, working hard was the most crucial component for one to be promoted.</EX> This implies that not only luck, working hard has a direct correlation with success in the future.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, people who has tremendous luck cannot succeed in life if they are not ready.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that with even if they can be promoted or appointed to better work place with such great luck. <TR>Later on</TR>, they are going to have the chance to be fired by superiors if they cannot prove their ability. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2008</TR>, there was the number of workes who be degraded due to inability after they got promoted with lucky situation. The researchers showd that they did not have enough ability to be entitiled for such position and they only used their luck.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> working hard is more safe and effective way to be successful in life.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, some people presume that barring luck, working hard is not enough for them to succeed in life. <TR>However</TR>, it is sufficiently possible for them to live a successful life when they are always working hard, waiting for their luck. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we ought not to underestimate the value of working hard.</CO>
column23: This essay has many problems, including an awkward thesis and frequent nonstandard grammar usage.

column1: 210&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Universities should provide the same level of funding to athletic departments as they provide to academic programs. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that students should concentrate on only studying and getting good grades in school. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I firmly believe that playing sports can be helpful for student to deal with their stress and develop a sense of responsibility. <TR>This is the reason why</TR> I recommend that universities have to promote investing in such departments.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, playing sports enables people to lower their stress level.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that playing sports can distract students from their worries and stress. This simple and quick escape from the reality may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2009</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of studnets in managing their academic pressure. Students in group A who spent four hours a week playing basketball were more satisfied with their school lives than those in group B who rarely engaged in such activities. <TR>Moreover</TR>, those in group B were involved in dangerous activities, such as smoking, drinking, and stealing to cope with their stress.</EX><TR>This implies that</TR> playing outdoor activities can be a safe and effective way to let out frustration and stress.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, moderate physical exercise allows students to enhance a sense of responsibility.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> most of team sports require many obligations, such as arriving at on time, feeling accountable for mistakes, and observing rules. Through the consequences arising from negligent actions, they can learn the importance of obligation. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my youngest brother used to be lazy and selfish. He has changed little by little after he enrolled in soccer club. He realized that his laziness could negatively affect teamwork and relationships with other members. <TR>Naturally</TR>, he became more punctual, played his part well, and even encouraged other members to do their best.</EX> This implies that playing sports is able to develop a sense of responsibility in students.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, some people presume that as for student, focusing on their studying is the most important matter for their future, underrating the value of outdoor exercises. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>I certainly support the idea that</TR> playing sports is as much important as studying in term of relieving stress and developing a sense of responsibility, eventually helping them to perform higher in school as well.</CO>
column23: This was a generally good essay. There was nothing really wrong, but the arguments could have been a bit stronger and more obviously connected to the issue of funding, and not just the issue of whether or not sports are beneficial to students.

column1: 211&The television has had a greater effect on people's lives than the telephones has.
column3:
<IN>Many people say that the television has had a greater effect on people's lives than the telephone has. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, telephone has affected our lives more than the television did for several reasons : telephone can be used in many different ways and telephone helps the globalization in a way.<TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, telephones can be used in many different ways, such as contacting other people or texting as well.</MI1> <SI1><TR>It is due to the fact that</TR> telephone is made to keep in touch with people easily. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, as it is portable, more and more people tend to use it in daily lives. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, television only functions in a way that gives the information. It cannot things more than delivering information and it is not portable unlike telephones.<EX> According to a survey done by the Seoul National University of Korea in 2010, people were asked whether they use the telephone more or watch television more in daily lives. More than half of them answered that they use the telephones more.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> the more use of telephones means that more it is related to people's lives.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, telephone is helpful to the globalization.</MI2> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> telephone can be used in any place at any time unlike the television. This function of the telephone has helped people to communicate others all over the world. People usually keep in touch with people using telephones, as it is enables people to talk to the person directly. <EX><TR>According to a research done by Seoul University of Korea in 2010</TR>, researchers found out what type of communication style has affected the people most. People answered that they used the Internet and telephones the most to communicate because they do not have to wait for long to contact others.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> telephone is being used quite frequently by people.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, <TR>although</TR> television has had great effect on people's lives, the effect of telephone cannot be underestimated. <TR>It is because</TR> telephone can be used in many ways and it also helped in globalization.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement takes a position, but the reasoning behind it is a bit vague. However, I felt that the distribution of transitional words and phrases in this essay was good.

column1: 212&How do movies of television influence people's behavior?
column3:
<IN>At that time when television first invented, one person said that "television is an idiot box, people will realize how it is undesirable."  <TR>Despite of his word</TR>, <TR>nowadays</TR>, people consider television and movie as one part of their life.  <TS>They affect people in many different way. I think expanding of movies and television programs have positive and negative effect.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>They give us many benefits.</MI1> <SI1>People can get information from television news and can read a today's trend in movies. If someone do not watch television or movie long time, he or she may become a out-fashioned person. <EX><TR>When I was highschool student</TR>, I could not watch television because I had to study all day long. I thought it is not important to me, but I realized it's importance later.  I could not talk with my friends because the topic of teenager's chat is usually dramas, tv stars and famous movie. If I had watched some TV program or movies, I could have talked with my friends about it.<EX> <TR>Plus</TR>, watching TV of movies are is good way to spend the leisure time. <SI?>They don't ask us expensive cost so everyone can enjoy them.</SI?> <SI?2><TR>Last but not least</TR>, they give people opportunities that they can experience some situations which is different from them.</SI?2> Through this activities people can learn different cultures, types of person and How they can deal with variable situations.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, there is negative effect too.</MI2> <SI2>Unless adult do not supervise their children, they can learn violence from TV programs or movies. Media can affect children's personality and character. <EX><TR>According to what I learned from psychology class</TR>, a child who frequently watched fear movie in his or her infancy is more aggressive than others.</EX></SI2> <SI?3><TR>Besides</TR>, TV and movies can addict people like drugs. If someone watch them too much, they may involved in the imaginary world in TV or movies. <TR>Then</TR>, they will not be able to distinguish the real world from imaginary society.</SI?3> <TR>Add</TR>, Media including TV and movies can steal our time for interacting among family members.</BO2>

<CO>I think there is nothings which have positive or negative effect only. Television and movies are not exception. <TR>If so</TR>, regulating the time for watching them and choose programs in selective manner are important to us. Adults should take care not only themselves but also their children. While we can control them, they will be nice tools for our happy life.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement here is incredibly weak and vague, not offering a real argument. Also, this student shows a lack of basic grammatical understanding, including conjugations of basic verbs like "to be."

column1: 213&Do you agree or disagree? The primary reason to get an education is to succeed financially.
column3:
<IN><TR>Personally</TR> I do not agree that the financial success is the ultimate goal of getting an education. If it were true, and if peopole pursue higher education solely  for financial success, this country of South Korea should have been full of millionaires because about 90 percent of teenagers enrol in high schools and more than 70 percent of koreans have bachelor degrees. <TR>Unfortunately</TR>, the reality is the opposite in most of the educated. The answer about the philosophical question of educatinal goal will vary depending on what you desire and where you place the value of priority.</IN> 

<BO1><MI1>There are some people who are longing for becoming an artist, designer, or poet.</MI1> They primarilly put their value on aesthetic development and want to be educated based on it ; moreover, they pursue working beyond material affluence after completing their studying. <SI1>Regardless of their income, they want to continue to satisfy their desires for the value on aesthetics, not money.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, there are other people who want to become a politician or leader.</MI2> <SI2>Their primary reasons to get an education is not to succeed financially, but to generally achieve broad approval from the rest of society. Instead of learning how to make money, they choose to study on politics or leadership. Their subsequent wealth may be a result  derived from the fantastic coincidence of their ideal and reality , not because they went after an education to succeed financially. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, neither educational institutions nor average people will think tha the primary reason to provide education or get an education is to succeed financially. There are merely more opportunities that the educated people can earn money in the social structure.</CO>
column23: The thesis is so vague that I don't know what the student feels is the purpose of education, other than that they disagree with the prompt. The lack of a clear position makes the rest of the essay suffer, with no real supporting evidence for whatever argument they wish to make.

column1: 214&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Young people enjoy life more than older people do. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people can think that young people enjoy their lives more than older people do, because they are literally young so they have more energy to have fun, and there are also a lot of things that young people can enjoy such as computer games and various kinds of outdoor activities. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, when we look at older people’s life more closely, we can find out that older people can enjoy their life more than young people do. <TR>This is because</TR> older people are more stable financially, and they are much wiser than young people.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, older people tend to be more stable in terms of financial issues.</MI1> <SI1>They already have been working and making money to maintain their lives. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, young people have difficult time to get jobs nowadays. The society is getting more competitive, so many young people become to encounter tough time after their graduation. They don’t have enough time to enjoy life, as they are busy developing themselves to get a job. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one of my cousin is trying to have a job after her graduation from university. She always gets up early and goes to the library to study English and the things about computer certificates, because she thinks it is necessary to get a nice job. She does not hang out with her friends. However, my parents travel to a lot of tourist attractions in country and have an enjoyable time with their friends. <TR>This is because</TR> they already made money for that and it makes them feel more relaxed and stable.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, older people are usually wiser than young people, as they experienced a real world more.</MI2> It makes older people can enjoy their life more than young people do. <SI2><TR>This is because</TR> they already went through a hard time in their life, and it makes them be able to take everything more easily. <TR>To be specific</TR>, if older people and young people face the same situation that gives them a difficult time, older people would be better to deal with it. <TR>Consequently</TR>, older people can be more comfortable and relaxed under hard circumstance, and it allows them to enjoy life. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I had a trouble with my colleague, my father advised me not to take it so seriously. He already underwent that kind of problem, so he knew what I had to do.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, older people can enjoy life more than young people do. Older people are apt to have enough money to enjoy their life, and they have practical wisdom for their enjoyable life as well. These are the critical elements of joyful life that young people don’t have.</CO>
column23: This student uses transitional words and phrases well. I also found their thesis to be good, though they could have connected their main ideas of each paragraph more obviously to the topic.

column1: 215&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Higher education should be available only to good students. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that based upon thought of equality, opportunity of education should be equal to everyone in spite of a doubt whether it is actually effective or not. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly support the idea that</TR> we had better give the intellectual chance to more potential students in terms of happiness and attendance rate.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, contrary to good students, higher education bothers poor students from living a happy-life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> most of them did not want to study advanced subjects even if intellectual knowledge tends to represent their power in society by showing their ability to know various things especially in academic fields. <TR>Thus</TR>, forcing them to study more only make them get stressed out by worrying about it. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2009</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of poor students in happiness index. Students in group A were required to take advanced classes and those in group B were limited to take basic courses during one month. The researchers showed that the level of happiness of the latter group was much higher than that of the former group. <TR>Moreover</TR>, those in group A had to constantly worry about finishing difficult assignments and reports. <TR>This implies that</TR> the higher education is better restricted to good students.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, forcing poor students to get higher education discourages them from attending every class.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> taking these difficult courses can be useless because the poor student are not ready to study and understand such courses. When they feel these courses is worthless, they are not likely to attend class. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2009</TR>, the attendance rate of the poor students who are forced to take advanced classes had decreased geometrically in direct proportion to the level of the courses. The contributing factor was the courses' difficulties in which they lose interests in studying them. This implies that as we expect easily, the higher education is not appropriate for the poor students.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, even if it looks like unequal unlike people's common idea, as for poor students, the higher level of classes are not adequate for them only to let them live a stress-filled life besides lowering attendance rate. In conclusion, good students should only provided with higher education.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay states a position but doesn't offer a full argument for that position. However, this student has quite good vocabulary and grammar command.

column1: 216&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? After graduating from high school. Students should take a year off to travel before going to university. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that traveling to other nations before going into universities can hamper concentrating on studying after coming back with a high degree of excitement. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> students might as well go to travel after finishing high schools since it can be helpful to relieve stress and improve a sense of responsibility. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, traveling after high school enables students to lower their stress level coming from pressure to pass exam to go to a university.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> taking a year off, traveling to various places, it can distract students from worries and stress. This simple escape from the reality may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by University of California at Los Angeles of the United States in 2009</TR>, there existed a huge difference between two groups of students who traveled or not in level of pressure. Students in group A took a year off and traveled to famous countries and those in group B did not travel and went straight into universities. The researchers showed that the former group of students were more satisfied with their college life and not easily stressed out than the latter group of students. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in group B could not concentrate on studying and they tried to hang out more than the students in group A. <TR>This implies that</TR> traveling before going into universities can be effective and safe way to stay out of trouble in college.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, going to numerous area after high school allows people to broaden their horizon.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> a journey to new place exposes them to many different worlds of life style, customs and culture. <TR>Through this experience</TR>, people can learn to embrace diversity. <TR>Moreover</TR>, this is especially important given the fact that modern society is becoming increasingly globalized. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my youngest sister used to narrow-minded which caused her to have fewer friends. She has changed little by little after having moved all over the globe because of our fathers' business. She realized that her narrow-mindedness could negatively affect her school life by delaying every step to survive, such as receiving tips related to schoolwork. <TR>Naturally</TR>, she became a social butterfly and conversation starter by showing interest in the school sports events and parties. This means that traveling is able to help students develop more diverse views.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, although taking a year off seems like a wasted of time and energy, it eventually help people to recharge energy by lowering stress level and became a person to have broadened views. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should not underestimate the value of traveling before going into university.</CO>
column23: This essay is excellent, with a clear thesis that is well supported and a strong grasp of English vocabulary and grammar.

column1: 217& If you could change one thing about your hometown, what you change?
column3:
<IN>If I could change one thing about my town, I would like to change parking system. <TS>My town have a lot of problem, but I think most important of them is severe parking problem. <TR>In my case</TR>, when I first got my drive license, It is so difficult to drive on way because of cars that parked on road. The proportion of people who have own car rise more and more, but parking area remaining the same. It makes a lot of problem. So we need effective solution to solve this problem. I will give you 2 suggestion the way we can solve parking problem.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, We have to increase parking area.</MI1> When company plan to build new buildings, they have to calculate how many people use that building at same time, and should make enough garage at their basement. I will ask the company following this rule. Because it is my rights. If they do not agree with this, I will make groups with my neighbor and boycott the company. We can give them a carrot too. If they make parking area more than they need, and allow people who live in my town using them freely, I will give them some advantage such as tax discount.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I will increase the fine of illegal parking.</MI2> In my town, the fine is only 50 thousand won which is  same approximately 500 US dollars. It is too cheap to prevent illegal parking. If I double it, more people do not try parking at inappropriate place such as edge of streets. If someone park on streets several times despite of expensive fine, I will cancel their drive license. Because they make other people irritate, the penalty is not heavy.</BO2>

<CO>We can give citizen both carrot and strick to solve that parking problem. But most important thing is our mind. We have to realize that if we take care other's comfortable life, then our life also being comfortable.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay is long and drawn-out, getting into irrelevant specifics without even clearly outlining the argument that will be made in the rest of the essay. Additionally, it is more of an action plan than an essay discussing an issue, and the student shows a clear lack of command of English grammar.

column1: 218&Do you agree or disagree? Before making a decision, it is important to find out if the decision will be popular with others.
column3:
<IN><TS>At a glance, it seems to be indecisive and weak-willed if someone tries to figure whether his or her decision will be popular with others before making it. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>on second thought</TR>, you will get to know that it is actually very wise to do so because one can have strong supports and get into the right way.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>One of the most significant reasons for considering whether the decision is popular is that it is easy to be supported by others.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, the decision based on popularity can get more responses and helps.<TR> In doing so</TR>, the posibility to accomplish it whatever is made may become high as well. <EX>For example</EX>, in case of making a decision about a gun control, if more people agree with a gun control, it is getting easier to pass the bill for prohibition of gun possesion can pass. </EX><TR>Therfore</TR>, it is important to consider whether the decision is popular.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason that it is important to make an agreeable decision is that</TR> it is most likely that the decision is right, and it can lead to majority's benefit.</MI2> <SI2>Getting support from more number of people can be related to having less prejudice; <TR>as a result</TR>, there may be more common senses and righteousness; <TR>Historically</TR>, adapting majority opinions stems from this grounds. Chief executive officer of a corporation or legislators in congress especially need to make dicisions necessarilly based on popular perspectives; <TR>accordingly</TR>, it can be said that they ultimately respect and reflect opinions of regular people. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, it is very crucial to make a decision depending on its popularity for the sake of getting more supports and clarifying rightness.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay takes a clear position on the prompt, but the arguments that it introduces are unclear.

column1: 219&Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than with a teacher. Others think that it is always better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>“Man is a social animal,” which means that we cannot live their life alone. People are living with others sometimes giving or receiving helps. <TR>However</TR>, some say that people can learn better without anybody’s help when they use their time efficiently. <TS><TR>I think that</TR> people can learn better with others, especially with a teacher, making someone follow righteous ways in his life.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a teacher has more experiences than a learner has.</MI1> <SI1>When a person plans his future, he should plan not just successful procedures for achieving the goal he set, but also predict the unsuspected failures to prevent his goal from being destructed. <TR>In this sense</TR>, people can acquire gemlike advice and indirect experiences from their teacher who already experiences these kinds of failures. The reason why people attend schools is in the same line for explaining this. If there is no teacher in the school, it cannot sustain the role of the school any longer with children missing their ways to learn. Advice from a teacher is as strong as a mother has an influence on their children in their lives. <TR>In the long term</TR>, they can save their time, sparing time for other valuable things.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, when people have a hard time, the existence of a teacher allows them relieve their stress.</MI2> It is important for a learner to keep their mind peaceful, even in hard time, or else the abilities to learn would be dramatically harmed. <SI2><TR>It is no doubt that</TR> every person can suffer from difficulties when they learn something. <TR>Therefore</TR>, where to get comforted is important. <EX><TR>When I learned playing the piano</TR>, <TR>from my experience</TR>, preparing a competition, I nearly gave up the competition because the level of the score I practiced was too challenging to play. <TR>However</TR>, with the help of my teacher, I could overcome the hard time. She applauded my behavior, even though my play was not good, and I felt comfortable while preparing the competition.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, we can get valuable advantages with a teacher who has more experiences and can be a spiritual friend, making us comfortable when we have hard time.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay is quite vague, even though it does take a position on the prompt. Also, the student strays from the topic, talking about some benefits that teachers offer in general rather than whether or not people learn better with teachers.

column1: 220&Teachers should not make their social and political view known to students in the classroom
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of controversies exist over whether teachers should make their social and political view known to students in the classroom. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> teachers should not show their social and political opinions, because I think teachers should be a mediator, not a pitchman, and becuase I think teachers should help students to establish their own social and political opinions.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, I believe that teachers should not express their social and political opinions because I think teachers should be the one who is most impartial in classes.</MI1> <SI1>Since social and political issues are very delicate and provoking subjects, it can easily bring up the arguments among students and bring them apart. And if teachers instill their social and political philosophies into students, there might happen into a big disputes between students. <TR>It's because</TR> I think the main ideas and philosophical opinions of the Democratic Party and the Republican party that provoke controversies between each other can never be settled because they both right and wrong.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Lastly</TR>, I think teachers should not propagate their opinion because I think that teachers should help students to establish their opinions about social and political issues.</MI2> <SI2>I think it's basically the same thing between showing teacher's own opinion about the social and political issues and brainwashing, because adolescent students are so susceptible to other's opinion, since they haven't lived long enough to established their adequate social and political opinion, and they don't have the criteria to distinguish right and wrong. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if they are exposured to teachers social and political opinion, students can turn into socially and politically biased person. And I think it's the teacher's job to keep them away from such situation.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I think teachers shouldn't show their own opinion regarding social and political issues because I think teachers should be impartial and mediator between students and because I think teachers should help students to establish their own social and political opinions, not instill his(or her) opinion. <TR>All in all</TR>, <TR>these are the reasons why I think</TR> teachers should not express their own social and political opinions. </CO>
column23: This essay starts with an excellent thesis, which offers good arguments upon which to base the rest of the essay. However, this essay suffers from a clear lack of support for those arguments.

column1: 221&It is better to watch serious movies that are designed to make you think than to watch movies that are primarily designed to amuse or entertain.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that is is always better to watch serious movies that are designed to make people think. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, it is better to watch movies that are primarily designed to amuse or entertain for several reasons : to live a healthy lives and to socialize with people easily.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, watching movies that are made to amuse or entertain helps people to live healthy lives.</MI1> <SI1>While watching the movie with happiness and laughter, people tend to forget about their worries and be distracted to think seriously about their problems. <TR>Therefore</TR>, by watching the movie, people are able to relieve stress and live a healthy life eventually. <EX>There was an experiment done by Seoul National University to see whether the mood of the movies affect people in different ways. They divided the groups into two, Group A watched a sad movie while the other watched a humorous movie. They did survey and health check up before and after watching the movie. The researchers came to a conclusion that those who watched a sad movie had some stress after watching as they were so into the story that they got to worry about the situation as well with the character in the movie. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those who watched the fun movies were able to relieve stress, showing a decrease in stress level. Researchers also found out from the survey that Group B people felt less worried and anxious after watching the movie. <TR>This implies that</TR> movies that made to amuse or entertain help people to live a healthy lives by relieving stress.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, movies that are designed to amuse and entertain helps people to socialize easily with other people.</MI2> <SI2>When people do something together, they get chances to be more friendly with each other having fun time laughing and entertaining movies will be helpful in this way even more. They got chances to spend time together watching and also got to talk about the movies. By sharing some thoughts about the same movie they watched, they will feel more connected and be close with one another more. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, there was a research done by Seoul University to find out if the types of movies affect people's behavior. They had two groups watching either sad or entertaining movies with new people. <TR>After finished watching the movie</TR>, those who watched the entertaining movie became friends easily, sharing and talking about the fun scenes in the movie. <TR>However</TR>, people who watched the sad movie were not easy to be friends as they were either busy hiding their feelings or because they were so into the movie that they needed some time to calm down again. <TR>This shows that</TR> when people are happy and in a good mood, they are more likely to open their mind and easily become friends.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, watching movies that are designed to amuse or entertain people is better because it helps people to live a healthy lives without stress and socialize with others well.</CO>
column23: This essay demonstrates a strong command of the English language. The argument is clear, transitional word usage is restricted to only where they are absolutely necessary, and the student supports his/her arguments well.

column1: 222&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor(boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3:
<IN>There are a plenty of qualities of a good supervisor. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I personally believe that</TR> there are the most three important qualities for him. Even though job situations can be very different, those three aspects are in common. Three important qualities are as follow.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a supervisor definitely needs the leadership.</MI1> <SI1>A supervisor or boss is a leader of a company or a department of the company. A supervisor leads workers to unify into one and sometimes let them get along fine with each other, because there are always some troubles in a group. <TR>Therefore</TR>, a supervisor has to have the quality to handle the dispute between co-workers and make them get along fine again. That is a capability that a supervisor has to have to lead a company with controlling workers.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> a good boss has to be fair.</MI2> When a worker has a mistake, he has to correct the worker as much as he did to the other worker who had done the similar mistake before. <TR>And then</TR>, workers can accept their fault reasonably. <SI2>If a boss treats some worker he prefers unfairly, the others would get complaint and finally they do not respect a supervisor and get in trouble. <TR>Also</TR>, a supervisor has to be a model for workers. When a supervisor respects rules and does his best during work, other workers also follow and portray him a good behavior.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, the most important quality, I think, is the pioneer split, because without that mind, there is no more development and even a company might become bankrupt.</MI3> Who is going to take care of whole workers in the company after all? Developing company is the existence of the jobs. <SI3>A boss is responsible to take care of workers, hence he has to develop a company with the pioneer split. <TR>Moreover</TR>, many people work for a company want to learn some specific skills from the company for their career, but if there is not any kind of enthusiastic thing, they would quiet the job and find better one.</SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> a supervisor has to have the three important qualities; a leadership, good behavior, and pioneer split. A supervisor is also responsible for a company or a department of the company with those capabilities to handle workers.</CO>
column23: The student uses some strange wording and phrasing, and their argument has no supporting examples.

column1: 223&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Having a broad understanding of many academic subjects is better than specializing in one particular field of study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people presume that having diverse information over several subjects is better way to succeed in life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> concentrating on one particular subject can give more possibility to be successful in the future because it can help get a good job and lower the chance of being sick.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, focusing on major courses can contributed to success in life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> when they spend most of their time on their major, they can develop their expertise. <TR>Moreover</TR>, as modern society is becoming increasingly specialized and competitive, today's job markets require job candidates with such qualities. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2009</TR>, the employment interview was the most important component in hiring practice, taking up more than 70 percent of the final calls. The interviewers tended to look at applicants' knowledge and skills, mostly related to specialty. <TR>This implies that</TR> specialization in one area can be effective and safe way for students to get a good job and succeed in life.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, pressure and stress stemming from studying several academic subjects at the same time can be deleterious to people's health conditions.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> concentrating one subject guarantees a stress-free life while taking various classes can stress students out by making them worry about how to study them. <TR>Moreover</TR>, such stress and pressure can be one of the main factors of disease through weakening the immune system. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by University of California at Los Angeles of the United States</TR>, a test on mice showed that life span was shortened when they regularly underwent a series of electric shocks. <TR>Interestingly</TR>, the researchers found a link between this and human beings who suffered from periodic stress. <TR>This implies that</TR> the high stress levels coming from dealing with many subjects can negatively affect the students' health condition.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, <TR>as I have described above</TR>, it is better for students to focus on one subjects because it can help them to be hired by good companies and stay healthy in life without severe stress. <TR>In conclusion</TR>, the value of focusing on one major subject must not be underestimated for these reasons.</CO>
column23: The thesis takes a position, but its arguments are a bit vague. However, the student does go on to give decent examples and supporting evidence to support those arguments.

column1: 224&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. The best way to learn about life is by listening to the advice of friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people presume that advice from their friends or family members is not more important in life than we expected because there are already other methods instead. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> there do not exist more effective way than getting advice from others to learn about life for two reasons : It can be helpful for their performance in school and suggest more possible solution for problems.<TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, advice coming from friends or family can teach students to learn to solve problems more wisely, making them think about their life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> having lived for a long time, they have already experienced many things such as rebellion, having to fit in and building a closer rapport with others. <TR>Thus</TR>, they have a bigger view on these matters and are able to provide more objective and satisfactory solutions. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>when I was in fifth grade</TR>, I had a huge misunderstanding that led to a fight with my best friend. <TR>Then</TR>, most friends were telling me not to speak to him first until he apologized to me first. <TR>However</TR>, my grandmother suggested that I mend things up by taking the initiative to apologize first. <TR>Finally</TR>, it turned out that it was a misunderstanding on my part and had I not spoken to him, we have never cleared the issue which could cost our relationships. <TR>This implies</TR> that such advice given by one of my family members is able to help solve problem more effectively.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, with advice of others, students can increase their academic performance in school by themselves.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> such advice can serve as one of the key motivators for students to perform higher and improve themselves. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2007</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in achievement. Students in group A were given advice from friends whenever they want and those in group B were restricted to get an advice a day. The researchers showed that the students in group A performed higher and spent more hours studying by 15 percent. <TR>However</TR>, compared to group A, the group B of students tended to doze off in class and lack focus on class materials resulting in lower grade in major subjects. <TR>This implies</TR> that getting advice from others let students realize their school life through enhancing their academic performance.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, <TR>contrary to others' thought that taking an advice is not that much crucial to learn about their life</TR>, it is one of the most significant component in learning life because through getting it, we can improve performance in school and solve problems more wisely. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should not underestimate its importance.</CO>
column23: The thesis has a clear argument, but it does not answer the prompt, talking about why taking advice is good rather than if it is the BEST way to learn about life. Also, this student severely overuses transitional words and phrases.

column1: 225&The fewer possessions you have, the happier you will be.
column3:
<IN>I have seen and heard a lot of statements from the books or lectures which argue that fewer possessions make people feel happy. <TR>However</TR>, I do not agree with this idea. Although more possessions do not bring people happiness, it is not true that fewer possessions bring happiness to people either. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I think certain level of possessions is necessary for people. <TR>This is because</TR> some level of possessions is necessary to handle extreme situations and this idea is not possible for common people. </TS></IN>

        <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, sufficient possessions help people to overcome the emegency situation.</TR> <SI1>In case of the possession, money, is especially necessary for people to afford the urgent event such as severe diseases or injuries. <TR>Especially</TR>, curing a disease costs so much that it requires people a fortune. It even bankrupt someone who affords that cost.They can utilize their financial possessions to cure themselves or others. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one of my friends whose mother was sick, could cure his mother thanks to his savings which he had been accumulated for a long time. <TR>Therefore</TR>, his mother could be cured. </EX></SI1></BO1>

         <BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the idea that fewer possessions can make people feel happy is only possible for religious people.</MI2> In terms of clergies or monks, they can make their livings without any possessions. <TR>This is because</TR> there are the system and supports. <SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, there are no systems or supports for common people to live without any belongings. <TR>As a result</TR>, they cannot live without any possessions. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, monks in a temple can make their livings by financial or physical supports from religious believers. <TR>Thus</TR> they can be happy with no possessions.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR> the idea that fewer possessions make people feel happy is not realizable.</BO2>

          <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the idea that fewer possessions make people be happy is not possible because some level of possessions are necessary to surmount hardships. <TR>In addition</TR>, the idea is not realistic other than clergies or monks who can be supported from their believers. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I do not agree with the argument.</CO>
column23: This student has a good argument with very thoughtful, well-supported ideas.

column1: 226&Because environmental issues are very complex are very complex, individuals can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>A common misconception is that individuals can do something about environmental issues on their own, despite the fact that there is complexity of it. <TS><TR>It is world nature that</TR> something must be achieved when an enormous of group combine. <TR>In my perspective</TR>, there is probably a resolution to overcome the problems, yet it would not have a profound effect on it.</TS></IN>

                 <BO1><MI1>Public transportation systems, as such as bus and subway, can be a solution about environmental issues.</MI1> <TR>To be specific</TR>, since majority of people in cutting-edge cities or pollution-filled cities have their own car, it contaminates air. The emission of gas from vehicles largely affects on air pollution. <EX><TR>According to the study conducted by Seoul University Environmental team</TR>, the unhealthy gas released from vehicles is a major cause of air pollution.</EX> It is a second to none among many causes. The air pollution has been worsening since car invented. Such problem can be alleviated, if people start to not use their own vehicle.</SI1></BO1>

                <BO2><MI2><TR> Alternatively</TR>, <TR>as previously mentioned</TR>, problems cannot be relieved, unless many people get together and take an action.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is duet the fact that</TR> there would not be any change if a person follows the action that provided from the study of university. <TR>Even though</TR>, some of people actually have been tried to relieve the problem and take the action, nothing change yet. The help of individual cannot be just a more than a little challenge. Let’s assume, there are thirty students who hate to study in a class. If a person tries to study hard for their school reputation, Will all rest of twenty nine students suddenly change their mind and study? No, they won’t. It is a same logic as the environmental issues.</SI2></BO2>

                <CO> <TR>Granted</TR>, the environmental issues might be relieved by taking public transportation. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, the problem will not be actually solved, unless a cluster of people try. </CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay doesn't seem to take a clear position, and it is very vague. Additionally, the student gets very off-topic, and they make a lot of grammatical errors.

column1: 227&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. The ability to speak well is more important than the ability to write well. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that speaking is not important as much as we expected in social life because in modern society, people depend less on speaking to communicate with others. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>opposed to such thought</TR>, speaking skill can be more crucial factors in life than writing one for two reasons : they can help make relationships and people are more dependent on speaking.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, good speaking ability enables people to make relationships properly.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> most of relationships are made through speaking rather than other ability such as writing. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2009</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of employees in dealing with problems. Employees who liked to speak was classifed as group A and those who liked to write was classified as group B. <TR>After one year later</TR>, the researchers tracked down the both groups and observed that the former group of employees has made good relationships among other coworkers. <TR>Besides</TR>, they can solve problems more wisely, get help easily from others, and did well in their work. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in group B had more problems between coworkers and they did not build a closer rapport with others.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> such conversation skill is one of the significant component in making good relationships.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, today's people are likely to less rely upon writing.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> speaking is more efficient way to deliever opinion. <TR>Moreover</TR>, as modern society is becoming increasingly competitive and busy, people tend to use cellular phones rather than send messages. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2010</TR>, the number of people who speak over phones was much higher than the number of those who send massege. <TR>Among subjectives</TR>, people using telephone conversation accounted for 80 percent of all. The contributing factor was that people eaily got stressed out by sending message and they were likely to speak because it is more convenient.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> speaking is more important than writing because it is more convienient way to communicate with others and more people is becoming dependent on speaking rather than writing.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, <TR>as I explained above</TR>, speaking is crucial in term of relationships between people and its dependence in today's society. <TR>Although</TR> most people underestimate speaking ability because everypeople can speak, we should do our best to enhance the ability to speak to others.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay makes an argument, but some of the supporting ideas behind it are a bit vague and could use clarification. Despite that, the student did use good examples to support those ideas.

column1: 228&Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of these situations do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that young adults should live with their parents even after they grow up if they cannot afford to live alone. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> young adults have to live by themselves as soon as possible for the following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, young adults can be independent when they live alone.</MI1> <SI1>Young adults can be more depending on their parents as much longer as they live with their parents. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I moved out from my home to live by myself when I graduated from high school. <TR>At that time</TR>, <TR>at first</TR>, it was so difficult and uncomfortable because I had to manage all the house chores such as cooking, laundry and cleaning.<TR> However</TR>, <TR>after for a while</TR>, I got used to them and could handle all kinds of stuff by myself. Besides housework, I could come to deal with almost all kinds of works well without asking my parents.</EX> <EX><TR>On the other hand</TR>, most of my friends who lived with family asked their parents to handle their works even when they could deal with by themselves.</EX> <TR>In retrospect</TR>, living alone was very helpful for me to grow myself up.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, young adults can experience the real life when they don't live with their family.</MI2> <SI2>Experience on the real life makes people to be mature. <EX><TR>Giving the same example used above</TR>, I could experience the things my parents do. <TR>For instance,</TR> I had to rent a room and pay various kinds of fees. <TR>Moreover</TR>, I had to have a part-time job to make up my rental fee and allowance. Those experiences made me think more about the real world, and it made me study harder. <TR>This is because</TR> I could feel that it is not easy to live well without much efforts in the real world.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I strongly prefer to live without families, since it makes young adults more independent so they can manage their own matters by themselves. <TR>Also</TR> young adults can experience the real world by living apart from their parents, and it makes them maturer.</CO>
column23: This essay starts with a weak thesis, but the ideas and corresponding supports used later are good. The student has overused transitional words and phrases.

column1: 229&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Successful people are willing to try new things and take risks. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that everyone can live a successful life as much as they hope. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> living a successful life is dependent upon whether people have enough will to achieve their goals. Such will to do unknown things is the most important component in living a honorable life and it give back rewards to people sufficiently.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, willing to try new things at risk is one of the characteristics of people to succeed in life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> almost all successful people are found to have such personality. The more people's personality enterprising, the more possibility that they tend to put in more effort, concentrate better on their task, and feel more responsible for their work. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2008</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in achievements. They divided students into two groups depeding on their characteristics. Students in group A had a high level of willpower to try innovative things and those in group B had no such characteristic, living in a peace. The researchers showed that the former group of students performed better in school and spent more hours studying by 25 percent. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they followed instructions well, submitted assignements on time, and participated actively in class discussion.</EX> <EX><TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in group B dozed off in class and lacked focus on class materials. <TR>Thus</TR>, grade of the students in group A was much higher than that in group B and hired by a good company.</EX> <TR>This impiles that</TR> people with willpower to achieve innovative things can live a successful life.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, achieving innovative things is able to reward people immensely for taking risks.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> because such new and unnoted things are likely to be avoided by people who loves trying common thing without doing at a risk, there is higher chance to earn money other than fields. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Jun Kim, one of my relatives, was scientist and inventor. He had spent most of time devised a apparatus which can heat water using solar energy instead of electric energy. It was so difficult that many other companies were reluctant to invest budget into such technology. <TR>However</TR>, he invented a solar energy and it was picked out one of the greatest national invention because it could save money and the environment. <TR>Finally</TR>, he eared a lof money and live a successful live now.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> doing new things that seem impossible is one of the ways for people to live a respectful and successful life.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, although people likes to think that everyone is capable of being successful in life and they all have potential to succeed. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>contrary to the expectation</TR>, I certainly support the idea that all successful people love to achieve new things, taking a risk because <TR>as I already described above</TR>, such characteristics is helpful in performing in school and making a lot of money.</CO>
column23: This student has a good vocabulary and gave good supporting evidence for their argument.

column1: 230&A teacher`s ability to relate well with students is more important than the ability to give knowledge.
column3:
<IN>There has been argument concerning whether it is more important for teachers to teach academic knowledge to students than to get together with them. <TS><TR>Although</TR> it is true that teachers should play a significant role to provide with how to study and develop their knowledge, I believe that it is more advantageous when teachers try to make students feel familiar and get close with them. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will present briefly two reasons supporting my idea.</TS></IN>

           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, teachers who are friendly with students can have more advantages to encourage students to study more hard and achieve much greater performances in their study.</MI1> <SI1>Once students feel they are intimate with their teachers, they can be motivated to study and concentrate on books they read. <TR>This is because</TR> they are able to feel less pressure and their stress can be relieved. These things are very important part of their student lives. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, I would have difficulty solving math problems. I did not know how to approach math problem and memorize important equations. <TR>And then</TR> while I was sad because of math, I met a very kind and nice math teacher. She didn`t blame and have any comment on my way of studying math. She always tried to fix my attitude on math and was willing to correct my solving process. That helped me a lot, so I could get very high scores in math when I took the college entrance exam.</EX></SI1></BO1>

           <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, getting together with teachers well, students can develop their social skills.</MI2> <SI2>It is very important to have that kind of ability and know how they behave in front of people, especially ones older than them. When they move out to the real world, it is good for them to learn and experience to have conversation with teachers and help them by getting familiar with. <EX><TR>According to recent survey conducted by BBC</TR>, it is very evident that students who had great relationship with their teachers are more likely to do their job very well in their workplace and have no trouble meeting their boss than counterparts who didn`t do. They are not used to that kind of relationship and do not know how to develop because they had not been intimate with their teachers. This study shows how important intimate relationship among students and teachers is.</EX></SI2></BO2>

          <CO> <TR>To sum up</TR>, teachers can encourage their students to show great academic achievements and make them more socialized people in their community when they try to have close relationship. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is essential part of teaching method and approach to relate students well and keep intimate relationship with them.</CO>
column23: This is a generally good essay, other than a thesis that lacks detail and clarity.

column1: 231&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are incapable of being satisfied with what they have; they always want what they don't have.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that people are capable of being satisfied with what they have.<TS><TR> However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, people are more likely to be unsatisfied with what they have because they tend to compare with those around them and to follow the fast changing trend. </TS></IN>

              <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, many people compare themselves with others.</MI1> At a school, workplace, or any circumstance where people see one another, they make comparisons. <SI1>This applies to women more than men. Since many women are interested in beauty, they look for things that make them more attractive such as fashion, perfume, or keeping their body in shpae. <TR>So</TR> when they go out and meet friends, they observe and compare what kind of clothing their friends wear, bags they carry, or shoes they put on.</SI1></BO1>

             <BO2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I once bought a purple-colored backpack. Because its brand was very famous, the backpack was pretty expensive. <TR>For a few days</TR>, I was so happy to have a new backpack and thrilled to show it to my friends. <TR>However</TR>, when I met friends, I couldn't show my backpack and brag out because the bags that friends wore look prettier and obviously more expensive. Because of comparing mine with the friends' bags, I wasn't able to be content and eventually coaxed mom to buy a same bag which friends had.</EX></BO2>

             <BO3><MI3><TR>On top of that</TR>, <TR>due to the fast changing trend</TR> people are not capable of being satisfied with what they have.</MI3> <SI3>There are abounds of luxuries that tempt us when we turn on the television. <EX>Celebrities in commercials always come up with clothes, and accessories that catch our attention. <TR>Not only that</TR>, people are also continually facing with recent electronics such as smart phones, laptop, and table PCs through masses of media.</EX> <TR>Thanks to the developing high-technology</TR>, more and more electronic devices are invented and consumers aspire to possess them. </SI3></BO3> 

            <BO4><EX><TR>To give you an example</TR>, I got an iPod five years ago. Since it was a present from my dad, as well as something I've always wanted to buy, I was so excited. <TR>At that time</TR>, my iPod was the newest version. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>within a month</TR>, it was no longer a newest product. An upgraded version of iPod was released, and it contained more functions and multiple cover colors compared with mine. The image of the new iPod made a deep impression in my mind and I began to feel greedy.</EX></BO4> 

         <CO> <TR>To summarize</TR>, people have a tendency to compare with other people and because of the rapidly changing trend they always want something more. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think people can hardly be satisfied with what they have and pursue what they don't possess.</CO>
column23: The format of this student's essay is incorrect, with examples placed in new paragraphs instead of within the relevant body paragraph. The student has good ideas, but I find the supports a bit lacking.

column1: 232& Whether physical exercise is more important for older people that for younger people.
column3:
<IN>There have been varying opinions whether physical exercise is more important for older people that for younger people. Some people argue that exercise is more necessary for younger people. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> exercise is essential for older people to keep in shape. <TR>This is because</TR> the more activity older people do, the more health they will get.</TS></IN>
