<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, it is very necessary for older people in modern times to exercise for healthy.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, for older people, exercise gives many advantages. There is a great example supporting this idea. <EX>My grandfather who exercise regularly during 10 years do not has any illness.</EX> <TR>so</TR>, exercise is very important for older people. <TR>And</TR> This acting leads to many profits.<TR> Also</TR> this profits have positive effects not just on oneself, but also many other matters such as formed good body shape and clean skin. <TR>For this reason</TR>, I think exercise is good for aged people.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, if older people do not exercising they would be able to have vitality life.</MI2> <SI2><EX>A recent survey from Statistic Commission in United Nations revealed an interesting result : 97 percent of those surveyed, people who do not exercise, think that their life was so boring. This high percentage provides a basis for the opinion already mentioned.</EX> <TR>To be specific</TR>, this outcome is because do not exercise in life brings out detrimental influences include solitude and gloomy. <TR>Through survey’s result and effects</TR>, we can know that exercise regularly is rational behavior for older people.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR> integrating the positive and the negative aspects mentioned above, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> physical exercise is more important for older people that for younger people.</CO>
column23: The thesis does not address the prompt- it instead talks about why exercise is important for older people, but doesn't discuss if exercise is more important for older people than for younger people. Also, this student needs a lot of work on vocabulary and grammar usage.

column1: 233&Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than with a teacher. Other think that it is always better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN><TS>Many people think that students would rather study on their own, because there are some disadvantages of learning from a teacher, such as time schedule, the level with other students, and so on. <TR>However</TR>, I think that to have a teacher is always best to learn. The reason why I think is as follow.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, teachers have been trained to teach students and also have a plenty of knowledge on their own fields.</MI1> <SI1>They can easily explain the tricky part that students usually encounter difficult and misunderstand. <EX><TR>Aside from that</TR>, what if you have a question when you study alone by a textbook, you would spend your precious time to search the internet or other books but it can not guarantee that the thing that you find out is correct. This is a part when students need the help of good teachers.</EX> <TR>Of course</TR>, a teacher can tell you the correct answers, and then you could understand it and move on to the next topic.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, some teacher or professor whom students learn form is also a writer of the textbook which we read and study about.</MI2> The topics or concepts in the book come from their brain, their knowledge. <SI2><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> the textbook is not completely involved in their everything that they know about, so that the textbook should be written and compressed shorter that that they know such as, background, behind-story and so on. <TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>when you learn from a teacher</TR>, you can get exact and complete knowledge. <TR>In addition</TR>, as a teacher tells the background or behind-story about what students learn, it will be able to drag their attention, so that it could be motivation to study about the topic.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, everyone may hold a different view on this issue. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>I absolutely support the prospective that</TR> a student has to learn from a teacher. There is nothing wrong with studying on your own, and a learner can always benefit from some quiet study. For the best possible learning, <TR>though</TR>, a good teacher is the biggest help you can have.</CO>
column23: The thesis takes a position but doesn't include any supporting arguments. Also, I feel that the student needs stronger examples, and that the student needs to improve his/her grammar a bit.

column1: 234&Do you agree or disagree? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activities as they give to their university libraries.
column3:
<IN>From the point of view of schools, it would be advantageous to invest more money in promoting sports activities since, <TR>as many of us know</TR>, various kinds of sports teams such as soccer, baseball, and hocky at schools play a significant role in publicizing the name of school. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I, as an average student's position, think that</TR> universities should invest more amount of money in their libraries to enhance their students' academic achievements. The specific reasons for my perspective are as follows.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, schools must not be a profit-oriented enterprise, but an educational institution.</MI1> <SI1>Universities hereby need to make sure that they will work more for providing a high quality of knowledge and fostering potential intellectuals. <TR>In order to achieve the education ideals</TR>, it is more important to invest their funds in improving libraries and securing professional instructors rather than spending on inducing athletes or promoting sports activities.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason</TR> that universities should spend more money on their libraries is that there alreay exist several sports-related schools specializing in training athletes and focucing on sports activities.</MI2> <EX><TR>In the case of South Korea</TR>, YONGIN university located in the suburbs of Seoul would be the most representive example of it. The university spend most of its funds on providing the students'sports activities and sports curriculums. The university's sports teams including Taekwondo are highly reputed all over the country. <TR>Therefore</TR>, a number of regular universities should need to hand over their desire for promoting sports activities to these sports-specializing colleges.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, universities, as educational institution, should focus their money and attention on improving academic facilities and environment  including libraries to cultivate the best members of future society, not training atheltes.</CO>
column23: This student displays a very strong command of English vocabulary and grammar. The only real downfall of this essay is that there is a shortage of actual examples and evidence to support the student's claims.

column1: 235&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Museums provide visitors to see many valuable things about the new places. <TS>By visiting museums, people can feel as if they are living in the places they are visiting. In Manhattan, New York, <TR>for example</TR>, Metropolitan Museum of Art provides valuable opportunities to learn and think not only about the American history, but also about that of the world. It is in the museums that we can learn about the history of new place and see important things the place has.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the reason why people visit museums when they travel to a new place is that people can learn about the history and culture of the places in a short time.</MI1> <SI1>A new place is so large that people cannot look around specifically in a short time, which takes a lot of time, making travelers tired. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if there is a museum that offers proper information, visitors should drop by there and get some important information that is useful to learn about their history, which helps them understand not just about their culture but also about their specific life styles and environment.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people go to museum with the purpose of seeing representative things in the new place.</MI2> <SI1><TR>In any country</TR>, the government accumulate the most valuable and important things into museums, investing a large amount of money to buy and maintain permanently. All people has to do is visit the museums with some money for admission, if needed, and just see the representative legacy of the new place. <EX>When I visited Washington DC last year, I went to Smithsonian Museum that represents Native American cultures who were living in the place a long time ago. I impressed about tools the Native American used, and understand their wisdom of surviving in the harsh environment, especially in a wild.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, by visiting museums in a new place, we can realize that even a small thing cannot exist without ancestors’ wisdom and their history. There is no better place where we can learn valuable things with a little time sparing than museums.</CO>
column23: The thesis is good, but it would have been better without the example that the student inserted into it. Despite that, the student has a fairly native-sounding flow, with strong vocabulary and grammar skills.

column1: 236&It is better to watch serious movies that are designed to make you think than to watch movies that are primarily designed to amuse or entertain.
column3:
<IN>Many people deem serious movies are not worth a while. <TS><TR>But I strongly believe that</TR> it is the serious movies that are more worth a one's while, not some flimsy entertaining films. <TR>This is because I think that</TR> by watching serious movies that cast questions make us more prudent person, and becuase producing serious movies are more demanding in a way that producers embody their philosophies in their movies.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I think that watching serious movies is more beneficial than watching entertainment movies, because of the philosophies that are embodied in films make us more prudent, more speculative, deeper person.</MI1> <SI1>And serious movies also provide chances to increase our thinking abilities. I think that elevated thinking abilities have become more important than ever. <TR>This is because</TR> modern day society demands us enhanced thinking ability by forcing us to take a part in a competition between co-workers or other colleagues. And most of people lack the chances to speculate about fundamental meanings of lives which eventually increases our intellectual capacities.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>And secondly</TR>, I think that serious movies are more valuable than some other entertaining films because producing serious movies demand very deep philosophical facilities.</MI2> <SI2><TR>And</TR> I think it is the philosophical subjects and themes that are incredibly hard to come up with, not some mundane and trivial themes like entertaining films.<TR> And another reason why</TR> I value serious movies is that serious movies last longer than entertaining films. <TR>This is because</TR> of the questions that are unresolved, will be imprinted on our minds. <TR>And</TR> these questions that were casted by watching serious movies last longer times in our mind than other entertaining films.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> it is better to watch serious movies than entertaining movies. <TR>This is because</TR> serious movies make us more thoughtful person, and because serious movies are harder to produce  than comedy films. <TR>In addition</TR>, serious movies last longer than entertainment films. <TR>These are the reasons why</TR> I think watching serious movies is more worth a while.</CO>
column23: This student provided no convincing examples to support his/her argument.

column1: 237&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantage and disadvantage of this new influence on your community.
column3:
<IN><TS>If a company want to build a large factory near my community I will oppose that factory. There are two reasons why I disagree with the company's wish.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Generally</TR>, Factories make a lot of pollutants.</MI1> <SI1>They expose dust, heavy metal and acidic chemical compound while they make some products. <EX><TR>To be more specific</TR>, dust is source of air pollution and sore throat. It also cause allergy response. <EX>In case of my mother, she had skin problem when my family lived near a large factory . <TR>However</TR>, she was healed completely after we move different place where is far from the industrial space.</EX> Heavy metals and acidic chemicals are also harmful to us. Water pollution and acidic rain will occur because of them. If factory is built in my community, we have to endure all of these problems.</SI1></BO1>
        
<BO2><MI2><TR>In recent</TR>, many community have a problem about the narrow area.</MI2> <SI2>Space is too small to support all citizens. People need space for living, working, exercising and resting, but there is no vacant space. Because the factory needs broad area, if we allow to build a factory in our community, we may lost space for other purpose. I will decrease quality of our life.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>Even though someone think that I am a person who persist "Not in my backyard (NIMBY) ", I will maintain negative point of view about this problem. Because I really want not only my family's happy life but also my neighborhood's qualified life.  </CO>
column23: This student did not address the prompt, which asked for a discussion of the disadvantages AND advantages, adequately. In addition, there is a lot of erroneous vocabulary and grammar usage in this essay.

column1: 238&The purpose of television should be for education, not for entertainment.
column3:
<IN>A common misconception is that the purpose of televisions is for education, not for entertainment. <TR>However</TR>, people have been using television for entertainment since it was invented. <TS><TR>In a same token</TR>, television cannot be an educational object because of its versatility.</IN>
               <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, television has many functions to play, hence distracting people from studying.</MI1> <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, <TR>as previously mentioned</TR>, the machine has been used for watching movie, drama, or show, so there are more functions that can entertain people. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people probably get interrupted just by intentionally or unintentionally clicking a button that changes channels on the remote control, thus it is not possible television can be used for education.</EX> <TR>On the contrary</TR>, unlike the machine, book does not have any things that stop their concentration. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>one day</TR>, I happened to take a course with the machine in my home somehow. <TR>However</TR>, I mistakenly stepped the remote control, and video I was watching suddenly shifted to the sport channel. It was a channel that I was interesting on. <TR>Consequently</TR>, I could even watch the class video three minutes.</EX> <TR>Had it not been for television</TR>, I would not retake this course again.</SI1></BO2>
              <CO> <TR>Granted</TR>, some people might think the purpose of television is for giving many educational programs. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, it is for entertainment, owing to versatility, interrupting from learning. </CO>
column23: The student clearly lacks a strong command of English vocabulary and grammar. The argument that they try to make is very weak and ill-supported.

column1: 239&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that television has destroyed communication among friends and family. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, TV provides people with various subjects to talk about, and it introduces a variety of entertainment that can be shared with friends.</TS></IN>
           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, there are many different subjects that TV covers with diverse genres of programs and channels. These themes are highly beneficial for the family to have a colorful conversation.</MI1> <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, every Sunday, my whole family gathers in the living room and watches the TV program “100-minute-debate”. <TR>After the broadcast discussion ends</TR>, we also conduct the debate with the subject that is already covered in the show. This custom in my house is extremely helpful for me to develop my speaking and writing skill, and have my own logic. <TR>Without the television</TR>, there might be no chance to have such a long communication with my family in a regular basis, even though all of the family members are busy for work or study.</EX></BO1>
          <BO2> <MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, there are a lot of TV programs which introduce a number of things to hang out and eat out. This definitely serves as a momentum for meeting friends. </MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I usually watch the program that recommends the delicious and beautiful â€“ but not well-known so far â€“ restaurants and cafes in Seoul, where I live in. <TR>Also</TR>, it became one of my favorite pastimes to visit those bistros or pubs with my intimate friends. <TR>In other words</TR>, thanks to the TV program, I and my friends meet twice a month to pay a visit to an introduced restaurant, and we usually have a long conversation in greater depth with the gorgeous dishes. <TR>Afterwards</TR>, we go to the theater to see a movie which is recommended by the TV program, “The Film of this Week”. Those kinds of activities allow us to nurture relationships deeper, because the more time we spend together, the stronger our friendship became.</EX></BO2>
           <CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, the TV programs suggests varied topics for the discussion, and brings out luxurious amenities that are good ways to spend time with friends and family. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I feel the communication can be more colorful by the television set.</CO>
column23: This student does not seem to use many supporting ideas, going straight from the main idea of each body paragraph to examples, but the lack of supporting ideas doesn't really harm the essay. The examples are personal and very relevant.

column1: 240&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that parents are the best teachers. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>although parents are highly influential model for their children</TR>, they are not the best. <TR>This is because</TR> it is more important for children to experience directly on their own to learn something, instead of just listening to their parents, and parents are too busy to care their children these days.</TS></IN>
           <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, just referring to the advice of parents or imitating them is not as beneficial as firsthand experience.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, children can be taught a lot by experiencing things firsthand with using all of their senses. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>since I was young</TR>, my father has always tried to teach me about the importance of acceptance of foreign cultures. I could not emphasize with his statement before I went on my journey alone. It was not until 2009, when I went to China alone, that I realized that his lesson was very imperative for living today’s world. I finally got to know how to accept and appreciate others with different backgrounds and interests by encountering many foreign friends. If I had not gone to China by myself, I could not be able to be enlightened with the remark of my dad.</EX></SI1></BO1>
           <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, <TR>nowadays</TR>, most of parents are busy for earning money to provide for family, and the trend that puts pressures to perform well in the companies makes parents not be able to spend much time with their children.</MI2> <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my parents have been working together for a living from the first time of marriage until now, so I was grown by my grandmother. <TR>Although</TR> my parents love me and my younger brother, they needed to be loyal to their work in order to keep our livelihoods.</EX> <EX><TR>Also</TR>, <TR>when I was 7 years old</TR>, IMF occurred unfortunately, so there was nearly no free time for them to teach us something. <TR>Despite the pitiful situation</TR>, my grandmother put all her effort and time into bringing us up. <TR>Until now</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> it is not exaggeration at all to say that my grandmother is the best teacher in my life.</EX></BO2>
           <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, experiential learning is far more helpful than just listening to or following parents, and modern parents do not have much time to provide their children with valuable life lessons. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I am against the idea that the best teacher is parents.</CO>
column23: This essay is strong, showing that the student has a large vocabulary and good grammar. The examples given to support the argument are nice.

column1: 241&Cars have had a greater effect on society than planes have.
column3:
<IN>A lot of controversy exists over whether if cars is more have more effect or is planes have. <TS><TR>But I strongly believe that</TR> cars have more effect on society qualitatively, <TR>and this is because</TR> cars are most prevalent transportation in the world, and because using airport sometimes really annoying and there are places where planes can't access and in planes, we have to be quiet, not to annoy another passenger.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, I think cars have affected our society, because people on almost every country drive or ride cars every day.</MI1> <SI1><TR>What I want to say is that</TR>, cars are more prevalent, and it is already grown to us convenient commodities of our everyday routine. But planes, we don't use planes as frequently as we uses our cars. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, we ride cars almost every day when commuting to work, or go for a ride with friends. <TR>For example</TR>, my experience that me and my friends took a road trip to another city. It is a great memory and using cars is currently affecting human societys even now, because no matter how trivial the use of cars is, we use it every day.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>And secondly</TR>, because of trivial works and procedures we have to take care of, I feel reluctant to use planes.</MI2> <SI2>All the visa issues and paperworks to be taken care of, and issuing passport is just so tiresome. <TR>And furthermore</TR>, planes only go to big cities even after we took care of all the paperwork. <TR>What I mean is that</TR> if we want to go to rural areas, it is better to use cars instead of using planes and <TR>I think it is more effective</TR> to ride car to build up good memories. <EX><TR>Wor example</TR>, we use planes only for a vacation or business trip, but using plane itself cannot provide any good memories because we cannot have a chat or play games with friends or families.</EX></SI2></BO2>  

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> cars have greater effect on our society due to the following reason. <TR>First</TR>, we use cars from everyday basis and second reason is that paperworks and planes have accessibility only to big cities and riding planes don't provide us good memories.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay is a bit drawn-out and rambling, but it presents a clear argument. Overall, the essay is very average, and it strays away from the question that the prompt asks at times.

column1: 242&It is important to have rules about the types of clothing people are allowed to wear to work and school.
column3:
<IN>There has been heated debate about regulation with dress code at work and school. Some people may believe that such rules are not necessary while others deem otherwise. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> the existence of costume regulation at school and work is crucial. This is not only because people will be more tensed and can focus better on their work, but also because they can save times choosing what wear day to day. <TR>In this regard</TR> I agree with the statement above.</TS></IN>

        <BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason for my opinion is that</TR> staffs and students can better concentrate on their assigned work.</MI1> <SI1>Though allowing comfortable attire can enable individuals to feel more relaxed, this actually can deter people from being tensed. People tend to exert their full concentration when they are tensed and pressured compare to times when they are relieved. <EX><TR>T0 be more specific</TR>, my uncle who is running small business with two other employees told me that he requires his staffs to be in their business attire. <TR>This is because</TR> the sales of the products have increased as his employees were more tensed as they were wearing business attire. My uncle’s example illustrates that dress code is favorable for people to concentrate.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason for my opinion is that</TR> wearing uniform or business attire can save time.</MI2> <SI2>In this heavily competitive society, individuals have to do several stuffs in order to overcome other colleagues. This is only possible by cutting down times spent on unnecessary things. <EX><TR>To be more specific</TR>, according to the study done by Oxford University, prestigious private high schools which require students to wear uniform are more likely to enter good university compare to public schools which does not regulate with what costume students wear. It was shown that students tend to waste a lot of time concerning what to wear before going to start or the night before. Students wearing uniform either had breakfast or had in-depth sleep which is definitely favorable for students.</EX></SI2> Like mentioned in this example,</BO2>

<CO><TR>Subsequent to mulling over this query</TR>, the regulation against students and employees for wearing certain cloth is essential. Comfortable clothes can lead individuals to feel too relaxed which can disturb them from focusing on the work. <TR>In addition</TR>, choosing what to wear is time consuming. For these reasons I agree with the given statement</CO>
column23: This student struggles with grammar and vocabulary choices in some spots, and their phrasing and flow is strange and even a bit stilted.

column1: 243&Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than with a teacher. Others think that it is always better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that they are able to learn better by themselves than with a teacher. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, learning with teacher is much better than studying alone because teachers have more information and experience <TR>therefore</TR> they can help student to learn in-depth knowledge and interaction with teacher make student to become more social figure.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Fist of all</TR>, teachers have valuable information and they are expert to give knowledge to others.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, we can learn more in-depth knowledge and more sophisticated structure of mechanism about academy thesis. <TR>When we study alone</TR>, there must be some difficult questions which cannot be solved or complex concepts hard to understand. <TR>However</TR>, with teachers, we can have opportunity to understand the hard problems because they give numerous advice or help to figure them out. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I firstly entered to high school student, I studied alone. <TR>However</TR>, my first score in math is 48 and it was very poor marks.  <TR>After the shock results</TR>, I always followed math teacher and questioned every day about problems which i couldn't understand. <TR>Thankfully</TR>, he kindly accounted for the solutions. <TR>As a result</TR>, my math score was raised to 84 point. <TR>This case eminently shows how</TR> teachers play important role in helping learning process.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, interaction with teacher help student to build up knowledge effectively.</MI2> <SI2>Students usually build up their own view by sharing idea, debating or having conversation with teachers. If a student studies alone, he would be dogmatic. <TR>In this sense</TR>, interpersonal activities are required to student in learning process. <EX><TR>According to the recent research of Seoul National University</TR>, there is significant gap between two subjective groups. Group A is make up by students who study alone. Group B is required to share ideas and debate each other when they study. <TR>After a few days</TR>, both groups tested several academic test and the average score of Group B is considerably higher than Group A. <TR>This research have shown that</TR> interaction between other people such as teachers help student to learn more than study alone.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Overall</TR>, we can learn better with teacher than study alone because social interaction with teacher help student to learn more effectively and they can give in-depth knowledge. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> learning with teacher is much better than learning by oneself.</CO>
column23: This is a generally good essay, but the student could use more work on grammar.

column1: 244&Drivers should be charged for congestion when they drive in areas with heavy traffic. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>People who have a car would feel the same frustration these days when they drive their car. Because too many cars on the road, congestion problems are ordinary phenomenon and it is not easy to solve the problem. <TS>Some people try to solve the problem by charging fees to heavy traffic, but many people oppose the opinion. <TR>However</TR>, I think this is actually one of the best solutions based on two reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Price differentiation is one of the efficient ways to solve the congestion problem.</MI1> <SI1>If there is high demand and low supply, it is ordinary that the price go higher than before. This is natural situation in nations which are based on capitalism. <EX><TR>As an example</TR>, movie tickets in weekend are more expensive than those of weekdays because more people want to watch movies.</EX> <EX><TR>Another example</TR> is the price of hotel. Even if people stay the same night, the price of rooms is different based on the location of rooms; rooms with better scenery charges higher than ordinary rooms. <TR>Likewise</TR>, charging higher price to something that is more popular than others is not reasonable. <TR>In this manner</TR>, charging with higher congestion to drivers is surely reasonable decision.</EX> As the price goes higher fewer drivers would drive the area with heavy traffic, reducing the traffic problem.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, based on the revenue that drivers paid due to the congestion, governments can invest to intrastructure for solving traffic problems.</MI2> <SI2>Since governments have to distribute their budgets to many kinds of problems, using much money to enhance the heavy traffic problem would not be easy. If governments can charge for congestion, they can not only reduce the traffic problems but also gain fess. Since these fees are gather by drivers, there is no reason to invest the money to other problems except the congestion problem. Drivers who paid for congestion can easily understand if the money they paid is used for improvement of traffic problems. <TR>Therefore</TR>, charging congestion fees to drivers would be a good way to both reduce the traffic problem and earn money for investment to the traffic problem.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>Heavy traffic problem is not easy to solve, but there may exists a way to reduce it. Pricing to drivers is one of them. It can reduce the traffic based on the theory of supply and demand, and the money that is earned by the fees can be used to improve the traffic condition, which can clearly enhance the traffic problem.</CO>
column23: This student uses good examples to support his/her argument. Also, their grammar is very strong.

column1: 245&It is much easier to achieve success today without the help from one's family than it was in the past.
column3:
<IN>An ongoing debate over whether achieving success without the help of one’s family today is much easier than in the past. Some people believe that one’s success is still dependent on one’s family as one should be supported by one’s family if one accomplishes success. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>contrary to the opinion</TR>, I maintain that people are better able to success by themselves when compared people do in the past. <TR>This is largely because</TR> developed technology enables people to do their task efficiently. <TR>Moreover</TR> coworkers have more influence on one’s success today instead.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, with the help of technology, people can achieve success without the help from their family today.</MI1> <SI1>Advance in technology give people greater opportunities to do their task efficiently and in the short period of time. This efficiency allows individuals to get the chance of success. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in the past</TR>, most people engaged in agriculture that needs many labors. So they ask their family to help their task. <TR>In contrast</TR>, <TR>in the present</TR>, people’s work occurred in the Internet. So they use the Internet and solve their work load with ease and fast.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, instead of family current people are affected by coworker as far as success is concerned.</MI2> <SI2><TR>These days</TR>, there are great amount of work in work place, which people spend their most time getting along with their coworkers. And they provide one another with strategy of success and useful information. So they keep each other moving forward their success. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by a team of researchers at Harvard University</TR>, 80% of the responded workers reported the importance of their coworkers related to their success. <TR>As a study shows</TR>, coworkers have more impacted on one’s success.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, is much easier to achieve success today without the help from one’s family than it was in the past on the grounds that with the help of technology, people do their task easily and efficiently and the existence of coworkers is more influential in one’s success presently.</CO>
column23: Despite a few grammatical errors, this is a strong essay with a good argument and supports.

column1: 246&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which do you prefer?
column3:
<IN>Immigrants and foreign students should have to decide whether to follow new customs or keep their ones in their new countries. Both ways will offer important but different experiences for them. <TS><TR>In this essay</TR>, I am going to compare the advantages between when you follow new customs and when you keep your own customs in the new country.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, when you decide to follow the customs of the new country, the biggest benefit is an easy adaptation to new environment.</MI1> <EX>You will be able to quickly fit in the new surroundings; <TR>particularly</TR>, it will be getting much easier to make friends and get along well with the local people.</EX> <EX>Another huge benefit is that you will less suffer from conflicts caused by different ideas  and easily recover from cultural shocks.</EX> <EX><TR>A final point</TR> that comes with following the new customs is language acquisition. If you follow the new customs, it would be much faster to master new languages and understand of local cultures by having a conversation with new friends. It will also boost your understanding of the new social backgrounds and cultures.</EX></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, there are also significant benefits to keeping your mother-land's customs when living in the new country.</MI2> <EX>One of the most important advantages is that you can preserve a sense of identity.</EX> <EX><TR>In addition</TR>, you will not forget your mother language and your original authentic cultures.</EX> <EX><TR>Finally</TR>, by constantly sharing the same cultural context with family members, you will be able to continue to keep up a close relationship with your family, friends, and relatives as well.</EX></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, there are several advantages of both choices. <TR>Given all the factors aforementioned</TR>, I think that living by following the new customs is a better option than maintaining yours when you live in another country .  The benefits of helping a language acquirement, reducing cultural shocks, and making friends far outweigh the advantages of choice when keeping my own custom.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay is very weak, as it simply restates the prompt instead of giving insight into the student's opinions on the issue. Also, the student doesn't develop an argument later or even really address the prompt, simply listing benefits to each option and not really comparing the two,

column1: 247&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Although many people, especially when they retire, tend to prefer to live in a small town, I strongly prefer to live in a big city. <TS>There are a lot of merits for living in a big city, but the biggest merits for me are like below.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, there are lots of opportunities to enjoy cultural events.</MI1> I really like to listening to music and going to see some art exhibitons. <SI1><EX><TR>However</TR>, If I live in a small town that is far from a city, I cannot go to concerts of popular musicians, and don't have an enough chance to see great exhibitions. <TR>This is because</TR> there are less people who are eager to see those kinds of events and less spaces where are good enough for those.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion</TR>, a big city is much better for education if I have children.</MI2> <EX><TR>According to a recent research which was conducted by a well-known company in Korea</TR>, the most important reason for living in a big city is a good environment of education. <TR>This is because</TR> there are many good schools and the other educational institutes in a big city so that their children can get better education.</EX> The society is getting more competitive, so many people are required to be more competent to succeed. The education of good quality from one's childhood can allow him or her to develop their ability more easily.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I definitely prefer to live in a big city to a small town as a big city has a lot of advantages. I can enjoy various cultural events such as concerts and exhibitions. <TR>Also</TR> there are more chances to get better education to succeed comparing to a small town.<CO>
column23: This student starts with a weak, unspecific thesis, but later introduces some good ideas and arguments. They should work on fixing some of their awkward phrasing.

column1: 248&It is important to know events around the world, even if they are not affect our life.
column3:
<IN>There have been varying opinions whether it is important to know events around the world, even if they are not affect our life. Some people argue that we do not have to know events around the world. <TR>However</TR>, I have a different idea. <TS><TR>I believe that</TR> we should know events happening around the world. <TR>This is because</TR>, the more information we have, the more we will get.</IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, it is helpful for modern people to know events in the world.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, if we know events in the world well, we could make productive activities in society. <TR>Also</TR>, knowing the events has many benefits. And this benefit has positive effect not just on oneself, but also on many other matters such as solved personal problems and socialistic problems.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR> if we do not know happening in the world, we would not be able to help each other.</MI2> <SI2><TR>putting it differently</TR>, without information for world events, we can make egoism in our society. <EX>A recent survey from Statistics Commisson in United Nations revealed an interesting result. 96 percent of those surveyed, having a few information about world events people, acting more selfish and individualistic. This high percentage provides a basis for opinion mentioned already. This is outcome is because do not know information about the world brings out many detrimental influences include makes egoism and leads to lack of interest in society.</EX> <TR>Through survey’s result and effects</TR>, we can know that knowing information about the world is rational behavior.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude integrating the negative and positive aspects mentioned above</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> it is important to know events around the world, even if they are not affect our life.</CO>
column23: This student doesn't make a good argument (and what little argument they make is poorly/hardly supported). Also, there are many sentences that are so malformed they are confusing.

column1: 249&Universities and high schools should teach students about specific careers and field instead of general subjects.
column3:
<IN>It has been said that students should focus more the general education in the school. <TS><TR>Although</TR> such an argument has some merits, <TR>I believe that</TR> students benefit more by studying specific careers and fields than by studying general subjects. <TR>The reason behind this is that</TR> specific study enables to students more concentrate on studying. <TR>Additionally</TR>, it helps student better prepare to succeed.<TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, students are more likely to concentrate on studying the specific careers and fields.</MI1> <SI1>It is common that people become more active in learning and feel more responsibility when they think it is important in their lives. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, students easily get bored when they are forced to study general subjects which are not directly related to them. <EX><TR>According to the report released from the National Human Development Institute</TR>, people were surveyed about which makes them intrigue to study most at schooldays. More than any other several answers, subjects related to their future career came out on top for the majority of survey respondents. <TR>It is also mentioned that</TR> even though they acknowledge that general subject is indispensable for graduation, they studied specific vocational subjects more.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, specific classes for careers and fields can help to success in the future.</MI2> <SI2>Through these trainings at school, not only have students gotten ready to be a professional for a long time, but also they can hone their particular skills that are not able to learn in the society. <TR>Compared to such students</TR>, those who have studied only general subjects at school days cannot defeat over them in the society. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my sister who wanted to be a famous cook decided to go to the school that had special classes for being a chef. She was exposed to the real implements being used by professional cook and able to learn directly from world-famous chefs. Without this special experience and knowledge, she would not have been such a popular master chef for korean foods for now.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, <TR>I have no doubt that</TR> university and high schools inquire students to learn specific careers and fields before their graduations. <TR>This is because</TR> special learning for career can make students more focus on their learning. <TR>What's more</TR>, this helps students to obtain their successful careers in the future.</CO>
column23: This student's essay has a good argument, with equally good supporting evidence and examples.

column1: 250&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live?
column3:
<IN><TR>It is clear that</TR> preparing for food has become easier and faster than ever. <TR>However</TR>, it remains mixed questions whether the easier process of cooking has improved our lives. <TS><TR>In my view</TR>, it has brought two different effects: making our lives more convenient and threatening our health. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I am going to present how it changed our lives positively and how it affected our health negatively.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, <TR>without doubt</TR> it has been easier to prepare for our meal.</MI1> <TR>This is because</TR> most of working in the kitchen is done by convenient appliences; <EX><TR>for example</TR>, previously people had to boil rice on the stove before eating it. This process took much effort and time. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>nowaday</TR> a rice-cooker, which automatically cooks raw rice for itself in a moment, replaced our hand working.</EX>  <EX><TR>Moreover</TR>, there are plenty of alternatives for cooked food such as frozen vegetables, which are already washed and ready for being consummed. This easier step certainly improved the way we live by allowing to have more leisure time with reduced the amount of time we spend preparing for dinner. </EX></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, the improvement of preparing for food at a quick and easy style has, <TR>at the same time</TR>,led to a serious danger to our our health.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Above all things</TR>, it caused serious obisity. More people are getting overweight. <TR>This is not because people do not exercise</TR> with saved time from cooking in the kitchen, but because most of the food that is cooked with easier processes generally contain high calories and fat additives. Food easy to cook and eat is increasingly deteriorating our health.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, food has become easier to prepare but it has resulted in both effects: positively in the way we live and negatively in our health.Now we should be carefully aware of the benefits and drawbacks.</CO>
column23: This student has fairly good vocabulary and grammar, but part of his/her argument- specifically, BO1, was a restatement of the beginning of the prompt and lacked and argument.

column1: 251&Young people today are less dependent on their parents than young people were in the past.
column3:
<IN>Some people argue that young people today are less dependent on their parents than the past. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, it should not be allowed. <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I do not agree with this view. There are many arguments to support my position, but the two main reasons are stated and explained in detail below.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Most importantly</TR>, parents today have a greater influence on their children than they did the past.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is because</TR>, <TR>recently</TR>, parents can help children to develop their talents by observing them close at hand. <TR>Today</TR>, young people lead highly scheduled lives as the world becomes more competitive and fast-paced than ever. <TR>As a result</TR>, they can miss chances to stumble on the fields they actually desire to study. This explains the need for parents’ involvement in honing children’s talents and potential that might have been buried for many years. <EX><TR>Referring to a study conducted by Stanford University</TR>, experts now argue that students who have close connection with their parents not only choose the correct path at an early age but also develop their true potential holistically.<TR> Actually</TR>, most surveyed respondents stated that they might have wasted much time if it had not been for parents’ counseling and assistance during their early years.</EX></SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, nowadays, parents’ influence on young people is become more important than ever.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> parents can guide today’s children to become model citizens by teaching important life lessons.<TR> Generally</TR>, students are immature and fallible day by day, and at such time, parents must teach them societal values and thus lend a helping hand in directing them to become useful members of society. <TR>Thus</TR>, parents play a significant role in children’s growth today. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, young students may feel tempted to succumb to drugs, especially these days where students can easily get in touch with it. Since they lack enough experience, they are likely to consider following the wrong path. <TR>However</TR>, if young people ask for the help of their parents, they can learn how to fix their moral standards and match the societal values they learned about to real-life circumstances. <TR>Through such guidance</TR>, young people can resist the temptation of taking drugs and thus grow up as good citizens.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>Due to these reason</TR>, my argument is worthy of being supported regardless of its logical flaws. <TR>Indeed</TR>, the role of older people such as parents, teachers should not be overlooked, but rather be highly regarded over time.</CO>
column23: This student's main ideas of the two body paragraphs are practically identical, and neither is convincingly supported.

column1: 252&The purpose of television should be for education, not for entertainment.
column3:
<IN>A lot of controversy exists over whether the purpose of television should only be for education, nor for entertainment. <TS><TR>But I believe that</TR> it is wrong to discriminate between educational programs and entertainment programs, because I think that every genres of TV program has it's own special values and because it doesn't necessarily mean that one can not learn lesson from entertainment programs.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> every genres of TV programs has it's own intrinsic values, and therefore it is wrong to diminish another genres besides education programs.</MI1> <SI1>Because laughing and having fun watching entertainment programs doesn't mean it is less valuable than education program. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Let's assume that the world without entertainment programs, but only education programs.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2>People will be starting to lose laughters and will be getting more depressed and getting more serious and serious. <TR>And furthermore</TR>, people will lose meanings of their life.  Laughter is essential part of life which makes us more relax. If we can't relax, we will go crazy. <TR>I believe</TR> laughter can make you happy.</BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Secondly</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> whether one can learn anything from education programs or entertainment programs depends on one himself, not just some TV programs.</MI3> <EX><TR>This is because</TR> my dream is to be an comedy program producer, and when I watch famous entertainment program for example, 'Muhan Dojeon', it's like I'm studying while I'm watching entertainment programs. <TR>What I mean is</TR>, education programs and entertainment programs is inseparable to me. When I watch 'Muhan Dojeon' I simultaneously analyzing the structure of the narrative and and mechanisms that induce laughing, what makes it so funny. And after I analyzing it, I go to my study and document every impression I made while I'm watching 'Muhan Dojeon'. <TR>Therefore</TR> I can say watching entertainment programs is a part of studying, and helping me to become a comedy program producer.</EX></BO3> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> it is not right to make distinctions between education programs and entertainment program because I think every genre of TV program is valuable and also I learn valuable lessons from entertainment programs. </CO>
column23: This student's essay is poorly formatted, with evidence and examples for MI1 appearing in BO2.

column1: 253&The best way to relax and reduce stress is by spending some time alone.
column3:
<IN><TR>These days</TR>, the number of study on how to deal with stress has been increasing. An ongoing debate exists on whether spending time alone is the best way to relax and reduce stress or not. <TS><TR>Regarding this controversial issue</TR>, <TR>I strongly support that</TR> spending time with others is more desirable way to cope with stress than staying alone. <TR>The reason behind this is that</TR> teachers can help us to reduce stress. <TR>Additionally</TR>, people can have happier lives spending time with friends and thus the stress become reduced.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, teachers help us to relax and reduce stress so that we are more likely to relax when spending time with teachers.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is because</TR> most students are so immature that they might not be able to find the way to overcome hardships or problems, the cause of their stress. The only thing students can do is just to sigh and regret their wrong doings, which make it more difficult to relax and resolve the problem. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, teachers who have more insights into life and watch students carefully can be of great help, because they can motivate students to fix the problems and help them to be relaxed and comfortable. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was in the high school, I had a friend who was in trouble because of other friends' bulling at school. As he could not find the way, he just felt stressed from others' offensive behaviors. <TR>However</TR>, my teacher treated the measure behind him and helped him to feel confidence and comfortable to spend his time in the classroom. If he had carried on his problems and worriness alone, he could not have overcome his stress.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Further</TR>, the time on spending with friends is more exhilarating.</MI2> <SI2>Some people may argue that they had better go home and relax by themselves. <TR>However</TR>, soon after they become alone, they cannot bear this tedious situation and gain more stress with their lonely emotions. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, they pack together with friends and talk to each other, which reduce tension and help to reduce stress. <EX><TR>According to the report released by the National Psychology Institute of Korea</TR>, people are more likely to feel depress when they are alone than when they are surrounded with people. <TR>Interestingly</TR>, the report suggests that speaking out and laugh with others is recommended to relax and reduce stress. <TR>Consequently</TR>, a happy time with friends is the most effective way to deal with stress.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, <TR>I have doubt that</TR> spending time with others is better off to relax and reduce stress rather than spending time alone. <TR>This is because</TR> people are given direct solutions to release stress by spending with teachers. <TR>What's more</TR>, people can release stress more with spending fun time with friends.<TR> All in all</TR>, the influence of people around us should be not overlooked when we strive to find the way to keep our mind healthy.</CO>
column23: This student makes some awkward vocabulary choices, but (s)he has a good argument that is well-supported.

column1: 254&Choose another technological innovation that is important.(Advances in transportation and communication like the airplane and the telephone have changed the way that nations interact with each other in a global society).
column3:
<IN><TR>Up until now</TR>, there have been a number of technological innovations such as cars and televisions that have made a difference in our lives. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>from my perspective</TR>, computers are the most innovative technology contributing to change in people's lives. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I am going to present two types of changes that computers have brought to us profoundly.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, computers have drastically changed the way we communicate each other.</MI1> <EX><TR>Only ten years ago</TR>, people interacted with one another by using wire telephone and exchanging letters. <TR>However</TR>, today we communicate via internet video telephone, looking at faces.</EX> <EX><TR>Besides</TR>, people use emails to immetiately send messages  instead of sending hand-written letters.</EX> <TR>As time goes by,</TR> there are very few people who go to the post office for taking stamps and mails.</BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, computers have changed the way we work and transact mutually.</MI2> <EX>People previously had to go to the bank to pay utility bills; <TR>however</TR>, now we do not need to go to the bank because we can use internet-banking, which allows to pay bills conveniently by automatic withdrawl system.</EX> <EX><TR>Also</TR>, people do not  get around stores or malls to purchase necessities because online shopping  is available at any time and anywhere and cheaper. </EX></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, there are several changes that computers have affected our lives. The most tremendous effects are in the ways of our communication and transaction.</CO>
column23: I feel that this student could try to use a more extensive vocabulary. They do, however, give decent supports for their argument.

column1: 255&Television advertisement directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.
column3:
<IN>Many studies have shown that television advertising affects people's behavior more than we expect. An ongoing debate exists on whether television advertising especially to children under the age of five should be allowed or not. <TS><TR>Regarding this controversial issue</TR>, <TR>I strongly support that</TR> television advertisement should be prohibited, if it directed toward children under the age of five. <TR>The reason behind this is that</TR> television advertising can put children in dangerous situation. <TR>Additionally</TR>, television advertisement makes children and parents waste the money.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, television advertisement can lead children to put in danger.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is because children</TR>, especially under the age of five, are too immature to tell the reality from the visionary situation. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, producers who make television commercials strive to attract children's attention and make them get engrossed in characters in advertisements in order to make more profits. Children who become an avid fan of products result in following the style of the products even if it is obviously dangerous. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, last month, I read newspapers reported one boy who fell from the second floor of the apartment. He wanted to follow the superman as the television advertisement showed so he wore the superman suit. It caused him to get broken his leg and arm. As this accident appeals, the detrimental influence of television advertisement on children should be taken more seriously.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, television advertisement makes children and parents lavish the money.</MI2> <SI2>It is impossible for children under the age of five to care about whether this product is really necessary for them. The only thing they do is that they just want to get products that they see in the television advertisement. <TR>Consequently</TR>, most parents can not bear children's constant asking for buying them, but their interest probably do not last long. <EX><TR>From my own experience</TR>, I know the boy who always asks his parents to buy new fancy character toys advertised in commercials. His parents refuse to purchase his all requests at the first time but not too long, they always buy them after all. The problem is that such toys he get to obtain go back to the storage very soon and their parents become frustrated. If had not been for advertisements in the television, he and his parents would not waste much money.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>,<TR> I have no doubt that</TR> television advertisement for children should be banned to make and show to children under the age of five. <TR>This is because</TR> it can cause the injury to children who follow commercials. <TR>What's more</TR>, television advertisement makes people waste money on buying useless toys. </CO>
column23: This essay has a strong thesis, but the argument points could be a little more specified. Also, the student's use of transitional words and phrases was perfectly balanced.

column1: 256&Increasing teachers’ salaries is the best way to improve the quality of education.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether increasing teachers’ salaries is the best way to improve the quality of education. Some people might believe that high salaries of teachers guaranteed the quality of students’ acknowledge as people will think that they put in more effort on education. <TS><TR>My view</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, is that it is impossible to connect between increasing teachers’ salaries and the quality of education. <TR>This is largely because</TR> the knowledge level of teachers can only lead to the best quality of education. <TR>Moreover</TR>, expenditure that spent on teachers’ salaries caused students to study in poor environment.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the quality of education is proportion to teachers’ acknowledge.</MI1> <SI1>If a teacher has a lot of information that involved the comprehensive school life, students would be likely to be motivated and learn many things. <TR>As a result</TR>, children study better more than before. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>when I was in high school</TR>, my history teacher always tell student the story which related to historical events. As my classmates were eager to listen to more stories, they put in more effort to study in history. <TR>Naturally</TR>, that situation made my class to be first class in history exam.</EX> <TR>As my personal example shows</TR>, the best way to improve the quality of education is only to increase knowledge level of teachers.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, increasing teachers’ salaries is detrimental effect on children’s education.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In the respect of school</TR>, much money should be spent on teachers’ salaries. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, the money is not used to children’s’ educational purpose. <TR>In this sense</TR>, imposing a high salaries of teachers allow their students to be poorly educated.<EX> Suppose you are science teacher. Many classes are required to many materials. <TR>And therefore</TR>, you should buy other experiment tools. <TR>However</TR>, because of increasing salaries, schools do not have the ability to support their science classes. <TR>Consequently</TR>, having high salaries of teachers are connected to lower quality of student’s education. </EX></SI2></BO2>    
    
<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, <TR>I firmly agreed with the opinion that</TR> increasing teachers’ salaries is not the best way to improve the quality of education considering the fact that teachers’ knowledge helps to grow up the students. <TR>In addition</TR>, limited cost which used to increase salaries of teaching people gives the problem to improve their student on material that they study in class.</CO>
column23: I would have liked if this student gave a concerte example instead of a hypothetical for MI2. However, the essay is overall well-written.

column1: 257&The best leaders are those who admit they have made bad decisions.
column3:
<IN>From charisma to generosity, there are many traits that a good leader should possess.  <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>undeniably</TR>, the best leaders are those who admit they have made bad decisions, since such action makes the followers to depend on their leaders and propels the company to aim for the better future.</IN>

                <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the leaders apologizing for their mistakes makes them trustworthy.</MI1> <SI1> Rather than avoiding the consequence and blaming other employers, fully acknowledging that they have made bad decisions makes the workers to respect their courage and responsibility.  <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, after his embezzlement was covered in the mass media, Kang Ho Dong, a well-known Korean entertainer, resigned from his job, saying that he does not deserve the spotlight that he previously enjoyed.  <TR>Indeed</TR>, impressed by his righteous deeds, Korean citizens demanded him to come back and again lead many Korean TV programs.</EX>  Leaders admitting their bad decisions enables the respective followers or employers to see the personal side of those leaders, consequently leading them to trust in the leaders’ ability more.</SI1></BO1>

               <BO2><MI2><TR> Furthermore</TR>, when leaders acknowledge that they have made mistakes, they are indeed strengthening the future-oriented nature within themselves.</MI2>  <SI2>Admitting bad decisions can be interpreted as an act of remorse and regret, a process necessary to be a better person in the near future. <EX><TR> Back to Kang Ho Dong’s example</TR>, he rose to the rank of the best MC in Korea because he constantly checked his mistakes in the past.  Whenever he appeared in or led the entertainment shows, he reviewed all of his performances to better his lame jokes.  <TR>As shown in the case of Kang Ho Dong</TR>, admitting one has made bad decisions inevitably leads oneself to think about how to perform in the future.</EX></SI2></BO2>

                <CO><TR>As such</TR>, the best leaders are those who admit they have made decisions because they become trustworthy and forward-looking through such process.  <TR>Therefore</TR>, one should try to admit, rather than to avoid, one’s mistakes in order to become a good leader. </CO>
column23: This student uses excellent examples to support his/her argument. However, it would have been nice if they had used two different examples instead of using the same person for both examples.

column1: 258&Opinions of celebrities such as famous entertainers or athletes are more important to young people than older people.
column3:
<IN><TR>Traditionally</TR>, the voice of older people controlled the entire society.  <TR>That is</TR>, when making important decisions, young people frequently consulted wisdom and experience of older generation.  <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>nowadays</TR> this is not necessarily true.  In the midst of the age of mass media, opinions of celebrities have insurmountable impact on younger generation, since young people blindly imitate seemingly luxurious lifestyle of celebrities and the generation gap has irrevocably widened.</TS></IN>

                <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the young people mimic celebrities without any second thought.</MI1>  <SI1>Impressed by the rather distorted and exaggerated depiction of celebrities in televisions, the young people blithely idolize and follow famous entertainers or athletes.  <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, Britney Spears, a famous teen pop singer during 2000s, was once captured eating a diet lollipop.  Though not scientifically proven, the paparazzi photos of her sucking that lollipop were suffice enough for thousand of naive American girls to purchase those lollipops in the hope of losing weight.  <TR>Indeed</TR>, the sales of diet lollipop have risen more than 60%, proving the importance of celebrities in influencing the young people.</EX></SI1></BO1>

                <BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, the young people now incline to ignore older people’s opinions due to deeply rooted generation gap.</MI2>  <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, the young people deem the history and senior citizens as outdated, unable to keep track of the newest technology.  <EX><TR>For example</TR>, many Koreans deliberately decide not to commemorate death of ancestors in Confucius holidays.  <TR>Even though older people emphasizes the importance of Confucius holidays in formulating our Korean culture</TR>, the younger generation still continues to disobey them, saying they do not understand the modern society.</EX></SI2></BO2>

                <CO><TR>As such</TR>, opinions of celebrities are more important to young people than older people.  Just as Britney Spears’ diet lollipops and rapidly disappearing Confucius holidays manifest, <TR>nowadays</TR> opinions of celebrities are more valued.  <TR>However</TR>, one should always remember that without old people’s efforts and prudent decisions, our society might not have developed as it is right now.</CO>
column23: This student has an excellent grasp on English vocabulary and grammar. There are a few issues, but nothing major.

column1: 259&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that living in a small town is more favorable than living in a big city. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I prefer to live in metropolitan because big cities have more convenient facilities and they give more opportunities to work.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, living in a big city is very convenient due to they have sophisticated public system.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For daily living</TR>, we need various kind of facilities such as public transportation, security system or education centers. In almost every big cities, these kinds of system are properly equipped with. <TR>As a result</TR>, people in the large cities enjoy high-level living. <TR>However</TR>, in small towns, people usually feel uncomfortable because there are a few places to help their living. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my grandmother and grandfather have lived in countryside in one of provinces in the Korea. When my grandmother came down with severe cold, they call the 911 and the ambulance came to their home too late. <TR>Also</TR>, the time to get to the hospital is late because the nearest big hospital was located in adjacent big city. <TR>Fortunately</TR>, grandmother recovered later, <TR>however</TR> , this case shows one of inconveniences in small town.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, there are many opportunities in big cities.</MI2> <SI2>Not only most of major cooperation prefer to held their branches in the city, but also Government agencies, universities and other social groups are collectively gathered in big city. <TR>In addition</TR>, numerous people from different area aggregates in the urban area. <TR>This means that</TR> there are limitless opportunities in cities generated from interaction between massive population and workplaces. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, one of my cousin went to New York despite he didn't have any money. <TR>However</TR>, he pursued his own goal running his own accessary business. He firstly got his job at a art gallery in Soho street. <TR>After that</TR>, he met numerous people who help his dream and finally opened his own shop in the city. This success story eminently shows the big city's influential role in generating opportunity.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I prefer to live in urban area because big cities gives more opportunities and convenient facilities.</CO>
column23: This student has good arguments that are supported with strong examples. They have minor problems with grammar and transitional word usage.

column1: 260&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answers.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that attending classes would not be necessary for lots of reasons. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my experience</TR>, attending classes was very useful to get profound knowledge. The reason why I think that is as follow.</TS></IN>   
     
<BO1><MI1><TR>The first</TR> reason for this is time management.</MI1> <SI1>Classes offer the certain time for attending and university students have to be on time for studying. Some people might say that it is totally wasted of time, because students spend their time for going to university back and forth by public transportation. Even if they have their own car, it is just little time saving. <TR>So</TR>, they claim that studying alone would be better. Students can study their own in anytime and anyplace. For the reason of time consuming, students would rather study alone. <TR>But</TR> there are a few persons who can manage their time properly and efficiently against temptation of hanging out or delaying the portion that they have to study a day. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, attending classes which force students to be in class on right time make them be able to handle their progress of study.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason is that</TR> attending classes usually give students knowledge beyond text books.</MI2> <SI2>A professor in the university is a identified person who knows very much for the subject. They could let them know further important information which does not exist on the text books. <TR>Aside from that</TR>, students can ask what they are wondering to professors right away in the class. Students study alone can not usually understand at once with text book, so they have to search the internet or other text books. <TR>But</TR> with professor, students can get the correct answer without wasting time for searching.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> students should attend the classes in the university for the reasons of time management and profound knowledge.</CO>
column23: In BO1, the student is practically arguing AGAINST his/her own position. Also, they  never give any real evidence for any of their arguments.

column1: 261&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. The need to use land for farming, housing, and industry takes precedence over the need to preserve the habitat of endangered species. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that there are various animals and plants that is facing the crisis of extinction. <TR>Thus</TR>, we have to consider preserving land for such species. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> given the limitation of land, we might as well use such land for other purpose like housing and farming for two reasons. Now we are confronting the lack of land for other purposes and there are still enough species living on the earth.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, <TR>in today's society</TR>, there do not exist enough land for numerous purpose.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> even if we are restricted to using limited space, people is likely to need more and more space for various goals. <TR>Moreover</TR>, such definite land space is increasingly becoming more limted on account of thawing glacier which makes sea level elevated. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by University of California at Los angeles of the United States</TR>, South Korea lacks of house compared to other nations with analogous population density. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the researcher showed that in ten years. the nation will confront serious housing problems, making people struggle to get a house for living.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> the priority of everything considered, necessity of housing, farming land has priority over other uses such as preserving animals' habitat.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, <TR>contrary to common thought</TR>, endangerd species is actually existing in large number.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> many related conservationists are likely to seriouly describe the environmental problems. Although sufficient animals and plants are coexiting in the environment, they usually report they are confronting crisis of extiction. <TR>By doing so</TR>, they can remind people of the importance of interest in endengered species. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in Jeju island, one conservationist reported the number of indigenous eagles were decreasing by geometrically. He claimed that now is the time for us to consider securing enough land for these species. <TR>However</TR>, it turned out that the report was overall written with exaggeration and the actual number of those eagles was so enough that we did not have to take care of. The conservationist just reported it in order to recall people's interest.</EX> <TR>This meant that</TR> many known endangered living things are virtually less being threatened than we expected.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, it looks that we should make sure to maintain appropriate land for threatened species. <TR>However</TR>, now most of these species is living on good condition unlike people's common idea. <TR>Thus</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> we must recognize the fact that needs to use space for aims other than living things preponderate any others.</CO>
column23: This student uses very good evidence to support his/her argument.

column1: 262&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. Games can teach people valuable lessons about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that games can be a good way to learn priceless lessons that is helpful in life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>everything considered</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> the disadvantages of the games far outweigh the advantages. <TR>Especially</TR>, game can be detrimental to people's health condition and performance in school.</IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, playing game can damage individual's health.</MI1> <EX><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> most of games are being played on computer monitor screen and such exposure to electric wave coming from screen is always harmful to people's eyes. <EX><TR>Moreover</TR>, playing computer games also can cause people to get musculoskeletal diseases such as back pain and neck spasm because we usually sit on a chair long time during gaming. <TR>For example</TR>, my youngest brother used to be addicted to playing games such as starcraft. <TR>After school</TR>, he played that game until he went to sleep. <TR>Finally</TR>, he got severe lumbar vertebral pain and dignosed as scoliosis in which the vertebral bone look like curvy.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> playing games only cause such health problems rather than giving valuable lessons in life.</BO1>
