<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, doing computer games bothers students from increasing their academic performance by themselves.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> computer games can serve as one of the main factors to hamper concentrating on study. <TR>WIth such distraction</TR>, they will put in less effort in study, concentrate worse on task, and feel less responsible for their work. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2008</TR>, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in achievements. Students in group A were restricted to playing games four hours a week. Those in group B were allowed to play games as much as they wanted to. The researchers showed that the former groups spent more hours studying by 20 percent and performed higher in school. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they followed instructions well, submitted assignments on time, and participated activately in class discussion. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in group B dozed off in class and lacked focus on class materials.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> computer games prevent students from improving their performance in class.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, although people are able to get several cherishable teachings while playing computer games. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> such games are likely to harm people rather than being helpful. <TR>This is because</TR> they can lower students' academic performance and cause serious heath problems.</CO>
column23: This essay is well-written, though BO1 lacks a supporting idea. However, both BO1 and BO2 have good examples to support the student's argument.

column1: 263&Some universities require students to take classes in many subjects. Other universities require students to specialize in one subject. Which is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might argue that requiring students to take classes in many subjects is better than to specialize in one subject. <TS><TR>Contrary to popular belief</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> it is preferable for universities to make students to specialize in one subject for the following reasons: it guarantees students a success in career and allows them to live a stress-free life.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, encouraging students to concentrate on one subject has a direct correlation with students' success in career.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR>  when students spend most of their time on specific subject, they can develop their expertise. <TR>Moreover</TR>, as modern society is becoming increasingly specialized and competitive, today's job markets require job candidates with such qualities. <EX><TR>According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2010</TR>, the employment interview was the most important component in hiring practice, taking up more than 70 percent of the final call. The interviewers looked at the applicant's knowledge and skills, mostly related to specialty.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> specialization is a secure way for students to prepare for the future.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, studying various subjects deter students from staying healthy.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> specialized in one subject assures a stress-free life, <TR>while</TR> having various courses can stress students out by making them worry about achieving academic performance from so many subjects. <TR>Moreover</TR>, stress is one of the main factors of diseases through weakening the immune system. <EX><TR>In a study conduced by Seoul National Univerisity of Korea in 2008</TR>, a test on mice showed that life span was shortened when they regularly underwent a series of electric shocks. <TR>Interestingly</TR>, the researchers found a link between this and human beings who suffered from periodic stress.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> high stress levels coming from taking many different courses can negatively affect humans, resulting in a shorter life span.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, <TR>although leading students to study many courses may have some benefits</TR>, the advantage of making them specialize in one course far outweigh for the reasons I have mentioned above.</CO>
column23: Though this student's writing suffers from some vocabulary efforts, they stuck to the topic and gave good support to their argument.

column1: 264&Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.
column3:
<IN>It is said that a friendship is one of the most fragile relationship between two people. <TR>Even though taking action to cope with mistakes is helpful to friends</TR>, people can easily get grudge to this advice. <TS><TR>Nevertheless</TR>, <TR>I strongly support that</TR> people should taking action to deal with friends' mistakes although a friendship can be broken. <TR>The reason behind this is that</TR> friends can be in danger if we let a friend make mistakes.<TR> Additionally</TR>, a friendship can be recovered after solving the problems.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, letting friends make mistakes results in jeopardizing them for their faults.</MI1> <SI1>Friends who make mistakes may not know the situation they are in or they avoid to look at the reality. <TR>In this situation</TR>, friends is ones who can watch them closely and motivate them to fix the poor choices. Saving friends has a priority to distructing a friendship. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, I saw my friend who walked though the street, not the pedestrian road. I talked to her how it is dangerous, but she did not like to listen to my advice and warning that it could be reported by policeman. This is the place notorious for many accidents. She never run across the street as I made her embarrassed with that. <TR>In the end</TR>, my actions can save my friends, which is the most significant than any other things.</EX> <TR>Likewise</TR>, friends should not be intimidated ahead of friends' perilous situation.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, a friendship is recoverable after friends fix their mistakes follewed by friends' action.</MI2> <TS><TR>Rather</TR>, if friends leave their friends into the trouble situation, the friend no loner continue their friendships since they do not have chance to care themselves. <EX>An old saying appeals that 'a friendship become more stronger after a hardship they should edure together.' <TR>After that</TR>, they can build trustness each other and share their experiences as valuable memories.</EX> <EX><TR>According to the research conducted by National Psychology Institute</TR>, people feel more intimacy to others who can correct their wrong doings and want to be friends more. It was highligted because it was opposite to the common sence that people do not want to allow others to blame or teach them even though they say right things.</EX> <TR>As this case shows</TR>, taking action to friends' mistakes will not destory a friendship, rather make it profound. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, <TR>I have no dount that</TR> people do anything to stop friends' mistake even though it could be risky about a friendship. If concerning about cracking in a friendship, friedns can be endangered. <TR>What's more</TR>, a friendship can be rebuilded after they fix the problem that friends make.</CO>
column23: This student makes errors with basic verbs like "to be," but they make a strong argument, support it well, and stick to the topic.

column1: 265&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor?
column3:
<IN>Even thinking of working for a bad supervisor is as much horrible as having a terrible teacher. A bad boss can make an employ quit the job or move to another workplace just like a bad teacher makes students drop out of their school. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, having a good supervisor makes all the difference in the workplace. <TR>Then</TR>,what qualities are important the most in order to be a good supervisor?</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>In my view</TR>, the most essential quality that  a good boss should look for  is the capability to assign work efficiently.</MI1> <SI1>A boss should be able to grasp the strengths and weaknesses of his or her employ and delegate workload accordingly. <TR>In this way</TR>, the company will increase the productivity while the employees will be able to have an opportunity to uphold their responsibilities and accomplish the work with zeal.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion</TR>, a reputable boss has the ability to motivate employees.</MI2> <SI2>A good supervisor encourages the employees to keep working hard and offers an incentive for their good works in the same way as a good teacher who gives hope and courage. Even in crisis times when things are not going well, a good boss sends an uplifting message and outlook.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, the supervisor who exhibits the attributes to assign work efficiently and motivate employees will command respect and loyalty from the employees.</CO>
column23: This student's thesis makes no argument at all. Also, they use some weird phrasing and don't give good examples to support the argument that they gradually introduce.

column1: 266&Some universities require students to take classes in many subjects. Other universities require students to specialize in one subject. Which is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>University’s main reason is to learn a specialized field so that students increase their knowledge of their own field. <TR>Based on this opinion</TR>, some people think taking as many classes for students’ own subjects as possible is very important. <TR>However</TR>, there are other different opinions that taking various kinds of subjects are better for university students. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> taking many different classes is better for students due to three reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, taking different kinds of classes can widen students’ background knowledge.</MI1> By taking different kinds of classes, students can learn various kinds of background knowledge. <SI1>Understanding different knowledge and experience different subjects are very useful not only for students’ background knowledge but also studying their own subjects. Taking subjects of different fields can be background knowledge. <EX>Creative idea of Steve Jobs, one of the best well known CEO in the world, is based on his knowledge about liberality. <TR>Although</TR> he starts his company with computer programmer background, he could create beautiful products because he could mix the technique with liberality which he had taken from a university class.</EX> <TR>Likewise</TR>, learning about different field can finally help learn or apply to students’ own field.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, university students can communicate with others with different interest and knowledge by having various kinds of classes.</MI2> No one would agree that studying one’s major is the only reason that universities exist. <SI2>There are several other important roles for universities and learning communication skills is one of them. Communication skill is very important during people’s life and universities are very good place to learn about it. By taking different classes, students can take part in a variety of team works such as making a report with their team members or going to the historical places with team members during a history class. While students try to do their own part during different kinds of classes, they can learn how to communicate with others, how to solve discuss with others, and how to solve problems when argues occur. These activities are definitely helpful for students.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, students can make sure their major is really what they want while they take other classes.</MI3> <SI3>Many students enter universities because they want to learn more about what they are interested in. <TR>However</TR>, not all students choose a right major that they really want to learn. Some students finally understand that they did not like the major they are taking after entering universities and learn about their special field. Others change their mind because they find some field that are more interesting than the field the students are now taking. Students can quickly fix these mistakes by taking different subjects during the very first season. <TR>By taking different subjects</TR>, students can really know what they are interested in, and if they really want to keep or change their major. In this manner, studying other fields would be useful.</SI3></BO3>

<CO>All three reasons are necessary reasons for students to learn about knowledge that are not directly related to their own major. Learning other majors will finally help students’ own major. <TR>Also</TR>, students can learn better communication skills and experience other students with different background. Students can understand if their major is what they really need to learn. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> learning other classes with different subjects are important for students’ university life.</CO>
column23: This student's essay is devoid of examples and evidence for the claims that (s)he makes.

column1: 267&Improving schools is the best way to advance a country.
column3:
<IN>Some people believe that investing in laboratories to develop technology is the best way to advance a country.  <TR>That is</TR>, as the Soviet Union has previously earned its wealth and popularity in the 1950s, the nation could be strengthened through technological development.  <TS><TR>However</TR>, that is not necessarily true.  <TR>In fact</TR>, it is evident that improving schools is the best way to advance a country, since education generates righteous citizens and grants opportunities to discover underprivileged geniuses.</TS></IN>

                  <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, education directly fosters a number of enthusiastic and moral citizens.</MI1>  <SI1><TR>Even though</TR> the effect of improving schools is not as immediate as building a laboratory, it has a long-term effect by creating the well-educated next generation.  <EX><TR>According to a recent poll</TR>, the educated people are more likely to vote and voice their opinions about government, consequently contributing to the betterment of that country.  Merely learning how the government functions can ultimately contribute to citizens’ informed decisions in the future.</EX></SI1></BO1>

                  <BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, enhancing school systems gives opportunities to the disadvantaged geniuses.</MI2>  <SI2>If the government prioritizes education as the foremost value of the nation, it will eventually benefit by the excavation of geniuses.  <EX>Thanks to financial aid provided by the government, Dr. Kim was able to attend one of the most expensive yet prestigious schools in Korea.  <TR>Consequently</TR>, Dr. Kim, a country boy from a very humble background, became a leading scientist who has prompted the development of Nano technology.</EX>  <TR>As shown</TR>, education is the best opportunity for the government to selectively foster geniuses and future leaders of the nation.</SI2></BO2>

                  <CO><TR>As such</TR>, improving school should undeniably be the number one priority of the government, since it creates enthusiastic citizens and gives opportunities to the underprivileged geniuses.</CO>
column23: This student had good main ideas, but I feel that they could have used more varied sentence structure.

column1: 268&Renewable sources of energy (sun, wind, water) will soon replace fossil fuels(coal, gas, oil).
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether alternative sources of energy will soon replace fossil fuels. Some people might believe that it is possible to change renewable sources of energy as world leaders are more and more interested in environment problems. <TS><TR>My view</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, is that fossil fuels would cause problems more than ever. This is largely because there are no common criteria. Moreover, rapid change leads to the country’s economic recession.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, many leaders in all over the world have no norms collectively.</MI1> <SI1>The country that used fossil fuels is different from their situation. Some country consumed more fossil fuels, <TR>whereas</TR> other countries might be well-developed in alternative energy. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>in this regard</TR>, many rules, norms, and criteria would be made by a stronger state, or well-developed country, such as the United States. <TR>As a result</TR>, these rules were simply to temporary methods. Suppose your country is the one of the strongest nation. <TR>Also</TR>, the nation used a large percent of renewable sources. In this sense, you can make the rule have priority. <TR>As a result</TR>, these forced method were not effective solution. <TR>Therefore</TR>, had it not been for collective and cooperative method, the world would have not improved on environmental problems.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, fast transition caused the nation to get severe problems.</MI2> <SI2>If some nations have a higher percentage of fossil fuels, the nation would put in more efforts when compared the other nation. <TR>And therefore</TR>, civilian of the country should unnecessary activities, such as taking transportation instead of taking personal cars. These situations gives the people unbalanced life. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by a group of researcher at Harvard University</TR>, if the policy that the nations should reduce fossil fuels implemented, more than two-third of the countries is harmful to economic recession. <TR>Also</TR>, this policy can be burden to people’s overwhelming load. <TR>As the study shows</TR>, changes lead to economic recession.</EX?</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, the adverse effect of rapid change far outweighs the benefit of renewable sources of energy considering the facts that there is no collective rules and alternative resources gives the more detrimental problems. <TR>Of course</TR>, replacing fossil fuels with renewable sources is beneficial to environmental aspects, such as reducing of air pollution, but it caused unfair norms.</CO>
column23: The student's thesis makes no sense at all, and the whole essay doesn't address what the prompt asks for.

column1: 269&The news media is a reliable source of unbiased information.
column3:
<IN>There has been a debate among many people whether we can trust the coverage by the news media and it is usually objective on problems. <TS><TR>Although</TR> it is true that the many reporters are trying to find out truth and provide people with reliable information, <TR>I believe</TR> we need to consider what is true carefully when we read newspaper before, <TR>which means</TR> some media are not trustworthy. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I give two reasons supporting my idea.</TS></IN>

           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the media corporations tend to give some information favor of certain person or companies.</MI1> <SI1>We can see several media companies owned by private and they keep very close relationship with other companies in different sector. If the news media were related to specific people, how they can be willing to make news that make them angry and unsatisfied. <EX><TR>For instances</TR>, I read newspaper published by ‘A’ media managed by ‘B’ large corporation which have also ‘C’ electronic company. There were severe accidents that employees who work for ‘C’ electronic company died because of poor and hazardous environment. Every newspaper wrote about these accidents and tried to encourage people to know the reality of accidents and the reason why they died. <TR>However</TR>, each newspaper published by ‘A’ media explains this issue from the side of ‘C’ company even if it is clear many worker had died because ‘C’company did not pay attention to their workers` health.  <TR>Regarding this event</TR>, we can see it is difficult for the media corporation keeps objective viewpoint on issue related to its interest.</EX></SI1></BO1>

          <BO2><MI2><TR> On top of that</TR>, the news media tend to do anything they can to induce people to read their articles.</MI2> <SI2>There is a lot of information on newspaper. They are very helpful when we live today, but we can see things on newspaper exaggerated, distorted and even faked. <TR>The problem is</TR> the newspaper are willing to write that kinds of things if they can draw people. <EX><TR>From my experience</TR>, I had read about living information on newspaper. That article had it that if you ingest lots of snacks on the shelves in supermarket, you could be blind. I was very scared that snacks can make me blind. <TR>But</TR>, <TR>in fact</TR>, it was some kind of exaggerating information. It is true some ingredients in snacks have a few possibilities that harm people`s eye but they never let people become blind. The newspaper want people to read their article by showing them very distinct title and context. <TR>Although</TR> they apologized that article which they intend to write in the wrong way, they certainly are willing to write some news that has purposes to deceive people.</EX></SI2></BO2>

          <CO> <TR>To sum up</TR>, it is evident the news media that are possessed by certain people or have close relationship with some companies are impossible to keep neutral posture on issues concerned and they are likely to write some face articles to attract more people. <TR>Therefore</TR> I truly believe the newspaper cannot play a very important role in providing trustworthy information.</CO>
column23: This student could use a little work on vocabulary and grammar usage, and their thesis is a little weak, but they have good main ideas and corresponding supports.

column1: 270&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3:
<IN><TR>These days</TR>, many people prefer to live in a modern apartment building which usually located in the city because it is easy to use public transportation and there are lots of convenient facilities. <TS><TR>However in my opinion</TR>, I want to live in a traditional house in the country. In a traditional house people can live in peace and fresh air which are good for their health.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, in a traditional house, I do not need to upset about noisy.</MI1> <SI1>Usually the atmosphere in traditional house is peaceful, after finishing my work I can rest very well. <TR>In the apartment</TR>, always I should here the noise such as car or children so I would get stress from them. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my grandmother’s home is a traditional house in the country so ever I visit her house I think I am relaxed in claim and quiet atmosphere. I think live in a traditional house would be more helpful for my health than living in a modern apartment.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, people can live in the fresh air in a traditional house.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Now days</TR>, air pollution is a serious problem. <TR>Especially in apartment</TR>, there could be harmful chemical things could occur disease to people. If I have a child, I do not want to live in apartment with negative chemical things. Sometimes we can easily see the people are suffering from respiration disease because of air pollution. They move to the traditional house for their health. No parents want to live their child in the air pollution I think.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think living in a traditional house is better than in a modern apartment building. Maybe people can enjoy convenient facility in a modern apartment. <TR>However</TR>, stressful noise will negative to their mental health and air pollution would negative for their physical health. There is nothing is important than our health.</CO>
column23: This student's main ideas are a bit vague and could be expanded upon a bit more. Also, more examples and evidence would be nice.

column1: 271&A teacher who is serious and strict is more effective than a teacher who uses humor and is easygoing.
column3:
<IN>There have been varying opinions whether a teacher who is serious and strict is more effective a teacher who uses humor and easygoing. Some people argue that teaching through funny joke and friendly is effective. <TR>However</TR>, I have a different idea. <TS><TR>I believe that</TR> rigid and rigorous is most effectively method to teaching. <TR>This is because</TR> the more strict teachers do, the more students will follow well.\</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, It is effective for students to participate in class intensively and improve score.</MI1> There is a great example supporting this idea. <EX>I have a teacher who try more rigid for students. <TR>As a result</TR>, students improve attitude and test score. This teacher’s acting leads to many profits.</EX> This profits have positive effects not just on one self, but also on many other matters such as intensive classes and improve students test score. <TR>For this reason</TR>, Severe teacher needs for student.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, If teacher is not rigorous, School would not be able to found regulations.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Putting it differently</TR>, rigorous is most important things in a group life. <EX>A recent survey from Statistics Commission in United Nations revealed an interesting result : 94 percent of those surveyed, teacher and parent, think that rigid and strict is need for student. The remaining 11 percent of the researchers show also not opposed theme but neutral in the near-positive.</EX> This outcome is because teacher who uses humor brings detrimental influences include disorder in class and discord with students. <TR>Through survey’s result and that of effects</TR>, we can know that teacher acting more stricter is rational behavior.</BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude integrating the positive and negative aspects mentioned above</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> teacher who is rigid and severe is more effective than a teacher who uses humor and is easygoing.</CO>
column23: This student shows a great weakness in vocabulary and grammar, especially concerning missing articles. Also, the student's main ideas are not very strong or convincing.

column1: 272&Students are influenced more by their friends than by their teachers.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that students are influenced more by thier teachers than their friends. <TS><TR>However</TR> <TR>I think that</TR> students are influenced more by their friends for several reasons : friends share more things in common and friends feel more comfortable than the teachers.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, students share more things in common with their friends unlike with their teachers.</MI1> <SI1>Students go to school everyday and they spend most of their time there with friends. They are all in same situation, having similar problems and thoughts, <TR>and therefore</TR> it is easy for them to share their opinions with friends. By sharing common things with friends, students tend to believe and trust each other, depending on one another. This makes students be influenced by their friends more. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, although teachers spend time with their students as well, teachers have to care for every single students in class, resulting in lack of attention to focus on indivisuals. This affects how the students feel about their teachers and in the end less trust for them, less influenced. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, there are a lot of cases that students listen to their friends' opinion at once while refuse to listen to their parents' opinion thinking that they are just nagging. <TR>This shows the reason why</TR> students are influenced more by their friends than by their teachers.</EX></SI2></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, students feel more comfortable when they are with their friends rather than their teachers.</MI2> <SI2>Students and teachers are different  in many ways no matter how hard the teachers try to be friendly with students. Teachers' job is to lead the students in a right way and also to give knowledge to students. <TR>In this way</TR>, there tend to be a gap between teachers and friends. Making friends feel easy to dicuss problems or matters that one has and resulting that they listen to each other well and be influenced. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, all friends of mine and including myself, we find each other for advice when we are in trouble. <TR>This shows that</TR> we influence one another more than the teachers do.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclustion</TR>, as students are likely to share many things in common and comfortable with their friends, students are influenced more by their friends than by their teachers.</CO>
column23: This essay needs more evidence and support for the argument that is being made.

column1: 273&What is the most important characteristic (for example, honesty, intelligence, a sense of humor) that a person can have to be successful in life?
column3:
<IN>Prior to making a decision about what characteristics are important to be successful in life, I would first like to define the meaning of a successful life as a life which is happy and rich. <TS><TR>Based on the inference</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> the most important factors for a successful life are a feeling of satisfaction and an act of sharing.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a feeling of satisfaction is essential for living a successful life, <TR>that is</TR>, living a affluent life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Putting it differently</TR>, not knowing about satisfaction can mean that you are poor all the time. Even though you earn ten million dollars monthly by doing a business independently, if you are not satisfied with the revenue that you are making, you will not feel yourself being successful or rich. <TR>Likewise</TR>, even thought you get one thousand dollars every month by working for a company, if you feel satisfied with it, you will be the same as a billionare. <TR>In this regard</TR>, a person who is successful in life is the one who knows about the feeling of satisfaction.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, in order to live a successful life, <TR>in other words</TR>, to be happy, one should be able to share what they already have with others.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As various social researches show</TR>, people find themselves extremely happy and successful by giving helps such as donating their assets and sharing their foods. These benevolent acts to share what one has with others increase addtitionally self-respect, which is another factor of leading to a successful life,  by receiving appriciation or approval from others and society. <TR>In this respect</TR>, giving a help or sharing with others is a paramount factor of being able to live a successful life.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Ultimately</TR>, it is not all that easy to answer about exactly what characteristics are essential to be successful in life since a successful life in itself is a extremly subject matter and depends where one puts their values. <TR>Personally</TR>, I think that the important factors to a successful life are feeling of contentment and sharing what you got.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement answers the prompt but doesn't have any other information to lead into the rest of the essay. Also, the student overuses transitional words and phrases, and provides no real examples or evidence to support his/her claims.

column1: 274&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3:
<IN>It is a double edged sword, for building a large factory near a community. There are possibilities of environmental pollution. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I would like to support that building large factory because large factory will help increasing economic profits in local area which is included our community for below reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin</TR>, a large factory gives opportunities to increase the job market.</MI1> <SI1>There always is a huge number of job needed near large factory. Large factories tend to look for people near them. It is also good for the factory because they don’t need to bring people for work from far away with higher salary due to transportation fee. <TR>Contrastingly</TR>, local small factory can shut down and that means job markets can shrink. <TR>So</TR>, people from small factory can contend that a large factory should not come in their community, if their market area will overlap and it could affect their own. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my friend’s father changed his job with nice salary when Samsung semiconductor factory moved to Cheon-An city. <TR>While this point of view</TR>, if a large factory comes, it would be helpful for developing competitiveness. Then it makes much nicer technology, it will makes more places for hiring in that area. <TR>Thus</TR> big factory would increase the job market and it is helpful for one’s society economic development.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, to build a large factory can give enormous economical wealth indirectly such as real estates increases, traffic systems, immigrant’s rushes from the other community.</MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the price of my hometown’s real-estate increased around 10 times after Samsung factory came. then we had a subway since the population increased.</EX></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In contrast</TR>, some people insist that large factory will make more crime and environment pollution after all the economy will decrease in local community.</MI3> <TR>However</TR>, this could prevent with people’s own exertion.</BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, building a large factory would be beneficial to our community for economical profits. It will generate bigger job markets as wells as indirect economical wealth. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly support building a large factory in my community.</CO>
column23: This student starts with a weak thesis which has no real support in the essay. In addition, the student has major vocabulary and grammar problems that make the essay hard to read at certain points.

column1: 275&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3:
<IN>If children go to the zoo and see many animals, they can learn more easily about animals that they experienced and they can memorize animals more effectively. <TS><TR>Like this</TR>, sometimes knowledge gained from experience is better than knowledge gained from books. <TR>But</TR> it is not allowed to experience everything to us because of time, money and so on. So we can't acquire every information from experienced knowledge. <TR>In reality</TR>, it is more effective to get information through books.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I have some information about the space and even the ancient times.</MI1> <TR>Of course</TR>, I never have experienced those things, but in my childhood I read many books written about the space and old history and I could obtain the information. There are no dangerous situations that spacemen can face, no high cost for going space, and no waste time for training. In addition, it is impossible to go back to the ancient times. <TR>Through reading books</TR>, we can get the information that we can hardly experience.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, there are so many data all over the world and these data are accumulated for a long time.</MI2> And in the future, the skill of storage will be more improved than any other time and then more data will be stored. <TR>In ancient time</TR>, if there had no books, human beings might have seemed like to animals. If someone invented very useful stuff for life, it would be invented again or perished when the man died. It would be no more improvements in human society. <TR>Also in these days</TR>, one having various and enough knowledge can win in competitive society. The best way to get more information is to read many books.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, knowledge gained from experience is more effective to learn and memorize something, but it is very definite in many ways such as getting inaccessible information and acquiring enough, various data. <TR>So</TR> I think it is better way to get knowledge to read many books in present trends.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement is long and confused, contradicting itself and ultimately not addressing what the prompt is asking. Also, some of the student's sentences are confusing, and the essay is off-topic in that it talks more about convenience of acquiring information through different means than the importance of the information acquired through each means.

column1: 276&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their student sports activities as they give to their university libraries.
column3:
<IN><TR>I believe that</TR> one of the most important role in university is education. Even thought many students enjoy a variety of activities in their school, most of students want to improve their knowledge in academic fields. <TS>So I disagree that universities should give the same of money to their student sports activities as they give to their university libraries. There are some reasons which support my opinion.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, library is a learning center of university in the sense that students and professors can gain lots of information and knowledge.</MI1> <SI1>Every student in university has experiences to go to the library for their study and research. <TR>I think that</TR> it is indispensable to need a large amount of budget for keeping up well its infrastructures and facilities in library. <TR>Therefore</TR> universities must consider the degree of priority when they allocate budget in each part.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, every student use a library for many reasons including study, research, discussion, exploration on Internet and so on.</MI2> Unlike library, it is not always available sports activities. Only parts of students who have a interest in sports. enjoy sports activities. So the same amount of money invested between library and sports activities is unfair for many students. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>for the above-mentioned reasons that</TR> I disagree the same amount of investment between library and sports activities. Because I believe that education should be main objective in university. <TR>Finally</TR> to provide better education, university must invest their money more library than sports activities.</CO>
column23: This student uses a lot of phrasing that sounds awkward. Additionally, they have a weak thesis with next to so evidential support.

column1: 277&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TR>Since the prehistory</TR>, human being has worn clothes. As a long history of clothes, there are many different clothes in the world and their style, color, type is very various. <TS>I think clothes influence on the way people behave. The followings are statements that support my point of view.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>At first</TR>, if colors, styles and types of clothes are changed , the psychology of people are also changed.</MI1> <SI1>If the color and the style of a clothe is bright, colorful and free , man who wear this clothe feels up and so, man will behave freely without any restriction. <TR>In contrast</TR>, man will be tranquil and conduct himself restrained if he wears a funeral costume.</SI2></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, a kind of clothes show a social position and a job to others.</MI2> <SI2>Students wear the school uniform and salary men and women wear a suite. <TR>Because of this</TR>, people in the society realize their social positions, tasks and jobs whenever they see themselves, and others also know what the man’s job is. <TR>So that</TR>, men who wear these clothes feel responsibility and don’t do illegal or unrighteous behavior.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, the behavior of people are changed by the use of clothes which they are wearing.</MI3> If someone puts on a gymnastic uniform, he will exercise and if a man wear a sleeping gown, he will go to bed. <TR>Of course</TR>, some people argued that a man can do he wants not concerned his clothe. This argument has a reliable reason. <TR>However</TR>, we can do the best to do what we have to when we put on the clothe which is suited for our job.</BO3>

<CO><TR>Consequently</TR>, the cloth influence on the behavior of people because people show the behavior which is suited for their clothes’s colors, styles, types and uses. <TR>for those reasons</TR>, I agree that different clothes influence the way people behave.</CO>
column23: This student makes a (very weak) argument but fails to support it- in fact, his/her essay seems to support a different argument than the one they make. Overall, the writing is awkward and unskilled.

column1: 278&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Throughout our lives, we will have many opportunities to learn from many different sources. <TS><TR>But</TR> our parents are the first teacher we will ever have, and they are only teacher who will stay with us throughout our lives. <TR>So I agree with that</TR> parents are always the best teachers.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>When we were a newborn babies, <TR>first of all</TR>, our parents are the first people who we met. <TR>And then</TR>, they start teaching us what we need for living as a social members.</MI1> They are first people who know what is needed to their children and what their children should learn.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, they maintain relationships with us throughout our lives.</MI2> Because they know all our lives, they can afford many advices and knowledges that they have experienced through all their life. These are things which only our parents can do.</BO2> 

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, because they are the first teachers who we will have and are the only teachers who will stay with us throughout our lives, parents are the best teachers we could ever have.</CO>
column23: This is a very weak essay. The student doesn't make a good argument at all, simply stating his/her opinions as fact with no supporting reasons or evidence, and the writing is simple and unvaried.

column1: 279&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Student usually have who options when studying. They can study alone or they can study with a group of students. <TS>I prefer to study alone because I can concentrate on it well. <TR>And</TR> It's also good to plan my schedule.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>When I study with a group of students I should work with them and care about them. In this way, I can not concentrate on study well.</MI1> Students can get some informations while they study with a group. Bun they can get all information what they want from Internet in these days. Students can ask the questions and get new information from it. <TR>In this respect</TR> I'm sure studying alone is the best way.</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2>When I study alone it is very useful to plan my schedule.</MI2> <EX><TR>For instance</TR> my older brother had studied with a group of his friends on Saturday. Consequently he could not do anything on Saturday for meeting with them. So he always had hard time to plan on Saturday. Even He could not make any promise on that day.</BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, Students should study alone. They can concentrate on it well. Also they can plan advanced schedule. All of these traits will benefit them through out their life.</CO>
column23: This student uses a minimal variety of sentence structure, and their argument is very poorly supported.

column1: 280&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>While a person is going through many things and people, numerous people may influence one’s life. <TS><TR>Among them</TR>, parents play the most decisive role to lead one to a certain direction, I think.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>People who a newly born baby first confronts are its parents, for sure and then a baby come to spend most of their time with parents until they’re grown up to a certain degree to go to school. Everything that he or she is curious about is answered by his or her parents.</MI1> <EX><TR>During childhood</TR>, small kids follow the way their parents behave such as the way to speak or the way to eat, unconsciously setting their parents as a standard in their minds.</EX></BO1> 

<BO2>While they are brought up, their parents give a piece of advice to their lovely children and come to be the most of reliable ones for them, whenever they meet hardships or problems of choices.</BO2> 

<CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, since parents are the best teachers who can lead their children to a good way, they always should be careful not to give bad influence on their children as well as do their best to be someone respectable.</CO>
column23: The thesis of this essay doesn't even properly answer the question that the prompt is asking. Their argument lacks strong main and supporting ideas to convince the reader of their viewpoint.

column1: 281&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>A child is what his parents make it. This explains the role of a parent is very important to bring their child up. Let’s see what’s the qualities of a good parent.</IN> 

<BO1>It seems lucky to have a rich father for a child but I can’t judge whether he’s a good father or not. Because to be a success as a rich doesn’t mean to be a successful man as a good father. <MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a good parent don’t spoil their child.</MI1> When the child get good grades in exam or find the right way for an old stranger, it’s natural for the parent to praise him. When he tells a lie or does harm to others, he should be scolded by his parent. <TR>But</TR>, many parent omit this scolding. They think giving him a lecture loses his nerve, however be strict when needed is necessary for a child.</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2>Parents are the best teachers.</MI2> <SI2>Children follow their parent’s behavior and words. <EX>Suppose a child has a father who is a swindler, there’s not much possibility of him being a great person. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, if his father works for social welfare, the child might be a person like him.</EX> A child resemble his parent therefore parents should be always righteous everything. The influences of parent’s way of living to their child cannot be ignored.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO>Every parent wants their child grow to be a great man. <TR>Well then</TR>, nothing can be got without effort. Chide your child when he’s wrong. Don’t be stingy with praise to your child when he does a good work. Although to be a good parent is hard, you must do your best to educate your child upright, A good parent makes their children as a good parent also.</CO>
column23: There is no clear thesis statement in this essay. The essay seems scattered, like the student is unsure of what (s)he wants to see.

column1: 282&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Most students learn a lot of subjects in high school. History, literature, philosophy, ethics, fine art, music etc. <TR>But</TR> students think these are less important than mathematics and science. <TR>In this situation</TR>, do they consent with studying art and music in high school? </IN>

<BO1>There are various subjects in curriculum of Korean high school students. Music and fine art are included also. <MI1><TR>Likewise other countries</TR>, students prefer to study mathematics, English and science things like that.</MI1> Because the grades of those subjects are important when they apply for a university entrance examination. But students are not bothered by music and fine art.</BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2>If students only study kind of science and mathematics, then as he grows older, he becomes more and more insensitive.</MI2> And he might be a machinelike person who doesn’t feel aesthetic sentiments. By learning music and fine art, students can be sensitive to beauty. They can find time to spare in their life, also find the way of enjoying their life.</BO2> 

<BO3><MI3>Some people assert that there’s no time for learning music and art, plenty of important subjects require more time to study</MI3>. <TR>But</TR> I insist just memorize something is not whole mode of study. Students have enough time to do it. And it doesn’t just take times instead helps to concentrate study of so-called 'important subjects' as making him peaceful.</BO3> 

<CO>Science and mathematics cannot make students sensitive and peaceful. All of students can become well-educated class from learning music and art. <TR>It’s the reason why</TR> students should study music and art in high school.</CO>
column23: This essay lacks a thesis statement. The lack of argument damages the rest of the essay, which suffers from lack of a clear sense of direction and poor formatting.

column1: 283&In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>In Korea, there are not abundant natural resources because of the small size of the country but, there are many labors. <TR>So</TR>, Koreans develop many industries. <TR>Therefore</TR>, my country meeds for land to be developed. The followings are that support this fact.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>At first</TR>, Korea don’t have much natural resource and so, we can’t develop the agriculture and forestry well. <TR>So</TR>, we must grow the industry to enhance the nation’s economy.</MI1> <TR>But</TR>, our country’s lands are not big. <TR>So</TR>, we must develop the land as much as we can for the industry. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the government are chaging the use of the not well-used land(for example, the desolated faming land or burned forests) into the industrial area continuosly</EX>.</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, there are many people in Korea.</MI2> The population is increasing whenever years go. People need their house but, the land for housing is not plenty. Most of them live in the apartment instead of the mansion. There was the law called ‘Greenbelt’ in the past. This law decided some green lands and restricted the area, which people can’t use for the residence. <TR>But</TR>, because of meagerness of the land, the government abolishes this law and allows people build houses in the area.</BO2> 

<BO3>Some oppnents argued that Korea don’t have to developed the land much because the country can advance the economy using the high-tech industry which don’t use the big factory or the aquatic-products industry. <TR>But</TR>, these industries have the limit and we can’t grow our economy fully with only these industries.</BO3> 

<CO><TR>Consequently</TR>, it is indispensably necessary to develop the land for Korea which has small natural resources ,high population rate, and small lands.</CO>
column23: This student's essay suffers from many things, including a lack of a strong argument and weak vocabulary and grammar command.

column1: 284&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Students in high school study many subjects. Among these subjects, some students want to study art and music ,and others do not. <TS><TR>I agree that</TR> it is necessary all students to study art and music. The followings are that support my opinion. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>At first</TR>, Most thought and emotion of the people comes from seeing ,hearing and writing or drawing.</MI1> <SI1>Art is the knowledge about seeing and drawing. And music is the knowledge about hearing. <TR>So</TR>, Studying art and music can help students in adolescence extend their range of thought.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, if students study art and music, they can feel and know the authors idea and emotion. <TR>From this point</TR>, students can obtain the ability to see the world's affairs in many points of view.</MI2> Some students who go to the college of science and want to be a scientist or engineer can also get the ability that they can solve problems of the science in many ways and many views.</BO2> 

<BO3>Some opponents argued that it is no use that students who dont want to be a artist or musician study art and music. Because they think students can be a professional as studying only concerned their interesting subjects or knowledge when others are studying art and music. <MI3><TR>However</TR>, without the wide range and flexibility of thought, students can not be a man who can understand and solve the events in the world.</MI3></BO3> 

<CO><TR>Finally</TR>, <TR>I agree that</TR> students should be required to study art and music in high school because art and music helps people get the ability to see the many affairs in flexible view points and ways.</CO>
column23: This student has no evidence or examples supporting his/her nearly-nonexistant argument.

column1: 285&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:

The question asks me where authority of the university spend the money which students paid for their tution fee. <TS><TR>I struggly hold my opinion that</TR> university need to use more money for libraries than for sports.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>The main reason to go to college is to study their interests, and the place for students to be able to learn is a library.</MI1> <SI1>Most students go to library for studying,and searching information that they have never known before. They should be farmilar with their subjects through the process.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2>There are many activities taking place in library,such as studying, meeting, searching for information and so on.</MI2> These activities mean that library isn't only place for studying.</BO2> 

<CO>Students of the university don't have the same interest,but the main reason is to study deeper and wider than when they were high school students. library enable most of students to learn and do. <TR>Finally</TR>, <TR>it is a tough choice</TR>, <TR>but i have to lean towards that</TR> unlike sports facility, library is the main center of university,and everybody think it is necessary for them.</CO>
column23: This student has problems with things like articles and other basic grammatical structures. Also, there is no evidence given to support their argument.

column1: 286&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3:
<IN><TR>In general</TR>, most of respected supervisors have something better than any other people in the emotional point of view as well as in the professional point of view. <TS><TR>Among them</TR>, I think listening carefully to co-workers, coordinating between them and powerful leadership to break through hardships are three important points to be a good boss.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the higher one gets promoted, the more carefully one should listen to other people.</MI1> A boss must know what workers complain or what are needed for them to encourage them to improve efficiency of works. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, a supervisor should have an ability to coordinate conflicts between coworkers impartially.</MI2> Keeping a balanced position, he/she should handle them perfectly so that they do not ruin a company’s work. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, a company needs one who has an excellent leadership.</MI3> <SI3>When a company faces hardships, a wise leader will gather scattered minds of workers, giving them courage to overcome troubles and make a sharp decision to get rid of them with his/her experience and wisdom.</SI3></BO3> 

<CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, in a company, people who are good listeners, coordinators with powerful leadership are doubtlessly accepted as good leaders. These people are welcomed by normal workers as well as by companies’ owners.</CO>
column23: This student does not make a good argument at all, simply restating different parts of the thesis in different body paragraphs without giving supports.

column1: 287&Do you agree or disagree that business should hire employees for their entire lives
column3:
<IN><TR>Nowadays</TR>, it is a heated controversy whether business should hire employees for their entire lives or not. Some people support the life employment system while others oppose to hiring employees for their entire lives. <TS><TR>I don’t agree that business should hire employees for their entire lives for two reasons. <TR>In addition</TR>, the current flow of the job concept has been changing from eternal hiring to contract hiring.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>The primary reason I can suggest is that</TR> companies can lead to flexible management when they are in a disadvantageous financial situations.</MI1> <SI1>Managers or owners must manage to their firms with their own plan. If they cannot lay off or take away employees as occasion demands, that might immerse enormous swamp. <EX>When South Korea came into economic crisis in 1997, many companies had it difficult to fire employees because of the inflexibility of the labor market. That resulted into more a critical situation.</EX></SI1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>The secondary reason is that</TR> employees can improve their careers through changing jobs.</MI2> <SI2>If employees who work at only one occupation leave their office, it would be difficult to find out easily new job. To experiencing a variety of filed, they will make it possible to increase their value. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, the current president of huge companies such as Carly Fiorina, HP’s CEO, Michelle Dell, Dell Computer’s CEO and so on, had several jobs before taking on the current position. A wide diversity of experiences make them undertake the presidency.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people say that whether business should hire employees for their entire lives or not. <TR>My own view of the matter is that</TR> I am against for hiring employees for their entire lives for two reason: the flexible management and employee’s value improvement. These help our country as well as employees make a growth rapidly.</CO>
column23: This student uses a nice variety of sentence structures, though his/her thesis could be more specific and stronger.

column1: 288&People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things; other people learn by reading about things; others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific example to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are several ways to learn something new. By doing things or by reading about things, even by listening from people who have already had the same experiences. <TS>Among these I think the best way to learn something is doing that myself. </TS></IN>

<BO1>Then let’s look over each method. <MI1>Learning by reading books or any is also important.</MI1> <TR>Needless to say</TR>, a good solution to solve problems can be found from books. But this method has a possibility that it may be an theoretical solution only. <TR>Next</TR>, learning by listening to people talk about things also can be a effective way. But this method may be a dangerous solution because it depends on someone’s personal thought or feeling. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, it is very important that doing oneself to learn something is the most positive method.</MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I learned the internet first, I didn’t have much knowledge about computer technology. But I tried to find out information that I wanted to get without anyone’s help. Even though I read some books, but I learned more things through doing myself.</EX></BO2> 

<CO><TR>Conclusively</TR>, I would like to emphasize again that the best way to learn something new is doing it myself. If we do something ourselves, regardless of successful or unsuccessful results, we will learn more than any other methods.</CO>
column23: This student strays from the topic, not really dicussing why one option is best for him/herself. Additionally, the arguments they do make are poorly-supported, following vague, unconvincing ideas.

column1: 289&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematices. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think it is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>Studying history and literature gives students an insight into the humanity itself.</MI1> History is not merely a collection of past accidents. It is an attempt to explain how our civilization has acquired present formulation. Literature is not merely an amusing storytelling. It expands our imagination and inquires our human nature.</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2>Science and mathematics are considered more and more important as the technology develops rapidly.</MI2> What we can get from them, however, is only 'how to' knowledges. They do not answer the questions of 'what' or 'why'. Only the mind that is trained by history and literature can give those answers. </BO2>

<CO>We live in an era of science technology. <TR>Surely</TR> technologies give us wealth and convenience. But without the wisdom to use them correctly, they may even hurt us. <TR>That is the reason why</TR> the importance of studying history and science cannot be overemphasized.</CO>
column23: This student uses neither varied sentence structure nor varied vocabulary. His/her argument is very simple and not convincing at all.

column1: 290&Parents are the best teachers.
column3:
<IN>We can meet many teachers not only in school but also in other places.<TR>In addition</TR>, it is very important to meet good teachers for the future.Some say parents can not be good teachers.<TR>In contrast</TR>,others say that parents are the best teachers.<TS><TR>There are two reasons why</TR> I agree that parents are the best teachers.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>,parents can teach not only academic knowledge but also their experiences for their children.</MI1> <EX><TR>When I was young</TR>,my parents tried to teach how to study and how to make good friends.<TR>In addition</TR>,they want t o make me strong,ev en though I face many difficult situations.<TR>Therefore</TR>,they gave me many books about famous people who overcome their dificulties successfully.These procedures was so helpful that I could not forget about those story whenever I face difficult situations.</EX></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>,parents can understand their children.</MI2> <SI2>To be good tearchers,they should understand their students.<TR>Therefore</TR>,parents are the most a ppropriate teachers who can understand their children.<EX><TR>When I was a child</TR>,my tearchers could not understand me because they could observe only my school life.<TR>However</TR>,parents could know not only my school life by asking many questions about school but also my daily life.</EX> To know and understand s tudents i s most important thing to teach efficiently and effectively.<TR>Therefore</TR>,we can say parents are the best teachers. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>,parents can teach us their experiences and understand us very well. <TR>In my opinion</TR>,parents are the best tearchers,<TR>therefore</TR> they should try to be good tearchers for their children.</CO>
column23: This student starts with a weak, unspecific thesis, but the rest of the essay is generally good. The structure works well, and there are decent examples to support the student's argument.

column1: 291&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be repuired to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>In human history, people have developed many fields of studies. <TR>For instnace</TR>, science, literature, economics, art and music, etc. Especially all fields have been studied by specialists. And they have many critical attractions and profits to some critical specialists. <TR>In other words</TR>, science has attraction for scientist and music has attraction for musician.</IN> 

<BO1><TR>But</TR>, it can't be said that all of the specialists have interests on their fields only. Scientists also have attraction on music or poetry as novelists have their interests in science. <TR>And</TR>, why do they have interests in other areas?</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Generally speaking,</TR> art and music make our lives richer.</MI2> <SI2>In modern society, our conditions for our lives are so mechanical that people think he is not a human but a element of a modern society. <TR>As a result</TR>, people have dried minds and emotions. Art and music awake our dried emotions and minds. They stimulate our hearts. So they can make our lives abundant. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>Art and music give us inspiration.</MI3> <SI3>people who study their critical field only have a tendancy to diminish their point of view. So they have less clues for creation than they had past. When poeple was stimulated by art and music, they have more inspirations and creative powers. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Einstein, a genious physicist, was a good violin player. I think that he could be more creative by playing the violin. </SI3></BO3>

<BO4><MI4>The age of youngster is very important period to form his charactor or point of view for life.</MI4> <SI4>A charactor formed in his age of youngster can last through his life. So, when he goes to high school, education for emotion and mind is very important. Art and music contribute to this education effectively.</SI4></BO4> 

<CO><TR>Conclusively speaking</TR>, all of the high school students should study art and music. That will be profits through their lives.</CO>
column23: This essay lacks a thesis statement that is relevant to what the prompt is asking. The essay feels very messy and directionless as a result.

column1: 292&In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples.
column3:
<IN><TS>In Korea, there is more need for land to be developed for housing and industry. Because there are so many people in small area and it would be profitable economically. The followings are statements that support my point of view.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>At first</TR>, The GNP of Korea is under 10,000$. <TR>In short</TR>, Korea is just a developing country.</MI1> <SI1>If we keep developing about housing and industry for long enough, eventually economic status will be better than now. People will get a job from industries and they’ll have their own house. I doubt if it is useful that there are more need for land to be left in its natural condition is.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR> there are so many people in small land.</MI2> <EX>The survey shows that 70 percent of Korean live in the metropolitan area. It’s one of the highest population rates in the world.</EX> After developing for housing and industry, it will make Korean life better.</BO2> 

<CO><TR>For the above-mentioned reasons</TR>, there is more need for land to be developed for housing and industry. It has much merit economically and it’ll give the Korean better life. If we keep it for long enough, eventually Korea will be one of the strongest and happiest country in the world.</CO>
column23: This essay starts with a good thesis, but it is very poorly supported. It would be nice if the student had clearer main ideas and more evidence with which to back those ideas up.

column1: 293&People have various ways of relieving stress. What are some of the ways that you find most effective in relieving stress. Give reasons and examples for your response.
column3:
<IN>There are some stress to most people in rather complex modern society. In order to resolve it, many ways of relieving are used to develop. <TS>I have about 3 ways for it, and Im sure that they make me feel free.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, when I get a certain stress I usually sleep enough.</MI1> <SI1>To sleep sufficiently gives me relieve all organs of my body and mind. I think this is the best way which I can get a new start.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, sometimes it's a good way watching movies which I'd like to see usually.</MI2> <TR>Besides</TR>, while I see it if I could lay down on a sofa or a bed, my body could be relax.</BO2> 
<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, I used to go a strange town or store - for example, bookstore, new restaurant or cafe having a good mood -.</MI3> If I do like that, my mind fall into concerning of the place. I could not concentrate on usual thing and it's possible to be far from stress.</BO3> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, whenever I receive some stress I have a few things to relieve it. I could do both body and mind by using these ways for relieving. They are so effective to me and I'd like to recommand other people to do it which I do.</CO>
column23: This student has weak grammar skills, in addition to a weak thesis and argument. This essay reads more like a list than a well thought-out essay.

column1: 294&Last 100 years benefit to my country??
column3:
<IN>The historical event which happened in the past 100 years influenced my country so much. It's hard to numerate each event. <TS><TR>However</TR>, all events made my country more strong and stand alone in the world. If someone asks me which is one of the events that influenced your country a lot, I can categorized as following</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I'll mention bad-point.</MI1> <TR>In chronological order</TR>, we lost our country to Japan in the early 1900's. <SI1><EX>Japanese took our language which means our soul and culture. It's not allowed to speak in korean during the colonial period. some koreans try to take our right back and appeal to international society. During the struggle, we lost our family, friends and it made lots of separated family. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, some koreans support Japanse's authority to Korea. It made the trouble among koreans inevitably.</EX><EX> Korean war is another big factor to change korea. <TR>Actually</TR>, it's kind of war which is generated from power game between the US and Soviet Union. From the war, so many civilians as well as soldiers are killed, many industrial capital were destroyed and the relationship between South and North are getting estranged. it was very undesirable both countries.</EX> However the Misfortune in Korea does not finished. <EX><TR>In 1970's</TR>, the millitary autority got political power. The accident is very important in the aspect that It made korean's thinking distorted. People had no freedom and creative thinking. They just followed others and government suppress the press and make people thinke the same.</EX></SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I'll mention good-point.</MI2> <SI2><EX>After indendence from Japan, we became the member of international society. we opened our country, developed eoconomy as the 13th largest country in national commerce in the world. many koreans are working in the world and show their brilliant skills in various fields. </EX> The ways of people's thinking were changed. <EX>After military government, we got speech freedom and started to pursue individual happiness. Women also started earnestly to step out the house and try to get their rights.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO>Past 100 years was very critical to korea in both sides, negative and positive aspects. <TR>However</TR>, it became a history and never comes back again. <TR>Now</TR>, my country is ready to take another 100 years. <TR>At this time</TR>, we will show matured attitude to any events not to get painful experience again.</CO>
column23: This student's essay was hard to grade because the prompt itself is confusing and vague, so I don't know if the student was responding properly or not. However, the student uses a good variety of sentence structures and vocabulary.

column1: 295&"When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3:
<IN>Do you know why most highly successful people succeeded in? People might say because they have good luck. <TR>But</TR> real luck visits those who do their best by themselves. One's dream is not predestined <TR>but</TR> changable. <TS> <TR>Thus</TR> I maintain that people's success is from hard at work. </TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, you might know about biography of Thomas A. Edison who called the king of invention.</MI1> <SI1>He had spent an unfortunate life with his disabled ears. <TR>But</TR> we can recognize and thank to what he made and brought to us like phonograph, vacuum and electricity. He said, "Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration". <EX>Personally I believe it is from his whole life.</EX></SI1> That expresses it is very hard to reach one's triumph. <TR>But</TR> some people may insist that a person can bring a successful life without any work. If it is right, the society will become unfair. <EX>NO PAIN, NO GAIN. </EX></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>I'll take this for example secondly. If a student wants to finish the semester earlier than others, he should study at the double.</M12> <SI2>The professor let him finalize his work by means of his efforts. If he had believed only luck, he could have failed to his college life. As you can see, good luck can spoil one's lives, <TR>Furthermore</TR> people who don't try for his life and satisfy his luck, he can't get more because of his mind.</SI2> <TR>In other words</TR>, hardworking brings a good fortune. <EX>ROME WASN'T BUILT IN A DAY. </EX></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>From my point of view, a destiny is not fixed but variable.</MI3> <SI3>No matter how long it takes, one's final position and be changed. If we try to do something with 70%, there should be followed the same percent of luck. <TR>Therefore</TR> there's no senses in trusting only luck. The luck can bring not only good thing <TR>but</TR> also bad one.</SI3> The more depend on the luck, the more lose one's confident. </BO3>

<CO><TR>As a result</TR>, only luck can't bring a success in one's life. What I want to stress is that we need lots of perspiration, control mind and self fulfillment. It's essential that the we make the luck knock our life.</CO>
column23: The author provides a few good reasons to back up his arguments, but the inclusion of the famous sayings are wholy unsupported and tacked on in an odd and distracting way. Some word use problems also detract from the overal reading of the essay.

column1: 296&"When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3:
<IN>When people succeed, they think of various ways about it. Some people say the succeed is only help with luck and others say it is the resalt of hard work. <TS>Both luck and hard work are the essential element to become success but I think that hard work is more important part; <TR>thus</TR> I agree with the statement above.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason</TR> why I choose the hard work to succeed is that people can get a self confedence with hard work.</MI1> <SI1>If people have worked very hard and they can't gain any resalt and any achievement, they will so disappoint that they are tired of most things. <TR>Thus</TR> they will not be challenge any job and they will believe only luck.</SI1> <TR>However</TR>, if people can gain some resalts with their hard work, they will feel worth of their effort and they will endeavor more than before. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I think that hard work is the most important part to be a success as hard work invite the luck.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example</TR>, we can think our ancestors who recorded by success people such as Columbus, Edison and several presidents. They achieved they want by hard work and repeat a lot of mistakes. If they believed only luck, they couldn't record and famous as now.<SI2> luck is follow hard work when people effort their job with attachment. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I agree with the statement that when people succeed, it is becaus of hard work. As people work very hard, they can gain self confedence and invite the luck. <TR>Thus</TR> they can satisfy with their resalts. These days, many people consider the importance of the hard work as part of the success.</CO>
column23: It feels well thought out and written. There are some obvious spelling errors and grammatical errors. It had a fairly clear flow to it and had a decent argument.

column1: 297&“When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success.” Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3:
<IN>Some people said that luck has nothing with success. <TR>But</TR> I disagree this opinion. Success always has anything with a important thing. <TS>This is because people who succeed in a field usually has rich parents, and they have suitable period in succeding and attaining a work.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people who was born in rich parents usually has many resources to succeed.</MI1> <SI1>They have the chance to attend good colleges or can be taught by excellent teachers in a private school, attaing good prestige. If they are born in a poor home, they can not attend good universities or get the good information to succeed in a field. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, there are a famous expert about experimental subject of lung cancer in Korea. Because he was born in a rich house, he attended a best university in Korea. And he studied abroad, and got the Ph.D in a Harvard University in U.S.A.
