If he had a poor parents, he could study for a long time.</EX></SI1> <TR>Thus</TR> having a good parents is a important chance to succeed in a field. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another reason why success has anything with luck is that people who succeed meet usually a suitable period.</MI2> <SI2>Although people has many efforts in their subjects, they may fail or drop in a situation. They need to make efforts in a certain time. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, sony company is famous example of successful companies in Japan, and in 1960 their supervisor had good luck when they can export the small walkmans in United States. He could export walkmans in the time when U.S.A has not interfere with this small item like walkmans, and he got three bilion dollors.</EX></SI2> If the supervisor in a Japan tried to export in 1970 or 1980, he could not sell this products.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, the people who want to attain a prestige are always have anything to luck, because they can be born in richer house than other people , and they meet a suitable time when they study very hard or try to succeed. If they do not have this sources, they can not have chance to succeed whether they make a effor in a field. 
<TR>For these reason</TR>, when ordinary people who want to succeed read their biography, they will always realize that the sources of success has anything to luck.</CO2>
column23: I liked how the essay was formatted and organized. An early issue was with the thesis that didn't make a complete thought.  It should not be a fragment. There were many sentences and thoughts that were not carried out to completion and there created most of the problems that resulted in the low grades this essay received.

column1: 298&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3:
<IN>Technology has improves with large factories. Large factories are essential for our country's development. <TR>However</TR>, if a company has announced that it wished to build a large factory near my community, my answer is No. <TS>Although there are advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on my community, I think there are much more disadvantages.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, advantages from a large factory can be attractive.</MI1> <SI1>If a large factory is built near my community, it needs many employees. So many people wanting to make money will move into my community, obtaining their jobs.</SI1> Products from the factory are sold in many citied and countries of theirs in accordance with that a factory makes our community prosperous. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, there are many disadvantages outweighing advantages.</MI2> <SI2>As a large factory is built in my community, many new other problems occur. The water near my town is polluted and the air is also contaminated. As many people come into my town, there are many serious traffic problems such as traffic accidents, jams and so forth.</SI2> My community that has been quiet and peaceful turns out to be distracting. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, building a large factory near my community has some advantages. I, <TR>however</TR>, personally oppose to build a factory around my town because environmental pollution and expected disturbance. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I strongly oppose the building a factory near my community.</CO)
column23: There were some good points presented in this essay, and the direction of the essay was good. The main problem was that the language used in the paper was fairly elementary and predictable. It didn't carry much weight.

column1: 299&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3:
<IN>It completely depends upon what kind of factory it is and how the current economic status of my community is. <TS>Based on my real situation in real life, I agree with the idea of building new factory in my community because of the beneficial effects it may contribute to our community. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>There must be many advantages that are expected to be acquired by the presence of a large factory.</MI1> <SI1><TR>First of all</TR>, new large scale factory will need a lot of workers who will be in charge of the production, management, and other kinds of task in the factory. Many jobless people in the community can get a new job. This kind of large factory will attract people to the region where it is located.</SI1> In order to meet their need, there will be lots of new infra structures <TR>such as</TR> new roads, transportation system, facilities such as theater, sports complex, things like that which is obviously a plus to one's life. </BO1>

<BO2><SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, there might be some negative effects of the industrialization <TR>such as</TR>, pollution of air or water caused by the production activity in the factory, social problems caused by the increase of population in the community.</SI2> In order to control those kind of egative effects, a considerable amount of money and efforts will be needed. <TR>However</TR>, these negative effects is the necessary evil which we can't avoid, but we should control. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, building a new factory in the region which is not so much industrialized is definitely desirable. But we all have to keep in mind that negative effects caused by it should be suppressed in order to protect ourselves from the things like ecological disaster or crimes.</CO>
column23: The author's word usage was proper and good. The author's grasp of the issues at hand were also good. The main issue was that there was little in the way of supporting examples for the main ideas. The author simply defined the word of the benefit or disadvantage rather than giving any sort of understandable examples. The author also failed to produce any real conclusions outside the original thesis except that the options must be examined.

column1: 300&A friend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on vacation or to buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your friend's two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>If one of my friend is hesitating whether to use his money on a vacation or buying a car. <TS>I would recommend him to buy a car. Because we can use a car again and again, has many ways to use. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, buying a car is better than going on a vacation because a car is a permanent property.<MI1> <SI1>That means, a car does not disappear or become invalid by using it. Supposing a car’s life is five years, the friend will be pleased whenever he uses it for that five years.</SI1> <TR>Besides</TR>, a vacation is only one time pleasure and lasts only in memory. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, a car is useful to many affairs.</MI2> <SI2>The friend can uise it to commute. <TR>Instead of</TR> taking crowded rush hour buses, he will enjoy listening to a car audio and relaxing. <EX><TR>Also</TR>, the friend can buy heavy things at a market place. With a car, he doesn’t have to move heavy things from bus station to home. <EX></SI2> Where vacation doesn’t devote to any practical usage. </BO2>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR>, a good vacation can relax him, revitalize his body, and can be leaved as a pleasant memory for long time. <TR>But</TR> a car can be a good investigation and having a car has far more practical advantages like I mentioned above. So I’d recommend him to buy a car rather than to go on a vacation.</CO>
column23: The author does a very good job of presenting his ideas, explaining and supporting them, and then drawing the conclusions together to make a grand conclusion. This was wonderfully done. The author, however, chopped the sentences when they should not have been. Even the thesis is detrimentally cut and needs to be put back together to work here. These vocabulary and grammer issues are major.

column1: 301&Business should do anything they can to make a profit. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3:
<IN>It is commonly said that the purpose of business is to make a profit, what is a definitely correct. But the problem is how they achieve it: if it wants to make money through economic process, it is required that the methods they hire should not leave any room to blame. <TS>I therefore disagree that business should do anything they can to make a profit for the 2 reasons stated below. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, if the place in which business is performing to make a profit is defined “economy”, like many other fields, there will exist law, which is a regulating system.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Thus</TR> if a company is allowed whatever they can do for their profit, it is highly possible that the law will be violated because a company’s primary purpose is money. And that means order of a society and its economy is destroyed, which can lead to harm company itself too. <TR>Therefore</TR> while business is pursuing its profit, observing the law or as a broader meaning “order” is a essential point. <EX>Take a look at this case. One company tries to put away with industrial waste, which is extremely harmful to surrounding environment. Without law or regulating its activity, that company will let it out with no any stumbling block.</ES></SI1> And as anybody will agree, that definitely should not happen! </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, if we leave companies do whatever they like to do in order to make a profit, they will put their primary concern on money not customer.</MI2> <SI2>They don’t need to concentrate on research for the purpose of improving the quality of their product, nor have to consider the convenience of the buyer. The protagonist in economy I think is not a company but a customer. <TR>Therefore</TR> a producer should always think of what people want and make such goods as they like but company like.</SI2> Through those processes, economy will grow and it will do good to both of them, </BO2>

<CO><TR>So far</TR>, I mentioned 2 reasons why business should not do anything to make a profit. <TR>First</TR> one was because, by doing so, law would mean nothing so that society might void of order. <TR>Second</TR> one was that consumer is the primary concern in economy otherwise company do whatever they like to and do not think of consumer, <TR>consequently</TR> leading to lack of interdependence and no communication between a company and a buyer. To somebody leading or managing business, and government, never oblivious those two points should be.</CO>
column23: Good thesis, organization, understanding of the issues, examples to back up the points, and a conclusion to wrap up all the points of the essay.  I just felt that the word choice could have been just a bit better. Also, using the number 2 rather than spelling it out made the otherwise outstanding paper feel a bit cheapened.

column1: 302&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Read and think about the following statement: The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Use reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN><TS>When we make decisions, we can decide quickly or carefully.</TS> Some people think that the decisions made quickly are always wrong. I disagree with that. <TR>Of course</TR>, quick decisions are likely wrong more than careful decisions, <TR>however</TR> they are not always wrong. In some cases, they would be better than decide too deeply. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, there are situations that we have to make decisions quickly.</MI1> <SI1><TR>As an example</TR>, imagine that you are taking a test. You have to answer whole questions in limited and short time. When you meet question in which you can't answer certainly, you must not spend much time for it. You have to answer that question as quickly as you possibly can and pass it.</SI1> Except this case, in our life we meet many situations in which we have to decide quickly. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, quick decisions can be more exact than careful.</MI2> <SI2>To find best solution we consider carefully every possible situation. <TR>But</TR> in that process we can be confused and our thoughts can go wrong way by over-thinking. In short time, after we see only the fact, we can make brief and proper decision.</SI2> Many thoughts and preparations aren't always good. Immediate decisions can be more exact than them. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusions</TR>, decisions made quickly aren't always wrong, and we can face a situation in which need a fast solution. <TR>Furthermore</TR> quick decisions would be better than careful thoughts. <TR>Therefore</TR> we have to decide according to situations: when quick decisions are needed, we decide quickly, and when careful considerations are needed, we decide carefully.</CO>
column23: This essay suffered from sentences that did not flow together and poor word choice. The greatest problem was that none of the conclusions to any portion were carried through to any other points or to the final conclusion. Therefore, while there was something to be said per individual point, they were useless in the end to come to any real lasting conclusion.

column1: 303&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Read and think about the following statement. The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Use reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people make a decision after enough time or other people prefer to make a decision promptly. Those who think after considering sufficiently will decrease their mistake. <TS><TR>Despite</TR> this merit there are several reason why prompt decision is important.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, in a sport game or a battle people should decide rapidly because time is the most important factor for winning the game.</MI1> <SI1>In a soccer game, if one decides to pass someone for a long time, the one's team will be likely to lose the game.</SI1> Excellent soccer players have speedy foot and prompt brain. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, People should behave quickly at emergence condition because loose behavior is dangerous.</MI2> <SI2>If one hesitates what to do with next neighbor's firing house it will result the neighbor's death or much loss in an estate.</SI2> It is the best choice to call the police and inform other people about the accident as quickly as possible. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, soldiers who have speedy hands and feet will be praised more than soldiers who work carefully because after a labor soldiers will be allowed long rest.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Also</TR>, private soldiers' thought is not needed in the army.</SI3> They only are required to listen their boss's order and behave as senior indication. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people who act quickly in a sport game or in emergency condition will have better result than people who make a decision after careful thought. <TR>In addition</TR> as if experts do jobs quickly prompt behavior indicate their capacity.</CO>
column23: This essay was fairly well prepared and written. Its strength was in the main points and examples given. One issue was that the thesis was only basic and not forceful while the conclusion did not tie up the conclusions found before it but rather tried to come up with a few final points to sqeeze in. This was unnecessary and actually made the paper weaker than it otherwise would have been.

column1:
304&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? 
Parents are the best teachers. 
Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I disagree with the statement that parents are the best teachers </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>It might have been true in older times when parents were only teachers to give their children such as lessons their children such as survival skills, artistic skills , habit and manner etc. because there had not been much of a educational system . </MI1><BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, nowdays, children spend their time in the public education institutions rather than in the home.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Especially</TR> in Korea where the university exam is strangling children, 
they are forced to attend there to learn English, piano, swimming and so on. </SI2>
so they have more time with their teachers not their parents. 

<BO3><MI3><TR>what 's more</TR>, more women participate in social activities than older times.</MI3>
<SI3>they're not mere housewives anymore. <TR>so</TR> somebody needs to look after the children instead of their parents. </SI3><TR>so</TR> parent affect their children less and less. </BO1>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR>, parents innately affect their children. and it cannot be denied. 
<TR>but</TR> In modern times, it is true that the effects on their children are declining. 
<TR>In sum</TR> up I think the parents are not the best teacher, but supporters of their children.</CO>
column23: This essay has some good ideas and examples but has a major issue due to its lack of really any introduction, lack of overal structure, and lack of conclusions for the main points, whatever they were.

column1: 305&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>A zoo can be used various purposes. Children can see about many kind of animals. Student can study the characteristics of animals. Scientists who study animals can also research and observe the behavior about animals. <TS><TR>So</TR>, I think a zoo is very valuable place in our society. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>When you are young, you can't enough chance to see many animal near your house. Even, you liked animals, you just could raise limited number of animals such as dogs or cats.</MI1> <SI1><TR>However</TR>, you can lots of animals by visiting a zoo. Eventuall they can watch very close distance and even can touch.</SI1> Therefore, childrens can feel and recognize the real animals. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Also, students can compare the true fact what they had already known.</MI2> <SI2>Most of their classes, they just learn through a textbook. It can provide plentiful of informations, but they cannot really figure out unless they can see.</SI2> So this visiting course is necessary for the studnet. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, scientists who study animals can take many unknow information by observing an animal.</MI3> <SI3>They have numerous experiment in laboratory, however, it is not all their tasks. <TR>In additional</TR>, to purpose more effective experiment they need the information of behavior from the group of animals.< /SI3> <TR>In this case</TR>, a zoo is desperately needed. </BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, a zoo has very useful purpose. Children can see in early age, students can learn and scientisets can observe to get informations. <TR>So</TR>, I believe that a zoo will develop continuously as our neighborhood.</CO>
column23: I feel that this essay was very well written with most of the errors made in spelling and grammar. The overal structure and organization of the essay made it an easy read and made the conclusions easy to follow through to the end.

column1: 306&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons and support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some students may prefer to study art or music because the subjects are both easy and interesting. <TR>On the other hand</TR> there are some students who dislike to study art or music because the subjects are not important to pass the university's entrance exam. <TS>But there are several reasons why all students should study art or music essentially.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, art or music is important part of our daily life and is the valuable key to understand our culture.</MI1><SI1> If we see picture which was drawn before, we can know the life style where the picture was drawn. <TR>In addition</TR> music which was composed at some time teach us much information.</SI1> Art or music has played a major role as human's language. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, Art or music will raises students' emotion. Students experience various changes in high school and they can be unstable in mental condition.</MI2> Good classic music can make these students stable. </BO2>
<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR> students can enjoy listening to music or drawing a picture for a long time.<MI3><SI3> Many people go to concert or galley when they have leisure time because music or picture gives them pleasure.</SI3> If students learn the knowledge of music or art in high school they can enjoy music or art more deeply than those who didn't study the subject. 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR> there are many subjects which are studied in high school. <TR>Among them</TR> music and art are necessary subjects in high school because they give students various cultures' information and valuable pleasure.</CO>
column23: This essay was not very strong or too exceedingly week in any point.  There weren't any forceful examples or conclusions made that made the reader want to agree with the author's points. The language was fairly simplistic and short with no real adjectives used to bring color to the essay.

column1: 307&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Attending a live performance (for example, a play, concert, or sporting event) ismore enjoyable then watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>There is a saying "Seeing at least once is much more worth than listening hundred times". <TR>In fact</TR>, we are unable to figure out and defind a matter untill the moment that we confirm with observation. Watching television is almost same as listening to radio so we can not sympathize certainly.<TS> <TR>Hence</TR> I comply with the statement "Attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television". </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, let us take basketball, forinstance, the atmosphere in the dorm is extremly exciting.</MI1><TR>Although</TR>, you probably can make a similar atmosphere infront of television with your family or friends, it can not be campared to the greatest one in the gym full of the audiences' screaming, players' sweat smell, and both' passion. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore</TR>, television allows you to watch only limited portion of a event.</MI2> <SI2>You only can see what cameras focus on , but there are plenty stuffs to watch over the main event such ass cheerleaders' dance, players' unique gesture, and so on.</SI2> <TR>However</TR>, if you are attened at a live performance, you can not miss any of those interesting substances. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, even though, television furnishes a incredible service, it does not provide you a scorching atmosphere and a freedom of view as much as sitting at a live performance. <TR>Thus</TR>, I prefer to attend live events. </CO>
column23: The author makes good use of adjectives to bring color to the examples and allows the reader to live and experience them so that they can more easily agree with the author's points. The main thesis was fairly weak though and only showed assent rather than full agreement.  This is in great contrast to the examples that were very good.

column1: 308&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Most parents seem to believe that high schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. In Korean educational environment, it is not actually impossible for students to select courses. Most students of high school are prepared for the entrance exam of university. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, they are likely to select subjects about the entrance exam.</TS> And subjects schools’ authorities can provide are limited. So I disagree with that.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I suppose that most of selected subjects will be English and math.</MI1> <SI1><TR>That is to say</TR>, because students are concerned with the entrance exam, the effect of allowing students to select courses is humble. <EX>For example, after the entrance exam did not include the second language, its classes mostly disappear in high schools. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, authorities are not capable of supplying a variety of subjects.</MI2> <SI2>High schools’ courses are composed of general and essential subjects. If students don’t study one of the courses, they don’t acquire part of basic knowledge. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, I didn’t study Chinese character, so I feel hard to read textbooks including that. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, selecting courses by students seems to be more effective. <TR>However</TR>, we should realize our educational environment. Students are absorbed in the entrance exam. And there are still not various courses but basic courses in our high schools. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I don’t agree that students should select courses in high schools.</CO
column23: The author made this a very difficult essay to follow and understand through the end. I am still not really sure what the author wanted to convey and how the supporting points and conclusions were supposed to fit in the final paragraph.

column1: 309&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people often argue that students should learn about history and literature at first rather than science and mathematics. <TS>Even though I recognize the importance of history and literature, I’m opposed to their opinion that they are more essential to students than science and mathematics.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1>I am willing to accept the fact that history and literature provide for students a lot of valuable knowledge of cultures, traditions, customs, and so on, however, it is narrow-minded to insist that they are more important to students than science and mathematics.</MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>In some or most aspects, science and mathematics are more influential on human life than history and literature.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example</TR>, we turn on TV to watch the news program when we awake, use a machine to toast bread, start a car to get to the workplace, and boot a computer to begin daily works in every day. All of the machines we use daily are originated from science and mathematics which produce technology. It seems to me that without them, we can not survive or have a difficulty in maintaining our life.</SI2> <TR>But</TR>, it is not likely to trouble with a usual life without historical books, novels or poems</BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, recently science and mathematics are considered as one of the most important factors that determine an economic, military and competitive power of a nation.</MI3><SI3> Almost advanced countries such as America, England, Germany, France etc., which are flourishing economically and militarily and occupying leading positions in the world, have developed their technology based on science and mathematics and tried to grow up a lot of scientists and technicians continuously for many decades. Developing countries are also making efforts to advance their science and technology which lead to the shortest way to be strong countries. </SI3> Many political and economical leaders in the world also emphasize on the importance of developing them. </BO3>

<CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, it can be said that science and mathematics to develop technology play a more significant role in our life than history and literature. 
As the materiality of the science and mathematics is gradually increasing, more weight is added to them. <TR>Finally</TR>, for students to study science and mathematics is more essential than to study history and literature.</CO>
column23: This seems like a fairly strong essay. It is easy to follow along with the author's line of thought and where the author wants to take the reader in the end. The points and examples are well tied together and work together very well for the end purpose. The sentences are also well written without too many errors in spelling or grammar.

column1: 310&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support our answer.
column3:
<IN>I strongly agree with the statement " most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future." Suffering from difficult experiences is certainly hardship and adversity in one' life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, if one is capable to handle those pains effectively, they can make one more stronger person. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>I believe that most people have fallen in love with opposite gender at least once when young.</MI1><SI1><TR> Perhaps</TR>, some had a sweetest memory that they never forget, and the others may failed with a large, incurable damage on their heart since love does not always fulfill what we want. One person or the other must be hurt if it ends and will seek for another love to recover the pain. By experiencing the pains, both can learn the answer of the troubles that they had, what to do, and what not to do in a relationship.</SI1> They would not make identical mistake to each other, therefore, it will be an important lesson for both. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Losing friends or relatives is a very painful happening in a human-being' life.</MI2><SI2><TR> In those situations</TR>, most people are apt to give up what they have, what they were working on, what they wanted to be because they may be the worst sadness one can have in one' entire life.<EX><TR>For example</TR>, my friend' parent left her alone with a younger brother by car accident when she was sixteen years old.. Before the accident, she always used to skip classes. <TR>For sure</TR>, her marks were below the average. Because of responsibility of everything in her family and her young brother, she came back to her track and began studying hardcore in school. </EX></SI2><TR>Finally</TR>, she was able to graduate highschool and find a job in a famous company with a high salary. </BO2>

<CO>The point is that the ability a restoration from difficulties will be a invaluable lesson for one' future. The capability will make a person more stronger and laborious in any hard situations. <TR>Finally</TR>, I agree with that most painful experiences in our lives that seemed hard at the time become valuable lessons for the future.</CO>
column23: This author makes good points that, while a bit more romantic than what I had expected, came to formulate a good conclusion. I felt that the author could have been a bit more forceful in some of the claims. It felt as if the author was unsure of the fact that most people fall in love with the opposite gender in their lives. The fact is obvious and should be portraid that way.  This same problem came up several times in the paper and made it difficult to really believe the author if the author could not be seen to believe him/herself.

column1: 311&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Only people who earn a lot of money are successful. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Most people seem to believe that people who has a lot of money has success. This is a myth that many of our generation like to hold. This common belief, however, has several critical flaws. <TS>I will demonstrate why supporting only those who has a lot of money are successful is not acceptable and should not be praised for reasons of two conditions of success and a subjective viewpoint.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, success generally requires two conditions; spiritual and material.</MI1> <SI1>Even though some people succeed in material condition, if they do not succeed in spiritual condition such as honor, authority or family happiness, they will feel unsuccessful. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when someone who has huge money dies if nobody comes to see him, it cannot be said that he was successful. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, grading success is decided by a subjective viewpoint when they reach their goal.</MI2> <SI2>Success could be changed case by case. Success cannot be rated by an objective measure like money. The measure of success may be not only money but also honor or love. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, even though somebody died with poverty if he was satisfied with his whole life, then we can say that he had successful life. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In Conclusion</TR>, I demonstrated why I disagree that only people who earn a lot of money are successful. I strongly have the opinion that success should be considered in terms of spiritual as well as material conditions and should be measured by a subjective viewpoint.</CO>
column23: The author comes across as very confident and willing to take a stand. The points and supporting arguments are very philosophical, but they are utilized well to help formulate a final conclusion. Well done.

column1: 312&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people argue that parents are not best teachers. Their argument, of course, has a reliable reason. <TS><TR>However</TR>, in my point of view, I agree that parents can be more precious and influential teachers than any other due to become good models and to find out their children’s merits and faults correctly.</TS> The followings are statements that support my point of view.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason</TR> to support my opinion is that parents may become good models for their offspring.</MI1> <SI1>This equals to the meaning that children has grown with imitating his or her parents’ behaviors since the first birth. <EX>Let me present an example of my experience. My father is a politician who has leadership. Since my childhood, I have learned my father’s leadership, and then I was used to be president of class during school time.</EX></SI1> <TR>For this reason</TR>, parents are shining examples. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>The second reason</TR> to support my opinion is that parents can correctly know about their sons and daughters near to them.</MI2><SI2><TR> In other words</TR>, parents who raised their children and affected to form children’s characters have acknowledged their merits and faults. <EX>To illustrate what I mean, parents can teach right way when their children face problems. </EX></SI2> <TR>Like this</TR>, parents are good instructors. </BO2>

<CO><TR>As a consequence</TR>, I would recommend that parents are the best teachers for the above-mentioned reasons; becoming good models and teaching right way. What I want to stress is that home is the first school in life for everybody.</CO>
column23: The author has very interesting and well laid out points to make the conclusion desired. The transitions between the paragraphs are really lacking, however, and the final sentences in each body paragraph do not come to any meaningful conclusions. These, as well as the grammatical and vocabulary shortfalls gave the essay a low score.

column1: 313&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>Although parent can be a teacher, it does not necessarily follow that parent is the best teacher.</TS> I have a couple of reasons why I don't think that parent is the best teacher. one is that parents in these days are busy because of their work. Another reason is that they have no appropriate knowledge to teach children. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, Many parents have no enough time to talk with their children because of their work.</MI1> <SI1> Children in Korea say that they talk with their parents for a few minutes a day, for example. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, parents have not much knowledge for which children need.</MI2> <SI2>I know very few percentages of parents in Korea studied at college or above.</SI2> Although parents are professional in a field, they are ineffective at teaching to children. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, Parents have no enough time to teach their children because of their job and have not much knowledge for teaching their children. I think that parents are not the best teachers, but they are good supporters for children everyday.</CO>
column23: The author has some good points but essentially fails to make any real conclusions in the body paragraphs with which to tie together in the final conclusion paragraph. This makes the essay at best mediocre.

column1: 314&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave?
column3:
<IN>Many people seem to believe that different clothes influence the way people behave. <TS>In this essay, I will demonstrate my supporting through some specific experience as a registered nurse. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>I am wearing a nurse uniform during my working time and acting as a professional nurse and surely feel myself as a nurse, but things are changed if I am not wearing the uniform.</MI1><SI1> In orthopedic area I usually take care of the patients having open wounds; fractured bones, stitched skins and amputated legs or arms. For the patients my duties are not only administrating medicine and reliving pains but also dressing the wounds. Some times changing dressing is not so precious thing to do right before meals, because it can be smelling, bleeding and making my cloths pretty dirty.</SI1><TR> Nevertheless</TR>, theses are cannot be any matter, the crucial thing is performing the duty perfectly for the suffering patient, and consequently I have no problem to enjoy meals. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>One day I met a co-worker for lunch in the ward where I am working.</MI2> <SI2> She was dressing an open wound for the patient who had an amputated leg and had not have a prosthesis yet. After seeing the unpleasant situation my lunch was already over. It grossed me out.</SI2> As I figured out the only difference was wearing the uniform and not. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, it is required that I wear the nurse uniform. Wearing the uniform I can prepare myself and it makes me do my duty better. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I truly agree with that different clothes influence people’s behaviors.</CO>
column23: The essay seemed well thought out but had isses because it could not articulately spell out what exactly the body conclusions were. These were not well tied together in the conclusion. The other and final issue was the use of passive voice in much of the essay. This makes it difficult for the author to make any real forceful statements to convince the reader.

column1: 315&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific example to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>A lot of people are influenced by their clothes. When someone wears formal suit, he/she'll probably try to keep manner and be polite. <TR>And</TR> if someone is in the funeral with black clothes, he/she should be calm and refrain from entertainment. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, in my opinion, clothes is very important to control people's behavior.</TS> There are some kinds of reasons to support my point of view. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, Human being is a social animal who hardly live without interaction with other people.</MI1> <SI1>It means that people have a tendency to be affected by others and try to do what other people want them to do. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a person who are pretty restrict and conservative, always wears formal suit, wears casual wear, some people who don't know him well might think that he/she is quiet liberal and extrovert.</EX></SI1> In this situation, he maybe behave more generous and smooth than as it ever. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there are various kinds of clothes and each of them has it's own function.</MI2><SI2> A sportswear is designed to play a sports more efficiently and a uniform is designed to unify a certain group.</SI2><TR> So</TR>, if a person wear a special clothes such as a uniform, sportswear and so on, he/she is likely to behave 
following the clothes' function. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In consequence</TR>, some people might assert that clothes can't influence people's behavior, but according to some reasons that I've mentioned above, I am not reluctant to say that different clothes influence the way people behave.</CO>
column23: The author did a great job in organizaing and writing this essay the only real issue was that there were grammatical problems that made it difficult to read. Word usage was a bit lacking as well.

column1: 316&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing a game is fun only when you win. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>After playing a game, it is natural that a winner is more pleasant than a defeater. <TR>But</TR> this fact doesn't mean playing a game is fun only when we win. <TS>Although we lose a game, we can learn a lot experiences and are familiar to unknown friends.</TS> It also gives us fun. I can offer specific reasons to support my belief. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, losers also enjoy playing a game because they can progress their skill or they can make healthy body.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, when you play a kind of card game with your friends, you may often lose the card game if you don't know the rules of the card game. <TR>Notwithstanding</TR>, you can love the game because of the attraction of the card game. <EX>In my case, I often play a basketball game after my classes. I continue to play a basketball game although my losing days are more than winning days. As many as I catch a basketball, I can feel my progressive skills. </EX></SI1>Without the result of the game, I can enjoy playing a basketball game. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, unfortunate players also enjoy playing a game because they become friendly with unknown plays.</MI2> <SI2>I believe that there is not better way of becoming close with unknown people than playing a game with them. When many male students in Korean university go to a picnic with other girl students, they often play a game with the girl students in a garden.</SI2> Sometimes a male student may lose the game consciously because a penalty from losing a game makes the relation between him and his girl more loving. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR> I disagree that playing a game is only when winning because we can make our healthy body, progress our skill through a game or become friendly with unknown plays.</CO>
column23: The author makes use of good points and examples as well as a forceful thesis to draw the reader into the essay. There were a few word choice problems here and there throughout the essay, but it was overal a good read.

column1: 317&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teachers should be paid according to how much their students learn. Give specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN><TR>In principle</TR>, I don't have any opposition that all men should be paid according to their ability and reward the result of time. In school matters, however, we have to reconsider the relationship between students and teachers. Education is not simply measured by certain standard, it has something to do with complex problems. <TS>In my opinion, teachers should not be paid according to how much their student learn. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a quality of education is not related with the length of time.</MI1> <SI1>Some talanted teachers can teach more effectively particular subject in a short time. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was a middle school, our class has two science teachers. The two teachers have different studying method. We, however, all had more easily understood the young teacher's explanation in a very short time than older ones.</EX></SI1> In this case, is it desirable the older teachers get more paying? Probably not. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR> there could be the possibility that some popular classes always could full of student.</MI2> <SI2>This phenomenon can cause serious problems. They needs harmonious knowledge and balanced view point. <EX>Suppose that most students attend english class, and just little students participated mathematices class. </EX></SI2> Even teachers could earn more money, we may not anticipate those studnet will be a excellent viewpoint. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conculsion</TR>, I think studnets should not be the victimes of the teachers desire to the money. <TR>However</TR>, we can think another positive way such as extra curriculam activity. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this could be the one alternative.</CO>
column23: The author could have been a little more forceful in the thesis statement from the very beginning and provide a few more pointers as to which way the essay content would go. The examples were not very vivid or obviously relevant to the conclusion.

column1: 318&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Many people seem to believe that television has destroyed communication among friends and family. <TR>But</TR>, my opinion on this common belief is rather different. I think this is an exaggeration. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, television could be helpful for their communication in my opinion. <TS>In this essay, I will demonstrate why supporting that television has destroyed our communication is not acceptable and that it could help them for two following distinct reasons.</TS?</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, television has various programs showing about the other people and cultures different from us.</MI1> <SI1>By watching these programs, we can better understand them or their cultures. I will take the program about teenagers for example. If parents watch it, they can better understand their children. <TR>In addition</TR>, they can know their children’s thinking and what they want.</SI1> These will be very helpful when they communicate with their children. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, television could inspire our discussion.</MI2> <SI2>By watching the television, we can have common subject of conversation and share our thinking with others. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, easily we can find students talking to friends about popular sitcom or news that they saw yesterday.</EX> <EX>I will take example one more, my family.</EX></SI2> When the world trade center collapsed, we discussed about the terror group after hearing the news. </BO2>

<CO><TR>in conclusion</TR>, television can help our communication by helping our understanding about the others different from us and inspire our discussion by letting us have common subject and share our thinking with others. According to the way that we watch the television, television can rather be helpful our communication. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I don’t agree that television has destroyed communication among friends and family.</CO>
column23: The author has a great introduction to begin the essay and carries these thoughts and conclusions through the remainder of the paper. The only thing that I would have wished more for was an additional example in the first body paragraph to give it more meaning and clarity.

column1: 319&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>“Television destroy communication among friends and family.” Some people may argue like this with their own plausible explanation. <TR>However</TR>, once they have read the following two reasons contradicting their argument. <TS>They are sure to realize that their idea is wrong. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, one crucial reason is that by watching television we can have common interest regarding TV programs.</MI1><SI1> Getting common interest helps us easily to communicate with family. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, for last three years, our family could not have any common interest. <TR>However</TR>, nowadays a TV program called “Friends”, the most popular TV program in Korea, become common interest to our family. </EX></SI1><TR>After that</TR>, our family can have much talk regarding the TV program, and another affairs. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the other reason consists in having opportunity to get together with family at the same place through watching TV.</MI2><SI2> Getting together at the same place is needed closely to communicate with family.</SI2><TR>Actually</TR>, a recent survey conducted in Korea shows that almost 80% of family with a television usually gets together at the same place for watching television. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, through watching television, we can have common interest regarding TV programs, and can have more opportunity to meet family and friends at the same place. The merit mentioned above can make much more opportunities to talk with their family or friends. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is clear that televison don’t destroy communication among friends and family.</CO>
column23: This was an average paper that was hurt by a very weak thesis that did little to provide structure for the remainded of the paper. The supporting survey examples and other facts were good for the essay though and made it worth reading at least for that.

column1: 320&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN><Nowadays, we spend much time to watch television and enjoy watching TV. In relation with this topic, some people think television destroys communication among friends and family. <TS>But I believe that as we watch television, we can make more close relationship with each other.</TS> I will give several reasons to support my opinion. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, we can talk about interesting subjects with our friends and family because television gives various stories.</MI1><SI1><TR> For example</TR>, during or after watching drama program it is interesting to criticize about drama's characters or its story. <TR>Also</TR>, when we watch sport games such as world cup and Olympic, we can exchange our information about teams and appreciate sport game foreseeing which team will win. </SI1>Television gives us sources to converse with each other. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, we can be for a long time with our friends and family without boring and this time allows nature conversations.</MI2><SI2> In our family's case, our all family like to watch TV, so in the afternoon we gather in the same room in which television is placed.</SI2> Although our family are busy, we can talk about the daily life naturally watching TV. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, I can often meet my friends who live in the same dormitory because television is placed in rest room. <MI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think television helps us communicate with our family and friends. <TR>As you can see</TR>, I am sure about this because television provides story materials and makes more often us get touch with our family and friends.</CO>
column23: This paper could have used a much better thesis, but the body paragraphs started out strong with good ideas, supporting arguments, and conclusions. The third paragraph could possibly have been eliminated. The conclusion paragraph was a good summary of the events.

column1: 321&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students’ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>I don’t agree that statement. Universities have so many things to be invested for students such as gymnasium for health, library for study, classroom for lecture ,cafeteria for nutrients and so on. <TS>Library should be distributed more portion of budget than other facilities. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Library is the heart of the University.</MI1><SI1> The main responsibility of University is to give proper knowledge to students and to seed philosophy on students’ mind. <TR>So</TR>, University should lead students to study and enable students to absorb in their majors. <TR>For this</TR>, universities should provide valuable resources and comfortable rooms, so-called libraries. <EX>When I was a University student, the library in my school was inconvenient for students. There were a lot of old books, not new ones. Chairs and desks were ruined. The worst thing was noise by construction around the library. So most student in the library were disturbed. </EX></SI1> <TR>Of course</TR>, they couldn’t devote their mind to study and used to complained inconvenience of library. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, new information system is required ,since internet is dominant to the world. </MI2>
<SI2><TR>So</TR>, libraries should equip new internet system. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, internet is not optional thing. It’s absolute necessity especially for the libraries which deal with information and intelligent data. We can get millions information about various fields through internet. If any party in the world ignores internet, it should fall behind in its field. </SI2> <TR>Likewise</TR>, schools nowadays need to invest more budget to libraries than before. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Partly</TR>, I admitted the importance of sports activities for health.</MI3> But for the students in the internet dominant world, the libraries equipped with new systems are imminent. </BO3>

<CO><TR>onsequently</TR>, I suggest that universities give more money to libraries than to studens’ activites.</CO>
column23: The author had a fairly week introduction and thesis. It seems that the tasked topic of the essay did not line up with author's wishes and the author just made due with what was in his/her mind. The supporting ideas were a great match with the main ideas of the essay though and made it very interesting.

column1: 322&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students’ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN><TR>Generally</TR>, many students are interested in as one’s health as one’s study and do many sports activities at the rest time. <TS>But I think that Universities should investigate more amount of money to their university libraries because of the following two reasons; more necessity of students’ study, the development of library utilities.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1>Most students want to gain the references for one’s detail study and new information for one’s future career.</MI1><SI1> It is very difficult that one person collect new information from rapidly changing society.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, To satisfy students’ desires like this Universities should be possessed of many references such as books, magazines and articles in library. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, Library utilities like a searching machine and a reading room are developed.</MI2> Since it is important to easily search and to conveniently read the books which student want, Universities should supply computer searching program and wide reading room. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, University library is the most important facility to fulfill students’ needs for learning and career. Although Universities should support their students’ sports activities, I believe that university library should be given more money than their sports activities.</CO>
column23: The author does a great job of tying the essay to the topic and coming up with good ideas to bolster the final conclusion. The main problem was that the author provided almost no supporting evidence for the main topics and included no examples. This made the arguments fairly hollow in the end.

column1:
323&Do you agree or disagree with the golloing statement? 
Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific 
reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN><TS>We have casily gotten lots of informationfrom watching a television.</TS> <TR>However</TR> I atree with the statement that "television has destroyed communication among friends and family". I want to present two reaons to support this statement. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>No one deny that television deprives our time of communicating with our family or friends from watching it.</MI1> <SI1>In my daily life, when I was young, after class, I went home and turn on TV. <TR>Usually</TR> I watched on TV until I went to bed without and conversation with my family. I believe most pieple did so.</SI1> The most important thing is this problem still goes on. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>I have heard that television is a foolish box.</MI2> <SI2> I think it's reasonable. Television makes us more passive. We can obtain much information through watching on TV without any effort. We don't have to go to libraries to get some information. Also we easily accept opinions that we watch on TV without criticizing them.</SI2> It makes us to be individuals without different personalities. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum up</TR>, television tends to reduse conversation between family members and makes us more passive. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly agree with the statement.</CO>
column23: This average essay had some good ideas and supporting evidence. The first major issue was that there were no great examples anywhere. The other problem was that the author's desire to write as little as possible in the conclusion made it read at a very elementary level.

column1:
324&Do you agree or disagree with this statement? 
the most important knowledges does not come from books. 
Use specific reasons and examples ro explain your choice.
column3:
<IN><TS>People get many informations and knowledges while living.<TS> <TR>Then</TR>, where do they get a great amount of knowledges? They'll may have knowledges through books, TV, movies, Internet, and also experiences. Some people think that almost every significant knowledges come from books. And others think that they does not come from books. There are reasonable reasons why these people think like that, and I will also take a look at each points. But, personally, I 'will take the view of the latter. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I hope to tell you the opinion of the former.</MI1><SI1>These people insist that we can only get small amounts of knowledges from other kinds of media except books.</SI1> <TR>And</TR> they also say that the knowledges we are having from Internet, TV, and movies are not exact ones and these materials can't cover knowledges as deeply as books do. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, others insist that we can have knowledges from books, but we can also have many important ones through other ways.</MI2><SI2> They say that we can have more real and recent informations from Internet. <EX>In my case, When I was a child and didn't know how to use computers, the only way that I could have most important knowledges was books. <TR>But as I grow</TR>, I find it is more convenient to use computer. I could have realistic and specific informations from Internet, TV, and sometimes movies rather than books. And I also could have important messages by myself through experiences. </EX></SI2> <TR>By experiences</TR>, I could learn how to deal with that kind of situation. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I'd rather say that we can have many knowledges from Internet, TV, movies, and experiences as well as books. Because we call Internet as a "sea of information", <TR>in other words</TR>, there are enormous amounts of informations. <TR>And</TR> also other mediums can be very useful if we try to search for informations. <TR>So</TR> we should take a look at all kinds of ways that can give us valuable informations. All things can be a good teacher of us if we use them efficiently.</CO>
column23: The author used a very polite and very good styling to write this essay. The only real issue here was that the thesis was not strong at all nor gave good direction for the essay. It would have been good to know with confidence what the author wanted to convey.

column1:
325&Do you agree or disatree with the following statement? 
- Parents are the best teachers.-
column3:
<IN><TR>>Usually</TR> if you thing about teachers, you might recall your school teachers. <TR>Although there are some great teachers</TR>. <TS>I believe that pareats are the best teachers.</TS> I have a couple of teasons to support my essay. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>>One reason is that parents are perpetual teachers for us.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, school teachers stay with us and teach us for a limited time. They are changed by changing years and moving into other schools. <TR>However</TR> parents can continually teach us about their experiences that they have taken for their lifetime </SI1> Even they passed away, they influence our life. </BO1>

<BO2><TR>Another</TR> one is that eventhough our parents don't have any expert experiences, they know everything we need to live well. <TR>For example</TR>, we obtain only well-estabilished information such as science, literature and engineering from school teachers. <TR>However</TR> we abtain wisdom of life while talking with our parents about our surroundings. </BO2>

<CO>To sum up, parents perpetually teach us essential things that make our life thrive. For these reasons, I agree with the statement that parents are the best teachers.</CO>
column23: There is a promising seed to this essay. The ideas are good but are not really built up to form a real paper with a in deptph analysis of anything. A few reasons are given, but they are not brought into any form of real conclusion at any point. Some of the sentences are fragmented and not joined into full sentences.

column1: 326&Do you agree with the folloing statement? Attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Todays there are many live performances like concert, sports event. And the more people go to there the more time they can have. Why do they prefer it to just watch on TV? <TS>It’s because it has some merits than watching TV.</TS> Some specific reasons are like below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, it can make us more concentrate on the play.</MI1> <SI1>TV shows just some special situation by the lenses. But it cannot show others. <EX><TR>For example</TR> in the stadium, we are one of the people like players.</EX></SI1> But in our home there are many routine stuff like doing dishes and taking phone and so on. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it’s important to share our feeling with other people in the place.</MI2> <SI2>And it can make us understand the performance well. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in Korea there is some famous street performance with masks. All players talk about the critical point to politicians or famous people. </EX></SI2><TR>In there</TR>, people can laugh at the show and agree with their opinions. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR> these days, many people work indoor.</MI3><SI3> And it’s natural that they have no chance to do outdoor activities. </SI3><TR>So</TR> going to a live performance helps us move our bodies. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR> it’s good for modern people to go to a live performance because of the reason like above. Most important tning is maybe we can meet a lot of people and feel a lot of emotion than in home. So how about going to a live show in this weekend with your families?</CO>
column23: The introductary paragraph had some shortcomings when it came to fragment sentences. This also hurt the thesis. There was also an overreliance on what could be transition words such as 'and' / 'but' which seem to be used as place fillers in this essay.

column1: 327&Do you agree with the following statement? Attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>People who want to see a performance may attend a performance ground directly or watch it on television. <TS>I agree with the opinion that attending a live performance is more enjoyable. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people who attend a live performance can feel enthusiastic mood on the spot.</MI1> To people watching the same event on television could never experience such vivid feelings like a living respiration. </B01>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there are some physical limitations in case of television.</MI2> It is difficult to imagine that people in home could hear sound lively and watch a performance as vividly as on the spot. </BO2>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR>, watching on television could satisfy them up to a certain degree. But, watching a live performance has limitations in vivid, so I think attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television</CO>
column23: While the author has a decent enough thesis statement and main points, the author does not provide much of any supporting evidence to back up the claims. This is a major issue in this essay and prevents it from taking off.

column1: 328&Holiday honor people or events. If you could creat a new holiday, what person or event would honor and how would you want to people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer
column3:
<IN><TS>Holiday honor people or events.</TS> <TR>If you could creat a new holiday</TR>, what person or event would honor and how would you want to people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer</IN>

<BO1><MI1>These days some people consider the holiday to take a rest among their life so that they seem to forget the meaning of holiday and go away with each family.</MI1> <SI1> Though there is some advantage of using the holiday and being recharged, I also want to recommend to set the holiday for pretending to die.</SI1> Here is some examples. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>To the humans being, the death is a special word because a man is a definite existence.</MI2><SI2> <TR>So</TR> by placing " The death day" for allotting one day, I encourage individuals to look back each life and opportunity with desirable mind for own life. <TR>Meanwhile</TR> people think what the valuable life is with their surroundings. Holiday comes from the meaning to spend that day to live meaningfully and purposeful.</SI2> <TR>So</TR> over the time we are supposed to die before family, there must be the meditation time among the days full of works. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>At the same time</Tr>, through this time, the lineage can take care of the members and oneself.</MI3><SI3> <TR>Until now</TR> holiday has not been significant to the people. That's why almost holiday are fix for some event or for the memory of another person. <TR>So</TR> people flock to the resorts and there must be traffic jam whenever there comes holiday.</SI3> By preparing and writing the letters for the members, the peace and love would be given to broken heart of family. </BO3>

<CO>"The death day" can give hope to some people who used to spend to kill the day in a holiday so that they will let each life live meaningful and important. The human being is the limited person. In my view, the meaning of death must be sculptured while people are living on the earth. It will appear that they can experience to assume themselves by this reflective time.</CO>
column23: There were portions of this essay that stood out as being good, but there was no consistency. Some paragraphs had supporting ideas, some didn't. There were also a lack of examples. The essasy was in the most general and broadest of terms and didn't include a specific person as was required by implication.

column1:
329&Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or 
event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer
column3:
<IN>There is no one but loves his father. <TS><TR>But</TR> I think my father deserve to be respected because was a great businessman in the work and he was one of the most human people in the world.</TS> <TR>So</TR> if I could create a new holiday, it would honor my father. People celebrating him, I would make a small house, called “Father”, in Seoul. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason<TR> I would create a new holiday for my father is that he was a great businessman in the world.</MI1><SI1> <TR>When he was 29 years old</TR>, he entered a trade company. He predicted the wet tissue would in fashion in Korea. Being 35 years old, he made a company where he exported various bags to Japan and America. He can speak English, Japanse and Chinese fluently, and there was no problem to do the work.</SI1> <TR>In my opinion</TR> he was one of the people who could predict the future. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason</TR> I would create a new holiday for my father is that he is one of the most human people.</MI2> <SI2> Ten years ago he ran a trade company where he dealt with used machines and made much money. But his friend working with him betrayed and prosecuted him. In a few years he fought the prosecution and won it. Though his friends had guilty, he didn’t want to punish them. <EX>In other cases, there are always bad people who want to steal the money from him. But he forgiving them every time, they were moved at last.</EX></SI2> <TR>So in my opinion</TR>, my father deserves being respected for being human. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>At last</TR>, for people to celebrate him, I would make a small house, called “Father”, in Seoul.</MI3><SI3> Seoul is the place where my father worked, and in the house I would put the picture and books saying the things my father has done. </SI3><TR>So</TR> I inform the fact that the greatness of my father. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if there is an opportunity to create a holiday, I would like to create a one that honors my father, since he is a competent businessman and has also humanity in the work. And to celebrate him I would make a small house where pictures and books are displayed.</CO>
column23: The author makes a convincing case as to why his father is a great person and deserves to be admired by all. The main problem is that this essay does not sufficiently address the topic at hand. The topic is supposed to talk about a holiday that would honor someone, but it seems that the main point of the essay is to point out that the author wants to build a house in the father's honor. Very little is written about what the holiday would be, what people would do, or even what it would be called.

column1: 330&If you could make one important change in a school that you attended. What change would you make? Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Whenever you think about your older schools, what do you recall? <TS>You would think about good and bad stuffs in your school that you attended, and you wanted to change something that you thought the worst thing of school.<TS> I also had one. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>In my country, Korea, we have tree types of high school : male, female, and coeducational schools.</MI1><SI1> When I was considered to attend a female school, I was furstrated.</SI1> As wanted to know about something that you don't know, I was curious about boy stuffs. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>It is reasonable that we could imagine wrongfully something we don't know exactly.</MI2><SI1> When I entered a university, I worried about facing to men, because I had no chance to meet a man in my high school life. Sometimes it's not so easy to understand male friend's thoughts to me. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, men frequintly tald to each other wieth a lot of jargons. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>I realized that it was minus effect not to share each other's thoughts easily, especilly between a man and woman. <TR>Therefor</TR>, if I have power to change one thing for my older school, I would change it to coeducational school.</CO>
column23: The essay quickly goes from its beginnings to a decent conclusion that flows together well. The thesis dis not properly introduce what was going to be covered in the paper. This leads to guess worlk for the reader. Also, there were only about two transitions in the entire essay. There could have been a few more.

column1: 331&If you could study a subject that you have never had the opportunity to study, what would you choose? Explain your choice, using specific reasons and details.
column3:
<IN><TR>Commonly</TR>, music has long been beloved by most people. Not only does music melt one' anxiety, but it also increases more of one' happiness. <TS>If I grab a chance to learn a subject that I have never had the opportunity before, I would choose a music class. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>One of the reasons that I want to take the music class is that there is no pressure in the class.</MI1><SI1> People in the class enjoy the subject. There is nothing such as competitions, pressures, and regulations. By taking the course I can get rid of stress that I got from other things since music have a power of charming which makes people comfortable. <TR>Moreover</TR>, there is no technical sound. I am annoyed by "noise-pollution" almost everywhere. The noise pollution with any other pollution brings me tiredness. </SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, I always look for an exit from it. Music class will be the one I was looking for. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>I want to get an ability that I can write a song.</MI2><SI2> By making immense songs, I want to give so much happiness to people that they can be satisfied with my music. I desire to make a song that cannot be expressed by words. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I love my girlfriend more than ever. <TR>However</TR>, it is not that easy to demonstrate the size of my love to her, but I still want her to know how much I love her. </EX></SI2>Making a lovely, rousing song will be able to let her know the size of it. 

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I want to get out of the stressing life and believe music class will be able to help me to do so since there is no burdens. <TR>Futhermore</TR>, it also can get me an ability to write a song by myself. Then I can communicate the words in my mind. <TR>Hence</TR>, if I have a opportunity to take a new subject, I will take the music class.</CO>
column23: This was a well writing short essay. I knew what the author was talking about and why at every stage of the paper. I felt that it could have used a few more examples throughout the essay, but it was overall well done.

column1: 332&Imagine that you have received some land to use as you wish. How would you use this land? Use specific details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>As heavy population and small range in korea, land is very valuable. I recognize that land is limited resource, so I would like to use efficient it. In my community, seoul, there are lots of people but few green gardens. If I receive some land to use an my wish, I want to make public gardens. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR> the public gardens make better quality of environment and place to learn children the Nature. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, due to car's emission gases and building's heating, the seoul air is polluted dangerously.</MI1><SI1> One of the ten day, we are alarmed the watching carbonyl dioxide, sulfate acid and ozone signal. <EX><TR>Also</TR> in the morning, I cannot breathe fresh air. I have to wear mask for prevent air pollution in winter. </EX> If I build public gardens, it can relax not only air pollution but also my feeling. I work vivid and meet people. </SI1> <TR>Through this change</TR>, I get room of live and relieve my stress. My community sight is looking good. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, such a dense building area cannot get opportunities to learn the Nature for children.</MI2><SI2> Before industrialization my community, I spent the time catching insects like beetles and locust. I played in green land with my friends. But children who live in present are do not have this chance. Even though they have a vacation homework to bring grasshopper or some nameless plant, they cannot make it because there is no green land. <TR>So</TR>, children buy the one from a supporting shop to turn it in for a homework. Can you imagine this happeing? <TR>Consequently</TR>, the building green gardens help children's education. They learn what is the Nature and their emotion also develop.</SI2> They are raise as more generous and care of other people. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In the end</TR>, the green gardens will make my community beautiful as well as functional. During industrialization, we lost lots of beneficial things. We look behind of our trace. With green gardens, we control our thankless activity and enjoy our better condition of life.</CO>
column23: This essay had a few good points and decent potential. It hurt from word choice and grammar at every stage which made it difficult for the point of the sentences to be coherent. Also, there seemed to be some mixing of the paragraphs. There wasn't sufficient clarity and focus in each.

column1: 333&It has been said, “Not everything that is learned is contained in books.” Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3:
<IN><TS>Little wonder that books are one of the most important knowledge sources; no one who studied in a school would question that statement.</TS> I also agree in some degrees, yet I think knowledges earned by reading are some what limited. And there's knowledges which can't be earned by reading books. Those should be learned only by experiencing them. In this essay, I will demonstrate some knowledges gained from books and experiences. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>Books are huge extracts of knowledge.</MI1><SI1> Man developed written words to memorize their thoughts. <TR>And thus</TR>, we can say books were written from the development of words, which is more than two thousand years ago. And from that time mans thoughts were ... by numerous people, in numerous subjects by means of books.</SI1><TR>So</TR>, in books there's virtually everything which can be written down. Such as scientific facts, cultural diversements, business rules, etc. </BO1>
