<BO2><MI2><TR>Meanwhile</TR>, there are knowledges which can only be learned by experiencing himself.</MI2><SI2> How can a man describe his feelings in a single word or two, when fallen in love? <TR>Of course</TR>, there's meaning of the word ‘love’ written in dictonaries. But many people will describe it in very different words. And it will be nearly impossible to feel just like the man who is in love by knowing what it means literally.</SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, especially in abstract things which can not be defined generally, like emotions, should be learned ‘by heart’ from self experience. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To summerize</TR>, I can say that the books obviously contains much general knowledge. While some abstract affairs are better gained by experiencing them by himself. And for none of these two ways of gaining knowledge are inferior or superior, we should both read many books and experience much at the same time.</CO>
column23: The essay is very to the point and is clear in its organization. I felt that the thesis could have been written a bit better so that the paper could be understood better in one sentence. Also, a few examples would have been good.

column1:
334&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in 
your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? 
Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TR>Nowadays</TR> our life-style has changed so much comparing with old days. many people go out to restaurants more often to eat food instead of cooking it at home. I usually go to restaurant because I live alone and don't like cooking. There are already many restaurants near my neighborhood. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I support the plan to build a new restaurant in my neighborhood for several reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the more restaurants we have, the more kind of foods we can eat. Imagine only one restaurant in your neighborhood.</MI1><SI1> Then you would eat only a few kind of foods it offers.</SI1> If we don't have a chinese restaurant in our neighborhood, it is not convenient to eat chinese food. But if we have diverse restaurants, we can taste various kind of foods as many. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the more restaurants we have, the better service we can get.</MI2><SI2><TR> As I demonstrated above</TR>, If we would have only one restaurant, that restaurant would not care about the quality of food and the service to customers so much. But if the number of restaurants would increase, they would compete each other and, consequently, the quality of food and their services would be upgraded.</SI2> <TR>Also</TR>, the price of food might get down. 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I support the plan to build a new restaurant in ny neighborhood. A new restaurant will offer to us more chances to choose a food and result in competition among restaurants in quality and service.</CO>
column23: The essay is very to the point and is clear in its organization. I felt that the thesis could have been written a bit better so that the paper could be understood better in one sentence. Also, a few examples would have been good.

column1: 335&It is easier to maintain health today than in the past. Disagree or agree?
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might assert that it is easier to maintain health in the past than in today. <TS><TR>Contrary to popular belief</TR>, I believe that it is easeir to sustain health today than in the past for two reasons: ability to deal with stress, and economic abundance that helps people to be healthy in modern era.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, living in today's world enables people to deal with stress and thus maintain health.</MI1><SI1> This is attibuted to the fact that living in the 21st century can distract people from worries and stress. It is obvious that there are more entertaining activities or facilities that distract people from worries and stress in modern period than in the past. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, in these days, we can watch television programs such as 'American Idols' and 'Dexter Series'. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this simpel and quick escape from reality that derived from benefit of modern period may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy.</EX><EX> According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010, there was a significant difference between two groups of students in managing their academic pressure. Students in Group A who are students in the 21st century were more satisfied with their school lives than those in Group B who were students in the early 20th century. This is especially true given the fact that in the early 20th century, catastrophic events such as world war frequently occured. <TR>Moreover</TR>, students in Group B were involved in dangerous activities such as smoking, drinking and stealing to cope with their stress.</EX></SI1> This directly indicates that living in today's world make people to be more healthy.

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, life in the 21st century enables people to have happy and therefore healthier life.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that in these days there are more abundance in terms of finance. <TR>To be specific</TR>, the world's GDP in 1950s was approximately 40% of that of today's. The money tends to represent their power in society by showing their ability to attain whatever they want ranging from fancy cars to even trust in realtionships. This is evident given the fact that modern society runs on materialism. <EX>According to the Ministry of Health and Welfare of Korea in 2009, there was a huge difference between two groups of employees in happy index. Employees in Group A who is currently a working man owned a house and those in Group B who were working man in the mid-20th century rented a house. In the mid-20th century, a number of people in the U.S. lost their home because of the bankrun incidents and economy crisis that was very often at that time. The researchers showed that the level of happiness of Group A was much higher than that of Group B. The happiness and health has dicrect correlation as stress that derived from lack of happiness weakens immune system of body. <TR>Moreover</TR>, more than 60 percent of the employees in Group B underwent severe depression. They constantly worried about paying rent in order to maintain a roof over their head and to care their family.</EX></SI2> This shows that living in modern epoch is more easier and happier.

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, although many people argue that it is easier to maintain health in the past than in today, the benefit of living in the present time far outweigh the benefit of living in the past in terms of health. <TR>All in all</TR>, the importance of relieved stress and increase finance abundance in modern era cannot be underestimated in order to have healthier life.</CO>
column23: Well rounded and well prepared essay.

column1: 336&It's better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>It is said that growing up children in the countyside has many benefits than growing them up in a big city. In point of views of sensability, harmony with nature, formation of personality and so on. <TS>With these good sides, I still think that there are far more effectives growing them up in a big city than a countryside. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, let us think of this. Here is your child crying for some illness and you are now out of the door for your work.</MI1><SI1> Your neighbor may give a hand to your child easily in a big city because they are at hand. But if your child is in a countryside, your child may be in a serious trouble without any help for the scarcity of neighbors.</SI1> <TR>Moreover</TR> there are dramatically dangerous places in countryside, for instance damp, dark forest and lake etc. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>I understand nature gives us many mental comfort.</MI2><SI2> <TR>But nowadays</TR> in a big city, there are lots of park and other comfortable places.</SI2> You can fully enjoy yourself with your children out there in a safe fence. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, most big cities have well-constructed social utilities.</MI3><SI3> Your children can participate in many social progrems and they also can improve their abilities.</SI3> It helps they can learn how to organize their way of behavior and thought in a group. </BO3>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR> there are some risks in a big city. But you only to avoid that kind of things for fear? Never forget that you have responsibilities to grow up your children in better and the best circumstances with safety comfort and constructive welfares!</CO>
column23: While the thesis and topic seemed good, there was too little content to each section and point to come to a full essay. This was just a number of sentences grouped together into an outline.

column1: 337&Many parts of the world are losing important natural resources such as forest animals or clean water. Choose one resource that is disappearing and explain why this is to be saved.
column3:
<IN><TS>Since the Industrial Revolution in 18th century, people have been only thinking about industrialization and thus productivity.</TS> <TR>Meantime</TR> our precious natural resources have been regarded just as good sources for the sake of industry. Among them I am going to put out clean air as an example. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>As industrialization goes on, its byproduct, pollutant, increased dramatically.</MI1><SI1> And during the early stage of industrialization or even present time, it can not be denied that people didn’t pay great attention to pollutant and its function to our environment and life. People, especially ones of governments and factories, acknowledge, of course that industry is destroying the environment and lowering quality of air. But because their primary concerns are making a profit, it is true that that problem have been ignored and sometimes connived so far. <EX>Heating power plant, for example, which converts fossil resource like coal, and petrolume to available electricity, necessarily produces harmful gases to atmosphere.</EX></SI1> But we have been depending so much on that kind of plant in order to get electricity although we know that excessive dependence on it will cause harm, after all, to human kind. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, another source that causes us not to be able to breathe clean air is automobiles.</MI2><SI2> Automobiles have increased surprisingly rapidly in modern times and corresponding gases from those are extremely noxious to human.</SI2><TR> Although we know that</TR>, on the way home, on the way to see buddy, or even on the way to school, we have no choice but to inhale that poisonous air. </BO2>

<CO>Clean air is essential to human life. There are lots of example from which we can get some lessons that even one leak of harmful air results in death of several hundreds of people, especially children and the old. We definitely should do our best to preserve clean air and try not to spoil it because it is crucial problem about our quality of life, and life itself. And also it is this generation’s duty to make our sons and daughters breathe clean air and live a healthy life. It is about time for us to work on that problem right now.</CO>
column23: The essay was fairly well written. It could have been a bit more balanced so that the second body paragraph wa s proportionate to the first body paragraph. This would have also solved the problem of the supporting ideas.

column1: 338&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific
column3:
<IN>Why do one go to travel to new places? I mean, what do they want to obtain by travelling to new places? To enjoy exotic landscape? To taste foreign food? Or just to enjoy themselves by travelling? These will make sense too. <TS>But the critical reason they travel to new place is to know and understand the culture they are visiting.</TS> From now on I am going to mention why poeple go to museums while travelling. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>Let's think about this. What are there in museums?</MI1> <SI1>Which is a easy question. <TR>Of course</TR> Museums have precious national treasurea as well as ordinary people's life style. <TR>In other words</TR>, museums show culture of that country. And like I mentioned above, the main purpose of visiting a new country or new places is to understand their religion, arts, land ife styles, in short culture.</SI1> That is why people go to museums. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>moreover</TR>, museums has all kinds of works just in a building.</MI2><SI2><TR> Accodingly</TR> museums provides the easist and the most effecive way for visitors to experience the culture. <EX>My country has enormous amount of precious and historically valuable works because she has a almost five thousand years of history. As you guess, many poeple from foreign countris come to visit and experience the small country in the East. And I heard that visiting museums among their courses of trip is not counted out.</EX></SI2> <TR>Because</TR> it is the most convinient way to "know " Korea. I love their trying to experience Korea. </BO2>

<CO><TR>So far</TR>, I mentioned 2 reasons why people go to museums while travelling new places. That's because by doing so, the main purpose of travelling is achived. <TR>That is</TR>, museums are coulture of that country itself. The second reason is during just seceral days of journey, museums are the most efficient and the easist way to understand the culture, the primary reason of travelling.</CO>
column23: There are many fragments in this essay as well as a lack of the required specific examples needed to make the arguments that make a good essay.

column1: 339&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3:
<IN>There is a Korean proverb that says, “Neighbors are like cousins”. This means that neighbors are very important in our daily life and we should get along with them very well. But, in these days, most of people who are living especially in urban area hardly care about what happens to their neighbors. <TS>If we want to make our daily lives more flourish, I think the followings are the qualities we should have as good neighbors</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we should respect neighbors’ private lives.</MI1><SI1><TR> For example</TR>, some people turn up the volume of their audio to an extent that their neighbors can hardly concentrate on their works. This shows that they don’t care about their neighbors. If these kinds of things continue to happen, they cannot be good neighbors.</SI> They will end up in blaming each other, which will be a great stress for their every day lives. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we have to be interested in our own neighbors.</MI2><SI2> It is very important to know what happens to them if we want to be good neighbors. <EX>Today may be the birthday of one of our neighbors or his or her parent may have passed away.</EX></SI2> If we share our joys and sorrows with our neighbors, joys will be largely increased and sorrows will be greatly relieved. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, neighbors should help one another.</MI3> <SI3>Our neighbors might be sick alone at night. Some criminals might intrude neighbors’ houses. We should help our neighbors actively when they get in trouble.</SI3> We can also be in the same situations. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if we don’t bother neighbors’ private lives, show interest toward our neighbors, and help them in trouble, we will live better life with them as if they were real “cousins”.</CO>
column23: A weak third body paragraph hurts the rest of the essay because it lacks the supporting ideas, connections, and conclusions needed by the rest of the paper to flow at its best.

column1: 340&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbors? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>In this scoiety, it is commonly said that the term "neighbor" seems to be disappearing.</TS> It might be because people are getting concentrated their concerns on themselves or their family not other poeple. And people started to feel that neighbor don't need to be with because they don't want to be interfered by them. But it is not a desirable phenomenon because neighbors can make our life more precious. I am going to examine over that qualities of good neighbors. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>As a Korean</TR>, I remember I was loved by many neighbors as well as my mother.</MI1><SI1>There's a saying that "Nearby neighbors sometimes are better than indifferent relatives". And I think it is quite right. The first quality that a good neighbor should have is taking good care of their neighbors. <EX>I remember onetime that my mom cook a food and told me , "Take this food to neighbors." <TR>At that time</TR> I could't understane mom but I realized that that's what neighbors are for. Onetime when I was young, my mom had to go out to take care of something, and I came home after school. And I had no keys and was very hungry,</EX></SI1> One of nextdoors kindly cook delicious food for me and lend me some toys so that I don't get bored while waiting for mom's comming back. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The second quality that a good neighbor should keep is, I think, trusting neighbors.</MI2><SI2> As trust between people in modern society is disappearing, it seems to be meaningless to say about neighbors. Trust people who are living right next to your house, and then they will trust you too. That's how good relationship between neighbors starts. <EX>My mom sometimes leave a message saying " Keys to home are nextdoors". That means she left keys to home when we had to go out.</EX></SI2> Without trust we wouldn't leave keys to next doors.</BO2>

<CO><TR>So far</TR> I mentioned 2 qualities that good neighbors should have. The first one is taking good care of his/her neighbors and the second one is trust neighbor. With good neighbors, this dull society will be better place to live and enjoy.</CO>
column23: The only real problem in this essay was the lack of a proper conclusion that did not tie together the thesis sentence and the body paragraph conclusions.

column1: 341&ome people believe that the Earth is being harmed(damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion?
column3:
<IN><TS>Since idustrializaion has been acceleted during only last century, people could get enormous benefit from industrializaion. by what I can definitely support it is development of transportation.</TS> Automobile, train, and air plane had great influence on human activity. A big problem despite of such a huge benifit is, as some argues aginst, that the Earth is getting worse for human bing to live. But I still think, human activity has made the Earth a better place than before. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>If I define human activity as all process through which human being has developed and advanced the people's life by promoting science or industrialization, many people will say, "Because such a development, our environment has been irreversibly damaged and human society is getting void of humanity.</MI1><SI1> And such a opinion is definitely right. But I think, they are excessively pessimistic. I want to point out that they can never live a second without those beneficiency which they are censuring. The problem is not human activity itselt. As I mentioned above, invention of automobile has been giving unimaginable advantage to human. <EX>Even 200 years ago in Korea, when there were no vehicles nor train at all, someone who wish to go to Seoul from Pusan, It might have taken a month to him by foot. But how about now? Last week, I went to visit my grandmoither in Pusan by cat, and it took me to get there junt 3 hours, Can you imangine the person waking to Seoul and I travelling by car? </EX>
Although these advantages has put environtal problem and humanity aside. <BO2><MI2>But rather science has been seeking the solution to the destroyed nature.</MI2><SI2> And lots of people are trying to recover the lost humanity. It will not take long to find ultimate solution. <EX>About 15 years ago, Han river, which running through the heart of Seoul, were severely contaminated by nearby industry. The Han river is a source of water to over 10 million people living in Seoul. But incessant effort to recover the quality of river with an aid of science and engineering has been strikingly successful.</EX></SI2> And now we don't worry about the river. </BO1>

<CO>Many people are still worrying about human society and have an excessively pessimistic opinion about future society. <TR>Of course</TR> those worrying is also precious and necessary to human society. <TR>However</TR>, instead worrying we have to find a more helpful solution to make better Earth with a human activity. It is because it is impossible to go back to Times of Stone tools.<CO>
column23: There probably should have been a paragraph split in the main body parapraph. There was also a conspicuous lack of transitions

column1: 342&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is true to say that many high school students want to enter famous universities. Also, many parents hope that their sons or daughters can graduate a university. As you can see this, there are some advantages for students to study in university. <TS>I will support my opinion following reasons; new knowledge, personal network, and leading professor.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I think that many high school students are eager to study in university because universities give them new knowledge.</MI1> <SI1>Although high schools teach students new knowledge, universities feed them more progressive and deeper information.</SI1> In society, people called intelligent persons would have university's career. </BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, in university many students can make their relations with students from similar or different major.</MI2> These relations help them when they find jobs or make an enterprise. 

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, famous professors in university will lead their students effectively because they have studied for a long time and have various experiences.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Sometimes</TR>, when high school students choose one of many universities they make a decision considering a professor in university.</SI3> Professors will show their students good examples from their know-how to find a solution. 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, although there are many reasons why many students attend college or university I think that giving new information, personal network and famous professor are the most important reasons.</CO>
column23: Essay required more supporting ideas and examples, of which there were none.

column1:
343&People attend college or university for many different reasons(for example, new 
experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people 
attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your 
answer.)
column3:
<IN>There are various kinds of reasons for attending college or university. <TR>Of those reasons</TR>, I think most people tend to attend college to get a better job after graduation. The reason is as follows. 

<TS>College experience can provide individuals many kinds of good chance to prepare a career they will get later time.</TS> <TR>For example</TR>, higher salary, higher position in company, means of promotion. But, how can they get such a prestige over those who don't attend college? There are a few of my opinions.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, college provides individuals a stage of association with other students in same college, what is called academic relationship.</MI1> Although it could be somewhat a bad custom in social life which is often criticized, it could help people make social relationship when getting a job or making a contract with other company, and so on. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the course work in college or university coursework has many theoretical aspects that one can rarely learn in later time in company.</MI2> So people can utilize their great experience of academic knowledge when they get a job, and they can have an important foundation needed for accomplishing hard work or specialized career with great skill in real stage.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, college, as a miniature or preliminary stage of real social life, could be a great chance to get a better job people want.</CO>
column23: This was a good essay except for the fact that there were no supporting ideas or examples whatsoever. The transitions were great and it was otherwise easy to follow and understand.

column1: 344&People attend college or university for many different reasons(for example, new experiences, career, preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are different reasons to attend college or university. Some people say they go to college to improve their knowledge, and others say they go there to make have experiences. <TS>But in my opinion, people go to college and university because of making many friends and career preparation. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people attend college or university to have the opportunity to make many friends. </MI1><SI1><TR>Especially</TR> by doing club activity people could meet people different from those in their hometowns. Doing many things such as playing soccer, they could make good relationship and learn to cooperate each other. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, in university, I've been in the classic guitar club for two years.</EX></SI1> There I was able to meet many friends and learn to play the guitar, so even in two years later I could open a guitar concert of mine. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people go to college or university to prepare for their career.</MI2><SI2><TR> Nowadays</TR> it is more and more important to young people to learn the skills to be a expert in some parts. In college people can major in a subject they are interested in, and prepare for using it in the future. <EX>For example, people, who want to be a doctor, can learn programs in medical college so as to attain job skills in that field.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, although there are different reasons why people attend college or university, I believe that they go there to make many friends and to prepare for their career in the future. Then people could be well-rounded.</CO>
column23: This was a very good and well written essay except that it lacked a full conlusion. The main ideas as well as their supporting ideas and examples were well thought out and recorded.

column1: 345&People attend colleges or universities for many different reasons. Why do you think people attend college or a university? Use specific reason and example to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People attend college or university for many reasons. <TS>In my country, the most two reasons that pupils attend colleges or universities are to acquire specialized knowledge, and to prepare for taking a workplace. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is the most commonly reason for most of all wanted to enroll colleges or university to extend their thinking and to increase their knowledge.</MI1><SI1> In there, you can learn subject all about that you have concerned, and interested. </SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, they always can educate any part that you like. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, attending colleges or universities is the previous step of getting job when you graduate.</MI2><SI2> Everyone wants that their occupation is convenient, easy to handle, and sure of high-salary relatively.</SI2><TR> For that reason</TR>, they attend that places, and study hard for high point in test. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I think that most students educated in colleges of universities go to school for increasing their knowledge, and preparing the living in future.</CO>
column23: This was an overall good essay though it could have used a bit more in the way of supporting ideas and examples.

column1: 346&People do many different things to stay healthy. What do you do for good health? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think one of the most important things in our life is good health.</TS> Once if you injure your 
health, you can hardly restore your health. <TR>So</TR>, i make it a rule to have my breakfast and go swimming to stay healty. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, i have my breakfast under any circumstances.<\MI1><SI1> To have my breakfast is best important thing to me because it give me the energies required to do my daily tasks. If,however, you go without breakfast, you will ultimately have your fill at dinner.</SI1> Overeating in the supper is not good for your health because eating too much, specially when you get dinner, cause not only overweight but also corpulence. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, i go swimming regularly.</MI2><SI2> Go swimming helps my muscle be strong, and swimming enables me to forget the worries. There is no one not to know swimming is one of the most excellent exercises for health, above all to build up healty body. <TR>In addition</TR>, if you focus your energies on the swimming, you can forget your troubles.</SI2> So, i recommend that if you want to not only have your sturdy body but also forget your worries, the swimming is the best choice. </BO2>

<CO><TR>Shortly</TR>, one does not appreciate the value of good health until one has lose it. Both haveing my breakfast and go swimming are most important thing in my daily work. <TR>So</TR>, i always try doing those for keeping my good health.</CO>
column23: This was a well thought out paper though it did not include the requested and requred examples in the supporting sections of the the body paragraphs.

column1:
347&People do many different things to stay healthy. What do you do for your good health? 
Use specific reasons and exemples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>The healthy body is very important factor for everyone's life.<TS> <TR>So</TR>, people do many different things to stay health. I clamb the mountain every weekend for my good health. There are two reasons to support my choice. To climbing the mountian strengthens my loose leg muscle and I can get the fresh air. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>The primary reason that I clamb the mountain is that walking uptoward strengthen the loose leg muscle. </MI1><SI1>When I worked in office, I was always sitting in my chiar. 
Walking to my workplace in one of the morning, I suddenly think of walking as special ardent task because my leg has weakened. <TR>From that time</TR>, I start to climb the mountain every weekend. Now my leg is enough strong.</SI1> To climb the mountain is good for make leg muscle strong. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The another reason is that the fresh air of the mountain give our lung the air of the high concentrated oxygen percentage.</MI2><SI2><TR> According to study of Seoul national university</TR>, the air of the mountain fulled with woods is good for the high blood presure patients. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, there are many different choice what people do for the good health, but I believe that the best one is to climb the mountain. This is mainly because it is good for the strong leg muscle and because there are the fresh air in the mountain. To climb the mountain make the life happier.</CO>
column23: A well written essay only lacks in its supporting points and additional examples besides one. Some of the verb tenses are wrong, but they don't really stand out to detract from the rest of the essay.

column1: 348&People work because they need to live. What are some other reasons that people work? Discuss one or more of these reasons. Use specific examples and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>Almost all people work today and the most important reason people work seems to earn money to manage their family and themselves.</TS> However, there are other important reasons they want to work as the follows. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, people want to get self-realization through doing work.</MI1><SI1><TR> In other words</TR>, they would complete tasks in their works and they could reach their desire. It can give them satisfaction and feeling of happiness. <EX>An obvious example that supports this idea can be found in the trend women want to work in these days. <TR>In contrast to the past</TR>, many women of today have been working and wanted to work, even though they don’t need to concern their living expenses. This is because they would like to perform something by themselves and want to prove their ability of working.</EX></SI1> This reason also says to us why a millionaire, who is rich and don’t need to earn money anymore, even continue to work. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, people want to belong to someplace and are willing to take a position in a society through working.</MI2><SI2> In that place they can get along their colleagues. Some people who don’t have a job could feel alone. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my senior who stopped doing her research recently entered a new research center promptly. She needed a position that can represent herself in a community. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, as I mentioned above, in addition to earning a cost of life, I think people work because they want to make a self-realization and desire to get a position to represent themselves.</CO>
column23: The introduction may and conclusion may have been a bit longer and thorough, but the overall essay was without great errors. The main ideas and supporting ideas with examples were impressive.

column1: 349&Renewable sources of energy (sun, wind, water) will soon replace fossil fuels(coal, gas, oil).
column3:
<IN><TS>There is an argument over whether alternative sources of energy will soon replace fossil fuels.</TS> Some people might believe that it is possible to change renewable sources of energy as world leaders are more and more interested in environment problems. My view, however, is that fossil fuels would cause problems more than ever. This is largely because there are no common criteria. <TR>Moreover</TR>, rapid change leads to the country’s economic recession.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, many leaders in all over the world have no norms collectively.</MI1><SI1> The country that used fossil fuels is different from their situation. Some country consumed more fossil fuels, whereas other countries might be well-developed in alternative energy. <TR>However</TR>, in this regard, many rules, norms, and criteria would be made by a stronger state, or well-developed country, such as the United States. <TR>As a result</TR>, these rules were simply to temporary methods. <EX>Suppose your country is the one of the strongest nation. Also, the nation used a large percent of renewable sources. In this sense, you can make the rule have priority. <TR>As a result</TR>, these forced method were not effective solution. </EX></SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, had it not been for collective and cooperative method, the world would have not improved on environmental problems.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, fast transition caused the nation to get severe problems.</MI2> <SI2>If some nations have a higher percentage of fossil fuels, the nation would put in more efforts when compared the other nation. And therefore, civilian of the country should unnecessary activities, such as taking transportation instead of taking personal cars. These situations gives the people unbalanced life. <EX><TR>According to a study conducted by a group of researcher at Harvard University</TR>, if the policy that the nations should reduce fossil fuels implemented, more than two-third of the countries is harmful to economic recession. <TR>Also</TR>, this policy can be burden to people’s overwhelming load.</EX></SI2><TR> As the study shows</TR>, changes lead to economic recession.</BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, the adverse effect of rapid change far outweighs the benefit of renewable sources of energy considering the facts that there is no collective rules and alternative resources gives the more detrimental problems. <TR>Of course</TR>, replacing fossil fuels with renewable sources is beneficial to environmental aspects, such as reducing of air pollution, but it caused unfair norms.</CO>
column23: This was a decent paper that only fell due to the fact that it quickly got off topic and started talking about global polution issues rather than the topic of global energy management.

column1: 350&Should a city try to preserve its old, historic buildings or destroy them and replace them with modern buildings? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Nowadays, people often travel all around the world. <TS>When they arrived at a certain city, the very first thing they do is visiting history museum or historic buildings because everyone wants to see the city' prior attraction, and wonders the progress of the city' alternation and development from its ancient time. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, old and historic buildings tell the story of the past.</MI1><SI1> Each of those has went through a variety of events such as a war, a revolution, change of the social atmosphere for thousands of years. There is nothing better which can provide people with a record of the history. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when travelers visit such a city which has no historic buildings, they will be disappointed with weak evidence of history.</EX></SI1> By observing the structures, people can depict its past more than learning from a degenerate history textbook. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, a city' most valuable matter is historic buildings.</MI2><SI2> They are the presents that its ancestors gave to offsprings. <TR>Simultaneously</TR>, the inhabitants are given an important responsibility to preserve and protect those safely.</SI2> Not only are people who have interest in history responsible, but everyone also are responsible to preserve them. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, destroying old and historic structures and replacing them with modern structures is an unbelievable behavior. The reason is that the antique buildings are the only visible, trustful witnesses and evidences of the past. <TR>Moreover</TR>, if the residents destroy the buildings, they will be losers of the era by evading the essential responsibility. <TR>Finally</TR>, in my opinion, a city must preserve its old, historic structures without any exception.</CO>
column23: The topic of this essay does not really clearly hit on the subject that was to be covered. Here it was more about a cities old building and the desire to see them, not their preservation and the work done there.

column1: 351&Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation (buses, trains, subways)? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>The question of whether a government should spend more money on improving roads and highways or improving public transportation is a difficult. Both these things are important for our city. <TS><TR>However</TR> I think governments should spend more money on improving public transportation. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, there are so many cars in my city.</MI1><SI1> Car problem is a big problem in my city. So many people think that governments should improve roads and highways first. <TR>But</TR>, they can solve only some part of the car problem. Maybe they can’t solve the whole problem. <TR>However</TR>, if they spend more money on improving public transportation, many people will use public transportation.</SI1> They can solve the car problem step by step. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><<TR>Second</TR>, if most people use public transportation instead of cars, we can reduce air pollution. </MI1><SI2>My city’s air is very dirty because of bad gas from cars. I have never seen very clean day in my city. <TR>However</TR>, if we use public transportation, we can live in clean air.</SI2> This is a good benefit for everyone in my city. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, of course by spending more money on improving roads and highways they can solve traffic problem. <TR>However</TR>, I think they should spend more money on improving public transportation. <TR>Because</TR>, not only will all people in my city benefit, but also the environment will benefit.</CO>
column23: The author's points and ideas were all on topic and where relevant to the discussion. Several of the main idea sentences in the body were not fully written out, but the supporting ideas were well written. There were some word choice issues in the essay.

column1: 352&Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation (buses, trains, subways)? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN><TR>Nowadays</TR>, there are tremendolous amount of transportation facilities in our city. People, however, complaining about our public transportation system. <TR>Because</TR>, they can't wisely solve the current problems such as trafic jam, proper reconstructions of road. <TS>For the purpose of resolving this unsolved subject, governments should spend more money on improving roads and highways.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, it is reported that the rate of the car owner's has been increasingly by 6 percent per year.</MI1><SI1><TR> Of course</TR>, we can't igonre the compertence of it. People who have a car is very convinent than does not. If government spend money to expand public transportations, then they surely blamed to their citizends. </SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, they shoul more effort to deter trafic jam. </BO1>

column1: 353&Some people believe that success in life comes from taking risks or chances. Others believe that success results from careful planning. In your opinion, what does success come from? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are some people who believe that success is purely a matter of luck. Like what they say, luck is an important feature of every success story. <TS>Every successful people appear to have some kind of attitude that makes them fearlessly put themselves in a peril, and also, it is essential to have the ability to take chances.</TS> These are, however, the things that will only come after a certain thing has been done. That certain thing is a careful, thorough planning and preparation.</IN>

<BO1><MI1>Why do planning and preparation have to be done before you go on to take risks and chances?</MI1><SI1> That's because they are the very basis of success- in other words, thorough planning and preparation is a solid grounding to success. It's like, without having your own solid building site, you cannot expect to build anything, nor can you even expect the bricks and other building equiments to arrive. Without careful planning and preparation beforehand, you won't be able to even have a chance to take a risk or to seize the chance that comes.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Besides</TR>, let's say, even though you had not done any planning or preparation at all, a chance came to you by a pure luck.</MI2><SI2> Even if such a thing happened, you still wouldn't be able to fully take that chance and get the full benefit of it. Maybe you wouldn't even recognise a chance came... You need to do the planning and preparation to obtain a precise knowledge of what you are aiming for and what will help you to achieve that aim. </SI2>Hoping for a success with no preparation is just like hoping for straight As in exams with no preparations.</BO2>

<CO>There are success stories that tells you that they achieved such success by grabbing a fabulous chance that came across them. That fabulous chance does not just come to anybody- behind every success stories there are always hidden efforts and careful plannings. Chances only come to those who are ready to take the chance. To those without a careful planning and preparation, no chance will be given. Everything comes in order and so does success. Without a thorough planning and preparation, nothing will come. Nothing.</CO>
column23: The essay does not have a strong topic or thesis statement that allows for the author to make great argumnets or examples to prove any real point besides the generic fact that planning might help a person. It doesn't quite prove that planning leads or causes succes..

column1: 354&Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is no doubt that people have been used and exploited many things from our natural resources. <TS><TR>By doing this</TR>, the quality of human life has advanced grately.</TS> However, Earth is being harmed by human activity especially technology development and population increase.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, Many scientists tried to get better materials availalble from Earth.</MI1><SI1><TR>As a result</TR>, the Earth was devastated and made no longer operate self-cleansing system. <TR>In addition</TR>, cars, the twenty century's high-tech representative product, were the main source of the air polution. They also depended on more improved technology to slove this pollution realted problems.</SI1> <TR>So</TR>, there was no choose to stop this vicious circle because of technology. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Secondly</TR>, the expansion of population is now becoming the globla problems.</MI2><SI2> It affected the Earth badly not only the shortage of an area but also a lack of food. As time goes by, we felt the need for housing. In this case, the answer was simple. We just bulit a house and provide peoples. And also we had to exploit many unused and new territory to supply for food.</SI2><TR> Therefore</TR>, our planet was dmanged severely.</BO2>

<CO><TR>Finally</TR>, to prevent harming the Earth, we must continous concern about human activity. We can't give away the accumulated technology. <TR>Moreover</TR>, we can't kill our neighbors artificially. </CO>

To sum up, people wanted to make a better place to live, but the reality bears the opposite effect. I believe, however, we still have enough time to reconstruct our land the Earth for our bright Future.
column23: The author uses god word choice and has relatively good grammar though there are some obvious errors. There are also some good ideas presented in a clear manner. Some additional examples could have been useful in making the argued points go further.

column1:
355&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. 
Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point 
of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I would like to say that students should attend the every class they planned to do.</TS> Most of all, following two main reasons will explain well why they have to be in the 
class they promised to take. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Basically</TR>, the curriculum in the university is the result of the research that has been done by the experienced person who works in education field for a long time.</MI1><SI1><TR> So</TR>, it can be said that the curriculum in the university consists of the least knowledge that college student should acquire during their attendance and for further advanced course. It is needless to say that those knowledges are essential for more advanced course that they will have to take next year.</SI1> He or she who didn't attend the class may not be qualified for the next course even though they got good grade point. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>I partly agree to the idea that college student deserve to be more free from the class or something, compared to those in high school or junior high school.</MI2><SI2><TR>However</TR>, it is themselves who promised to attend the class during the semester. It is kind of contract between those who will give a lecture and the students. Professors also have their own plan how to make their class go, and surely, the number of students in the class do affect the progress of the class. </SI2>And it may affect the effectiveness 
of the class itself, accordingly, other students who attend the class.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, it is a duty of every student to attend the class that is well prepared and designed by highly experienced experts. <TR>And</TR> also they shouldn't disturb the class itself by breaking his or her promise with other people who are involved in the class.</CO>
column23: Looking at the thesis and the main points, it is clear that the author doesn't really know what the point of the essay should be. The author makes claims that students should have freedom and quality in courses, but the author does not address the question of whether or not students should go to class or do something else. Perhaps online courses should have been addressed. There are also very few examples in the supporting ideas.

column1: 356&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optical for students. Which point of view do you agree with ? Use specific reasons and details to explain you answer.
column3:
<IN>Some university students believe that it is nature to attend classes, while other students insists they have the rights to choose attending classes or not. <TS>It depend on their attitude, however, I think it's better to attend classes for several reasons. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, you can share variety of opionions by discussing some problems.</MI1><SI1>When you think of some reasons of an phenomenon, it is likely to make a limited conclusion and can be prjudiced as well. In classe, however, people have each point of view so that they can both stimulate your thoughts and even change your idea.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, you can get much informations by attending classes. </BO1>

column23: The thesis of the essay is clear and the wording is readable throughout. The thesis and introduction  could have included just a bit more information to preview the essay. The supporting ideas also could have used a few more examples. Otherwise, this was a good essay.

column1: 357&Some people like doing work by hand. Others prefer using machines. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>Usually</TR>, people consider whether doing by hand or using machines, when they are work to something.</TS> I think that the selecting two ways of work depend on the work's condition and characteristic. In my work, like accounting, using machines is better than doing by hand. There are two main reasons. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>The first reason is that using machines provide precise figures.</MI1><SI1> In accounting, I meet lots of numbers and formulas. To handle my tasks, I use not only simple calculators but also complex programs which can manage difficult tasks.</SI1> If I work calculating task with by hand, I make lots of uncorrected figures and unrelated outputs. Getting accuracy is essential to accounting. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The second reason is that using machines can save lots of times.</MI2><SI2> The accounting, one of the difficult and disinteresting parts of work, is need many time. Even though I work the account of expense or closing fiscal auditing with using machines, it tasks a couple of weeks. And then I have to review results. If do these tasks cope with just by hand, it make all of accounting part members have keep working without sleeping.</SI2> I am not sure when it can conclude. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In the end</TR>, Machines are more efficient. Using machine bring lots of advantages such as precision and saving time. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I cannot make my work without using machines, I prefer using machines</CO>
column23: The author does a great job creating some good points to argue their point. Besides the points, however, there is almost no details, supporting ideas, or examples. Also, the introduction paragraph could also be combined into one sentence and still make sense if the unnecessary words were omitted. It was very inefficient.

column1: 358&Some people like to travel with a companion. Other people prefer to travel alone. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>Travel is probably one of the humnas favorite hobboy. I believe that is the vital element to improve the qualithy of life. Even travel experts recommend and consult various ways to travel. <TS>Among them, I think the most valuable thing is to travel alone for several reasons. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Traveling alone helps me to find myself and learn more about me that I didn't noticed in usual days.</MI1><SI1><TR> For instance</TR>, I had an experienced of walked across the korean peninsula by alone. It took 14 days to finish. <TR>During those days</TR>, I could think something over and over again. </SI1>If I traveld with a friend, I had to spent most of times talking with him. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another attactractive point</TR> of travelling alone is that you can decide what you want to.</MI2><SI2> Suppose that you are travelling with your friend. When you have a problem with your friend some different opinion, it is very hard to make a proprate decision. Because this is a rare opportunity both two friends. </SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, you will choose travelling alone, if you want to free from conflict. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>The last advantage</TR> that I want to emphasize is that you can learn to adjust yourself a new circumstance.</MI3><SI3> When travelling alone, you don't know anyone so automatically you must try to adapt the way with unfamiliar things. This experience will gives you to understand the different culture more deeply. </BO3>

<CO><TR>Conclusion</TR>, I have suggested three advantages of travelling alone. It is a matter of personl preference. <TR>However</TR>, I strongly recommed travelling alone the people who didn't make decision yet. Do not hesitate, get away right now !</CO>
column23: There are good points made in this article.  Even the first introductary paragraph is written well and is imformative to the direction of the essay. Some examples would have been nice as well as a spell checker.

column1: 359&Some people pay money for the things they want or need. Other people trade products or goods for what they need. Compare the advantages of these two ways of obtaining things. Which way do you prefer? Explain why
column3:
<IN><TS>There are two methods that we can get products or goods which we need.</TS> Some people prefer to pay money for them, but others prefer to trade them. Both of them have their own advantages. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>If we pay money for buying some products, you can get new ones.</MI1> <SI1>We can always be satisfied with the fresh products.</SI1><TR>Moreover</TR>, because we can just pay money for them anywhere and anytime, we don't need to spend much time and energy for getting them. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Trading products also has its benefits.</MI2><SI2>It is more economical. When we need something, we can swap our unnecessary products with our necessary of others. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when a new semester starts, we may need many books. <TR>In this situation<TR>, we can exchange unnecessary textbooks with those of other classmates without spending money. <TR>In addition</TR>, trading goods can reduce garbage so that we can reduce pollution by much sewage.</EX></SI2> When we move far away, yard sale can be a good chance to make neighbors use our stuffs further instead of throwing away. </BO2>

<CO>Some people prefer to money for the things they need and others prefer to trade them and two methods have their own benefits as I discussed above. <TR>In my view</TR>, I prefer to trade goods if possible because it makes me save money and reduce garbage, which can cause serious pollution problems.</CO>
column23: This essay was written in a very easy way. It does include a few good examples and has a comprehendable thesis. It could use more transitions from one thought to the next.

column1: 360&Some people pay money for the things they want or need. Other people trade products or goods for what they need. Compare the advantages of these two ways of obtaining things. Which way do you prefer? Explain why.
column3:
<IN><TR>Over many centuries</TR>, we needed the things to live more comfortably and succesfully. <TS>To get the things we want, we should confront two choices- paying money to take it or trading products for what we need. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>If you earn money as a result of your efforts by working and pay that money to obtain what you need, you would feel proud of yourself that you did worthy work. </MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In another case</TR>, if you trade products with the other people who wants your goods and also you need another's goods, it could be a perfect trade.</MI2><SI2> But if one of them do not need or want what the other people want to trade, there would be a problem.<TR>Moreover</TR>, to acquire the products that we need, we should trade many times. <EX>Imagine that you have apples and want to get shoes. <TR>In addition to</TR>, there are no peole who have shoes with wanting apples . <TR>First</TR>, you should find what product the people who have shoes want. <TR>Second</TR>, you should also find the people who have the products what he or she needs. Then trade the products to get shoes. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Through the use of a couple of examples and specific explanation, I demonstrate Trading products also is a good way to obtain what we need, but moreover Paying money to acquire what we want is more valuable and makes us inspire to work happily.</CO>
column23: The author uses supporting evidence only rarely and does not use these things to properly support the conclusion.

column1: 361&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants but I prefer more to prepare and eat food at home.</TS> There are many reasons why I think but I will use a couple of reasons. Follow then. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is clean.</MI1><Si1> I heard that food stands or restaurants often use bad materials such as dirty oil and not fresh vegetables. <TR>However</TR>, Mothers love us and they don`t want us to eat dirty food so they will cook carefully.</SI1> So we can eat fresh and clean food. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we can save money.</MI2><SI2><TR>In my oppinion</TR>, the price of food stands of restaurants is too expensive to eat. I think it is because of tax and some tips. </SI2><TR>However</TR>, it is cheap to eat at home because we only have to buy some materials and don`t have to pay tax and some tips for the shop. 

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, we can help the cook.</MI3><SI3> At food stands or restaurants, we only wait for the food and don`t help the cook. <TR>However</TR>, At home, we can help each other to make a food. </SI3><TR>In addition</TR>, when we help the cook, we can learn that it is difficult to make a food so we thank to the cook for making foods. 

<CO><TR>Finally</TR>, from the above-mentioned reasons, to be clean, save money and help the cook, I prefer to prepare and eat food at home. I want to recommend people to eat at home.</CO>
column23: The author uses very basic sentences to express the topics of the paragraphs. This small foundation makes the rest of the body paragraphs very weak. Weak paragraphs make the conclusion weak as well.

column1: 362&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:

column23: This was a well written essay that had good points and even some advanced level statements. It would have been nice if all of these uses were gramatically correct, but it was good.

column1: 363&Some people prefer to live in large cities, while others prefer to live in small towns which of these two life-styles go you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>Usually</TR>, people select their surroundings according to their personalities and situations.</TS> I'm a small town-type person. I would like to explain three reasons. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I can enjoy nature such as mountains, brooks and hills.</MI1><SI1> I'm born in Seoul. <TR>For this reason</TR>, I don't have a chance to enjoy nature. <TR>Also</TR>, I can see many stars I love. <TR>Second</TR>, I can know all neighbors well. One of the problems being in a large city is that we feel alienated so many times, but people who live in a small town know each other so they can share their situations or feelings. <TR>Third</TR>, using a lot lf high-tech utilities, I can access almost all information that I want to know. </SI1> And I don't have to go to the city to work because I can use the Internet that links anywhere. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, there are lack of good educational environments, hospitals and entertainments.</MI2><SI2>Some who likes to live in a small town might select to live a large city because of his/her children.</SI2> For others who go to a hospital every day to care their health, it is hard to live in a small town. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I prefer living in small towns. I can wake up while birds sing, can share feelings with my friends, and can go anything by using the Internet. But you must be considered which of situation you are in.</CO>
column23: The author makes some good statements using some advanced wording. The problem is that there is no consistent use of supporting ideas or even structure of the body paragraphs. These need to be addressed.

column1: 364&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others like to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Give reasons to support your answers.
column3:
<IN>People have various personalities according to their circumstances. So some people have optimistic attitude and others have pessimistic attitude to the same problem. But there is no one who is always happy or unhappy. <TR>Therefore</TR> we need to talk to others and it can make us more comfortable. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, to spend time with others is more desirable than to be alone.</TS> Followings are the statements which support my point of view. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, when we have some personal problem, we can consult others.</MI1><SI1> And it can help us solve the problem or re-think the problem. We tend to think it’s just my problem when being front of the big problem. But it’s not. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I have some problem, I talked to friends and it’s useful to me although their opinion isn’t always right. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, there is some saying in Korea.</MI2><SI2>Happiness is doubled and sadness is diminished when we shred it with others. I largely agree with this saying. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, imagine the situation when you go to the theater alone. And if it’s a comic movie, you don’t have any chance to laugh at the some scene together, and if it’s a sad movie, after movie you'll have no friends take care of crying you. It makes you more sad. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR> I know that there is some situation to be alone is better. But human is maybe happier with others. It’s natural to talk about different idea, or same emotion.</CO>
column23: The only real issue with this essay was that the conclusion did not tie up all the pieces of the essay together to bring the reader to a complete understanding of the argued point.

column1: 365&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others like to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people want to spend time alnoe, but others want to spend time with others. These two types have their own advantages. <TS>I prefer to spend my time by myself for the following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, spending time alone demands less than with others.</MI1><SI1> I don't need the place to meet my friends. I have not to try to make an appointment to meet others. In modern society, people are very busy.</SI1> It is not easy to make a time to meet my friends. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I feel more comfortable when I am alone that when I am with others because I don't need to listen to what others talk about.</MI2><SI2>As you are with others, you must listen to what others say.</SI2> If you don't listen carefully to others you may get an impression that you are not a careful person. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Thirdly</TR>, When I am alone I can have oppertunities to reflect myself.</MI3><SI3> It is very important to reflect what I say, behave, think and I can find what faults I have.</SI3> If you make a habit to reflect yourself, find your faults, and try to make them correct, you will make your life better. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I prefer to spend my time alone because spending time alone demands less, makes me comfortable, and gives me oppertunities to think over myself and to make my life better.</CO>
column23: The author did not use very many examples to provide a basis for the arguments. These would have provided for a better essay and conclusion.

column1: 366&Some people prefer to work for themselves or own a business. Others prefer to work for an employer. Would you rather be self-employed, work for someone else, or own a business? Use specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are a number of different jobs in the society. Some work for someone else, and the other run their own business. <TS>However, I believe that most people want to own a business if they have adequate money, social capability to make a good relationship, and superb talent. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, working for someone else is a harder job than owning a business.</MI1><SI1> Although one takes less responsibilities than a leader, it is certainly difficult to ingratiate oneself with one' superiors. They surely will want him to work in their style. It is also an unreliable job. No matter one is doing right one' work or not, if his company goes bankrupt, then one suddenly becomes an incompetent person. </SO1>Working for someone else, then, does not look promising. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, owning a business seems to have tremendous responsibilities for employees, products, bills, and many other stuffs.</MI2><SI2><TR>Yet</TR>, those will not be an obstacle if the leader takes his responsibilities with taking care of his men with love and trust, being honest to his consumers, and economizing property of the company. <TR>Moreover</TR>, a satisfied pay contributes to his life to upgrade itself. Even though money is not the goal of his business, it is essential matter to live on nowadays. Most people want to work in their style. Employees must follow the rules that the leader regulated. </SI2>This can be the most advantageous in one' working environment because of less stress. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, in spite of difficulties of owning a business, people desire to run their own business because of some advantages that I mentioned above. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I prefer to run my own business.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay that has some good points and good ideas. The thesis especially stood out as good. It could have used a longer and more involved introduction and conclusion.

column3:

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>. I can learn easily another country's language.</MI1><SI1><TR> Now</TR>, I and many of my country's students. Korean, try to learn English, also we have studied it from middle school. <TR>However</TR>, we can speak it less than students who study in America just for 1 year. This reason is that we do not know American's customs and habit and how to match any vocabulary for each situation. </SI1><TR>The other hand</TR>, a student studying abroad have more chance to meet American and easy to learn English. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it give us an opportunity to challenge a fresh life.</Mi2><SI2> Most people are reluctant to move their house to another country. <TR>However</TR>, it is a good experience that we can learn abroad customs and do new ones that we have never done in our country.</SI2><TR> By doing so</TR>, we can have self-confident to advance our life against any new environment. </BO2>

column23: The essay was overal satisfactary. Some issues were with the lack of a complete conclusion and the fact that there were very few examples.

column1: 368&Some people think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. Others believe that young children should spend most of their time playing. Compare these two views. Which view do you agree with? Why?
column3:
<IN>Which is better for children to study or to play? Studying has its own benefits. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I strongly believe that children should spend their most of the time to play. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Children could learn more knowledge, which is useful to learn high level knowledge or higher education, when they begin studying at a very early age.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nonetheless</TR>, The method of evaluating children in school would have negative effects on them. <TR>By this</TR>, I mean the school evaluates its students only with grade, and also, their parents would measure their children with grade. <TR>Therefore</TR>, children attending school always worry about their scores, so this would bring about depression and stress to them. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, children are not old enough to get these feelings. <TR>In addition</TR>, they couldnot control this kinds of feelings properly. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Nevertheless</TR>, children could have problem to adapt themselves to school first time when they attend school not at a very early age.</MI2><SI2>They always acted what they want before going to school, and they are not accustomed to the school's fixed rules such as they have to attend school, have lunch, and study at fixed time. <TR>In spite of the fact</TR> that, they could have a chance for someone to find their talent when they are playing since children usually play what is interesting to them. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a child, who is a girl, has talent of playing piano. If she goes to school at very early age, someone cannot notice her ability now that she spend most of her time studying, and most schools do not teach how to play piano. <TR>For all that</TR>, her parents or someone else could find her talent when she is playing with a piano toy if she does not go to school at very early age.</EX></SI2> This will lead to change her life better. </BO2>

<CO>There are advantages and disadvantages in both activities. <TR>All the same</TR>, I think having a chance to find a child's talent is the most important event in his or her life.</CO>
column23: Well thought out, prepared, and written. There are a few word choice issues, but it is overall very good.

column1: 369&Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answe
column3:
<IN>There is an argument concerning whether the automobile improved modern life or caused serious problems. <TS>Although there are some problems coming from using the automobile, I believe that it has brought tremendous developments to our life. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the automobile makes it possible to communicate easily with another community which is far from our community.</MI1><SI1><TR> In other words</TR>, when there was no the automobile, people should use a horse or foot as transformations. Those transformation forms were so slow that it took so much time to get far places. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in the time of 19 C when there was no automobile in Korea, people living in countryside should depart before around one month to arrive in Seoul to take a public test. It was so time consuming and tired.</EX><EX> <TR>Another example</TR> is that people who live in suburban area can go to their own works using the automobile in a day. It means people don’t need to live near to work any more, so they could enjoy living in countryside.</EX></SR1><TR> In this regard</TR>, the automobile makes modern life getting better. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, the automobile has improved the trade.</MI2><SI2> When there was no the automobile, people could not even think about the trade between far apart places. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the food which is easily spoiled in a short time such as egg, vegetable and milk could not be delivered from a rural area to a city. Using the automobile, however, it is possible to deliver anything in a very short time, before it is spoiled. </EX><TR>Also</TR>, the automobile makes it possible to deliver heavy materials and a great deal of amount at one time. </SI2><TR>Therefore</TR> the automobile is very helpful for trading anything and between any distances. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, the automobile brings largely two important improvements in modern life; making communication with far community easy and developing the trade. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I believe the automobile has brought improvement of our life.</CO>
column23: Well thought out, prepared, and written. There are a few word choice issues, but it is overall very good.

column1: 372&Some people think that they can learn better by themselves than with a teacher. Others think that it is always better to have a teacher. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN><TS>There are many ways to learn something.</TS> Some people like to learn with someone to teach them, while others preper to learn by themselves. <TR>First of all</TR>, I think the learners need to have a teacher.
