<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, the man who like to study by himself, is not always wrongful think. We can’t ignore their personal life style, however, learning something with teacher is more effective and desirable. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I will keep studying with my advisor to get help.</CO>
column23: The essay could have used a few more examples. The conclusion was also a bit short.

column1: 373&Some people work more effectively during the day, while other people work much more effectively at night. Discuss which type of person you are. Give reasons and examples to support your response.
column3:
<IN>'Some people prefer working at night, while others don't. However, most people have no choice but to work in the daytime because they should work with other people. <TS>If there doesn't exist such limitation, I'd like to be a night-worker for two reasons. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I can concentrate on working in the quiet environment much better than in the noisy environment.</MI1><SI1> When working in the daytime, I feel uncomfortable because many people and cars make much noise. Some months ago, I was trying to think out an important idea and then someone shouted to me, "Hey! What are you thinking about?". </SI1><TR>After then</TR> I could not remind of anything. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I want to enjoy myself during the day.</MI2><SI2> Most people can not spend the daytime for themselves because of their works.</SI2> If someone should work in the office when it's shiny day outside windows, he or she may feel bad and not be able to work effectively any more. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, whether or not people prefer working at night depends on types of their jobs and lifestyles. <TR>In my cases</TR>, I don't need much contact with other people and instead I need more time to think carefully about a given problem. <TR>So</TR> I can tell you that I am a type of person who works much more effectively at night.</CO>
column23: While there are some great ideas in this essay, there is a lack of consistency in what makes a body paragraph. One of them needs additional examples which could then be used to create a more inclusive conclusion.

column1: 374&Some students prefer to attend a small university. Others prefer to attend a big university. which type of university you prefer? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>University is the last stage to study for many students. <TR>Hence</TR>, it is obviously important. It is not too much to say that university decides one's life direction. As far as I am concerned, I consider a small university better than a big university. There are several reasons to prove my point.</IN>

<BO1><MI1>While big university has many students, small university has a few.</MI1><SI1> This may sound trivial, It can virtuallya important factor. If there is many students, Independent asking or conversation would be hard, since there are hundreds of students in one class.</SI1><TR>However</TR>, In small university, students can share their thoughts through debate, and professor can help students individually when students call for help.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR> a big university is usually more expensive compared to smaller ones.</MI2><SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, if one has not enough money or want to save a money, They should better go to smaller ones. <TR>Also</TR>, those cheaper and smaller universities are usually located in a rural, and thus people can feel the nature while studying. </SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, big universities are located in big cities, and hence environment is not as fresh as the former.</BO2>

<CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly believe that a smaller universities are better than bigger ones. </CO>
column23: The author has some great ideas and puts them down in a coherent and easily understandable essay. There isn't anything flash though and no personal examples.

column1: 375&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>When we study something, we have thought of whether to study with a group of students or study alone is more effective.</TS> <TR>However</TR>, in my case, it is more effective to study with a group of students. The reason consists in aspect of saving time, and sharing information. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, one crucial reason is that through studying with a group of students, we can save time for achieving the goal.</MI1><SI1><TR>For example</TR>, when attending high school, I had so difficult assignments such as a quadratic equation in mathematics area. Not until five hours later did I solve the assignment. <EX><TR>However</TR>, my friend, Kyung-Jin, with the same assignment can easily solve the homework only for an hour through studying with other students. </EX></SI1> <TR>Since that time</TR> I have understood how effective studying with a group of students is. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second<TR>, the other reason consists in sharing information by studying with other students.</MI2><SI2>It is impossible for us to know all the knowledge of various fields. <TR>Thus</TR> we should have help from others to get knowledge which we don’t know, and studying with a group of students is so effective for sharing the knowledge. <EX><TR>Actually</TR>, a survey conducted in Korea showed that 80% of students surveyed preferred to study with a group of students, the reason consisted in effectiveness for sharing information.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</CO>, considering the aspect of saving time, and effectiveness to share information, it is clear that studying with a group of students is better than studying alone.</CO>
column23: The essay is clearly organized in its parts with the sturcture and points made clearly the supporting ideas also have some short examples included. The only real problem is that the conclusion doesn't tie anyting together. It is short and essential only repeats the thesis.

column1: 376&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people want to study alone, while others decide to study in group. Studying alone is good because the student can just concentrate in the study. I also like to study alone when I don't want to be disturbed. Yet there are many overweighing advantages in group study. By studying in a group, the members stimulate each other and can find a better solution. <TS>Thus I prefer to study in group rather than alone.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>In a study group, members are stimulated by others.</MI1><SI1>I usually go to a library to study. At home, I can't keep concentrating in the study because there are too many things tempting me to play. But at a library, I can get stimulated by seeing others studying. <TR>Also</TR> in a study group they can encourage to study if one is in slump. If someone in the group is loosing interest from the study, they can help him/her to get along with them. Because the aim of the all member is same-to study. </SI1> <TR>So</TR>, in a group they can help each other to keep studying. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>More over</TR>, in a group they can gather their power together to solve a problem. </MI2><SI2>If one is solving a difficult math problem, there’s no way to confirm his/her answer before looking at an answer sheet. But if a group is solving the same problem, they can check other’s way to solve and correct it. <TR>What is more</TR>, they can get the best way to solve the problem by discussing each member’s methods. </SI2>By gathering all member’s brain power, a group can find a better way to solve a problem. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I prefer to study in a group. Because by watching others studying, I can be stimulated to study, and a group study helps to find a better solution. <TR>Of course</TR>, we shouldn’t care too much about the group’s affair rather than the study itself. Because it is myself who make the knowledge mine.</CO>
column23: The thesis is weak because it doesn't do much to introduce what will be covered in the essay. The topics seem well thought out and the main ideas are really great. The supporting ideas may have been better with a few extra small examples.

column1: 377&speaking well is more important than writing well.
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of discussion at hand is whether speaking well is more important than writing well. The answer to this question can vary greatly depending on the individual perspectives. <TR>Thus</TR>, the jury may still be out, but as far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement. <TS>In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, speaking is more frequent in daily lives.</MI1><SI1>We talk to people with not writing but speaking and express our thought with speaking. If I can’t speak, I will be stuck in discomfort and have difficulty enjoying the other aspects of my life.<EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, my friend have disability with his ears find himself always stressed out because he can’t communicate with people. He said me that he was hard to get a job because companies prefer people who communicate well. </EX></SI1> His writing ability is absolutely outstanding but he has difficulty communicating with people, he has gone through hard times.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The other reason is that people who have great speaking ability is easy to succeed.</MI2><SI2>This is due to the fact that we all like people with great communication skills. When we talk each other, we prefer people who speak well and are likely to be impressed with him. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Roosevelt fascinated people with his good speaking skills. He could succeed due to his speaking ability.</EX></SI2> There is no doubt that people with good speaking skills have more chance to manage successful lives.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of the two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again</TR>, although the verdict may still be out, I personally believe that two of my rationales above are sufficiently convincing enough to represent the viewpoints of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim.</CO>
column23: The author has some great ideas and puts them down in a coherent and easily understandable essay with relevant examples. There isn't anything flashy, but it is still very good.

column1: 378&Teachers should not make their social and political opinions known to students in the classroom.
column3:
<IN>An ongoing debate exists on whether teachers should not tell their social and political opinions to students in the classroom. <TS>Regarding this controversial issue, I strongly support that teachers can teach students by giving their own views in the classroom.</TS> The reason behind this is that showing social issues and views to students is one of important parts of education. Additionally, it helps students to develop their own opinion.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, teachers should show their social and political views to students in the class since demonstrating own view to public is necessitate part of students' learning.</MI1><SI1>Some people may argue that it will lead students to have biased view to the society especially controversial political and social issues. <TR>However</TR>, before this concern occurs, teachers are of greater help because they can show how to present their critical opinions by explaining step by step. <TR>In turn</TR> students learn how to deal with the argument in a logical way not just insisting their views. <EX><TR>According to the study released by the Bain and Company</TR>, most surveyed respondents state that the key to their success to show their own opinions on the public stage with social issues is hands-on lessons in the classroom at school days. <TR>To specific</TR>, they were able to learn how to attract opponents' attentions and how to employ proper implements that support their social and political opinions. </EX></SI1> If had not been for their learning in the classroom, they would not have performed the address on their social opinion effectively.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, if teachers make their social and political opinion in the classroom, students can encourage to make their own voices onto social and political issues.</MI2><SI2>In the classroom students are given the chance to learn extensive views of social issues which are designed well to understand in the appropriate way. Students can make their own decision on the base of these evidences given by teachers, and can compare teachers' views on the certain issue with their standpoints. <EX><TR>From my own experience</TR>, when I was in the middle school, one day my teacher took the social issue whether government should spend more money on expending zoo. <TR>As long as she explained both sides of argument</TR>, I decided my view with ease and was able to enhance my argument by comparing my teacher's view opposite my viewpoint.</EX></SI2><TR>In this way</TR>, appealing teachers' view on social and political issue in the classroom is helpful to make students' own thinking process and results.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, I have no doubt that teachers are better telling their social and political opinion to students. This is because students are better able to learn how to present their views in public. <TR>What's more</TR>, they can easily make their own social and political opinion with teachers' view.</CO>
column23: There were a few small word choice and grammar issues in this essay. The essay was for the most part very well written and thought through.

column1: 379&The best way to relax and reduce stress is by spending some time alone.
column3:
<IN>An ongoing debate exists on whether spending some time alone is the most helpful way to relax and reduce stress. <TS><TR>Regarding this controversial issue</TR>, I strongly support that people can deal with their stress with many friends rather than leaving alone.</TS>The reason behind this is that friends can help to solve the problem, and thus make us feel relaxed. <TR>Additionally</TR>, it is hard to take away worries if people are alone. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people can overcome their difficulties more easily when they are with friends.</MI1><SI1> This is because as they concern about their friends, they are the ones who watch them closely and motivate them not to discourage ahead of difficulties. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they have a deep understanding about friends' situation and preferences so that they are likely to find out what they really need more than when they contemplate the solution by themselves. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my brother had a hard time with the bad grade in Math when he was in high school. He was under severe stress but he was so busy that he could not make extra time to take lessons from tutors. </EX><TR>At this time</TR>, as I already knew what part was his defeat in Math and when was available, I could give him a help of improving his studying. </SI1>If he had his time being in worry and stress alone without saying to me, he would not have entered the university due to the bad grade of math. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, when they are alone, people are less able to overcome the bad feelings.</MI2><SI2>Some people may say that it is more convenient to leave alone to release worries and stay calm out of stress. <TR>However</TR>, in most cases people fall into deeper dispression staying alone; it makes necessary to be surrounded by many people that allows people in worries to get distracted from melancoly feelings by doing other things. <EX><TR>According to the report released by the National Psychology Institution in Korea</TR>, most experts suggest that the best remedy for people who are in depression is to find other people who can share their feelings. This is because people easily tend to get engrossed in their bad emotion and think it more serious and lament than the real when they are alone. </EX></SI2> <TR>In this sense</TR> it would be unreasonable to argue that spending time alone is desirable to release all stress and stay relaxed.</BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, I have no doubt that people are better to spend their time with others in order to relax and reduce stress. This is because people can obtain more practical way to overcome their difficult with friends' help. <TR>What's more</TR>, spending time alone may lead people to bigger worrisome and thus hinder to relax themselves. <TR>All in all</TR>, the importance of time people spend relating with others should not be overlooked for keeping our mental health.</CO>
column23: The author has some great ideas and puts them down in a coherent and easily understandable essay with relevant examples. There isn't anything flashy, but it is still very good.

column1: 380&the decisions that people make quickly are always wrong.
column3:
<IN>Surrounded by too many things to deal with, nowadays people are usually forced to make quick decisions. They firmly believe that they have made a wise decision and feel proud of their decision-making faculties. <TS>However, in my opinion, a quick decision, which is resulted from lacking of enough time and calmness, always misleads people to failure.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we cannot understand the situation well without enough time.</MI1><SI1> All of the things have advantages and disadvantages. Only we ponder about the situation for a long time, can we make wise decisions. <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, in 2008, Korea Bank, which is the central bank in South Korea, decided to mingle and administer Rimman Brothers. But after a detailed analysis on RB, it gave up the previous decision. <TR>Before long</TR>, surprisingly, RB went bankrupt and most of the companies that were directly and indirectly related to it suffered from enormous damages.</EX></SI1> <TR>Clearly</TR>, if it had not been for an adequate time to consider about the global financial situation, Korea Bank would not save itself from lethal financial crisis that might make the whole country go a mass.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, impulsive emotions make us blind.</MI2><SI2>People without cold brain do not observe the situation objectively so that they have difficulties in making good decisions. <EX>Take my sister’s experience as an example. When she was a freshman, she fell in love with a man and made an immediate decision to get married to him. <TR>In spite of other family members’ oppositions</TR>, her impulsive emotions let her keep going and started new wedding life at last. But it took a short time for her to open her eyes to realize the situation, regretting her quick decisions.</EX></SI2> <TR>Like this</TR>, people in tumultuous emotions have a tendency to make a quick decision and fail in getting satisfactory ramifications.</BO2>

<CO><TR>Taking above two things into account</TR>, it is obvious that too hasty decisions lead people to mistakes even failure and finally bring about miserable consequences. I strongly believe that only a long time and a cold brain allow us to end up success.</CO>
column23: The author has some great ideas and puts them down in a coherent and easily understandable essay with relevant examples. There isn't anything flashy, but it is still very good.

column1: 381&The news media is a reliable source of unbiased information.
column3:
<IN>In today's complicated society, it is believed that the information that new media offer to civic people is trustworthy. Some people advocate that a number of contents and vivid spot materials make them reliable. <TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this view. I firmly believe that people should not believe the new media completely. <TR>This is because first</TR>, articles by new media are also made by humans with diverse views and second, it can sometimes federate with a government or a company.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, articles cannot include perfectly objective coverage.</MI1><SI1> It is because most contents new media convey also made by reporters like historian who wrote many ancient books. <TR>That is</TR>, all articles are not raw truth as they need to be processed to be able to offered precisely with specific views. <TR>Then</TR>, they are framed into a reporter's particular standpoint. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, although a real occurrence brought about and the truth is only one, the point about the happening can be different in accordance to new media. Such different perspectives as to a occurrence also make distinct preference among people who choose particular media to subscribe or watch. The methods media put importance differently are represented in content or structure aspects. <TR>In case of content facet</TR>, different media reporters can stealthily imply their perspective on the articles and also they can use different headlines structurally. <TR>Thus</TR>, it is hard to say that new media are reliable.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, sometimes the new media cooperation are involved in other profit relationships such as governments or other commercial companies.</MI2><SI2>The fact that the new media also need funds to be operated cannot make them completely independent themselves. That is the reason why they sometimes distress between the sense of responsibility about dealing an article with objective views at most and inevitable profitable relationship with commercial markets like advertisements. <EX><TR>In addition</TR>, governments can overpower the new presses wielding their power because they want not to be criticized by citizens. Such many outer pressures make them confused. Such confliction sometimes make unaccurate information and results in corruption.</EX></SI2><TR>Hence</TR>, the remark that new media are fair information provider is little absurd.<BO2>

<CO>In conclusion, it is my belief that new media cannot be completely impartially about their articles. It it because their coverages are also written by human also they sometimes have the probability to collude other companies or governments. Maybe, there would not be fair media even in the more developed future because media cannot deviate from framing specific truth. It just requires the enhancement of the civic's views beholding the world.</CO>
column23: This was a great essay. It had good points, good examples, and wrapped it up all nicely.

column1: 382&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken.Why did you enjoy this class so much?
column3:
<IN><TS>Everybody has their special memory in school days. </TS>
It can be caused by your favorite class. For me, art class was the most interesting class in my high school days because of the teacher and my ability. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the teacher of the art class was very handsome and very good at drawing.</MI1><SI1>Whe I saw him at the first day of the term, he seemed like an actor of romantic movie.His eye were large enough and lips were like an apple, and he was very tall with long legs. </SI1>Next class when he showed us his own paintinf,it was so fantastic and I couldn't believe that the painting was drawn by him. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I was very good at drawing and I liked to paint.</MI2> 
<SI2>Whenever I completed my paintinf,the friends were so surprised at my exellant painting and they used to envy me. <TR>As a matter of a fact</TR>, my grade of art class was higher than any other friends. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>For these two reasons</TR>, my art class in high school days was remained as interesting experience.I want to have one more chane to take class like that.</CO>
column23: The essay topic seems easy to write about, but it is difficult because it is so familiar. The Thesis is very vague and does little to dig into the topic at hand. The author does a decent job trying to get to a good essay, but there is still a lot lacking in style and usage of higher level vocabulary.

column1: 383&We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (someone you work closely with)? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important
column3:
<IN>I am working at a research center. <TS>Even though I am researching single topic by myself, often I found my condition is very dependent on my work colleagues.</TS> <TR>Of course</TR> sometimes my work makes me tired but it doesn`t force me think about other job. <TR>In contrast</TR>, because of a work colleague from time to time I try to change my job. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>I think that most important characteristic of co-worker is altruistic mind.</MI1><SI1>Cooperation is very essential to work together in work place but even if just one person thinks about his or her own work and doesn`t consider any other people, there can`t be any synergic effect to complete the mission.</SI1> Thinking other people first is the quality which I willing to get for the co-worker of other people. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, a faithful mind is critical for working together.</MI2><SI2>If someone is very kind but doesn`t have any responsibility for his or her job, the kindness is needless in case of doing job.</SI2> I also try to complete my task by myself on time for prevent giving other workers distress. </BO2>

<CO>Working with other people harmoniously is very important because it give worker happy and good result for doing job as well but as we know it is not so easy and effortful. <TR>To achieve this</TR>, I should effort to get the good characteristics which I mentioned above than wish to meet the qualified co-workers.</CO>
column23: This is a decent essay except for the introduction. The introduction does almost nothring for the essay as a whole. None of the background details have relevance to the topic, and the thesis also has almost nothing to do with th topic. It seems to come from a different essay. Apart from that, the rest of the essay is much better with good topic related main and supporting ideas.

column1: 384&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3:
<IN>Supervisor, leader of certain group, has to have some important qualities as a good boss. <TR>As a leader of group</TR>, they have potent power in group. This is why supervisor must have good qualities. <TS>I believe that supervisor should have two qualities, leadership and fast determination.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, supervisors ought to have leadership.</MI1><SI1>Being a supervisor means that they have to lead followers. </SI1> If their supervisor weren't have leadership, they couldn't follow their leader, because lack of vision. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, supervisors must have fast determination.</MI2><SI2><TR>Recently</TR>, world changes very fast. Late determination means lose. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, IBM, which is one of the biggest computer company, had lose, because of late determination in personal computer trands. </EX> </SI2<TR>However</TR> they recovered recently. PC World, well-known computer paper, said that this dramatic change came from their fast determination. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I insist that supervisor should have two qualities, leadership and fast determination. I am sure that these two qualities leads supervisors right way. If they were not have them, being a supervisor must be hard. <TR>Moreover</TR>, their group can easily lose.</CO>
column23: The essay does not flow from one point to the next because it get's off topic between the thesis/main points and the supporting ideas. Supervisors usually means by implication lower level managers, not the CEO and executive staff of a company. This disconnect is a major issue with this essay. Furthermore, there are a number of obvious grammatical and word choice errors in this essay.

column1: 385&What are the important qualities of a good son or daughter? Have these qualities changed or remained the same over time in your culture? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Every parent want his daughters or sons to be well educated as he teaches. <TS>In my point of view, a good son or daugter's good qualities are as follows.</TS> <IN>

<BO1><MI1>The main good quality is fillal piety.</MI1><SI1>Good sons and daughters are well aware of the fact that they were borne thanks to their parents, therefore they should obey to their parents. <TR>But</TR>, in the world, it seems like that many children have difficulty obeying their parents.</SI1><TR>So</TR>, what I would like to make clear here is that the sons or daughters should always obey to parents regardless of the tendency of the present children in the world. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The second quality is the wisdom of the sons or daughters.</MI2><SI2> We might regard 'wisdom' as a tool used in trickery, but it really is not. Wisdom rather means that how individuals wisely cope with problems in society. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, consider many youngsters in schools. Many of them commit suicide. Many youngsters think committing suicide will solve all problems and they will be comfortable. Their parents regard their youngsters as treasures. But they do not care about their parents. It is the one of the examples that show how they are unfaithful to their parents. Many might think that committing suicide can be justified because the behavior is widely conducted, but regardless of the fact, it means that they are not aware of the priciousness of life.</EX></SI2><TR>In this situation</TR>, younsters should show wisdom. </BO2>

<CO><TR>Consequently</TR>, the good qulities of a good son or daughter are as follows. Obeying to his or her parents and wisdom.</CO>
column23: The author has good main ideas but instantly spends the entire supporting idea to negatively portray how the main idea is not upheld by society. This could be seen as against the topic which was to show what is a good child, not the failures  of children in being good.

column1:
386&What is the most important animal in your country? Why is the animal 
important? Use reasons and specific details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>There is a specially important animal in every country. <TS><TR>In case of Korea</TR>, the magpie has been one of the most beloved and important animals.</TS> The reason is that it has been regarded as a messenger of good news, and a messenger of love. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the crucial reason is that magpies are messengers of good news in Korea. </MI1><SI1>Magpies have capacities to see farther than any other animals, and to distinguish welcome visitors from inhabitants. <TR>Thus</TR>, when they see a welcome visitor in the distance, they twitter loudly.</SI1> Owing to the phenomenon, people came to regard magpies as an animal, which inform us about good news. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the other reason consists in a messenger of love.</MI2><SI2><TR>In Korea</TR>, there is an impressive fable about a magpie as a messenger of love. The title is a Kyunwoo and Jicknye. The story is as follows. For some reason, Kyunwoo and Jicknye were separated, and could not meet again. Many magpies felt them pitiful. <TR>Thus</TR>, they made a long bridge, by using their bodies, enough to connect two places where Kyunwoo and Jicknye lived respectively. <TR>As the result</TR>, Kyunwoo and Jicknye could meet each other. </SI2><TR>Through the fable</TR>, Koreans have considered a magpie a messenger of love. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, in case of Korean, considering role of magpie as a messenger of good news, and love. It is clear that a magpie can be the most special and important animal in Korean.</CO>
column23: The author creatively addresses the topic through the use of a colorful story. This required a creative thesis and well thought out ideas. It was a nice read.

column1: 387&When famous people such as actors, athlets and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions?
column3:
<IN>It is commonly seen that people are likely to listen to famous people such as entertainers or sportsmen especially they like. And it is quite true that people replace their own opinions with those of famous people. <TR>Accodingly</TR> actors, atheltes or rock stars seem to be getting considerable power over making social opinion. It is not, however, favorable, I think, because the one who make opinion should himself/herself, not famous people. <TS>I am going to mention why I disagree the statement that we should pay attention to famouse people for the following reasons. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>I have my own favorite acotr, athlet and singer.</MI1></SI1> And I respect them as a good professional because they always try to be the best in each field. I like Michael Jordan, legendary basketball player because whenever I watch his playing on TV, I am quite a bit fascinated by his excellent play. The reason I like him is just because he plays basketball well. That's it. Once out of court, he is just a guy I know. Suppose he mentioned one of his favorite candidates during American Presidency Campaign. But If I were American, I wouldn't listen to him though I like him. It's because he is just a player. <TR>Outside of his field</TR>, he is as good as a common man.</SI1> The fact I like him as a basketball player should not influence on making my own opinion or decision. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Unfortunately lots of people are influenced by who they like when making opinion.</MI2><SI2>Most consumate and most common example will be commercail advertisement. A purpose of employing famous poeple in advertisement is that people are like to choose to buy the product which famous people are recommening. I was considering buy shose but It was hard time to choose which one. On TV I saw Jordan was advertising shose. I finally made up my mind to buy that product though it cost much more than other ones.</SI2> But it was a poor choice because there were a lot of other ones which cost much less and more robust one. </BO2>

<CO><TR>So far</TR> I mentioned that why we should not pay attention to famaous poeple for their opinion 
Famous people are famous just because they are popular in thier own fields. But outsiede of thier fields, they rarely have no authority for us to depend on or convince in. <TR>Rather</TR> when we have to make a opinion or make a choice to buy somethung, what is most important is you have to consider and you have to make it. We should not be influenced by our idols.</CO>
column23: This essay has many ideas but very little is written in a comprehendable manner due to the many word choice, vocabulary, and grammatical errors.

column1:
388&When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success. 
Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It has been said that people could succeed owing not to be lucky, but to work hard. <TS>Although it is true that working hard is one of the most essential factors to succeed, but I believe that it is impossible to succeed only with their efforts if it were not been luck in course of work.</TS> The reasons why luck is necessary for success will be presented briefly in this essay. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, succeed is related to opportunity which come from accidentally.</MI1><SI1>Accidental opportunity should be obtained by luck, not by one’s willingness. <TR>In other words</TR>, although a person have a remarkable ability, the opportunity to perform this is rare. <TR>Commonly</TR>, people meet this opportunity by chance: sometime and somewhere else. Without luck, we don’t face a good opportunity and come true our dream. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, some movie stars become casting in the street, not by passing the audition. Whether they have an effort to their succeed or not, they caught an opportunity to grow as big star. <TR>In this case</TR>, it come from completely their luck.</EX> <EX><TR>Another example</TR>, students who study hard are not always pass the exam.</EX></SI1> Because of having no luck, these persons failed. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, there are some factor for succeed that people cannot complete such as whether, condition, environmental sources and so on.</MI2><SI2><TR> In other word</TR>, although a person have a opportunity to show their ability, those factor disturb that work will be done well. 
<EX><TR>For example</TR>, when a grand concert is designed to hold on outdoor stage in summer, it might be cancled by rainfall. However a performer prepare for this concert, bad weather is not controled by human being. <TR>Also</TR>, when a company invented some convenient instruments for household if domestic economy condition is so depressed, consumer is not adapted this. </EX><TR>So</TR>, benefit from this invention is nothing and company will not succeed.</SI2> <TR>In this regard</TR>, it is said that success cling to luck, not effort. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, people who succeed in one division have an effort too much to achieve their goal. <TR>However</TR>, it is more important for them to have luck in that opportunity come from accidentally and some factor for success are not predictable to us. <TR>Eventually</TR>, lucky person catch an opportunity and success.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay that has a good thesis, topic, main and supporting ideas. It's main shortfall is in grammar and word choice.

column1: 389&When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success" do you agree or disagree with the quotation above?
column3:
<IN>When people succeed, it is because of hard work. I agree that it is almost impossible to succeed with out hard work. Those who are successful are always diligent and determined. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, I think that luck also plays a role in the outcomes of our lives. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, it is impossible to plan for every scenario in our lives. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Let's take the case of me.</MI1><SI1>My friend and I consulted a fortuneteller in Internet because we have to take the exam to enter the university. The fortuneteller say that my friend can enter the university but I can't therefore I was so upset but I never give up. <TR>After one years later</TR>, we took the entrance examination and the result is my friend was failed and I success in the examination. The reason is that my friend didn't study hard because of fortuneteller says but I studied very hard. </SI1><TR>Succinctly</TR>, the fortuneteller says is wrong and hard work is the key of success. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>People who understand challenges and goals are well rounded people.</MI2><SI2> They know what its like to work hard for the success they want to achieve. If people expect luck to bring success their way, they may have to wait for a long time. If the inventors in history had waited for luck to show them how to make a light bulb or how to transmit electricity, we would probably still be waiting. </SI2>These inventors tried and tried again until they succeeded in their goal. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I think that successful people deserve our respect. They are usually responsible for their won accomplishments. But those people who are successful should also count their blessings. <TR>I most cases</TR>, luck has been on their side and has contributed to the success that they now enjoy.</CO>
column23: This essay has a good thesis and ideas, but it is short on examples and proper grammar. Spelling is also an issue.

column1: 390&When someone visits your house without invitation, what will you do?
column3:
<IN><TS>One cannot say with any certainty what a good decision is.</TS> <TR>Personally</TR>, if someone visits my house without invitation, I think that I will refuse to get him or her in my home. There are several reasons as follows.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, an unexpected visit makes me embarrassed as well as unpleasant.</MI1><SI1><TR>For example</TR>, if either I wore pajama with disheveled hair or I just started to clean up bathroom with a mud pack on my face, no doubt, I wouldn’t show my bad looks to someone. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, someone who visits without notice will break my schedule.</MI2><SI2>Suppose that I am in an impending test. An unexpected visit costs me to spend my precious time to study for the test. This sounds as if I am a little more exaggerating than it seems, but it usually happens as in my case. </SI2><TR>Naturally</TR> he or she becomes an unwelcome guest. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In spite of considering the above-mentioned aspects</TR>, to make my choice whether I allow a visitor to come in or not is of course difficult. My refusal seems a kind of selfish and this decision itself makes me feel uneasy. <TR>Evidently</TR>, the ramification of this choice will provoke stress. Anyhow most unpredictable things usually lead me to uncomfortable ness. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, I will give a polite refusal to someone’s visit.</CO>
column23: This essay is just adequate. It is a bit short on supporting ideas and barely just has enough to formulate an argument. It is, however, fairly readable.

column1: 391&Which is more important for success : the natural ability you are born with or hard work? Explain your opinion, using specific reasons and examples.
column3:
<IN>Do you believe that someone's success is from his natural talent? I disagree with what I said above. <TS>I insist that it is more essential that hardworking makes someone's' success.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, if a person wants to be a specialist at his own field depending only natural ability without any efforts, he should wait for a long time or might be a failure.</MI1><SI1> I maintain that running for someone's goal without hardworking, he can't find what he was born with.</SI1><TR> Therefore</TR> he has to make a success by experiencing all sides of working and doing his best whatever he does. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, in my experience, whenever I showed what I did with all my efforts at work place, most of co-workers allowed me as professional.</MI2><SI2> If I relied on my natural ability, I could make a mistake and a disadvantage in my life. I didn't show off airs even though I was good at that work.</SI2><TR> Thus</TR> those who want to succeed have to be moderate. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, as there is an old saying like "Heaven helps those who help themselves", natural ability is looking for a person who does hardworking, too.</CO>
column23: This essay is just adequate. It is a bit short on supporting ideas and barely just has enough to formulate an argument. It is, however, fairly readable.

column1: 392&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN><TR>Generally</TR>, any roommate makes much effect on us during the campus life. Choosing our own roommate is probably one of important events.<TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I’d rather have the university choose my roommate.</TS> This will not only give new and various experiences but also save time choosing own roommate. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the former case doesn’t require us anything but we should fill out information sheet including age, major, and interesting field and so on.</MI1><SI1> <TR>But if we all must choose our own roommate</TR>, we should spend much time to get information from the list of students. <TR>In this case</TR>, we should find out a person who seems to get along with us and he also has to agree with us.</SI1> <TR>So</TR>, most of the students might choose one of their friends as a roommate. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, Students should have their range of thought widen through various experiences.</MI2><SI2> If they would choose a person their knowing before as a roommate, they might lose the chance which they could have own range of thought widen. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was university student, my major was physics and my roommate’s one was music. I had known how to listen to music well from him. And also I had had a chance touching many kinds of music.</EX></SI2> <TR>Of course</TR>, he also could get the common scientific knowledge from me. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, considering that we can have new experience and various opinions through new person and that we don’t waste time to choose a roommate, I’d rather have the university assign a student as my roommate.</CO>
column23: This essay is very cryptic and difficult to understand. The ideas from paragraph to paragraph do not line up or work together to make any real point. Even the main points seem like supporting points for some unknown idea.

column1: 393&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>We have much interaction with our roommates. <TR>Therefore</TR>, choosing a roommate is an important event in our university lives. <TS>I would rather have the university assign a student to share a room with me.</TS> There are several reasons that I select that way. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>One reason is I could save much time.</MI1><SI1> If I chose my own roommate, I would have to do many things. <TR>First</TR>, I would need to investigate a list the university gave to me, and then I would select some candidates from it. <TR>After that</TR>, I should contact them by phone, by mail, or in person to decide who is the best roommate for me. I would do a lot of job to find out my roommate. </SI1><TR>In spite of the fact that</TR>, despite my great effort, I would get into trouble with my roommate because living with a person is different from knowing a person well. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another reason is the university is an expert to select roommates.</MI2><SI2> My university, Hangang University, has done this job for over 10 years and I think it has its own skill to find one's roommate. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, if I took my roommate, I would do similar job my university would do. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, age, hobby, interests, and mayor are the most important information to select a roommate and I might consider those factors to choose my roommate.</EX><TR> However</TR>, my university would do the same job what I do because we always fill out a dormitory application form with those information when we want to have a room in dormitory. </SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, the university does better job than I do. </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am not an expert in choosing my roommate and if the university chose my roommate I could save time. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, I could spend my time left for doing other valuable things.</CO>
column23: This essay is just adequate. It is a bit short on supporting ideas and barely just has enough to formulate an argument. It is, however, fairly readable. There are many transitions and they flow nicely.

column1: 394&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>If I receive a gift of money, I would buy concert tickets of the following reasons: a concert is more intellectually stimulating, more emotionally satisfying and more socially responsible.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>For one thing</TR>, attending a concert such as a concert of classical music can expand my cultural intellectual horizons, especially if it is a concert of music I have not heard before. </MI1><SI1><TR>For example</TR>, I can still recall a performance of Indian classical music. And dance I attended over 15 years ago. <TR>Prior to that concert</TR>, I knew very little about India or Indian music, but after reading the program booklet and watching the concert, I learned both the history and cultural significance of that style of dance. </SI1>I have had this knowledge since then. </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, while wearing a new ring or bracelet may be satisfying for a day or evening, much deeper and more permanent feelings are aroused by music.</MI2><SI2><TR> Last year</TR> I attended a benefit concert to raise money for homeless children. All the musicians played songs about children at the concert, and the audience was invited to sing along. <TR>As we sang together</TR>, I felt a deep sense of community and love.</SI2> We had all arrived at the concert as individuals, but we left feeling like a family. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</Tr>, purchasing and wearing a piece of jewelry can be a selfish action: one buys jewelry because one wants to look beautiful and wants others to notice the new pin or necklace.</MI3><SI3>By attending a concert, however, we have the opportunity to participate in the artistic life of society and show our interests and supports for those who posses great talent.</SI3> When we buy a concert ticket, we provide financial supports for these many singers, musicians, and dancers who make a living through the arts. </BO3>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, although wearing jewelry can provide some temporary happiness, I feel attending a concert is more intellectually stimulating, more emotionally satisfying and more socially responsible.</CO>
column23: This essay is just adequate. It is a bit short on supporting ideas and barely just has enough to formulate an argument. It is, however, fairly readable.

395& It has been just announced that a new baseball stadium may be built in your neighbor

column3:
<IN><TS>I support that a new baseball stadium is built in my neighborhood.<TS></IN>

<BO1>Many people like to play baseball and go to stadium. So they can spend their extra time in playing game or going to stadium. And baseball stadium require many restrants and places of rest for people going to stadium. <TR>hence<TR> many unemployed neighbors and poor people in my area can earn their money. So our local economy will grow more than before. But baseball stadium probally can pollute in our clean area. But this problem is fewer than our getting profit.</BO1>
