column3:
<IN>For the most of the times when I watch a TV or read a magazine, I sometimes see the advertisements, too. Most of them were always giving me the idea that I need to buy that product on the advertisement. <TS>It is really good that sometimes some advertisements introduce new products that can make our life more improved. But it is sure that a lot of advertisements are making the customers buy the product by using the power of the advertisement.</TR> There are a lot of examples about this.</IN>

<BO1><MI1>The most ridiculous advertisement is about the golf ball.</MI1> <SI1>It is said that many scientist studied the golf ball and made the ball go longer when it was hit by a golf club. I can’t understand that why scientists need to study the golf ball that is really not necessary for the improvement of our life. I guess the company that produces the golf ball might wanted to appeal people with showing their effort to make the ball better, but in my opinion, they must have not done any scientific study about the golf ball. If they really studied a lot about the golf ball, why can’t the ball go much longer than the ball that produced 10 years ago? It is only the company’s idea to higher the price so that they can have more profit.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR> ridiculous advertisement is an advertisement about a make-ups.</MI2> <SI2>They also say that they studied the make-ups scientifically, so that they could make women prettier. I guess the word ‘scientifically’ appeals to the people a lot. <TR>But</TR>, I think the reason that many women look prettier is not because of the make-ups, but because of the way they do the make-ups. I don’t think that the make-ups did a lot of work to improve the faces of women. If they really made women look prettier, then there should be no women that look ugly, because the history of the make-up is pretty long but the way to do the make-up is not.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO>Only by these two advertisements, you can see that our money is spent to the people who like our money, but not us. The company’s cunning trick is driving us to spend money to the products that are not that far different from the similar previous product. It is nonsense that we haven’t improve a lot from 20 years before, with a technology we have. We should not be trusting every word that the advertisements say. Their purpose is our money, not our comfort.</CO>
column23: Fairly organized, lacking in analysis. Overall acceptable essay

column1: 476&Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that advertising give us very useful informaion about new products to improve our lives. <TS>However, I think that it encourages us to buy things we really do not neet. There are two major reasons for this.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, advertisement is more attractive than what we think.</MI1> <SI1>There are many advertisements and companys introduced by them around us. All advertisements are mediums to compete each product for their profits. So they should be made more attractive than real things. This exaggerated advertising seduce that we buy their new products.</SI1> <EX>I somethimes bought many things what I saw those on the advertisement. If I use the product, I seem like the model on the advertisement.</EX></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, advertising make me to use much money.</MI2> <SI2><EX>For example, whenever I see a bargain advertisement from Wal-Mart, because every things looks much less cost than other places are bought, I buy many products that I do not need on impulse. Usually, after using these things, I would be done unnecessary things any more, and they are in the closet.</EX> Buying impulsive does not make me to save money.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am sure that advertising stimulate us to buy useless things. Because of these "an exaggerated advertisement and saving money" reasons above, advertising encourages us to buy things we do not need.</CO>
column23: Very thoughtful reasons

column1: 477&Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Today we can’t live without advertisement whatever we want or not. Some people believe that advertising makes us to spend more money and other people argue that it gives us useful information about new product. Undoubtedly both of all are worthy of consideration. <TS>But, as I will demonstrate several examples, we should support that advertisement is very useful in our life.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>. Advertisement gives us a lot of information about products such as prices, size and color.</MI1> <SI1>If we want to buy a new car without any information it is very difficult to choose the car tailored our requirement. But recently we can have much information of cars by advertisements offered by auto- mobile companies in TV, newspaper or Internet. So we can buy a car without visiting mobile shop.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR> advertisement gives us not only commercial information but also information of public good.</MI2> <SI2><EX>For example, advertisement about using condom against A.I.D.S can enlighten people who didn’t know why condom must be used.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Unfortunately, advertisement can make us buy things not necessary to us but in almost all case it can tell us very useful information about new products improving our lives. In my thought, it depends on our adoption or rejection whether advertisements are good or harm for us.</CO>
column23: Good reasoning. Weak thesis

column1: 478&Some people think that the family is the most important influence on young adults. Other people think that friends are the most important influence on young adults. Which view do you agree with? Use examples to support your position.
column3:
<IN>In the case of younger children, I think that family is the most important influence. <TS>For young adults, <TR>however</TR>, I completely agree that friends are a greater influence than family is. There are two main reasons for my opinion : contacting frequently and sharing similar problems.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, young adults spent more time with their friends than with their parents.</MI1> <SI1>In the case of me, I spent most time in the school when I was a university student. I was surrounded by my peers whatever I did ; I had lunch and I drank a cup of coffee, and I studied in the library. My friends who shared a great amount of time with me was much more importantly influential people than my parents were.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, young adults have a lot of similar problems with friends.</MI2> <SI2>As they grow older, they suffer from a great deal of problems such as association with a girlfriend or a boyfriend, the study, and a future job they will have. It is friends, who already experienced those troubles, that are the best consultant under that circumstance.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, since they spend a great amount of time getting along with their friends giving a lot of advice about their personal problems, young adults are greatly influenced by their friends. I am absolutely sure that friends play a major role in the life of young adults. <TR>Therefore</TR>, It is so essential that young adults have good friends who guide them to righteous way.</CO>
column23: Excellent reasoning

column1: 479&Some people think that the family is the ost important influence on yound adults. Other people think that friends are the most important influence on young adults. Which view do you agree with? Use examples to support your position.
column3:
<IN>Teenagers are usually influenced by the people around them. They give you senses of what to do or what should I do. The periods when you are young adults, the people you deal with every day are mostly your family members and friends. Therefore, their effect on your life is undeniable. <TS>Of the two, however, the effect of friends on teenagers is the more considerable.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason</TR> that the friends are most influential persons in one's teenage is that he or she spend more time with friends at a time.</MI1> <SI1><EX>In Korea, middle school and high school students spend almost 15 hours with their friends in school. They study together, eat together and then they become like family members. One of my friends once said that she can't even remember her own mother's face.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>The second reason</TR> is that there exists some kind of symphathies among friends.</MI2> <SI2>They pass through same agony in the same age. Thus, teenagers can share their similar problems with their friends. They can talk about sex, grades, boy/girl friend in the same level. I usually share my problems with my friends without any burdens, and then my friends give me advice which is obtained from their own experiences. Accordingly, we can feel more intimacy from interchanging each other's thoughts. <TR>As a result</TR>, we make an big effect on each other reciprocally.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the most influencial persons on young adults are their friends because of a great amout of time they spend together and their symphaties. They mainly affect your ego-making procedure. That is, teenagers orgnize their values based on thier friends' thoughts. They keep this values mostly designed by their friends untill the day when they become grown-ups.</CO>
column23: Average essay, could improve English usage

column1: 480&Think of the most important class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>The enjoyable class gives you not only the pleasure of learning but also lots of knowledge. This kind of class is remebered as the most interesting and practical class in your memory. <TS>In my case, the most important and joyous class in my life was the film class which was the class taken when I was in the high school because of its having interesting and practical knowledge.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason</TR> why I love this class is that it contains a lot of useful sources of film-making.</MI1> <SI1>I never interested in the film itself, but once taken this class, I was captured by the magic of this movie class. It offered me that a lot of artistic and interesting movies which I never seen before. Moreover, afther the movie, teacher gave us a lecture about how the scene in the movie can be shown, or how the actors or actresses react in the certain situation. In addition, there was the pure knowledges about the film-making ; the angle of camera, the uses of light and mike in film etc. were absolutely new to me. What it's like to be "learn" was unfamiliar to me but it was pretty flesh and fun.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>The second reason</TR> why I love this class is that It gave me lots of interesting sources.</MI2> <SI2>The teacher gave us interesting backgroud like how the director of this film inspired to initiate the film and the funny things happened during the film-making. This kinds of backgrounds of film-making makes me more engaged in the movie. I didn't like movie at the first place but at the end of semester, I counld't take my eyes off every stuffs such as the newspaper, magazine and so on which dealt with the film-making. Because I realized that the movie is incredibly interesting thing that can be made by humans through this class.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the most important and enjoyable class in my life was the movie class due to its interesting and knowlegable sources. It was like inspiration for my whole day . Everytime I couldn't present this class because of lots of other stuffs or my laziness, my frustration of not being in the class kept me down all day. You never know the pleasure of learning unless you do take this class sometime. I hope that there will be some opportunity to take this class again.</CO>
column23: Confusing phrasing

column1: 481&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>several years have passed since I entered the university in 1996. <TS>There was many interesting classes,but the most interesting subject was "the historiy and culture of orient" in that the professor's erudition and humor, the outdoor class, and my interest about oriental history.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the professor, Yong-bum Kim, was very erudite and he had an ability to make students concentrate on his class.</MI1> <SI1>we had never been absent from his class. Every students in university wanted to take his class. I think I was a luck boy at that time.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, we should go to a travel around the historical place.</MI2> <SI2>It was a succection of his class. The professor divided us eight group. The aim of travel was not for the knowledge but also for the human relationship. Our group member became a friend and we are still in good relation.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>The last</TR>, originally I am interested in oriental history such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean history.</MI3> <SI3>My hobby is reading historic books, I always watch the TV program relevant to history. If I were not majoring in computer engineering I would be an archaeologist.</SI3></BO3>

<CO>I was realy like that class so that I studied very hard. So I got A grade in that class. It can be one of the reasons why I like "the history and culture of orient class". 
The class, the professor, and the students are still in my memory.</CO>

column1: 482&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>I have been attending a lot of classes for several years. There were some boring classes also some interesting classes. I enjoyed my English class which I took at university. It was different from a boring high school English class. <TS>Because university English class was in English, non-traditional class, I liked this class and learned many things.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, university English class which was processing in English gave me more advantages than high school English class which was in Korean.</MI1> <SI1>Because not only the text book but also teacher's words were English, I had to learn all grammar and memorize all examples in English. Memorizing in English gave me more knowledge of vocabulary and phrase. The high school English class which was in Korean couldn't give me a clear sense of English grammar because the text book was translated in Korean which had not exact meaning of English.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I enjoyed university class which gave me more knowledge.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the university English class was non- traditional class, I had a chance to present my opinion.</MI2> <SI2>In high school, it was traditional class which made student passive. Even though I had a good idea, I couldn't talk to my teacher. He thought that students must follow the teacher's opinion. However, in university English class, I could speak my opinion and if it was good, the teacher would accept it. It made me confident. Also, I had to speak in English in a class, I could improve my English speaking skill.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>I have learned a great amount of knowledge in many classes. However, there are few classes which give me real advantages. I am interested in class which can give me real knowledge to use in the future. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I enjoyed learning in English in English class and in non-traditional class. It makes me more confident, give me more freedom to speak my opinion, and know many things about English.</CO>

column1: 483&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>The most interesting class I have ever taken is the Advanced English Conversation during the summer session last year.</TS> I not only enjoyed the class so much but also could improve my overall speaking ability. Actually this class had two unique strategies in encouraging students to progress rapidly.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the instructor frequently gave the students an opportunity participate and speak in class.</MI1> <SI1>I believe instructors' attitude is one of the main factors to make student involved in class or not. From this point, Advanced English class had a perfect instructor who pays devoted attention to students' overall performance and progression.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the various subjects that we dealt with were just appropriate to pick everyone's attention.</MI2> <SI2>We covered one topic per week, including economy, music, insanity, technology and etc. This wide range of topic was especially good in a class which was made up of students of different majors, giving everyone an equal knowledge base for the class discussion.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, those two elements mentioned above were effective in bringing student's participation and at the same time in increasing the class performance. It was indeed a good and useful experience that I would never forget.</CO>

column1: 484&We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (someone you work closely with)? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important.
column3:
<IN>All people have their own characteristics. Because human being is a social animal, all of them must work with other people. Some people say that these co-workers have to have their characters such as funny, friendly, and smart. <TS>However, I think that the most important characteristics are harmony and responsibility.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, co-workers need harmony with other workers.</MI1> <SI1><EX>For example, when I was an engineer in my company, I worked with graphic designers and other engineers.</EX> Although all engineers want to finish their work very fast and accuracy, most designers want to work slowly and freely. Because of their different characters, we sometimes occurred a conflict of opinions. At that time, conducting a business was very slow and we could not set our project on time. If we were harmonious, we could finish our project before on time.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, besides this "harmony" reason for co-worker in the company, co-workers need responsibility about their job.</MI2> <SI2>Most our project in my company was very large how much no one could do that alone. In this case, if one worker did not process his part what he must do, other workers who work with him, also could not do their parts. It would bring a result of latency for our project management.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am sure that harmony and responsibility is the most important character what co-worker must have. It brings a high degree of efficiency to our job and company.</CO>
column23: Lapses in usage

column1: 485&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>I think that it's very difficult to become a parent. Because a parent demand many responsibility. If you want to become a good parent, you must be keep to the three word; many admiration, many communication and reliability.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>first of all</TR>, you become a good parent, you applause to a your child.</MI1> <SI1>A praise is very important. Because child to praise is full of confidence in anywhere. however, otherwise child lack assurance in anywhere and acclimate oneself to a new environment. especially, korean parent is not accustomed applause and they think that it is a right method. however, that is an error.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>second</TR>, you must be many communication with child.</MI2> <SI2><EX>for example, if you have many talk with child, you are intimate with your child and you know his mind.</EX> however, if you don't have a talk with child, he is isolated because he thinks "My parent doesn't understand about me".</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>finally</TR>, you give a trust for you child.</MI3> <SI3>that is to say, you always keep to a promise to your child. <EX>for example, if you keep to a promise to him, he is to believe and follow about you. however, if you don't keep to a promise to him, he has a doubt about your word and he thinks that a promise is not important.</EX></SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>conclusively</TR>, because these reasons, I think that if you become a good parent, you follow three word above all. If I grow a parent, I will make every effort and I observe these three word.</CO>
column23: A little weak in grammar and usage. Great examples

column1: 486&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that the study room is the most important room in their house ,and Others say the dining room. <TS>However, If someone ask me what do I consider the most important room in my house, I will say that the restroom is more important than any other room in my house.</TS> There are two main reasons for my view : sanitation and a busy room.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, the restroom is the symbol of sanitation of the house.</MI1> <SI1>It is said to go to the restroom and look at its condition if you want to know how sanitary the house is. This means that the restroom is the most important room in sanitation of the house. <EX>For examples, When I visited the house of my friend two years ago, I was surprised at the huge room and luminous furniture. Going into the restroom, <TR>however</TR>, I was much disappointed and unpleasant to know that the restroom was unclean, smelly, and messy.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the restroom is the busiest room in the house.</MI2> <SI2>The room which is most members of the family go into and out of most frequently every morning is the restroom. As most people are very busy every morning, my family is no exception, too. Father, mother, an old brother and I used to compete to enter the restroom every morning because all of us had to go to company on time. Recently, since we moved to the house with two toilets, we came to be less competitive.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, since it represents cleanness of a house and is the most frequent room, I think that the restroom is more important than any other room in a house.</CO>
column23: Very creative way to think of this topic

column1: 487&What is the most important animal in your country? Why is the animal important? Use reasons and specific details to explain your answer
column3:
<IN>There are many important animals in each country. My country, Korea, surely have these animals. <TS>Among the animals, I think that the most consequence animal in my country is a tiger. There are two major reasons for this.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a tiger is my country's mascot.</MI1> <SI1>Whenever we have a big event like olympic games and asian games, we use a tiger as a mascot. <EX>For example, in the 88 Seoul olympic games, its mascot is Hodolie that its mean is a tiger as a phonetic spelling in Korean. And in the all zoo, a tiger is the most famous, expensive, and important animal. All children are going to a zoo to see a tiger.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Besides</TR> these "mascot" reasons in my country, we have others of a more character.</MI2> <SI2>My country's map looks like a tiger that is roaring. From ancient times, our ancestor believed that a tiger gave us a fortune, money, and fame(reputation). In most legends, because a tiger descripted a powerful and a dreadful animal, all strong persons called a tiger. In these days, we still want to resemble temple of a tiger in my country.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, for these reasons above; mascot and tiger's temple, I am sure that a tiger is the most important animal in my country. No one can deny this importance of a tiger.</CO>

column1: 488&What is the most interesting class you have ever taken?
column3:
<IN>Pythagoras and Decartes are some of my favorite scholars in the field of mathematics. Furthermore, there are great number of such innovative and respectable mathematicians who revolutionized our knowledge throughout the history. <TS>The mathematics is the most interesting class I have ever taken in my school for it's importance in our lives, definite solutions to problems, and the lessons it provides.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we can't exaggerate its significance in our daily lives enough.</MI1> <SI1>Everyday, we encounter mathematical problems starting with a trivial cause such as calculating how much money I should pay in a bookstore or supermaket. Sometimes, it can be amplified to more sophiscated problems such as building an architecture, working out chemistry equations and etc. In addition, the city we live in or the time we believe are all influenced by mathematics. They are actually organized with a mathematical concept and I think an infra-structure(such as roads) is a typical form since it is built with an accurate measurement of distance. We can find mathematics related surroundings anywhere and anytime.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, mathematics is one of the rare subjects that has definite answers to problems.</MI2> <SI2>The idea of 'one plus one' is always equal to 'two'. No one would turn up and say its wrong since it is a rule, an absolute answer accepted by people all around the world. However, when it comes to a subject like literature there is no lucid answer for questions like 'what was the writer's intention to let Romeo and Juliet end in death?' or 'what was the motivation for Hemingway to write books?". It can vary from one person to another considering their individuality and knowledge.<SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, it offered invaluable lessons that influenced the great turning point of my school life.</MI3> <SI3>In Korea, mathematics is regarded as one of the vital subjects we have to learn in schools. For instance, the subject is a mandatory to students ranging from primary schools to high schools. Therefore, it clings to their legs no matter how they feel about it, either bad or good. I have experienced a great hardship in order to get accustomed to this headaching subject since I was a litte kid. However, after entering my high school, things started to brighten up litte because it had changed my behavior to be more organized and puncture. Solving out mathematical problems widened my comprehension and concerntration in studying. In addition, I attained the lesson of being accurate and catious in doing other mundane chores as well.<SI3></BO3>

<CO></TR>In brief</TR>, I just love studying mathematics though I'm not really planning to choose it as my future major in college. However, it has a great influence on our daily lives and also provides unambiguous solutions to problems. Moreover, it teaches me great lessons both mentally and physically. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it will and still remain as my most favorite class I have ever taken.</CO>
column23: very thoughtful essay

column1: 489&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Actually, clerks' poor service sometimes angers me, while I look around and choose in order to buy a product. I usually put up with it, but when I really need to complain, I prefer writing to talking directly, through e-mail or letter. <TS>In my case, it is the best way for me make a more rational and clear complaint.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Writing a complaint allows me to avoid emotional quarrel.</MI1> <SI1>When a clerk imposes me to purchase certain product or tries deceiving a price, I am very annoyed. In this situation, if I complained in person, my voice would get so loud, plus my words would hurt the clerk’s feelings, or could provoke him or her. I do not want to have an unnecessary fight, even if his or her service does not displease me.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>When I complain in writing, I can fairly discuss my dissatisfaction and measures they have to take.</MI2> <SI2>With enough time, I organize the problems of a product, unfair treatment, and so on, and in addition if necessary, add proper documents to support my argument. <TR>Therefore</TR>, my complaint would be more reasonable and persuasive than when I talk in the emotional state.<SI2></BO2>

<CO>By writing a complaint, I explain my view more rationally and logically. <TR>As a result</TR>, my choice would be to complain in writing. It is better that I don't have any to make a complaint, though.</CO>
column23: Offered good reasons

column1: 490&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>When I heard the news that my dormitory room should shard with another student, I would like to live with whom I choose by myself. <TS>Although it is true that living with a roommate who I don't know helps me to meet various students, I prefer to share my dormitory room with my close friend or classmate.</TS> In this essay, I will reveal briefly two reasons for my preference.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, living with a roommate who I already know well provides me with a comfortable living environment.</MI1> <SI1>In other words, if I share my room with my close friend or classmate, not only do not I have to spend much time finding out what the roommate likes or dislike and I also have to make an effort not to interfere her. Actually, it needs a tremendous time for me to adjust to a new person. Furthermore, the roommate who is assigned by the university could have a habit that I can't put up with. However, I need not do so if I live with whom I know well. In this respect, as sharing my room with a close person helps me neither to spend such efforts nor to worry about new roommate, I prefer to choose my roommate by myself.<SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, I can share common things with my roommate if I live with a close person.</MI2> <SI2>Particularly, as I should spend most of my time with her, it is so fun for me to share common hobbies or to study common fields with her. <EX>For example, because I like to play tennis, it is so enjoyable to play tennis with her. It can make us more friendly and funnier to live with. In this regard, living with a roommate close to me make me possible to share common things.</EX><SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, sharing my dormitory room is more beneficial for me because I I want to live in a comfortable condition and also want to enjoy the same stuffs what I like to do. Regarding this respects, I still prefer to live with a roommate who is close to me.</CO>

column1: 491&You have decided to give several hours of your time each month to improve the community where you live. What is one thing you will do to improve your community? Why? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3:
<IN>In my community, there are many people needing helps. Also, there are many things which I can do to improve my community. <TS>However, if I give several hours of my time each month to improve my community, I will teach students.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, because I do best and like, I will teach students.</MI1> <SI1>I have been teaching students although I am not a teacher. Also, many students improved ; then I am happy. Besides, because I am weak, physical works are difficult to me. However, teaching students is not difficult to me.<SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, there are many students who want some to assist their study ; however, due to economical problems, it is impossible to some students.</MI2> <SI2>Students will become learder in future. If we help students study, students' ability improves more. I often see students who can improve if someone help them. However, because they are helped, it is really a matter for regret. Then, my community more improves.<SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a conclusion</TR>, I will teach students if giving several hours of my time each month to improve the community. Because I can do well and like and many students are not able to be helped. Students plays an important role in future ; therefor my community can improves</CO>

column1:
492&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a 
piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which 
would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>When people choose what they buy, they show different preferences about their choices. In this case, some people want to buy a piece of jewelry, 
while others decide to buy tickets. Both decisions have their own advantages. <TS>From my point of view, buying tickets to a concert is more valuable because I 
can spend time to relax myself and share enjoyable feeling with my wife.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I am able to relax myself tired from work.</MI1> <SI1>Nowadays, I am feeling so tired that I want to get some rest. In this situation, free tickets are really exciting me. Therefore, I would not hesitate to buy tickets.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, my wife and I can share good feeling by seeing a concert.</MI2> <SI2><EX>For example, I can make it up with her if my wife has been angry at me for some reasons. Apparently, tickets to a concert is a good gift for her, like money is one for me.</EX> For this reason, I want to buy concert tickets.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I would buy concert tickets if someone gives me a gift of money. Some people might argue that buying a piece of jewelry is more attractive because of its beautiful appearance. However, I am not interested in beautifying myself with jewelry. Futhermore, I would be worry about robbery if I buy a piece of jewelry. For me, buying tickets is the prior choice to buying a piece of jewelry because I need some rest and want to spend good time with my wife.</CO>

column1: 493&Your city has decided to build a statue or monument to honor a famous person in your country. Who would you choose? Use reasons and specific examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>If I am a mayor of the city and I have to choose a famous person to build a bronze statue, I'll order to my man to make Go Gyung Myung's statue. Go Gyung Myung lived 4 decades ago and he organized volunteer army against Japans invasion. He is not known for even Koreans, but He is one of the Korea's brave, straight scholar.</IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, He was famous for his scholarship and he took minister in Cho-sun government.</MI1> <SI1>When he resigned minister and returned his hometown, Doyotomi Hideyosy's Japanese army attacked Korea without reason. Though he was in a high-social position, He didn't run away. He spend his all money and gather righteous men to save his country. So far as he made his two sons fight against Japan. Though many governors and nobles escaped,, He fight out and save his homeland.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, even if he had very few followers and surrounded by three times more enemies, he did not surrendered to Japanese and dead in battle with his second son.</MI2><SI2>(His eldest son also dead in another battle.) His several hundreds armies also dead with him. Though Go's volunteer army was completely destroyed, Japanese gave up fighting other Korean armies as they also mortally damaged.</BO2>

<CO>In contemporary society, Teenagers are getting throw out their patriotism. On a survey, Only a third teenager said that they would go to the battle for their country when a war broken out; a half of teenager said they would run away when a war occurred. I convince that Go Gyung Myung's statue will make unpatriotic teenagers feel something to their country.</CO>

column1: 494&Your school has received a gift of money. What do you think is the best way for our school to spend this money? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>Today, most schools are given a gift of money from various people who are willing to donate money to improve educational environment. To satisfy their purpose, the schools should spend money in useful way for both the schools and students. <TS>However, the most important thing to consider is the benefits of the students because of the fundamental fact that the school is all about students.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, you should consider about lowering the fees on behalf of the students.</MI1> <SI1>If the school lowers the fees, the students don't have to worry about money. Without any burdens of earning money, the students freely concentrated on their study. <EX>For example, my school raises the fees every year and most of my friends can't meet the fees on their budget. We are students. We are not a money-making machines.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, They should focus on students' convenience with their donated money.</MI2> <SI2>Most Korean colleges don't have the Air-conditional, heating system in class. That makes it hard for the students to absorb in study. The needs for good environment is significant thing. That is the most basic wants of the students. Besides, they deserve it.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if somebody donates money to your school, the first thing comes your mind should be "the students". To realize the school which are highly dedicated to their own students, you should emphasize on the needs of the students; lowering the fees and their convenience. If you use the money in this way, the students can enjoy the academic life with full of happiness. Eventually, this students will lead the society.</CO>
column23: "You" and "they" pronoun confusion. Who are you talking about and who are you talking to?

column1:
495&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Classmates are more influential than parents on a child's success in school.
Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN> It is often said that friends are more important than both of parents on being successful in school because they are able to understand better each other. <TS>However, I firmly support the idea that parents have a more significant influence on their child for two reasons : they can help their child overcome problems and perform better in school.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1> </TR>To begin with</TR>, parents enable their child to solve problem more wisely.</M1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that having lived a long time, they have already experienced many things in life, such as rebellion, having to fit in, and getting good grades in school. Thus, they have bigger views on these matters and are able to provide a more satisfactory and objective solution. <EX>For example, when I was in fifth grade, I had a huge misunderstanding that led to a fight with my best friend.</EX> Then, my friends were telling me not to speak to him until he apologized to me first. However, my mother suggested that I mend things up by taking the initiative to apologize first. <TR>Finally</TR>, it turned out that it was a misunderstanding on my part and had I not spoken to him first, we would never have cleared the issue which could have cost our friendship.</SI> This implies that parents' previous experience can be helpful for dealing with problems that are likely to occur in school.</BO1>

<BO2> <MI2><TR>In addition></TR>, by encouraging their child, parents can wield their influence on them and make them be successful in school.</MI2> <SI2>Not to mention that this encouragement has more impact on them, being told by their parents, not classmates. This is due to the fact that words of encouragements coming from parents can serve as key motivators for children to perform better and improve themselves. With such motivations, they will put in more efforts, feel more responsible for their work, and concentrate better on their tasks. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2007, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in achievements. Students in group A were praised every day for the progress they made by their parents and those in group B were scold for even little mistakes at home. The researchers showed that the former group of students spent more hours studying by 25 percent and performed higher than the latter group of students. Those in group A increased their academic performance by themselves on account of parents' encouragement. This result implies that encouragement from parents let children perform better and succeed in school.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

 <CO>In brief, it tends to look like peers can crucially affect the children's performance in school. However, everything considered, I firmly believe that parents' role is the most influential component in whether or not the children is successful in school, parents helping them solve conflicts and improve academic performance in school.</CO>
column23: Thoughtful essay, with good organization. Few grammar issues

column1: 496&It is better to live in one city or town than to move from one place to another.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether living in one city is better than moving from one place to another. Some people might believe that moving from one place to another is better as they have opportunity to make new friends and culture. <TS>My view, however, is that it is better to live in one city.</TS> This is largely because living in one town gives you a sense of stability. Moreover, people living in one place can get closely with other people living in a town.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> living in one place provides people with achieving stabilized life.</MI1> <SI1>Moving from one city to another causes people to change their life pattern. <TR>And therefore,</TR> they cannot get balanced plan. As a result, they lead to absence of stability. Suppose you are living in one city. Presumably, you would know where gym, store and other facilities are. <TR>Additionally,</TR> you have balanced scheduled time. <TR>Accordingly,</TR> you do not have to think what work I have to and where the building is. All things you do are unchangeable.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> people have a sense of friendship. When people get in touch with other people frequently, they can improve their friendship for a short period of time.</MI2> <SI2>Also, because knowing one another, they can share times to play jogging, shopping, and other activities. <EX>According to a study conducted by a group of researchers at Harvard University, when a person keep in touch with other people, which depends on their physical distance. <TR>In addition,</TR> the study shows that more than two-thirds of surveyed respondents felt a stage of friendship on how often they met each other.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To summarize,</TR> it is better to live in one city than to move from one place to another. Of course, moving from one place to another enables people to get diverse experiences, but living in one country far outweigh moving from place to place on the grounds that you can improve balanced life. Also, it is probable that people living longer in one city have more friends and a sense of friendship</CO>
column23: A very coherent essay with few grammar issues. Organization and essay flow is good, however, should be more descriptive with examples.

column1: 497&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Different people have different opinion about the statement that Television has distracted communication among friends or family. <TS>In my opinion, Television is the major obstacle to build proper relationship between people because it reduces total conversation time and hampers making peer-opinions.</TS></IN>

 <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR>because of television, there are so little time to have talk each other among friends or family .</MI1> <SI1>In modern society, formal families usually spend their leisure time for watching television. <TR>As a result,</TR> time for meeting friends or family has been continuously decreased. <EX>For example, one of my cousin really likes Japanese animation. She have used most of her time to watch animation movie through cable channel in her room. <TR>As a result,</TR> She dosen't tell any words with friends and there are little conversation between her and her family even they live together. This case definitely shows the time-consuming impact of television.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2>One top of that, programs which are displayed on television deter making sense of unity in community.</MI2> <SI2>Adults usually watch soap opera which sometimes contain erotic, brutal scenes or news program. On the other hand, youth are willing to watch their own cultural movie that their parents hard to understand. In this sense, television programs establish walls between generations. <EX>According to one of the famous research institution in Korea, 63% of components of normal families reported that they have suffered from understanding other generation group in the family. <TR>In other words,</TR> youth are not want to know their parent's life because they think older people are tedious and boring. <TR>Meanwhile,</TR> parents responsed that youth culture is too funky and progressive to understand. And they reported that these thoughts are formed by television image.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

 <CO><TR>Overall,<TR> television consumes the time for talks and build obstacles between generation group. In these reasons, I strongly agree with the statement that Television wipe out communication among family or friends.</CO>
column23: Overall coherent essay but some grammar mistakes make argument less effective. Good use of personal and non-personal examples.

column1: 498&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is debatable whether people should attend college or university. Some attend college for some advantages such as a rather deep academic opportunity or future career opportunities, while others don’t go to college because they think they still can obtain jobs without attending it. <TS>In my opinion, it is highly recommended to attend college because you can learn further, prepare better for your job, and help expand your social relationship.</TS></IN>

            <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> when you go to college, you can get an education different from high school, and it is rather complicated, professional, and fun.</MI1> <SI1>Learning further flourishes your knowledge and makes you professional towards certain subjects you select, which is obviously a great opportunity of experience when you attend college. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when my cousin was confused whether he should go to college or not, he had a desire to learn more about engineering, which required a huge amount of technical knowledge. Attending college contributed to him to be a lot smarter in the field of engineering.</EX></SI1></BO1>

            <BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all,</TR> attending college gives you an opportunity to search and prepare better for your future job.</MI2> <SI2>While you are studying in college, you can actually discover what subject you really wanted to study and endeavor towards it. Based on this, you can search what jobs you can obtain in your field of study, and finally approach on your ideal career based on professional knowledge you have learned throughout your college year. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> if one wants to be a doctor, disregarding college might be critical due to the fact that medical education of becoming a doctor is basically provided in colleges and graduate schools.</EX></SI2></BO2>

            <TR>Third of all,</TR> you can get acquainted with people who attend the same college with you. It might be a professor, peers who are in the same class with you, or a person who might be your husband or wife. <EX>When I observe my mom, she still keeps contact with her college friends. She says, “All people meet their forever friends in college. <TR>Also,</TR> people have to go to college because you get accepted in a wide range of society.”</EX> When you graduate college, people who attended the same college might be in the same company you are trying to get in, introducing other co-workers in the group, thus a more amicable relationship along other co-workers are possible.

         <CO>College is a place of opportunity, where you can learn more, search for jobs that are suitable for you, and act as a base of social relationship even after you get released to the society. Because of those advantages that will benefit you, attending college is necessary for one’s successful life.</CO>
column23: Overall organized, however, grammar mistakes make the essay less coherent. Should use more concrete examples to deliver point more effectively.

column1: 499&teachers should give students homework ever day
column3:
<IN>some peope think that teachers should give homework to students every day. Homework given by each teacher of different subjects is sure to accumulate. That means students have many homeworks. <TS>But in my opinion, teachers should give adequate quantity of homeworks to their students.</TS> This is because too much homework make students' bag so heavy that it can affect their physical health and hinder them from concentrating one field of study.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>At first,</TR> many homeworks given every day, as you know , backpacks will give pretty much pressure on the back of students, changing the location of bones of back  and prventing thm from growing height.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> according to the physicians, Too much pressure on the human's back could change the position of bones on back and suppress their growing hormones. It means children with heavy loads can't grow to the average height of human.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> this kind of homework leads children not to concentrate on one field of subject specifically.</MI2> <SI2>As children should finish their various and many homeworks on a day, they can't get any chance to concentrate on one field of study. It means,although the range of their knowledge is wide , their knowledge is just like wide river with shallow depth. people who have shallow knowledge can't solve problems whch requires efficient information on one field. Deep and pratical information can't be acquired by infrequent studying on one field. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I got two competent friends. One is multilingual and the other is bilingual. One day I got question of a certain english sentence. The sentence was as pretty complicated as english teachers in korea can't explain it . Both men can read and speack english. When I asked that question to my multilingual friend, he couldn't explain and translate it precisely. <TR>But,</TR> unlike him , my bilingual friend translated it in to korean and explain it with elusive description.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR> studens shouldn't receive homeworks everyday. They can not only prevent their potential physical illnesses but have chances to concentrate on one field and get high-quality information through less homework. In this regard, I highly object to teachers giving homeworks everyday.</CO>
column23: Grammar mistakes make the essay very incoherent. Try to use better examples to make your argument

column1: 500&At universities and colleges, sports and social activities are just as classes and libraries and should receive equal financial support.
column3:
<IN>There are many universities which support to libraries and classes in Korea. Many students want to do social activities with co-worker and professor. There are no opportunity to do active plan, because many colleges or universities do not support equal financial problem. <TS>I agree about the topic. I have some reasons to support this topic sentences: develop their list of score, important to get a job, and healthy problem.</TS></IN>
 
                  <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> universities should develop their list among various universities.</MI1> <SI1>It is competitive situation, in addition it is serious problem in Korea. So, many students can not get any opportunity. I think in order to improve their list score, it does not to give financial aid for classes and libraries, but to give some aid for activity. activities are important to interact other people.</SI1></BO1>
 
                <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> it will be important to get a job or work in companies.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Of course,</TR> studying is important to live our lives, but we need to meet various people and to do experience at universities.<EX><TR>For example</TR> for me, when I was in high school. I always study in libraries and classes, I do not have time to play with my friend and no place to sport center. I regret that time to only study, and I do not understand why the school did not make any place for student.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
                  <BO3><MI3><TR>Last but not least,</TR> the universities should think about student's healthy problem.</MI3> <SI3>We need to more exercise for our body. Unless we do exercise, we will be got a illness. They should not press as studying. I think that universities give financial support just classes and libraries, it means you need to study more and more in classes. We will be tired as some as possible. it is not efficient way to study for student.</SI3></BO3>
 
　
                <CO><TR>In sum of these,</TR> I agree with this statement. I also want to do activities with other people by sharing ideas and cheating. If we have some activities in school, we would reduce our stress from studying.</CO>
column23: Grammar is very problematic. Argument is not clear. Use more concrete examples too support main idea.

column1: 501&Being different from others is helpful for achieving success.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether being different from others is helpful for achieving success. Some people might believe that there is other ways to lead to success.<TS> My view, however, is that being different from other people is beneficial to make a lot of money.</TS> This is largely because unique characteristic enables people to achieve success. Moreover, today job market requires people to have different advantages.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people’s special personality can encourage to being very successful.</MI1> <SI1>Difference gives you the ability to efficiently access a method with regard to some problems. And therefore, people overcome the difficult situation with ease and for a short period of time. Also, they are able to present solution. <TR>As a result,</TR> those who have a special personality think faster than those who have not. <EX>According to the study conducted by a group of researchers at Harvard University, surveyed respondents are successful and privileged people who are in the field of their interest. A study shows that more than two-thirds of surveyed respondents are good at a sense of creative ability.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> these days job market make you have to get being different.</MI2> <SI2>Today society is more and more competitive. In this situation, each personal manager only hires people with a diverse experience and technique. <TR>Consequently,</TR> people who have different characters and backgrounds can be hired a good company. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my brother and my sister applied to same company. My brother prefers to travel all over the world, whereas my sister dislikes walking around a lot and making new friends. <TR>As a result,</TR> company’s manager chosen my brother as a member of company. <TR>Also,</TR> my brother thinks that I had opportunity to pick up the member because of my diverse career.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To summarize,</TR> being different from others have a positive effect on your success in the future. <TR>Of course,</TR> other things, such as good impression and nice working capacity, can be lead to a person’s success, but I think that individual’s uniqueness is the most use of quality on people’s success. <TR>Additionally,</TR> there is society where job markets in the diverse field require people to have being different.</CO>
column23: An overal coherent essay with some grammar mistakes. Good use of examples but grammer needs to be fixed.

column1: 502&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? University athletic departments should reveive the same amount of funding as university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples toe support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is thought-provoking to concern whether university athletic departments to receive the same amount of funding as universiy libraries or not. Some might consider university athletic departmentns obsolete, in fact it is really efficient for students. <TS><TR>Therefore,</TR> same amount of funding should be received.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>As I said,</TR> It is undeniable that excercise helps one to strengthen health.</MI1> <SI1>Especially for unversity students who study overnight, regular work-out is crucial. Therefore, University should upgrade the athletic departments so that students can be fascinated. To do this, university has to put more fund to it. Then, It is obvious that budget should be distributed equally.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2>The another reason is that if the budget leans too much forward on libraries, athletic students would say it is unfair.</MI2> <SI2>As a university students, they will surely prefer better apparatus and stuffs used for fitness. <TR>However,</TR> if they get little money, their equipments would look poor. This can constrict athletic students. All university students have right to pursue the equality, and thus money should be balanced.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO>For these reasons, I agree with the topic.</CO>
column23: Grammar mistakes make the essay very unclear. There are no use of examples and conclusion is too short.

column1:
503&Some people live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a bit city. Which Place world you prefer to live in?
Use Specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people prefer to live in a small town, because of beautiful landscape of nature and clear air, while, others prefer to live in a big city. This is because it has many advantages for them. In my opinion, I disagree with the
idea. <TS>I advocate that living in a big city has many benefits for me because it gives me numerous opportunities that I can enjoy for my life.</TS> There are a lot of reasons why I prefer to live in a big city and I will explain them below.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> A Big city provides various chances to me.</MI1> <SI1>Such as getting more education and going through diversity experience. A big city has many universities of high quality and professors who received higher education. The universities give me a valuable and meaningful education and then It is good for me to focus on research. In addition, living in a big city helps people to acquire variety of experiences. Big city has many facilities such as movie theater, historical, art museum and opera house. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I went to New York City,
I went to natural history museum and I watched fantastic musical. Also I visited Lincoln center and I listened perfect harmony of orchestra there. At the same time, I learned a lot of history and music. And then I spent more exciting leisure time.</EX> It was nice for my live. If you living a big city, You can make your life preciously and you can enjoy Interesting all facilities of big city</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> A big city offers a wide of range public transportation.</MI2> <SI2>Public transport is so comfortable to our busy daily life. Usually Most people commute to school or company by train, bus every day. Public transportation can shorten commuting time a lot. A big city has huge public transportation more than a small town. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I studied for seven months in small town of newzealand before three years. When I studied there I did not have a car. I have a difficult time for going to school. <TR>But</TR> I moved to Auckland that most big city of newzealand. <TR>Afterward,</TR> I was commute to school so easy everyday. Because, The buses came my home frequently at intervals of 15minutes. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I was more convenient to commute to school. Public transportation was important to my daily life. It provides comfortable way for go to school, shopping mall and anywhere.</EX> In these circumstance, If you living in a big city, You can make your life more quickly and convenience. <TR>And then,</TR> You can shorten your valuable time than living a small town.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I support the idea that living in a big city is better than living in a small city. Living in a big city offers numerous opportunities and enjoy interesting culture to our life. <TR>Moreover</TR> Living in a big city gives us convenience public transportation to our daily life. It can make life more easily and fascinating. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I strongly agree with the idea that living in a big city provides many advantages than living in a small town.</CO>
column23: Good essay and good use of personal examples. Try to fix grammar mistakes so that the argument is clearer.

column1: 504&The ability to cooperate with others is more important today than in the past.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that it is not necessesary to have the ability to cooperate with others. <TS><TR>However</TR> in my opinion, it is becoming more and more important to have such ability to live better for several reasons : people tend to be more open-minded than before and the world is becoming globalized.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people are now being open-minded more than in the past, expressing one's thoughts directly.</MI1> <SI1>People in the past did not like to or refused to express one's thoughts or feelings in front of others, thought that it was either rude or shame. Compared to the people in the past, people now do not feel any difficulty to express one's thought as the society changed. People these days think that all differences between people have to be appreciated and respected. As people nowadays give lots of different ideas, the need of the ability to cooperate with others is increasing. Harmonize and unite all the possibilities into one, also satisfying all people at the same time. <EX>A survey was done by Ministry of Education in Korea to two groups. Group A with age twenties, group B with age over sixty who have lived longer than people in Group A do. The survey was about to rate the importance of some abilities needed in daily life including the ability to cooperate with others. The result was that group A responded to the cooperation question more, saying that it is necessary to have that ability because of the diversity in society.</EX> This clearly shows that the present requires more of the ability to cooperate with others than in the past.</SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> as the world is becoming globalized day by day, bringing all people around the world together, it is important to accept each others' differences and cultures, cooperating.</MI2> <SI2>Many people easily and often travel overseas for many reasons and they become exposed to new environment, customs and cultures. In order to get along well with others, it is important to adjust the thinkings, opinions and ideas together without conflicts. <EX><TR>To be specific,</TR> one of my friends once went abroad to study. At the place where she was staying, there were lots of other foreigners who came to study as well. Because they were all from different parts of the world they often had conflicts due to the differences in their living styles. They later become used to the environment, adjusting themselves well to be considerate, learned to cooperate with others. The friend said to me that as more and more people go abroad to study and work compared to the past, it is important to have a skill to cooperate with others.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is becoming more important to have the ability to cooperate with others, being considerate. It is because of the globalization taking place and people these days have open-minded feature.</CO>
column23: Very coherent essay with few grammar mistakes. Good use of examples.

column1: 505&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? University athletic departments should reveive the same amount of funding as university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples toe support your answer.
column3:
<IN>An intruging topic of discussion at hand is whether sports is important as academy is. The answer to the question can be vary greatly depending on the opinion individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus,</TR> the jury may still be out, I agree with the statement that sports activites receive the same amount of money as University libraries do.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with,</TR> sports can help students to study more effectively.</MI1> <SI1><EX>It can be evidenced by a recent report by the National Research Center of korea. According to the report, a students who enjoy sports got good grades than a students dosen’t enjoy it. Let me take my friend’s case as illustration. In my school days, my friend doesn’t study so hard, but she always got good grades. I think the reason she was able to get good grades is she enthusiastically took part in sports activities.</EX> This is attributed to the reason that human’s body all work together. Brain can be influenced by actions of legs and hands.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> sports activites foster students’ social skills.</MI2> <SI2>This is because sports include a wide variety of group activities such as soccer, football, and basketball that require collective effort and coopertation.<EX> For example, I could make friends playing baseball in my high school. students is able to make their friends easily playing sports games.</EX> <TR>Likewise,</TR> students can reap numerous benefits from participating in sports activities.</SI2></BO2>
 
<TR>In conclusion,</TR> I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of the two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again,</TR> although the verdict may still be out, I personally believe that two of my rationales above are sufficiently convincing enough to represent the viewpoints of people who are in favor of my claim. University departments should invest to sports activities as they do to university libraries.
column23: Grammar mistakes make the thesis statement unlear. Generally organized structure but should use better examples to deliver argument.

column1: 506&people learn more by watching television than reading by books.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that these days, TV is more intellectually beneficial. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I believe that people can glean more information by reading books than watching TV.</TS> This is because TV's ways to convey knowledge is limited, and books are likened to be food of human soul.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start,</TR> I believe that formats of the content that are broadcasted on TV is limited, thus the means to convey information is also limited.</MI1> <SI1>Only a documentary form of information gives us valuable knowledges.    
<EX><TR>For instance,</TR> although a famous TV talk show, The David Letterman Show is very interesting, but can hardly convey us valuable informations.</EX> If it gives us nothing but trivial informations, which is not very relevent to our lives, who can say it is more effective way to glean knowledge?</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Next,</TR> I think Books are food to people's soul.</MI2> <SI2>It's the books that enriches and strengthens our soul, not some TV shows. The reason why I think books are soul's food is that books contain more specific informations compared to visionary informations. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> The movie 'Extremely loud & Incredibly Close', which is cinematized version of a famous novel, Extremely Loud & Incredibly close, written by jewish writher Jonathan Safran fore, contains less information than novel version. This is because, in movies, running time is limited, which is a drawback compared to novels.</EX> <TR>And plus,</TR> books are more suited form of describing one's feelings or situations. And I think specific illustration in novels is the thing that enriches our soul, because it deepens readers mind.</SI2></BO2>
<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> I think that books are more suitable for conveying informations to readers. Because TV's ways to convey information is very limited thus leading people hard to glean valuable knowledge, and because books are more capable of giving valuable ideas that deepens our intellectual abilities by illustrating specific informations. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I disagree with the statement that people learn more by watching television than by reading books.<CO>
column23: Good essay but need to perfect grammar. Good argument and good good use of examples.

column1:
507&Choose one of the following activities and explain why you think the activity is the best way for students to make new friends.
-Joining a sport team
-Participating in community activities
-Traveling
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might argue that traveling and joining a sports team are the best way for students to make new friends. <TS>Contrary to popular belief, I believe that the best method is to participating in community activities for two reasons: broadening one's perspective and relieving stress.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> joining in a community activities allows students to broaden one's horizon and to learn to socialize with others.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that the activity exposes them to different world of lifestyles, basic customs, and cultures. Through this experience, they can learn to embrace diversity. This is especially true given the fact that modern society is becoming increasingly globalized. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> when I was in eleventh grade, there was a Malaysian girl who brought home-cooked meals, such as 'Nasillamak', which is a Malaysian traditional food, for lunch. It smelled funny and she ate with her hands without using utensils, and other students kept their distances from her who had never seen such a thing before. <TR>Nevertheless,</TR> I felt comfortable with it because when I went to Malaysia for community activities, I could experience the country's custom.</EX> This indicates that participating in community activities allow students to have a foreign friend.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> the performances that require students to help others via involving in community activities enable students to lower their stress level, and thus having more friends.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that such activities can distract people from worries and stress. It is obvious that the activity can distract them from personal worries and concern since they have to care the people in desperate needs. <TR>Therefore,</TR> this kind work may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. <EX>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in managing their academic pressure. Students in Group A who frequently engaged in community service activity have much less stress level than those in Group B who rarely engaged in the activity. The reaserchers also found out that those in Group A had more friends than those in Group B. The reason is that the people who were helped by the students wished to become a friend of the students. Even after the end of the community service, they wrote mails to each other for a long period of time. This implies that the activity serve as a safe and effective way to make friend as well as to let out stress.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> although traveling and joining a sports team could be a good way to socialize and to make friends, the effectiveness of making friends by involving in community activities far-outweigh the effectiveness of making friends through prior two methods. <TR>All in all,</TR> the importance of community service activities cannot be underestimated for the sake of creating healthy relationship.</CO>
column23: Very good essay but still needs to perfect grammar. Very good use of examples to deliver argument effectively.

column1: 508&What is the most important characteristic (for example, honesty, intelligence, a sense of humor) that a person can have to be successful in life?
column3:
<IN>What would be the most essential key to getting a good job and making a lot of money? <TS>Although there
will be various opinions depending on who you are, I believe that knowlege and skills are the important
requirements for success.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1>Above all things, knowledge is a necessary factor to success.</MI1>
<SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> successful individuals, such as prominent  doctors, lawyers, entrepreneurs,etc, are all the people who have their specialized knowledges. In my case, I desperately wanted to get a job in the field of foreign business administration and tried applying for several companies; <TR>however,</TR> I failed to be employed. The most paramount reason for my failure was that I did not have enough background of knowledge about business and finance,
which most companies wanted their potential applicants to have.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addtition,</TR> professional skills are important to be successful in life. The demand of skilled workers, such as  engineers, technitians, computer programmar, is gradually increasing; <TR>moreover,</TR> this trend will
continue to grow in the future.</MI2> <SI2>If you have a special skill no matter what  it is, you will be a person who
is highly demanded from any workplace; in return, you will earn a higher salary than any unskilled peple. <TR>Ultimately,</TR> you will be able to find yourself successful in life.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> specified knowledge and professional skills are the most important keys to success.
By be prepared for the knowledge and skills, it is easy to get a job and accumulate money enough to
enjoy a successful life.</CO>
column23: Essay is good but quite short. Should elaborate on main idea and provide more concrete examples.

column1: 509&Games can teach us valuable lessons about life
column3:
<IN>Games. They are developed in rapid speed since the invention of computer, and nowadays it became a part of culture. Many people in advanced country, even in the developing coutries play games. <TS>In korea, where I live, people usually play a computer games, and I don't think it is affecting people in positive way.</TS> <TR>Thus,</TR> I disagree with the topic.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> I think chatting in the game is especially negative for people playing a game.</MI1> <SI1>Sensational and violent words can directly transferred to other. Those negative words can make others feel bad or even shocked. Not only that but also children can learn to swear from it. <EX>I actually saw kids swearing to each other, and asked them where they learned those words. All answers were virtually all the same. They are said that they saw those words from 'online game' </EX>This contradicts the topic saying people can learn valuable lessons about life.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2>On the top, even before learning valuable lessons from the game, one's health can seriously harmed.</MI2> <SI2>Watching monitors for over the hours can obviously decrease one's eye sight. Moreover, It can also kill brain cells. <EX>These effects, comes from my own experience. I was once addicted to the online game called 'League of legend'. It was brilliant game, and thus I coudn't stop playing it. It ultimately made me to wear glasses, and fail exams that were important to my life. It also deteriorated my ability to memorize. Then I determined to quit the game, and I could re-start my life again.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO>These reasons prove why I disagree with the topic. Although it feels awesome while playing games, while after, it feels not so great. People may learn valuable lessons while playing a game, bad points overpower the good points.</CO>
column23: Overall good essay with few grammar mistakes. Good use of personal experience as examples.

column1: 510&The best way to learn is through listening to others or reading books.
column3:
<IN>In terms of the given statement that listening or reading is the best way to study, I would like to associate it with studying English. In Korea, there are many students who study TOEIC or TOEFL, and they concentrate especially on listening and reading, thinking that these are the best way to learn English. <TS><TR>However</TR> in my opinion, I do not agree with their idea and the given statement. Rather, I think speaking and writing is better way to study English.</TS></IN>
 
     <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> speaking and writing are more efficient to study English.</MI1> <SI1>Listening and reading affect only a sense of seeing and hearing. On the other hand, Speaking and writing not only stimuli seeing and hearing, but also make people think creatively. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it encourages a wide variety of senses, and this can lead better ability to remember. As a result, speaking and writing are more effective. <EX>One study from the Seoul Institution has shown that subjects who concentrate more on speaking and writing show more performance in English than people who focus more on listening and reading. This shows how more effective speaking and writing are.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
     <BO2><MI2>Through speaking and writing, it can provoke people's interest in learning English.</MI2> <SI2>Listening and reading are relatively static and inactive.
