People only sit and study in a sedentary manner. <TR>Whereas,</TR> speaking and writing are active and brisk. <TR>To be specific,</TR> people can communicate with others in the manner of speaking or writing, and this brings more interest from people. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> many friends of mine study English, and they only listen to a conversation or read a book. I saw most of them having hard time studying because their studying style is boring. <TR>However,</TR> in case of other friends who focus more on speaking and writing feel more interest in English. They even made many foreign friends by having conversation and chatting on the online. And it is them who show better academic performances in English.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
     <CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> listening or reading is a good way to study English. <TR>However,</TR> there are more efficient way to study, and those are speaking and writing. Through speaking and writing, they will find these more efficient and they can have more interest in studying english. In this reagard, I oppose the idea that listening or reading is the best way to study.</CO>
column23: Thesis statement is clear, however, grammar mistakes make the essay less coherent. Good use of examples but try to elaborate upon it more to make the argument clearer.

column1: 511&The ability to cooperate with others is more important today than in the past
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might argue that the ability to cooperate with others is more important today than in the past. <TS>Contrary to popular belief, I believe that cooperative skill is more crucial in today's society for the following reasons: because it assures success in modern society and helps building a close relationship.</TS></IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> unlike the past, cooperation skill guarantees success in career.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that as modern society is becoming increasingly specialized and cooperative, today's job markets require job candidates with such qualities. <EX>According to the Ministry of Labor of Korea in 2009, the employment interview was the most important component in hiring practice, taking up more than 70 percent of the final call. The interviewers looked at the applicant's ability to work with others, mostly related to cooperation. This implies that cooperation skill is a secure way for people to prepare for the future.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> nowadays, working with others can contribute to building a stronger relationship.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that issues derived from advancements of technology lead people to work together and solve the problems. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> Pittsburgh, a city in the United States, made public transportation free in order to promote clean air in downtown area in the late 20th century. Governments and individuals happily participated and cooperated to reduce air pollution. While using public transportation Instead of driving their own cars, they not only reduced pollution problems but also built a close relationship.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>All in all,</TR> because of the reasons I have mentioned above, I firmly believe that ability to work together is more crucial today than in the former time.</CO>
column23: Very good essay. Thesis statement and main ideas are very clear but should elaborate more in the conclusion section.

column1:
512&Some people live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a bit city. Which Place world you prefer to live in?
Use Specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people believe that prefer to live in a small town, because of beautiful landscape of
nature and clear air. <TR>While,</TR> Others prefer live in a big city. This is because it has many
advantageous for them. <TS>In my opinion, I disagree with the idea. I advocate that live in a big city have many benefits for me. Because it gives me numerous opportunities for my life.</TS> There are a lot of reason and I will explain below</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> It provide various chances to me.</MI1> <SI1>Such as learn more education, go through diversity experience. A big city has many university of high quality and professor who receive higher education. It give me a valuable and meaningful education and then It is good for me focus on research about my subject. In addition, living in a big city is that acquire variety experience. big city has many facilties near by. Such as movie theater, historical, art museum, opera house. <EX>For example, I was going to Newyork city. I’ve been natural history museum and I watched fantasic musical. <TR>Also</TR> I visited Lincoln center and I listened perfect harmony of orchestra in there. At the same time, I learned a lot of history and musical music.
And then I spend more exciting leisure time. It is nice for my live.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> A big city offers a wide of range public transportation.</MI2> <SI2>It is pretty comfortable
for our daily life. Most people commute to school or company every day. Public transportation will shorten commuting time a lot. A big city has huge public transportation than a small town. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I studied in newzealand of small town for seven months before three years. When I studied in there I haven’t a car. I have a difficult time going to school. <TR>But</TR> I moved in Auckland that most of big city in newzealand and so easy to commute school everyday.
Since, The bus that going to my shool coming frequently at intervals of 15minutes in my home
town.</X> So, It is important to my daily life and comfortable to going to school, shopping and anywhere.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO>With the statement above, <TR>In conclusion,<TR> I support the idea that live in a big city is better than live in a small city. It offers numerous opportunities and enjoy interesting culture for me. <TR>Moreover</TR> It give us convenient public transportation for our daily life. It will be live our life more easily and fascinating life for me. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I strongly agree with the idea that living in a big city is that provide many advantage than small town.</CO>
column23: A generally organized essay but grammar mistakes make it incoherent. Good use of personal examples.

column1: 513&The ability to coorperate with others is more important today than in the past.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over the subject that has it become more important to be connected with other people than in the past. <TS>I think the ability to cooperate with others is more important than today than in the past because the world's population is getting higher and higher and the digital divices are enabling us to feel 'not connected' with other people.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> I think it is getting easier to have an argument or a fight with other people over small and trivial things such as noise problem, or a simple mistake.</MI1> <SI1>It's because cities are getting more crowded due to the increasing world's population and the peoples movement into cities. So naturally the density of population is getting worse and worse. Especially era such as this, I think that people need to sit back and relax, have time to talk or be more cooperative to the common issues. So this is the first reason why I think it is important to be cooperative with other people.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> due to an advancement of technology, people feel that they are imotionally separated.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example,</TR> one reaserch indicates that Social Network Services and the Internet are the main reason why people are getting indifferent. You might think advancing technologies help people but actually, there is famous proverb that can be used moment like this. 'Lonly Crowd'. It's from famous sociologist David Riesman. People who is behind the mask of anonymity in internet becomes more aggressive.</EX> So this is the second reason why I think it's important to keep imotionally close with someone else.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summerize,</TR> I think that the importance of being cooperative with someone has increased because of the world's growing population is leading people to be more competitive and varying advanced technologies are enabling people to be more dettached imotionally.</CO>
column23: Overall good essay. Grammar mistakes should be fixed to make essay more coherent

column1: 514&Games can teach us valuable lessons about life
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether games can teach us precious lessons about life. Some people believe that games enable people to give lessons as they think about cyberspace as their alternative reality. <TS><TR>My view, however,</TR> is that games are detrimental to people. This is largely because games cause people to act aggressively. Furthermore, games can leads to people’s addictives.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> games make people do aggressively.</MI1> <SI1>On the cyberspace, People are replaced to characters. <TR>In this sense,</TR> people act like violently and do not responsible for their behavior. <TR>Also,</TR> they can learn about a sense of cruelty. <TR>And therefore,</TR> people’s behavior gradually changes aggressive, which transport the reality. <EX>According to the experiment conducted by a group of researcher at Harvard University, those who have more time to do games reveal that they are likely to play a higher aggressive behavior than those who have not. As the study provides, it is a well known fact that games are prone to cause people’s barbarism.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><SI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> the one of the best property of games is severe addictives.</MI2> When people play games, they chat with their friends or some people and play together. Because of this characteristic, people waste a great deal of time monitoring their games. <EX>Regarding to the paper reported by a Chinese paper “dung-zao New” , A man continuously played games for 45 times. <TR>Eventually,</TR> he died due to malnutrition and shortage of water. As the report shows, addictive of game is so powerful that people are distracted from the reality.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In summarize,</TR> games cannot teach us valuable lessons about life. <TR>Of course,</TR> we learn about a sense of teamwork, but games caused people unnecessary conflicts. In this respect, adverse effects of games far outweigh positive effects of those. Considering a resource of aggression and addictive, people should stop playing games.</CO>
column23: Generally organized structure and good use of examples. However, grammar mistakes make the main ideas of the essay very unclear.

column1: 515&Higher education should be available only to good students. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Many people, these days, think that every student should have an equal opportunity to have higher education. <TS><TR>In contrast to this idea,</TR> I strongly believe that only good students should be available higher education.</TS> This is because smart students help each other to study more efficiently and academically poor students easily fail to keep up with the curriculum.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> smart students support each other while studying together which can improve their academic performance.</MI1> <SI1>It is because they actually spend much time questioning each other and discussing the material that they have learned at school. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> academically poor students often get easily distracted, and do not care about what they are learning during classes. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> researchers have recently found out that students who have better grade at school actually spent much time studying than those who get lower grade.</EX> <EX><TR>Plus,</TR> according one study from Korea Herald, academically poor students often interrupt the class environment by distracting other students who are trying to focus during classes.</EX> In this way, every student should not have a chance to higher education, but only those who have good grades.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> it is hard for academically poor students to keep up with the higher education curriculum.</MI2> <SI2>To have higher education is students have to be prepared and should already have some basic knowledge to learn something advanced. It, <TR>however,</TR> would be hard to understand and follow the classes for those students who are doing poorly at school. In this way, they might earn nothing, but fail the class. <EX>My friend is the best example to illustrate this point. One of my friends, Hannah, was performing bad academically in high school, but decided to go to college to have higher education. While she was at school, she could not handle all the essays, lab reports, and many reading assignment that she had to do for her classes. <TR>Finally,</TR> she decided not having higher education, realizing her poor ability in learning.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> I definitely think that only smart students should have higher education. It is largely because smart student can improve their academic performance, not being distracted by others. <TR>Plus,</TR> only smart students can keep up with the curriculum in higher education.</CO>
column23: An overall organized essay but supporting information lacks coherent grammar. Examples need to be further elaborated to make essay clearer

column1: 516&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion,
column3:
<IN>As far as I’m concerned , it would be much nicer having real experiences than reading thousands books. Some people could say, books could give knowledge much easier and faster. <TS><TR>However</TR> I strongly believe that real experience is better because, it can give lessons beyond the written letters and save time for understanding.</TS></IN> 
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all,</TR> I think that experience can give real lessons.</MI1> <SI1>It is hard to convey original ideas with written words, because when we defined something, it inclined to contained author's intention . <TR>Then,</TR> it lost their objectivity. <EX>In that point of view, how writer could can give real lessons to reader.  There is a famous poem about this in Korea. The Poem’s name is "The Flower". It says that it is no longer a flower after you call it a flower. The author wants to show the Flower but after he says flower, it is no longer a real Flower anymore, because it is not the exact Flower that he wanted to show to reader, it has changed. <TR>Thus,</TR> real experience can give real lessons better than  written words.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> people can understand much faster when they have experiences.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example,</TR> if professor describes characteristics of historical architectures, it would be much faster for my understanding if I learn by experience building those architectures rather than studying  those architecture types in books. That is the reason, many students going to art museums and historical museums for looking at real things. Actually When I was young, my mother brought me to the science experiment-exhibitions that were helpful to understanding really faster than my normal friends. I can always get the top score in my classes.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> I insist that experience helps me understand faster and better.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO>Long story short, I suggest that it is better to choose experience, if you have two options experience something or reading books. It will provide you more real lessons not from abstract words as well as time saving.</CO>
column23: A generally organized essay with a clear thesis and main ideas. But pay close attention to grammar to make essay more coherent.

column1: 517&Schools should ask students to evaluate their teachers. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN><TS>I agree that schools should ask students to evaluate their teachers in order to provide a high quality
of education.</TS> There are several advantages to be acquired by doing so.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the evaluating system can be beneficial for students.</MI1>
<SI1>A student as a learner knows well about his or her teachers and about who is a good teacher;
moreover, the learners can perceive whether their teachers are well prepared for their classes.
<TR>Therefore,</TR> the system, which students rank a level of a teacher's educational performance, will
serve as one of the most progressive methods to be able to select out who is a good or bad educator
depending on their educating skills. This will, in return, give a great benefit to students by giving
an opportunity to be taught from a qualified teacher.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Besides the benefit for students,</TR> if schools introduce the system of allowing students to evaluate their teachers, it will be also helpful to the school in itself.</MI2>
<SI2>Schools can provide a high quality of education only if they are open to various opinions, especially
to their students who are passive receivers of education and also subjects of leading schools.
The evaluation given by students will play an important role to creating a positive school image and
educational status because there will be an increasing number of students
who hope to enter the prestigious school.</SI2></BO2>
 
<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> allowing students to evaluate their teachers is, in fact, advantageous to teachers as well.</MI3>
<SI3>Teachers can get to know more about their good or bad points; eventually, it will give a great momentum to improve their problems or develop better educating skills.</SI3></BO3>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> the evaluation about instructors given by students should be put into an action
for the sake of students as well as teachers and schools</CO>
column23: Grammar is good and essay is coherent. However, introduction is very short and there are no examples to support the main idea.

column1: 518&There is nothing that old people learn from the younger ones
column3:
<IN>It has been argued among many people whether younger people can teach older people and it is helpful. <TS>Although it is true that older people have experienced and learned a lot as they age, I believe that older people can have numerous benefits if they listen to the younger ones.</TS> In this essay, I am going to give two reasons supporting my idea.</IN>
           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> there have been a number of technological developments that older people had never met before.</MI1> <SI1>These days, the pace of science improvement is getting faster and faster, so it is very tough for older people to catch up with trends. They may have trouble getting used to how to use sophisticated electronic devices such as smart phones, smart pads and smart TV. <TR>However,</TR> younger people are likely to adapt these flows of changes and they behave like experts even if they are not. This shows that younger people now can utilize the newest instruments released recently and they never have difficulty keep up with today`s scientific breakthrough. <TR>Therefore</TR> it is the best way for older people to learn how to use and be used to technological development these days. <TR>Otherwise,</TR> they might lose valuable opportunities to see their loved ones` photo in any time and any place.</SI1></BO1>

           <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR>it is very effective for older people to cooperative and listen to younger people`s advices.</MI2> <SI2>It is natural that older people do great performances in their work because they have accumulated lots of experiences and overcome substantial obstacles. <TR>However,</TR> they are people, so they cannot work perfectly even if they have done the best since things have changed a lot comparing today to past. What they learned may be wrong these days and what they ignored may be considered very important in their filed. <TR>In this case,</TR> younger people can help the older ones do better consequences because they are educated by up-to-date knowledge. <TR>Also</TR> they are so passionate that they are likely to do anything if it is very critical and serious problems. Passion and knowledge that younger people possess can have great and positive influences on older people.</SI2></BO2>

           <CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> it is very important for older people to learn from the younger ones because they can help them make use a lot of devices made recently  the older ones have never learn how to use and work better by using their fervor and understanding. <TR>Therefore</TR> I certainly believe that older peole are required to learn from younger people.</CO>
column23: A generally organized essay with good flow and few grammar mistakes. However essay lacks concrete examples to support main argument.

column1: 519&A company is going to give some money either to support the arts or to protect the environment.
column3:
<IN>Some people argue that companies’ effort to support arts or environment is a waste of time, so it should not be allowed. <TS><TR>Personally,</TR> I do not agree with this view.</TS> There are many arguments to support my position, but the two main reasons are stated and explained in detail below.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> paying money to support arts should be permitted, especially for rich companies.</MI1> <SI1>This is because it is effective for relaxation and can boost people’s moods. Today, people have to live with too many tasks and too little time. <TR>As a result,</TR> their lives are run by deadlines. Because arts are a powerful stress-relieving tool such as visiting museum and watching musical, they can help people to escape from full-brown stress. This is why company should be advised to support arts.
<EX>My own personal experience can be used to prove this point. Every morning, I have to get through traffic-clogged roads to go to school. While I am at school, I also have to read through countless books. <TR>Therefore,</TR> as a way to lower my stress level, I am used to visiting art museum nearby my home right after I return home from school. Even if it is only for short time, my mind becomes relaxed, and I am no longer thinking about the demanding request at school. Indeed, during this brief period of relaxation, I am able to relieve tension and prepare myself to tackle the problems I will face at school the next day.</EX>
<TR>For this reason,</TR> companies should support art to relieve our stress.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> supporting the environment is also beneficial because it can help people to bond with each other.</MI2> <SI2>In order to adapt to the harshness of the modern lifestyle, people have become increasingly in different to those around them. <TR>Consequently,</TR> the traditional notion of friendship has weakened and family ties have loosened. <TR>However,</TR> people can restore the value of friendship and family life by developing the environment. This is because people can get together with their friends and family in clean and nice parks thanks to the company’s effort to support the environment.</SI2></BO2>
<EX>A recent study, which is done by Stanford Univ., found that having a good park near home provide useful opportunities for people who are struggling to connect with their families and peers.</EX><TR>Basically,</TR> parks are good places to meet people and to talk with people, so people who have nice park near home can freely express their views in parks even if the topic is arguable. <TR>Therefore</TR> it is needed that company gives as much as money to public or government to build more parks.
 
<CO><TR>Therefore,</TR> in spite of the potential disadvantages of supporting arts and the environment, this activity is not waste of money in modern society, <TR>Instead,</TR> it offers people huge advantages, which are likely to increase over time.</CO>
column23: A very coherent and well written essay. However, the thesis did not address the propmt correctly.

column1: 520&It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>The question of whether city life is better or country life is better has been the subject of many debates and conversations. Since the Industrial Revolution, more and more people to started to flock to cities for various reasons. And with it came a lot of problems as well as advantages. <TS>While some say county life serves us better,in my opinion, living in a big city still outweighs country life in many areas.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with,</TR> better education can be expected in cities due to the fact that there are more of schools competing each other to attract more students.</MI1> <SI1>More competition means that they are collectively attempt to be ahead of others in curricula,cost,quality of staff members,and even amenities,  thus ultimate beneficiary would be students. <TR>Not only that,</TR> students can enjoy more variety of subjects of their interest as well. Students might have their own field of interest; for some, language learning is considered more important , while others would be more inclined to high-tech related areas. And it is imperative for students to have appropriate providers in order to have necessary education. <TR>However,</TR> limited numbers of school available in country can prevent us from having that. <TR>Thus,</TR> students can fall into being incompetent compared to those in cities.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> city life can have benefit of more entertaining choices.</MI2> <SI2>More population in city life might stimulate entertaining-related sectors such as library,arcade,theaters,museum,and so forth. This is highly significant for one's quality of life. We live in a society with high competition and subsequent stresses, and without having proper means to control that, we might consider our lives to be miserable. 
And it can be assumed that everyone would have different definition of entertainment; some might find going to a museum very pleasing whereas others would watch a movie to get rid of stress. <TR>Therefore,</TR> restricted choices of those would leave some without any choice.</SI2></BO2> 

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> we can also build up social skill provided by being exposed to various kinds of people in cities.</MI3> 
<SI3>In cities, there are not only people residing there but also those from other towns,cities,and even countries. Even though county might have distinction in people's characteristics, they have tendency of putting value on conformity to one way of acting,dressing,speaking, and more. This compartmentized view makes it possible for one to have narrowed social skill, and it is apparent that there are myriad kinds of people in our society and it's indispensable to recognize how to deal with them.</SI3></BO3> 


<CO><TR>All in all,</TR> while country life is attractive in many ways such as environmentally friendliness and more laid-back life style, it is my opinion that those offered by city life are more important in today's life that we can't seem to disregard.</CO>
column23: Good essay with clear thesis and main ideas. But should include more concrete examples to deliver argument more effectively.

column1:
521&do you agree or disgree with the following statement?
Teachers should assign homework every day. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that through  assignments, teacher can help their students prepare for the future. <TS>However, contrary to their expectation, such assignments do not improve students academic performance.</TS> Making them stressed out too much, it is going to end up lowering their performance and health condition.</IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> getting a high degree of stress coming from immense homework forbid the students to live a stress-free life.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that having homework everyday can stress the students out by making them worry about how to finish them after class everyday. <TR>Moreover,</TR> stress is one of the main factors of disease through weakening the immune system. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2009, a test on mice showed that life span was shortened when they regularly underwent series of electric shocks. Interestingly, the researchers found a link between this and human beings who suffered from periodic stress. This implies that the high stress levels arising from assigned homework everyday can negatively affect the students' health condition by malfunctioning the immune system.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> teachers do not need to give their students assignments everyday.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that even if intermittent homework can be helpful for their grades in school, such exhausting one is only detriment to students' motivation to study hard. They focusing on completing their homework, they do not tend to consider how the homeworkd is related to the subject. <TR>Moreover,</TR> it can make students less concentrate on class. <EX>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2009, there was a huge difference between two groups of students in their concentration. and academic performance. Students in group A were allowed to finish a homework a week and those in group B were given one a day. The researchers showed that the students in group A followed instructions well, submitted their assignments on time, and concentrate better on class. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> those in group B dozed off in class and lacked a focus in class materials becaue they were tired by much too sufficient homework. This implies that imparting students everyday can be harmful to their performance and participation in school.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>In brief,</TR> teachers assigning every-day homework to students, they are likely to think they are improving their students significantly. <TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that it only lower the chance for them to focus on major subjects. <TR>Not only that,</TR> receiving an assignment every day, their health condition can be damaged as well. <TR>Consequently,</TR> less homework teachers give, the better it is for students.</CO>
column23: Excellent essay with good use of examples. Pay more attention to simple grammar mistakes.

column1: 522&Television advertising directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.
column3:
<IN><TS>I agree with the idea saying that television advertising directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed because of several reasons : children under the age of five are not able to make right decision and can harm the children's health.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> children under the age of five are not mature enough to make right decision for themselves.</MI1> <SI1>They cannot clarify what will be good for them or not. If they are told that a certain product is good, they will just accept it, thinking that they had made a wise decision. They are in learning process, therefore easily affected by things around them. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> there was an experiment conducted by Seoul National University, to check whether young children at the age of four to five can make a rational decision. There was a book in foreign language and children were told that the book contains a good quality of story therefore it is good. Although the explanation about the book was not enough, no one asked futher questions about it. After the lecturer got out of the room, leaving the book and children alone, the researchers found out that all children wanted the book for themselves although they do not exactly know what that was. This shows that if the television advertising directs toward children, telling that the product is good, children will just want to have those products without any reasons.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> television advertising can harm the children's health.</MI2> <SI2>If the children cannot get things that they want, they will be stressed. This can harm children's mental health. Children are still young to control their emotions rationally. <TR>Therefore</TR> it would be difficult for them to manage the stress got by their dissatisfaction that they could not get all things they want. Many parents want their children to have things that they want, but it is hard for the parents to get all things because of their finance and for their  own children as they can be rude if they get all things that they want at once, not able to appreciate it. <EX>A survey was done by Ministry of Education in Korea. The survey was about how often parents accept their children's request for buying something. More than half of them answered that they do not usually accept all requests. Then with those children who their parents answered that they do not accept all requests, further experiment was done. To check if the children's stress level increases when they are declined about their requests. The result was that children showed high increase in stress level when they are refused by their parents not buying things for them.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> elevision advertising directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed as children are not mature enough to make their own decision and can harm their health.</CO>
column23: Good essay with few grammar mistakes. Elaborate more in the introduction and conclusion section.

column1: 523&About environmental issues, individual people can do nothing about it because it is too complicated
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether individual people can do nothing about it because of environmental problems’ complexity. Some people believe that people can do nothing as it is so broad that they do not know what to do. <TS>My view, however, is that citizens should do something ordinary step by step.</TS> This is largely because a trivial method gives the chance to improve the earth’s environment. <TR>Moreover,</TR> in order to make the problem simple, people can get the rule on their own plan.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people are able to trivial things in order to improve their environment, namely, recycling the garbage.</MI1> <SI1>In this respect, this method is so small percentage of the earth, but it can be expand your neighbors. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my apartment had a problem that garbage smell is so severe that people living in periphery of my apartment denounced this situation. Eventually, apartment citizens made the rule that people should disposed of the garbage one a week. <TR>Also,</TR> the garbage was transported on that day. After this rule enacted, citizen looked very well as well as people living in the periphery applauded this solution.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> people should make their own plan.</MI2> <SI2>Environmental issues are so diverse and broad that people cannot be expected something specific method. Accordingly, we plan our environmental schedules. <TR>For instance,</TR> I should waste a lot of foods and not recycled goods. <TR>Also,</TR> I should vacuum my home one a week. Suppose you make this rule, which will help you sustain your life fulfilling and make your home clean. As many people do this, people are able to think of environmental issues as personal problems.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To summarize</TR> people should come up with how we improve the environmental issues. Of course, it’s annoying and people can think what the problem is in my life. <TR>But,</TR> had it not been for the help of trivial development, the earth can be generated severe problems in your life. <TR>As a result,</TR> people have to do small but important alternatives and get the rule on their own.</CO>
column23: A generally organized essay, however, thesis statement does not address the prompt clearly. Pay more attention to grammar and provide more concrete examples.

column1: 524&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think it is good to support the plan above.</TS> Since the land value is high here where I live, there are not many restaurants nearby. Even though there are some, still it is  too crowded. <TR>Also,</TR> since my neighborhood's current restaurants' menu is all similar, I would definately like the new restaurant, assuming it' menu is new. For these two reasons, I would welcome a new restaurant.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> I think restaurants in my neighborhood is too crowded and old.</MI1> <SI1><EX>I personally don't like waiting, and thus It bothers me when I have to wait for 20 minutes to eat.</EX> To prevent this kind of problem, building a new restaurant can be a good solution. Once it is built, people  will be distributed, resulting a high efficiency.</SI1></BO1> 
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> a new restaurant can be a good idea for its food.</MI2> <SI2>Current restaurants' menus are similar, and thus we are tired of eating them. <TR>However,</TR> if new restaurant case a joint and come up with fresh menu, neighbors will enjoy it. I would obvious enjoy it too, since I like eating outside. This can ultimately relieve our stress, by eating delicious foods.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>Finally,</TR> Other restaurants are really expensive. <EX>Since there are few restaurants, they all increased a food value. 20 to 30% higher than the last year.</EX> To prevent this kind of price advance, new restaurant is needed. if a new restaurant is cheap, people will abandon other restaurants. Then, those other restaurants will decrease their food costs. <TR>Consequently,</TR> price reduction will happen.<TR>For these two reasons above,</TR> for efficiency, innovation, and the price reduction, I strongly support and welcome a new restaurant.</CO>
column23: Thesis statement is not clear and so is the main ideas of each paragraph. Give better examples to support your argument

column1:
525&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Television advertising driected toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.
column3:
<IN>Some people may may that TV is not that bad because TVs do have positive influence on us. <TS><TR>But</TR> when it comes to children, I think I have to beg the difference because of following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> I think that the contents coming from television is bad for children.</MI1> <SI1>That is because it's nature of attract people's attention with violent things or sexual things, which contaminates children's mind. <TR>But</TR> some people might think that there is nothing wrong with the content, as long as you keep an eye on your child. Well, I gotta say monkey see monkey do. Because there is always a moment when you can not watch your child, and really serious and really bad things can happen even in the slightest moment. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> My sister's baby almost got himself hurt real bad by using drill. He said that he was 'imitating a guy with a gun' Of course, my sister is also reprehensible for letting her child do that, but I think that it's TV's fault. You gotta remember, monkey see, monkey do.</EX></SI1></BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I think there's a bunch of other things that are better than just sit around and watch TV.</MI2> <SI2>Especially, for Children, excercising or playing out side is much better than watching TV. I think hanging out side can dramadically enhance children's abillity to appreciate the beauty of nature and acknowledge their positionin environment. Appreciating nature can also help children by making them realize the value of wildlives and cherish environment, which might become important because the global warming is processing and I think environmental condition is getting worse and worse. I believe that letting child hang around outside can make them to grow into responsible adult.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>So,</TR> I think that maybe TV is not the best choice children because it's influence is too powerful to children, and there is a great positive value for children out side of the TV. These are the reason why I think TV advertising shouldn't be directed toward children.</CO>
column23: Do not use the abbreviated forms of phrases in an essay. Pay attention to grammar.

column1: 526&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>I strongly agree with the plan to build a new restaurant. <TS>Building a new restaurant means that the ranges of food choices would expand, that it would be easy to eat out, and that he or she might be able to have nice relationships among neighbors.</TS></IN>
 
  <BO1><MI1>A new restaurant gives us more various kinds of food to choose from.</MI1> <SI1>We eat everyday and we cannot live without eating. So we often go to restaurants to eat. If there are few restaurants, there is limit to the food we can choose from so we'll be sick of it soon. <TR>But</TR> if a new restaurant is built, there will be a lot of food to choose from.</SI1></BO1>
 
  <BO2><MI2>When family members travel and come back to home, when someone's birthday in family falls or passes an important test, it will be wonderful to eat out.</MI2> <SI2>But it may be a burden for the family to go out for lunch or dinner far away. If a restaurant is built near the neighborhood, <TR>however,</TR> it would be convenient to eat out.</SI2></BO2>
 
 <BO3><MI3>Some might say neighbors should be familiar with each other, but these days few neighbors are than in the past.</MI3> <SI3>It is probably because of the absense of communication. This can be easily solved by meeting neighbors more at the new restaurant and as doing so they will get to be familiar with each other.</SI3></BO3> 
 
 <CO>Building a new restaurant is really helpful for neighbors there in many ways. It makes eating out easier and more convenient. It also gives people there options for food. <TR>Finally,</TR> it may make neighbors there communicate with each other more. This is why I agree with the plan to building a new restaurant.</CO>
column23: Pay attention to information organization and grammar. Elaborate more in each paragraph and use concrete examples to deliver argument effectively.

column1:
527&Do you agree and disagree with the following statement.
Government funds should be used to explore outer space rather than to solve problems on Earth. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that in the future, nation that possess the technology related to outer space will have more power than others in the world. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly believe that we had better focus on resolving earth problems rather than investing budget into a field of space in terms of cost-effectiveness and urgency.</TS></IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> numerous countries expending their money on developing space, they have yet to get promising results.</MI1> <SI1>This is attributed to the fact that speding money on unknown area such as space is less cost-efficient  than we expected. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2008, among 13 countries spending more than a billion dollars on exploring space, only two countries were able to draw trivial but positive effects. The researchers showed that the others nations were exhausting their budget without hopeful results. This implies that we should contemplate on taking the exploration of universe into account because of cost-effectiveness.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> presently, we are encountering various problems on earth such as overcoming today's energy crisis that is more emergent than making an exploration of cosmos.</MI2> <SI2>This is due to the fact that traditional energy sources such as fossil fuels is running out and thus becoming increasingly expensive. That is why I suggest that we should come up with a permanent solution such as alternative energy sources since it has no limit in the usable amount. <EX><TR>Besides such energy problems,</TR> we have other matters such as improving the environmental condition on earth and starvation in Africa.</EX> In fact, these problems can elicit more immediate response and result in positive impact more quickly. The gap between procedure and result is relatively short. <TR>For these reasons,</TR> expending money on such problems, we will have a quite brighter future.</SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>In brief,</TR> we usually thinking universe is unknown yet and not fully understood, developing universe is likely to look great and fantastic. <TR>However,</TR> it is less cost-effective way for us to spend money and efforts. <TR>Rather,</TR> we do our best to solve closer problems we are now facing.</CO>
column23: Good essay with few grammar mistakes. Good use of examples.

column1: 528&The advice from grandparents has no use for their grandchildren because the world changed a lot during the past 50 years.
column3:
<IN>There is one most important thing every person should do : decide.
In this seance people are always asking the better opinion and they'd love to refers other positive perspective to their decisions. Especially some young especially,who is less determination has faced with meters,they might frequently ask their parents or grandparents to give them prosper suggestions. What's more they expect that these kinds of suggestions are the best option for them to chose.
<TS><TR>However</TR> they missed biggest important point.
The young generation they are faced with maters given by 21century.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>On top of that,</TR> grandparent's advises and opinions are based on their own perspective and short sight of views.</MI1> <SI1><TR>More over</TR> they argue that young kids should follow their own way. 
<EX><TR>For instance</TR> when I was high school , to became more influential pension in social stage,I should decide what major should I learn, and where should I go to prepare for my future. When I asked my grandma, she told me women should merry earlier, do house hold and educate your kids. that's enough for women to do. <TR>However</TR> my teacher's recommend was different with grandma. My teacher told me you should do your favorites to create your ways and don't forget this is your life only for once! Even thought grandma suggested me to merry earlier, i decide to attend university to study my favorite subject: Mathematic. Now my life is better than I expected. I guess it's not only the perfect decision for me, but also good for my parents too. because using my capabilities, i can offer my grandparent better conditions. such as big garden with cutting edge systems and sport car with full options. Now Even my grand parents extols my decisions.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> previous generation can not give direct help through their advices.</MI2>
<SI2>Most important reason is they don't aware that recent trends and demands. 
<TR>Frankly speaking,</TR> young people forsake the advices which can appreciate to refer and can solve the problems. <TR>However</TR> older generation's recommend not include what the 21 century social demands . Absolutely their advice is not useful. Because they don't know how is the social arounding by .</SI2></BO2> 

<CO>I<TR>n conclusion,</TR> no body will deny that our parent' s advise was based on true love. <TR>However</TR> they had limited informations and narrow perspectives. <TR>Therefor</TR> far more cleaver youth should listen more informative advise and might consider widely before they decide. <TR>Because</TR>choice would result you and your family's remain lives.</CO>
column23: Essay is organized however thesis is not stated clearly. Also, grammar mistakes make essay less coherent.

column1: 529&Some people like doing work by hand. Others prefer using machines. Which do you prefer?
column3:
<IN>More and more people live in an era of machine and material conveniences. In this regard, the question about whether it is better to do things by hand or machine is very important because it gives a moment
to think about what I really enjoy from the convenient machines. <TS><TR>Personally,</TR> I like to get my work done by
machines whatever I am doing because of a number of benefits that they provide: extra time I can enjoy and precision the machines provide.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place,</TR> using machines gives me extra time.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words,</TR> I can make the use of time while machines are working by themselves. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> while the laundry machine washes my dirty clothes, I can go shopping or watch my favorite movies, sprawling in an armchair in front of television.</EX>
<EX><TR>Another good example</TR> of this can be applied to using the dish washer. Once you put the cups and dishes after using them into the machine and push the operation button, you do not even watch its working.
<TR>Instead,</TR> you can prepare for having a party with friends.</EX> How wonderful it is to save time and use it
to different places you need.!</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion to the efficiency of spending spare time,</TR> you can enjoy precise results that machines provide.</MI2>
<SI2>Machines are never getting tired by working unlike human beings, so that they hardly make mistakes or errors. <EX><TR>Specifically,</TR> if I use the food-processor, which is one of my favorite kitchen appliances,
whenever I have to chop vegetables for cooking, I can get my work done perfectly in a minute without
being cut my finger or chopping food materials in a wrong way, resulting from using a knife. The machine chop them precisely in consistent shapes with no errors.</EX> How beaufiful it is.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>Ultimately,</TR> I like using machines instead of doing work by hand. The machines provide so many advantages such as letting me save time and use it and performing a perfect work in an exact way.</CO>
column23: Generally organized with clear ideas, however, overall essay is not coherent. Pay attention to grammar.

column1: 530&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? About environmental issues, individual people can do nothing about it because it is too complicated.
column3:
<IN>A large number of people might argue that individual people can solve environmental issues despite of its complexity. <TS><TR>Contrary to popular belief,</TR> I believe that individuals cannot deal with environmental issues for following reasons: economic loss, and intense stress that derived from attempt to resolve them.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> individuals' tries to recover environment hinder people from living happy life.</MI1> <SI1>This is due to the fact that money that originated from depleting natural resources tends to represent their power in society by showing their ability to attain whatever they want ranging from fancy cars to even trust in relationship. <TR>To explain</TR>, in modern society, economy developed by consuming natural assets such as woods and coal. The activities that utilize such materials certainly damage environment. <TR>Hence,</TR> it can be deemed that deeds to reconstruct environment by hampering such activities can negatively affect people in terms of finance. <TR>Therefore,</TR> individuals attempt to heal damaged environment will be avoided by majority of people. This is especially true given the fact that modern society runs on materialism. <EX>According to the Ministry of Health and Welfare of Korea in 2010, there was a huge difference between two groups of employees in happy index. Employees in Group A owned a house and those in Group B rented a house. The researchers found that the level of happiness of Group A was much higher than that of Group B. <TR>Moreover</TR>, more than 60 percent of the workers in Group B underwent a severe depression. They constantly worry about paying rent in order to maintain a roof over their head. This indicates that money or economic benefit that came from anti-eco-friendly acts makes life easier and more comfortable.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> working on environmental issues in individual level arise stress to many people.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that such works can bring worries and stress to them. It is obvious that involving such activities can stress people out since most of modern society is closely related to factors that destroy environment. <TR>To be specific,</TR> general products that people use such as computers, fancy clothes, and microwave are the factors that harm environment. These products require natural resources such as soil and rare gem to be produced. <TR>Therefore,</TR> this complex projects to deal with environmental issues may actually serve as a stress arousal source.<EX> According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010, there was a significant difference between two groups of students in managing their academic pressure. Students in Group A who rarely engaged in eco-friendly performances were more satisfied with their school lives than those in Group B who frequently joined to such activities.<TR>On the other hand,</TR> those in Group B were involved in dangerous activities such as smoking, drinking, and stealing to cope with their stress. This implies that the eco-friendly works can become a common pain for individuals.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In brief,</TR> although many people urge that environmental issues can be alleviated by each person, such activities will be ignored by vast majority of people for the reasons that I have mentioned above. <TR>All in all,</TR> the importance of overlooking environmental problems cannot be underestimated for the sake of society.</CO>
column23: Organized with a clearly stated thesis. However, grammar mistakes make the essay less coherent. Pay attention to sentence structure.

column1: 531&It is more advantageous for children to grow up in rural areas than in big cities.
column3:
<IN>It has been argued among some people whether children can get more benefits when they are raised in rural than when they spend their childhood in big cities. <TS>Although it is true that growing up in urban enable children to experience a lot of developed and convenient things, I believe that children can grow as a better person if they are raised in rural area. In this essay, I am going to provide two examples supporting my idea.</TS></IN>

           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the countryside can encourage children to have a lot of experience that they can touch and interact with nature, which make them keep healthy.</MI1> <SI1>Children who stay in the city have difficulty trekking, swimming and hiking. It is pretty hard for them feel nature in the first hand, even if great environment is necessary for them to develop their health. <TR>On the contrary,</TR> children who live in rural region are surrounded by many beautiful natures. They can experience a lot for things related to environment as a result they have more opportunity to have physically healthy attributes. <EX>According to recent survey by BBC, children who grow up in the countryside achieve greater performance in the physical activities than ones who live in city.</EX></SI1></BO1>
           <BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that,</TR> city is relatively dangerous, <TR>however</TR> the countryside is very safe for any crime or accidents, so children can spend their childhood very safely.</MI2> <SI2><EX>There have been a number of criminal that focus on children recently. Children now are exposed to very dangerous things such as very fast car on the road or drunken men who are likely do anything that we cannot expect in city. <TR>In contrast,</TR> the countryside provides them with such a safe environment that cannot be harmful to them. People who live in rural area are so nice and kind that they are not threaten children.</EX> <TR>And also</TR> there is a little traffic on the road and there is no reason to hurry in that kind of rural area. So the possibility that children can get accidents in the countryside is much lower than one in the city.</SI2></BO2>

           <CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> the countryside enables children to grow up in the safe and healthy surroundings and it really helpful for them to live and make their own world. <TR>Therefore</TR> I certainly believe that it is more beneficial for children to grow up in the countryside</CO>
column23: Good essay and good use of examples. Try to fix grammar mistakes so that the argument is clearer.

column1: 532&Cooperation is more important in today's society than the past.
column3:
<IN>In today's complicated society, it is believed that there are many things to do which requires teamwork like farming in the past. Some people advocate that a current person should invest almost entire time to develop his or her own competence to achieve something rather than cooperation. <TR>However,</TR> I disagree with this view. <TS>I firmly believe that the ability to cooperate with others become much more important than the past time.</TS> It is because it is hard for one person to treat whole things and today's society has stretched works in the world which require more and more understanding about other cultures.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> achieving something successfully by oneself become difficult compared to the past.</MI1> <SI1>As technology has developed, a lot of fields are concretely sophisticated. That is, people have hard time finding out other fields unrelated to their jobs. <TR>In addition,</TR> today's times put importance on fusion among areas like a compound of art and cell-phone. Many consumers do not buy a new cell-phone model just because its design is appealing or it has merely original functions. They purchase when both two factors fits with their preference. It shows well the consumer's needs also become complicated and diverse. If a designer and an engineer strive for inventing a new model together, the procedure would be more efficient as their diverse knowledge would be reflected on it. That is, it can also a increase the probability of making a breakthrough. <TR>As a result,</TR> nowadays competent designers and engineers collaborate together to satiate requirements from people in leading companies. In addition, it is common that universities promote team projects for their students to be able to cope with works which need a coordination among people in different realms in their future jobs. <TR>Accordingly,</TR> cooperation can allow people to accomplish bigger success.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> the chance to work with people from other countries has been increasing.</MI2> <SI2>It is because many globalized companies has sprang up around the world. It means that they require employees who can cooperate with foreigners. The cooperation especially includes requisite such as the understanding about other cultures and proficiency of English. If a group composed of only Koreans works in China, they couldn't get any success. When they employ the native people in China, they can achieve a goal of their enterprise. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a famous international pizza company made success through naturalization. The success required natural employees' help who know well what taste and savor are preferred by residents in a specific country.</EX> <TR>Thus,</TR> it shows that when people start to business in other countries, they need to employ and cooperate with native people.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is my belief that cooperation is more indispensible factor in current society rather than the past. <EX>It is heard in a news article that many people try to begin their own company, about 5% companies survive in markets after 10 years.</EX> If they put effort to cooperate with diverse people, the probability to succeed would be rise.</CO>
column23: Generally coherent and organized. Pay attention to grammar.

column1: 533&People should spend their money on traveling rather than saving for the future
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether people should spend their money on traveling rather than saving for the future. Some people believe that people need to save for the future as they can do diverse things in the future. <TS>My view, <TR>however,</TR> is that people should spend their money going to another countries.</TS> There is largely because people have the opportunity to learn a sense of responsibility and independence. <TR>Moreover,</TR> they can make so many diverse people of many backgrounds.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> people have the chance to learn responsibility and independence by traveling.</MI1> <SI1>People adapt to environment by themselves. <TR>Also,</TR> they can respectively spend their money eating, transporting, and visiting the sites. By doing so, they decide their schedule on their own. <EX><EX><TR>For example,</TR> I was vacation on last year in Hong-Kong. When airplane landed on there, it was 11pm. Because I was alone, I couldn’t provide any help. I was concerned about this situation and felt anxiety. But I asked foreign people to give some advice to recommend living for days. When I arrived to my dormitory, I felt a sense of independence and responsibility.</EX></SI1></BO1>
                                 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> people make new friends living in all over the countries.</MI2> <SI2>By travelling, people can experience it is no problem to communicate with foreign people. Suppose you are traveling Spain. <TR>But</TR> you don’t speak Spanish completely.<TR>However,</TR> people who are the same age can help you to go right place. By doing so, you have the opportunity to make new friends. <TR>Also,</TR> it is probable that someone invite you to inform their families.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To summarize,</TR> people should spend their money traveling all over the world considering that there is the chance to learn a sense of responsibility and independence and people mak e a lot of people who living another countries. Of course, saving their money can be beneficial to live your life enjoyable in their nation. <TR>But,</TR> they didn’t know the fact that it is small part of the world that they do live in. There will be no regret that I spent too much money on traveling. It was the traveling that can give your life enjoyable.</CO>
column23: Generally organized and with a clear thesis statment but grammar mistakes make the essay very incoherent. Pay attention to grammar.

column1: 534&One of the best ways that parents help their children prepare for an adult life is to encourage them to do a part-time job.
column3:
<IN>Parents can help their children in various way. One of them, as mentioned in a topic, is encouraging them to do a part-time job. <TS>It is beneficial for the children because it makes their children to experience society.</TS> <TR>Also,</TR> Earing money can help them to understand this world's economy. <TR>For these reasons,</TR> I agree with the topic.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> As I mentioned above, by helping their children to prepare for an adult life by helping them to do a part-time job.</MI1> <SI1>This can enable those children to realize the meaning of getting job in society. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> by working and earning money, they can realize how hard earning money is. This would motivate them to study harder to get a better jobs. Since parents afforded them for life time by working hard, they should now teach them to work(Part-time job) when suitable time comes.<EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> by earning money, their children can self-reflect their way of spending money.</MI2> <SI2>Since it is hard to earn money even though it is a part-time job, they will know the importance of money. If parents don't encourage them to do those part-time job, their children might get lazy and lay around for a whole day in a bed. To prevent these type of situation, I think it is effective to encourage children to get a part-time job to prepare for an adult  life. In short, By doing part-time job, children can realize this world's economy.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>For these reasons,</TR> Encouraging children to get a part time job is a best way that parents can do for their children.</CO>
column23: Essay is organized but needs concrete examples to deliver argument. Grammar mistakes make essay incoherent.

column1:
535&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
There are so many sources of news and information available that it is difficult to know which sources to trust. Use specific reasons and examples to support your idea.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that as the inspection technology dealing with information coming from various sources is improved, the reliable amount of news and information has been increased. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I firmly support the idea that nevertheless there existed immense information which is unknown about sources.</TS> There are two reasons why : Information technology has significiently increased and the inspection is not fully adapted.</IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the advancement of Information technology has created huge doubtful information at rapid rate.</MI1> <SI1>This is the due to the fact that cyber tools, such as personal blogs, chat rooms and social networking on the webside have been peopel's new hobbies nowadays. Not only that, spending home alone, today's people tend to attract the attention from others by uploading stimulating rumors. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> Jun Kim, one of my classmates in the high school, wrote exaggerately an article related to a famous actress. He wrote it in order to his stress by feeling people's attention. <TR>However,</TR> the article became disseminated around all over the world. Naturally, the actress got compromised and sued him for a libel. This implies that with the advent and spread of information technology, there are vast untrusting news and information.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> information-inspecting method is not perfectly developed and applicable to all the website creating numerous fishy articles in nation.</MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that inspecting every website is not possible for now, considering today's IT level. Moreover, the low level of inspection is one of the main factors to promote serious gossip mostly related to entertainers, politicians, and artists. <EX>According to a study conducted by University of California at Los angeles, there was a huge difference between states in the amount of news stemming from unrevealed source. One group of states had improved technology that is able to inspect the website at a higher speed. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> second group of states had not invested in such technology. The researchers showed that in second group, the unreliable news had increased by geometric progression. This implies that if it were not for the inspection, today's people have difficulty distinguishing whether or not the information is true.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>In brief</TR>, even if it seems that information surrounding us is fairly probable, we have to consider it's reliance. <TR>All in all,</TR> I firmly believe there existed immense news and informations because of the lowed level of inspectation and a huge number of Information technology.</CO>
column23: Grammar mistakes, specifically, wrong usage of tenses make the essay incoherent. Pay attention to grammar and spelling.

column1: 536&It is better to spend time with one or two close friends than with a large number of friends.
column3:
<IN>People often make a large group to get along with each other, and there are many clubs to play with a lot of people. <TR>However,</TR> I found it uncomfortable and uneasy. <TS><TR>Therefore,</TR> I agree with the topic that spending time with one or two close friends is better.</TS> This is because, getting along with many friends is hard to decide one idea that every members in a group would agree. <TR>Moreover,</TR>spending time in a small group has less possibility to quarrel.</IN>
 
     <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> people have thier own idea, so it is hard to unite in one idea.</MI1> <SI1>If there are a lot of people in a group, there would be many ideas and opinions. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is almost impossible for them to make their opinions into one. Even if they decide the one idea, there would be other people who do not agree with that. And there are even people who follow that idea unintentionally. <EX><TR>For example,<T/R> when I was in the swimming club, all members in the club were getting along with each other all the time. <TR>However,</TR> members always have different ideas about doing something and it was hard to decide into one idea. As a result we often quarreled and begaun to seperate within the team. After all, the club members rarely got together unless there were important events in which they have no choice but to participate. <TR>Thus,</TR> we found nothing but getting along with a lot of people uncomfortable.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
     <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> spending time with one or two close friends has less possibility to be at odds with each other.</MI2> <SI2>People usually get together who have many things in common. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is rare to find each other different. They have more possibility to agree with each other's idea, so they can spend their time without any conflict. Although one of them has different idea about deciding something, they can adjust their opinions by yielding each other. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I often see other friends in the university who are getting along each other in a group which has two of three member. They seem that they have less conflict than other groups that have more than three members, becuase they have a lot in common. <TR>Moreover,</TR> their relationships even last after the graduation.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
      <CO><TR>In conclusion,<TR> spending time with one or two friends is better than with a large group of friens. This is because a large group friends have hard time to communicate each other. <TR>On the other hand</TR> a small group can agree wtih each other well.</CO>
column23: Generally organized and good use of examples. However, grammar mistakes make essay incoherent.

column1: 537&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is debatable whether easy prepare food styles change improved people live or not. Some people disagree that it is not improve at all. There are many health issues with harm chemicals from instant quick food. And the other around, some people says it improved people live significantly as time saving and it makes faster developed technologies in common life. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I strongly agree with this latter opinion because of saving time and choosing variable food much easier simultaneously.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all,</TR> saving time is very important modern society.</MI1> <SI1>Money, Knowledge, loves, youth and almost everything depend on their time and timing when we can get; however there are many competitors who want same thing at the same time. <TR>Therefore</TR> we have to prepare to grab our goals much faster than them with easy quick food. <TR>Afterwards,</TR> these competitions make society improve. <EX><TR>For example</TR> technology developments social connections, arts will be nicer and nicer with competitions. </EX><TR>Thus,</TR> it would be helpful for improving people life live with holist view.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> choosing variable food would be easier with easy prepare food at the same time. In my experience, Korean food takes a lot of time to prepare.</MI2> <SI2>So I usually eat only one cook per meal. <TR>But</TR> If I can make 2 or 3 kinds of food together, I will fulfilled more happiness than before. According to happiness, I can say this various food make people live abundant and improved more. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I can have Korean salad, Italian Pizza and American cokes. Because every those food now easy to prepare with same time.</EX> In this sense, I would like to say easy prepare food can make variable food choice for better human being life.</SI2></BO2>

 <CO><TR>Conclusions,</TR> it is clear that easy prepare food affected to people life better with saving times and choosing variable food simultaneously. I never doubt that everyone love to take many great meal at the same time and have more free time after quick meal.</CO>
column23: A generally organized essay with a clear thesis and main ideas. But pay close attention to grammar to make essay more coherent.

column1: 538&In order to stay well-informed, people should get information from various news sources
column3:
<IN>Thought-provoking current issue concerns with the news sources, since the news often express it's own thought. In other word, It becomes polarized. When someone contact those news, those people lose their own critical thoughts and believe what the news say even if it is prejudiced. <TS>To prevent these kind of situation, I think attaining information from various news sources is better than sticking with one news source.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> when it comes to the politics, one has to become critical.</MI1> <SI1>He or she must have their own thoughts about what is going on. He or she must be dispassionated and impartial. If they insist to get information from one news sources, it is clear that he or she will be partial. <TR>However,</TR> If we look up various sources, he or she can conjecture his or her indepedent thought. This can help him or her to select most reasonalble choice.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> various news sources contain various news.</MI2> <SI2>This we can know without any doubt. Reading various kinds of books is better than merely reading one type of book. This is undeniable fact. <EX>I can be a good example of this. When I was middle school student, I really liked to read science books and I was stuck to reading that kind of books. <TR>However,</TR> after final exam, I realized that I was paying no attention at developing other subjects' knowledge. <TR>Then,</TR> I started to read various kind of books. Consequently, I could get A+ in every subjects.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>For these reasons I mentioned above,</TR> I strongly believe that gaining information from various news sources is better than sticking on to one news source.</CO>
column23: Generally organized but main ideas are not clear. Grammar mistakes make essay inchoerent.

column1:
539&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge).
Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>Colleges or universities are considered to be the highest level of education system. People who did not attend a college or university usually envy those students. There would be several reasons why people hope to enter college or university. <TS>From my perspective, I think there are two main reasons for entering college or university: to learn deeply about what they are curious, and to prepare for their career path.</TS></IN>

 <BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost,</TR> people enter colleges or universities in order to study their fields more specifically.</MI1> <SI1>Most people desire to learn something that is interesting to them. Curiosity is one of the most fundamental aspiration for human beings. Some people would be interested in math, others would hope to learn chemistry. Colleges or universities give people a chance to think about their major, discuss with others, and study deeper than before they were in high school students. From colleges or universities, people can learn what they did not understand before, enhance their knowledge, and find out new phenomenons or inventions by researching their own fields.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> people try to prepare for getting a job by studying from colleges or universities.</MI2> <SI2>Although many people like their study in one way, they also are stressed by the study in other way. This is because they have to get a good grade in order to prepare for their future job. Education of college or university is one of basic requirement for getting a good job because companies want to hire highly qualified people and they think college or university education is appropriate method. People who want to enter a top class college or university usually think that one of good ways for getting a good or high salary job is to graduate a top class school. Their purpose of entering a college or university is mostly getting a good job.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>Several other reasons would be possibly come up for different people. Although various kinds of reasons are sensible, I think the most common reasons for entering colleges or universities can be classified as these mentioned reasons.</CO>
column23: Essay thesis and main statement are clear but should use examples to clarify point. Pay attention to grammar.

column1: 540&It has been said. "Not everything that is learned is contained in books". Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3:
<IN>Main source of most knowledge is from book, I admit it. However, It seems pretty certain to me that there are knowledge that can't be gained by books. As we all know, there is a thing called 'Experience'. Physically and mentally experiencing something can be way better than just reading a piece of paper. <TS>With these reasons, I believe experience is better than books.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1>There is this well known maxim.</MI1> <SI1>"Experience is the best teacher" . This saying, can be applied in various situations. <EX>Let's cite a drastic example. In combats, It applies significantly. For example, some soldiers may attain combat-knowledge from reading book, They cannot be better than those who already experienced a war. They may have good strategies based on their book knowledge, experienced soldiers can cognize what is right to do.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> Social relationship is another thing that cannot be gained by book.</MI2> <SI2>We now live in a harsh society and thus meet many kinds of people. To confront these people, we need particular social skills. This cannot be gained by a book. It is purely and merely from experience. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when my family moved to a new place, I had to make friends all over again. <TR>Then,</TR> I needed to show something to get close to them. Owe to my experience, I chose to play a sports together, and I could get close them easily. It was beyond the reading.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think experience is more important than a book. It doesn't mean that reading book is not required for people.
