They take all kinds of measures for upgrading both visual and hearing effect to convey their messages. <EX>According to the report released by the National Education Institute in Korea, students who study using television lectures of all subjects perform better than those who study focusing on their reading material for themselves. <TR>It also adds that</TR> students state that they can easily recall what they see in television than those who just read the books.</EX> <TR>As this study shows</TR>, the advantage of learning through watching television outweighs that through reading books.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, people feel easier when studying by watching television than by reading materials, so that they can learn more with watching television.</MI2> <SI2>Some people argue that reading books makes students get into the discussion which is the best way to make profound reasoning. Such an argument is true in some sense; <TR>however</TR>, in most cases students who are in trouble to read materials are main problems for leading discussion. <TR>In this situation</TR>, watching television on the discussion issue is of great help, because most all students can participate in discussing in the class with ease. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was in high school, my teacher wanted us to read about green-house effect before the next discussion. <TR>Needless to say</TR>, some students did not read nor think about that topic. <TR>However</TR>, my teacher turned on the television and watched documentary on that theme, so that we could continue the discussion and we all had a deep understanding on that topic.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, <TR>I have no doubt on that</TR> people are better off learning by watching television than by reading books. <TR>This is because that</TR> people can remember effectively and learn easily when they watch what they learn. <TR>On the whole</TR>, the more sensory we can utilize, the more we can learn.</CO>
column23: This is a strong essay. The student has a good thesis, and it is supported with adequate evidence and examples. There are some vocabulary and grammar issues, but not so many that the essay is hard to read.

column1: 601&Developing many different skills are better than focusing on one skill in order to succeed.
column3:
<IN>In the today's globalized society, it is widely believed that developing many different skills are better than focusing on one sill in order to succedd. Some people advocate that developing  various skills allows people to braoden their perspectives. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this point. For the following two reasons, I firmly believe that concentrating on one skill is better than studying a variety of skills : to develop speicialty and to increase children's academic performance.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, focusing on one skill enables people to enhance their specialty.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> when people spend most of their time studying their major, they can develop expertise <TR>Moreover</TR>, as modern society is becoming increasingly competitive and specialized, today's job markets require job candidates with such qualities. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, according to a study done by the New York Times in 2010, <TR>it revealed that</TR> the employee interview was the most important in hiring practice, taking up more than 70 percent of the final call. The study indicated that the interviewers looked at the applicant's knowledge and skills, mostly related to specialty. <TR>Thus, this proves that</TR> specialization is a good and safe way for children to prepare for their future.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, concentrating on one skill encourages students to perform with more entusiasm.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</SI2> studying one skill lowers their stress level, which serves as one of the key motivators for them to perform better and inprove themselves. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they can put in their effort, concentrate better on their work, and feel more responsible for their tasks. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, according to a study conduceted by the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2009, <TR>it revealed that</TR> there was a huge difference between two groups of students in achievement. Students in Group A spent more hours studying their major and  those in Group B spent most of their time studying different skills. The study indicated that the former group performed higher than the latter group. <TR>Not only that</TR>, students in Group A followed instructions, submitted assignments on time, participated actively in group meetings. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in Group B lazed off in class and lacked focus on class materials because studying different skills stressed them out. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this shows that concentrating on one skill allows children to increase their academic performance.</EX></SI2></BO2>
column23: The largest problem with this essay is that it doesn't contain a conclusion. Otherwise, the essay is alright, but there is a large number of unnecessary transitional words.

column1: 602&It is sometimes acceptable to infringe upon people's freedom.
column3:
<IN><TS>In terms of the statement that controlling people's freedom is sometimes necessary, I would like to talk about two advantages, especially in the view of national system. <TR>First</TR>, in specific situation, limiting people's freedom is more efficient and fast. <TR>In addition</TR>, infringing people's freedom is necessary to develop the economy of a nation.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> when a nation is in a dangerous situation, controlling people's freedom is more effective and fast to solve the problem.</MI1> Securing people's freedom is the basic element of the democracy and the democracy is peaceful and stable system. <SI1><TR>However</TR>, in the desperate situation, the freedom of people needs to be restricted, because the democracy takes a lot of time to make a quick decision. If the freedom of people is restricted, the nation can decide quickly and efficiently. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in the ancient Rome, people restricted their freedom themselves and elected one dictator, when they met the dangerous situations such as wars or disasters. By doing this, Rome could avoid crisis, and could be prosperous for a long time.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, limiting people's freedom is necessary to develop the economy of a country.</MI2> <SI2>To achieve the national economic goal, people need to coordinate, and to collaborate, people's freedom should be restricted. This is because, people can unify and consolidate into one community. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, Korea developed its economy in a short period. It took only about 50 years to be one of the richest countries in the world. The government of Korea limited the people's freedom and exagerated the unity of people. In this way, the nation can achieve its economic goal.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, limiting people's freedom can be effective and fast for the country in dangerous situation. <TR>Moreover</TR>, by restricting the freedom of people, the country can develop its economy quickly. Although infringing upon people's freedom has several side-effects, but in certain situation, it is necessary to control over the people's freedom.</CO>
column23: The weakest part of this essay is its thesis statement, which is unnecessarily wordy and long-winded. The student uses good supporting examples to make his/her argument.

column1: 603&Some people say getting too much information causes problems. Do you agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>When confronted with the problem of whether too much information causes problems or not, hardly would maintain that too much information is a problem. Most of them think it is good to gain information as much as possible. <TS><TR>However</TR>, too much information is not the best for solving problems or selecting the best choice. There are some problems of getting much information when people encountered a problem.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR> too much information does not actually help solving problems but only makes people feel confident.</MI1> <EX>Suppose a problem of whether a stock market will rise a week after today and 1 information is given to one group of people, 3 information to another group, 5 to yet another group of people, and 10 information to the last group of people. Many people would think that  the group of people who got the best result is the group of people who have 10 information. <TR>However</TR>, some scientists performed the experiment and got a result that the group of people who had the best result was people who had 5 information. People who had 10 information did not good enough to be the best. Instead the level of confidence about their result was highest among the group.</EX> This indicates two things. <TR>First</TR>, there exists a maximum limit for getting best result when gathering information for solving problems. <TR>Second</TR>, as information which people gathered gets larger, people’s confident gets higher even though the result cannot be possibly better. Strong confident can cause problems because people can lose their objectiveness.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, too much information increases the management points.</MI2> <SI2>There exists maximum amount of information that people can handle for their works. If the amounts are acceptable to take care of, information that the person have can be useful. <TR>However</TR>, if there exists too much information and if a person has to care about all of them, the person would be seriously stressed out and possibly make a mistake. In this situation it is more helpful to increase the number of people to take care the management point rather than giving too much information to handle. Giving just too much information only causes mistakes and problems.</SI2></BO2>

 <CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, I think too much information does not helping people to solving a problem. Gathering just appropriate amounts of information is the best way of solving a problem and avoiding a mistake.</CO>
column23: This student could have written a more detailed, convincing thesis. also, they use some very awkward phrasing and word choice.

column1: 604&In high school, college and university, teachers should spend more time teaching specific skills for future career and less time giving general knowledge.
column3:
<IN>As the economy has decreased, <TR>recently</TR>, many teenagers in the world have has a hard time to get a good career after graduate. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, some people said that the teachers in university or high school should teach the specific skills to students throughout school years. <TR>However</TR>, when I saw an economic magazine last year, it said that, <TR>in fact</TR>, many company prefer the applicants who have diverse knowledge and experiences. <TS><TR>As I saw the article</TR>, teachers have to provide broaden knowledge to students. <TR>First</TR>, general knowledge can enhance the student's creativity as they think deeply when they learn the general information. <TR>Second</TR>, there is not enough time to learn anymore after graduate the university.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, <TR>nowadays</TR>, creativity is most important skill.</MI1> <SI1>This is normally derived from the diverse knowledge. As teachers provide diverse information, student's creativity will be upgraded. <EX><TR>Take my experiences as an example</TR>, <TR>a few years ago</TR>, when I was at the beginning of the semester, I also thought I have to learn specific design skills in order to enter the design company directly after the graduation. <TR>However</TR>, when I told that to my professor, he replied I have to read a lot of books instead. <TR>Despite his advices</TR>, I just found to learn specific computer skill of design. <TR>Next few years</TR>, I applied the internship of the big design company and finally went to the final step of the application interview with the employer. <TR>During the interview</TR>, the employer said what the company strongly require to the employees, are finding people who have creativity. Because, the best design products are coming from the creativity and various knowledge rather than the only skills. <TR>Without a doubt</TR>, I failed to enter the company.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there is not enough time to learn after people get old.</MI2> <SI2>Both the high school and university are the legal facilities people have to learn many things. If people want to learn just one thing in the school, they have to get the specific job and learn basic knowledge. <TR>However</TR>, if people want to get a job or live a plentiful life, they should develop their knowledge more and more. <EX><TR>According to the study of the Seoul University</TR>, all the jobs completely connected each other. One field of jobs is normally connected with the other field. <TR>Therefore</TR>, only assimilating specific knowledge about the one field is not helpful at getting career. As the research, people have to get diverse knowledge in order to get good career.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, teachers in school should spend a time to teach general knowledge to the students even if it is not seems like effective. <TR>First</TR>, the effect of getting diverse knowledge appears when people find a career, because many tasks and projects in the company are normally based on the creativity which can be obtained by the broaden knowledge. <TR>Second</TR>, student should learn diverse things in their school. <TR>This is because</TR>, they have no enough time to learn after they graduate the school as well as all the career are connected eachother.</CO>
column23: Some of this student's wording and phrasing is highly awkward, to the point that it is sometimes a little difficult to understand. Despite that, they make a generally good argument.

column1: 605&People learn more by watching television than reading books.
column3:
<IN>There has been heated debate whether people can learn more from the TV than from the books. Some may argue that viewers learn more through TV than just the reading a book,  while others deem otherwise. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I believe that beneficial of books outweigh the TVs. This is not only because books delivers information with detail but because TV is produced basically for entertainment not for education. <TR>Likewise</TR> I go against the statement above.</TS></IN>
    
<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason for my opinion is that</TR> books deal the information in detail.</MI1> <SI1>Though some people may claim TV also does describe facts along with the sound effect and visual aid, TV program actually omit a lot of information. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, compare to the books, movie Harry Potter does seem to skip some of part. As the running time is limited to 2 to 3 hours, it is not possible to play everything that was depicted at the book. All the details which illustrate how  Harry Potter uses magic wand and how he fly with its magic brooms helps readers to imagine and learn all the marvelous vocabulary. <TR>However</TR>, such scene on the TV is just very small tiny part of the book which does not really help the viewers.</EX> <TR>For this reason</TR> <TR>I think that</TR> TV is not much helpful for learning than the books.</SI1></BO1>
 
    <BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason for my argument is that</TR> TV program is made for fun not for education purpose.</MI1> Numerous TV programs are filmed and played day to day. <SI2><TR>However</TR>, as TV broadcasts are mostly relying on their proceeds from the advertisement and commercial they have to produce programs that are eye catching. <TR>This means</TR> whether it is helpful in giving knowledgeable information, PDs and directors have to primarily consider how it can draw as much attraction as possible. Such act can even distort the actual fact and even hinder viewers from learning anything new. <EX><TR>To take this into illustration</TR>, according to the recent statistic from the Seoul National University 8 out 10 TV program academic programs always had comedian and other celebrities even though they do not have any proper knowledge with the topic. <TR>Also</TR> such programs sometime deal with the issue they are not related to the topic which can deter viewers to concentrate on the topic.</EX> This example illustrates how TV programs are not proper choice for learning.</SI2></BO2>
 
   <CO><TR>Subsequent to mulling over this query</TR>, I disagree with the statement given above. Books are favorable for individuals as they depict tons of information with marvelous vocabulary and statement. <TR>In addition</TR> TV itself does not include much of in-depth information, instead it airs program which tend to focus on comic and violent program to draw more numbers of viewers.   
<TR>To conclude</TR>, TV is not suitable for learning much information when comparing to the books. </CO>
column23: The student makes errors with things like article placement and pluralization. However, they come up with some good examples to support their argument,

column1: 606&Professors should focus on research more than teaching student.
column3:
<IN>There is a debate whether professors should focus on their research more than teaching students. <TS><TR>I agree with that</TR> doing study is more important for professors than teaching students for the two reasons. <TR>First</TR>, professor can give valuable research experience to students through more focusing their study. <TR>Second</TR>, it is better for students to get knowledge from their friends.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, for students, research can be the best way to get valuable knowledge that is not written in textbook.</MI1> <TR>Of course</TR>, it also might be a good way for professors to focus on textbook materials for their students' better academic performance. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>these days</TR>, all of knowledge can be available in the Internet. If students want to know something, they easily get that knowledge in the Internet. There is even online education course like "coursera" that is made up of internet online courses professors from famous university teach for free. <TR>Therefore</TR>, research experience more than better for students because students cannot get those kinds of knowledge from the Internet.</BO1>
 
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it is better for students to ask vague questions to their friends not to their professors.</MI2> <SI2>Professor definitely knows more things related to academic areas than students' friends. <TR>However</TR>, as far as getting understandable academic explanation is concerned, students' friends can give more comprehensible knowledge because students share similar learning environments and backgrounds. <EX>My friends, Su-Jin, can be a good example for above explanation. <TR>At first</TR>, Su-Jin asked questions that are not clear for her in class. <TR>However</TR>, she could not understand professor's explanation because professor said unfamiliar terms and matrixes she first heard. <TR>After class</TR>, she asked me and I explained same explanation using easier terms and examples. She was surprised at my explanation and said she understood all of things perfectly. <TR>This shows that</TR> although professor tries to focus on teaching students, it is better students to get knowledge from students' friends.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 
<CO><TR>I really agree with that</TR> concentrating on research more than teaching student is better for professors for the two reasons. <TR>First</TR>, professor can give valuable research experience to students through more focusing their study. <TR>Second</TR>, it is better for students to get knowledge from their friends.</CO>
column23: I find BO1 very disjointed and confusing, and it seems to go against the student's argument. Also, the student makes some very obvious grammar and vocabulary errors.

column1: 607&businesses should do anything they can to make a profit
column3:
<IN><TS>Many Businesses are eager to make better profits. This can lead them to using methods that do not commensurate with current laws, not paying their workers to save more money. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I disagree to the statement that businesses should do anything they can to make a profit because of two reasons; hurting themselves and creating disorder.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, businesses should not do anything they can to make a profit because it would eventually hurt them.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Generally</TR>, when businesses try to increase their profits, they consider breaking the law in some way to detour their hard work . <TR>However</TR>, although it could provide them with a method that allows them to make lots of profits in a short time, it would eventually hurt them. <TR>This is because</TR> when a business does well, competing companies try to search for holes in their success to ensure their success in the business world. <EX>Take my uncle’s faucet company, true waters, for example. When my uncle’s company first started, it did not go well although he tried hard. This lead my uncle to violate the law in order to succeed in his company. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, <TR>although at first</TR>, his company went well after my uncle violated the law, competing companies turned skeptical and irritated of his success and tried to find what lead him to succeed. <TR>However</TR>, after they found out that all of my uncle’s success was not due to his hard work, they requested investigation and my uncles company had to close down with a large amount of debts. <TR>Therefore</TR>, when people do anything to make a profit for their business, it would rather hurt them.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>In addition to the idea that doing anything a person can to make a profit will hurt themselves, doing anything a person can to make profits could lead the company to an end by creating disorder.</MI2> <SI2>Many companies that need an increase of their profit, need workers to work for the company twenty-four seven. <TR>However</TR>, when employers start requiring workers to work, the workers will only be frustrated with the amount of work they have to do compared to their salary. This could also lead to disorder in the company as workers have a limited amount of patience and since they need to rest and spend their time doing other things too. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this could create disorder in the working environment and put an end to a company. <EX>According to a research done by the Korean Statistics Bureau, the respondents, who were CEOs of a small company that had been put to an end, were asked the main cause of their failure. They responded that, the company’s eagerness to make a profit for the company put the company to an end because they forced workers to work day and night, not letting workers have their own time and not paying them as much as they were supposed to be paid.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, trying to make profits no matter what it takes could lead the entire business to an end by creating disorder among the workers and the employers.</SI2></BO2>

 <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I disagree to the statement that anything should be done in order to make a profit for their businesses because by doing this, it would actually hurt themselves by stimulating competing companies to search for what illegal activities the company has done, and because businesses could be put to an end by the disorder caused from working hard and not getting paid well enough. <TR>In the future</TR>, I hope businesses will regard being ethical and reasonable a priority since doing whatever it takes to make a profit can lead to so many bad results.</CO>
column23: The only truly weak parts of this essay are the vocabulary and grammar usage, which sound very unnatural at points. However, it is never so bad that anything is confusing, and the student makes a very good argument.

column1: 608&the most important aspect of a job is the money a person earns
column3:
<IN>When applying for a job, we consider many aspects; the money the company pays us and whether they have health insurance or if the working environment is encouraging and whether it is what we want to do. <TS>While a lot of these aspects are crucial for a person’s future, the money they earn should be the most important aspect they put into account because it can decide our wealth and heatlh. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I agree to the statement that the most important aspect of a job is the money a person earns because of two reasons; stability and pursuing our dreams.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the money a person earns from their job, can be mentally healthy because it gives them stability in their lives.</MI1> <SI1>While some people state that doing what we want is the most aspect of a person’s job, <TR>it is obvious that</TR> without money people cannot be stable. Some families might not be able to have meals every day because they do not have enough money and they would have to worry about what they would eat. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my cousin’s father has been trying to achieve his dream of becoming an engineer. It has been told that he abandoned all of his previous work because it was not what he wanted to do, and started working as an engineer. <TR>However</TR>, although the atmosphere of their household has improved, the family sometimes has to loan money from our family to provide their family with a nice warm meal because the money he earns is not stable. <TR>Also</TR>, <TR>because of this</TR>, my cousins family have to constantly worry about money and this has caused my cousin to get a mental illness.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, although monetary values are not the only thing that should be considered, it is in fact the most important aspect of the job as so many can depend on it. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to the idea that the money a person earns can give them stability</TR>, the money a person earns can help us to pursue our dreams.</MI2> <SI2>When we have enough money we can spend our spare time watching movies or learning sports. This can be applied to workers who only go to work for money since they can earn a lot of money and use it during their spare time to do what they want; having another job or attending a pottery class. <EX>According to a recent study by the Korean Statistics Bureau, the respondents who earned a lot of money, were asked whether they had achieved their dream job. One third of the respondents responded that although they did not get to do the things that they always wanted to do, and stated that they were somehow doing it by spending their spare time doing what they pleased to do and did not have to stress about the fact that they did not get the job that they always aspired for.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, even without having to get their dream job, people can enjoy their lives just as much.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I agree to the statement that</TR> the most important aspect of a job is the money a person earns because it allows them to be mentally healthy by giving them stability in life and allowing them to pursue their dreams even when they do not have an ideal job, by allowing them to pursue it in some other way without worrying them about money. <TR>In the future</TR>, when people apply for a job or go looking for one, people should not only consider aspects just as the overall environment of the company but should also consider whether they pay well enough since it gives us so many advantages.</CO>
column23: The student has an okay thesis, but it would have been ever better if they were more specific about what exactly they would be arguing. The rest of the essay is fine, with good evidence and examples, though the student does make some fairly basic grammar errors.

column1: 609&attending a live performance (for example, a play concert, or sporting event) is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television
column3:
<IN>Attending any kind of live performance can have its benefits; people would be able to participate in the event and they could meet various people who are interested in the same field as they are. <TS><TR>However</TR>, attending a live performance can also have various drawbacks; it could be unhealthy and it could somehow be a waste of money due to its size. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I disagree to the statement that attending a live performance (for example, a play concert, or sporting event) is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television because of two reasons; health and money.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, attending a live performance could be harmful to our health.</MI1> <EX>Many live concerts tend to have speakers, which have their volume fully raised. Although this can enable everyone, even to the people in the very back, to hear their performances, it could be harmful for people who are standing right next to the speakers.</EX> <TR>Also</TR>, in performances where a lot of excited fans are eager to get closer to the performers, the fans that are standing right at the front may be in danger of getting their internal organs damaged due to the pressure. <EX><TR>Take myself as an example.</TR> <TR>Last year</TR>, I went to a Justin Bieber concert in Canada. As soon as I arrived at the concert hall, there were thousands of fans screaming and pushing to see Justin Bieber sing. Although the atmosphere was very encouraging, I couldn’t concentrate on the concert because everyone kept pushing and at one point my stomach started to ache. <TR>Also</TR>, my ears started to make weird noises due to the consistent screaming, and the blaring speakers. <TR>Thus</TR>, <TR>when the concert was over</TR>, I had to visit the doctors to make sure I had not gotten an ear problem. <TR>Therefore</TR>, attending a live performance could harm our health.</EX></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to the idea that attending a live performance could negatively affect our health</TR>, watching a live performance on television could save money and allow us to be more flexible with our time.</MI2>  <SI2><TR>Generally</TR> in concert halls, the closer we are to the performers, the more expensive it is to watch.  <TR>Therefore</TR>, if people buy seats that are quite far away in order to save money, they cannot enjoy the show as much since it is hard to watch the performers in detail.  <TR>However</TR>, by watching the show on television, we can see the performers in a more detailed way, since the cameras try to capture the performers in detail, and it does not have to cost us that much money. <EX><TR>According to a research conducted by the Korean Statistics Bureau</TR>, two thirds of respondents who were asked whether watching live performances on the television was more beneficial , responded that watching it on television was better. They also stated that watching the performances not only enabled them to see the performers perform in a more detailed way but also cost them less money because they paid less money on transportation. <TR>Also</TR>, they responded that they had been able to eat while watching the performances and stated that watching the performances on television allowed them more freedom.<TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>considering the respondent’s response</TR>, attending a live performance will not only save money but also benefit in a lot of ways.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I disagree to the statement that attending a live performance such as a play, concert, or sporting event is a more enjoyable than watching the same event on television because watching these performances on television can benefit our health by not exposing us in harsh environments and could save our money. <TR>In the future</TR>, I hope to see a lot more performances on television as it will allow me to be more flexible with my time and situation.</CO>
column23: This is an excellent essay. The student clearly has a strong command of English vocabulary and grammar, and (s)he persents his/her argument well and supports it with very good examples.

column1: 610&Technology designed to make people's lives simpler often turns out to make them more complicated.
column3:
<IN>Technology designed to make people's lives simpler often truns out to make them more complicated. In the today's globalized society, it is widely believed that technology designed to make people's lives simper often turns out to make toem more complicated. Some people advocate that technology can stress people out. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this point. For the following two reasons, I firmly believe that development of technology makes people's life comfortable : to broaden their perspectives and to perform with more enthusiasm.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, development of technology enables people to widen their horizon.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> technology, such as computers and cell-phones, can expose people to different worlds of lifestyles, basic customs, and cultures. Through such experience, they can learn to embrace diversity. This is especially important given that modern society is becoming increasingly globalized. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I went to a park with my father, there was an Ethiopian girl who brought home-cooked meals for lunch. It smelled strange and she even ate with her hands without a fork. Altough my father who had never seen such behavior kept his distance from her, I felt comfortable with it. This was because I learned and knew about such behavior by using my computers.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, this shows that development of technology allows people to broaden their perspectives.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, technology encourages children to increase their academic performance.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> people can get all the information with one-mouse click, which serves as one of the key motivators for students to perform better and improves themselves. With such motivaion, they can put in their effort, concentrate better on their tasks, and feel more responsible for their work. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, according ot a study done by the New York Times in 2010, it revealed that there was a huge difference between two gorups of students in achievement. Students in Group A spent many hours using a computer in order to get information they needed and those in Group B spent more time reading their text books. <TR>The study indicated that</TR> the former group performed higher and get better grades than the latter group. <TR>Moreover</TR>, students in Group A followed instructions,  submitted their assignments, and participated actively in group meetings. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in Group B lazed off in class and lacked focus on class materials.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, this proves that techonology enalbes students to perform with more enthusiasm.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, it is my belief that my argument regarding this topic has been precisely and effectively delivered with the reasons mentioned above. Never should I forget that this issue has may a huge impact on our future.</CO>
column23: This student has very good grammar and an equally good vocabulary, but I dislike how the essay starts with a position opposite from what the thesis later says, and I feel like they stray from the topic.

column1: 611&People attend college or university for many different reasons(for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>Nowadays</TR>, most students from high-school go to university. There are many reasons for it such as having new experience, learning professional skills.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, through the attending university people have a chance to get new experience.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In the university</TR>, they choose the lecture that they want to attend. People meet new friends from different environment. With meeting new people, they experience lots of things such as values, life style and so on.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, competition spread out our society, getting a job, marriage and so on.</MI2> <SI2>All of things are under the control of competition. Therefore people learn how to prepare for it before they step out to the real society.</SI2></BO2>
 
<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, “Knowledge is power” as the saying goes.</MI3> In the university, students get specialized knowledge of their field, it made them professional and to be able to have a good job.</BO3>
<CO>People go to university to learn and experience for the rest of their life.</CO>
column23: This student doesn't make a strong argument, and they don't support the argument that they do make. This is a generally poor essay.

column1: 612&Parents should give money to their children for high grades they get at school. Do you agree or disagree.
column3:
<IN>There has been a debate whether parents should give money to their children for high grades they get at school. <TS>I disagree that giving money to children is helpful to encourage them to study hard for the two reasons. <TR>First</TR>, understanding about each other can more encourage children to focus on their work. <TR>Second</TR>, giving money for just academic performance are not good for children's mind.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is better to give intrinsic motivation to children for better academic performance in school.</MI1> <TR>Of course</TR>, monetary motivation might helpful to encourage children to concentrate on their studies due to they can buy anything through those money. <SI1><TR>However</TR>, those kinds of encouraging factor can have not lasting effect on their studies. <EX><TR>Let me take my cousin for an example</TR>. For my cousin, her name is Su-Jan, computer games and online social networking are she are always obsessed with. Her parents came up some idea that giving money to encourage her to study hard. <TR>At first</TR>, she tried to study hard. <TR>However</TR>, she felt that it was hard to study for long time and gave up those money finally. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, her parents are paying more and more attention to how to fun time with her. <TR>Fortunately</TR>, <TR>these days</TR>, entertaining family TV programs in the prime time have been really catching on. <TR>By watching those TV programs</TR>, her and her parents talked more and understood about each other. Her parents naturally talked about future loads that they took and advised about her future loads like what kinds of jobs would fit her.</EX> <TR>Naturally</TR>, those kinds of motivation cannot help but encouraging her to study hard.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, giving just money is harmful for children's future developing.</MI2> Some people might think compensating children's academic performance as money is good idea. <TR>However</TR>, as far as children's future developing, monetary rewarding is bad idea. <SI2>Children in their teenage have to experience a lot of things to learn various situations for their future. If parents just give money because of children’s academic performance, children definitely lose their opportunities to earn money by other kinds of method like working with unfamiliar people and locations. Even children might just think academic performance is everything in their life. Those kinds of children's thought might cause teenage problem in our society. <TR>For this reason</TR>, giving money children for their academic grades is bad idea.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>I really disagree that giving money to children is helpful to encourage them to study hard for the two reasons. <TR>First</TR>, understanding about each other can more encourage children to focus on their work. <TR>Second</TR>, giving money for just academic performance are not good for children's mind.</CO>
column23: The student's thesis is weak and confusing- I don't understand what the first point means to say. Despite that, the student sticks to the topic very strongly.

column1: 613&The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong.
column3:
<IN><TS>Altough there are a lot of mistakes from a quick decision, not all quick decisions make problems. <TR>This is because</TR> today's people are already familiar with a quick decision, so they can avoid from making a wrong decision. <TR>Also</TR>, people have their own intuition to make quick and precise decisions.</TS>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begine with</TR>, People are familiar with a quick decision in this society, so they do not make a mistake often.</MI1> <SI1>This society is called the informational era, and in this society, it is important to make a decisions quickly. <TR>As a result</TR>, many situations are happend that people have no choice but to decide quickly. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people have to decied quickly even though there are many mistakes. <TR>However</TR>, since they are already familiare with this situation, they tend to make less mistakes.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, since humans have their own intuition, they can decide quickly and precisely.</MI2> <SI2>According to the evolution theory, humans often met dangerous situations. <TR>In this situation</TR>, they had to make quick and precise decision so that they can survive. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, people in the prehistoric era, are often chased and hunted by dangerous wild animals. <TR>In this situation</TR>, they had to make a quick decision whether they have to run or hide to avoid from being hunted. This conditions are similar to today's society, even thought today's people are not hunted by animals.</EX> Today in the inforamtional era, people have to make a quick decision. <TR>In this circumstance</TR>, they exert their own intuition to decide. Since the intuition from prehistoric era still exists in today's people, they can decide quickly and precisely.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people in these days are already used to make a quick decision. They already have experienced in deciding quickly. <TR>Therefore</TR> they know how to avoid from making a wrong decision. <TR>In addition</TR>, people have their own intuition to make quick and precise decisions because we have developed our intuition since the prehistoric era. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I do not believe that the statement that people make mistakes when they make a quick decision.</CO>
column23: The student makes a lot of errors with verb conjugation and pluralization. In addition, they severely overuse transitional words.

column1: 614&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN><TR>These days</TR>, people are becoming more and more busy. <TR>Naturally</TR> the franchise fastfood markets are growing but in the same time, it also casts this question. Is The food that easy to prepare always good for people? <TS><TR>I strongly believe</TR> the fastfoods and cooking food more easily harm us more than help us. <TR>It's because</TR> fastfoods can cause health problems and cooking food easily takes away the pleasure of cooking one's own food.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, fastfoods can easly be the causation of health problem.</MI1> <SI1>This is mainly because of the higl calories that fastfoods contain. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, hamburgers contain calories over 300 calories and if you have sidedish like frenchfries and colas with it, it exceeds half of calory recommendation per each day for grown man. <TR>It's because</TR> even a small size cup of colas contain 200 calories and french fries contain calories more at least  than 600 calories, so it's not that surprising fastfoods cause heath problems.</EX> <EX><TR>If you need another example</TR>, go and watch a documentary named 'Super Size Me'. This film propagates the danger of fastfoods by the director himself eating Mcdonald's menu every day.</EX></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, foods that are easy to cook take away the pleasure of cooking.</MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, simple microwaving or boiling water doesn't make you appreciate what you eat. But if you cook your own food, you can savor the tasty food itself and the pleasure of making your own food.</EX> <TR>Plus</TR>, not only you can enhance your cooking ability, which might become more useful when you get in to relationship with another person, but also you can appreciate sacrifice of the other living things. Since we're in the top of food chain, I think It's important to acknowledge the base of our lives.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>because of these reasons</TR>, I strongly believe the foods that are easy to cook and easy to eat are not good for people. Altough it can save some times but I think it coincides taking away our health and pleasure of cooking.</CO>
column23: The thesis does make an argument, but one of the reasons for that argument is very confusing to the point that it sounds contradictory. Also, this student is weak in grammar.

column1: 615&A school should invest in purchasing computer for students rather than books for the library.
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of the discussion at hand is whether the school should invest to the computer for the students rather than the book. The answer to the question can vary greatly depending on the individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, <TR>the jury may still be out</TR>, <TR>but as far as I concerned</TR>, I agree with the statements suggested in the question. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will present two reason supporting my standpoint as follows.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the computers have very wide range of information as much as the books, so that the students can get information and knowledge which they want easily, without going library.</MI1> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>when I was in the university school</TR>, I used to go to the library for a long time to find a data related in my reports. It took too much time to do another activities that I wanted. <TR>However</TR>, I usually search the materials in the web and the computer for my works. <TR>Even though</TR>, the works have been needed to deal very broad and various subjects, computer makes me to do rapidly and correctly.</EX> <TR>Hence</TR> Investing to the computer is very helpful for the students, especially who want to use the library.</BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, investing to the computer is future-oriented activities for the students.</MI2> <TR>Todays</TR>, almost companies have required to the students who have wanted to get a job. <TR>In other words</TR>, A capacity for using computer is necessary for the students. <EX><TR>According to the recent research data issued by The Knowledge and Development Association of Korea</TR>, show that my country’s investment rate for the computer and the Internet is lower than other countries, even though Korea is ranked No.1 for a long time until last year. <TR>As the report further notes</TR>, reducing the investment to the computer has a lot of risks for Korean future.</BO2>


<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I strongly argue my standpoint on account for the two reasons mentioned above</TR>. <TR>Once again</TR>, <TR>although the verdict may still be out</TR>, <TR>I personally believe that</TR> two of my rationales are sufficiently enough to represent the viewpoint of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim.</CO>
column23: The conclusion of this essay is not satisfying, as it is bogged down with too many transitional words and doesn't even restate the writer's position. This might result from having a very weak, overly wordy thesis.

column1: 616&For success in a future job, the ability to relate well to people is more important than studying hard in school.
column3:
<IN><TS>When I worked for Kookmin bank in Korea as an intern, I heard that the ability to get along with people is more important than studying. I could not understand the meaning of this statement at that time. <TR>However</TR>, now I can understand what it means, because I got to realize the system of the capital society and the company. <TR>That means</TR> the ability to get along with people brings more profits to the company and the power of a boss that affects on the promotion are important to success in a future job.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the ability to relate well to people can bring more profits to the company.</MI1> <SI1>Today’s society is called the capitalism. <TR>In this society</TR>, the corporation is one of the major factors, and to success, it is important to do well in the corporation. <TR>Further</TR>, to do well in the company, people should make as many profits as possible to the company. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is important to get along with people, because good relationship brings more profits. <TR>To be specific</TR>, the company should make profits from their customers. <TR>Thus</TR>, employees of the company should make good relationship with customers, so that they can buy more products from the company.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, since a boss has an authority to promote, it is important to have the ability to relate well to people.</MI2> <SI2>There are classes in the company. <TR>It means</TR> the higher the class is, the more power he or she has. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is important to make good relationship with a boss – who usually in high class, so has more power. Considering that they have an authority to promote his or her staff, making good relationship with a boss is never a trifling factor. <EX><TR>Actually</TR>, one study has shown that employees who spend their time with their boss more often have 30% more possibility to promote than others who don’t.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>it is not an exaggeration to say</TR> this society is ruled by companies, <TR>therefore</TR> doing well in the company is the way to success. Since the ability to make good relationship with people – whether it is customers or bosses – is closely associated with the succeed in the company and promotion, it is very important to relate well to people.</CO>
column23: The essay starts out alright, with a clear argument in a thesis that could be a more concise, and that could use a little more clarity on one of its introduced supports. The essay suffers from a lack of variety in sentence structure, and from some very strange wording and phrasing at some points.

column1: 617&Today, young people do not help their community.
column3:
<IN>There has been heated debate whether young generations are helping with their community or not. Some people assert that youth are playing pivotal role for their residents and community while others deem otherwise. <TS><TR>Still</TR> <TR>I believe that</TR> young people are not doing much for their community they are in. This is not only because they are busy with their career but also because they have become so individualistic to care about the society they belong. <TR>So from my point of view</TR>, I am in agreement with the former stand.</TS></IN>  
    
<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason for my opinion is that</TR> youth are too busy to give support.</MI1> <SI1>In this heavily competitive world, not only finding job is tough but working day to night is tiresome as well. Especially ever since the global economic crisis in 2008, numerous people have lost job or are in danger of being dismissed from the occupation. <TR>This means</TR> they have to put a lot of effort to show more than what they can do. <EX><TR>To be more specific</TR>, my older sister who has started her job last year is worried that her company might fire her. As the economic is still flagging her company is planning to cut down the numbers of employees who doesn’t seem to be helpful. Such situation makes her to solely concentrate on the work and at home she is knocked down .She cannot spare any moment for anything else.</EX> <TR>In this manner</TR>, youth cannot afford the time for their community.</SI1></BO1>
   
<BO2><MI2><TR>Another reason for my argument is that</TR> young people do not think it is essential to aid the community.</MI2> <SI2>Though it might be common courteous for everyone in the town to work together when they face any of issue, not everyone, especially young people do not much care. With the advent of modern technology like internet and IT invention,  it enabled young people to spend time alone. Such phenomenon leads teenagers and university  to care less about their community. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, <TR>according to the study done by Harvard University</TR>, teenagers age from 10 to 18 tend to less participate snow removing work than the people from age 40 to 50. The study concludes that older people feel more affection toward the community while younger generation don’t.</EX> This example illustrates why young people do not care about the community</BO2>
   
<CO><TR>Subsequent to mulling over this query</TR>, I support the statement above. Youth cannot spare time for their community as they are busy keeping up with their career. <TR>Also</TR> many of young people have come so individual that they do not recognize the essence in helping the community. <TR>To conclude</TR> there is no doubt that young people do not give hand for their community</CO>
column23: This student makes a strong argument, which they back up with good examples and evidence.

column1: 618&Nowadays it’s easier to maintain health than the past
column3:
<IN><TR>it is evident that</TR> in our currently society, health is tremendous important in our lives. Some people think that in the past, it was easier to maintain health than the present, while others do not. <TS><TR>Contrary to popular belief</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> nowadays it’s easier to maintain health than the past for two reasons. <TR>First</TR>, it is efficient. <TR>Also</TR>, people can relieve their stress easily.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people can stay healthy efficiently.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> <TR>these days</TR>, many technologies for healthy life are being improved gradually. <TR>Unlike the past</TR>, people do not further effort to maintain health. <EX><TR>Take my father, for example.</TR> When he was a college student, it took over 1 week to maintain health because he had no choice but to exercise. <TR>These days</TR>, it only took 5 minutes for him to maintain health because he ate a special nutrient food, such as vitamin pills. <TR>Thus</TR>, he was able to improve his health faster than before.</EX> <TR>This experience shows that</TR> nowadays, it is easier to maintain health than the past because people can deal with their health efficiently by using many technologies developed by them.</SI1></BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people nowadays maintain their health by doing many leisure activities.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In the past</TR>, people were not aware of importance of stress. <TR>In commonly society</TR>, people think that stress is a main factor in the disease, through weakening the immune system, making a lot of leisure activities to cope with their stress. <EX><TR>Take my uncle, for example.</TR> When he was fifth grade, he received a lot of stress from his study. <TR>As a result</TR>, he had to take 2 weeks off because he and a stomach ulcer because he did not know what he did not for his health. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, he is maintaining his health because he does not get a lot of stress by doing leisure sport and hiking. <TR>Thus</TR>, this experience shows that nowadays it is easier to maintain health than the past because people can cope with their stress easily through many recreational activities.</EX></SI2></BO2>
column23: I understand what the thesis is trying to say, but it's worded very awkwardly, in a way that may be confusing to some. Also, there is a lack in sentence structure variation.

column1: 619&young people today are more likely to give time and effort to improve the world than young people were in the past.
column3:
<IN><TR>Nowadays</TR>, trying to improve the world is tremendous important in our lives. Some people think that in the past, young people was more likely to give time and effort to improve the world than young people who are in the present, while others do not. <TS><TR>Contrary to popular belief</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> young people today are more likely to give time and effort to improve the world that young people were in the past. <TR>First</TR>, young people nowadays are exposed to globalization, young people want to be successful.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, young people nowadays are exposed to globalization.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> our modern society is becoming globalized through surprisingly development of technologies. <TR>Thus</TR>, young people today are more likely to spend time to improve the world because they are contacting with globalization and have diverse opinions about the world, unlike the past. <EX><TR>Take my father, for example.</TR> When he was a young child, my father did not know about other country because there was not the internet. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, I was raised awareness of global problems, such as global warming and pollution after he used the internet by using the internet. <TR>Through the internet</TR>, I had concerns about the world issues naturally and effort to improve the world by joining in global environmental organization. <TR>Thus</TR>, this experience shows that young people today are more likely to give time and effort to improve the world than young people were in the past.</BO1>  

<BO2></MI2><TR>Second</TR>, <TR>these days<TR>, young people want to be successful.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> many companies nowadays prefer people who have a lot of relationship. <TR>Therefore</TR>, young people today are more give time and effort to improve the world because they can meet many diverse people by doing many activities to improve the world. <EX><TR>Take Dr.Ahn, For example.</TR> I read online that Dr.Ahn, the former CEO of Ahn Lab Company transformed his company one of the most profitable Information Technology enterprises because he was concerned about the world. During one of his interview he said that he was able to do this because he already concentrated on world’s relationship and did many activities in the United Nations. This helped him make a broaden relationship with other countries’ people.</EX> <TR>This interview shows that</TR> young people today are more likely to give time and effort to improve the world than young people were in the past because young people nowadays want to become more successful.</BO2>
column23: This student has strong vocabulary and grammar.

column1: 620&Professors should focus on research more than teaching student.
column3:
<IN>Different people have different opinions about the statement that professors should be more concentrated on the research than teaching students. <TS><TR>I strongly believe</TR> the statement above is untrue this is because professors have a duty for students to learn more and students are deserve to request the higher quality lecture because they paid for it.</TS></IN>
                  
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the most important role of the university is growing intellectual students and makes them erect their own view to the around the world. <TR>For that reason</TR>, professors should do their best in teaching students with sincerity.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Especially</TR>, with the state-of-the-art gadgets in the lecture, professors can convey their notion or conception to the student easily and effectively. Using smartphone, internet and email, they are able to contact with students more closely than ever before.  <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I joined the class in which the professor mainly uses the smartphone on the lecture. He turned on the computer and projector in a classroom and used his own smartphone and linked them through the Bluetooth. The class was about the history of economics, he projected a sort of graphs and data immediately and quoted many images whenever the students had a hard time to understand the topic. So we are easily figured out the various concept of the economics and felt the class is more enjoyable.</EX></SI1></BO1>
                   
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, students are same as customers and they are eligible to require certain quality of the lecture.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As we know</TR>, tuition fee is not much low and lecture quality is the most considerable part of choosing the class for students.  <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, one survey conducted by a Korean National Institution for Education has shown that 63% of the university students response they are not satisfied with their lectures. <TR>It strongly represents that</TR> universities and professors are not providing proper education to their students. <TR>That is</TR>, the ‘companies’ are not meeting the demand of customers. It’s not fair.</EX> <EX>A survey also represent that when students required to choose the question that the most dissatisfying thing in the lecture, they response the old-fashioned material in the class. Not all the classes, but some of that still use outdated case, examples, uncorrected material. These things disappointed the students and they, <TR>as I mentioned above</TR>, have right to request the higher quality of the class context.</EX></SI2></BO2>
                   
<CO><TR>Overall</TR>, professors should try to sharpen the lecture ability because it enables students to accept more knowledge and students is eligible to receive education quality that they want to. <TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>I strongly agree with the notion that</TR> teaching staffs on the university should focus on teaching students than the research.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement reads like an awkwardly-phrased run-on, but the argument that the student is making is good. However, they don't connect it well with the topic when they go on to the body paragraphs, simply aruging for better education for students as opposed to arguing what the prompt wants, which is better education for students as opposed to more reasearch time for professors.

column1: 621&people should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing.
column3:
<IN>There are some people who maintain that there is something which people do not want to do but should do. <TR>However</TR>, others disagree with that idea. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>I agree that</TR> people have to do something which they do not enjoy because it can be a way to be familiar with another people, especially group members and avail to one's future.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people can make intimate relationships with other people by doing something although they hate to do.</MI1> <SI1>It maybe a irritate to do that but by doing this people make more unified and intimate relationships. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was in middle school, I had to practice dancing with my classmates for school festival. I really hated to dance in front of lots of audiences but I had to. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>after the festival</TR>, I could be familiar with my classmates more because we together did something although I hate to do.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, acting something although do not enjoy to act can be a good resource for one's future.</MI2> <SI2>There are somethings hated to do but are helpful in one's lives such as studying, <TR>For example</TR>, there are little students who really enjoy to study. <TR>Rather</TR>, most of them enjoy playing. <TR>However</TR>, studying is surely a good method to achieve one's future goals and careers. <EX><TR>Also</TR>, I hated to exercise when I was young. I just hoped to watch TVs. <TR>However</TR>, I had to exercise regularly because of my father. <TR>Now</TR>, I thank to my father because I can keep my health through exercising from young to so far.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, <TR>I strongly assert that</TR> people should do what they hate to do because it can be a useful way to build up warm relationships with others and a valuable resource to one's future.</CO>
column23: The student does a good job at really focusing on the topic, but their sentences are really unvaried, and they misuse a lot of vocabulary words and grammatical structures.

column1: 622&Governments should spend more money to make the Internet more easily accessible than to improve public transportation.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>I think</TR> the government should spend more money to improve public transportation for several reasons : the use of public transportation is now a serious problem and to save the earth.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>,  the government should pay attention to the use of public transportation because it is a serious problem these days.</MI1> <SI1>The  number of people are greatly increasing day by day. There are more and more cars and other transportations on the road. So people are trying to take more public transportation than to take their own vehicles. <TR>However</TR>, as people usually take the transportation on their way to work and home, there are certain period of time that people move from place to place. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my father uses public transportation when he goes to work and come back. But he always complains that there are too many people using that transportation, numbers of the vehicles limited, moreover the periods when they take the transportation are all similar and it causes a big trouble. To solve all these problem, the government should introduce a new policy or a solution. Probably by spending more money on increasing the number of vehicles for the public.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, the government also should encourage people to take the public transportation to save the earth.</MI2> <SI2>Global warming is getting serious and most of people know that there is a need to take public transportation instead of their own, <TR>however</TR>, it would not be easy to take actions when you already have your own. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR> my homeroom teacher in my school knows that she has to take public transportation to reduce carbon dioxide produced, but it is not easy for her as she is now living in a country side and there are not many public bus and she has to come school in time. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the government should spend more money to this problem.</EX> To advertise and encourage the people to take public transportation more, and also to provide bus to the country side people so that they will not take their own vehicles individually, resulting in producing more carbon dioxide.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, because the use of Internet is already easily accessible and the problem of the use of public transportation is more serious the government should encourage people to use public transportation more also to reduce the amount of carbon dioxide, after increasing the number of public transportation.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement would have been nearly perfect if the student had elaborated more on why "the use of public transportation is now a serious problem." A problem that I see in this essay is a large number of run-on sentences.

column1: 623&Being creative, rather than planning carefully, often results in the best solution.
column3:
<IN>In the today's globalized society, it is widely believed that being creative, instead of planning carefully, often leads to the best solution. Some people advocate that planning carefully prevents people from broadening their perspectives. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this point. For the following two reasons, I firmly believe that planning carefully is a better way to solve the problems than being creative: to improve a sense of responsibility and to promote work efficiency.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, planning carefully encourages people to improve a sense of responsibility.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is due to the fact that</TR> planning requires many obligations, such as managning their schedules widely, abiding by rules, cooperating with other members. Through the consequences arising from negligent actions, people can learn the importance of obligation. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my youngest brother ,who was the present of a sport club in his college, used to be lazy and sefish. He has changes little by little after he started to plan his time carefully. He realized that his laziness could negatively affect everyone by dalaying every step to achieve victory. <TR>Nuturally</TR>, he became more puncual, made a good suggestion and encouraged other members who had a hard time. <TR>Thus</TR>, this shows that planning carefully enables people to improve a sense of responsibility, which leads to a good suggestion.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermoe</TR>, managing own time carefully allows people to perform with more enthusiasm.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> having careful plan help people feel confidence because they don't feel fear. Having confidence can serve as  one of the key motivators for them to perform better and to improve themselves. With such motivation, they can put in theif effort, concentrate better on their tasks, and feel more responsible for their work. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, <TR>according to a study done by the New York Times in 2010</TR>, it revealed that there was two groups of employees in achievement. Employees in Group A planed their time carefully and those in Gruo B behaved freely. <TR>The study indicated that</TR> the former group spent more hours working by 50 percent and performed higher than the latter group. <TR>Moreover</TR>, workers in Group A followed instructions, participated actively in group meetings, and made good suggestions. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in Group B lazed off in work and lacked focus on group meetings. <TR>Thus</TR>, planing carefully encourages people to bring about good ideas.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, it is my belief that my argument regarding this topic have been precisely and effectively delivered with reasons mentioned above. Never should we forget that this issue can have a huge impact on the future.</CO>
column23: This is a strong essay overall. The student uses good examples to support his/her argument.

column1: 624&The purpose of television should be educational, not entertaining.
column3:
<IN>When I read the newspaper, I found the article which addressed the number of the viewers, who watch the entertaining television programs, are much more than those who watch the educational program. This article makes me think what the purpose of television is whether entertainment or educational. As the entertaining programs have bombard, people usually prefer to get excitement and joy. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> the television should be educational for following reasons. <TR>First</TR>, educational program can enhance the knowledge and insight of the people. <TR>Second</TR>, educational broadcasting can develop the effects of the education as people might use the senses of hearing and sight, during watching television.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, educational programs via public broadcasting will make people high standard, being exposed by the diverse information.</MI1> <EX><TR>According to the survey of Korea Broadcasting System</TR>, 70% of respondents said that they have got diverse knowledge, what they have never known before, during they watched educational programs. And also they mentioned that they have felt full of satisfaction after assimilated the information via television.</EX> <TR>Besides</TR>, as watching more and more educational programs, people's standard will has been enhanced afterward. <TR>Without a doubt</TR>, this phenomenon will be contributed to the economic growth and country development.</SI1></BO1>

 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, as television provides the information with sight and sound, people are able to be facilitated developing their study. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, the television is most accessible media as all the families, nowadays, have the television.</MI2> <SI2>For students, it is good way to study, who normally study independent after came back from the school. <EX><TR>According to the research of the Seoul National University</TR>, it is more effective to study with using all the sense rather than using only one of them. They also mention television is best media to provide the diverse knowledge for student because of its popularity.</EX> <TR>Besides</TR>, <TR>it is no doubt that</TR> the television only shows entertainment factors will disrupt the study. <TR>In line with this thinking</TR>, television programs should be educational for people as well as students.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I think</TR>, the purpose of the television will be changed educationally. <TR>First</TR>, by providing educational information and broaden knowledge, the standard of people become highly. It is being the great asset for the country. <TR>Second</TR>, because of the most houses have televisions, it contributes the effective study, especially for students, as providing information with sound and sight with the great accessibility.</CO>
column23: This student has written a strong essay, starting with a good, specific thesis statement. There are some grammatical errors, but the student sticks close to the topic and uses very strong examples as support for his/her argument.

column1: 625&It is important for the government to protect wild animals and wilderness places for the future generation.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>I totally agree with the idea that</TR> goverment should protect wild creatures and their habitats. <TR>That is because</TR> the speed of wild lives destruction is now proceeded very fast. <TR>Also</TR>, many wild lives are getting extinct . Since most of causes are human activities, I think goverment can preserve wild lives by controling human activities</TS></IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, desertification is progressed at a fast speed.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Usually</TR>, desertification is caused by human activities, and these activities are somewhat prohibited by restrictions made by goverment. <EX><TR>In Africa</TR>, many people cut trees and plants because of their hunger. <TR>However</TR>, since these greenery plants have positive effects to provide wild plants and animals with appropriate environment to live, the devastation of the habitat for the nature deprive of the wild lives.</EX> If goverment keep people from destroying the nature by the law, various creatures in the wild may be able to exist. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the Keynan goverment prevented people from cutting trees without the permission from goverment. With this persistent endeavor over 10 -year period, the speed of desertification became slower, and some species of birds increased their number.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, many creatures in the wild are being extinct.</MI2> <SI2>Many people hunt wild animals for the purpose of money. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in Korea</TR>, <TR>in the past</TR>, some people hunt bears and wild boars to sell in the underground market. <TR>As a result of this</TR>, the numbers of these animals are rapidly declined. <TR>Thus</TR>, the Korean goverment stipulated these indicreet hunt illegal, and levied a heavy fines for the hunters. <TR>Fortunately</TR>, this effort was proved effective, the number of wild animals started to increased again.</EX> <TR>I think</TR> this shows the efficiency of govermental efforts.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>By way of concluion</TR>, <TR>based on the arguments above</TR>, <TR>I am of the opinion that</TR> wild lives are protected by the govermental efforts. The goverment can prevent the trees and plants from being deserts where wild lives can not live any more. <TR>In addition</TR>, the extinction of plants and animals can be decreased somewhat by the human effort. <TR>I believe</TR> these efforts can bring change into the habitat of wild lives. <TR>By doing these</TR>, people can transmit our wild lives as a precious heritage of our mother nature to our offsprings.</CO>
column23: This student shows a strong command of English vocabulary and grammar, with just a few issues. Their argument is very well supported.

column1: 626&Some people think it is more efficient to go to school and take the class. Conversely, others think it is more effective to have home schooling.What is your opinion?
column3:
<IN>Some people think home schooling is better than taking lectures in the campus. <TR>This is because</TR> it will save their time. <TS><TR>In contrast</TR>, <TR>I contend that</TR> having class in the school is better than doing home schooling.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, School is not just a place where we get the information and learning. It is a sort of society.</MI1> <SI1>Students learn how to join with other people and social skills: sharing opinion, solving problem with friends, and how to cooperate with others. <TR>For an example</TR>, if there are two students, one took the lessons by going school directly and the other one took the lesson indirectly through home schooling. Which one do you think can adapt to the society easily? Maybe the first one will be able to adjust the society faster than the second one. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, school is a place where making us to be prepared before getting in to the society. <TR>This means that</TR> you lose chance to prepare to be a part of community when you take home schooling instead of going school.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> there is a limitation for students to learn the subjects.</MI2> Most of students will be taught under one teacher to learn diverse subjects. It is impossible for one teacher to know about every academic subjects. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the students will learn only the surface of each subject, not the academic depth.</BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, It is important to young students to experience people and society. <TR>For above reasons</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, taking lectures in the school is more effective to students than having home schooling.
column23: The student makes errors with simple things like using infinitives, and with (over)use of articles. Also, the student gives no real supports for his/her arguments.

column1: 627&what is something that you would like to study in school?
column3:
<IN>The world is becoming more and more globalized, and last few decades, there's been a significant awareness as to the importance of international language. While many still are being adamant on their thoughts that keeping regional language is more important, we can't deny the fact that the international language is becoming more of a matter of must rather a choice. <TS><TR>Likewise</TR>, <TR>given choice</TR>, I would personally like to study English in school and my reasons are economical, educational, and social.</TS></IN>
