 <BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, one of the great advantages that comes along with learning English is that a person  gets to have better opportunity to be successful in the society.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is because</TR> the demand for a person being able to speak is increasing higher than ever before. <TR>Due to globalization</TR>, companies are bound to be connected with companies overseas. And this created a phenomenon called English obssession.
<EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in my school years</TR>, I remember putting in as much as 5 hours a day just to get better score on English test called Toefl. And those who had failed to get wanted score felt devastated, while those who had managed to obtain high score might've been self-esteem.</EX> This is just one of many examples that show the significance of English in recent years.</SI1></BO1>

 <BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, making friends with people from different parts of the world has been made possible as more and more people are now able to speak English.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In the past</TR>, even if one wanted to broaden his views and perspective by having relationship with those half way around the world, so called "language barrier' kept them from making it happen. With a help of language that connects the world in the way not present in the past, it's not too far-fetched to say that there's no such thing as different languages anymore. <EX><TR>Last year</TR>, I went to France for the purpose of having a little getaway after a long period of hard-working, I was a little anxious at the fact that I didn't have any information regarding France, which includes where the good restaurants are. <TR>However</TR>, my worries proved me wrong, because everything could've been dealt with just by asking locals. <TR>And</TR> this might've been impossible without English skill.</EX></SI2></BO2>

 <BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, English also provides us with threshold of great education.</MI3> <SI3>Since most of prominent schools like Ivy League require students to have score on English test like Toefl, it has become nearly unimaginable to attend those schools without solid English skill. Whether it be communication major or sports business management, the classes are all conducted in English, <TR>therefore</TR>,without English listening skill, attending the classes becomes no meaning in the very first place.</SI3></BO3>

<CO>Everyone might have a dream that they want to achieve in their lives. Some might want to be a renown scientist, and others would go to bed every night dreaming of becoming a rich business man. whatever their dream is, that we live in a society that puts a lot of emphasis on English language is something we can't ignore.</CO>
column23: It's clear that this student is a fairly advanced English speaker. While not perfect, his/her grammar and vocabulary choice is extremely skilled, and his/her argument is well thought out and supported.

column1: 628&It is important for the government to protect wild animals and wilderness places for the future generation.
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of discussion at hand is whether or not it is important for the government to protect wild animals and wilderness places for the future generation. The answer to this question can greatly vary depending on the individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, <TR>the jury may still be out</TR>, <TR>but as far as I am concerned</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> governments should preserve wild animals and wilderness places for the future generation. <TR>In this essay</TR>, <TR>I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows.</TR> <TR>First</TR>, by doing it, people release their stress level. <TR>Second</TR>, it helps them succeed in their life.</TS></IN>

           <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, visiting wilderness places significantly reduce one’s stress level.</MI1> <SI1><TR>This is attributed to the fact that</TR> watching wild animals and natures distracts one from worries and anxiety. <TR>Thus</TR>, this simple and quick escape from the reality may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, there had been a study conducted by the Seoul National University in Korea. The researchers surveyed a thousand people to see if governments have to protect their wild animals for the future generation. <TR>Of all</TR>, 78.1 percent of them stated that governments have to concentrate on preserving wildness places. <TR>This is because</TR> it helps their citizen relieve stress and settle down, as they are likely to forget their worries while watching wild animals and natures. <TR>Thus</TR>, governments have to spend their budget on protecting wilderness places because their citizen can stay healthy without stress.</EX></SI1></BO1>

            <BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, being educated about the importance of preservation of wilderness places from an early age has a direct correlated to success in life.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As the saying goes</TR>, “Old habits die hard.” <TR>This indicates that</TR> people cannot make sudden dramatic changes in life, such as controlling their desires and behaviors one morning. <EX><TR>According to an article</TR>, Alex Kim, the Sociology Professor at Harvard University in America claimed: “Modern students have to learn the importance of wildlife protection because it allows students to be successful in their life. <TR>It is obvious that</TR> students who have been taught about wildlife protection will be likely to consider their heritage valuable in comparison to those who have not. <TR>For this reason</TR>, they can have the ability to develop their heritage and create the newest values by doing it, which helps them being specialized job candidates.”</EX> <TR>Hence</TR>, wildlife protection by government is crucial for the future generation since it helps them to be successful in their life.</SI2></BO2>

           <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of the two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again</TR>, <TR>although the verdict may still be out</TR>, <TR>I personally believe that</TR> two of my rationales are sufficiently convincing enough to represent to the viewpoint of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim.</CO>
column23: I find the introductory paragraph horrible, just a jumble of fluff with a little hint of argument thrown in out of necessity- and that argument itself is quite confusing until one reads the following paragraphs and gets a little clarification. Despite that, this student shows that (s)he has a strong grasp of English grammar and vocabulary.

column1: 629&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answers.
column3:
<IN>People’s thoughts about this statement can vary. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I agree with this statement that</TR> parents are the best teachers because parents spend more time with their children and parents are people who know their children the best.</TS></IN>
            
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, since parents spend more time with their children, children are easily influenced by their parents’ lifestyle.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In fact</TR>, children only spend six or seven hours a day at school and the
rest of time at home with their parents. <TR>In other words</TR>, children learn more from their parents’
daily routine such as how they talk each other, how they greet other people and how they eat etc. <EX><TR>One day</TR>, I watched a TV program about students who are accepted into Ivy League. A common habit they have was they love reading various books. They said that they used to spend time with their parents in the library and discuss issues from books what they read. Their parents also read a lot of books at home instead of watching TV so that children can be influenced by looking at
their parents’ lifestyle.</EX></SI1></BO1>
            
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion</TR>, parents are people who know their children best; <TR>therefore</TR>, they know how to motivate their children.</MI2> Parents know their children since they were born, while teachers have
many children to take care of in a class and children do not always have same teachers every
year. <SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, parents know their children better about what their children’s strengths and
weaknesses are. <EX><TR>Best example is my mother.</TR> Since she knew that I am introverted until I feel
confident with something, she made me learn singing, playing the piano. I participated in various
competitions and recitals to perform in front of other people. <TR>When I look back</TR>, this experience
helped me be active and gain confidence in myself. </EX></SI2></BO2>
            
<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, teachers are the best teachers for their children because the way of parents’ life can easily affect children’s lifestyle in daily life such as reading and exercising and
also, parents can encourage their children better since they know characteristics and personalities of their children very well.</MI3></BO3>
column23: This student's vocabulary and grammar are fine, but their thesis statement is quite weak and unconvincing.

column1: 630&Traveling with companion or on your own
column3:
<IN>Some people prefer to travel alone, while other people prefer to travel alone. There are disadvantages and advantages in both the approaches.
<TS><TR>Yet</TR>, <TR>I personally believe</TR> traveling with a companion has better advantages than traveling alone <TR>because</TR> the more people you have, he more information 
you have in the touring scene and environment. <TR>Not only that but also</TR> you can reduce the traveling expenses in various ways. These two factors are crucial in
determining what a sucessful trip is, <TR>thus</TR> the following excamples and explanations will help your understanding.</TS></IN>
  
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, going on a whole new and unfamiliar area is an adventurous challenge, even though the place is made suitable for foreign tourists.</MI1> <SI1>Language barriers, cultural differences,
pharmaceutical and food issues are just the few matters that we have to mediate with. If you were all alone in such a location with so much demand, you will have less time and resources
to enjoy what you have planned for, in the first place. <TR>However</TR>, if you're accompanied with few others, you'll have a much bigger chance to solve out these problems easier. <EX><TR>For
example</TR>, I went on a trip to Turkey with my college friends last summer, and despite preparing for the trip for a long time, none of us were able to be fluent in Turkish language.
<TR>Starting from the first day of arrival</TR>, we struggled to communicate with the locals, and had a hard time finding our Hotel, but were able to minimize the confusion by gathering our heads
 together with our individual information and ideas. One of my friend used frequently used Turkish words to explain our destination, while the other used map and body language to
express our needs. It was a terrific team work and the locals had little problem understanding us. Were it not for the team work, I would not have had found a place to stay for the whole day.</EX></SI1></BO1>
   
<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, traveling with companions is an effective means to reduce one's traveling expenses.</MI2> <SI2>Many of the tourist locations offer discounts to group of visitors. <EX><TR>It has been announced in the
annual report from the Ministry of culture and tourism, that</TR> 95% of major tourist locations around the world implement group discout policies to attract more visitors.</EX> This also applies to
restraunts and suvenior shops or Theater ticket purchasements. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I visited Australia last year with my family, me and my five other family members recieved discounts
in Koala Forest walk program, Ozzy fish and chips diner, and even for the Theater show held at the Opera House in Sydney. We were able to save an additional airline ticket price, back to our hometown.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>As a result</TR>, Traveling with companion not only secures your timely and financial resources, <TR>but also</TR> it allows you to relax and enjoy the trip as a whole. <TR>Based on the reasons mentioned above</TR>, <TR>I definitely believe</TR> traveling with companions have a lot to offer than traveling alone.</CO>
column23: This essay has a thesis that is unnecessarily drawn out, but the main ideas behind it are supported with good examples.

column1: 631&It is more important for people to spend their time at work than with their families.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think it is more important for people to spend their time at work for several reasons : to produce high quality of work and to relieve stress.</TS></IN>
     
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, people spend most of time at work.</MI1> <TR>This shows that</TR> it is very important to be familiar, friendly, and get along well with them. If you do not get along with them well, it will be difficult for you to be at the work place for a long time, feeling uncomfortable. It is important for people to work at a comfortable place, in order to  produce high quality of work. If you spend enjoyable time more with people at work, it will be a great opportunity for you to a chance to be close with them, making a comfortable place for everyone, and also resulting in better quality of work. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, there was a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2006. There were two groups, group A with people new to each other and group B people with their close friends. They were asked to do same task in time and the experiment turned out that completed work from group B was better than group A. This shows how important it is to become friendly to each other in order to get a good quality of work.</EX></BO1>
     
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, you will be able to get a friend who shares same interest, becoming a good advisor for each other if they happen to have troubles at work.</MI2> <SI2>This cannot be done when you are with your family because family members will have a limit to understand your situation fully and if you cannot share your feeling right away with people, you are likely to get stress from it. <TR>So</TR> it is beneficial for you to have such friend who can understand and share your situation and feeling about the issue. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a friend of mine who was not good at making friends, she always had hard time spending time at her work because of the working stress and she had no one to talk to, unable to get rid of it. <TR>Then at last</TR>, she quit. <TR>This shows that</TR> people need to relieve stress whenever they need to.</EX></SI2></BO2>
     
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, it is important to spend time at work as to produce good quality of work and also to relieve stress that you will probably get from work.</CO>
column23: The thesis states a position, but it doesn't state what the alternative is, making it feel incomplete to anyone that doesn't know what the prompt is. Also, the student gets off-topic from the beginning- I don't understand why they focus on being friendly with people in the office in BO1 when the point is to compare spending time at one place over another.

column1: 632&Teachers should give students homework every day.
column3:
<IN>I had the teacher who gave assignments every day when was a high school student. <TR>At that time</TR>, it is too demanding for me because it was never a easy job to do my homework every day. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>come to think of it</TR>, it truly helped me a lot to develop my studying skills. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I agree with this statement. <TR>This is because</TR>, <TR>as I stated above</TR>, it improves skills of studying, and assignments help students understand the class better.</TS></IN.
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, it develops skills of studying.</MI1> <SI1>I would like to focus on two of several skills - creativity and writing skill. Although doing homework is demanding, it can enhance the sense of creativity and writing skill. <TR>While students are doing their work</TR>, they have to think what subject and contentst should be included in their homework. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they should think how to write that subject and contents. <TR>By doing this</TR>, they can enhance their sense of creativity and writing skill. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, I was very poor at a writing class due to lack of creativity and writing skill. <TR>But<TR>, <TR>after meeting the teacher who gave me daily homework</TR>, I came to get good grades at the writing class.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, students can understand the class better by doing homework.</MI2> <SI2>Teachers usually give assignments which is associated with the class, and by doing homework, students can preview the subject which will be learned tomorrow. <TR>In addition</TR>, they can also review the subject that they are taught yesterday. The most important thing is it can help students understand the class much better. <EX><TR>Once</TR>, I have read about the newspaper article which stated that students who do their homework every day can understand and follow their class better than others who do not. <TR>In other words</TR>, doing daily homework truly effective.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, although doing assignments every day is demanding and tough, it surely has the effect to improve studying skills. <TR>Plus</TR>, it also helps students grasp their class better. <TR>Actually</TR>, <TR>in my case</TR> it was hard to do my homework everyday, but even if its process was harsh it was very fruitful. <TR>Thus</TR>, I would like to recommend teachers to give students a daily homework.</CO>
column23: I feel that the student gets a little off-topic, but overall, (s)he is able to write his/her argument successfully and convincingly.

column1: 633&Visiting museums is the best way to learn about a country.
column3:
<IN><TS>I do not agree with the idea saying that visiting museums is the best way to learn about a country for several reasons : experiencing is a better way to learn and to broaden one's view and perspectives.</TS></IN>
     
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, it is better to actually visit the country to learn about it because it is more memorable and there will be things that you will learn more than just knowing things that you should know in museums.</MI1> <SI1>The information and knowledge you got from visiting its country will last long and beacuse you felt the country with your skin and you will be able to think deeply. <TR>I am quite sure</TR> it will teach more than the words from books. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in Korea</TR>, people take off their shoes before they come into the house. If foreigners just visited to museums to learn about the country's culture and custom, they would have not get this kind of information. <TR>In addition</TR>, people in Korea use chopsticks and spoons to have their meals and  foreigners will be able to know naturally about it while having meals in the country.</EX></SI1></BO1>
     
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, visiting country itself compared to visiting the museum to learn about a country will also help to understand the native people as well, broadening your view and perspectives.</MI2> <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, when I was a student in fifth grade, I had a friend of mine who came from India. On the day when she came to the school, she brought some home-cooked meal. It smelled funny and friends around her tried to keep distances with her. <TR>However</TR>, I felt comfortable with it as I had visited India a year before and I could understand her.</EX></BO2>
     
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> it is more beneficial to visit the country to learn about it because you can learn about a lot of things by experiencing, information you cannot get from just studying in the museum, and to learn about the native people as well.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement takes a clear position, but it's not very strong or compelling. This essay is okay overall; it has some mistakes, but it is understandable.

column1: 634&It is better to have friends who are similar to you than those who are different from you.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>I can surely say that</TR> having friends who have similar characteristic with me is better. <TR>This is because</TR> this has more advantages over having friends who are different from me. Now I'd like to introduce 2 advantages to support my opinion.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, making friends who are similar to me is easier.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Needless to say</TR>, getting close to someone who is different from me is difficult in any case, even trying itself is not easy. <EX>Think of a person who likes to read a book and the other who loves playing football. Will they have any common interests to talk about? I do not think so. It will take a lot of time for them to find topics with which they can share. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, making similar friend takes less time and effort. A person who has common interests with me is easy to get along with, because we can find our same topic without effor, and we can easily feel sympathy to each other.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, a friend who has similar to me can understand me better.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Not to mention that</TR> a friend who is similar to me can understand me better, because the friend has similar thinkings, experiences and emotions. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, when I was depressed because of poor grades in my test of last semester, a friend of mine who had a similar experience with me gave me advice and it helped me a lot, becuase he also got terrible grades several years ago and knew that how to escape from that situation. <TR>From this experience</TR>, I got to rely on him more, and we still best friends now.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 <CO><TR>In summary</TR>, having friends who have similar personality to me has more advantages, becuase making that kind of friend is much easier and that sort of friends can understand me better. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I firmly believe that similar friends are better.</CO>
column23: The student gets a bit off-topic in BO1, talking about making friends instead of just having friends, which is what the prompt is asking about.

column1: 635&Grades encourage students to learn
column3:
<IN>There are some people who maintains that learning is encouraged by grades. <TR>However</TR>, other's don't. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, the notion that grading makes students learn is absurd, because grading raise student's stress in learning and can't bring genuine learning.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, Students easily get stress by grading what they learned.</MI1> <SI1>Grading encourages stress rather than learning. <TR>This is because</TR> students are apt to be get stress and lower confidence when they have lower grades than others. This frustrate students' willing to learn. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was in high school, I had lower math grade than rival. It made me depressed and frustrated.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, genuine learning can't be touched off by grading.</MI2> <SI2>Genuine learning means raising ability to understand concepts and apply them to real life. <TR>However</TR>, grading encourages students to be hard for upgrading their scores, which causes not understanding concepts but just remembering. <TR>For instance</TR>, most Korean students just remember what they learn in school to get higher grades because remembering is more easier way to understand. <TR>Therefore</TR>, there are no novel prized person in Korea.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I strongly disagree that grading makes students learn because it touch off stress which hinders students to learn and prevents students from genuine learning.</CO>
column23: This is a weak essay. The student doesn't really support his/her argument well, and some of their sentences sound very strange and confusing.

column1: 636& It is necessary to understand the past to solve the problems of the present and future.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think it is necessary to understand the past to solve the probems of the present and future for few reasons : to learn from the past for better development, and to have broader view and perspectives.</TS></IN>
     
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is necessary to study and understand the past for the better development.</MI1> <SI1>We need to learn from the past, clarify the problems to solve and improve, and also keep up the good points and advantages. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, we are able to learn how people lived in ancient time. We, people, slowly improved our life style by fixing things that are inappropriate, difficult to manage, <TR>for example</TR>, people started using forks and spoons after trying eating with their hands. We also continued behaviors that are appropriate for us, <TR>for example</TR>, we are continuously making houses and shelters to live in.</EX> <TR>This shows that</TR> we learnt from the past and there is possibility for us to develop better in the present and future.</SI1></BO1>
     
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, it is important to know the past to have broader view and perspectives.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This means that</TR> we can know the others after knowing ourselves. To show and introduce us, people of a nation, we are required to know the other side's situation and history. <TR>Theses</TR> days, there are often problems occur when there are misunderstanding between the countries. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if we are living in Asia and do not know about the other side of the world, west, there can be conflicts occuring from the differences that each other do not know. If we are able to learn about the west's past, how they lived and their perspectives it will be much easier to understand them, broading one's view to look at the world.</EX></SI2></BO2>
     
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, for the better development of present and future, and to broaden one's view and perspectives, it is necessary to understand the past .</CO>
column23: The student who wrote this essay overuses transitional words and phrases. Additionally, their arguement needs a lot more support to make it convincing.

column1: 637&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Preparing food has become very easy. Frozen foods that can be bought at supermarkets and only need to be heated up to be eaten. There are powders that requires only water before is it cooked to produce soup or cake. These are great changes from the past, when raw ingredients had to go through numerous steps, of washing, cutting, mixing, cooking, etc. <TS>People's living style has significantly benefited from this shift in the way of preparing food, for it does not require good cooking skills, and also give them more time to do other tasks.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, these new methods of making food allows people who cannot cook very well make tasty food.</MI1> <SI1>All one needs to do to make these foods are heating it, adding a cup of water or an egg if necessary. This does not need skills, and will still produce delicious food. <EX>My mother, <TR>for example</TR>,  could not bake good cakes. She tried multiple times, but the product would have a mysterious taste. <TR>One day</TR>, she bought a packet of cake mix, that required an egg and water to be added, only. The result was a perfect chocolate cake, even though my mother still could not bake well.</EX></SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, it enables people to save time on cooking and do something more important at the time.</MI2> <SI2>Simply putting a dish inside a microwave, which would take 3 minutes at the most, takes significantly less time than cooking or eating out. This is crucial, <TR>as time is gold</TR>, especially to the people of modern society who are always busy. <EX><TR>A few weeks ago</TR>, when I was staying up late in the night writing an essay,I got extremely hungry. No one was awake to cook for me, <TR>however</TR>, and I could not waste my time fixing a snack for myself. <TR>Luckily</TR> I found a piece of frozen pizza in the fridge, heated it up, and filled my empty stomach. It took me less than five minutes to prepare it, and soon, I could get back to my task.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO>The easier ways of preparing food of today let terrible cooks to make good food, and help people save time. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> the new method improved how people live.</CO>
column23: These is next to nothing wrong with this essay. The student has excellent grammar, and their essay is well structured.

column1: 638& Cars have had a greater effect on society than planes have.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that cars have affected society more profoundly than planes do. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, <TR>I think that</TR> planes have played a greater role in society than cars. <TR>This is because</TR> it is possible to go abroad by taking planes, and because it is faster than cars.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, taking planes is one of the most effective ways to travel overseas.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, it is impossible for cars to travel foreign countries across ocean. <TR>However</TR>, it can be done by planes; planes can fly over the ocean. <TR>Thus</TR>, it is more convenient for people to take planes to travel. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was a primary school student, my family and I planned to have a trip on America. <TR>Of course</TR>, we chose planes to travel because it is the fastest and most convenient way to get there. It was unable for us to ride a car because cars cannot pass the ocean, and South Korea is isolated by North Korea.</EX> <TR>This implies that</TR> planes have a more close relationship with citizens.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, planes have much faster speed than cars have.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is because</TR> cars usually face with serious traffic jams, which make cars not to move appropriately. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, Planes hardly have those kind of obstacles. <TR>Therefore</TR>, planes travel a lot faster on average. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, two years ago, I traveled from Busan to Seoul. If I took a car to get Seoul, I may have to spend about 8 hours. <TR>However</TR>, it was only needed to use an hour to get there. This help me to save my valuable time and to travel more easily.</EX> <TR>This example clearly demonstrates that</TR> plane is one of the most effective ways to travel.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, by taking planes, people can travel foreign countries more easily and faster. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I strongly think that</TR> planes have had a more significant impact on society than cars have.</CO>
column23: This student could use more varied sentence structure, but they stick to the topic well and make a strong argument.

column1: 639&Do you agree or disagree? Technology has made the world a better place to live.
column3:
<IN>There are some people who maintain that people can live in better world due to development of technology. <TR>However</TR>, others don't. <TS><TR>I strongly agree that</TR> development of technology makes human life more flourish, because technology reduces people's working time and makes one's life convenient.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people can reduce their working time using technology.</MI1> <SI1>Several computer programs are developed and make one's vexing works simple. <TR>Also</TR>, cleaning robots and washing machines are useful to reduce women's chores. <TR>With these development of technology</TR>, people can save their time and take more relax using saved time. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my grandmother was suffered from hard chores, so she didn't have any relaxing time. <TR>However</TR>, my mother could afford both doing chores and enjoying her own life.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, technology makes our life more convenient.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In the past</TR>, people should go to someone's house to communicate him or her. <TR>However</TR>, people can communicate each other easily via e-mail or phone calls in these days. <TR>Also</TR>, people don't have to be in trouble at night because of lack of light any more as light bulb invented. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my grandfather had trouble in studying at night because there are no light bulb but only candles exited in the past. <TR>However</TR>, I can use light bulb whenever I want.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, <TR>I strongly asserts that</TR> technology takes key role to make better place to live because people can enjoy time for relaxing rather than working and convenient life compared to past.</CO>
column23: This essay starts with a good thesis statement, which is well supported with personal examples.

column1: 640&With the help of the Internet, students can learn more effectively.
column3:
<IN>Thanks to the advent of the Internet, the life of people came to be more convenient and efficient. They can find the information whatever they want easily in any place where the Internet is accessible. <TS><TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> students can be helped by the Internet as well. <TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> the Internet surely can help students study more effieciently. <TR>This is because</TR> they can easily find the information that they want.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, students can access to the information that they want easily and quickly.</MI1> <SI1>If a student find problems he or she don't know while studying, he or she may need some source that he or she can find the information to solve problems. <TR>In the old days</TR>, the source was used to be a library, but getting information from there takes time. But after the advent of the Internet, the student can get the information easily and quickly. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, if I have words that I don't know while I am studying english, I can readily find the meaning of those easily with my lap top. I do not have to go to a library to go over a dictionary to find those words.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, students can learn cheaper through the Internet.</MI2> <SI2>The Internet provides the information freely. Although there are the information that costs, it is restricted only to the high-level information which is rarely used. Without the Internet, students should buy books or attend a school to learn. <TR>Even though</TR> today's students buy books and go school to study, it cost less that the time when student should do those without the Internet. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, students in the old days should buy all the books they need. <TR>However</TR> students today, don not need to buy all the books in order to study, because they can get information on the Internet.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, students can get the information easily and freely, because of features of the Internet. <TR>In this regard</TR> <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> the Internet helps students study more efficiently.</CO>
column23: This student makes some errors with verb conjugations, but overall, the essay makes a good argument  and has good examples to support that argument.

column1:
641&People study in college or university for many different reasons.
why do you think peope attend college or university?
column3:
<IN>The number of going to college or university is increasing in all over the world.
What are the factors that make people do that?</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all, in my opinion</TR>, the most important reason is to gain competence than others.</MI1>
<SI1><TR>Long ago</TR>, almost everyone can’t afford to go to university or college. <TR>That time</TR>, it is normal that go to factory to earn money instead of going to college or university. <TR>So</TR>, everyone can get a good after graduated to high school or even middle school.
<TR>On the contrary</TR>, <TR>nowadays</TR>, most of the people attend college or university. That’s the normal
sequence today. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it’s impossible to get a good job without degree.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, college or university can be providing a fundamental component in our future vocation.
<TR>Because</TR>, it is consist of people, knowledge and location so on.</MI2>
Just look at the people, when we meet the people, we can get a different concept, ideas and their own experiences. We can expand our thinking and experience to help in future life. <TR>Without these resources</TR>, we can’t achieve we want. <TR>Because of that</TR>, college and university is not choice anymore, it is becoming definitely necessary in our life.</BO2>
 
<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, educated in university or college can be help to boost skills.</MI3>
<EX><TR>For example</TR>, there is person who got a interest in mechanics. <TR>Even though</TR> he got a simple skill to fix machine, he doesn’t understand how machines operate inside without knowledge of mechanics.
when he get a profound that knowledge then his career progress is limitless.</BO3>
 
<CO><TR>Overall</TR>, there are different reasons in each person to go college or university. <TR>But I believe that</TR> it is natural desire to human to advance their potential. <TR>So</TR> more and more people up to go university now.</CO>
column23: This essay has no discernable thesis, which is a major error. Also, the student makes major grammatical errors, showing that (s)he is not very proficient in English.

column1: 642&Young children should be required to learn art and music.
column3:
<IN>Most Korean parents encourage their children to learn art and music, and so did my parents. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I think they should not be required to learn art and music. <TR>This is because</TR> they should do what they want to do and they will voluntarily learn art and music if they find those interesting.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, children should do what they prefer to do.</MI1> <SI1>Some children may want to play sports, and others may prefer reading a book. <TR>In this case</TR>, they should be let free and the only thing what their parents can do is the encouraging what they are interested in. <TR>In other words</TR>, children who would like to play soccer should be encouraged to play soccer, not leaning art or music. <TR>In addtion</TR> this way can improve their talent more efficiently. <EX><TR>Once</TR>, I have read the newpaper article which stated that children can do better if they are encouraged to do what they want than others who just required to do specific activities. <TR>From this article</TR>, we can find out how doing what children want is important.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, they will learn art and music voluntarily when they feel that those are interesting.</MI2> <SI2>Children don't want to be required to do some activity, even if it is what they are interested in. They just don't like the atmosphere of being forced. <TR>Likewise</TR>, although children show their interest in art and music, they shouldn't be imposed to do those, but let them free to find out how learning those are interesting. <TR>If they find out</TR>, they will learn those spontaneously. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, I didn't want to learn art and music. I didn't know why I hated to learn it since now I am very interested in art and music. <TR>But come to think of it</TR>, what I didn't like to do was not learning art and music itself, but the situation which I had to learn those. For now I love to learn art and music but if someone force me to learn those, I will not likely to learn.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, children should be encouraged what they want to do, because this is more effective. <TR>In addtion</TR>, children will learn art and musci by themselves when they find out how intereting those are. <TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> children should not be required to learn art and music.</CO>
column23: What struck me most in this essay was the student's sometimes awkward and erroneous use of vocabulary and grammar- I think it's the weakest aspect of the essay. The student has a clear opinion, but a few more examples to support it would be nice.

column1: 643&Face to face communication is better than letter, e-mail, phone.
column3:
<IN>In a busy routine life, the thought has been accepted that it is more advantageous to use non-facial communication than face to face communication. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, I can't agree with the assertion for several reasons related with essential of communication.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, <TR>at the point of essential view</TR>, communication should turn stranger into acquaintance.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To put it another way</TR>, it can break the ice and can make it possible to reduce awkward relationship. <TR>And then</TR>, it can be possible not through non-facial communication , but through face to face communication. With the help of facial talk, we share sorrow, concerns, happiness with all our heart. <TR>In the course of the empathy</TR>, we spontaneously build trust and can be distracted from burden of life.<EX><TR> According to research conducted by Seoul National University</TR>, those who persistently maintain personal relationship through the facial  communication have a more familiar connections with people than those who mostly depend on non-facial-system. <TR>It means that</TR> the facial-relationship enhences the quality of life.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>The second reason is that</TR> facial communication doesn‘t cause ambiguous of meaning, which often cause conflict in the middle of dialogue.</MI2> <SI2>When we talk with others, we stare at his eyes, hear his tone of voice and see his gesture. <TR>After gathering the signals from him</TR>, we can catch the implied meaning. <TR>However</TR>, if we communicate with others through letter or e-mail or phone, we inevitably use only one sense or imperfect sense. <EX><TR>According to the investigation conducted by Harvard University in 2011</TR>, it show us amazing fact- the more people use their sense in talk, the more they understand the hidden meaning. <TR>It imply that</TR> when we have facial connections, we escape from imperfect and obscure meanings.</EX></SI2></BO2>

 <CO><TR>All thing considered</TR>, facial talk have a more evitable role in communication than non facial connection. <TR>First</TR> facial relationship can break ice easily. <TR>Second</TR>, the relationship also make it possible to deliver implied meanings. <TR>So I strongly recommand that</TR> people had better use face to face communication than non-facial-connection</CO>
column23: The thesis statement makes and argument, but that argument is not elaborated upon enough. Also, I noticed that the student uses articles where they aren't needed at times, as well as sometimes omitting them where they are required.

column1: 644&All University students should be required to take basic science courses.
column3:
<IN><TR>When I became a college student two years ago</TR>, I was thrilled to know that I needed not take science courses, as I had no interest in science. <TR>However</TR>, many people nowadays argue that all university students should be required to take science courses compulsorily. They think basic science knowledge is indispensable to people of the modern society. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this argument, because students already learn much knowledge about science before entering college and the purpose of university is to encourage students to concentrate on what they are good at.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, students take enough science classes in their middle and high school age.</MI1> <SI1><TR>By taking these courses</TR>, students already know lots of basic science knowledge and information, from the field of earth science to physics and chemistry. <TR>Due to these education</TR>, many students are familiar with basic principles of science and use them in a daily life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I learnt what kinds of ingredients vegetables have. <TR>Thus</TR>, when I shop around, I can choose which vegetables are best suit to my conditions. Knowing further is unnecessary because it is useless and easy to forget.</EX> The more complicating and specialized the science knowledge become, the less ordinary students are likely to remember or use this.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the college should focus on finding out and building up each student's own strong point.</MI2> <SI2><TR>To put it in another way</TR>, it is better for university to encourage students to take subjects which they like as well as are good at. This is the primary purpose of university, <TR>that is</TR>, helping students become a specialist on their own field. To achieve this goal, concentrating on specific subjects is required. <EX><TR>One famous professor says</TR>, 'Four-years in college is not enough to study deeply, even if students choose just one field.' <TR>It shows why</TR> university should not make students take basic science classes.</EX> <TR>Of course</TR>, some students will pursue their dream to become a scientist or researcher and they have to cultivate science knowledge, taking related classes. <TR>However</TR>, others have a right to focus on another field. More efficiency will be achieved by taking selective courses. It is a win-win strategy, as students can learn what they really like to do, and university can have special graduates.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, 'one-size-fit-all' approach toward college education is a bad idea. Making all students take basic science class is no difference with this approach, as it limits freedom of students and not effective as well. <TR>Therefore</TR>, all university  should not demand their students to take basic science courses.</CO>
column23: This student shows that (s)he has a strong command of English through his/her nearly-perfect grammar and varied vocabulary. The argument presented in the thesis is very well-supported, also.

column1: 645&Friends are the most important influence on young adults.
column3:
<IN>My grand mother always says that I should make good friends, because they affect me a lot. I couldn't understand what it means at first, but when I was an adolescent, I got to realize how friends influnce teenagers a lot . <TS><TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>I agree with the statement that</TR> friends are the most important factor that influence young adults. <TR>This is because</TR> they are susceptible to be affected by their friends and friends mean a lot to teenagers.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, adolescents are vulnerable to be influenced by their friends a lot.</MI1> <SI1>Although they physically look like an adult, they are not mentally matured. <TR>That is</TR>, they are easy to be affected by their circumstance, especially their friends. <TR>Moreover</TR>, young adults' characteristic is even decided by their friends. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, <TR>when I was a young boy</TR>, there was a friend of mine who was nice and kind. <TR>However</TR>, after getting along with the group of bad friends, his words began to turn to coarse and indecent words. <TR>At that time</TR>, I was surprised that how friends can turn one's overall personality like this. I had no choice but to left him, because I didn't want to be affected by him and his friends, <TR>and this shows how</TR> an adolescent are easy to be affected by their friends.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, for teenagers, friends mean a lot to them.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is because</TR> they are undergoing delicate and comlicate emotional changes, and they used to get depressed by this experience. <TR>Thus</TR>, they tend to rely on someone such as their friends. Although they have their family, family members can't understand and help them as much as their friends can. <EX><TR>Actually</TR>, when I read the report which was about inspecting factors that influence young adults a lot, I got to realize that how friends are the most important factor among any other factors such as family or teachers, and this shows how friends means a lot to them.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, adolescents are vulnerable to be influenced by their friends, since they are not mentally matured, and their friends even decide one's personality. <TR>In adition</TR>, they used to depend on their friends, so friends mean a lot to teenagers. <TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> friends are the top factor which has influence on young adults.</CO>
column23: One of the problems I found was this essay was the student's tendency to write sentences that would border on being run-ons- they weren't quite too long, but they would have been better if they were broken down or at least better organized. The structure of the essay, however, allows for fairly smooth progression from one idea to the next.

column1: 646&The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong.
column3:
<IN><TR>Of course</TR> many people often get unwanted outputs when they chose immenent choices in their lives. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I don't believe decisions made in that way is useless. <TR>Rather</TR>, I believe these flickering choices sometimes became invaluable in our lives.</TS></IN>
 
 <BO1><MI1>Humans brain has subconscious sites for these decisions.</MI1> <SI1><TR>That means</TR>, we are made to make a choice for an emergency. If the site didn't exist, human beings couldn't survive during so many situations though many harsh ages. <TR>That explains that</TR> we need to decide something when the time is not enough.</SI1></BO1>
 
 <BO2><MI2><TR>Even if we are not in an emergency</TR>, flickering decisions can help whether to decide as a method. I call it speed decision method.</MI2> <SI2>Many leaders around the world uses this method. <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, We usually encounter a situation that we have to choose between two selections. Consider we had two job offers and we have to decide in a month. There are enough time to consider and compare which offers, conditions, welfares are better. <TR>In fact</TR>, most of them are not compard by thinking. <TR>Because</TR> we never know what happen to us in the future.</SI2></BO2>
 
 <CO><TR>In that situation</TR>, I will follow the principle. What body knows are the best we knows. We are not made to decide always carefully, or even correctly. Quick decisions are not always wrong. It can make us win each lives.</CO>
column23: This student doesn't quite address the topic, at times more discussing why people sometimes make decisions quickly instead of whether or not that quick decision-making is a bad thing. In addition, their argument is under-supported.

column1: 647&Television advertising diredted toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that it is no harm to young children letting watch television advertisement. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, people should not allow their children to watch television advertisement.
<TR>This is because</TR> it may lead serious injure even death. It could be also waste of money to make them happy for their greediness.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, children of the young aged group easily misunderstand the statement from the advertisements.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, young aged group could simply follow what the advertisements showed them.<TR> Therefore</TR>, they think it really works. <EX><TR>According to news reports</TR>, one young child watched advertisement of super hero suit, and he thought if he wears it he will gain power like super heroes. <TR>Therefore</TR>, he wore and jumped from the roof. <TR>In the end</TR>, he injured his body.</EX><SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, young children are easily attracted by the surroundings.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Hence</TR>, they ask their parents to buy them what they are willing to have. <TR>When this situation continued</TR>, they are simply bored with an object they have. <TR>Nowadays</TR> many parents buy everything which their children want. <TR>However</TR>, when they got bored with it , they simply throw it away. <TR>In fact</TR>, this is a great loss. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was young, I had bought a lot of stuffs from television shopping. <TR>After a while</TR>, I lost interest about them <TR>hence</TR>, I threw them away. From this experiment I realized how the young aged groups are easily attracted by the media.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, under the age of five could easily attract, lead to waste of money and serious injury. <TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>I agree with the statement that</TR> television advertising to children under the age of five should be prevented until they are grown up when they could able to identify and understand.</CO>
column23: This student has a good point to make, but his/her faulty grammar and misuse of vocabulary holds him/her back. The essay is well-organized, but is bogged down by too many transitional words and phrases.

column1: 648&Can the chimpanzees communicate like humans do?
column3:
<IN>Both the reading passage and the lecturer deal with the topic if the chimpanzees have linguistic abilities just like the humans do. <TS>The writer claims that chimpanzees do have excellent linguistic abilities just like humans have based on several examples. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, the lecturer disagree with the writer's opinion.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost</TR>, the writer argues that  the chimpanzees have a great linguistic abilities on the grounds that there is a research which shows chimpanzees have memorized and learned new symbols.</MI1> <TR>However</TR>, the lecturer counters the writer's argument. The research was not reliable because the researchers gave chimpanzees treats and the lecturer believes the chimpanzees reactions are conditional responses. The lecturer argues that the chimpanzee's behavior is merely an result from an repeated training</BO1>. 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, The writer claims that chimpanzees have oral skills because they do make meaningful sounds.</MI2> <TR>Based on the examples the writer suggested</TR>, the chimpanzees made different sounds when the researchers had changed the pictures they have. <TR>However</TR>, the lecturer contradict this argument as the chimpanzees don't have developed sound organs like the humans. </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, the writer explains that the chimpanzees have highly developed linguistic abilities because they have enough abilities to combine symbols to make sentences.</MI3> <TR>However</TR>, the lecturer disagree with the writer's claim. The writer do agree that the chimpanzees can make basic sentences, <TR>however</TR>, they don't have enough abilities to form sentences with complex structure and great length. <TR>Moreover</TR>, the writer explains that the chimpanzees make errors frequently when they were forming sentences.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay is extremely weak, as it simply offers a summary of the differing opinions in a reading instead of critically engaging the content of the readings. This leads to the rest of the essay being weak, more of a summary than an argument.

column1: 649&Friends are the most important influence on young adults.
column3:
<IN>My grandmother always says that friends are very important since they affect me a lot. <TR>When I was a little boy</TR>, I couldn't understand what it means, but when I was a young adult I got to know that why friends are important. <TS><TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>I agree with the statement that</TR> friends are the most important influence on young adults. <TR>This is because</TR> young adults are easy to be affected by their friends and in that age, a friend means lot to them.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, They are easy to be influenced by their friends.</MI1> <SI1>Although a young adult looks like an adult, they are not matured mentally. <TR>Therefore</TR>, they are affected by numerous factors such as their family, school, environment and especially friends. If a young adult get along with bad friends, they can be influenced by bad factors. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, there was one friend of mine who was nice and kind, but after getting along with some bad friends, he began to follow their behavior and speak. He often talked about coarse subject matters by using shoddy words. <TR>After that</TR>, I came to realize that how friends affect someone a lot.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, for young adults, friends mean a lot to them.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Since</TR> they undergo the most important times and experience emotionally complicate afflictions, they are easy to be depressed. <TR>Thus</TR>, they often resort to their friends rather than their family. <TR>In this regard</TR>, friends mean a lot to them. <EX><TR>According to one report which investigated about factors that is the most important to young adults</TR>, most young adults said that their friends are the most important to them, <TR>because</TR> friends are reliable and understand them well. This report show how friends have important meaning to young adults.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, young adults are well influenced by their friends, <TR>and sometime</TR> friends even determine one's characteristic. <TR>In addition</TR>, since they are so emotionally delicate that they tend to rely on their friends often. <TR>Therefore</TR>, their friends have a lot of meaning to them. <TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> friends are the most important factor that influence young adults.</CO>
column23: This student wrote a generally solid essay, with a good structure and argument, but there are some strangely phrased sentences and oddly used vocabulary words that make the essay sound a bit awkward at times.

column1: 650&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teachers should be required to update their knowledge every five years. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>I totally agree that</TR> teachers need to update their knowledge every five years for two reasons. <TR>One</TR>, teachers are able to get useful skills to deal with their students from recently updated knowledge. <TR>Two</TR>, their teaching must give latest information to their students beyond the old-jaded textbooks.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, teachers can get valuable tips to make polished school life.</MI1> <SI1>Becoming a good teacher requires to manage whole of students and their life. Over a 10 million thesis in the education field has introduced to academy, including the way to deal with school bullying, and juvenile delinquents.  <TR>This means that</TR> all Students-Guider can study about latest methodology to apply their school. It will helps the teachers to train skills to obliterate school-based social problems. <TR>Therefore</TR>, requiring teachers to update their knowledge is necessary to make good school.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, teachers have a duty to give cutting-edge information of its field.</MI2> <SI2>Some people can argue that teachers are pass the state certification test in order to obtain license to teach, and it proves that test-passer are the expert of their field. <TR>But</TR> It doesn't mean that they are hipped on the latest updated information in their assumed subject. They cannot constantly accepted flows of newly updated news. Instructor have to understand about its information and gives to student beyond chunky textbooks. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, one of Giant IT companies are working to make smart-glasses like on the SF movies. Students who study Technology cannot study such a thing based on a 10-years-old textbooks. Instructor always has to hipped such a latest news and give to their students.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Teachers are certificate education experts who can teach and lead the students smoothly. If they tries to update their knowledge regularly, They might give great school life and learning to their students. </CO>
column23: This essay suffers greatly from misused vocabulary and grammatical errors, which make the essay hard to read at times.

column1: 651&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space. Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TR>Since the Industrial Revolution</TR>, people all over the world have been searching for and utilizing energy resources that can satisfy their needs through developing technology.  <TR>To add</TR>, as resource depletion is currently one of the most serious issues in the world, it is essential to find the foremost way to resolve the predicament. <TS><TR>In this sense</TR>, it is vital for governments to use their budgets for discovering outer space because of these following reasons: obtaining unknown and effective natural resources and offering job opportunity.</TS></IN>
            
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, through exploring and excavating other planets in the universe, people can achieve raw materials that can fulfill people’s necessities in generating energy.</MI1> <SI1>Through launching space shuttles to search for abundant amount of rare and effective materials planted in other space planets, people can resolve the problem of lacking of natural resources on Earth, and thus, generating more energy. <EX>A research conducted by RMDC (Raw Material Data Center in New York) in 2009 clearly supports this point. The institution cooperated with National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) since 2004 to 2009 to obtain some information about the resources in outer space. <TR>As far as they know</TR>, through NASA’s exploration so called asteroid mining, there are many minerals and volatiles such as Deuronum that do not exist on Earth. Those kinds of resources have much greater efficiency in generating energy, <TR>and amazingly</TR>, it is really easy to excavate them if with enough supports and money. <TR>Thus</TR>, having a government to subsidize and support outer space industry, a nation would generate great amount of energy with numerous natural resources.</EX></SI1></BO1>
            
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, there will be more opportunities for people to be employed as space field expands.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, a lot of people are suffering from unemployment phenomenon. <TR>However</TR>, by simply using a government’s budget on developments in universe, more jobs would be produced. <EX>Paul Garnet, an American future forecast expert, stated that in the future, more careers would likely to be created due to lessen people’s burden in getting jobs. <TR>To add</TR>, the most predictable occupations are related to space industry because it contains much potential that can lead the future economy. <TR>He also mentioned that</TR> current predicaments including joblessness can be resolved through funding outer space business. To rebut skeptics’ doubts that this is only a hypothesis, he provided the statistic of people who are engaged in space industry. <TR>According to the statistic</TR>, more than 760,000 people are recently having jobs that are related to outer space only in Northern America. <TR>This means that</TR> if governments aid in developing space facilities, more jobs will be available to people. <TR>Hence</TR>, problems of job loss will be solved by increased number of jobs linked with outer space.</EX></SI2></BO2>
            
<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, governments’ subsidies in exploring outer space are really essential. <TR>First</TR>, it can help generating abundant energy by mining ample of natural resources in planets in galaxy. <TR>Also</TR>, it can provide many careers to people due to its affect in the upcoming economy. <TR>Thus</TR>, people would live in better world if a government spends its money on developing outer space facilities.</CO>
column23: This is a well-written essay, with a good thesis and argument. The weakest part of the essay is the student's occasional unusual usage of certain words and grammatical structures.

column1: 652&One of the best ways that parents help their children prepare for an adult life is to encourage them to do a part-time job.
column3:
<IN>Parents can help their children to prepare for an adult life in many different ways such as assigning house chores, encouraging them to keep a pet. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>for several reasons</TR>, <TR>i believe that</TR> having a part-time job is the best way for children to prepare an life as an adult.</TS></IN>
   
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, children can acquire social skills from a part-time job experience.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, by having a part-time job, children can practice their communication skills, punctuality, sense of responsibility and all of them are extremely important elements for grown-up men. <EX><TR>To borrow from my experience</TR>, <TR>back in high school</TR>, I was quite shy and passive student and some teachers had worried about my sociality. After i graduated from high school, i got a part-time job as an sales associate at an clothing store. <TR>While I was working there</TR>, I had to meet new people every day and need to talk with clients constantly. <TR>Naturally</TR> I became talkative and active person. If it had not been for the part-time job, i would not have improved my communication skills.</EX></SI1></BO1>
     
<BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore</TR>, children can find a their future career by experiencing a variety of jobs.</MI2> <SI2>Children can get hands-on experience as well as obtain practical skills from their part-time job. <TR>Needless to say</TR>, those are better way to children to get ready for adult life than reading a textbook and memorizing complex formula. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, tom, who is one of my oldest friend, had a part-time job at a renowned bakery. <TR>At first</TR>, he took this job to make some money for the rent, <TR>however</TR>, he found that his love and passion for baking. <TR>By working there</TR>, he could learn not only baking skills from one of the best patissier in south korea, but also business part of running bakery. <TR>So</TR>, <TR>it is no exaggeration to say that</TR> my friend found his dream job from a part-time job. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I am confident that lots of students can decide their future career based on their part-time job experience.</EX></SI2></BO2>
     
<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, having a part-time can allow children to prepare for adult life most of all on the grounds that students can acquire social skills while working, and can get practical advice to plan their future career. <TR>It is true that</TR> there are various ways to get children ready for adult life, but those cannot exceed the benefits of part-time working experience.</CO>
column23: I dislike the student's thesis statement because it does not tell what exactly the student will discuss in the rest of the essay; it just takes a side on the prompt issue. What I do like is how well the student incorporates personal examples into the argument.

column1: 653&univerisity should spend as much money on sports as they do on libraries
column3:
<IN>an intriguing topic of discussion at hand is whether univerisity should spend as much money on sports as they do on libraries. The answer to this question can vary greatly depending on the individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, <TR>the jury may still be out</TR>, <TR>but as far as I am concerned</TR>, <TR>I agree with the statement</TR>. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I wi present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, sports can improve students' ability in mind in respect of mental sphere.</MI1> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in many studies conducted by the National Research of Korea</TR>, it is found that working regulary on a daily basis actually can improve students' performance at university and that can increase intellectual quotient instantly. <TR>also</TR>, as the old saying goes, a sound mind in a sound body.</EX></BO1>
  
<BO2><MI2><TR>secondly</TR>, sports promote students' physical health.</MI2> <SI2>not only is a book important for our intellectual growth, but also a exercising for that of body. the fitness can severly affect a student to do well at the college. Suppose a hypothetical situation that a person with an exhausted physical condition should prepare several exams, <TR>as we all know</TR>, he or she will hardly concentrate on study for exams.
<TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>it is evident that</TR> university should spend much money on sports as well as on libraries.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of the two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again</TR>, <TR>although the verdict may still be out</TR>, I personally believe that two of my rationales above are sufficiently convincing enough to represent the viewpoints of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim.</CO>
column23: This student's writing is mechanical and rehearsed, like so many other essays. It repeats the same opening and closing lines with the same extraneous fluff and overuse of transitional words/phrases, and the thesis statement in incredibly vague and doesn't even properly state its position.

column1: 654&Children should play sports for fun rather than for competition.
column3:
<IN>Many children in the world love to play any sports such as soccer, basketball or baseball. <TR>Sometimes</TR> they just play it for fun, <TR>but in another case</TR> they play it for competition. They might have some reason for the purpose of playing sports. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I think sports should be played for their each purpose. <TR>That is</TR>, some children who want to play sports for fun should play it for fun, and sports can also be played for the purpose of competition by children who want to play it for professional reason. <TR>This is because</TR> either way of it is helpful to each of them, if the purpose of playing sports is fit to their will, and this way will be more efficient.</TS></IN>
 
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, whether children play sports for either fun or competition, it will be more helpful if the purpose fits to their purpose.</MI1> <SI1>Children who want to play sports just for fun, would like to play it for their happiness or the cooperation with their friends. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those who want to play sports for competition, would like to play it for their professional career. <TR>That is</TR>, just let children play sports for their purpose, so that they can play it freely. <EX>I read the newpaper article states that just letting children play for their own purpose is more helpful than restricting them to play it for one purpose which is opressed by others. <TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>I believe that</TR> the goal why children want to play sports is more important.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, letting children to play sports for any purpose is more effiecient.</MI2> <SI2>Most children want to do something they like, and there will be no children who do their work that they don' like. This principle is act as same in case of playing sports. If people - especially their parents - let children who want to play sports just for fun, they will be more happy and can get along with their friend more friendly. And same thing is likely to happened to children who want to play it for competition. The most important this is this system brings more efficiency than another such as forcing children to play sports against their will. <EX>One statistic has shown that children who want to play sports for the purpose which fits their will shows more enhancement, either in sports or study. <TR>This shows how</TR> fitting their purpose on their will is important for increasing their efficiency.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, fitting children's purpose of playing sports on their will is more important than just insisting that one purpose is more important than the other. <TR>In addition</TR>, this method is more efficient for children. <TR>Therefore</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> children should play sports at their will. <TR>In other words</TR>, choosing the purpose between one of two is not a debatable subject.</CO>
column23: The largest issues in this essay are grammatical errors and vocabulary errors that result in awkward sentences and phrases. Otherwise, the student generally does a good job explaining his/her position.

column1: 655&The government should pay more attention to health care issues than environmental issues.
column3:
<IN><TS>Judging from the two concerns – healthcare issue and environmental issue- both seems to have major consequences on contemporary lives and deserve attention. <TR>For environment</TR>, we are facing the risk of global warming, air and water pollution, <TR>but</TR> the healthcare issue also spans the problem of diseases or other causes of death. <TR>As jury may be out there</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> environmental issue should be a foremost concern of government.</TS></IN>
     
<BO1>Environmental issue is an imminent problem that determines our physical life.Fresh air allows us to breathe in oxygen for sustaining life, and the health of many living things determine health of human beings. <MI1>Air and water pollution should be addressed immediately because it directly affects the very existence of our life.</MI1> <SI1>Water pollutant contained in drinking water poses great danger to our health and should be addressed by controlling  waste disposal. <EX><TR>It is observed that</TR> air holds much more carbon dioxide than oxygen which needs sequestration of carbon dioxide and establishing green environment. Global warming raises the temperature on earth to endanger the lives of human and many other species.</EX></BO1>
      
<BO2><MI2>Healthcare issue is not as important as other issues because medical care have extended its effect across the globe.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>Thanks to the discovery of penicillin</TR>, medical care has immensely developed to save millions of lives from the harmful effect of unknown disease.</EX> <EX>The average life span was also raised highly that there are higher proportion of the old than the young.</EX> <EX><TR>Due to the implementation of Medicare</TR>, a healthcare service for 60 older- many old, diseased people can survive and the average life span is continuously increasing.</EX> Despite rooms for improvement, medical industry has achieved greater development than in the past. There is no more disease that is fatal and incurable than cancer and AIDs. Healthcare issues is all about extending healthcare service to more people which is not first priority of government. Many people are already benefiting from medical services.</SI2></BO2>
      
<CO>Multifaceted analysis of environmental issue and healthcare issue makes the government hard to determine to draw a line between the investment in two areas. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>to me</TR>, healthcare issue is secondary to environmental problems because protecting the environment affects our lives directly. Water and air pollution will threaten our lives if not properly addressed. Global warming would exert great influence on the coexistence of many species. <TR>Although important</TR>, extending healthcare to many people is secondary requirement since medical research has improved our health tremendously. <TR>All considered</TR>, government should pay more attention to healthcare issues than environmental issues,
column23: This student's thesis statement is very weak, simply taking a position without introducing any of the rest of the argument. In addition, the student has problems with subject-verb agreement.

column1: 656&The government should pay more attention to health care issues than environmental issues.
column3:
<IN><TS>Some people argue that the government should focus more on health care problems, and others insist that they should concentrate more on environmental matters. <TR>As far as I'm concerned</TR>, I'd like to voice my opinion related to former one. <TR>This is because</TR> medical service is getting to be more expensive now, and numerous unknown deseases are increasing today.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, medical service is too expensive to take advantage of.</MI1> <SI1>As medical technology evolves, so as the cost of medical service rises, too. The cost of medical intruments and medicaments are rising today. <TR>Therefore</TR>, individuals, especially who are too busy to make their ends meet, are very hard to pay for that expensive medical attention. <EX>When I saw a newpaper article which stated that most people give up to see a doctor due to the high cost of the medical treatment, I felt this problem is very deperate. <TR>So</TR>, the government should pay attention to this problem rather than caring for other problems.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, there are tons of unknown deseases in the world today.</MI2> <SI2>More and more unfamiliar deseases are generated even in this moment. Although many researchers are trying their best to find and cure the new illnesses, there is a restrition to do that. That is just the lack of infrastructure which include personnels and facilities, and the financial aid. Those problems are matters that can be dealt by the government, but only those who don't know this fact is just the government itself. <EX><TR>According to many articles from newspapers</TR>, it seems that the government is only intereted in their position and their personal goal. <TR>So</TR> they should turn their eyes on the real problem, <TR>say</TR>, the perilous and real situation of the emerging deseases.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, although medical technology is developed, this world is still not safe from deseases. We still have a problem about the rising cost of medical service and the danger of the emerging desease. <TR>In this sense</TR>, <TR>i firmly believe that</TR> the government should invest more on health problems.</CO>
column23: The student makes some errors with subject-verb agreement, and with noun-pronoun agreement. However, (s)he explains his/her viewpoint well.

column1: 657&Some people prefer to cook at home. Other people prefer to eat out. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Eating food has become a crucial part of our life. Individuals could not survive unless they absorb enough nutrients from food no matter who he is. <TS>Almost all of the people decide to cook themselves at home, <TR>however</TR> <TR>if I were them</TR>, I would head to famous restaurant near my home. There are several grounds why I prefer to eat outside instead of eating food at home comfortably.</TS></IN>
