<BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost</TR>, we could save our time and effort since we do not have cook food by ourselves.</MI1> <EX><TR>According to the statics</TR>, individuals generally cook food for 40 minutes but spending this amount of time could be detrimental for some people, since they are so busy that they do not have enough time.</EX> <TR>What is more</TR>, cooking could be extremely nuisance for some people. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my family often goes to the restaurant due to the fact that my mother and father do not have enough time to cook, and they think that cooking is extremely annoying to them.</EX> This perfect example illustrates that why I prefer to eat out.</BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, individuals could broaden their social network by talking with other people who spend their time eating outside.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the contrary</TR>, in the event that we cook at home ourselves, we do not even have an opportunity to talk to other people. <EX><TR>What is more</TR>, <TR>according to the Harvard University</TR>, 20 percent of friends originally met in restaurant fortuitously.</EX> <EX><TR>As an illustration</TR>, I met my girlfriend at restaurant accidently. She had worked restaurant for 4 years as a waiter. She recommended that I try to eat other appetizing food. <TR>Hence</TR>, we contacted each other and she became an enormous part of my life.</EX> This illustration shows why I love eating outside.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, even though there are a large number of individuals allege that cooking at home is much beneficial and practical than eating food outside, I still disagree with them by these two opinions which are mentioned in my essay. Not only we could save a great deal of time and efforts, but we also could widen our social net work by eating outside.</CO>
column23: While this student starts with a very weak thesis statement, (s)he later gives some very good supports for his/her argument. Also, the essay is structured well, in a way that reads very easily and fluidly.

column1: 658&Today, life is easier and cozier than it was when our grandparents were young.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that today's life is much easier and more convenient than before. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, <TR>I strongly think that</TR> life became more complex and complicated. <TR>This is because</TR> today's society became more competitive, and because abundant new technologies are being developed.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, there is more competitiveness among most of the people in society.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, as time passes, life becomes more and harder to live. <TR>Thus</TR>, people have turned out to be selfish and egocentric. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, <TR>in my school</TR>, most students do not want to share information and materials about study each other. They always keep secrets and be self-centered. Even though I had taught them some questions, they rarely repay back to me and even hide information that they know. <TR>Therefore</TR>, many people have to solely rely on themselves. <TR>As a result</TR>, it is more difficult to obtain materials.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, new technologies and machines are being developed relentlessly.</MI2> <SI2><TR>It means that</TR> people have to learn more new stuffs. <TR>Thus</TR>, life becomes more complicated. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my grandfather is not used to take subways. <TR>This is because</TR> most of the salespeople are replaced by machines. And he is not very good at controlling machines. If the new technology had not been introduced, he would have bought tickets conveniently.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, more and more competitiveness is present, and a large number of up-to-date technology is being introduced. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I strongly believe that</TR> life is more difficult than when our grandparents were young.</CO>
column23: This student has a good argument which (s)he supports with fairly strong examples, though it would be nice if (s)he used some examples that were applicable to people in general instead of just him/herself. Also, I found some errors with subject-verb agreement.

column1: 659&Physical exercise is more important for older people than for younger people.
column3:
<IN>It is debatable whether physical exercise is more crucial for elders than for younger people.
Some people say that old people have to do sports more over the young people. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I think that</TR> younger people need to do any physical exercise for two reasons. <TR>This is because</TR> doing exercises when someone's age is young, people can prepare their own health and will be more industrial.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To Begin with</TR>, exercise that is being done in childhood, it is possible to make someone more healthy life.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Moreover</TR>, it is true that  regular-physical exercise makes people someone who are not only strong, but also extend their life. <TR>While</TR>, If you starts exercise when you are old, it is not easy to start that because of weakness of muscle. <EX>the recent study by shown that the more doing physical exercise earlier, the lifespan is longer. this shown how important people do exercise early.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, physical exercise can makes people successful.</MI2> <SI2><TR>This is because</TR> if you start playing soccer or basketball early and regularly, you will be industrial. It is industrial that successful people have to have something. <EX><TR>To be specific</TR>, the studies about how physical activities make effect on a body have shown that exercise makes normal level tired and string in body, it helps for deep sleep. <TR>This is evidence that</TR> physical activity make a person industrial.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, if people doing exercise when they are young, it helps both to get success and to make lifespan more longer. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> people have to exercising as young as possible.</CO>
column23: This student has massive issues with grammar and vocabulary, resulting in many sentences sounding highly confusing and awkward. There is a good argument, but that is more or less obscured by the stylistic and grammatical errors.

column1: 660&Grading encourages students to learn.
column3:
<IN>It is debatable whether grading stimulates students to study. Some people disagree that grading is encouraging the discrimination between students, so it can decrease the marale of students. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, grading truly makes students to learn. <TR>Because</TR> it shows their achievement of students. <TR>Moreover</TR>, it can also gives them a motivation.</TS></IN>
 
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, grading is a perfect way to show the achievement of students.</MI1> <SI1>The grade that students want depends on their effort, and grading shows the effort how much the student put, well. <TR>That is</TR>, grading is the way of etimate or assess the academic achievement of a student, and students can utilize it to plan their studying. They are able to know where their position is, and how to break through their difficulties. <TR>In other words</TR>, it is similar to a map. Students can find their way destination, and know what way is the best method to achieve their goal. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, I could find out where I was by checking my grades when I study the financial certication exam, and thanks to this I could get the certification.</EX> <TR>In this sense</TR>, grading helps student study efficiently.</SI1></BO1>
 
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, grading motivates students.</MI2> If a student got lower grades than he or she expected, the student can do better next time, or if a student got higher grades than expected, that student will do better to enhance more or maintain his or her status. <EX><TR>From my experience</TR>, I got good grades when I was a freshman in the university, and people around me praised me about this. <TR>At that time</TR>, I was very happy that I have never got those praises before. <TR>After that</TR>, I studied harder because I wanted to get higher grades than I did, <TR>and thanks to my effort</TR>, I could get scholarships for 4 years in a series.</EX> This shows how grading can motivate students to study.</SI2></BO2>
 
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, students can study more by checking their grade and position, and they can also be motivated with their grade. <TR>In this regard</TR>, <TR>I firmly believe that</TR> grading motivates students to learn.</CO>
column23: This essay is very strong, with excellent main ideas and supporting examples. The essay is structured well, so that it flows easily from idea to idea.

column1:
661&"Not everything that is learned is contained in books" 
In your opinion, which source is more important? why?
column3:
<IN>Although books have been considered the major source to gain knowledge for the long time, people also realized that it is not the only way to learn. <TS><TR>I believe</TR> life experience, advice from parents, and even failures are the sometimes act as the best teachers.</TS></IN>
  
<BO1><MI1>Life experience provide vital knowledge which enrich our life with valuable lessons.</MI1> <SI1>Learning is a lifelong task. Since we born as an infant, people start to learning from real life. The first step, <TR>for example</TR>, is learned from numerous practice not from a book. As people grow up, join school, start to learn communicate with others, meet new friends, these skills are not learned from books. <TR>Instead</TR> these are learned from real life experiences and it is important for anyone else.</SI1></BO1>
  
<BO2><MI2>Sometimes parents could teach us with nice advice.</MI2> <EX><TR>When I was kid</TR>, I did not enjoy schoolwork. I rather spend time with my friends to play video games. My parents gave me advice with their story instead of criticize. They teach me the negative effects of being obsessed by video games and a person should responsible for their behavior. <TR>Because of this advice</TR>, I realize that I should focus on study to bring up my grad. I went to a good college and my effort finally paid back.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, parents can be a good teacher for their good advice which no books can provide these valuable lessons.</BO2>
  
<BO3><MI3>People learn more from failures than anything else. <TR>In other words</TR>, "failure" is our best friends.</MI3> <SI3>Failure can be stressful and frustrating, but with acceptance and open eyes analyze root cause and correct shortcomings would reshape ideal people. Our life is filled with chance. We do not need to dragged by 
one failure, instead open our eyes, learn from it and strive for another option. These lessons are precious than anything else that would benefit for entire life.</SI3></BO3>
  
<CO><TR>In conclude</TR>, although books provide important information, there are many ways to learn skills such as from life experience, from parents advice, or from failures. It is indispensable lessons which correct wrong behavior, reshape ideal person.</CO>
column23: This student at times struggles with basic things like regular past tense conjugations. In addition, there is little/no support for the student's argument.

column1: 662&eating home-made food is better than eating out in restaurants or food stands
column3:
<IN>As modern society grows fast, eating outside becomes common phenomenon. <TR>These days</TR>, if people do not want make food for their own, they can buy food from outside, which have a variety of restaurants and food stands. <TR>However</TR>, people having different environmental conditions have different opinions about foods. Some people believe that home-made food is still better than eating out in restaurants or buying food from food stands while others argue the opposite side. <TS><TR>In this essay</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> eating outside has more advantageous than making our own food at home since it is easier to meet our nutrients and more efficient for time consumption and expenditures.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, eating outside or buying food from food stands is better for our health than spending only home-made foods.</TR> <SI1>Some people would argue that home-made food is better for health because it is more safe and believable. <TR>Although this argument is partly true</TR>, it lacks the assumption that all foods can be made at home, which is almost not possible for most of people in these days. To meet the appropriate nutrients for a human being, various kinds of foods are required such as vitamin, calcium, protein and so on. If people make their own food for their health, they may have to spend most of time for cooking. It wouldn’t be desirable situation. <TR>On the other hands</TR>, if people buy food from outside such as restaurants or food stand, they can easily take the food and get the appropriate nutrients. It is easier and faster for people living in modern society.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, eating out from restaurants or buying food from food stands can both save time and money for food.</MI2> <SI2>Restaurants or food stands are usually specialized in some particular foods, which are cooked with a large amount, consequently decreasing food price. They are mostly cheaper than home-made food if the cookings are constituted with the same ingredients. Since home-made food cannot be cooked with a large amount, it cannot be cheaper than the food in restaurants or food stands. <TR>In addition</TR>, home-made food needs more time for cooking. <TR>When we eat outside</TR>, we just need to wait after order. <TR>However</TR>, when we make our own food at home, we need to wait for cooking, which is time consuming.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO>Many people unwittingly assume that food made at home is better for our health. <TR>As mentioned above</TR>, it is partly true. <TR>In reality</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, there is not enough time for people to make all kinds of food to meet our every single nutrient. It is less effective than eating outside restaurants. <TR>Also</TR>, eating outside takes less time and expenditures for food ingredients.</CO>
column23: This student makes a lot of claims in the essay, but those claims are not supported by evidence. This student is also good at using transitional words and phrases effectively.

column1: 663&The television has had a greater effect on people's lives than the telephone has.
column3:
<IN>Can you imagine living your life without television or telephone? Most people do not want to consider about because the two already take place in much of our daily routines. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>I think</TR> telephone has greater influence on people’s lives than television has because television gives negative impacts and reduces communication.</TS></IN>
                
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, television tends to bring negative effects on people.</MI1> <SI1>One effect is addiction. <TR>As some people call</TR>, the television has a nickname, a “fool box”. Television contains lots of news and functions; it brings international, political, and economic news and entertainments like dramas and documentaries. While people watch television, they only focus on what is on it, <TR>later</TR>, falling for it. <TR>If this continues</TR>, then watchers will eventually be addict to television. <EX><TR>Once</TR>, Korean Central Newspaper posted an article of how television makes a person addict. It surveyed the time of how much people watch television by ages and genders, and the increased rate of patients, addicted to television, as years pass by. In 1960, when television was first introduced in Korea, there were no patients and not many people were able to see it due to high prices. <TR>However</TR>, in 2000, the rate of patients increased to about 30 percent of television audiences and kids watched more than adults did. <TR>As this mounted year by year</TR>, kids’ addiction to television became a severe issue in Korean society. If cases like this keeps go on, then it will bring harmful effects on individuals, communities, and nations.</EX><SI1></BO1>

                
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, television reduces communications.</MI2> <SI2>Communication has always been important to people because it tends to decrease depression. <TR>With telephones</TR>, people can talk and discuss many things; favorite foods, actors, daily live and etc. Television however, makes one fall for it rather than discuss about it. <EX>I participated in Medical Youth Society in high school, and our club hosted a guest speaker who talked about a decrease rate of conversations around the family due to technologies. She mostly centered on bad influence of television. “Television is important for us but really, do you think it is crucial for our lives? When we do not have a true conversation like we did before they were invented, and it is scientifically proven by researchers?” </EX> This quote really came into my mind because as a person, who does not like to watch television, I totally agreed with her. Watching television may influence one in a harmful way.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I disagree with the statement that television brings greater influence on people than telephones brings because television causes addiction and reduces conversation. Even though both inventions have impacted our lives, not all of them have positive influences.</CO>
column23: This student makes a strong argument, though I don't think they totally understood the prompt. They wrote as if asked whether television or the telephone has had a greater NEGATIVE impact on peoples' lives, and not as if the prompt were asking if the television has had a greater impact overall. Despite this misunderstanding, the essay is strong, showing that the student has a good vocabulary and grammar.

column1: 664&Improving schools is the best way to advance a country.
column3:
<IN>It is said that people should improve schools in order to advance a country, and even argued that this is the best way. Some people agree with this idea because they think education is the only way to improve the state of a country. <TS>However, I think this is not true because improving schools is not suitable for all countries and there are numerous other ways to progress a country.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the idea that improving schools is the best way of advancing a country is not a way for all countries.</MI1> <SI>A country where most people are not educated might need to imporve their schools, but for developed countries like the United States or Western countries, improving schools is not the best way, since those countries already equiped with numerous schools. <EX>For example, in the early 1900s in Korea, this way was a only and the most effective way to improve the quality of a country, becuase people in those days were not educated. But today in Korea, most people are educated and there is no more need to improve schools, instead there might be need to improve other aspects that is lacked in the society.</EX></SI> In this sense, i think the concept that enhancing schools is the best way to promote a country is not correct.</BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there are other ways to raise the status of a country.</MI2><SI2> Sports or culture can also advance a country by make people in the wolrd contact with the country. <EX><TR>Especially</TR>, in this world in which has well develpoed online communication technology, there are more chances to experience other country easily, such as YouTube or Facebook. Therefore sports or cultural influence become more powerful to promote a country.</EX> <EX>For instance, Korean figure skater Yuna Kim and Korean singer PSY have advanced Korea significantly by showing their talent around the world.</EX></SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, improving schools is not the best way to advance a country for all countries. Instead, there are other ways to promote a country. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I firmly believe that the idea of enhancing schools is not the best way to advance a country.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay would be better if it were more specific- what are the numerous other ways for a country to progress, for example? Also, the student's writing is a bit awkward, especially where misused articles are concerned.

column1: 665&University Athletic departments should receive the same amount of funding as university libraries
column3:
<IN>These days, many people do not have any time to exercise and do any sports activities because they are too busy doing their works and jobs. Thus, this leads them to have ban health conditions, like diabetes and obesity. <TR>Surely</TR>, it would be effective for university to increase their funding to the athletic department to foster student’s physical ability. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>what I firmly believe is that</TR> it is far more effective to support more budgets on school’s library than to support the equal money on athletic departments. <TR>First of all</TR>, libraries are essential for student’s educational development, and also it would serve as a vital factor for promoting the university to new students.</TS></IN>
     
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> expanding budgets on the university libraries would benefit the whole students on their academic learning.</MI1><SI1>Most of the students on campus utilize its library in some way; in order to search textbooks for their papers, surf on the Internet, or to have a meeting with their study groups. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, not all students use school gym except for those who are athletics. <TR>Thus</TR>, expanding more funds to the library would be more advantageous for student’s academic performances. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, <TR>last year</TR>, I really had some trouble finishing my paper work. My professor wanted students to write a paper about one specific book for an essay, and everyone wanted to reserve that book in order to read it through and write about it. <TR>Hence</TR>, that one book was on reserve for several months and I had to wait for others to return it before the deadline.</EX> These kinds of problem would be solved when the university budgets more on the resources at the library department, making it convenient and easy for students to enhance their academic abilities.</EX></SI1></BO1>
     
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, a big library system on campus would work as a promotion to new students.</MI2> <SI2>Library is a great place to concentrate on studying with lots of resources, and also is a great facility to hold group meetings. <TR>So</TR>, most of the students spend their time in the library rather than staying at their dormitories. <TR>Thus</TR>, advancement in the library department would persuade more new students who seek for true education and an opportunity to study in comfort. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I usually make my study group schedules in the library. I choose the library as our place because it is very quiet and it has all the books and papers available. <TR>Also</TR>, our school library’s facility is significant that it also has a café and rest places where we can watch videos and movies. <TR>Thus</TR>, many students want to come to our school, and it really is the best part in our school.</EX></SI2></BO2>
     
<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, physical activity is surely an important thing for students to keep their body healthy while doing their studies. <TR>However</TR>, students would be more satisfied when their libraries advance. This would benefit more to the students because it would be available for all students to read every sort of books and enjoy other academic activities in the library.</CO>
column23: While I feel that this essay could use some more examples and evidence to support the argument being made, it is a good essay overall. The student has very good grammar aside from a few errors (most notably to me, some issues with articles).

column1: 666&The news media is a reliable source of unbiased information
column3:
<IN>With the advance of media, the news media have served as provider of information. Therefore a great number of people are considering this news media as a reliable source of unbiased information.<TS>However, I certainly believe that the information offered by news media can be biased in that the media company producing news media is operated for profit and political leaders sometimes use the news media for their purpose.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost,</TR> news is produced under the company who seek for profit. It is obvious that the media company is not the non-profit organization, therefore, inevitably their act depends on how their act influence on profit, which also affect news media and make the information unreliable.</MI1><SI1><EX>For example, nowadays, many media company rely their financial aspects on advertisement from the big company.</EX> So, they need to please this company needs in order to make sure continuing advertisement from the company. </SI1>As a result, they sometimes arrange the information in news in a good way for them by adding good news for them instead of showing negative news for them.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that,</TR> the government or political leaders can have great influence on the media. Media is very useful tool in political area because almost all information people receive come from news media. Therefore, some rotted political leaders are attracted to control the media section in order to keep their political power.</MI2><SI2><EX>For example, the democracy of korea have been fixed at the expense of the life of a great deal of people.</EX>However people back then didn’t know these sacrifice of people, since the media back then was controlled by the rotten government and didn’t inform any information about that.</SI2> It was many years later that people recognized their sacrifice and respected them.</BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> the news media is made from the company which seeks for profit and there is a possibility that media can be controlled by government. In this regard, I affirm that the information provided by media is not reliable.</CO>
column23: Some of the most significant errors I see in this essay are errors in subject-verb agreement- it happens a few times and is quite noticeable. Also, it would be nice if the student used more varied sentence structure, as the structure of a lot of their sentences is "Transitional word/phrase, new idea..."

column1: 667&Because environmental issues are very complex, individuals can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that individuals cannot do anything for the environment because environmental issues are too complex. <TS>However, in my opinion, I think that people can do many things to improve the environment.</TS> This is because people can use public transportation in lieu of their personal vehicles, and because they can use the less amount of water.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> public transportation can be an effective tool for improving environment.</MI1><SI1>To be specific, in the public transportation such as bus and subway, many people ride a same car at the same time. Thus, some pollutants, such as carbon dioxide, would be emitted the less amount than personal vehicles do. As a result, air pollution would be decreased. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2008, after many people used more automobiles, 10 times more pollutants were found in the atmosphere when compared to before. Also, cars emit CO2 and SO2 which bring about acid rain. And acid rain acidifies the top soils.</EX> Therefore, environment is further exacerbated. After Korean government had announced a policy that tax more money on people who have cars, the rate of using personal vehicles decreased. Consequently, pollutants in the air were disappeared 30%.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI1\2><TR>On top of that,</TR> saving water would play a significant role in preserving environment. </MI2><SI2>As people started to need more water, irrigation systems were developed. This resulted in desertification. <EX>In an experiment done by Seoul National University in 2007, same people were experimented twice. When there is an abundant supply of water, they used a lot of water. On the other hand, when they were allowed to use half of the water compared to the amount of water they used, they tried their best to conserve water. Surprisingly enough, they did not even used entire water.</EX>The experts said that the amount of water that they conserved were enough to stop the desertification.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> by riding public transportation and using less water, environment can be enhanced. For these reasons, I strongly believe that individuals have ability to change environmental situation.</CO>
column23: This is a very strong essay. The examples used to support the argument are very convincing, and the student has minimal issues with grammar, the few issues mostly being related to article usage and misuse of complex tenses like the past perfect.

column1: 668&Children should not make important decisions alone.
column3:
<IN>The world has radically changed that the way people think is definitely different from the past. In this respect, some people come to believe that children should be the one who should make their own decisions. <TS>As for me, however, I agree with the statement saying that important decisions should not be considered by children themselves for the following two reasons. First of all, they are not mature enough to take the risks. Secondly, problems that children face these days are too complicated.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> children are not old enough to take the burdens of making decisions.</MI1><SI1>This is because they are likely to choose something that they like, not the best choice s for them. As a result, they often face problems that they cannot control. Moreover, they lack the ability to be responsible for the outcomes. <EX>According to a research experimented by Seoul National University, kids who chose to live alone have shown serious problems.</EX> It was that they always get into troubles by the decisions they made. Mostly, results that happened created vital fianancial problems and often came close being bankrupt. As one can observe this example, important decisons are not the areas that children should put thier hands on.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> many concerns in modern societies are too sophisticated for a child to handle.</MI2> <SI2>As the world is changing every moment, there are certain aspects that children are not able to look into or might neglect although it seems insignificant. Therefore, their decisions for important events might not cover all sides and run into problems. <EX>For exampel, when I was a junior in high school, I decided to move to differnet areas by myself in order to concentrate on schoolworks. My parents provided only housing fees as I considered them the only things that I will be requried. However, as the first month passed spending all of my pocket money there were certainly issues. The money needed for transportataion and most importantly, foods.</EX>As a result, I had to comeback to my original home.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> important decisions should not be made by children themselves as they are not riped enough to take the responsibilities. Moreover, porblems are very complicated for them to solve. Therefore, parents and adults should be encouraged to control the kids when dealing with important issues.</CO>
column23: I think that this student could have made each paragraph transition a bit more smoothly into the next. Also, though the student makes some good points, there are a lot of vocabulary errors that make sentences sound a bit awkward or even confusing at points.

column1: 669&Hanging Gardens of Babylon
column3:
<IN><TS>The lecturer claims that there is no concrete evidence that proves the Hanging Gardens of Babylon actually did exist. This contradicts the reading passage's claim that a variety of evidences shows us that the gardens were not myths.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the lecturer mentions that researchers did not actually visited the place.</MI1> <SI1>He says that many stories can be embellished and fabricated such as Indiana Jones. Also, there is no references about the gardens in Babylonian historical texts.</SI1> This refutes the reading passage's claim that ancient Greek records are convincing evidences which describing the existence of the Hanging Gardens in Babylon.</BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, the lecturer contends that Babelonian buildings  were made of clay. This means that the buildings could not endure constant moisture to support plants.</MI2> <SI2>Consequently, the entire structures might be detroyed. This counters the reading passage's claim that the Babylonians possessed extraordinary architectural techniques to build the amazing gardens.</SI></BO2>

<CO><TR>Finally,</TR> the lecturer argues that three holes do not prove that these were used for water pumps. He points out that the Babylon was located at the middle of desert, and the holes were not near the rivers. Therefore, Babylonians needed a outstanding irrigation system. However, There is no remain of such systems. This casts doubt on the reading passage's claim that the three holes in the ground are highly reliable proofs.</CO>
column23: I find this essay very dissatisfying, but I feel that part of that might be because the prompt is so vague that it doesn't even ask for any specific argument. As a result, the essay is a summary rather than an argumentative essay with a thesis statement and  is accordingly difficult to grade as an argumentative essay.

column1: 670& in some countries, people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think this is a good rule or a bad rule?
column3:
<IN>The number of smokers is increasing today and as the cigarette is harmful to human’s health, the arguments on prohibiting smoking in public areas is often being issued. Some people argue that the rule may violate smoker’s right but other say that the smoke would effect on other people’s health. <TS>But in my opinion, smoking in public should be strictly restricted. In this essay, I will present two reasons to support my opinion.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> cigarette is one of the most harmful thing to human's body.</MI1> <SI1>it could cause lung cancer, heart attack and even death. not only this, the second-hand smoke from smoker is much worse than the original smoke. this fact is known worldwide and most non-smokers are being victim.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Further,</TR> by implementing this rule, the community's and even nation's environment could become more clean.</MI2> <SI2>it is not difficult to find the cigarette butts thrown carelessly at the bus stop and on the street.</SI2></BO2>
column23: This student has written an incredibly poor essay, presenting a clear argument but not really bothering to back that argument up with strong evidence. Also, the essay is very short, lacks smooth transitions, and is very limited in the types of structures used.

column1: 671&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space(for example traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with?
column3:
<IN>Many people have dreamed of exploring the outer space and now they believe it is the right moment to spend money on developing the space. <TS>However, I disagree with this argument, because there are so many areas for basic need, which are short of funds.</TS> By investing money to these field and satisfying people's basic need, the society can develop much further.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> there are still lots of people who are suffering from the lack of basic necessities.</MI1> <SI1>To put it in another way, we can find out starving people or distressed unemployed people, who are really seeking to a way to live a proper life. As there is a limit to government budget, setting a priority is important. In this circumstance where numerous people are still below the poverty line, the most necessary step government should take is to help them. This is the reason why government exist and why people pay taxes. <EX>For example, India is one of the most populous countries in the world, four times more than Brazil, which has similar territory. However, the living standard of these two countries is really huge, as around 35% of the Indian is in poverty whereas only 5% of the Brazilian is.</EX> Contrary to the fact that the India government invested the budget for outer space program, which was shamefully with no fruit, the Brazilian government focused on meeting basic demands of people instead. The current differences between them stem from this different policy and this is why we have to invest money for our basic needs.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> there are alternatives which can not only satisfy our basic needs but also develop technologies of our society.</MI2> <SI2>Although the scientific technique of space program has developed, it is not efficient when we look into the ratio of benefit to cost. Lots of funds has been invested almost for 30 years but the outcomes are slim. <EX>For example, most people still cannot travel the outer space even though scientists promised when they started the space research. We can find out alternative field, which is helpful to meet basic needs as well as to advance scientific technology. New renewable energy is a good example. By spending money to solar energy, wind power and bio-energy, our society can get electricity with cheap price, which is beneficial to our basic life.</EX> Also, by researching how to get clean and effective energy, the level of technology can advance and our environment can become clean as well, which helps people's daily life.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things considered,</TR> I firmly believe that investing money for fulfilling our basic needs is 'two birds with one stone,' because it helps poor people and draws technological advancement efficiently.</CO>
column23: The largest issue I found in this essay was misuse of articles, as they were sometimes inserted where unnecessary and omitted where necessary. However, this doesn't happen often, and the essay is quite good. I especially like the evidence and examples the student used to support his/her opinion. They are strong examples, and they are presented well here.

column1: 672&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>The society has drastically changed thanks to mistakes that human beings made. As time passed, education has become a crucial part of our life. Nowadays, almost all of the individuals emphasize learning science and mathematics, since those two subjects are practical for real life. <TS>However, in my eyes, learning only science and mathematics is not beneficial for our children by several grounds.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost,</TR> as children look into literature, they are likely to be much creative, since literature comprises of many informative stories.</MI1> <SI1><EX>According to the Harvard University, 80 percent of pupils are prone to be ingenious. On the contrary, when children study mathematics, they must memorize all the formulas. As an illustration, I was interested in reading a bunch of books when I was young, and I became an inventor right now due to the fact that I enjoyed getting new creative information while studying literature or reading books.</EX> This example shows that how studying literature is much beneficial than studying mathematics.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> history represents our country and grants information about the importance of our country.</MI2> <SI2>What is more, there is a famous quote “review the old and learn the new”. We could figure out which way is practical for country or not by examining history. <EX>An illustration of my uncle, he thought that history was despicable and useless. However, while he was doing presentation with regards to history, he chided himself and he knew that history is really practical for our life.</EX> This illustration shows that how history is crucial for our life.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> even though some people allege that studying history and literature is waste of time, energy and efforts, I still strongly and firmly suggest that my opinion which are mentioned in my essay. Not only studying literature makes children much creative, but studying history also offers information about our country.</CO>
column23: It would be nice if the student had elaborated upon the reasons behind his/her opinion in the thesis instead of waiting until the body paragraphs to expand. Also, the student makes some vocabulary errors and grammatical, including errors with superlatives and lack of agreement between verb tense and adverbs ("I became and inventor right now...").

column1: 673&Television has had a significant influence on the culture of many societies. To what extent would you say that television has positively or negatively affected the cultural development of your society?
column3:
<IN>Many people  believe that television has had a positive influence on the culture of many societies. They argue that television transfers lots of information to people and helps them know various society's cultures. <TS>However, I disagree with this argument and think television actually has negatively affected the cultural development of our society. My view can be greatly substantiated by the reason addressed below.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> television has made people become passive and this leads the regression of civilization.</MI1> <SI1>In other words, people in nowadays, who should play a pivotal role in developing the culture of society, are not thinking creatively because of the influence of television. People tend to accept information from television with no criticism, <EX>according to a study conducted by MIT research team. They investigate how media can affect people's thinking abilities. Among many mediums, television is the worst media as it affects viewers to become passive. They just absorb information and knowledge from television and believe it is true, even if it is wrong.</EX>This is harmful to the cultural development of society. The improvement of our society requires critical, voluntary, creative and active attitude toward received information and knowledge. Because television lacks these qualities, I firmly believe television is negative to our society.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> television has made the culture of society monotonous.</MI2> <SI2>To put it in another way, it has devastated the diversity of culture in our society. Some people think through television, the globalization, which means the development of cultural diversity, has been achieved. However, it is totally wrong. In fact, this globalization through television has destroyed many valuable cultural inherits. Due to many television programs and advertisements, people not only buy one specific goods, but also imitate things what they see. Especially, as most of the television programs are produced based on American society, people around the world have abandoned their own culture and adopted the style of America. <EX>For example, South Korean no longer wear their traditional clothes and eat their foods. What they do is what Americans do, which is the same.</EX> One famous philosopher refer to the globalization as 'Americanization' which clearly reflect the negative impact of cultural diversity of the world.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>We agree that the cultural development appeared the most in the Renaissance age. At that time, people did not have any television, only many debatements and discussions existed among creative people. However, it was these characteristics that actually led society to the cultural improvement of the society. From this historical example, I can support the idea that not television, but other things that advocate the creative ideas really make the development of the society.</CO>
column23: I was impressed by this student's strong command of English vocabulary and grammar which, while not perfect, was very close to it. The student also used very good examples to add to his/her own thoughtful analysis of the issue at hand.

column1: 674&If tou could go back to some time and palce in the pas, when and where would you go? why?
column3:
<IN>Someday, one of the witch or a psychic ask to you they will taking whenever in the past?often many people imagine that  if you can go there! It is always issued many fiction novel, drama and movie. <TS>For me, I used to imagine when I was young. Futhermore still I think the best place and time I want go there is Europe.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>For the first,</TR> If I can go back in the past. I will definitly choose the Europe.</MI1> <SI1>Beacuse Im a art student. In the past, Europe was a centre of arts filed and actually that times many artist is well known to people by their great painting or arts work. <EX>For example, If I can go there, I would more easily get chances for  famous artist painting and progress from thier academy.</EX></SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I heard at that time Europe was so incrediblely romantic place.</MI2> <SI2>It would be exciting.I already know what they eat, learn, do and play by many media such as Televison, radio and history class in a school. However, just not showing and not imagine and everything is realistic age. It will be awsome.also, I can get exprience everything such as riding a hores, clothing up dress, and meet many people in the past. It will be able to widen perspective also learn different interest in that time.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> If I can go back to some time and place in the past. I really want to go Europe beacuse there are hot place to art filed in the past. Of course now still it is. and I hope I can feel at that times romance. that's why I want to go to in the past time's Europe.</CO>
column23: This student's grammar is severely lacking, to the point that a lot of the essay is hard to understand, starting with the very first sentence. The essay is littered with sentence fragments, and the essay has an overall messy and confused feel about it.

column1: 675&Young people enjoy life more than older people
column3:
<IN>Some people think that old people can more enjoy their life than young people do. <TS>However I think that younger people will have more enjoyable life than old people in that young people have suitable tendency for making life valuable and old people usually have many responsibilities.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First and foremost,</TR> when it comes to change, young people tend to have more positive mind since they don’t have fearsome about change, instead they more have curious and want to experience new things as much as they can.</MI1> <SI1>Therefore young people are willing to accept and learn about new things or change easily, which make their life more variety. <EX>There is a poll by Korean government indicating that 95 percentage of the people who range from 20 to 25 show desire to study abroad.</EX> Considering that living in another country require lots of challenge and change, we can see young people are likely to enjoy change, which help them enjoy their life.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> there are many things that old people have to take care about.</MI2> <SI2>Old people usually the person who get married and have their child at home. These all require tons of responsibilities for old people. Therefore, old people have to consider these duties when they make new attempt to their life, Which makes it hard for old people to enjoy their life. <EX>For example, my uncle is working at the publication company as an editor. The works he deals with are quite burdensome, so he needs some time for refreshing himself. He thinks traveling all over the world can recharge his energy.</EX> However he just can’t do this because he has to care for his family and make money for them. If he took the trip all over the world, the financial condition of his family will be in trouble.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> young people have characteristics that make it easy for them to accept change and it is hard to attempt new things in their life for old people. Consequently, I contend that the life of young people is more enjoyable than that of old people.</CO>
column23: One thing I noticed in this essay was the student's constant misuse of adjectives, whether that came in the form of using adjectives where some other part of speech was necessary, or using some other part of speech (usually nouns) where adjectives were necessary.

column1: 676&Being able to speak well is more important than being able to write well
column3:
<IN>There has been an argument concerning whether being able to speak well is more important than being able to write well. A growing number of people believe that writing ability is more important. <TS>However, I firmly believe that speaking well is more useful and important ability in one’s life.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons to support my opinion.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> people spend more time talking than writing.</MI1> <SI1>They have to speak for many reasons. Specifically, people speak to persuade, argue, and explain. People cannot live without speaking. <EX>For example, there are still many people who cannot write, but they can express their opinion and live well without writing.</EX> However, if people cannot speak well, it will cause problems. Therefore, in that sense, I think speaking well is more important.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> I have learned English for many years.<MI2> <SI2>What I usually studied was reading and writing. When I went to Canada for the first time, I could not come up with how to say in English. I could not express what I needed. At that time, I realized that it is not helpful when I really need to speak in English. I think many people also have experiences like me.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I agree with the statement that being able to speak well is more important than being able to write well. The reason is that speaking ability is more needed in real life. Furthermore, even though people can write well, they can be in trouble if they cannot speak well.</CO>
column23: This student's thesis and supporting arguments aren't really exciting or super-insightful, but they are presented in a clean, careful sort of way. This student overuses transitional words and phrases a bit.

column1: 677&All University students should be required to take basic science courses.
column3:
<IN>I often ask myself "Why do I have to take some of these required classes at the school?". <TS>To me, some of the courses I had to take always seem unnecessary.</TS> Especially, subjects that I'm not interested in like math and science.  When I think of materials I learn in math or science classes, it feels like I would never use most of information I learned. I believe that after certain basic level of education, there is not much of necessary information we need in our real lives. in other words, we don't need that high level of education to live our general lives.Then, do all university students should be required to take basic science courses after they take required science courses in high schools? Definitely not. First of all, there's no point of taking science class when we are not in the science related field. At the same time, we don't need to know that high quality-information to live our every day lives.</IN>
    
<BO1><MI1>University is the place students go to study more on what they want to work on later day of their lives.</MI1> <SI1>A lot of students make their decisions on majors very carefully since university gets them closer in to the field. Depending on different majors students, students get various kinds of courses. As students take their courses to meet the requirement to get degree on their majors, they get to study on that particular subject deeply and become more and more professional. It is very natural for those of who are working on science related field to take science courses but there are lots of students who are in that field and not willing to study science. <EX>In my case, I am very interested in language and literature so I want to go to the school that has good language programs and literature programs.</EX> I would not want to take required science courses because I am not willing to study on science and it is not going to help strengthen my career.</SI1></BO1> 
    
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> I am not going to need to know about all the details in science because we just don't use those knowledge at all.</MI2> <SI2>Who cares about how the mercury dioxide can form certain chemical and how the genetic mutation can cause serious problem? To be honest, we only need basic knowledge to know and figure out things we face everyday. The reason we take required science, math, english and other classes is to keep us decently enlightened enough to live fair lives. There is no way we are going to need more than what we learned in middle schools and high schools.</SI2></BO2>
    
<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> I believe that University is for students to study what they're interested in. There is no point of Universities if they require science courses no matter what field students are interested in. It's taking opportunities away from students who are wanting to spend more time on their majors and developing themselves. I would hate to take science classes in University because of this reason. Also, once we have basic knowledge on basic science, i have no doubt that we are going to be just fine living our lives fairly well. Therefore, University should not require all students to science courses.</CO>
column23: This student writes very well, with a very good argument that is supported with strong examples. They make some grammatical errors, but overall, their command of English grammar is very strong, and those errors don't make the essay hard to read.

column1: 678&The purpose of television should be used for education, not for entertainment.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that television should be used for entertainment because it is one of the crucial outlets for people to release their stress. However, in my opinion, <TS>I think that television should be used for education rather than entertainment.</TS> This is because television is an effective tool for educating children, and because it would cause negative effects on children, if it is used for entertainment.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> television has potential to teach children efficiently.</MI1> <SI1>To be specific, images and sounds of television allow young kids to obtain materials at faster rate, ranging from elementary information to professional information. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2008, there were two groups of people observed with the different studying condition: Group A was offered televisions to watch about certain topics, and Group B was given books to read about same topics. Later, both groups took quizzes and the result showed that Group A had a higher accurate in understanding the content, whereas Group B was quite confused with different terms and various versions of the story.</EX> This implies that reading books is not as practical as watching TV.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> entertainment on television has a bad influence on children's behavior.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, children are easily be affected by TV to learn some bad behaviors, such as violence. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2008, there was a difference in studying condition between two groups: Group A consisted of children who watched entertaining shows on TV, and Group B was made up of children who watched education programs on TV. Interestingly enough, after six months, negative characteristics such as aggressiveness, bad attitude, and selfishness were observed in Group A in comparison to Group B.</EX> This implies that exposing entertainment shows to young children has a great influence on the character formation.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> televisions help children to gain materials practically and children's behavior can be affected negatively by entertainment on Television. For these reasons, I strongly believe that television has to be used for education.</CO>
column23: This student has excellent grammar, making very few mistakes in his/her essay. Also, (s)he uses some very convincing evidence to support his/her argument.

column1: 679&some people think govermnets should spend as much money as possible exploreing outer space(for example traveling to the Moon and to other planets.)Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reason and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>today many people are excting exploring outer space such as traveling to the moon and other planets. and it is often issued by government and many society. Those who argue with governments should more spend this money for exploring outer space. Other people say they should spend this moeny for our basic needs on Earth. <TS>I believe that government should pay much money to exploring and observing outer space. Because It will be more helpful to mankind's future.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> exploring outer space,It is challenge for human and many people will interest in that.</MI1> <SI1>Mankind always desire to exploring universe.it is showed a lot of drama serises, fiction novel and movie <EX>such as Doctor who, E.T and so on.</EX> Actually, most of people have interest in outer space also it often issued by in modern social community. so exploring outer space should be paid by government. it is definitely mankind wish for a long time. Beside today government have enough technology to exploring and obsevation outer space.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI1><TR>Secondly,</TR> Earth is enough developed by human so mankind need to find and observe new planets and outer space in the future.</MI1> <SI1>Thesedays, Earth is too destoyed by human and some parts of Earth is able to reverse as mankind should searching new place to live in outer space like Mars. If Earth is completely destoryed and if human did not find new place to live in outer space, Human would be disticnt whenever.Because government should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space for new living palce.<SI1></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> goverment should spend a lot of money to exploring outher space.It would be excited to people. Also, Earth is getting destroyed by human and finally mankind will not live in Earth thus, government have to spend money a lot to find new space for living that's why I agree with that opinion.</CO>
column23: This student makes many errors with grammar and vocabulary usage that make the essay hard to read at times. Some of these errors are misspellings of basic vocabulary words, showing that the student has a weak command of English. However, they do have a clear point and they work hard, though not entirely convincingly, to argue it.

column1: 680&It has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>A large shopping center is relevant to people who live in cities. Since it offers a variety of service, a large shopping center has became part of our life. <TS>However, there are pros and cons for this buildings which provide essesntial service to us.</TS> Sometimes it can be serious concern to people. Here are a few potent reasons for negative sides.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> traffic jam is one of biggest reason why people usually oppose to establishing a large mall.</MI1> <SI1>When a gigantic shopping center comes into our neighborhood, they make us twice time tougher to get to our house, which can play a significant role to some people when they decided to move there. <EX>In my case, now I live in a city named Istanbul, which is a mega-city consists of a number of buildings.</EX> In other words, there are enough large shopping centers in my surroundings. But, still companies never planning to stop constructing buildings. As a result, one of my neighbour named Ali, who works for Green-Peace, accuse both the government and companies for thoughtless approval of construction.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> a large shopping center can be baneful to stores and restaurant around it.</MI1> <SI1>If malls keep built in our neighborhood and devastate their stores and restaurants, it is impossible for aunt-store owners to sustain their lives by. <EX>For instance, in Korea, ceaseless construction of huge shopping centers became a hot issue.</EX> Anually a number of people are fighting against the plans to build malls in our neighbours because once they come in nearby us, there is no other way to hinder them from taking advantage that should be rediscussed.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>As a summary,</TR> it might looks nice if neat buildings located around us. However, for several reasons, contiuous and thoughtless construction of a large shopping center has become a social concern of our lives. First, it makes us more stressd by increasing traffic jam, and second, it induce us to lose sight of imporatnce of living together since humans can not live without humans. Be brave and start concerning our neighbor is the first thing a person has to do when economy versuses humans, rather than lured by the attractive words.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay is too vague, not giving enough indication of what will be discussed in the rest of the essay. Also, the student has good arguments for his/her opinion, but they are not supported well, causing the essay to suffer more.

column1: 681&using cell phones should not be allowed when using public transportation.
column3:
<IN>Nowadays, a considerable number of people believe that people should not use cell phones when they use public transprotation. <TS>However, I strongly maintain that using cell phones should be allowed when using public transprotation.</TS> The fundamental reason behind this is that using cell phones in public transportation makes people time-efficient and available to always connet people.</IN>
    
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> using cell phones in public transfortation helps people not to waste their precious time.</MI1> <SI1>The underlying reason behind this is that people do not waste their time moving to other place by public transportation but can have various activities such as texting, calling, listening to music, and watching videos by usung cell phones. <EX>According to my experience, I go to my school by subway every morning. At that time, I study TOEFL listening using cell phone for 30 minutes. Therefore, by using cell phones, I can save time during going to my school.</EX> If it were not for using cell phones, my time for going school would be meaningless.</SI1></BO1>
    
<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> using cell phones in public transfortation makes it possible for people to keep connecting with others.</MI2> <SI2>The rationale behind this is that people can inform others of thier locations of schedules by calling or texting. If using cell phones should not be allowed in public transportation, people will not able to know other's  circumstance which may be emergency. <EX>For example, One day, I did not use cell phones since there was too silent to use cell phone. Therefore I cound not answer my mother's call which was asking to bring medicines since my yonger sister was sick.</EX> This example proves that peple need using cell phones in public transportation for emergency.</SI2></BO2>
    
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> without any doubt, I firmly belive that using cell phones in public transportaion is more beneficial for people. The reasone is that using cell phones when using transportation can certainly save time and be available to keep connecting others. All in all, using cell phones in public transportation can be a great and most convenient ways for peole to live in this rapid societies.</CO>
column23: I like the examples that this student uses, making his/her argument simultaneously person and relevant to many people as (s)he supports his/her argument. Also, this student shows decently strong grammatical command.

column1: 682&Countries should spend more money on the exploration of outer space than on the preservation of the environment.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument whether it is better for countries to spend more money on the exploration of outer space than on the conservation of the environment. <TS>Although it is true that the space industry is peak of the popularity because of the sceince technology development, I strongly disagree with the statement that countries should spend more money on the exploration of outer space than on the preservation of the environment.</TS></IN>
  
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> a few people will enjoy privileges when the aerospace industry become successful.</MI1> <SI1>For instance, only rich people will have an opportunity to travel a space because of the money matters. On the other hand, if people investigate the moeny to the environment, all the people will have the benefits. To be specific, people can enjoy more healthier life in pleasant, clean surroundings.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> protecting the environment will prevent not only animals from extincting but also people on Earth.</MI2> <SI2>Nowadays, people contract many kinds of disorder because of the environment pollution that people arouse such as global warming and dirty air. The earth can be maintained more safely when people preserve the environment. What is more, people can leave a clean environment for generation to live in a healthy surroundings.</SI2></BO2> 
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I believe that preserving the environment is more important matter than the exploration of outer space for countries, on account of the reasons that I mentioned above : not only a small majority of people will get a benefit from space industry , but also people can prevent themselves from becoming extinct.</CO>
column23: The strongest part of this essay is the ideas that the student uses to support his/her argument, but unfortunately, those ideas are supported only with hypothetical situations. This student would do well to work on his/hervariety of sentence structure, as well.

column1: 683&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?Advertising can tell you a a lot about a country? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>today we can see a lot of advertisement thougout everthing such as Televison, Internet , Radio and so on. Someple argue that advertising can give information of a country beacause they who watch other country's advertisement  get  information of a country throuout different style of advertising. <TS>However I believe that most of advertising have simliar aspect so it cannot give many inforamation to someone.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> today are getting more globalization thus, people who make advertise consider to veiw point for all of the world.</MI1> <SI1><EX>for example, one of my friend he always buy new cloths on other country's website. and most of their website soureces from were facebook advertisement, also for my exprience it is not unfamiler to other country's advertisement.</EX> beacause many people and I are exposed that by the internet.also rencently, avertising tend to targetting all of the world.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR>some people beileve advertisements would show a lot of information of a country. but i beileve advertisements are not information of a country.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, advertisement are not include infromation which for let know a country. Futhermore, The world is changed rapidly also it is effect on a lot of people. advertisement which need to adopt  to change everything are getting more various and involving various people taste. for these reasons they cannot include information of a country.</SI2></BO2>
 
<BO3><MI3><TR>Fianlly,</TR> if advertisement have a information of a country.</MI3> <SI3>many people would be do not care about them.so when people make advertisement they will not care about include them. thus if they have them, it would a little bit including them. <EX>According to national survey centre of U.S.A approximatly 75 percents of advertisement are not include information of a county and only 25 percents of advertisement have a small information of them.</EX>That's why I believe adversting cannot give informaiton of a country.</SI3></BO3>
  
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> rapid globalization and many advertising operated by the internet.advertisement need to extend custumer's range to all of the world. that's why I believe advertising cannot tell that much infomaiton of a country.</CO>
column23: This student hashorrible spelling, and their lack of capitals on words starting many of their sentences is disappointing. Also,this student makes a lot of claims but doesn't really support them.

column1: 684&All University students should be required to take basic science courses.
column3:
<IN>I often asked myself  "Why do I have to take some of these required class at the school?". <TS>To me, some of the courses I had to take always seem unnecessary especially, math and science.</TS> When I think of materials I learn in math or science classes, it feels like I would never use most of thing I learned. I believe that after certain basic level of education, there's not much of necessary information we need in our real life. In other words, we don't need that high level of education to live our lives. Then, Do all university students should be required to take basic science courses after they took required science courses in high schools? Definitely not.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> there's no point of taking science class when we are not in the science related field.</MI1> <SI1>It's not efficient. At the same time, we don't need to know that high quality information to live our every day lives. University is the place students go to study more on what they want to work on later day of their lives. A lot of students make their decisions on majors very carefully since university draws you closer to getting professional on the certain field. Therefore, depending on different majors students get various kinds of courses. As students take their courses to meet the requirement to get degree on their majors, they get to study on that particular subject deeply and become more and more professional. It is very natural for those of who are working on science related field to take science courses but there are lots of students who are not in that field and not willing to study science. <EX>In my case, I am very interested in language and literature so I want to go to the school that has good language programs and literature programs.</EX> I would not want to take required science courses because I am not willing to study on science and it's not going to help strength my career.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> I am not going to need to know about all the details in science because we just don't use those knowledge at all.</MI2> <SI2>Who cares about how the mercury dioxide can form certain chemical and how the genetic mutation can cause serious problem? To be honest, we only need basic knowledge to know and figure out things we face everyday. The reason we take  required science, math, english and other classes is to keep us decently enlightened enough to live fair lives. There is no way we are going to need more than what we learned in middles school and high school.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary,</TR> I believe that University is for students to study what they're interested in. There's no point of Universities if they require science courses no matter what field students are interested in. It's taking opportunities away from students who are wanting to spend more time on their majors and developing themselves. I would hate to take science classes in University too because of this reason. Also once we have basic knowledge on basic science, I have no doubt that we are going to be just fine living our lives fairly well. Therefore, University shouldn't require all students to science courses.</CO>
column23: It would be nice if this student had used more evidence and examples to support his/her argument. However, his/her grammar and vocabulary usage doesn't have too many errors, and I found that (s)he used transitional words and phrases quite effectively without overusing them.

column1: 685&Venus Habitation
column3:
<IN><TS>The lecturer claims that there are solutions to nullify the problems with living on Venus. This counters the reading passage's claim that it is unlikely for human beings to habit on Venus because of some serious problems.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> the lecturer asserts that we can live in the man-made structures that are high up in the atmosphere.</MI1> <SI1>Because atmosphere above the surface fifty kilometers has similar pressure with that of the Earth. Thus, nothing would be crushed while it is trying to landing. This contradicts the reading passage's claim that 90 times higher air pressure on Venus would prevent humans to live on Venus.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> the lecturer argues that it is possible to obtain water and oxygen via chemical reaction.</MI2> <SI2>We can isolate oxygen from the Venus's atmospheric gases to attain water. <EX>For example, there are carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulfide in the atmosphere.</EX> And these can be transformed to water and oxygen by chemical reaction and electrical spark. This casts doubt on the reading passage's claim that it is almost impossible to keep supplying water and oxygen.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>Finally,</TR> the lecturer mentions that it is able to gain heat energy from the sun on Venus. This is because gas layer is not really thick, and man-made structure is in high up atmosphere. Also, Venus rotates very slowly. Therefore, we can put solar panels in the sunny side for a long time. This would result in a limitless supply of heat energy. This refutes the reading passage's claim that we cannot attain enough heat energy because thick gas layer inhibits sunlight to reach the surface of Venus.</CO>
column23: This essay lacks a satisfying, convincing thesis statement, as the student simply points out the difference in viewpoint between two sources of information. Ultimately, there is no argument being made in this essay, resulting in a lack of good ideas to discuss and a corresponding lack of supporting evidence and examples for those ideas.

column1: 686&it is a better to do things one at a time than to do many things at once
column3:
<IN><TS>It is evident in our society that time has a tremendous importance in our lives.</TS> As society change more quickly, Some people believe that it is a better to do many things at once, While others do not. However, from my point of view, no matter how fast the world is changing, doing things one at a time is more beneficial. There are several reasons I discuss to support my argument so I will my discussion to the two that I feel are mst relevant to the topic. First, it can save time. Also, people can receive less stress.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> to do things one at a time allow people to save a great amont of time.</MI1> <SI1>Commonly in society, people tends to manage their time efficiently. If people can do many things at once, company may let them do more things to do. Thus, they can not enjoy and manage time. <EX>From my personal experience, I  was very tired when i was in sophomore in college. This was due to the fact that I tried doing many things at once.</EX> Therefore, I have no time to enjoy my college time. On the other hand, My friend Minji received scholarship because she always did her things at a time. As this outcome shows, it is better to do things once at a time.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> Doing many things at once can people receive a lot of stress.</MI2> <SI2>Nowadays people are stressed out. This is because there are too many things to do. Doing many thing at once is not necessary for health. A recent article I read on the Korea Herald revealed some interesting findings. <EX>According to the article, a surprising numbers of people in company claimed that they are stressed out. I found it interesting because this was due to requirement from comany that they need work and discover new technology and do other things simultaneoulsy.</EX> This clearly shows that doing many things at once is not useful to life and make them angry.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I disagree to do many things at a time owing to the waste of time and the problem of stress. All things I considered, with reasons mentioned above, I believe that I have sufficiently and adequately explained my position on the matters regarding this topic.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay has a clear position on the problem that is being discussed, but other than picking sides, it's quite empty, with its supporting ideas not very well elaborated. Also, while this student's essay is not hard to understand, there are still some grammatical issues with things like tense and articles that make certain sentences read a bit awkwardly.

column1: 687&If you could meet a famous entertainer or athlete, who would that be, and why? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of people who I want to meet who is a famous entertainer or athlete. <TS>However, I have one person that I really want to meet who is athlete. His name is Messi.</TS> There are a lot of reasons that I want to meet him.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> he is very famous soccer player.</MI1> <SI1>He is fast and powerful. However, he is technical, too. I think he is the best soccer player ever. He is small like me, but no one can stop him in the field because he is so fast to catch. My dream was to becoming a soccer player when I was young. When I was young, I ran for Seoul soccer team. I got trophy, too. However, I had to stop playing soccer because my parents told me that I am not good enough and my height was too short. But Messi is small too. So I like very much.</SI1></BO1>
