<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> he do not know how to forgive something.</MI2> <SI2>When he was young many teams did not let him in as a player because he was too small, However, he really wanted to became soccer player so he practiced everyday to improve his soccer technic. If I tried like him, I might became a soccer player, too.</SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> loves his team very much. He is in FC Barcelona.</MI3> <SI3>FC Barcelona raised Messi since when he was very young, and they never forgive him even though he is very small. So Messi think very thank to them that he never leave the team.</SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclude,</TR> these are the reasons that why I want to meet him and why I want to be like him. I wish I can be a soccer player like him but it is too late. So I just want to meet him and say that I like him very much.</CO>
column23: This student makes errors with things like verb conjugations and picking the right verb tense, and (s)he even omits a subject in one sentence. Overall, the essay sounds a bit rushed and childish.

column1: 688&Universities and high school should teach students about specific careers and fields instead of general subjects.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that teaching specific careers is better for students than teaching general subjects. <TS>However, in my opinion, I think that universities and high schools have to teach general subjects for students.</TS> This is because experiencing a variety of subjects would help students to decide future careers that are most fit with them, and because having abundant basic knowledge would help students to adapt themselves to the society.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> by dealing with many subjects, students can choose their better future careers.</MI1> <SI1>To be specific, studying fruitful subjects would lead students to find their aptitude. Students would learn subjects more ardently to find their aptitude. Thus, efficiency would rise. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2008, Students in high school A and B were examined by researchers: School A just taught students specific subjects instead of general subjects, whilst School B provided students with general subjects. Because students in School B could experience enough subjects, they could easily find what they want to do and what they want to be in the future.</EX> As a result, they were more willing to learn. Interestingly enough, students in School B show higher rate in getting jobs than those in School A do.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> it is important in the society to acknowledge fundamental knowledge.</MI2> <SI2>To be specific, if people lack elementary understanding, they may be underestimated by others. Therefore, they cannot socially behave well and be ignored by others. <EX>For example, my uncle attended the high school which only provided students with specific subjects. When my uncle went to the society, many people did not treat him politely.</EX> If he had learn general subjects, he would have not been belittled by others.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> experiencing general subjects plays a big role in selecting students' future careers, and those general subjects are essential in social activities. For these reasons, I strongly believe that studying general subjects is more preferable.</CO>
column23: I think that this essay has a good thesis statement, which makes a clear argument with supporting reasons. The student also provides good evidence and examples to support his/her argument.

column1: 689&All students should be required to take history courses.
column3:
<IN>There aren't enough students dreaming to have a career related to history in the future these days. It is because many people think that history is not important comparing to other subjects such as language, math, science etc. <TS>However, I strongly believe that all students should learn about our past.</TS> Universities should require students to take history courses because history not only raises responsibility as a citizen but also prevent making same mistakes that happened in the past.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> by learning history, university students can raise responsibilities as citizens in their own country, and even in the world.</MI1> <SI1>Students who will lead our future can raise more interests about our society which will finally result in patriotism. <EX>To illustrate, I studied Korean history to get an certification for 3 months last semester. As I studied more and more, I soon sank into our past, and concentrate on the stories in the lecture.</EX> Especially, in Japanese colonial era, I was impressed by our respond to protect Korea from Japan such as 3.1 movement. Even though I already passed the exam and get certified now, I still study and search more about our history. By learning it for few months, I not only got interested in our past, but also our present and future, and I now dream to work for our country in the future. Therefore, history raises patriotism which is one of the most essential qualities that future leaders should have.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that,</TR> there will be a less chance to make same mistakes in the future when students take history courses in universities.</MI2> <SI2>When they become a working member of society, they will cope with various problems that might even influence their whole careers. By learning history, they can learn what decisions they should make by learning the reasons and results of many incidents that happened in the past. It will also benefit our society since there will be many leaders who can make a right decision to improve our country. <EX>For instance, my aunt who chose history as her major when she was in her university, now lives a successful social life.</EX> It is possible because she learned how to think logically and make less mistakes by learning history. Thus, learning history can let students make less mistakes in their future career.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> history is one of the most important subjects that a person has to learn in their life. And university seems to be the best place to learn about it since it is the last course to prepare their careers for students. By requiring to take history courses, students can raise responsibility and patriotism, and make less mistakes. With these notions in mind, our society will be more strongly attached, and finally make our county a better place by encouraging students to learn history.</CO>
column23: I like this student's thesis statement because it takes a position and presents points that are interesting and make me want to read more about the student's opinion. Also, the student's writing is interesting in that while some sentences have a lot of grammatical and/or vocabulary errors (never enough to make the sentences very hard to understand but still enough to be obvious), some sentences of equal complexity are nearly perfect. This student would do well to work on his/her consistency.

column1: 690&Films can tell us a lot about the country in which they were made. What have you learned about a country from watching its movies?
column3:
<IN><TS>There are two movies that gave me an opportunity to think about other countries' life. Those are The Lord of the Ring and The Spider Man.</TS> They have each feature that I noticed ; beautiful scenery and big city's life.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> The Lord of the Ring had been made in New Zealand.</MI1> <SI1>In the course of running time, many beautiful sceneries have held me fascinated. Those were historical, beautiful and artistically subtle. And still I wish I could go to the ocean seen by the movie.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> There were different life styles from my country that were made me excited in the film.</MI2> <SI2>The film is named The Spider Man. It was made in New York city, U.S. As a person who are living in very distinguishable culture from U.S, everything was all new to me such as a kind of attitude toward older people.</SI2></BO2>

<CO>Through these movies, I learned what I had not known and had a chance to ponder to study abroad of travel.</CO>
column23: The thesis statement of this essay doesn't really answer the prompt, pointing out things that the student simply noticed rather than things that the student actually learned about an area. Overall, this student uses very unvaried sentence structures and makes a lot of grammatical errors.

column1:
691&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Technology has
made the world a better place to live. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>With the technological development, people can now communicate each other from far away distance, go to the movies, shop online, do not starve to death and so on.  The world definitely seems better than the past.  There are some people, however, say that that the world did not go better, rather it went worse than the past. <TS>From my perspective though, I agree with the statement above.</TS> It is because technology made people to enjoy more and helped not to starve.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> people nowadays have more things to enjoy than the past.</MI1> <SI1>In the past, there were not much things to do, and that is why ancient people just looked up on the sky at night and thought about stars and the creation of earth.  However, thanks to the technology, people have bunch of things to do nowadays. <EX>For example, I can call my friend with cell phone and ask him to come over to my house to play baseball. Also, I can go to my friend’s house which is an hour away with a car and play video games.</EX>  None of these happened in the past. There are a lot more to do in today’s world compared to the past.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> there are more things to eat, so people do not starve.</MI2> <SI2>Technology made crops to grow more stable than ever. The pesticides, water control, weather forecasting, efficient farming method contributed to the abundant food for people to eat.  In the past, however, people starved except the aristocrats and royal families.  As many people say, starving is one of the most painful things to go through. Since people have no problem with less eating nowadays, it can be said that it is a better world to live in.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I firmly agree that the world we live today is better than the past.  Modern society provides more things to enjoy and eat.  People’s primary goal is to enjoy the life that is given, thus enjoying the diversity and opulence of food and joyful activity can be the best choice given to them.</CO>
column23: This essay is okay, but it suffers from a proliferation of strange grammatical misusage and weak supporting ideas that aren't very well supported.

column1: 692&Some people say that the Internet provides people with a lot of valuable information. Others think access to so much information creates problems. Which view do you agree with?
column3:
<IN>Thanks to the Internet, people are able to access to useful information by clicking several buttons at home. However, this powerful informative system also has brought us some serious problems. <TS>I agree with this perspective for a couple of reasons: children can easily approach to violate or sexual contents and many contents from the Internet are not accurate.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> people, especially children, become more accessible to the information containing sexual and violate contents through the Internet.</MI1> <SI1>To be specific, in order to develop children's personality well, many parents prohibit their children from watching sexual or violate scenes when they are young. However, since the Internet, it becomes relatively easier for children to watch those contents at home. This can lead them to behave aggressively. <EX>For example, a recent survey conducted by the Ministry of Education of Korea shows that the number of children who have ever watched adult movies are more than two third of the population.</EX> The report also mentions that most of children access to the contents through the Internet.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of the claim above,</TR> the information from the Internet is frequently inaccurate.</MI2> <SI2>Specifically, although many people use the Internet for searching for what they want to know, many sources from the Internet are from anonymous, so the information is less reliable than from books or experts. <EX>For example, few years ago, my friend and I argued with a Korean grammar issue. We had different opinions of a grammar problem, so we looked up the Internet and turned out my friend was correct. However, after a while, I found a grammar book written by a famous Korean language professor, and it says that my opinion was correct.</EX> After then, I have been cautious to decide whether the information from the Internet is really true or not.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum,</TR> even though I appreciate one of the greatest developments in the world: the Internet for its convenience of finding useful information. However, it also has problems such as inaccuracy and easy access to provocative contents. For these reasons, I agree with the claim that the Internet creates problems.</CO>
column23: While this is a very good essay overall, it does suffer from a lot of grammatical and vocabulary problems. Despite those, there is a good thesis that is supported well, and I find that the student's essay flows well from idea to idea.

column1: 693&Students can get as many benefits from organization or club activities as they can get from academic studies. Agree or Disagree
column3:
<IN>Having a professional knowledge is regarded as the essential element to success. When learning knowledge people usually listen to lecture and read a book. However, nowadays, companies are very interested in hiring people who not only are able to collaborate with others but also have good relationship with other people, and these two things can be learned through activities in organization and clubs. <TS>Thus, I believe that organization and club activities are able to provide as many advantages as academic studies.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with,</TR> club activities allow people to have relationship with club members.</MI1> <SI1>As they frequently communicate with members, they are able to make friends with them. This brings a lot of benefits, especially while running a business. It makes much more easier for people to get products that they need for business. This also enable people know recent information. Besides, achieving contraction with friends would be much more easier than achieving it with people that you are not familiar with. When it comes to students, having a lot of friends enables them to borrow books that they might need and learn academical things that they didn't understand. In other words, if there are problems that one cannot solve alone, one can ask his friends to give advice and helps. In this respect, joining in organization and club activities bring good relationships with people which is highly helpful.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> when participating in organization, people learn cooperation skill.</MI2> <SI2>As shown above, cooperating with team members is highly significant. As a result, a lot of companies are making group assignment for their employee tests. In this test, employee should form a group and represent their works as a whole. In real business, workers should work together in order to achieve goals that one cannot attain. This cooperation ability can be learned while participating in a activities such as musical performance club and sports club. When members work together to make beautiful melodies and pass balls through openings they learn how to ameliorate their problems while respecting others which is great team work.</SI2></BO2> 
 
<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> no one can deny the fact that academic studies give people professional knowledge which makes them experts but there are also a lot of things that cannot be learned through books or lectures. The two most obvious things would be friendship and cooperation skills. When professional knowledge is complemented by things that are learned through social works, it would make icing on the cake.</CO>
column23: This student has strong grammatical skills overall, and his/her writing feels almost natural. Also, (s)he explains his/her point of view well.

column1: 694&it is more important to teach self-confidence than to teach specialized knowledge
column3:
<IN>It is evident in our society that enjoying-life has a tremendous importance in our lives. Some people think that it is more important to teach self-confidence than to teach specialized knowledge, while others do not. <TS>I however, believe that it is not important to teach self-confidence than to teach specialized knowledge.</TS> There are several reasons that I could discuss to support my argument so I will limit my discussion to the two that I feel are most relevant to the topic. First, it is inefficient. Also, people can receive a lot of stress.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> most important reason for my feeling this way is that teaching self-confidence is not efficient because it is not good to success.</MI1> <SI1>Commonly in society, knowledge tends to be important. If people do not have knowledge of his field, they can not get a good job. <EX>Take Tom, for example. He could not get a job long time because he did not have specialized knowledge of his field. It took him over 2 years to get a job.</EX> In constract, it only took 6months to get a job for his friend Tom. This was because Tom knew many things of his filed. This result clearly shows that it is inefficient to teach self-confidence.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> another reason for my thinking this way is that people can receive a lot of stress.</MI2> <SI2>It is difficult to have self-conficence. Thus, it can be said teaching specialized knowledge is better because teaching self-confidence is hassle. A recent article I read on the Korea Herald revealed some interesting findings. <EX>According to the article, a surprising number of people claimed that they had anxiety issues. I found it interesting because this was due to stress from fact that they want to have self-confidence. Just last year, I could not go to sleep for 2 weeks because I was too stressed out from one person who has excessive self-confidence. He was a big problem in company.</EX> As this outcome shows, teaching self-confidence is worse because people can receive a lot of stress.</SI2></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>All things considered,</TR> with the reason mentioned above, I believe that I have sufficiently and adequately explained my position on the matters regarding this topic.</CO>
column23: I dislike the thesis statement here because, while it takes a position on the issue at hand, it is still quite vague. Also, the student has issues with switching verb tense in the middle of sentences.

column1: 695&People should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing.
column3:
<IN>I agree with the above opinion. <TS>We cannot live and shouldn't live only doing what we want to do.</TS> The most distinct difference between humans and animals is that humans can control their emotion and behavior. There are three reasons why I agree with this. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> we cannot get something without trying it on.</MI1> <SI1></EX><TR>For example,</TR> let's assume that we want to buy an expensive car but don't have enough money to buy it. <TR>In this case, </TR>we should work in a company or do a part time job so that we can obtain the car. Even if we don't like to enjoy working, we cannot but work to get something we want to have.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> we can improve our will power by doing things we do not enjoy doing.</MI2> <SI2>I think that will power is one of the most important factors to succeed in life. Unless we can overcome ourselves, we will not win in our lives. The ability of controlling ourselves can be improved by doing things we do not want to do.</SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> we can do something we haven't experienced yet.</MI3> <SI3><TR>In other words,</TR> we can experience various lives and be a better person who can adapt to any circumstances. I think that this experience will be helpful when we meet new coworkers and cooperate with them</SI3>. </BO3>

<CO>I think that people should experience a lot of things that they have not ever done. After experiencing various things, we will be able to make our lives more active and energetic. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, although a little short (that's ok). However, your first main point doesn't seem to match up to what you are trying to say.  In fact, it sounds very similar to your third point.  Change the first main point to go along with your supporting points.  You have to work to get what you want.  Also, your thesis statement is good, but with a little more development it could be better.

column1: 696&Some people say that it is a good idea to have the experience of living in another country. Do you agree ? Give examples for your answer.
column3:
<IN>In my neighborhood, there live two foreigners who work at big airplane companies near my town. I was so interested in their life and their culture a lot when I found that most of my neighbors are also curious about their life in my small town. <TR>After times flew,</TR> I could have a chance to talk to them and give hands to them when they asked me some help. <TS>Now, I can say that living in another country is such a good idea to enrich the quality of life throughout my two foreign friends’ story.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><SI1><EX>Their best favorite event of their daily life is going out and trying to have a Korean food at restaurant with me. Most of people who come from oversea say Korean food are really spicy but I could help them choose their favorite Korean food after trying food at many restaurant. <TR>Also</TR>, they like to see various cultural event around my town such as the exhibition of Silk which is very famous in my hometown and the annual festival which is also very traditional Korean style. </EX></SI1><MI1>I think new experience itself tells us the amount of worthy things in our lives even when they are in foreign country.</MI1> </BO1>

<BO2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I would like to mention about my experience when I lived in another country. <EX>I could have a chance to stay in the united state when I was a college student and study English.</EX> <MI2>Learning foreign language is also very attractive fact among lots of merits in living in another country.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>Certainly,</TR> I could improve my language skills for a short time compared with my friend who tried to learn English in Korea and also well- trained language skill helped me understand American culture as well as the united states as it self. That was really great time in my life and I can say that experience helped the quality of my life highly.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>To be conclusion,</TR> sometimes people have a difficulty in living in another country with language problems or cultural differences but we can also think about the time what they can get after they overcome those some problems. There is a proverb, “ Try to buy experience when you are young” in my country which means reasonable experience is considered as a necessity in successful life. If I can find another chance to be able to live in foreign country, I will never hesitate to accept the chance.</CO>
column23: The ideas in this essay are pretty good, but it needs some organization.  Your main idea should be the first or second sentence in the paragraph, and it should introduce an idea you want to talk about.  Next can come supporting ideas and examples.  Your conclusion is quite good!

column1: 697&All students shoud be required to study art and music in their schools.
column3:
<IN>These days almost all schools make their students to study art and music. I think that this trend is a natural phenomenon because we have been with art and music since human beings appeared. <TS>There are three main reasons why all students should study art and music.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> we can keep our emotion stable and delightful by listening to music or drawing a picture.</MI1> <SI1>Especially the role of art and music is becoming more critical because the society is developing and we are getting much stress from our work.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> we can spend our free time usefully.</MI2> <SI2><EX>I learned to play the guitar when I was in an elementary school. Although my mother forced me to learn it and I didn't want to do, now I think that learning to play the guitar was a good experience to me. When the school music contest was held, I could play the guitar and win the first prize. The experience also brought me self esteem.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> art and music enable us to have a good relationship with people who are interested in same hobbies.</MI3> <SI3><EX><TR>For example,</TR> we can join an art or music community to show our talents or spend our free time.</EX> <TR>In addition,</TR> we can meet many people having same kinds of hobbies, so we can be close each other easily. </SI3></BO3>

<CO>I think that all students have the right to experience the world of art and music because it is surely worth experiencig. As a result, all schools should make their students to study art and music.</CO>
column23: A good essay!  You make some good points, and your essay would be stronger if you backed them up with some research.  Your first main point paragraph especially needs some more development.  You bring up and interesting idea and it needs to be talked about a little more, maybe with a few examples. Also, your thesis statement needs to be stronger.  Think of your thesis statement as an advertisement for your essay - in one sentence, sum up what your entire essay is trying to say.

column1:
698&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? 
People behave differently when they wear different clothes. 
Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? 
Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> the clothes which people wear make a great influence on them.</TS> Though clothes do not say about the people who wears that, it can affect people's behavior indirectly. In ordinary life I could expierience many examples which say that statement is true. I will exemplify the cases of the retired man from army and the highschool students. </IN>

<BO1><SI1><EX><TR>Firstly,</TR> Koreans who is out of military service must join the program which is prepared for the retired mans. When they go to the program they wear the army's uniform which they weared during soldiers. When they wear the uniform, they seem to change to the soldier back. They behave like a real soldier; what they say, how they walking, and so on. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another example is the highschool students.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Today most of high schools in korea adopt to wear school uniform when students are go to school. Before several years high schools students weared what they want to wear. Not wearing uniform, they are indistinguishable from adults in figure. So there were many social problems, such as student's smoking and drinking. After they wear the school uniform, anyone see them can konw they are students. And students become to behave more prudently.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO>What people wearing up do not say all thing about them. But it can affect their mind and then appear in the form of their behavior. It was showed evidently in the cases of the retired mans unordinary deeds and in the decrease of the highschool students bad acts.</CO>
column23: Again, this is a good essay, but there are a few organizational things to clean up. Your first main paragraph has no main idea!  You need to set the scene for the paragraph. Example: "Military men are an excellent example of how clothes can change a person." Otherwise, you have good points!  I would suggest trying to find a way to combine your first and second sentences to create a stronger thesis statement.

column1: 699&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There is a proverb in most of countries, “ Like father, like son” which means children generally resemble their looking as well as personality with their parents. I’ve experienced that people who know my parents well often said that I looked like my parents a lot even though no one told them who I am. <TR>Also,</TR> as a view of education, human being in their childhood are likely to be affected by several factors of their circumstances including family, friends and even where they live very easily. <TR>Among factors,</TR> we can simply assume that parents will be the ones who can spend the longest time together with their kids. <TR>Now,</TR> I can give several examples why parents can be the best teachers of their children with some specific reasons.</IN>

<BO1>My parents started going to church when I was three years old. I could get along with many friends in church and joined a lot of activities which were really interesting to me. After all, I grew up to be a Christian without any questions why I have to go to church and so did my sisters and brother. Though there might be different reason on being Christian, I would rather say that I’ve got used to going to church when I was young because of my parents than I’ve decided to go to church by myself. <TR>Sometimes,</TR> we can see cases that family member has each religion no matter what their parents believe but most of cases, same religion in one family are general cases around us. </BO1>

<BO2>Even not only family’s religion, but we can search for also another example when children are affected by their parents easily. <EX>One of my friend who had lunch with me told me that she would not eat carrot even a little piece. After visiting her place, I realized that why she would not eat carrot at all after seeing what her mom did. Her mom also didn’t use carrot on her cooking and said she didn’t like it because of her mother.</EX> With this simple case, we can imagine that how easily children can look after their parents. No matter how small habit, parents should be careful of showing it to their kids and affection to their habit too. </BO2>

<BO3>While I was living alone, I’ve been cooking with reminding what my mother did on her cooking. <TR>Sometimes,</TR> I even called mother and asked what the recipe was. This is kind of simple case which shows what makes children look like their parents but I believe that there are many other reasons why parents are the best friends to their children throughout many personal experiences. </BO3>

<CO>There is another proverb in my country, “ Do not drink cold water in front of little kids” which means children mimic everything what their parents do especially when they are young. I will also confirm it when I raise children in the future.</CO>
column23: I am not sure what to think about this essay.  You don't really talk about the question.  Your essay does not have a clear thesis statement, nor any clear main points.  You talk about how kids are affected by their parents, but not if parents are good teachers or not.  Read the question again and make sure you understand it before writing.

column1:
700&What is one of the most important decision you have made? 
Why was this decision important?
column3:
<IN>When I was a third grade middle school student, I had to decide which shcool I would go. I hesitated a lot whether I should go to a science high school or not. <TR>At last,</TR> I made up my mind to go to a sience high school. <TS>I think that the decision I made two years ago was the most important decision I have made.</TS> There are three reasons why this decision is most important. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> Unless I had gone to other schools, I would not have studied deeper science and math.</MI1> <SI1>I could learn various and effective solving skills of math and sicence in the class. <TR>Above all,</TR> the most valuable experince I could have in my science high school was that I was able to do a lot of experiments most high students in other high schools cannot do. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I think that my high school period was more valuable than any others. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> I made many good friends while I was in my school.</MI2> <SI2>There were various kinds of friends around me. Some friends were so good at math that they won a lot of prizes. Some friends were very sincere and gave many lessons to others. <TR>Moreover,</TR> because the students of my school live in a school dormitory, they can share good information and encourage each other.</SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> all of the teachers of my school specialized in science or math, so they could teach their students more efficiently and easily.</MI3> <SI3>They were also very kind and always tried to help their students whenever they had a trouble with homework or experiments. I think that I could not have learned more things without them.</SI3> </BO3>

<CO>I could learn many lessons from my high school period. That was possible since I made a decision to go to a science high school and I don't regret to make that decision. </CO>
column23: Good essay!  I think it could be made a little stronger by changing your last main paragraph about the teachers.  People expect the teachers at a science high school to be experts in science and math.  Instead, why not write a paragraph about how the science high school experience helped you later in life?  Show that it has been beneficial for you.

column1: 701& It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3:
<IN>There are many ways a person can get knowledge. Two common ways are gaining from books and gaining from experience. <TS>While learning through experience seems to give a person his own knowledge, know-how, there are several disadvantages in adopting learning from experience over learning through books.<TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> we can get a great deal of knowledge through reading books.</MI1> <SI1>It is limited what a person experiences through his whole life. In contrast, books have all kind of profound knowledge that many people have gotten from their various lives. <EX>Suppose that a student must do his history homework. The best way to find sources of that is not experiencing history but looking up some historical books.</EX> It is no wonder that we can gain a lot of knowledge from just "reading" books. <SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>In addition to amount of knowledge, reading books makes a person get knowledge more efficiently.</MI2> <SI2><EX>When I was a fresh man, <TR>for instance,</TR> I had to summit a report about teacher's life. For collecting sources to write, I spent a lot of time and effort to meet some teachers. But only for several hours could Sumi, my close friend, get lots of sources through reading some books which is written by a teacher's association.</EX> Through reading books,<TR> in fact,</TR> we can attain knowledge more easily and fast. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>Although learning by our experience makes us attain sturdy and practical knowledge of our own,<TR> in my opinion,</TR> books are more important source of getting knowledge. This is because reading books gives us more knowledge readily and rapidly. Necessary of books will not disappear as man want to learn something.</CO>
column23: Your thesis statement is very misleading.  It makes me think you are going to talk about why experience is not useful, but instead you talk about why books are good.  You need to make your thesis statement focus on books, not on experience.  Also, your second main point is a little unclear.  Re-read that paragraph and think of a way to re-phrase it.  Otherwise, good job!

column1: 702&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is not exaggeration to say that education is ‘process of socialization’. When people are young, it is important what they saw and what they heard because it can be dominant behavior in their lives. Children are strongly affected by their parents because they spend most their times with their parents, especially in their childhood. <TS>I agree that parents are the best teachers whether they are good advisors or not.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> parents are the best instructor in linguistics.</MI1> <SI1>Children learn their most languages from their parents. There are lots of researches about the correlation between childhood and language. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> if parents are coarse in speech, children just follow their parents and speak badly, which even affects their behavior. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> most children follow their parents’ habits consciously or unconsciously.</MI2> <SI2>Children see what their parents do and just move to act. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my mother went to church and I thought Christian was the only religion in the world and all people went to church on Sunday.</EX> <TR>Of course,</TR> I can choose my religion when I realize that there are lots of religions in the world but it is not easy. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> parents have never given up their children even if children go away from the right path.</MI3> <SI3>‘Love’ is the essential to become a good teacher. The parents who love their children always take care of their children. When children are doing well, parents are happy praise them but when children are frustrated, parents cheer up them and give an advice.</SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> many people can be teachers but parents are the best teacher because children follow their parents’ speech and behavior and they trust their parents more than anyone. <TR>Thus,</TR> it is important that parents do their best to bring up their children. Even though it is not easy to bring up their children, they should carry out their obligation as a fosterer.</CO>
column23: There is so much about this essay that is good.  One thing that bothers me is that your argument, while very effectively defended, does not really answer the question.  The best teacher is the one that imparts the best lessons on the student.  Your argument says that parents are the best teachers because kids learn from them unconsciously, but that doesn't make them the best, just the most effective.  What do you think are the best lessons for children to learn?  What helps them the most in life?  Go from there and think about this topic again.

column1: 703&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students’ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Sports activities are as important as libraries for students because sports activities make students strong physically and mentally, give students fun and relax. <TS>I agree that University should give the same amount of money to their students’ sports activities as they give to their university libraries.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> sports activities are good for body: ultimately it affects mental.</MI1> <SI1>There is saying that ‘health’ is the most important. When people are sick, they cannot do anything but stay in bed. Students need quality libraries for studying but if they are sick, it is useless. In order to stay healthy, sports activities may be the best way.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> sports activities give students fun.</MI2> <SI2>When people do sports game, such as basketball, sky, swimming and football, it is fun as well as hard. During game, they walk/ run and shout/ laugh a lot. Unless it is serious game, they can enjoy their game. Students have obligation to study but also have rights to enjoy their school days. <SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> sports activities release the nerve from studying.</MI3> <SI3>Students get stress from their course work, friends, professors and something others. Although there are bunch of ways to solve the stress, sports activities especially, meditation is excellent for reducing stress. <EX>When I was a university student, <TR>at that time,</TR> I took the Yoga class. It was really good for my mind, not to mention my body.</EX></SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think University should invest sports activities as well as libraries. Sports activities help students to stay healthy, keep sound mind, release stress and enjoy their school days. I highly recommend that Universities should concern various sport activities that student want to do.</CO>
column23: A pretty good essay.  Your thesis statement is strong and you have organized your ideas relatively well.  Your first main paragraph (first main point) is the weakest.  If someone is doesn't exercise it doesn't instantly mean they are sick and bed-ridden.  I understand that you are trying to link good health to good studying, but you need to find a more convincing way to do it.  Your fourth paragraph (third main point) is the strongest.  Your main idea is strong, you back it up with good evidence and have a very good example.  Try to make the rest of your paragraphs like that one.

column1: 704&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:

You talk about how kids are affected by their parents, but not if parents are good teachers or not.  Read the question again and make sure you understand it before writing.

column1: 705&It has recently been announced that a new high school may be built in your community. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details in your answer.
column3:
<IN>How many high schools should be built in a community? I can say that our community, which I belong to, has too many high schools. Too many schools in a community may lead some problems like being competitive to other schools. Besides, it can bear many other problems. The specific problems and that I need to disagree that a new school should not be built in our community will be following. </IN>

<BO1><SI1>Our community is so-called 'an overheating community in education'. We have a lot of middle and high schools and many parents wish to have a chance to move to our community. <MI1>In this situation, if more high schools were built, too many families would want to rush to be here.</MI1> It will cause not only high prices of houses and everything for supplies but also extreme competitions among the schools. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Extremely competitive schools also lead that schools make students study too much.</MI2> <SI2>In our society, because it is common that the ultimate purpose in high schools is to be admitted to universities, students do not have to do anything but studying. <TR>In addition,</TR> if I mention about the parents who hope to get moved for children's education, they would give brides to teachers to make their children survived in overheating educational system and it brings about corruption of teachers who want to accept brides. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TS><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I strongly oppose the plan that a new high school is founded in our community because we have already many schools.</TS> If schools are in excess, that will cause many problems like increasing the price of everything including houses and supplies. In addition, students, parents, and teachers are also caused to other problems such as corruption of parents and teachers and forbidding doing nothing but studying for students.</CO>
column23: You make some good points, but your essay is pretty disorganized.  First of all, your conclusion sounds like it would make a better introduction than your introduction.  Your thesis statement comes at the end of your essay! It should be at the very beginning.  Also, your main ideas are a little disorganized.  I can appreciate what you are saying, but it takes more effort than it should to understand what you mean.  Reorganize your ideas a little bit, and it will make your paragraph easier to read.

column1: 706&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others likes to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I prefer to spend most of my time alone.</TS> <TR>Of course,</TR> it is good for me to have time with my friends. But personal time have various positive things. I'll discuss two of many affirmative things.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I can have time that I could arrange my thinking and I am able to do my job.</MI1> <SI1>I am always going to think many things such as my future and doing works. <TR>However,</TR> if I have not time I couldn't arrange my thoughts. If I cannot arrange my ideas I wouldn't carry out my duty. So my future will be able to mislead.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Secondly, I can many family affairs that I had put off due to my laziness.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>In my case,</TR> I had delayed my room cleaning. If I have enough time, I will clean my whole room. Besides I can help my mother such as cooking, laundering and cleaning the whole house</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell,</TR> I think it had better have the time to spend alone rather than pass with their friends. It is useful that I would think back to the past day and make new plans. Beside I can spend to my family, especially my mother. It should be give satisfaction to me. </CO>
column23: Not bad.  Your essay is a little short.  It would be good to put in some more examples, but since this is an essay on personal opinion, it's ok.

column1: 707&You have decided to give several hours of your time each month to improve the community where you live. What is one thing you will do to improve your community? Why? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3:
<IN>We live in a variety of environments. Each person has grown in different environment. The necessary thing to improve one's circumstances is also different. <TR>In my case,</TR> My city has no facility ready to communicate in internet yet. <TR>So,</TR> I had difficulties to talk the officials in the City Hall. <TS>So I wish I make a homepage that has two benefits: easy communication and convenience.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> by making a homepage, I can make a place that the officials and citizens are communicate each other easily.</MI1> <SI1>Many citizens have difficulties in delivering their problems related to taxes, or law, etc. Those may a delay in carrying out tasks. It may cause distrust between local officials and citizens. But If I make a useful homepage, these problems are solved easier because they are talking each other more.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> homepage has a advantage of convenience.</MI2> </SI2>If it is possible to talk about our problems in internet, we are of no use to take a bus to go City Hall. Through internet, we can deliver our problems, and we can save much time. The officials also don't have to face people in close. It is also expected that traffic jams can reduce by these convenience. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>Based the above mentioned statements, I believe that making homepage is the best thing I can do. By making homepage, I would like to see my community develops more</CO>
column23: Your essay is a little short, but you have written out your ideas very well.  One note on the main ideas: the way you have them worded makes them sound like the same thing.  The first one says, "it will be easier" and the second says "it will be more convenient".  Only after reading them again was I able to understand the difference in the ideas.  Try to make them sound a little more different.  Otherwise, good job!

column1: 708&In general, people are living longer now. How will this change affect society. Use specific details and examples to develope your essay
column3:
<IN>Have you ever thought people are living longer nowadays? If a number of people who are living longer are getting increased, how the society could be changed? It is most people’s desire to live longer since long years ago. By reason of a thing of this sort, people researched a lot of time to find a way to live longer. <TR>As the result,</TR> they made people living longer through various scientific discoveries especially in the field of medicine. But it isn’t a matter to be desired from all angles. It could affect badly in society.</IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> population will increase.</MI1> <SI1>If people live longer, death rate will decrease.<TR> Therefore</TR> population will grow higher. Then many problems like traffic jam, housing problem, environmental pollution will appear much more badly than today.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> labor power will be in short supply.</MI2> <SI2>On account of increase olds, people who could work in society will reduce. It causes a shortage of labor. And it is able to exert a bad Influence upon companies, such as decrease of productivity. It also affects nation’s economy badly by companies’ problem.</SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Thirdly,</TR> it will increase welfare facilities of old people.</MI3> <SI3>I saw many old people who are deserted by their sons and daughters on TV. It means many people don’t want to support old people even though they’re their parents. <TR>So</TR>, it is no doubt that old people need somewhere to live. <TR>Hence</TR> welfare facilities must be expanded, but it is not easy for our country to spend so much money to expand welfare facilities.</SI3></BO3> 

<CO><TR>It is true,</TR> people are living longer now than before. <TR>For this reason,</TR> some bad effects can appear in society as the growth of population, a shortage of labor, increase welfare facilities of old people, and so on. This can make society a little confuse. So we must understand the thing that will happen in the future, because of the swelling of old people. And try to conquer the situation. <TR>In this case,</TR> our society may grow to be more inhabitable place.</CO>
column23: Your essay has several flaws.  First of all, there is no part I could call a thesis statement.  Most of your introduction is unnecessary; your conclusion is awfully long, but it sounds like it would make a better introduction.  Your first main paragraph makes a lot of points quickly, but without examples or research. Your second main paragraph is a fallacy.  There will be just as many people in the work force, but there will be more old people too.  You make some good points, but you need to think this argument through and organize it a little better before attempting it again.

column1: 709&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People establish museums to commemorate famous people, or to show their particular culture, history, art and so on. <TS>Visiting museums give people lots of information of the new places. The more people know about new places, the more people enjoy their trip.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> by visiting history museums, people can quickly see the history of the region where they visit.</MI1> <SI1><EX>When I visited Ottawa, the capital of Canada, I toured the Civilization Museum. I could be familiar with Canadian history because they explained and showed their history in the museum. It was stronger than gaining knowledge from reading books.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> museums can tell what are the notable features of new places.</MI2> <SI2><EX>When I visited Nova Scotia in Canada, I toured the “salmon museum”. I was very impressed the fact that people who have lived there donated most exhibits as well as this region was famous for salmon fishing. I could learn why the salmon fishing was important for people who have lived there through the salmon museum.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> museums show what people cannot see in ordinary times.</MI3> <SI3>There is something that can be seen at the only museum. <EX>When I visited the museum of LeeSunShin, the famous Korean general at the ChoSun dynasty, I could see his books, clothes and so on. It was worth seeing them because I like him so much.</EX></SI3></BO3> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> people visit museums because of various reasons such as see particular exhibits, learn features of the new places and understand a history. I think visiting museums is the best way to be familiar with new places. <TR>Thus,</TR> I highly recommend that when people visit new places, they should consider visiting museums.</CO>
column23: Great essay!  You made me want to go to a museum.  My only suggestion is to turn your thesis into one strong statement instead of two sentences.

column1: 710&Some people say that it is a good idea to have the experience of living in another country. Do you agree ? Give examples for your answer.
column3:
<IN>In my neighborhood, there live two foreigners who work at big airplane companies near my town. I was so interested in their life and their culture a lot when I found that most of my neighbors are also curious about their life in my small town. <TR>After times flew,</TR> I could have a chance to talk to them and give hands to them when they asked me some help. <TS>Now, I can say that living in another country is such a good idea to enrich the quality of life throughout my two foreign friends’ story.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><SI1><EX>Their best favorite event of their daily life is going out and trying to have a Korean food at restaurant with me. Most of people who come from oversea say Korean food are really spicy but I could help them choose their favorite Korean food after trying food at many restaurant. <TR>Also</TR>, they like to see various cultural event around my town such as the exhibition of Silk which is very famous in my hometown and the annual festival which is also very traditional Korean style. </EX></SI1><MI1>I think new experience itself tells us the amount of worthy things in our lives even when they are in foreign country.</MI1> </BO1>

<BO2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I would like to mention about my experience when I lived in another country. <EX>I could have a chance to stay in the united state when I was a college student and study English.</EX> <MI2>Learning foreign language is also very attractive fact among lots of merits in living in another country.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>Certainly,</TR> I could improve my language skills for a short time compared with my friend who tried to learn English in Korea and also well- trained language skill helped me understand American culture as well as the united states as it self. That was really great time in my life and I can say that experience helped the quality of my life highly.</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>To be conclusion,</TR> sometimes people have a difficulty in living in another country with language problems or cultural differences but we can also think about the time what they can get after they overcome those some problems. There is a proverb, “ Try to buy experience when you are young” in my country which means reasonable experience is considered as a necessity in successful life. If I can find another chance to be able to live in foreign country, I will never hesitate to accept the chance.</CO>
column23: The ideas in this essay are pretty good, but it needs some organization.  Your main idea should be the first or second sentence in the paragraph, and it should introduce an idea you want to talk about.  Next can come supporting ideas and examples.  Your conclusion is quite good!

column1: 711&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer?
column3:
<IN>All parents in the world try to be good parents, but being good parents is not easy. <TS>I believe the qualities good parents require are giving confidence and sacrifice to their children, and helping their children's dreams come true.</TS> Through the use of a couple of examples, i will demonstrate why these qualities are important. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> I think good parents help their children have confidence, because confidence is sort of a power with which people can get over difficulties.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> a couple of months ago ,i got a driver's license. i started driving, right after getting it. <TR>Unfortunately,</TR> i got a big accident, so i felt quite depressed, and felt like i could not drive any more. While i almost lost my confidence, my dad encouraged me to try driving again, and he said such a thing did not give me any trouble. I became positive and tried it. Now, i am very good at driving. If my dad had not given me confidence, i would have given up driving.</EX> With this experience, i think it si important for parents to encourage their children to be confident. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> i also think good parents are dedicated to their children.</MI2> <SI2><EX>I had a problem with my right arm three months after i was born.<TR> Actually,</TR> i almost died. <TR>At that time,</TR> my arm could be healed. They took care of me through their efforts. My dad was a teacher in a rural area, so he should commute from the country to Seoul everyday.</EX> Now i feel grateful for their dedication. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> i believe good parents help their childrens' dreams come true.</MI3> <SI3><EX>My friend's sister is a renowned pianist. She said she was supported by her parents, so that her dream was accomplished. She was interested in music in her childhood, so her parents brought her a piano, and helpd her to study music abroad later. <TR>Eventually,</TR> she became a pianist with her parents'support, as well as though her efforts.</EX></SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> there are a lot of qualities of a good parents. However, the most things among them, i believe, are giving their children confidence, being dedicated to their children, and helping their dreams are carried out.</CO>
column23: This is a really great essay!  Good job!  It is well organized with good examples and a strong thesis and strong main ideas.  My only suggestion is to develop the second main idea paragraph a little more.  What happened to your arm that almost killed you? Why did your father have to drive to Seoul every day for it to heal?

column1:
712&We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker(someone you work closely with)? 
Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are importance.
column3:
<IN>People would be meet many people who different from characteristic and capacity in jobs. Because of dlfferenting from feature and skill, people do sometimes battling with own companion. <TS>I think that a co-worker should equip diligence, honesty, or humor sense.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> a co-worker should diligence all the aspects.</MI1> <SI1>For working own co-worker, we can often encounter a large number of problems. When we face troubles, I and my co-worker should diligent for overcoming the troubles. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I and my friend did project in last year, we encountered problem which couldn’t earn data. But we could collect much information because of diligently searching data together.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> a co-worker should always honesty.</MI2> <SI2>I heard from my parents “Honesty is one of the most important items”. For working together two or more, people shouldn’t deceive their co-worker. If what my co-worker deceived me know, I won’t believe him again. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Also,</TR> a co-worker should have humor sense.</MI3><SI3> We may be met a lot of people. For talking and trading with they, we should grap their sensation by stirring humor sense. But I haven’t such humor sense, so my co-worker should humor sense.</SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> people can better work if they meet a good co-worker. Although a co-worker hasn’t excellent ability and money, he would be a great co-worker if having diligence, honesty, humor sense.</CO>
column23: Your thesis statement is very strong and quite elegant.  Nice job.  Your argument is pretty convincing until your third main idea.  Saying your co-worker should have a good sense of humor because you don't is NOT a good reason!  I'm sure you can think of a better reason!

column1: 713&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that the study room is the most important room in their house ,and Others say the dining room. <TS><TR>However,</TR> If someone ask me what do I consider the most important room in my house, I will say that the restroom is more important than any other room in my house.</TS> There are two main reasons for my view : sanitation and a busy room. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, the restroom is the symbol of sanitation of the house.</MI1> <SI1>It is said to go to the restroom and look at its condition if you want to know how sanitary the house is. This means that the restroom is the most important room in sanitation of the house. <EX><TR>For examples</TR>, When I visited the house of my friend two years ago, I was surprised at the huge room and luminous furniture. Going into the restroom, <TR>however,</TR> I was much disappointed and unpleasant to know that the restroom was unclean, smelly, and messy.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> the restroom is the busiest room in the house. </MI2><SI2>The room which is most members of the family go into and out of most frequently every morning is the restroom. As most people are very busy every morning, my family is no exception, too. <EX>Father, mother, an old brother and I used to compete to enter the restroom every morning because all of us had to go to company on time. <TR>Recently,</TR> since we moved to the house with two toilets, we came to be less competitive.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> since it represents cleanness of a house and is the most frequent room, I think that the restroom is more important than any other room in a house.</CO>
column23: This is definitely the most entertaining essay I've read so far!  You defend your point quite well and your argument is quite interesting.  I may never be able to enter someone's house without looking at their bathroom again. However, I don't know if I would call it the busiest room in the house - maybe the most urgently necessary?  Great job!

column1: 714&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others likes to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>In the world, there are many people who spend differently their time. Some people pass most of their time alone and others likes to be with friends most of the time. <TS>I think that spending the time with their friends is more useful for us than spending alone. It make it for us to improve our relationship. And we will get many information.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> enjoying their friends will help well know our friends.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> last summer I went to go camping with my friends. We talked about many things such as our future and afflictions. Our relations have gained in intimacy by a chance.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> we will have amount of information such as major, midterm and final exam, professor's lecture and so forth.</MI2> <SI2></EX>When I register for my classes, I and my friends always help make a class schedule each other. In these progress of making, we share information with friends.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> people have various methods how they spend their time. <TR>In my case,</TR> I like having time with friends better than others. It makes it for us to share information and make better reference.</CO>
column23: This essay could definitely be longer.  You need to build on your ideas a little more.  Also, try to make your thesis statement one sentence with all your reasons.

column1: 715&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People should eat to live but people can enjoy eating itself. There are various ways for people to eat: prepare and eat food at home, eat at outside, order food or take out. <TS><TR>Of all these,</TR> I enjoy eating food at home because I like to cook, I can share my cook with my families and friends and eating at home is more healthier than eating at outside.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I like to learn new cookery and cook.</MI1> <SI1>Cooking is a kind of creation. Although people use the same ingredients, taste is different depending on how to cook. Whenever I cook, I found the result of my cook differed. I like eating at home because I enjoy cooking at home and enjoy the process of my creation.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I cannot afford to eat outside often and I hate to eat alone.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Therefore,</TR> I want to cook at home and share my food with my families or friends. If I eat at restaurants, it costs higher than eating at home. Instead of eating at restaurants, I rather prepare food at home. <TR>From time to time,</TR> I cook and invite my friends. They love to visit my home and eat my food. They always praise my cook and we spend lots of time eating and laughing.</SI2></BO2> 

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> people cannot guarantee food of restaurants.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Sometimes,</TR> it is announced that some food stands use the rotten ingredients. <TR>Moreover,</TR> it can causes people to be sick.<TR> However,</TR> if I cook by myself, I can choose my own ingredients: fresh fishes, meats and vegetables. I can take a time to cook unlike restaurants. There is direct correlation between food and health. People should consider what they eat.</SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>As a result,</TR> I like to prepare food by myself and eat at home with my friends and families. It is good for heath and good to save money. Leaning cooking helps me to improve my imagination ability and makes me happy. Sharing food is the best way to associate friends.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay!  Your thesis statement is very elegant.  Nice job.  Your reasons are very solid, and your last reason - quality of ingredients - is especially thought-provoking and interesting.  A few specific examples would be nice, but overall you've done a very nice job here.

column1: 716&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>As technology is developing, it can be possible to study without going to class. <TR>However,</TR> going to classes can help students to enjoy their school days as well as to study their course works. <TS>I believe that attending classes is essential for students because they can meet their friends through classes, attend to various discussions, and going to classes itself can be one of studies.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> that going to classes means students can meet their friends who study the same major.</MI1> <SI1>In class, they can talk, ask and share their information one another. Suppose that people study alone without attending classes. If they need help, they have to figure it out by themselves. It would take longer that borrow friend’s note.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> attending classes can provide a chance to take part in lots of discussions.</MI2> <SI2>People can gain knowledge from books or lectures but discussion is also good way to gain knowledge. While they discuss about some issues, they learn their discussion skill: how can express their idea and how can accept others’. Even if students can discuss though Internet, it is probably worse than attending directly because students can see the faces of panelists and feel the atmosphere.</SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> going to classes itself can be also one of studies.</MI3> <SI3>While students go to school, professors evaluate how students are diligent. No matter what weather is, if they should attend classes, it can discipline students to achieve their aim. <TR>In this point,</TR> I think it is worth that schools give students who participate all their class awards. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> attending classes is necessary to students. In order to enjoy school days, students had better make good memories. It will happen easily when they are with their friends and professors. I highly recommend that students should attend classes because attending classes is better than studying alone in various ways.</CO>
column23: You make some very good points.  Good job!

column1: 717&Some people prefer to spend most of their thime alone. Others like to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TR>Generally,</TR> it is said that introverts like to spend their time alone and extroverts like to spend their time with friends. I think I am an extrovert although I wants to be alone from time to time. <TS><TR>Personally,</TR> I would like to spend my most of the time with my friends because I like to talk with my friends, I was encouraged by friends and I can learn something from them. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> I really like to talk with my friends.</MI1> <SI1>I like to share my idea and listen to my friends'. While I am talking, I laugh a lot and feel my stress disappear. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I can understand my friend's situations and if I need help, I can ask to them because they know me well. When I stayed at home alone, I strangly felt I got depress without any particular reason. I think I am talkative. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> I like to play games with my friends.</MI2><SI2> I like swiming and dancing. I can do them alone, but it is hard to keep them. <EX>When I took a dancing class in my school days, I and my friends bought the same clothes. We fixed our positions each other and when I wanted to give up a difficult course, she encouraged me. If I was doing it alone, I probabley failed to pass that course.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> I can always learn something from my friends.</MI3> <SI3>I have had roomates since I atttended a university. Although we fight each other, I have learned how to control my anger and how to take care of others. I learned a lot from one of my roomates, Hee who is generous to everybody.</SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I would like to spend my most of the time with my friends. While we get along one another, we can give and take lots of things: fun, knowledge, love and memorry. Instead of staying alone, I rather learn something from my friends.</CO>
column23: A very good essay!  Nicely organized and defended.

column1: 718&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are two ways of complaining about a defective product or poor service. Some people prefer to write a letter to a clerk and others prefer to talk about dissatisfaction directly. <TR>At a glance,</TR> though, the disadvantages such as the volatility of a proof and the aggravation of the situation by impulsive action are really discouraging. <TS>However, I believe that the advantages of the latter outweigh its disadvantages by far.</TS> In this essay, I will demonstrate some reasons why supporting the latter is reasonable and justifiable. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, you can get quicker service when you complain in person.</MI1> <SI1>A letter takes time to go through the mail and to be answered by someone. <TR>However</TR>, if you complain in person, you can go back to the store whenever you want and you usually get someone to help you as you wait. <TR>For this reason,</TR> this is a better use of your time. <EX>Let me offer an example, I had sent my pants and a letter written some complains when my pants was shrink after washing. At that time I had to wait to change the pants during one month.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore,</TR> if you complain in person, you can explain yourself more clearly.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the other hand,</TR> if you writer a letter, you cannot be as clear as you can in person. As the Korean proverb say, one facing is better than one hundred letters. This means that the best way to make understand someone is talking in person except to writing. We cannot read any emotion and gesture of the other party through the letter because it has no eye and lip. Sometimes this weak point makes a lot of mistakes. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I support that a dialogue is easier to understand mutual opinion than a letter.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> complaining is never fun. <TR>However,</TR> if you have to complain about a low-grade product or service, it is often better to do so in person because you can talk to the right person, get quicker service and explain yourself clearly, and.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay. I think your conclusion makes a better introduction, though.  In your thesis statement, you need to state what "the latter" is.  A thesis statement should be able to stand on its own.  Also, while I understand your arguments and I think you support them well, I do think sometimes you can explain yourself better in a letter.  Maybe it depends on the person.  You are definitely right about it being faster, though!

column1:
719&Businesses should hire employees for their lives. Do you agree or disagree? 
Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>I disagree that firms should hire employees for their lives. In Asia, many companies lately are going to maintain lifetime employment. But after Asia's finance risk, we are going to point its many troubles. <TS>I think lifetime employment may make employees to decline desire and companies to weed out.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> lifetime employment is that firm will never fire employees.</MI1> <SI1>If workers enter any firm, they should work there for the rest of their life . It should be make workers to enervate. They will work like a clock for a whole day. If these progresses do over, they will be indifferent about their surroundings. They will not consider their desire and achievement of duty.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> companies will not adapt a free competitive market.</MI2> <SI2>Modern society is going to quickly change every day. Firms ought to fit to pace variations. <TR>Therefore</TR> they will need many efficient staffs. Original persons will lead the firm in the rosy future.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> the lifelong employment system has drawbacks rather than advantage. Some time ago we experienced IMP in Korea. In that time we dismissed many worker. Our neighbor underwent an amount of pain but our economy could get out of faster financial crisis than other Asia countries. So I insist that we constantly ought to cut staff reduction in our companies.</CO>
column23: Your points are great in this essay, but your organization needs some work.  Look at your thesis statement again.  You make two good points.  However, it is hard to find those points in your two main paragraphs. They are swimming around in there.  You need to make your main idea clear and close to what you said in your thesis statement. Also, your conclusion should not be longer than any of your other paragraphs.  I think you could take some of the things you say in your conclusion and add them to your second main paragraph!  Try to reorganize your two main paragraphs and make them clearer.  Examples are always a good idea.

column1:
720&In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. 
Do you think this is a good idea? 
Support your opinion by using specific reasons and details.
column3:
<IN>In most countries, many teenagers have part-time jobs while they do studying in school. Some people think teenagers having part-time jobs may have disadvantages. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> other people think teenagers having part-time jobs may have advantages. <TS>I think having jobs is a good idea for teenagers. Teenagers having jobs can acquire such merits as society experience, knowing the value of study and money.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> teenagers having jobs can society experience in advance.</MI1><SI1> Most secondary students do only studying while going school in. They don’t know society flow, haven’t capacity for corresponding at difficult problems. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> students having jobs can deposit their experience and have ability solving troubles. If they go in society, they can rapidly adapt rather than. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Also, teenagers having jobs can feel the value of study and money.</MI2> <SI2>A large number of teenagers hate studying in school and lavish their money for buying fruitless things. But if they work , they will be encountered a lot of problems. <TR>As a result,</TR> they will be realized the value of study and money. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> by having part-time jobs, teenagers will be matured rather than. They can learn a lot of abilities which acquire and need in society, can realize the importance of study and money. What Parents force children to have part-time jobs is a good method for nourishing their children.</CO>
column23: This essay is very good, although I had a little difficulty with the grammar.  Overall, you make good points. Try to turn your thesis into one sentence instead of two.

column1: 721&People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read; some exercise; others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3:
<IN>People who live in modern society cannot avoid getting stress. Among many solutions to salve this problem, people had better find their best ways to reduce stress. <TS>My best way is to do farming becasue it is productive as well as reduce my stress.</TS></IN>
