<BO2><MI2>Another different advantage of having a broad relationship is that we can learn a lot of things from other's experience.</MI2><SI2> We can experience another world through listening friend's talk. <EX>For example, I have nerver been to Australia before but I have some informations about Sydney's life style by hearing from my friend.</EX> <TR>Thus,</TR> sharing other's experience can be a good way of understanding our life.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>As I mentioned above,</TR> a large circle of acquaintance can make us to be more sociable, and broaden our understanding about our life. <TR>However,</TR> we have to be careful not to cling to the numbers of friends. I believe that we also have to try to keep one's own relationship strongly.</CO>
column23: A very good essay!  Excellent job!

column1: 754&Some people prefer to spend their free time outdoors. Other people prefer to spend their leisure time indoors. Would you prefer to be outside or would you prefer to be inside for your leisure activities? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your choices.
column3:
<IN>Whether one spends his/her own free time outdoors or indoors depends on his/her taste. And I think, it can also depends on his/her occupation. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> one whose works for a travel agent, he may prefer to spend his free time indoors while a programmer may want to go out instead.</EX> <TS><TR>In my case,</TR> I prefer to use my free time outdoors because I'm one of those who spent much of time indoors.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I can refresh my mind if I go out.</MI1><SI1><EX>If I climb mountain on weekend, <TR>for example,<TR> I feel free from my duties including job activities. All stress that I got from 5 days job diminish as I go up to the top of a mountain and this makes me get new energe for following week.</EX> <TR>Furthermore,</TR> a moment of deep rumination on the last week gives me a chance of good scheduling of future. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> I really want to say about friendship.</MI2><SI2> Usually, I don't climb mountain alone. I can do that with my friend, family, relatives or other people whom I want to be more familiar with. During climbing time, I can tell him about my hobby, religion, brother and sister, etc or ask them about their concernings. It's a good time for me to make better relationship with them after all. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>From these major two reason,</TR> I prefer to be outside for my leisure time. Even though there are some cases that I want to rest and stay home, I may go out and use my free time to enjoy fresh air and make better relationships with my close people.</CO>
column23: Good essay.  Your second main idea needs to state WHY you want to talk about friendship in that paragraph, though.  Relate it to the topic.

column1: 755&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television, newspapers, magazines, and other media pay too much attention to the personal lives of famous people such as public figures and celebrities. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your opinion.
column3:
<IN>If you want to be a famous man(like singer, talent, actor and so on) who is cheered and clapped, you might be shown your all private secrete reluctantly, and openly. It maybe painful and troublesome mentally and physically <TR>however,</TR> I contend that a well-known person should accept those responsibility for extra person. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>In society, there are lots of distinguished persons damaged by their private lives(or information) exposure.</MI1><SI1> A famous talent was chased by enthusiastic fans's much callings, another have trouble in taking a walk as people want to meet and touch him. What is worse, A notable actor was hit by his old sweat-heart as his old private history was exposed on news. He has retired himself to others and avoided mass communication.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>However,</TR> It is also true that they have a plenty of money, fame and popularity.</MI2> <SI2>They exercise their own privilege just they are famous. As they are treated heartly and kindly, I insist that they should obey much more duties and exposure of private livings than other common civilians. It is one of the notable's important liability; they must keep in mind an old saying 'Nothing gains without pains'. And <TR>also</TR>, They should control their own lives and rumors more carefully than commons. If a distinguished person think running away from these obligations, He(or She) also give up all of their wealth and fame, and apology his fans who have believed and acclaimed him. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Nowadays,</TR> There are so many juveniles dreaming celebrated man. Almost all of them imagine wealth and glory, but few imagine pain and obligations. It is certain that thinking only happiness may lure a man, moreover our society into the depth of misery. Therefore, Introducing 'Success story' in school or on TV, We are supposed to inform how much pains and adversities they tied over. Providing that someone become a celebrated person without perceiving social duty, unfortunately he would be isolated from society soon.</CO>
column23: All of your paragraphs say mostly the same thing, except the first main paragraph all about the downsides of being famous.  You need to organize your ideas a little better.  Also, where is your thesis statement?

column1: 756&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers .Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I believe parents are the best teachers, because they always advise and support children, whenever their children are in troubles, and how parents behave in life affects their children.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> parents are advisors for children.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR> ,i have had quite difficult time studying for a university-entrance exam. i had taken practicing exams five or six times for it, but i didn't do well, so i was depressed, and almost lost my confidence. When i was suffering with the results of the practicing exams, my parents encouraged me to try again, and they said success is achieved through many defeats. Thanks to their advice, i regained confidence, and finally could get a good grade on the real exam.</EX> If i had not had any advice from my parents, i might have had given it up. <TR>Therefore,</TR> parents are good teachers in that they always help and counsel their children who are in difficulties. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> the way parents live always influences their children.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For instance,</TR> both my uncle and aunt are so interested in reading books and seeing movies, so whenever they have free time, they enjoy reading books, and watching videos. their interests influenced their children. Their children get to like these things. so they ask their mom and dad to buy books for them, and, when they come to my house, the first thing they do is taking out books from a bookshelf. <TR>In addition</TR>, after watching a movie, they criticize how it was, and talk about it with their friends <TR>In other words,</TR> their parents' hobbies had a good influence on them. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>I agree with the statement parents are good teachers for children, because they play an important role as counselors all the time their children are struggling with troubles, and their instructive lifestyles always give good effects on their children.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, but I think it doesn't quite address the question.  Your essay shows beyond a doubt that parents can be a good influence on children and that their actions affect them.  However, is this really teaching? It sounds like an unconscious effect. What do parents knowingly teach children?  Why is a parent a better teacher than a teacher who is paid to teach a child?

column1: 757&In general, people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon. Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN><TR>Nowdays,</TR> it's fact that people are living longer than before. <TS>This phenomenon is caused by the development of the medical technology and the concern about health. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the medical development is the main reason to live longer</MI1>.<SI1><EX> <TR>For instance,</TR> scurvy caused by the deficiency of the vitamin C was a very dangerous disease for a long time. so many people died of illness beacuse they didn't know why people get illl. <TR>However</TR>, today, it is a very simple problem and is cured easily.</EX></SI2> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Next,</TR> the concern about health is important, too.</MI2><SI2><EX> <TR>For example</TR>, i smoked approximately for the past seven years, but i stop smoking lately.</EX><TR> Besides</TR>, people reguarly exercise to keep their health such as jogging, rope jumping and so on . All of the cases are done to maintain the health </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> people are living longer than before because of the medical development and the concern about health. so we should find out that people live longer but strong life.</CO>
column23: You make good points, but your main paragraphs are awfully short.  You've intrigued me with your argument - give me more information!  People take care of their health now. How is that different than in the past? What are some other ways health care has improved?  You have a lot you could say, so say some more.

column1:
758&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? 
Parents are the best teachers. 
Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many people in our lives who help us in different ways. Parents, teachers, 
friends and even neighborhoods are all precious to us. Among many helpers through out 
our lives, in my opinion, parents are the most important assistances and the best 
teachers. <TS>We can call our parents the best teachers since we imitate parents' behaviors 
and because parents correct us and teach us about lives.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> parents deserve being called the best teachers because we imitate their actions.</MI1> <SI1>Parents are the people whom we rely on and stay with for the most time. Thus we try 
to imitate them and to act like them since we love our parents. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I 
was a child, I tried to behave like my mom who used to and even now say to anybody 
"Well done!" if he or she did a great job. Now at school, I say to my friends "Well 
done!" involuntarily just like my mom.</EX> Because parents affect children most, they have 
right to be called the best teachers.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> parents are the best teachers because they correct us and teach them about 
lives.</MI2><SI2> The only people who can really point out and correct our mistakes with love are 
parents since blaming and pointing out others' mistakes is considered as a very rude 
action in my country, Korea. Sometimes parents teach their youngs about life and show 
them about it. Until the school age, children learn language and even customs from their 
parents. During the school age, parents help them get out of the adversities and teach 
them to be braver and wiser. Even after the school age, when children are all grown 
up, parents push them forward to success and hold them up to the top. Parents are the 
people who really teach us with love and care so they are called the best teachers.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I am so grateful to have and love my parents, the best teachers. There is 
no doubt that parents are the best teachers because children imitate their parents and 
because parents teach and correct their youngs with love and care. I would strongly 
suggest everyone in the world to be thankful to their best teachers, parents.</CO>
column23: You have written a really thoughtful essay, and I can tell you really mean what you say.  It is a very good essay. My only concern is your first point.  Just because parents have an involuntary affect on their children does not make them good teachers.  What are some other ways parents are good teachers on purpose?

column1: 759&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Boys and girls should attend separate schools. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>In Korea most high schools are not co-education. Teenagers study in school with their same sex friends their whole school life. <TR>Generally speaking,</TR> teens' curiosity of opposite sex is most energetic. Some people think that this curiosity can have some bad effects on teenagers. And this views made our schools non-coeducation.</IN>
 
<BO1>Coeducation system is made only for students to go to university. <TR>In my case,</TR> our schools boss believe that mighty rule can lead satisfactory consequences.<EX><TR> For example,</TR> our schools has many regulations. We can't grow our hair freely and must take part in school's schedule.</EX> But look back on my high school time, there aren't any beautiful memory. Of course students study more harder if there are no girl-friend or boy-friend. But studying is not everything in teenagers school life.</BO1>
 
<BO2>Schools do not only knowledge education but also cultivation of human nature. <TR>For example,</TR> right sense of man and woman can be learned more efficiently. Besides girl students can learn man's feature and boy's can learn woman's features like fineness. In addition, both can help each other. Just imagine a boy borrow girl's note and a boy explain a problem in mathematics for a girl. Also, boys can make many memorable things with girls. School holiday will be more interesting and various club activities will be made. <TR>As a result, school life will be more spicy and actual.</TR></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, in our school life university is not everything. Once we graduate our school, these times never come again. So our school life must be more diversified and memorable.</CO>
column23: I have no idea what you are trying to say here.  It seems like you approve of co-ed education, but you don't say that anywhere in your essay.  Your main paragraphs have no direction.  I don't understand what points you are trying to make.  Try this: Look at the question and make an outline.  First, write down whether you agree or not. Next, make a list of reasons why you agree.  Then, under each reason, write two things that support that reason.  THEN write your essay.

column3:
<IN>These days most part of people have televisions and watch them. Some people can think that television is so useful in respect that it have us much information.<TR> Of course,</TR> I agree this opinion, but television has so serious problem which is cause that conversation between parents and friends is decreasing so rapidly. <TS><TR>Thus</TR> I agree that television destroyed communication among friends and family.</TR> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firs<t,</TR> today many people watch television a great deal of time, and it made us get television poisoning.</MI1><SI1> <TR>For example</TR> My brother likes television very much, so he watches television every day. However his time to watch television is much. He knows that spending much time for watching television is bad, but he already get television poisoning.. from this respect, he almost doesn't talk with family and me, and he doesn't play outdoors so his communication with friends also is destroyed by watching television. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> when today adults were young, they almost didn't television, so they don't see television very well.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Futhermore,</TR> they don't know anything teenagers like, so surely generation gap occur and conversation decrease. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my father almost don't watch television , so they don't know any entertainer who is popular. <TR>Thus</TR>, I don't have topic to talk .</EX></SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In short,</TR> television has many disadvantages , which is that it made people spend much time to watch time and it cause generation gap so rapidly. <TR>in this respect,</TR> I agree with following statement, television destroyed among friends and family.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay!  You've done a good job. It would be good to add a little more information.

column1: 761&some people choose friends who are different from themselves. Others choose friends who are similar to themselves. Compare the advantages of having friends who are different from you with the advantages of having friends who are similar to you. Which kind of friend do you prefer for yourself?
column3:
<IN>There are some people who choose friends who are different from themselves, whereas some choose friends who are similar to themselves. Each of them has many merits and demerits, so it can be not so hard to find some differences in between those two ways of making friends. <TS>These two ways, preferring to make friends with people who are different from themselves or similar to themselves, can be contrasted in some ways as followed.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> There are some differences in sharing interests.</MI1><SI1> People who are similar to each other have a lot of things in common. <TR>Thus</TR>, they can easily share many things without an opposing opinion. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I have a friend whose interests are almost the same with me; We do a lot of things together with great satisfaction.</EX> People who are different from each other, <TR>however</TR>, may have not something in common, but on the contrary, they can also enjoy themselves sharing different and unusual things by experiencing that they never tried before. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we can also find a few differences in the way of dealing with difficult situations.</MI2><SI2> Friends, who are similar to each other, tend to react in the same way when they have to go through a worse situation together. It is not so hard to see that they make the same or very similar solutions in coping with problems.<TR> On the other hand,</TR> friends who are different from each other can have many kinds of solution through conversation though sometimes they make disharmony. <TR>Thus,</TR> they can choose the best way among many solutions and get over difficulties. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>As I mentioned above,</TR> there are each merits of their own between two aspects of making friends. In these two ways of getting friends, I like to make friends who are different from myself because of sharing different interests, different way of thinking. To some people like me, who enjoy themselves experiencing unusual situations, it could be more attractive to make friends different from themselves. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, it is also a good way of having wide life experience.</CO>
column23: This is a well-written essay, yet it is so non-commital that I don't know what to say about it.  I would have liked to hear more about your opinion in the body of the essay.  Also, your example in the first main paragraph is really weak - tell us about one thing that you and your friend have in common.

column1: 762&In some countries, people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think this is a good law or a bad rule? Use specific reasons and examples to support your positions.
column3:
<IN>It has been argued that laws banning smoking in public places represent an infringement on the “rights” of smokers to smoke when and where they please. Smokers may argue that if speech and worship can have legal protection, then why not smoking as well? This is, <TR>however</TR>, simply a specious analogy. <TS>I think that stautory restrictions on smoking are good rules for some reasons</TS>. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> smoking is harmful both to the smoker and to bystanders who breathe the smoke which he or she emits.</MI1> <SI1>It is generally accepted that one who is in the habit of smoking is more likely to have diseases than non-smokers.<EX> One painful story about my relatives tells that vividly. My grandfather smoked a lot of cigarettes from his early ages, so he died of lung cancer when he was 60 years old. To make the matter worse, my grandmother who had lived with him for almost 40 years died two years after his death for same reason.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> although one reasonably may claim the right to indulge in a harmful practice when alone, one may not claim a right to inflict harm on others by thay practice in public.<SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, smoking makes the places around the smoking area unplesant.</MI2> <SI2>If the smoke diffuses through the air, at first it becomes difficult for people in pubic buildings to breath, and then with the smoke, the cigarette butts and ashes can make the surrounding places dirty and filthy. In my office, there are several rooms, one of which has smokers, some of which have non-smokers, <TR>however</TR> one can easily find the diffences between them only by smelling the air and looking at the desk of the rooms. <TR>Thus,</TR> smoking in public places create unclean environment. </BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> even though smoking may be the personal taste, smoking in the places where many people are around should not be the smoker’s right for danger to other people’s health and places’ clean environment.</CO>
column23: Wow. A very strong and well-written essay.  Your personal story makes a huge impact.  Good job.

column1: 763&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>I disagree with that a zoo has no usefuf purpose because a zoo has a lot of useful goals. <TS>The zoo not only can serve a big pleasure to a child and helpful spaces, but also can see dircetly the animals which are difficult to see now.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> The zoo that has many animals and plants locate far from city, so gave us a helpful space which is similar to nature such as fresh air, a beautiful promonade and cool shade.</MI1><SI1><TR> In addition</TR>, children seen a big elephant, lion and monkey take a great enjoyment.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Next,</TR> nowdays there are many rare animals because of the environmental pollution and poaching.</MI2> <SI2>Those animals live to difficuit if without humans help. So, we have to take care of these animals in the zoo very well. If we didn't look after the animal, we might haven't seen these one like we didn't see a dinosaur more.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> A zoo has a great many of useful purposes, so we must develop the zoo facility more modern and the animal to live more comfortable. <TR>Therefore,</TR> we could avoid seeing amimals only in television.</CO>
column23: This essay looks like an outline.  It needs more ideas and supporting sentences! Examples! Research! Proof!

column1: 764&A gift (such as a soccer ball, a camera, or an animal) can contribute to a child's development. What gift would you give to help a child develop? Why? Use reasons and specific examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>When thinking of a present to give to a child, many think that gifts that help the child study academic fields is the best thing to give, like books, encyclopedias, and textbooks. <TR>However</TR> I do not agree with the opinion of these people. <TS>Rather than teaching a child one more page of school textbooks, I believe giving a child a board game as a present, supposing that the board game has many rules and needs many people to play.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> by letting the child learn the rules of a game, the child would be able to know that the society also has laws to follow.</MI1><SI1> This would also let the child know to keep things in order--later in while living in a larger society, he or she would know why he or she has to stay in line. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> if the child was losing the game, he or she would definitely try to win, even by changing the rules or cheating. <TR>However,</TR> since he or she would have companions playing with him, it would be impossible to do so. <TR>Also</TR>, if the child cuts in line, he or she would eventually learn that it would cause chaos.</EX> By giving a child a multi-player board game, I believe that the child would learn the importance of the societies laws and how to keep them in order to prevent chaos.</SI1></BO1>
 
<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, since the game would be based on luck and rules, it would be impossible for two people to win the game</MI>. <SI2>Since everyone would want to win, in the long run, the child would learn the necessity of strategies. <TR>Later,</TR> when the child grows up to a adolescent, he or she would recognize the importance of plans in life. <EX><TR>As an example,</TR> if the child was playing chess, he or she would need good moves and strategies in order to win the opponent. It would not be easy for the child to just win by playing without strategies. <TR>Like this,</TR> the child would grow up and set plans and goals for his or her life, which would make the child's life more meaningful and time-efficient.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I believe that the best gift to give a child is a board game that has many rules and needs many people to play. By playing the board game, the child would know that there are regulations and laws to keep while living in the society. <TR>As an influence,</TR> the child would learn that in to prevent chaos, it would be best to take turns. <TR>Moreover</TR>, since everyone enjoys winning, the child would know how that plans are essential--later making goals and plans to accomplish during social life.</CO>
column23: Wow. This is a 100% perfect, thought-provoking essay.  You've convinced me to get a board game.  Really excellent job!

column1: 765&In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Do you think this is a good idea? Support your opinion by using specific reasons and details.
column3:
<IN>It has been argued that whether it is necessary for teenagers to have jobs while they are in schools. Some people may say that teenagers should not work for money, because they need to focus on the studies provided by schools. <TS>I think, <TR>however</TR>, having jobs in schools is usually good for teenagers for several reasons.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> they can learn the the value of money.</MI1><SI1> <TR>In general</TR>, teenagers get the money from their parents and spend it freely for whatever they want, such as, books, concert tickets, and so on. If they have to earn their own money for those things, they will change such attitude toward money. <EX>When I was in high school, my father, who had been in manufacture company, unpredictably got fired from work due to sudden bankruptcy, <TR>therefore,</TR> I had to get part time job in a bookstore for several months, there I got paid 10,000 won per month. Since then I have spent money more prudently than before.</EX> As that experience illustrates, earning their own money can teach teenagers priceless lessons.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, teenagers can get the sense of responsibility from works.</MI2><SI2> When they get employed, they have to be at work on time and can not leave the work undone. <TR>Also,</TR> if they work in a group and someone who work with them can not work for some reasons, like sudden car accident, sickness, then teenagers should take up his or her work, and vice versa. <TR>Besides,</TR> in order to carry the work efficiently, they may voluntarily cooperate with co-workers. Thus through works, teenagers can be responsible and cooperative. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> some jobs help teenagers decide their future profession.</MI3><SI3> There are a lot of occupations in our society from lawyer to musician, which give us some opportunities to work for part time jobs. Although such jobs may seem trivial at that time, we can find and develop our aptitude and finally decide our callings.<EX> I could determine my future career working at bookstores where I happened to read books about my major. </EX><TR>So,</TR> jobs can be a source of the future work. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>All things considered,</TR> if the jobs do not affect the studies which teenagers should at least learn and are not excessive, having jobs along with studies is beneficial to teenagers.</CO>
column23: An excellent, well-focused, well-written essay.  Good job!

column1: 766&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>Vacation system in school differs from countries to countries and schools to schools. Some people may argue that it is better for students to have one long vacation, because it gives the students sufficient rest. <TS>I think, <TR>however,</TR> several short vacations are more beneficial to students than a long time vacation for some reasons. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> students can spend time efficiently by some short vacations</MI1>.<SI1> <TR>In general,</TR> students tend to waste time when they are given much time to spend. <TR>On the contrary,</TR> if they have little time to spend, they will spend the time more prudently. <EX>I have experienced both two kinds of vacations in schools, when I got a long term holidays for about two or three months, I was at a loss what to do and usually wasted time just oversleeping, playing computer games all day long, but when I had short term holidays, because there was no time to waste, I had to concentrate on something important, such as making up for previous studies and visiting the intimate relatives.</EX> <TR>As those experiences illustrate</TR>, divided short vacations can help students manage time effectively.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> several short vacations can help students study well.</MI2> <SI2>If students are given a long vacation and they do not study regularly, they will probably forget something provided by previous classes. <TR>On the other hand, however,</TR> short vacations do not break the rhythm of the studies, so the students can easily go back to their studies. <EX><TR>In my case,</TR> a long term vacation made me lazy and loose, so I could not adjust myself well to new classes, but short vacations hardly affected my studies.</EX> <TR>Thus,</TR> short vacations are beneficial to academic achievement. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> no one denies that it is good for people to have a well -planned long vacation. I think, <TR>however,</TR> for students, who have to concentrate on studies, to spend time wisely and study effectively, several short vacations are probably better choices.</CO>
column23: You have a very good writing style and you organize your thoughts well.  A few observations: you rely a little too much on transitions.  Try to cut down on them a little.  Also, your examples in your two main paragraphs are pretty much the same.  Try to make them different. Overall, you did a good job!

column1: 767&How do movies or television influence people’s behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>Many people in modern society always watch TV or movies. Statistically Korean have spent time to watch tv about 3 hours in a day and movies about two times a month. <TS>So I think that they were influenced in various ways. On the one hand there is positive effects, on the other hand a negative effects.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR> I want to say about positive effects.</MI1> <SI1>In my view of point I had many useful things through tv or movies. <EX><TR>For example</TR> a few years ago I saw soap drama about never giving up person. At that time I failed to enter university, therefore studied for going there and had much difficulty in studying hard. However I made up my mind studying harder when I saw TV drama.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another point of view is negative effects</MI2>. <SI2><EX>Last year there was a cruel accident that a student killed his classmate at school. Many companions usually annoyed him several ways. The early days he endured beyond strength but long before he was no more bearable. One day he came to school with a jack knife and stabbed the head of them to death. When he arrested and said “I saw the movie ‘Friends’ over 100 times.” </EX>It was the best movie in Korea last year.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO>As I mentioned above people have an effect on TV and movies. Though they have two sides of influences, it was obvious that they affect people’s action. The important thing is that they will put the man to the right roads.</CO>
column23: Essays like these work a little better if you choose a side.  Argue for the good points or the negative points.  Your thesis sounds pretty weak if you don't choose a side and so do your main points.  You could write a lot more than just one supporting point and example if you are trying to talk about positive points AND negative points, so this essay could be longer.

column1: 768&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are some people say that students should have several short vacation throughout the tear; there are others say differently. These two opinions have their own reasons. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think that students should have one long vacation each year. There are two major reasons for this; experiencing something special and getting money through a job. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I think that students need many activites without their study of school.</MI1><SI1> <TR>Actually,</TR> many students hope to travel in new places and want to experiencing interesting fields. Any student goes to other countries during long rest-time. Another student learns driving and get a driver's licence during her or his long vacation. These activites make students better. If short vacation is provided to students, they would not able to undergo anything that needs long time. You cannot deny that students can improve through long vacation.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> students can get some money for signing up for class through working.</MI2><SI2> <TR>According to research,</TR> many students start to work since taking vacation. <EX><TR>Vertually,</TR> I often worked in a cafeteria and a book store, so I could not only make money enough to paying tuitions of next class, but also prepare adaptation of society life.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> working during long vacation has many advatages to us.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO>Because of two major reasons above, I prefer that students have long vacation each year. By spending time throng many experiences in their vacation, the quality of students' life can improve. </CO>
column23: A good essay with good points.  Good job. Your thesis would be stronger if you combined it into one strong sentence.  Also, be careful saying things like "you cannot deny that..." because someone almost certainly can.

column1: 769&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Boys and girls should attend separate schools. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>In Korea most high schools are not co-education. Teenagers study in school with their same sex friends their whole school life. <TR>Generally speaking,</TR> teens' curiosity of opposite sex is most energetic. Some people think that this curiosity can have some bad effects on teenagers. And this views made our schools non-coeducation.</IN>
 
<BO1>Coeducation system is made only for students to go to university. <TR>In my case,</TR> our schools boss believe that mighty rule can lead satisfactory consequences.<EX><TR> For example,</TR> our schools has many regulations. We can't grow our hair freely and must take part in school's schedule.</EX> But look back on my high school time, there aren't any beautiful memory. Of course students study more harder if there are no girl-friend or boy-friend. But studying is not everything in teenagers school life.</BO1>
 
<BO2>Schools do not only knowledge education but also cultivation of human nature. <TR>For example,</TR> right sense of man and woman can be learned more efficiently. Besides girl students can learn man's feature and boy's can learn woman's features like fineness. In addition, both can help each other. Just imagine a boy borrow girl's note and a boy explain a problem in mathematics for a girl. Also, boys can make many memorable things with girls. School holiday will be more interesting and various club activities will be made. <TR>As a result, school life will be more spicy and actual.</TR></BO2>
 
<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, in our school life university is not everything. Onc
column23: I have no idea what you are trying to say here.  It seems like you approve of co-ed education, but you don't say that anywhere in your essay.  Your main paragraphs have no direction.  I don't understand what points you are trying to make.  Try this: Look at the question and make an outline.  First, write down whether you agree or not. Next, make a list of reasons why you agree.  Then, under each reason, write two things that support that reason.  THEN write your essay.

column1: 770&In the future, students may have the choice of studying at home by using the technology such as computers or television or of studying at traditional schools. Which do you like prefer? Use reasons and specific details to explain your choice.
column3:
<IN>As the technology develops increasingly faster, there are a great number of high performance facilaties such as on-line education or television. Some people think that traditional education is better while others think technology-based education is better. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> to study at traditional schools is much more beneficial to students since it give students a chance to make friends with peers and to acquire a hands-on knowledge from their teacher. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> by learning in traditional schools, we can make friends.</MI1><SI1> In school days, a person's radius is crucially important in their future. Without this school education we cannot easily meet a person who have the same inclinations to me. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in the middle school, I almost always met classmates and interacted with them about our hobbies and assignments. By doing these activities, I could get along with them easily.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> we can gain hands-on experiences from our teachers hands-on experiences and we can verify it directly in the lab.</MI2><SI2><EX><TR> For instance,</TR> when I was in the electrical engineering course the professor taught us how to solder a electric curcuit board and the way to make a amplifier which is widely used to operate a radio.</EX> Therefore traditional education is more emphasized in terms of detailed, clearly verified knowledge. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I strongly support the opinion that studying at traditional schools is indispensable to our life because of its opportunity to make friends and direct method to acquire specific knowledge. If I had to choose between the two, I would definitely opt the traditional education.</CO>
column23: A very good essay!  The only thing that could make it better would be to make it a little longer.

column1:
771&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others like to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? 
Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many kinds of spending time. Some people like to be with friends most of their time and others like to spend their time alone. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> to spend time alone is a lot more beneficial to me because it gives me a chance to cultivate my expertise, budget my allowed time efficiently, and meditate deeply in my behavior. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> when I am alone, I can develop my skills efficiently.</MI1><SI1><EX><TR> For example,</TR> I can search the internet or go to the library to gain information related to my electrical engineering job such as how to make amplifier and how to make a optical fiber.</EX> Acquiring these kinds of information is indispensable to me to keep up with the competitive job market. So I can well adapt to it.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> by spending time alone I can budget my free time.</MI2><SI2><EX> When I was with my friends, I was forced to go to the movies, hiking, swimming. Although I don't like it, I often allured to such activities since I don't want to left with my friends. Thus I can barely allocate my time to study unbeknownst to me.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR> It is crucially important in that time allocating.</SI2></BO2> 

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally.</TR> I can have a break to consider myself peacefully by being alone.</MI3><SI3> I really don't like noisy atmosphere. Thus calm environment enables me to ponder my previous behavior and thought in detail. When i am alone I can concentrate my meditation so I can have a peaceful mindset and refresh everyday' businesses. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I am strongly in favor of being alone since I can develop my specific skills, budget my time in my own method, and retrospect my past experiences in minute.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 772&do you agree or disagree with the following statement? there is nothing that young people can teach older people. use specific reasons and examples to support your position
column3:
<IN>It is usually thought that there is nothing that young people can teach older people, in many cultural societies. Because older people have abundant experiences, it seems to be true. <TS><TR>However</TR> I think young people can also teach older people something, such as, new ways of thinking and progressive attitudes.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR> new ways of thinking can be learned from young people.</MI1><SI1> Many old people depend on the fixed wayof thinking according to their prior experiences. These are sometimes helpful to solve the problems, but sometimes new ways of thinking can be more supportive to solve them. These can be achived from young people, so I am sure that there is something that young people can teach older people. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore,</TR> a progressive attitude can be learned from young people.</MI2><SI2> Because older people have gone through many difficulties, they tend to avoid the challenge. They think challenges will cause other hardships. However this kind of thinking is wrong, because a progressive mind can offer older people a vital power. <TR>Therefore</TR> a progress attitude might be another thing that is useful to learn from young people.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO>It is important to realize that young and older people can help each other by teaching each other. Regarding the progressive mind and new ways of thinking, it is absolutely true that there are many things useful to learn from young people</CO>
column23: You have a very good writing style and you organize your thoughts well.  My concern with this essay is that the two points you make are very similar. They could be the same point.  I would consider trying to find a different second point.  For example, young people can teach old people concrete things too, like how to use technology.  Finally, can you think of any examples to add to your essay?

column1:
773&ou need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. 
Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. 
Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are many different types of transportation which I can use to travel from my home to a place 40 miles away: on foot or by bicycle, bus, car, or train. <TR>Of these ways,</TR> traveling on foot or by bicycle is impossible for me because 40 miles is long distance. <TS>The reasonable ways I can use are traveling by bus, car, or train. I think that traveling by train is the optimal choice.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1>The first way to go 40 miles is using a bus.</MI1><SI1> Although it may be cheaper, it takes longer and be less comfortable than using a car or train. <TR>Also,</TR> the bus often makes a lot of turns, slows down, and speed up, which makes me feel sick, especially when I try to read a book. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>The second way is using a car. </MI2><SI2>The car may be more convenient and faster. However, it requires much attention of a driver. If I drive my car, I will have to pay attention to driving, and can’t read a book or do anything except driving. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> I am likely to be too tired because of long-time driving. </MI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>The final way, which I prefer, is using a train.</MI3><SI3> <TR>In the case of me,</TR> the train is a perfect way to travel 40 miles. The ride is so smooth that I never suffer from sickness. I can also read, sleep, or do a lot of things in the train. <TR>In addition,</TR> I can watch a great amount of view from the train windows because I do not have to pay attention to the road. </SI3>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> if I need to go 40 miles, I will travel by train rather than by bus or car. Traveling by train is more comfortable and less tiring. <TR>Also,</TR> I can enjoy the beautiful view while traveling by train. I firmly believe that no other transportations match trains.</CO>
column23: For this prompt, you have written a very suitable, well-organized essay.  Good job!

column1: 774&You have received a gift of money, The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to supports your answer.
column3:
<IN>People have money and they usually spend money for their cultural information or beauty. Some people want to purchase a piece of jewelry that they want to wear for beauty. While others want to buy concert ticket for their cultural information. <TS><TR>In my case,</TR> I would buy concert ticket that I want to attend because of information about unknown musician and reducing stress.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> If I have enough money, then I will buy concert ticket Because of musician about who I do not know.</MI1><SI1> There are many famous musicians and every day concert is help in many places. But I do not know every musician so I wander what kinds of musicians who I do not know. So If I would purchase concert ticket, I could go to concert place, then I could know about characteristics of their music. Therefore through concert, I could gain information about unknown musician. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> concert give me opportunities of reducing stress.</MI2> <SI2>Interesting concerts such as comic performance usually offer joy and happiness. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was high school student, every day I experienced trouble school affairs like difficult mathematics assignments and unfriendly relationship with my friends. <TR>By chance,</TR> I got a chance to attend a concert of rock bands and I reduced my stress of the school life.</EX> Ardent concerts always give people a lot of opportunities of decreasing stresses. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> If someone give me a lot of money which is enough to buy a piece of jewelry or concert ticket, I will buy concert ticket. Because I can gain knowledge about artists who I do not aware and have the chance of reducing stresses. I suggest many people should buy concert tickets rather than a piece of jewelry for these reasons.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, although your first point seems a little weak.  What if you went to a concert and you didn't like the music?  Wouldn't that upset you? Can you give an example of a time you went to a concert of a band you were unfamiliar with and had a really good time?

column1: 775&If you could meet a famous entertainer or athlete, who would that be, and why? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are many famous entertainer or athlete in the world. Some people like a comedian and others like a runner. <TS><TR>In my case,</TR> If I could meet a famous entertainer or athlete, I definately meet a well-known singer Michael Jackson because of his creativity in making popular music and contribution to improving economic condition in underdeveloped countries.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> I would like to meet Michael Jackson since he has composed and sang a great number of popular music.</MI1><SI1><EX><TR> For example,</TR> his hit songs such as "beat it", "heal the world", "thriller" are the most hit songs from in the 1980s to in the 1990s. His music has a fast beat and his tune exactly fits the words. Most people were attracted his overwhelming his stage manner and his fever in the music. If people see him on television, they certainly felt like seeing him because of these. <TR>In addition,</TR> we also know about his winning many American music awards and academic prizes.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I would like to see him. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> I want to meet Michael Jackson because he has done so much about donating the money and concert to make the world comfortable and peaceful.</MI2><SI2><EX><TR> For instance,</TR> in the 1993, he went to Africa to care for children who were suffering from famine. Children did a hard work nineteen hours a day in order to live. So Michael gave donation to them and he was called as a lifesaver that time. As well as that, he performed a lot of concerts all around the world in order to publicize the situation in many desolate countries and gave all the profit to the poor countries.</EX> So I come to like him and also wish to meet him in this reasons. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> if I have a chance to see a person, I would like to meet Michael Jackson because he is recognized as not only a world's popular singer but also a saver people in destitution.</CO>
column23: A well-organized essay with good points.  Nice work!

column1: 776&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3:
<IN>It has been argued that it is necessary for children to help their parents with houseworks. Some people may say that children need not assist with household works, because those works are very hard and even dangerous. <TS>I think, <TR>however,</TR> children can learn the sense of oneness and develop good personality through houseworks, therefore I agree with that statement.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> children can realize the importance of families.</MI1><SI1> <TR>In general,</TR> when they are infants, they do not know what the families are: they just accept everything from their parents. As they grow up and take part in family works, such as cleaning rooms, washing dishes, they become real family members. <EX>When I was young, my mother, who was pharmacist and always busy with works, usually gave me some works, like dumping out trash can, shopping some commodities. <TR>At first,</TR> I was so reluctant to do that work, but gradually I came to know what made mother do that.</EX> That was sense of oneness. <TR>Thus,</TR> children can get the true feeling of families through household works.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> children get the sense of responsibility with houseworks.</MI2> <SI2>As the society develops and changes rapidly, the family members, especially parents become more and more busy with outside works. As a result, children need to not only take care of themselves, but also take up some housework which used to be a parent’s works, such as shopping or even keeping their house. <EX>Until I was 16 years old, my parents both had jobs so I had to clean my room and even my whole house everyday, and sometimes when my little brother got severe fever, I took him to the hospital. At that time I thought it was too hard, but that experience gave me a priceless lesson.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> houseworks can teach children some lessons. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> although childhood is important period for play and study, some moderate houseworks are good for children providing sense of family members and good personal traits.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! Nice work!  My only concern is that your first main point is a little bit vague.  I'm not really sure what you mean. It seems like it could be tied in to your second main point.  Can you clarify it a little more>

column1: 778&Your school has enough money to purchase either computer for students or books for the library. Which should your school choose to buy? computer or books? Use the specific reasons and examples to support your recommendation.
column3:
<IN>Both computer and books help a student to study so it is good for a school to have a library and the computer room. Considering the financial plan, a school should invest the only one part of them: computers of books. <TS><TR>In my view,</TR> a school have better to buy computers for their students first.</TS> There are reasons that computers should be purchased instead of books. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> new computers will make an educational system better.</MI1><SI1> A computer helps founding and searching and gathering the informations easily. development of technology also should be adopted to the field of education. Computer will make students to study and teacher tutoring efficiently. Computer enable to extend study time above the class through a internet that enables student to share their ideas each other and teacher.<EX> During I took a lecture through internet I could share my opinions with class partners easily and teacher gave advices about questions and distribute data related to the lecture. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> computers in school give fair opportunities to use them.</MI2> <SI2>Despite of computer's usefulness in studying, stated above, not every students have their own computers. Each computers they own have a different level in quality, even there are some students who do not have personal computers in our country. In the light of this economical gap of the students, a school should give them a chance to using them that doesn't out of date. <EX>My friend whose major visual design sometimes complain that her computer' break down ruin her work while her class mate who have good computer make assignment without any problem. <TR>In my case,</TR> I spend many ours in school but have a difficult in access to internet to waiting for using them.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In short,</TR> school need to equip computers for developing study system and giving fair opportunity each student to use a computer. A school willing to invest to their students will purchase computers. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay.  Your first main paragraph is excellent.  Your second one needs a little work.  First, your main point is a little misleading.  My first thought was that books also give people an equal opportunity.  The body of the paragraph clarifies it a little, but your last sentence is very confusing.  I would take it out to strengthen the point.

column1: 779&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds, cats, or other animals as member of their family, In your opinion are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answers.
column3:
<IN>Is it good for people to have a intimate relationship with their animals, such as birds, dogs, cats, and so on? Some people may argue that having a relationship with pets is not a good choice, because pets can make much noise, and therefore would be a great nuisance. <TS>I think, <TR>however,</TR> it is a good custom to treat pets as family members for several reasonos.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> we can learn from pets about sincerity and loyalty.</MI1> <SI1>Pets are usually loyal to their owners by following any order that is given to them and sometimes they even sacrifice their lives to save and protect their hosts and hostesses. This can be illustrated by this occasion. <EX>There was a news report in my country that a certain dog saved the old man who had been a dog’s keeper and was almost burned to death because of a fire by rolling his body to extinguish it and taking the owner out of the house.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> pets can show us good qulities that people should possess in a group society, especially in family.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> pets can become excellent friends.</MI2> <SI2>Merely seeing a dog running, jumping, rolling and barking, we can get out of the daily stress. <TR>Thus,</TR> pets have been traditionally useful companions to people, especially little babies and the old. <EX><TR>Once,</TR> my grandfather, who was seventy years old then , bought a little dog named ‘merry’ and used to take the dog wherever he went, such as park, grocery store, even bed. But when the dog died because of unknown disease, he was so sad that he would not eat anything for several days.</EX> So, because of the friendlieness, pets make a good family members. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> treating pets as family members contribute to saving wild life.</MI3> <SI3>The rapid development of industry has destructed our environment so utterly that living animals have lost their lives and habitats. If we take good care of some living animals, our planet would be a better place for wild life and even human beings. Thus having a pet as our family member is useful for conserving the environment. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up,/TR>, although having pets involves many unpleasant problems, such as, making noise and breeding cost, I think it is good practice, because of many positive aspects mentioned above.</CO>
column23: For the most part, this is a good essay, but there are some flaws. First, the example of your granfather makes pets seem like a bad idea. It is a negative example.  Try to use a more positive example.  Also, your third point does not make any sense, unless you are suggesting that people take wild animals as pets.  Try to think of another reason, or take that paragraph out.

column1:
780&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? 
A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that a zoo is not useful and unavailable to us, because they think it is not pragmatic and practical. <TS><TR>However</TR> I believe that a zoo not only has useful purpose fully but also give power of life time to us.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> it give us educational information especially to children.</MI1> <SI1>We have got along with many livestock such as chicken, pig, dog, cat and the like. But we do not have the time to meet the animals that we have seen and heard from many books in our childhood. And a zoo give the chance to see them as well as to learn about them. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> it make it possible for our lifetime to be heartful.</MI2> <SI2>Often have we lots of stress in our social life, and we know that we have to solve it for our health of mind. At the point of view, going to a zoo is one of the best choice for it. Going to the zoo, not only we can get amuzement from seeing them but also we can get away our grief. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>In conclusion, i argue that a zoo do not useless and it is not unavailable to us. <TR>More over,</TR> far form thinking of it's nonuseful purpose, i am longing for getting a zoo to be located in my neighborhood.</CO>
column23: I can understand your first point, but your second main idea doesn't make any sense.  You could say that going to a zoo helps to relieve stress, perhaps.  This entire essay needs to be longer.  Develop these ideas!  Use evidence! Use examples!

column1: 781&Your city has decided to build a statue or monument to honor a famous person in your country. Who would you choose? Use reasons and specific examples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of persons who made remarkable contribution to our country. <TS>Among them, I think King Seiong, who was one king of Yi dynasty, is the most important person, because of his inventions and great devotion to our people and country. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> he invented and developed many useful things.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>Above all,</TR> he conceived and made the first Korean letters: Hanguel. Since then our people had used the Chinese letters, which were difficult to read and write. <TR>However,</TR> the new letters were so easy to read and write that even a non-educated people could communicate their thoughts through Korean characters. <TR>Besides</TR>, he invented water clock to get the precise time for farming and improved gauge system.</EX> With all those inventions, the Korean people could lead advanced lives.</SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> he made a great effort to enhance the people’ welfare.</MI2><SI2> <EX>When harsh weather made people have few crops, he distributed the food which was kept in king’s palace to the poor for free and when there was a dispute among people, he readily went out to listen to their opinions.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR> all people respected him sincerely and even neighborhood countries, such as Japan and China admired him enviously. <TR>Thus,</TR> he was the king for the people. <SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> he protected our country and people from enemies.</MI3><SI3><EX> There were threats from foreign countries, so he sent brave soldiers to wherever the enemies endangered his people to secure their life. Driving the enemies away, he could also enlarge the territory. <TR>However,</TR> he did not want to kill other people, instead he treated the foreign people like his family members , thus they came to admire him as their governor. At the frontier region foreign people along with new immigrant from inside of the country became harmonized each other. <TR>Therefore</TR> King Sejong was a brilliant governor.</EX></SI3> </BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> if other countries thought so highly of this foreign king, why should we not honor him with a monument? If our city has the opportunity to build a statue or monument to honor a famous person in my country, I will definitely choose King Sejong</CO>
column23: A great essay! I like the question you pose at the very end. Very persuasive!

column1: 782&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>As the industrial society developes and changes with rapidity, we are less likely to have time for having a meal at home. Some people may say that it is better to eat out than to have a meal at home, because they can save time and energy for a meal. <TS>I think, <TR>however,</TR> eating at home is better than eating out for several reasons.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> there are some sanitation problems in food made at food stands or restaurants.</MI1><SI1> <TR>In general</TR>, because such food is treated as one good provided for people who are not seller’s family members, those who make and offer that food would not have interest in sanitation of food. This can be illustrated by this occasion.<EX> Once I had a hamburger at food stand for lunch, and I got severe stomache and diarrhea for two days, so since then I do not even think about eating fast food.</EX> <TR>On the contrary,</TR> at home, because a housewife herself may prepare and make food for her family members, the meal is usually clean and sanitary. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> making and eating at home is more economical than eating out</MI2>.<SI2> Due to the development of farming and transportation, we can get fresh food materials, such as vegetables, meats, ingredients at any time and at the nearest store for relatively low price. And they sell the food which can be easily made for a meal that it takes less time to make a meal than before. <TR>Therefore</TR> we can save time and money by eating home-made food. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> food made outside home tends to be malnutritious.</MI3><SI3> Fast food, so called junk food, usually contains high fat and low protein that anyone who likes to eat such food are likely to become fat and unhealthy. One medical report says that children who have much fast food tend to be more agitated and hasty than those who do not and do less. But at home because our mothers and wives are always concerned about family member’s good health, a meal made by them is likely to be not only delicious but also nutritious. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>All things considered,</TR> no one denies that some decent restaurants provide excellent food and sometimes we need to go there to celebrate a special day, such as some family member’s birthday. <TR>On the whole, however,</TR> in perspective of sanitation, efficiency and nutrition, making and eating a meal at home is better choice. </CO>
column23: This is a very good essay.  You make good points about the benefits of eating at home.  Your use of transitions in this essay is pretty good, but watch them carefully.  Make sure you don't use too many.

column1: 783&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throught the year. Which view point do you agree with? Use specific resons and exa,ples to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>There are two kinds of vacation for students. One is to spend their time in single long vacation each year and the other is to spend their time in a several short vacations each year. Each method has its distinctive characteristics. <TS><TR>In my opinion, </TR>I am in favor of the statement that students should be given one long vacation each year because they can meet their family more frequently and refresh their minds.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> to spend their time in single long vacation each year gives the school students a chance to meet their relatives.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in the dormitory in the first semester in 2001, I missed about my parents and brothers badly. But I couldn't get there because my dormitory vacation program is not allow us to come late far into the night. And also the distance from the dormitory to my home is too far for me to commute in a day. So I have requested dormytory advisors to chage their policy related the vacation systems for lots of month. At last it came true by a dean's admission. So I can have the six short-term vacations in the semester. </EX> After the incident, students can get in touch with their parents or friends more.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> to spend their time in single long vacation each year refresh their minds.</MI2><SI2> In the very stuffy library and classroom, we cannot always become concentraed. <TR>Therefore,</TR> it is desperatly needed for us to find a break to relax about a couple of days. Accordingly, in the short-term vacation plan, students can fully enjoy it. After students rest a several days, they can recharge and refresh their energy, thus making it easy to study efficiently as well as concentrate more.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> to spend their time in single long vacation each year is every bit beneficial since students can use the short-term vacations fully with their families and they can also refresh their minds.</CO>
column23: I followed your argument completely until the second paragraph.  It seemed that you switch to the short term argument instead of the long term.  That paragraph is very confusing.  If you are saying that students need some time to relax, you need to have some evidence to prove that a short vacation isn't long enough. Otherwise, a short vacation is still relaxation time.  Fix that paragraph and you will have a good essay.

column1: 784&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throught the year. Which view point do you agree with? Use specific resons and exa,ples to support your choice.
