column1: 785&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think that good parents must have much money, understand and love their children, and own a good quality as a teacher.</TS></IN>
<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> economic statility is indispensable for a good parent to maintain their happiness.</MI1><SI1> If children have no money to buy a book, and cannot go to school because of the deficiency fo money, we cannot regard our parent as a good mother and father. </SI1></BO1>
<BO2><MI2<TR>Senond,</TR> a family is consist of love.</MI2><SI2> When parents take care of their children sincerely, children can follow their parents, too. The chileren who lack for love from parents often could see that they have run to a wrong way. </SI2></BO2>
<BO3><MI3><TR>Next,</TR> I believe that a child learn much of information, as well as wisdom from our parents in a daily life.</MI3><SI3> <TR>Therefore,</TR> parents always should qualify their ability to explain, when chiledren ask them what the problem is. </SI3></BO3>
<CO>In conclusion, it is never easy to become a good parents. For that reason, we should keep our ready to do a good parent in a ordinary times.</CO>
column23: Look at this essay.  You must realize that it is very short, much too short for a test.  If you are going to claim that only people with a lot of money are good parents, you are going to need a lot more than what you've written to prove it.  All of your paragraphs need to be longer and have more examples and support.  Your conclusion makes absolutely no sense.

column1: 786&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>I disagree with the statement that parents are the best teachers. In older society, parents are only peresons who teach social or cultural knowledge to their children. <TS><TR>However,</TR> due to the improvement of educational circustances and many other factors, children can learn not only their parents but also lots of other people.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> recently there are a lot of educational instituntions where children can learn.</MI1><SI1> These institutions mean both public school and many other academis. Especailly in Korea, it is very difficult that children enter famous university without taking extra educational coursese. <TR>Therefore,</TR> most children forced to attend various academis. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I learned piano, English and many other things when I was 6 years old. So the effect of parents less and less.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> recently lots of women participate in social activities.</MI2><SI2> Because many women have their own job, women no longer do housewife work or take care of their children. <TR>Therefore,</TR> many children in young ages attend kindergarden and spend most of the time with other teachers, not parents.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>Of course</TR>, the relationship between parents and children is more important than any other relationships. But, in educational fields, it isn't. I think that parents are not the best teacher in education, but the economic, pyschological supporter. </CO>
column23: You have started a great essay.  You make some very interesting points and your ideas sound very strong.  Now you need to build this essay up a little more with more examples and support.

column1: 787&What are the important qualities of a good son or daughter? Have these qualities changed or remained the same over time in your culture? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many good qualities that a son or daughter should have to become a good family member. A list of them would fill the several pages. <TS><TR>Among them,</TR> I think, filial piety and patience have been traditionally needed for a good son or daughter.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> one should be loyal to his or her parent.</MI1> <SI1>we have been taught and trained to respect the parent. As a rule, people in every country think highly of a person who is willing to follow what his or her parent want. <TR>Likewise,</TR> in Korea, filial piety has been the most important quality that one should have, that when sons or daughters take good care of their parents, they are admired, otherwise they are severely criticized.<EX> <TR>Recenlty,</TR> there was a news report that some high school student had his kidney cut and made it implanted to the body of his father who suffered from fatal kidney disease, Thus that story illustrates, faithfulness to parent is good trait for a son or a daughter.</EX></SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another good character is patience.</MI2><SI2> In a group society, like family or school, one should follow some rules and discipline. For a family member, a son or daughter must accept the order and advice which the parent give, until he or she become physically and economically independent from the parent. <EX>When I was young, my parent usually made me do some work, such as cleaning the house or washing dishes, which I thought was a troublesome extra work. <TR>However,</TR> through those works, I have learned one priceless lesson : patience makes a good son.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR> tolerance is another good personality. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> to be a good son or daughter, one should have loyalty to the parent and patience above all. <TR>In addition,</TR> if all sons and daughter keep those good qualities and practice in real life, our societies will be more harmonious and pleasant.</CO>
column23: Very good essay!  If you take the transition out of your thesis, it will be stronger.  Also, your example about the boy giving his kidney to his dad sounds really extreme to my Western mind.  It was a shock to read about!  Your essay is well-constructed.  Good job.

column1: 788&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many reasons why people go to college instead of getting a job after they finish high school. <TR>However,</TR> many people who enroll a college may be deeply considering getting a good job as follow reasons. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> in the college, they will have such many choices that students can select majors which is related his or her future job they wanted.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance,</TR> someone can have a literature major if one wants to be a writer or one who hopes to be a doctor can choose medical school. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> after people enter a college, they will have excellent lectures from professor which is closely related their future job.</MI2><SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR> they can easily upgrade their skill. <TR>In fact</TR>, if they get a good mark, Employers of companies consider them having good talents for their company.</SI2></BO2> 

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> they will have chance to get a higher education like entering a graduate school course in college,only if they want, after they graduate their undergraduate course.</MI3><SI3> <TR>Furthermore</TR> if they are lucky, a few of them will be a specialist like a professor. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>All things considered,</TR> the main reason why people join in college in spite of high tutuion, long time consuming, many of them consider it investment for a better ob or at least job-related.</CO>
column23: Look at the size of your essay.  It is very short.  Now look at how many transitions you have.  There are far too many.  You don't need to have one in every sentence.  Also, there is no thesis statement!  Read the essay again and try to summarize it in one sentence.  That can be your thesis statement.  Put it in your introduction.  Finally, you have good points, but your essay needs to be longer.  A paragraph is supposed to have 4 to 5 sentences in it.  Yours have 2 or 3. You can turn this into a good essay, but it needs work.

column1: 789&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>It is easy to become a parent, but nobody says it is easy to be a good parent. Probably, no parents do not want to be good parents. They migh try, but it is not always succeed, for several reasons such as not having time for their kids and patience. <TS>There are qualifications to be a good parent. It might difficult to act upon, but it is not imposible. The followings are some tips for requirements of good parents. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>The very first step to become a good parent is talking to your children a lot.</MI1><SI1> In this kind of individualistic society, families have rare chances to have communicate with each other. The intimacy among family members which comes from the communication have decreased in the most homes. This lack of conversation between family will cause serious problem. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> your child may have problems in school and want to get advice from you, but he is afraid of talking to you since you seems really busy. Then he will not ask for your help untill the problems become out of control.</EX> <TR>In this regard,</TR> you should talk to your kids as much as you can. Be a good listener and don't hesitate to advice your children to solve their problem. In this process of communication, you can build more closer relationship with your children as well as become a good parent. </SI1>

<BO2><MI2>The most important quality of a good parent is patience.</MI2><SI2> Parents are human. <TR>Thus,</TR> they can be tempremental. They might sometimes have emotional explosion if their children do not listen to him. They may use abusive words to their children or even beat them. We've seen some parents who beat their own kids. If you use this violent ways, <TR>in the short term,</TR> your kids can be obedience, but it will not good ways for both you and your children in the long term. Parents who abused their children because of unheld anger may regret about what they've done since they love them after all. The bad effects of this ways more profoundly afflict the kids. A sensitive kid might have these painful memory for his lifetime. <TR>Moreover,</TR> he may undergo phycological problem which resulted from pysical and emotional suffering. <TR>In sum,</TR> if you want to qualified for being a good parent, avoid the bad words or conduct toward your kids and be patient. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> to be a good parent, you should have conversation with your children a lot and be patient. These are the simple truth, but it is easier said than done. If you just don't listen or talk and act impatiently to your children, they are afraid of you and have bad feelings toward their own parent. Then, you might be more angry since they do not respect you anymore and you will use more offensive behavior or words to your children. As long as this vicious circle contiues, you can never be a good parent. </CO>
column23: Wow. What an excellent essay.  This reads like something out of a magazine. For the sake of testing, try to make your thesis statement stronger.  Think of it as the heading for your essay - try to fit the main idea of your whole paragraph into one sentence. Great work!

column1: 790&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>Living in a dormitory is an important part of school life for students, because they spend most of the time there. Some people may say that it is better for students to accept the roommate whom the university select, because of saving time and efficiency.<TS> <TR.As for me, however,</TR> choosing my own roommate is a better choice for several reasons : happy life, study improvement and harmony.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> we can lead a pleasant life by choosing our own roommates.</MI1><SI1> There are many kinds of persons who have different personalities such as sleeping habit, preference for food. If a roommate who is chosen to live with me has a totally different character from mine, then life in a dormitory would be miserable. <EX>When I was a freshman, I lived in a dormitory room with a senior student who usually sat up all night doing computer games. For a year l could not sleep well because of the noise. </EX>As that incident vividly illustrates, when we ourselves select the person who has similar taste for our roommate, we enjoy the happy life in the university.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> it is also beneficial to the studies.</MI2><SI2> If we have a roommate who has same major or same classes, we can collect data and exchange information efficiently so that we can improve the studies. <EX>When I was a junior student, I shared a room with a student who had same major that we made a study group and could be easily prepared for exam. As a result we both got good grade that year.</EX> <TR>Thus,</TR> we can achieve academic goal easily by selecting our own roommate.</SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> it is difficult for students to have their own roommates because the university can hardly satisfy all the students by allocating roommates to them. <TR>However,</TR> if the situation provides, it is better for students to have their own roommates ; thus so students can live happy lives and heighten the studies. <TR>In addition,</TR> that police would harmonize university with students. Then, why not choose our roommates?</CO>
column23: The organization of your essay is great, but I'm finding your reasoning a little flawed.  Being able to choose your own roommate does not guarantee happiness!  Your example in the first main paragraph shows that not choosing your roommate could make you unhappy, but it doesn't show that choosing your roomate WILL make you happy. When I was in college, I lived with my best friend from high school, and after a year of living together we stopped being friends.  I also didn't get much work done.  You need to think about this a little more. Think of all the problems and all the things that need to go well for your topic to work.  Also, your idea that allowing students to choose their own roommates will harmonize them with policy makers should not be in the conclusion. If this is a valid idea, you should put it in your essay and defend it.

column1: 791&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of qualities that a good parent should have. <TS><TR>Among them,</TR> I think that a good parent should at least have these three aspects : economical ability, patience and not having favoritism.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> a parent should have enough money to support the family.</MI1><SI1> <TR>In general,</TR> a family needs a lot of money to spend : buying essential commodities, paying housing rent and so on. If the parent do not earn much money and their children have to work for money, their lives, especially the children’ lives will become miserable. <EX>This can be illustrated by my case. When I was young, my parent both had their own jobs and made much money so I could concentrate on the studies without worrying money problem.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> until the children become independent of their parent, a parent must have considerable money.</SI1> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> another quality that a good parent should have is patience.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In general,</TR> the children are likely to make some mistakes or be resistant to parent’s normal order. <TR>However</TR>, if a son makes a mistake, the parent instantly scold or even hit him severely then situation get worse and can never be recovered. <EX>My parent have never said curse words and used rod to me, instead they just waited till l got to realize my mistake. That attitude gave a great impression to me, and big help to my future life as a parent.</EX> <TR>Therefore,</TR> tolerance is good trait for a good parent.</SI2> </BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition,</TR> a good parent should avoid favoritism.</MI3> <SI3>In school, so called “teacher’s pet” can break the harmony of the students and schools, likewise, if a parent give their love only certain family member, then the house will become desolate and quarrelsome place, <EX>There was a news report that some high school student whose parent had been used to give their affection only his brother killed his parent because of extreme hated.</EX> As that incident vividly shows, a parent should be fair in their love.</SI2></BO3> 

<CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> although it is difficult to satisfy all the family members, a good parent at least should be financially independent, patient and impartial. <TR>Also,</TR> a parent must practice such qualities in actual life before they demand others.</CO>>
column23: You have defended your essay extremely well.  The language you have used is persuasive and you have great examples to back it all up. Excellent work!

column1: 792&When people move to another country. Some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with the specific details.
column3:
<IN>As the transportation systems are increasingly improved in recent years, the needs for having trips become more frequent than the past. <TR>Therefore,</TR> in the stream of globalization, people often need to move to another country. Some people decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Each has its own advantages. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> I prefer following their customs because it can avoid the conflict among between them and we can understand more their customs every bit. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand,</TR> following their customs, we can avoid the conflict among between them and we can more understand their cultural customs.</MI1><SI1> There are so many cultures in the world. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in some culture, they share their wives or have more than one wife for their entire lives.<TR> On the other hand,</TR> in other countries, man can only the one wife in their life. To the travelers in the latter countries will not experience strange things but to the travelers in the former may undergo a culture shock.</EX> In this case if we follow their rules, we can avoid conflict with them and somewhat understand their situation easily. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand,</TR> not to follow the customs of the new country is advantageous in that we can give them a curiosity as a cultural diversity as well as we don't lose our identity as a foreigner.</MI2><SI2> <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I was in nine years old, I made a showing trip to California to represent our nation, Korea, about the martial art called Taekwondo. There were many kinds of people to watch my play. And I show them kicking, jumping, and punching. <TR>Therefore</TR> I gave contribution to the nation in terms of the cultural diversity and also my nation's characteristics of martial art.</EX></SI2> </BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> although stick to their own customs are beneficial to them in some respects, I am in favor of the opinion that to be assimilated in the country there during the residence is better since we can escape the conflict with them and more make out their culture easily.</CO>
column23: Your style and organization and both great.  You write very well. However, your argument doesn't really seem to go with the question.  The prompt is asking if you think foreigners who move to a new country should give up their traditions and live like the people of the country or if they should keep living with their own customs. Example: Should a Musilim woman take off her veil and start eating Korean BBQ if she moves to Korea, or should she continue to wear her veil and eat no pork because she is not Korean? Your argument sounds more like a plea to travelers to be open-minded when traveling in other countries.

column1:
793&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. 
Which do you prefer? 
Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer
column3:
<IN>Some people want to do something in a group, and others want to be individually. Whatever they prefer, these are very important points that they may be progressed by doing so. Studying is concerned with these facts relatively. If someone is willing to study alone, they maybe expect to solve some problems oneself or to be volunteer. However people who want to study in a group of friends are eager to know their present ability and to advance by competing. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> it is good for students to study with peers.</TS></IN>
 
<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> because students can realize their positions of studying, learning in a study circle is beneficial method to convince oneself.</MI1><SI1> If they learn alone, because they can't know their capability, in spite of making efforts to achieve something, they would be confused. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> studying with others makes them know their weak parts and plan concretely. To do so, their accomplishment will be better than before eventually. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>More importantly,</TR> studying in a group promote someone to improve by competing others.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Of course,</TR> too passional and impulsive rivalry isn't rather than private study. However proper competition in right intention to develop one's ability is one of the best way to learn. <TR>For instance,</TR> if someone know others' achievement and that is better than someone's, he/she would make efforts for better one than others'. <TR>As a result,</TR> it is doubtless that studying in a circle help one get purpose. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, studying with associates is very progressive and developable method. The way studying alone also help students be independent or active. <TR>However,</TR> despite changing habit, this way of studying can't help students keenly. <TR>From the point of view,</TR> I think studying in a group is rather than alone</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay. Try to reword your main points - they don't make too much sense.  The rest of your paragraphs are fine!

column1: 794&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of persons whom I favor or hate. The dormitory is a kind of society that is make relationship. Selecting my own roommate have advantage : good relationship, similar life style. <TS><TR>However, as I will illustrate,</TR> to assign a student to share a room by university is more better.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> to assign a student to share a room by the university is rational.</MI1><SI1> If each of students in dormitory choose his or her roommate, assigning a student brings high cost. Choosing own roommate spend long time, because the university have to collect each student's favor, computerize those and then assign. <TR>Forthermore,</TR> how will assign a roommate with freshman. They do not know other dormitory person.</SI2> </BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> in dormitory we get a chance to make new friends.</MI2><SI2> To know many person is a kind of property. If each of student in dormitory select his or her roommate, he or she choose the his/her friend or already know person.</SI2></BO2> 

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR> : to assing a student to share a room by university has benefits; chance to make new friends, faster and more economical. Take a chance to make new friends. They will give various infomation, and then you will grow up.</CO>
column23: This essay has the potential to be great.  You make very good points (although you may need to reword your first main point, or at least explain it a little more).  Now make the essay longer.  Back up your good points with research, examples and other support.

column1: 795&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a business. Which would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3:
<IN>The one who is a faithful family man wants to buy a house instead of a business. Of course, having a house could give me pleasure. <TS>However, if I have only one choice, I would select a business rather than a house as follow reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR> of all, managing a business could give me better pleasure than owning a house. </MI1><SI1>The reason I want to have a business is because I want not only to be a self-employed businessman,but also take a chance to make money. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, I like the works related business rather than housework such as gardening, lawn cutting, because most of works in a house are time-consuming and hardworking despite no salary. </MI2 ></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, I can have more occasions to meet many people, communicate with them naturally, and get much more information through business then staying at home. It must be helpful to me, considering my career development. </MI3></BO3>  

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, the selection might not be easy decision of which choice gives me a better satisfaction, because it could bring me a different happiness. However, Owing a business has a priority to me, because of more merits. </CO>
column23: Well organized essay. Needs work on grammar and usage. Elaborate on your examples

column1: 796&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate?
column3:
<IN>Sharing room is not easy because each person has his or her own particular habit. <TS>What people share their room requires lots of ability: endurance, understanding and generosity. I think when I myself choose my own roommate I can get long with my roommate easily. Thus I want to choose my roommate by myself. </TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1>I can share a room only on this condition that the student is not a morning person. I am an extrovert and easygoing person. In spite of all my merits, I cannot put up with a morning person. </MI1><SI1> Even though there are so many things that I don't like, getting up early is the worst. I can bear anything but working at morning. If the university assigns a student to share a room with me, nobody knows that the student is a morning person or not. If the student is a morning person: wake up so early, I should give up sharing room with the student. Conversely, if I have a power to choose my roommate by myself, I will live with my friend who has a similar habit with me. One of my friends is a night person like me. We wake up lately but we enjoy staying up midnight. Of course, she and I are different and fight each other sometimes but it can be possible to reconcile and compromise. </SI1></BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another</TR> important reason that I want to share my room with my friends is that I want to have a deep relationship with my friends.</MI2> <SI2>While I share a room with my friends, we can talk our problems each other. Five years ago, when I shared a room with my friend, our relationship was love-hate one. However, in spit of love-hate relationship, she is my best friend and whenever I have a problem, I trust she can help me. I am not sure that I can make that kind of relationship with a new face. I might happen but nobody guarantee.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I want to share a room with my friend who I know and trust because I can put up with her habits. Moreover, I can share my problems with her. What I share a room with anonymous is little bit dangerous because if I may hate the student. </CO>
column23: Basic essay structure is there. Needs a more developed thesis and better transitions.  Grammar and word usage could also be improved.

column1: 797&A friend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on a vacation or buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your friend’s two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3:
<IN>Given a choice between going on a vacation and buying a car, some people may choose to buy a car because of the convenience. <TS>I think, however a vacation can provides some rest, fun, and lessons so I would rather recommend the first choice to my friend.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, having a vacation can give us some rest. </MI1><SI1> Every day we are likely to get much stress from work or studies. If we can get out of the stressful daily life and take a rest for some time, we can work or study more easily next time. Once I got totally tired of my work which had made me work two weeks all night long, then I decided to go somewhere; I went to some rural region by train by myself and just relaxed myself for several days. After the rest I could recover to my work easily. On the contrary, owning a car is much stressful activity; it needs a lot of money from insurance to maintenance and we should always cautious about traffic, road condition. Therefore, going on a vacation is better choice for a rest. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, going on a vacation offers us much fun.</MI2> <SI2>In general, there are a lot of things to do outside: mountain climbing, fishing, hunting and just strolling with a pet. When I went to Euroupe for a backpack trip, I was considerably amused by old museums and castles which I read and saw only in books or movies. On the other hand, when we drive a car, there is constant possibility of collision so we can hardly enjoy the beautiful scenery outside. Even a nice place, after I drove back to my home, I was completely exhausted. Thus, having a holiday is more enjoyable than buying a car. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, we can learn a lot in a vacation. </MI3> <SI3> There are a lot of places which give us some lessons: museum, zoo and some old temples. I have learned a lot from many museums in France about art and history which were my favorite subject in high school. However, buying a car give us just self-satisfaction and them make us more wasteful. So, going on a vacation is more educational than buying a car. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, although a car can give us some convenience such as going anywhere easily, a vacation offers more relaxation, entertainment and lessons so I would readily recommend my friend to go on a vacation. Next thing that we should do is how to plan and enjoy a vacation well. </CO>
column23: Solid essay format with clear intro, body, and conclusion but lacking in sentence structure and grammar.

column1: 798&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people hehave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are a lot of clothes that we wear in every daily lives : jogging suit, school uniform, and pajama. Some people may argue that even if a person wears different clothes every day, the person’s personality remains the same. <TS>I think, however, on the whole people behave differently according to their clothes ; because we expect them to do, they are required to do on specific clothes and we can do best on some clothes.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, some clothes need someone to perform special duties. </MI1> <SI1> An army general or navy captain wears unique military clothes and they are expected to do something important, such as demanding orders and inspecting the barracks. Likewise, we anticipate a clown who puts on funny clothing to carry out some entertainment. When I was in middle school, most of the students wore student uniforms; compared to the students in these days who wear their own clothes, they were more likely to conform to the school rules. Thus the clothes make the man. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, clothes can make people do the thing best. </MI2> <SI2>In general, clothes fit to some specific purpose, such as sporting clothes, casual wear and formal dress. Therefore according to the clothes which we wear, the modes of acts are likely to be changed. Here is a hypothetical case, when some man is to meet his friend ; if he wears casual clothes he can enjoy every activity, but if he wear formal dress, he can hardly enjoy outdoor sports freely. So, the clothes make man’s behavior. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, a king is a king even if he wears a clown suit. However, the clothes, on the whole, represent the person’s profession or status, and make us fit for some activity. We should all recognize the importance of the relation between clothes and human behaviors and choose carefully proper clothes in case. </CO>
column23: Grammar and more style could be used in sentences to make the essay flow better.  Also the thesis could be more clearly defined.

column1: 799&It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>More people gather in a big city from the countryside in these days. For a big city has more convenient traffics, more facilities like huge department store and bookstore and more spaces for cultural activities. <TS>However, I think it is better especially for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city because a village has more chances to experience the great nature and there is fewer crimes in a country than in a big city.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Children who grow up in the countryside can experience the nature wherever they want.</MI1> <SI1>They have the nature just next to them, so they usually play in the natural ground rather than play with computer games. It makes them much familiar with nature; undoubtedly, they get to know about the nature world such as wild lives of various plants and animals. In addition, their character will be more cheerful and joyful than the children who play only with computers without friends. Therefore, it is more helpful for children to live in the countryside than in a big city. </SI1></BO1>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Next</TR>, children in the countryside are less opened to dangerous crimes.</MI2> <SI2>We often see kidnapped children by criminals on TV. On the whole, it does not happen in the countryside, but in a big city. Also, there are more possibilities of car accidents in a big city, because there are much cars there. In this point of view, parents in the countryside would worry abut their children less than in a big city. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>It is true that living in a big city looks nicer and happier. But in fact, children in big city have narrow-mind and more intolerant than children in the countryside. Finally, it will not be helpful for them to grow up in a big city from the infant for their entire life. </CO>
column23: Well composed intro, body, and conclusion.  Lacking in word choice and grammar.

column1: 800& When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People complain when they are dissatisfied with the product they've bought. There are several ways complaining to a person. <TS>I strongly assert complaining in writing than in person.</TS> I could be too much emotional when I grumble at the problem, and I'm a little shy to complain in front of many people. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I could be less impulsive by writing my complain. </MI1> <SI1>Writing makes me to be calm and organize my thoughts. I might say something wrong by talking in person, but writing allows me to erase and rewrite my opinion. It helps me not to make mistakes in front of other people. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, talking to other people makes me shy. </MI2> <SI2>I do not like to talk to the people I don't know especially when I'm saying something negative. Writing helps me to figure out problem like this. I'm more at ease when I write in the privacy of my own home.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I prefer to address problems in writing because I get embarrassed easily, and I don't have to argue with others and loose tamper. Writing is the best choice for me. It is the best way for me to communicate, and when I have problems with my friends or situations at work, I always decide to write out my feelings. </CO>
column23: Basic elements of an essay but could be supporting arguments could be seriously expanded.  Also, grammar and sentence structure could be improved.

column1: 801&When famous people such as actors, athletes and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Nowadays, many people listen to famous entertainers or athletes on TV. <TS>I don't think we should pay attention to these people. Many of them are lack of knowledge and there are other people who would tell us more valuable experience. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, most of the entertainers and athletes have only a little amount of knowledge. </MI1> <SI1>They say things without understanding the meaning of them. For example, a famous singer in Korea was solving a quiz problem on TV show. The question was to spell the word 'rose' in English. She wrote the letter 'l' instead of 'r'. Everyone in the audience laughed at her, but she didn't realize what was going on. She has shown the foolishness of the entertainers. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I believe there are some very important people who do not get paid enough attention to. </MI2> <SI2>There are better role models who would give better advice to us than a beauty queen or a famous singer such as Martin Luther King, Maya Angelou, or John Glen. There are many people in neighbors we can listen to: parents, grandparents, and friends. A child can learn much more from his/her teacher than from an actor on the TV screen. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I do not think we should listen so closely to the words of famous people because they don't have as much knowledge as normal people and there are more substantial people we should pay attention to such as adults in our home or an educated person. </CO>
column23: Grammatical errors and vocabulary usage are the downfall of this essay.  Thoughts could be more effectively presented.

column1: 802&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Choosing one between a piece of jewelry and tickets to concert is a very difficult problem. Jewelry and concert ticket both have some advantages. <TS>If I have to choose one, I would choose a concert ticket because it enables us to escape from our everyday lives and it also helps us to relieve stress. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>The first</TR> advantage of choosing a concert ticket is that we can get out of everyday lives for a short time. </MI1> <SI1>When we go to a concert, we usually get absorbed in a concert. Thus, during the concert, we can forget about problems in our lives and feel happy. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Another</TR> advantage of choosing it is that attending the concert helps us relieving stress. </MI2> <SI2>During the concert we scream and cheer for the musician. This action helps us to relieve a great deal of our stress. After attending the concert, we will feel much better. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><EX>Last year I failed to pass the exam. I was so depressed that I couldn't do anything. Then, a friend of mine suggested me to go to a concert with him. Throughout the concert, I yelled and screamed so hard that I just forgot everything about the exam. Also, my stress was totally taken away. Thanks to the concert, I could start off again. </EX></BO3>  

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, choosing a concert ticket can be regarded as a better choice since it enables us to forget about our everyday lives, and also takes much of our stress away. Since most people in modern society gets a lot of stress, attending a concert can be a good way to relieve them. </CO>
column23: Overall, a well thought out essay but supporting evidence could be expanded upon to strenghten the main argument.

column1: 803&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some people like to eat at food stands or restaurants, while others like to prepare food and eat at home. Often this inclination depends on the ability that can afford to and own lifestyle. Because I have a busy and decent job, like to try various plates, and want to relax when I have meal, <TS>I prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants.</TS></IN>

<BO1><EX>If I try to prepare and eat at home, first I need to shop, then make the meal and set the table, finally wash the dishes. But I can just enjoy the services and foods, which is provided, once I go to my favorite restaurants or food courts and decide what to have. Also it is much faster to go out than prepare myself.</EX> <MI1>Convenience is one of reasons why people eat out with family or friends</MI1></BO1>

<BO2><EX><TR>Furthermore</TR>, whenever I would like to try any kind of ethnic cuisine or any particular dish that I don’t know how to make, I usually use restaurants or food stands where I can have what I want. I have more choices at restaurants or food stands than at home and don’t have to learn cooking. </EX><MI2>People decide to eat at restaurants or food courts because of more selections. </MI2></BO2>

<BO3><EX><TR>Finally</TR>, I can relax in the comfortable and fresh surroundings without any stress while I enjoy meal. There are few restaurants that are noisy and dirty because no owners want to loose their customers. If there are, I could also avoid those and try other places.</EX> <MI3>Due to pleasant and different environment, People have meals at restaurants. </MI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>Though</TR> I cannot eat at restaurants or food stands place to place everyday, I would go more often if I can because I can enjoy what I want conveniently and have various choices and feel comfortable during the meal. </CO>
column23: Good start and ample information in the body but the conclusion is lacking.  Grammar could also be improved.

column1: 804&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like and dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3:
<IN>The place where I live is a small town so that it has both aspects of city and country side; from shopping malls and office buildings to farms and mountains. It depends on the person who will move to my residence whether he or she is preferable to city life or not. <TS>I think, on the whole, he or she would like the natural environment and dislike the lack of entertainment and some facilities. </TS></IN>

<BO1><SI1>My town has a lot of natural surroundings such as beautiful mountains and rivers where many trees and flowers grow and a huge number of birds and animals sing and run. If anyone who lives in a big city stressed from daily activity visits here, he or she can probably free himself or herself sufficiently by just listening to the music made by birds. Besides, because the water here is so clean that we can drink the water without filtering.</SI1> <MI1>Therefore, newcomer will like the clean and fresh surroundings. </MI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, my place is considerably quiet and the traffic is very light.</MI2> <SI2>The town area is big, but the number of car is so small that we can make a silent sleep. As a result, there hardly is traffic jam on rush hour so we rarely have car accidents. We can drive to the place where we want go in a few minutes with satisfaction. Thus, someone who would be here will be happy for that. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>However</TR>, my town has some drawbacks compare to the big city: insufficient facilities. </MI3> <SI3>Because my town has so little population that can create big business that there are so small number of public and amusement buildings, such as big shopping malls and theaters. We have only one general hospital, three schools: from elementary school, middle school and high school, one small shopping mall and two tiny theaters. In case of emergency, such as sudden car accident, we have to rely on a poor medical service or go out to the big city for more prepared services. So, newcomer will be sorry for that inconvenience. </SI3></BO3>  

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, we have a beautiful scenery and quiet surroundings, but a few convenient facilities. Although at first, someone is going to move to my place is sorry for that inconveniency, soon he or she can realize the advantages of living here would outweigh the above mentioned drawbacks. </CO>
column23: Run on sentences; grammar errors

column1: 805&Music tells us something about a culture. What does the music of your country reveal about the culture of your country? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Many people say that Music represents their culture directly or indirectly. Yes that is right, Nobody can deny that music has a power to evoke people’s emotion and motivation. In Korea, There are many people who says that computer made life more complex and stressful. Of course I agree with those opinions. <TS>However, I think computers made life easier and more convenient very much. So I think computer helped our life than making it bad.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, it made our life easier to live. </MI1> <SI1><EX>For example, letters, writing, and other things. In the past, when we were wring a letter, we had to write it by our hand. I was very tired when we had to write it long. Also, when we write a writings for homework we had to write it very very long. Then our hand got very tired and hurt when we finishes the writing. And when we got a place that something wrong, then we had to erase all.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it made our life convenient. </MI2> <SI2><EX>For example, in the past, we had to find the information by reading books in the library. It was very irritating looking for the book for the information.</EX> However, if we use computers, we can find the information very fast and quick. Then we can finish our homework very fast. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, computer made our life more better. </MI3> <SI3><EX>For example, computers made more working spots. There were lack of working place in the world.</EX> However, many working place came out such as profational game players. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, by using computer we can make our life more easier, convenient, and better. We feel easier to write with computer than writing with our hand, we feel more convenient by looking for the information by computer than finding a book for it, and we can live better by getting a job when you do not have a job. For these reasons I think we need computer to live our life. </CO>
column23: Music or computers? Essay doesn't address the topic

column1: 806&Music tells us something about a culture. What does the music of your country reveal about the culture of your country? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>We have two kind of music that are revealing about Korean culture: One is a ‘Hymn’ and the other is ‘Taryung’. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I would like to mention about Hymn. </MI1> <SI1><EX>For instance, The role of church hymn was an impetus of gathering people under the rule of Japanese imperialism. They persecuted innocent Korean people. That is why, we have a grudge for Japanese people. Whenever they oppressed us, we used to sang a hymn to endure their stupid require or something.</EX> I think from that time, Korean’s gospel hymn changed to optimistic. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we have another music ‘Taryung’ which is Korean traditional music. </MI2> <SI2> From the ancestor, we have been singing Taryung to promote our efficient labor. The sound Taryung is exceedingly exciting. <EX>For example when I was in high school I also used to sing a Taryung to promote our baseball team.</EX> I dare to say that Taryung music reveals a culture of Korea as well. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, what I have mentioned above two kind of music could express Korean culture. Sometimes, That provides us vigorous at companies, home, and church. For this reason, I support music reveals country’s culture. </CO>
