If the government spends the money on the new project, such as building universe traveling station and museums, then the employment and consumption will increase. <TR>As a result</TR>, the economy of the country will boost and also benefit the people. <TR>In addition,</TR> we can get a lot of vivid information and knowledge through those outer space facilities. <TR>Thus,</TR> investment on the universe can produce benefits to the government and people. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, we can have fun by outer space facilities. </MI2> <SI2>We have gotten the information of the universe and been taught about it only by books or television. I could hardly any interest in astronomy or something related to the universe in high school. When we actually contact and feel the outer space by exploring outside Earth or visiting universe museums, then we are likely to be amused by those spectacular unknown mysteries. We can go on a vacation to Mars for several days and the whole family members can enjoy the weekend on space shuttle museums. So, spending on the outer space can provide us with a lot of entertainment. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, no one denies the fact that the government should also spend some money on the urgent need of the Earth. I think,<TR> however</TR>, we have spent much money on it, the time has come that we should spend considerable money on the plan of outside Earth, since it can contribute to the economy of the country and offer a big fun. We will make a good member of the universe by that investment plan. </CO>
column23: Your thesis statement is great.  However, your two main paragraphs are quite similar.  They could be one paragraph because they essentially talk about the same thing.  You start your first paragraph by saying that Earth is overcrowded and desolate, but you never talk about how development in space could help that - instead, you talk about how it can help the economy.  Reorganize this essay and try again.  It has great potential. As a side note, you rely a little too heavily on transitions in your writing.  Try to use fewer transitions.

column1: 915&In some countries, people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think this is a good rule or a bad rule? Use specific reasons and details to support your position.
column3:
<IN><TS>I think that prohibition of smoking in public places is a very nice regulation because of the following two reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason</TR> why I support this standard is because indirec smoking is harmful to people's health. </MI1> <SI1>Many researchers have announced that to have a pipe is more injurious to someone who is nere the smoker. Wheather someome is smoking or nonsmoking , have a smoke is their taste. but smokers have to keep in mind that rhey must not damage to other people's health. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>The other reason</TR> for this is that smoking in public place has chance to make a sympathizer of smoking. </MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example,</TR> My brother was nonsmoking. but he joined the army two years ago. And then he learned to smoke there. <TR>In addition,</TR> My father gave up smoking one years ago. but he smoked in his office by stealth because he saw the smoking of his associates. If smoke is good for both my brother and father's health, I am going to not conneted with that.</EX> However smoking effect both mind and body certainly. So I disagree that smoking in the public place. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In cocclusion</TR>, I confirm this rule for non-smofer's health. I hope that my country will forbid somking in common area entensively. </CO>
column23: This essay is very good.  You make very good points, and your second main paragraph is especially strong with its good personal examples.  Can you think of any examples for the first paragraph?  You need to strengthen your thesis statement by stating your reasons for your opinion.

column1:
916&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for exmple, 
new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you 
think people attend college or university? Use specfic reasons and examples 
to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Since we can't deny the fact that "Knoldege is power", many people are trying to major in at least one subject. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think that people are only doing so, because of the benefits it brings. Here are some benefits one can gain from it.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people can preepare for their future career. </MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays,</TR>employers value those who have taken higher education course.<TR>Therefore,</TR> taking such a course will ensure stable and much more paid job compare to those who did not go.Since there is no one, over the world, who does not want higher selary; this phenominon triggers people to pursue higer education. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, you can acquire new experiences. </MI2> <SI2>You will meet people from all sorts of different backgrounds; thus helps you to learn how to deal with people. <TR>Also,</TR> school activities will be something that you have never experienced at the highschool. <EX><TR>For exmple,</TR> if you have chose to major in robotics, you'll get to actually learn, not just looking, the method of making robots.</EX> These experiences will broden your knowledge. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, as we have seen, it is human's nature to hire those who have majored at the University. In the mean time, you can learn how to cope with expert problems that cannot be readily solved unless you learn at the University. <TR>Consequently,</TR> sometimes, one can achive a reputaion and will certainly have a better prospect for the future. </CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good.  You need to strengthen your thesis statement.  It should be a summary of what you are going to talk about.  Your main topics are very general, so I think you can fit a few more supporting ideas in your paragraphs.  Finally, please take the part about human nature out of your conclusion. It is not human nature to hire someone with a degree; it is business.

column1: 917&Some movies are serious, designed to make the audience think. Other movies are designed primarily to amuse and entertain. Which type of movie do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many kinds of movies. <TS>I prefer the movies solely to entertain and amuse to serious and artistic movies.</TS> One’s life are sufficiently complicated and burdened. Lighter movies, especially comic movies can get rid of the burden in mind and clean one’s head. I will explain the reasons with examples. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>When I was young, I liked serious movies. </MI1> <SI1>At that time, I have a lot of thinking about the world. So I want to think everything and I want to capture behind meaning in like-puzzle writings and movies. But When I become adult, almost all daily routine makes my mind heavy and serious. I getting become serious and nervous person. My friend suggests that the comic movies can get out of my burdens. So, after that time, I usually see the comic movies and I will be happy better. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, when my head is complex and can not be ordered, Seeing the comic movie can clean my head. </MI2> <SI2>So I can start with new mind. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, the comic movies can make a person who suffers one’s burden happy. Because of the two reasons, I prefer to amuse and entertainment movies. </CO>
column23: Your two main points are just two ways to say the same thing. in fact, your enire second paragraph should be the main idea for your first paragraph. Try to think of another point to add to this essay.

column1: 918&Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are a number of holidays from country to country. <TR>Among them,</TR> some holidays are celebrated in several nations, such as Christmas or labor day. <TS>When it comes to making a new holiday, I would rather like to set up “Earth day” and demonstrate some activity, since our planet becomes more and more polluted, so there is urgent need for conserving the environment. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the surroundings of Earth is getting contaminated and desolate, because of a huge number of development in buildings and industry. </MI1> <SI1>A lot of wild life including unknown beautiful birds and animals have lost their habitats according to the deforestation and mass construction. I used to hear many birds sing and see pretty flowers blossom in front of my house. <TR>However</TR>, I could never encounter such magnificent scenery any more, when a new apartment complex was built over that area. Here is why I want to make a special day for our planet. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, I would like to celebrate ‘Earth day’ by arranging some events. </MI2> <SI2><TR>First</TR>, people who like to climb the mountains may take part in the environment campaign by demonstrating in the trail of the mountains or picking up the garbage and wastes along the way. Many families go to the old palaces and public park to compete with others by writing a essay and poems about the theme related to the Earth or conserving the our world. <TR>Moreover</TR>, the government will give awards to people and institutions that show prominent achievement in the contribution of preserving and cherishing our planet. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, there are, of course, other famous people and historical evens that deserve a new holiday. <TR>However</TR>, I think, our planet which has been our precious habitat is suffering from pollution and devastation of the environment, so the time has come that we should make a special holiday for our planet. We can sincerely think about the present and future images of the Earth on “Earth day” </CO>
column23: First of all, Earth Day is already a holiday. You can get away with using it as your holiday by making it more elaborate, but your essay needs a lot of work before you can convince your reader.  Your first main paragraph should be deleted completely.  It is just a second introduction and it is completely unnecessary.  Your second essay is an excellent outline of what your essay should look like - the first sentence is a great introduction starter, and your next three events should be your next three paragraphs.

column1: 919&films can tell us a lot about the country where they were made. What have you learrned about a country from watching its movies? Use specific examples and cetails to support your response.
column3:
<IN>I believe that I have learned about other nations since I went to the movies for the first time in 1989. <TS>Not only gave Attending a movie the informations of other conutry, it also helped me understand foreigner's custom, their style of living. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, and most importantly, I can be familiar with other countries from many cinemas. </MI1> <SI1>If I have not seen movies I would not be acquainted with other countries like the present state of me. I have seen a lot of mowies for many years and they have maden me see a foreign nation frequently and totally. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> After I saw the 'Loveletter' that is the first japanese movie arrived at Korea I become more enterested in the TV programs which is related to Japan because this movie let me think that Japanese and ma nation have similar emotion. This movie whose story is love between a common girl and a blunt boy showed me Japanese and korean are much alike in the moderate emotion that is based on the oriental feeling.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, I can obtain information about other nations from the movie. </MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For instance,</TR> When I see a hollywood movie, I learned the language of U.S.A. And I train to study American's customs, their way of thinking. Americans have active, enthusiastic, and rational mind.</EX> And they try to conquer the nature while the orients try to harmony with nature. These charadterastac are appeared in the movies and then I can feel the weastern countries' whole tone from the films. While I saw a cinema I was seeing both their ordinly life and specific evet. This helped me to understand their total culture more effectively than I study it at the school. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that it is very useful for me to see a movie for learning other countries.-their custom, the way of thinking, language...and so forth. Perhaps I might have been learned lots of things about a foreign nation from movies unconsciously or consciously. I hope that my country will inform the culture of itself through succesful film , too. And many people over the world will know my country better than now. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay.  I can't decide if your two main ideas are similar enough to be one idea or not.  They are very close.  Try to make them sound a little more different.

column1: 920&The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Do you agree or disagree with the statement?
column3:
<IN>Occasionally, people have to decide some problems. I think that it is not easy. <TR>Nevertheless,</TR> some people make a decision quickly. <TS>I agree the decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>I think it will bring us many mistakes if people make decisions quickly. </MI1> <SI1> <EX><TR>For example</TR> when one people have to decide certain problems that he don’t know well, he can expect better results, if he decides prudently. <TR>However</TR> if he don’t do that, he might mistake.</EX> I think it seems they aren’t interested in the situation that people quickly decide. </SI1></BO1>

<CO><TR>Consequently,</TR> if people decide quickly, it will give them wrong. <TR>Therefore</TR> we have to decide our problems prudently. It will give us many benefits. </CO>
column23: You need to write more than this.  Think of more than one reason why it is wrong to make a quick judgement.  Defend your points.  Each paragraph should be at least 4-5 sentences.

column1:
921&Do you agree of disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best 
teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>Some may disagree the state that "parents are best teachers", for they are not expert in teaching. <TS><TR>However</TR> i do belive that they are the best teachers with out any doubt.</TS> There are some reasons to support my answer. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>,parents have affection for their children.If their children were to stray away from the right path and fall into bad habits; they are sure to provide helping aid to their children. </MI1> <SI1>Sometimes children can find this annoyed, however; because of such a tenderness, children are most likely to appreciate it and thus, get to learn their parents are reliable.Parents also want their children to benefit in all ways. They will always try to be exmaplary to their children. <TR>As a result</TR>, children imitate the good examples from they show.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, parents have been through childrens age. </MI2> <SI2>Which means, they do know how to cope with any hardships during the childhood. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if a child is having difficulty getting along with he or her friends, parents will listen carefully to what the child is saying; and analyze the cause of the problem step by step and then give the child a soution to the problem.</EX> <TR>Thus,</TR> the child wil likely to have less trouble dealing with he or her friends from now on.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, we have considered some proofs of the fact that parents are best teachers. Since they love their children so much, they try to manifest good examples, and to help when their children is having problems.<TR>Thus,</TR> children will learn from them and will probably do exactly the same to their children when they become an adult. </CO>
column23: Great essay!  You could make it a little better by saying why teacher don't do those things.  Otherwise, good organization and excellent points!

column1: 922&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students’ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think sports activities are most important in school life because students can be healthy and learn cooperation. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think university should pay more money to library for following two reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, library is used by more students than sports activities. </MI1> <SI1>In many schools, there are many sports facilities such as swimming pool, gym, and tennis court but just few limited students who are major in physics use sports facilities. <TR>However</TR>, almost all students use library regardless of their majors because there are many resources of all fields in the library. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, students need more up-to-date materials in this complex society. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, there is much new information that students have to know. <TR>Therefore</TR>, university should pay money at the library to update its materials in order that students are able to deal with new information and data easily. If students improve their ability to deal with new knowledge, they can easily adapt themselves to the complex society. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, university should give money to the library because most students use library and they need new information in this society. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think it is more beneficial to spend money to the library. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay with very good points.  They are pretty well defended.  You could elaborate by talking about how giving money to the sports programs could hurt students.

column1:
923&Parents or other adult relatives should make important decisions for their older(15~18old) 
teenaged children. Agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>Many people seem to believe that parents and adult relatives must make important decisions for their older sons and nephews. This is a myth that mans of our generation like to hold this common belief,<TR> however,</TR> has critical flaws, such as the lack of responsibility and self-reliance. <TS><TR>In this essay,</TR> I will demonstrate why the decisions made by parents or other adult relatives are not acceptable and should not be praised for two following distinct reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>When I was so young, my parents always decide everything around me; what to eat, when to sleep, where to go, and how to put on clothes etc. I needed nothing but obedience to my parents' order. </MI1> <SI1>But, at 18, I have to decide the major which I study in the university, but I can't. Why? Mainly because I lost my self-reliance. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, at that time, to enter university is the most important thing in my life. </MI2> <SI2>If I accept their decisions thoroughly, My life as a university student will not be mine but theirs. Right. When I have something to solve out by myself, they always suggest me the best way in their thought from their life experience. Because of this, I'm in a state that lacks of responsibility. I don't have any authority over me. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>I say again 'Life is mine not others'. Make your own mind on everything whether it is right or wrong. Parent's suggestion is just be an advise to your significant decision. </CO>
column23: This essay does not have two distinct ideas, just one.  The two paragraphs should be one, and you need to have a main idea uniting them.  Your main idea should state the point you are trying to make.  Meanwhile, you need to come up with another point for your second main paragraph.  Your point about not having self-reliance is good, but you need to support it with a good argument.

column1: 924&All university students should take basic science courses even when they are not planning on going into the field of science.
column3:
<IN>I believe that science is the most important subject in that every scholar needs them as underlying of their field. This is because science represents the key issues between basic organisms and human activity. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think pressing all students to take science course as mandatory is unfair. There are two reasons below the paragraph why I think this is wrong. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, studying beginning level of science that already students have studied in high school is a waste of time. </MI1> <SI1>All students have an opportunity to learn basic science knowledge during their second school time. After graduation of second school, students go to the university to learn specific and special field what they are really interested in. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I paid by myself for college tuition. I was working twelve hours per three days a week and that was just because of my tuition.</EX> <TR>In addition</TR>, my major is far away from science but I took those for only meeting the requirements for graduation. During that time, I thought repeating a basic science knowledge that I already have studied before is a waste of money and time. Even though my opinion is different from college, <TR>however</TR>, their rule obligates me to take that course. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it is unfair to press students who are not good at science to take a science course. </MI2> <SI2>One of important goal in college education is encourage people to learning. And also, not all students are good at the science courses. If the students get the bad grade of science, and that does not even what they want to choose, they will lose their eagerness toward learning. In real life, <TR>for instance</TR>, we can see most students push themselves into extreme way as possible as they can to get a good grade during a semester. <TR>However</TR>, some students never get a good grade because they just not good at specific subject even they are really try hard. This is because for many sector; loss of interest, or their inability to understand, etc. If we know this is true, we would encourage the students to choose what they really good at. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I do not agree the following statement that all students must take basic science course. This is because we have the right to choose course what we want, and it is not fair to obligate the students who are not good at science to choose that courses. </CO>
column23: A very good essay!  Good job!

column1: 925&The most important skills successful leaders and politicians have are good communication skills
column3:
<IN>During my life time, I have been aware that the most important qualification of leaders and politicians is their contents. Then how the leader or politicians assert their contents efficiently? <TS>I definitely can say it is conveyed by great speech skills and ability to bring fluent communication.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, politician’s impressive speech moves peoples mind. </MI1> <SI1>Many of countries, and in history, we easily can find a speech admirable. When a historical figure brings people’s attention, they always select the words that fascinate public. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> Ahchachi Kariyatirichci’s speech that had shown in his inauguration has engraved in many Thai people’s heart ever. Even after his death, many of audience recall that the speech is the best memory of him. But what people really think the most admirable aspect of him is his communication skills. He always opens his mind to public and tried to communicate with everybody; elders, children, woman and even peoples who lives in slum. Still now many of Thai people not hesitate to choose him as the father of Thai.</EX></SI1></BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, leader’s ability to bring fluent communication among their teammate always suggests the right way they will go. </MI2> <SI2>Many of people suffer from bossy and one-way communication style leader when they try to do something with them in their job place. This discourages people to talk new ideas and fresh opinion that have a potential to help company to be better than before. <TR>However,</TR> if leaders have good ability to communicate with others, peoples would more willing to participate to discussion or not hesitate to bring a new idea. <EX>For example, I met many leaders when I worked in high school as a voluntary internship. I had difficulty working with the manager who did not try to care about other’s opinion. <TR>However</TR>, when I worked with another manager who was really good at communication skills, all of my coworkers were willing to talk with him. He applied people’s ideas in office, and this visible outcome encouraged effective relationships between him and my co-worker.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>I agreed that communication skills are necessary qualification in which to become a leader. I think that the leader’s ability to communication lead people to the right way. <TR>Indeed,</TR> when leader charm the people’s mind, impressive speech skill is always necessary. </CO>
column23: A very good essay with good examples. Great job!

column1: 926&The government should require all young adults to perform some kind of national service, such as military service or social work.
column3:
<IN>The government has to demand some national services to all young adults. This issue is very controversial. Pros and cons will largely depend on the situation of each country. <TS><TR>However,</TR> in my country case, I agree that the government should require all young adults to perform some national service. It is because this national service will increase the patriotrism, give valuable experience, and reduce national cost for national service.<TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, national service can increase patriotrism of young adults. </MI1> <SI1>While living our life, we have very rare chance to think what government means to us. But, by implementing national service such as going military and social work, we probably think deeply about the government or country. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> after completing obligation of military service, I became more faithful for my country.</EX> I realized how important the government is to my life. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, national service can give us a valuable experience of life. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Generally speaking</TR>, young adults will be students and new comers in society. So, national service will be helpful for young adults as pre-stage for future social life. Even for young adults with some physical disablities, the government can give proper obligation for them. They also can obtain rich experience. This experience makes young adults to get more ability to overcome hardships and difficulty of entire life. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I got hard time in military service. It eventually gave me more confidence to win the difficulty of life</EX></SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Last</TR>, obligatory national service can reduce national cost. </MI3> <SI3>If the government does not assigns obligatory national service, it has to hire someone to implement national service. It will need a huge budget. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the government must spend lots of labor cost for military service and public service. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, the government has more and more debt in order to provide well-being budget for medical insurance, senior pension, and so on.</EX> <TR>Additionally,</TR> the government can not afford another cost needed in national service. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I agree that the government should require all young adults to perform some national service as the following reasons. It will increase the patriotrism, give valuable experience, and reduce national cost for national service as well. Strong relationship between government and individuals will lead to both national unity and individual happiness. </CO>
column23: This essay really impressed me.  You have convinced me so thoroughly that I am starting to think civil service should be mandatory also.  Excellent work!

column1: 927&people learn more by watching television than by reading books.
column3:
<IN>Recent technological advancements have changed the way people live radically, also it has become easier to prepare the foods. <TS>Some people believe these changes improve people's life style. 
However, I can't agree this statement for following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, our needs for being easier to prepare foods produce "Fast Foods". </MI1> <SI1>However, having too many fast foods has bad influences on people's health. This is because most of fast foods are not only low nutrients, but also contain high calories. Recently, some studies have shown that many of people have been suffered from obesity and having excessive taking fast food is major cause of this social phenomenon. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that</TR>, we have lost the fun of cooking because of these fast foods. </MI2> <SI2>Before fast foods industries have grown like nowadays, people enjoyed cooking and satisfied they got by cooking tasty meals. <EX>For example when I was 17, I used to make breakfast to share dishes with my family. That was my favorite hobby and memorable time.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, our desire for being easier to prepare dishes produce fast foods, these have negative affects for above reasons. 
All things considered, I disagree with that changes of the preparing foods improve the way people live. </CO>
column23: This essay is completely unrelated to the topic.

column1: 928&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN>In this set of materials, both the reading and the lecture deal with the growing challenge of early retirement. <TS>Regarding this issue, the lecturer argues that steps have been taken to address the problems that the writer mentions.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, according to the lecturer, now companies offer shorter working hours to senior employees. </MI1> <SI1>He explains that those firms are expecting that the policy, which includes more break times, will please the old workers so that the workers will be retained. This point refutes the reading passage’s argument that the usual working environment represented by repetitive work and inflexible plans pushs old workers towards leaving their jobs early being stressed out. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, the lecturer goes on to say that mentoring programs resolve the complex feelings of stress that the senior workers suffer. </MI2> <SI2>To be specific, the old generation would feel connected to younger workers through this kind of programs, training the younger. This counters the writer’s viewpoint that the elders are accelerating their leaving the workplace because they have become isolated amid younger people. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, the lecturer mentions that premature retirement would be eased if companies sponsor training programs to them. <EX>For example, a worker in his 50’s was provided such the program and felt himself valuable because of not only his extensive work experience but also new computer science skills. This casts doubt on the reading passage’s claim that workers hasten their retirement because they are not proud of the fact that their skills have become obsolete.</EX></SI3></BO3>
column23: This essay is completely unrelated to the topic.

column1: 929&University athletic departments should receive that the same amount of funding as university libraries. agree or disagree?
column3:
<IN>In order to meet all their need academically and help them find some physical activities such as soccer team, base ball teams, many universities fund their athletic department and other athletic facilities at the expense of libraries. <TR>Indeed,</TR> some universities have forgotten the gravity of what they are meant to be. <TS><TR>Therefore,</TR> universities should invest more money in the area of libraries so that it could cover more students’ needs and studying outweighs playing sports. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, schools should cover more students’ needs since they play a pivotal role in supporting their student financially. </MI1> <SI1>It is evident that money should be spent to help the most students in struggling to get help from school, especially during one’s twenties, they hardly meet any chances to make good money while at university. More importantly, funding libraries has a positive influence on producing highly scholastic students and graduates. <TR>To illustrate this point</TR>, provided more scholarships, so many students liked school. <EX>When my cousin “Jack” struggled to have a scholarship, there were a lot of scholarships going on to assist him financially. After he succeeded in attaining a scholarship from his school, he was able to carry on his studies.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, studying far outweighs playing sports. </MI2> <SI2>Considered that it is the place for studying, if they can focus on academics, they are prone to perform better in their studies in regard of time and extensive efforts. In the case of spending most money on sports, we have been witnesses finding that it definitely has a bad influence on their grades, or test scores. Although it might seem to be a good way of striking a balance between athletic department and libraries, it is no doubt that libraries are the one upper hand. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, I definitely believe that universities should give more money to spend on libraries so that their students can have its full of advantages. <TR>On the whole</TR>, I agree with the saying “the sparrow near a school sings the primer.” In other word, Students with good financial assistance and environments inspiring their students to perform better are the most factors for their success. </CO>
column23: This essay is great, except the first main paragraph is off topic.  The question is whether to give money to the libraries or the athletics programs, not to the students for scholarships.

column1: 930&It is better to have one or two close friends than to have a large number of casual acquaintances.
column3:
<IN>There is a old proverb that a friend in need is a friend indeed. From this point, I can guess why I need friends and what the friends must be like. <TS>So, I agree that it is better to have one or two close friends than to have a large number of casual acquaintances, although others think it oppositely. A few close friends can enhance the quality of relationship better, and reduces stress to know new people. <TR>In addition,</TR> making a few friends can be more efficient considering available time and efforts.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the quality of relationship is much higher in case of making a few friends. </MI1> <SI1>We can know each other's character and trait pretty well. So, we can easily understand how he or she feels and behave. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when my friend is in the trouble, I can give best advice for himself because I understand him.</EX> By this process, we are able to build more and more strong relationships. It will eventually strengthen our relationship. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it will be more stress especially for me to meet various people. </MI2> <SI2>Because I am introvert, it is not easy to meet new people very often. <TR>In my case,</TR> having a few friends and stronger relationship is more comfortable. Whenever I try to make a lot acquaintances, it really gives me stress. <EX>For example, I used to become nervous whenever I meet new people at first. And, I am concerned even about something like appearance. I don't want to imagine that I has to meet lot of new acquaintances.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Last</TR>, having a few buddy is more efficient in term of time investment. </MI3> <SI3>If I try to make lots of acquaintance, it will take much time. <TR>In addition</TR>, the relationship is maybe not so strong. It is because we can not share much time together. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I attended some class in university, I decided to memorize and know the face of all students. Soon I realized that it was pretty hard and even not effective. Not only could I make good relationship, but also it will need much time.</EX></SI3></BO3>

<CO>Throughout my above deliberation, I believe that it is better to have one or two close friends than to have a large number of casual acquaintances. Having a close friends permit us to have strong relationship and less stress. Considering the perspective of time, it has no doubt that making limited strong relationship has much more advantages over large acquaintances. </CO>
column23: A very good essay, and very personal!  In your third main paragraph, you might want to explain a little more about how time spent with a good friend is good quality time.

column1: 931&Some people think that your community would be a good place to locate the university. Compare the advantages and disadvantages of establishing a new university in your community. Use specific details in your discussion.
column3:
<IN>In Korea, there are many universities around the capital city, Seoul. <TS>I, also as a citizen of Seoul, cannot help thinking of various affects when someone adds another one in this region.</TS></IN> 

<BO1><MI1>Starting with positive effects, Seoul is a good place for academical environment. </MI1> <SI1>In the more globalizing world, Seoul, the capital of South Korea, become a hub place of Northeastern Asia in various area like culture, technology, economy and education. Studying in Seoul has advantageous to the students in the view like this. They maybe able to see on their own eyes what issue is occurred in global society everyday, and how an episode alters into another. In this background, university students can have many chances to apply their studies, <EX><TR>for example,</TR> job, internship, and volunteer for the affairs. These chances also help them preparing their own tuition.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>But</TR>, there are defects to establish another university here, too. </MI2> <SI2>Seoul has already excessive people on the small ground, and it affects rising the price of houses. The more universities, the more populations around Seoul. Korean government has made efforts to resolve this matter, but because Seoul has many settings already, it may be not dealt with easily. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, opposite to other nations, Korea has emitted graduated over and over, so this country is full of high-educated people. And this inclination aggravates university-aimed education and unstable employment. In the view of society, it is not welcomed to build a new university, especially in Seoul. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>Establishing a university is related to many factors like money, people, and society problems, so this matter should be regarded discreetly through social agreement. There are advantages as well as disadvantages. We would be able to deal with this with our intelligence and harmony. </CO>
column23: This is a good essay.  My main complaint is that you need to strengthen your thesis statement a little more.  Actually, it couldn't hurt to add a little to each of your main paragraphs too!

column1: 932&The best way for a teacher to make their students intersted in a subject is to explain how the subject helps them outside the school.
column3:
<IN>"Knowledge is power." With heavier and fiercer competition tainting our everyday live, this saying can be more true. <TR>As such,</TR> a majority of students are focusing on honing skills for their future dreams. <TS>From my personal view, to render students intrigue a subject, just explaning how the subject aid them in the real world is not primary method.</TS> In this essay, I will be discussing two other ways for opinion. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, participating in the field related to the subject is more effective way to motivate students. </MI1> <SI1>The rationale behind this is that it is easier for students to understand something by working in the real world. <TR>In other words,</TR> It is a better way to act than just listen. <EX>The best example of this is seen from when I participated in internship programs. I major in Mathematics. <TR>In the class,</TR> professor said that Math is utilized in the field of insurance and how it is used. <TR>At that time,</TR> I do not interest in that field. <TR>However</TR>, after I worked in Samsung Insurance as an intern, I was very impressed in Math. I got an opportunity not only to observe process of designing new insurance in front of my eyes but also to be involved in developing new one on my own. <TR>As a result</TR>, after the end of the intership, I was more motivated than before, and I got to concentrate on my major.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, ability of teacher is one of the most important factors to help students be fascinated with the subject. </MI2> <SI2>This is because students are likely to be interested in overall study as well as the subject how they like their teacher. <EX><TR>To illustrate this point,</TR> Helen Keller, who could neither hear nor see, was hard to get to study.<TR> At first</TR>, Helen Keller was likely to give up easily and she thought that she was so crippled that she could not learn anything. <TR>However,</TR> Anne Sullivan, who is her private teacher, struggled to divert her attitude from negatives. As Helen Keller was touched with her constant effors, she determined to open her mind. <TR>After that</TR>, she could concentrate on learning, and she become one of the admired people in the world. Without the teacher`s passion, it would be impossible for Helen Keller to begin learning something</EX>. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, It is good way to teach students how the subject is used. <TR>However</TR>, I strongly argue that firsthand experience and efforts of teachers is more imperative. My reason, as above stated, could encourage students to be intrigued in the subject as well as study. </CO>
column23: A really excellent essay.  Good work!

column1: 933&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Children should wait to begin learning a foreign language until they start school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Many people usually refer nowadays as “global generation”, which represent that whole world is connected to one. In this situation, we can say knowing a foreign language is the most important and strong weapon in this society. <TS>I, <TR>however</TR>, believe children should not begin learning a foreign language until they start school for some reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, learning first language is more important for children because it provides a basic understanding of a language. </MI1> <SI1>When they learn and study their first language, they get to know grammar, especially the structure of sentences. In this way, they would feel easier when they start learning a second language at school. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, A student felt more confident on second language before going to school while B student did not. After first semester, B student got better result on Spanish class than result A student had. The school teacher clarified on this result by saying that B student could get better grade than A student since B student has had better understanding of the structure of language. According to this school teacher, the understanding of basic element in language is more important than starting studying foreign language earlier.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, I believe it is not late for them to start learning foreign language after going to school. </MI2> <SI2>Many people say the younger ones are the better at learning a foreign language. According to one article from Joseon, there is no big difference between the one who have already started learning it before school and another who have just started. They continued stating that both children are still at the same level in foreign language skills and beginning point does not really matter on their ability to speak foreign language for those younger ones. <TR>For this reason,</TR> I do not think children should start learning a foreign language before school starts. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, understanding the basis grammar of their first language is the most important thing for children, and it is not late to start learning it after school starts. The ability of their foreign language skills depend on their efforts and practice, not when children start learning a foreign language. </CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but it's not very convincing.  Where did your first example of Student A and Student B come from?  If you can't say where you got the example, it sounds like you just made it up to support your point.  As for your second example, for it to be convincing you need to give more information.  What languages were being used? Had the students learned them in preschool or at home from native speaker parents?  You need to do a little more research on this subject and try again.

column1: 934&All students should be required to take history courses.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether, history classes have to be mandatory to all students. Some people believe that taking history classes play a vital role in understanding past events for young generation. <TS>My view, <TR>however,</TR> is that history courses should not be mandatory.</TS> This is largely because, students have a right that they can choose subjects freely.<TR> Moreover</TR>, The past is not a useful manner for students in that historical events are too old to apply in the present. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, government and university can not force to students to take history classes All students have a right that they choose what they want to take. </MI1> <SI1>Even if they take the history classes due to requirement, they may not concentrate the class. When students choose subjects that they want to take, they can motivate from learning what they really want to know. According to a study conducted by a team of researchers at Harvard University, students are unable to study hard when they are forced by taking requirement classes. The study shows that students put in more effort when placed determining decision themselves. As far as choosing subject is concerned, it would never forced. Also stududents’ right should be respected. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, to focus on learning the past keep from young generation developing their mind as well as knowledge. </MI2> <SI2>These days are totally different from the past. It is a complex society that many knowledges are going together for developing in an short time. It means that the knowledge of history can not apply practical any more because recent society is more smart than the past. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, it is the Internet. when the first time that people use telephone, they might think that developing more highly technicals than telephone should take much time. <TR>However</TR>, it does not take long time to making high technical instruments.</EX> Thus, it is more beneficial to learn practical courses than past events. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, university never force students to take class without their favor. And it is better to take pragmatic classes of helping recent life style. So students take classes, which they really want to take and aid them by giving practical knowledge. </CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good except for your first main idea.  You are making a statement that cannot be proven.  Go instead with your first supporting sentence as your main idea.  Then your essay will flow nicely.

column1: 935&If you could change one important thing about your hometown, what would you change? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer
column3:
<IN><TS>If I could change one important thing about my hometown, I will increase the number of park in Seoul.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>I was born In Seoul and have lived here all my life. </MI1> <SI1>The city that I see today is too developed and advanced compare to when I was at primary school.Seoul is well known for IT infrastructure. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> <TR>However</TR>, the city is full of keen competition, and citizens are tired of this phenomenon. They need to take a rest, and increasing parks could be a best solution for following reasons.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2></TR>To begin with</TR>, the park is good for our health. </MI2> <SI2>In Seoul, there are lack of places where people could enjoy physical activities. <EX>Let me take my own experience as an example. When I lived in Tokyo, I used to jogging at the nearby park. Running with cold air refreshed all my body, relieved stress, even more it was good for fatigue recovery.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, the citizens need places where their family could spend time together. </MI3> <SI3>
Seoul is developed radically after 1970's. <TR>For this reason,</TR> keen competition society, most of people concentrate on only their business and family bonding has weaken. They need to be aware of importance of family and park is proper solution to strengthen bonging.</SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, the citizens could be healthy and realize importance of family by increasing the number of park. For these reasons, If I could change one important thing about my hometown, I would increase the number of park in Seoul. </CO>
column23: I think you should combine your thesis statement and your first main paragraph as your introduction.  It makes more sense.  The next two paragraphs have good points, you just need to defend them more!  Add more supporting sentences and examples.  Finally, watch your use of transitions.  You don't need to have two right next to each other.

column1: 936&Being creative, rather than planning carefully, often results in the best solution.
column3:
<IN>The term 'organizing' has been emphasized by all adults around me, from parent to teacher. They argue that planning carefully should be a top priority in my life. Not to be too creative and focus on planning specifically, or you will be faced with many hardships. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this opinion, and firmly believe that being creative is the best way to make good solution.</TS> My view can be greatly substantiated by the reasons addressed below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, planning has a limitation. </MI1> <SI1>That is, there is no perfect planning in this fast changing society. <TR>Thus</TR>, people had better be creative to make a best solution. A famous scholar Nassim Taleb insists that human's reason and knowledge has a clear limitation. <EX>He shows one example. Many economists have made numerous economic models, which were for the purpose of predicting future correctly. <TR>In other words</TR>, by planning economic policies carefully based on their economic models, they thought it would help society to be a better place. <TR>However</TR>, it was wrong. In 2008, financial crises hit the world's economy severely. None of the models predicted that there could be economic crisis in the near future.</EX> Taleb refers to this situation as 'Black swan.' The term 'black swan' means that no one can precisely predict what will happen in the future. <TR>In contrast</TR>, being creative and giving spontaneous solutions or improvisations can be a excellent way to overcome many difficulties. <EX>In the economic crises, whereas economists did not respond to difficulties effectively, investors who were ingenuous and had no long-term planning adapted themselves to the changing circumstances and made huge profits.</EX> From this example, I can conclude that being creative is a better choice. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, many successes can be derived from creativity, not from planning. </MI2> <SI2>Although planning carefully gives stability to people, it cannot make huge success. Creativity is different. By being ingenious, people are able to make creative solution and attract many attentions, which leads to great success. <EX>Steve Jobs is a clear example. When he launched his company Apple and produced cell-phone, all cell-phone making entrepreneurs focused on just phone technology. <TR>However</TR>, he thought differently and adopted many new features to his iPhone, from internet technology to fashionable design. Due to satisfying customer's expectations, Apple now becomes a No.1 company in the world. If he had just followed a traditional way and planned his company's strategy equivalent to other companies, he could not have succeeded like today.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, I firmly believe that being creative should be emphasized as much as possible, because it is a new solution to succeed in the modern society. Encouraging people to be ingenious should not be disregarded as absurdity or irrationality. </CO>
column23: An excellent, thoughtful, well-researched essay!  Great work!

column1: 937&A city should try to preserve its old, historic building rather than destroy them and replace them with modern buildings.
column3:
<IN>We live in a century of modernized cities, with the sophisticated buildings all around us. <TR>However</TR>, most of those buildings were not built on an empty space, but where the old, historic buildings were. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, even though it sometimes is necessary, the city should refrain destroying the old buildings for preservation of the three: beauty, history, and environment.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, old, historic buildings have their own beauty that modern buildings cannot have. </MI1> <SI1>Modern buildings might have sophisticated beauty, but it cannot have the traditional buildings elegance. I live in Seoul, Korea, and there aren’t many traditional houses left. It is convenient to live in apartment, but sometimes it just feels so dreary to see the same buildings here and there. I think leaving some buildings of our ancestors’ will add another beauty to our modernized life. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it is obvious that preserving old buildings is important for conservation of historical remains. </MI2> <SI2>Traditional houses of Korea are so wisely built in aspects of ventilation, eco-friendliness, and etc. Old, historic buildings are remains of our ancestors’ wisdom and life. I do not think people should destroy them just for some money or because they look a little shabby. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Last but not least</TR>, there is the environmental problem when replacing old buildings with new ones. </MI3> <SI3>When destroying the old buildings, it will definitely do some harm to the environment near the area. Moreover, building a modern building takes a lot of work including putting water pipe and wires below the earth. Not only that, unlike the traditional buildings which were mostly made out of wood, mud, and bricks, modern buildings require many other materials such as asbestos and formaldehyde. Those materials are harmful for human, not to mention the environment. </SI3></BO3>  

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, it seems necessary to refrain replacing the old, historic buildings with the modern ones, and thus our city will be able to keep the beauty of history as well as the modernized buildings that were already built. This way, we can preserve the evidence of our ancestors’ wise life, and also preserve the environment also. All in all, I think people should stop destroying the remains of history and try to preserve it. </CO>
column23: An excellent, thoughtful essay.  Great work!

column1: 938&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Exams encourage students to learn.
column3:
<IN>Some people maintain that exams are unnecessary, as it only causes stress. <TR>In this sense,</TR> a few schools already discarded policy to take a test. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this statement and believe exams encourage students to learn.</TS> My view can be greatly substantiated by the reasons addressed below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, exams motivate students to learn as it gives students the arranged amount of study until the scheduled date. </MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words, exams induce students to look back at their books which would be out of their eyes if it were not for the exams. No test makes students loose, since they think they all know about the contents, just because they had the class before and it disencourages them to study. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, I was in a high school where the policy was to not to take a test to relieve stress of students. It really had an impact for students including me, and I didn't study at all. I didn't have any incentive to do study. <TR>In contrast</TR>, after realizing that students' intellectual ability is going down, the school modified the policy to take a test every semester. Then students initiated studying, also accepting the evaluation that their ability was deteriorated.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, exams foster competence amongst students which would encourage students to study. </MI2> <SI2><TR>To put it another way,</TR> students care about the test score and their rivals. <TR>Thus</TR>, when a student see that his or her rival studying in free time, it is likely that the student would also study, not to be loitered. An analogous example studied in Seould National University shows this precisely. In marathon, runners tend to form groups sepereately and the groups make runners to keep up with their rivals. They do not go faster or slower than the group members, but they just follow them. Even though it's speed is faster than one runner can afford, the runner follows the group and get a better result because of his mind not to be defeated by his rivals. This shows how competence benefits each person, and can be samely applied to student who has his own rival on studying. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I totally agree with the statement which argues exams encourage students to learn as they make give them a motivation and competetitor. Not to get a stress and enjoy to take an exam would really benefit students. </CO>
column23: This is a very good essay!  Your first main paragraph is especially strong.  I think your second main point is a little too confusing - go ahead and use the sentence after that as your main point.  Finally, I would suggest taking the very last sentence of your conclusion out.  It does not make much sense.

column1: 939&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Classmates are a more important influence than teachers are on a child’s success in school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>It is required for one to have a good relationship with one another in this society. For students the interaction with school teachers is essential and also beneficial for them in many ways. <TS><TR>In this way</TR>, I strongly believe school teachers are a more important influence than classmates are on a child’s success in school for some reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, teachers are, of course, better at teaching one’s students than their classmates do. </MI1> <SI1>Teachers’ primary work is teaching their students and they are the qualified ones. In this regard, students would learn something helpful for them than they do from their friends. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I often go and ask math questions after having AP Calculus class since last year. Since there are no many classmates who are taking that class, I have to ask to my math teacher, Mrs. Kromann. When I ask to one of my friends, most of them answer my question without much explanation, which does not help me to understand problems at all. <TR>On the other hand,</TR> Mrs. Kromann actually explains where I get wrong and help me understand the material that I need to know for solving the problem.</EX> Since learning is the one that would actually help students’ success in school, I believe that teachers are more important influence on their students’ success in school.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, teachers help and lead their students in a good way on their success in school. </MI2> <SI2>Most of teenagers do not have their specific plan for their future. <TR>Thus,</TR> many are struggling and do not know why they need to go to school and learn things. <TR>In this situation</TR>, many teachers encourage and help those students to find their dream and things that they are good at. Since they have already gone through that time that students are having now, they are so much better at helping them than their classmates. <TR>Plus</TR>, teachers have their sight on their students so that they would give hands to their students practically. <EX>According to my dad, he actually did not have his dream until high school before he met his English teacher, Mr. Kim, whom my dad had great impression on. During class, Mr. Kim often encouraged and gave his students confidence on what they are doing. After spending one year of high school having him as a English teacher, he started thinking about one specific job, banker. Through my dad experience, I definitely believe that teachers would bring a lot more influence and impression to their students.</TR></SI2></BO2>
column23: This is a great essay!  It is only missing one thing.... a conclusion!

column1: 940&advertisement on products
column3:
<IN>Both reading passage and the lecturer discuss about advertisements on products. <TS>The lecturer contends it is not beneficial to individual and nation as a whole while reading passage asserts it is valuable service to all.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, according to the lecturer, what advertisements intended to do is just for selling the products not any other purposes. </MI1> <SI1>He further asserts that they are not informed and even are accused of some misinformation. This is contrary to the reading passage’s argument that they are informational by notifying consumers and giving them instructions of products.</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, the lecturer claims that consumers are the one who pay for the expensive advertisements. </MI2> <SI2>The big cost of advertisement is paid by the consumers who pay more prices on the product. Thus, consumers basically pay extra money for the products. This casts doubt on one claim made by the reading passage that advertisements are cheap and free access to certain media.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Lastly</TR>, advertisements encourage people only to spend money. The lecturer states that advertisements even draw consumers to pay everything for credit, which does not help economy at all. The borrowed fund is not a smart long term strategy for general economy as well. This point refutes the reading passage’s claim that stimulating consumers spending is good for economy.</CO>

column1: 941& Universities should spend as much money on sports as they do in libraries.
column3:
<IN>Many people are enthusiastic in their university sports team and this leads a positive effect on student to devote their school more than before. That is why someone argues that universities should spend more money as much they spend on usually do in libraries. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I disagree with that, because investing money on sports should treat as separately with spending money on library.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>If universities willing to spend more money on sports, usually they would press students pressed paying more money on tuition. </MI1> <SI1>In ordinary case, many of universities can not afford extra money because of their fixed financial plan. Then, what happen if university spends more money on sports than before? This means they expand their plan anyway regardless its purpose. They cannot handle their situation without reasonable solution, and charge rest of money to student’s tuition. There are some solutions on this controversial issue. <EX><TR>For example<TR>, if students, faculty, and school agreed the same ideas, it might be happen. <TR>Moreover</TR>, in real life, it happens sometime that a prominent faculty member donates money to school and brings possible way to expand their financial plan. I just say schools must not request students to pay school’s additional investing toward sports. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>How about library by the way? Spending money on library is the most important priority in any case. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Recently</TR>, students use library as not just their studying or borrowing books, but also using lots of web based resources for their assignment. The purpose of university is education and library has been changed constantly toward form that mixed between traditional style and web database. This is why universities never stop spending money on library. Constant investing money relate with enhancing competitiveness of university.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>Few years ago, I visited my university that I have been graduated. I recall my memories that I studied so hard during that time. When I visited the library, I found that so many change in there; a cafe for students has been set up, multimedia rooms, and enormous amount of computers located at a center. I saw still many of students are studying for their future. I understand spending money on sports, but that experience leads me to insists that school's priority is invest money on library.</CO>
column23: This essay is very confusing.  I am having a very hard time following.  You need to reorganize your thoughts better and try again.  I don't think the question is asking students to pay a higher fee; rather it is saying "We have x amount of dollars. Should more go to the library or to sports? Why?"  Also, your conclusion is not a conclusion, but rather a continuation of your second main paragraph. Don't forget to write a conclusion.

column1: 942&Competition among friends has a negative effect on friendship.
column3:
<IN>In this dog-eat-dog world, heavier and fiercer competition taints our every life. <TR>In this situation,</TR> <TR>from my personal view,</TR> competition among freidns could bad effects on their friendship. <TR>In this reagrd</TR>, some might suggest that competition could have pivotal role in developing their relation. <TS><TR>However,</TR> <TR>contrary to such a belief,</TR> I strongly argue that the competition could cause their friendship to break.</TS> In this essay, I will be discussing two reasons for opinion. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, competition cause people to stick to the result. <TR>Thus</TR>, their self-respect could be hurt according to the result.</MI1><SI1> <EX>The best example of this can be seen from when they are playing a soccer game. It is likely to start game with their face with smile to enjoy the sports. <TR>However</TR>, as they are occupied in winning or losing, they could forget why they took part in the game. If they get the victory, it could be okay. <TR>Otherwise</TR>, their pride are damaged and It could lead them to dislike opposite members of team.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>My second</TR> reason has to do with stress. </MI2> <SI2>With more and more people are focusing on improving their quality of life, reducing stress is a must. In this envoronment, people get stressed out from competiton, which cause bad impact on keeping their relationship. <EX><TR>To illustrate this point</TR>, before I entered in the college, I was sensitive for getting good grades. My ex-best friend, Steve, always said that you are my rival and I will get admittion from better university than you. <TR>At first</TR>, I did not care about it. <TR>However</TR>, whenever I got low grades than him, I was stressful that I could not concentrate on study. <TR>As time goes by</TR>, stress became more deepen, so I even wanted not to meet him. <TR>As a result</TR>, we grew apart more and more, I am not contacting him now.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, although friends` contest have advantages, I stronlgy believe that competiton be prone to breaking their freindship. This is beacuse they could be obsessed with triumph and stressful. </CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, except that your two main points are really one main point.  Can you think of another point you could make?  Also, a warning about transitions: try not to use too many of them.  There are too many in your introduction.  If you use a transition in 3 sentences in a row, then you know you're using too many.

column1:
943&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
The fewer possessions you have, the happier you will be.
Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that if you possess less, you will be happier. But I don't agree with this opinion. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, if you possess many things, you will be happier.</TS> Because if I you have lots of money, you can buy things that you need, and also if you have a car, you can go anywhere you want by the car. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, if you have a lot of money, you can buy anything you need with it. </MI1> <SI1>You can buy food to eat, clothes to wear, a house to live and so on. we have to buy this, because we need this. But there are some people who don't have money and also can't buy these enough. So compare these people, the people who have much money are happier. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, long time ago one of my friends didn't have enough money so sometimes she skipped meals. So she was sometimes hungry and didn't feel so good. But after she earned money, she could eat every meals. And when I saw her, she looked better than before.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, if you have a car, it will make your life more comfortable. </MI2> <SI2>Compare to the people who don't have cars, car owner can go anywhere they want and anytime they want. But the people who don't have cars have to take bus, train, taxi or something and sometimes these ways have some limitation. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was late for school, I wanted to take a taxi. Because I don't have a car. But it took long time to take a taxi, because there were few taxies on the road. So I lated for the class and I felt sad. So I thought that if I had a car, I couldn't be lated for the class.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, the person who possess more money and a car will happier than who don't possess them. <TR>In this regard</TR> I think if you possess more you will be more happy because of these reasons.</CO>
column23: The prompt asks if having more THINGS can make you happy or not.  It does not say anything about having money.  Some people with lots of money have very few things.  Also, a car is just one thing.  The question did not ask if having a car would make you happier.  Try to look at this question again and think about all the stuff you have - books, pots and pans, a fancy rice cooker or TV, etc.  Would you be happier with more stuff like that, or with less?

column1: 944&It is important to use land for human needs such as farming, housing, and industry than to save it for endangered animals
column3:
<IN>Some people might say land is exist for human beings so human should use it for farming, housing and industry rather than use land for endangered species. <TS><TR>However</TR> I personally believe land must used for endangered animals by following two reasons, the first is result for not caring extinction animals will result in destruction of nature balance which will destroy entire nature and the second reason is land usage for only humans will pollute the land.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, not caring for about to extinct animals will end up destroy whole world. </MI1> <SI1>Through the history even too small to see spices have relationship with other species including human beings. And if one spice disappears whole relationship between creatures can be doom. <EX>I read from science magazine last week that if carnivore specie animal get extinct from people`s careless cultivation, the herbivore spices which were prey for carnivore animal will populate in big number. As a result a large group of carnivore animals will eat all of plants in the spot and carnivore animals will be extinct due to competing with each other for less food.</EX> <TR>In conclusion</TR> the extinction of species, whether carnivore or herbivore, from human`s relentless land use will bring whole destruction in nature including human themselves. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, land use for only humans will pollute the land which will make land cannot be used for decades. </MI2> <SI2>All animals living in the nature have interaction with the nature. Most of them gain benefit from the nature and give back beneficial things, such as fertilizer, to nature. <EX>To clarify this I heard from my cousin who is farmer that he doesn’t cultivate land recklessness because rashness cultivation could pollute land which will bring extinction creatures living in his land. <TR>In addition,</TR> he included if animals extinct in his land, the land won`t be able to recover the pollution because animals, which can eat up pollution materials, were extinct.</EX> <TR>To conclude,</TR> human must not pollute their own sake because pollution can results extinction of animals which can recover land from pollution. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up with</TR>, human must not use land for themselves such as residence, farming and factories because think less cultivation will bring destruction of nature balance and pollute the land permanently. For these reasons I assets land should be used not only for humans but also endangered animals. </CO>
column23: This is a very thoughtful and well-defended essay.  Great work!

column1: 945&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The government should destroy old, historic buildings and replace them with modern buildings. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>As the society gets bigger and is needed to have more new buildings, it often gets rid of old buildings and builds new buildings. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I strongly believe government should not destroy old, historic buildings and replace them with new and modern buildings for some reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, by conserving old and historic buildings, society can share with others who do not know its own country's history well. </MI1> <SI1>It is self-evident that government must to preserve and keep its relics and old buildings that contain memory and history of its country. It is also important for those who want to learn more about its own country's history. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Korea has put its effort to keep many historic buildings and statues in a city by moving them to preserve in a safer place. <TR>By doing it so,</TR> these historic buildings give and help many children who come to learn and understand their own country's history more easily.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, it is more essential and pivotal thing to do for its government to keep and conserve its own things such as those buildings that contain historic meanings inside. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, the government can have economic benefits by having many visitors coming to see the historic buildings. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Nowadays,</TR> not only people from its own country, but also many from other countries visit the country for many reasons such as traveling, studying, and business. <EX>According to one research by sociology professor in Korea, when foreign visitors from other countries to Korea, they are very pleased to see many historic and old building from 1800s. Plus, as they spend several days for just sightseeing, they often reserve hotels to stay several nights and go to restaurants to eat.</EX> <TR>In this regard</TR>, many visitors actually affects its country economically and enormously. </SI2></BO2>
column23: This essay would be perfect if there was a conclusion!

column1: 946&The rule society expects young people to follow and obey are too strict
column3:
<IN>In this dog-eat-dog world, I believe that society require the young to conform to strict rule. <TR>In this regard</TR>, some might suggest that it is not strict but it help young people to improve their quality of life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, contrary to such a belief, I stronlgy argue that It is necessary to relieve several rule.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will be discussing two cases for opinion, especially my country, Korea. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> Korea young people, from elementary school students to high school students, are required to learn demanding study. </MI1> <SI1>This is because what universities are graudated could have a exmtremely great effect on their success. <TR>To illustrate this point,</TR> most parents demand that students should only concentrate on their study. <TR>In other words,</TR> they could not have to do anything if it is needless not to enter college. <TR>In this situation,</TR> even elementary students should attend to elemantrary school, but also to extra lesson including piano lesson, learning foreign languages, and math. This continues until they get admittion from university. <TR>As a resulut</TR>, Korean research shows that some students are so stressful that they decide to kill themselves. I stronlgy believe that there are more important things such as interacting freidns, playing soccers, and taking a trap. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, Korean young people should serve in the army for two years. It could enhance our national defense. </MI2> <SI2><TR>However</TR>, some young people have diffcult keeping their career as a result of this long gap. The best example of this can be seen from sports athlete. Popular sportmans such as a soccer players, a baseball players could get the chance to be examped from army service. <TR>However</TR>, athlete preparing unpopular sports such as cycling, ski-jump is hard to benefits of exemption. <TR>Thus</TR>, even if cycling athlete get a great record of cycling, after serving in the army, a number of the athlete are likely to restore the record. <TR>As a result</TR>, it is diffult for them to keep their career for a long time. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, although some part rules are not strict but helpful for the young, from my personal view, I strongly believe that there are some demanding rule for some young people. My reasons, as above stated, should be considered and my country need to alleviate these environment. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay.  Your first paragraph is very strong. Your second isn't quite as strong, but it is certainly interesting.

column1: 947&Multinational corporation
column3:
