<IN>Both the lecturer and the reading passage deal with the idea of the multinational corporation. <TS>The lecturer argues that there are some doubts about the multinational corporation. This contradicts the reading passage’s claim that these corporations give people benefits.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all, in response to the reading, the professor says that it is rare that the companies yield their savings to the customer. </MI1> <SI1>The speaker explains that the multinational companies can have monopoly on certain products. He says that when this happens, the price will increase and the quality will decrease. This explanation refutes the reading passage’s claim that multinational corporations can reduce the cost of the products for customers. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the lecturer challenges the reading by saying that multinational corporations might cause the loss of unique culture, providing the locals with the same products. </MI2> <SI2>The speaker contends that homogenization will occur throughout the world. He mentions that diverse culture will resemble each other as this phase continues. This fact directly opposes the reading passage’s position that local people can easily get access to various select of products thanks to multinational corporations. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Finally</TR>, the professor contents the reading’s assertions by standing stating that local economies will be destroyed by sizable multinational corporations. The speaker asserts that local businesses might be wiped out when multinational corporations are introduced to the region. He states that local people are actually suffer, having no other choice but working for multinational corporations. In addition, corporations don’t care and pay enough for the locals. This finding effectively rebuts the reading passage’s argument that corporations from overseas can boost local economies. </CO>

column1: 948&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Famous athletes and entertainers deserve the million-dollar salaries they earn. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion
column3:
<IN><TR>These days,</TR> there are many famous sport players and entertainers who earn the million-dollar salaries, and many people might think they do not deserve it. <TS><TR>For me, however</TR>, it is right and reasonable for them to earn high salaries for some reasons such as keeping their privacy from public and investing in many ways for themselves.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is hard for famous celebrities and sport players to keep their own privacy. </MI1> <SI1>Since they are famous and well-known, it is not easy for them to go outside and do whatever they want to do since their fans are looking at them. <TR>Plus,</TR> these days people quickly find out where the famous movie star is or what he or she is doing right now by tweeter and facebook.<TR> As a result</TR>, the celebrities and famous athletes often look for the place where they can keep their privacy, and these places cost usually much higher than any other regular places. <TR>In this manner</TR>, they spend much money on any activities that they do outside, <TR>thus</TR> it is reasonable to earn higher salary than other normal people do.<EX><TR> For example,</TR> according to one article about one famous figure skating star, Yuna Kim, she replied that she has spent much money eating her supper at some places where there are no many people visit after she won the gold medal in 2010 Vancouver Olyimpics and became famous. When she was in one restaurant, many people noticed her and kept asking for signature and pictures while eating. After this event, she starts finding places that not many people visit. She continues saying that these places usually cost much higher than any other places. Not only Yuna Kim, but many other famous ones deserve to earn much money as they spend much money than common people. </EX></SI1></BO1>


<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, many celebrities or famous sport players invest on themselves. </MI2> <SI2>As they are well-known, they need to prepare and keep improving their ability or skills on whatever they do. <TR>In this way</TR>, they often spent more time on their practice and spent more money as well for the equipment or clothing. <TR>Thus</TR>, it is right to earn more money for these people. One city in South Korea has the most popular and famous baseball team, Lotte Giants. Many players start gathering for practice 6 hours before the actual game starts. They pay their own money to buy all things that they need for practice and game. Plus, most of those are expensive to buy. <TR>In this situation</TR>, even if they buy only the essential ones that they need, they get to spend lots money. All these efforts of each player make Lotte Giant to be the most popular team in South Korea and each player actually does his best for the team. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>Both famous entertainers and sport players deserve to earn high salaries, because they need it. They spend money buying their everyday items and invest on themselves as normal people do, but they just need to spend much money than we do. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I believe they deserve to have high salaries. </CO>
column23: A very well-defended essay, good job!  Your first main paragraph uses a few too many transitions - consider taking some out.

column1: 949&The most important invest in a company is improving the work skills of its emplyess.
column3:
<IN>In this dog-eat-dog world, I believe that reducing stress and maintaining human relationships are the most important factors in this world. Some might suggest that enhanceing the work ability of employee is more imperative to develop their company. <TS><TR>However</TR>, contrary to such a belief, I strongly argue that it is more beneficial for company to foster environment that worker can focus on their work with less stress and utilizing their relationships for work.</TS> In this essay, I will be discussing two reasons for opinion.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, my first reason has to do with stress. </MI1> <SI1>With more and more people are focusing on improving their quality of life, getting less stress is a must. In this situation, getting less stress is optimal for enhancing their efficiency of work. <EX>The best example of this can be seen from when I worked in Samsung Insurance as an intern. It was at first that I worked at company. I was aspire to working hard, but I could not focus on my work. This is beacuse I could have to not only meet a lot of people inclduing annoying co-workers and strict bosses. If I had got stressed out, I could achieve the work successful.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, human relationships are getting more complex. </MI2> <SI2>As you may know, in the stories of books and movies in the past, people are divided into two groups: good ones and bad ones. <TR>However</TR>, as times go by, friend can become enemies and enemies can become friend. From helping from others to working with a team, there is not thing important than utilizing their social relationships to improve their the ability of work. <TR>As a result</TR>, Using human relationships is very necessary for achieving their goals in this human-relationships-oriented society. If they use their relationships, they could succeed in finishing their work. <TR>Otherwise</TR>, I will become losers.</SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, although helping the worker inhance their ability of their work has advantages, I stronlgy believe that relieving their worker and using relationships is more beneficial for developing company. My reasons, as above stated, outweighs opinion of opposition.</CO>
column23: I think I understand what you are trying to say, but it is very confusing.  Your second paragraph is especially confusing. Try to make your sentences clearer.  I believe you are making some good points, but you have to clarify them a little more before they can help you.

column1: 950&The most important invest in a company is improving the work skills of its employees.
column3:
<IN>Many CEO's may think that investing in improving the work skills of its employees is of utmost priority, but I feel there are more aspects to work than the skills of employee. <TS>I believe that companies should invest more in motivation and bonding of employees as these would be highly beneficial in the long run. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, companies should invest in motivating the employees for better efficiency. </MI1> <SI1>Enhancing the skills of employees are valuable, and high competency of employees are desired. <TR>However</TR>, no highly skilled employee can beat a motivated one in terms of efficiency and eagerness to get the work done. Einstein once said, genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration. I firmly believe that work efficacy is indeed the ultimate objectives of the companies in order to make high profit. Experts have discovered that these welfare policies have a strong correlation with the efficiency of employees. Motivating the employees by making the workplace pleasant and comfortable has a strong impact on the output given by employees. Many trend-setting companies have adopted many policies such as flexible work hours, and invested in facilities such as in-house gyms, billiards, table tennis, yoga, therapist, etc. to make the office more employee friendly and to help relieve the stress of its employees</SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, relationship between employees are important when working towards a single goal. </MI2> <SI2>While many employees feel that their colleagues and peers are potential rivals, we cannot deny the fact that companies needs its employees to cooperate and work as a team. By investing in activities that build and strengthen relationship between employees, companies can expect the employees to collaborate from everyday tasks to billion-dollar projects. <EX>From my personal experience, my company provides a myriad of activities that bond employees, and ultimately enables employees to work seamlessly as a team. By participating in such activities, camaraderie inevitably began to build, and this extended to real work too. </EX>I have always found it much easier to accost a colleague and make work-related request when I am well acquainted with him or her. Companies are oriented towards a single goal, and cooperation among employees is crucial as this would not only get the work done, but create a synergy effect that elevates the standard of work. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In a nutshell</TR>, while an employee skill set is a desired trait, the impact of motivation and employee cooperation far outweigh the number of advantages provided to the company. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I strongly feel that companies should invest in aspects other than employee training. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay!  Great work!

column1: 951&People should try several different jobs before getting a long-term job.
column3:
<IN>It is debatable whether people should try several different jobs before getting a long-term job. Some people disagree that having had many jobs before they got a permanent job is usefulness, because it is to waste time. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I strongly believe that experiencing a variety of job prior to getting their long-lasting jobs is critical role in one’s life because it can be helpful to find one’s aptitude and extend their knowledge.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, experiencing many jobs are likely to detect what they want to do, while working only one job can be hard to person who is not in their aptitude. </MI1> <SI1>Studies in University of Busan in Public Korea have shown that 73 percent of responded people who have their work were not satisfied their jobs because of aptitude. But only 27 percent of typical people answered they were in satisfaction. This shown that it is important for person of contemporary society to do what a person is interested in. <TR>Thus</TR>, it is imperative for a person to acquire jobs that fit to each person. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, these days, It is a crucial role to combine many different experiences. </MI2> <SI2>This is because, our society is more complexified than before. While, If somebody knows a wide sort of knowledge about his job, he can apply his knowledge to his work. <EX>According to my experience, when I was high school student, I won the first prize in Physics that held in my country. It is not only knowledge about Physics knowledge, but also mechanical and chemistry to help get academic success.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, accumulating experiences in extended fields is likely to process something more easily than are not. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In short</TR>, before getting a job that works so long, trying works in wide field are not only helpful in find one’s aptitude, but also deal with one’s works. <TR>In this reason</TR>, people who lives in concurrent should have to strive in different jobs. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay!  Great work!

column1: 952&Governments should spend more money expanding access to the Internet than improving public transportation
column3:
<IN>As a society has developed for a long time, there have been many improvements in our country. And we can be more access to the Internet and use easily improved public transportations such as buses and taxies. It is often said that governments should use more funds expanding access to the Internet than improving public transportation. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I believe that improving public transportation is more important factors than expanding access to the Internet.</TS> This is because economy can be increased by developing public transportation and developed public transportation can improve the quality of life.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, improved public transportation systems can boost economy.</MI1> <SI1>In the past, people are tired of going to their companies because the companies are far away from people’s house. So, most people got a job near their house regardless of people’s desires. But, these days, as public transportation systems have improved, people can commute on their companies far from their house by using public transportation. According to a study of the researchers by Harvard University in 2009, the employment rate in Seoul had exponentially increased and the study found out that most people of employees resided in the rural areas far from their companies because of construction of subway system. This shows that improved public transportation play a significant role in creating job openings. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, improved public transportation improves the quality of life. </MI2> <SI2>People have thought to find cheaper ways to travel because it is very difficult for people to often take a trip by their cars because of expanses of gas. So, people recently go a trip by taking relatively cheaper subway or bus. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was 24 years old, I planned to go on a trip to Busan area. <TR>However</TR>, I do not a little money because I was a student in university. It was so hard for me to take a trip to Busan owing to the expensive gasoline costs. So, I searched cheaper methods to travel to Busan. Finally I found out the ways by taking the express bus. It spent 20% cheaper than driving an own car. Thanks to the public transportation, I could travel to Busan and I had a really good time in there.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, the governments consider improving public transportation as important traits. This is public developed public transportation make our society’s economy boost by creating job opening. Besides, the quality of life can be improved by developed public transportation because it is economical. </CO>
column23: This is an excellent essay!  Great work!  A suggestion (not mandatory): it would be interesting to say a few things about the internet as well, like how so many people have access already.

column1: 953&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast the knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why? Use specific reasons and example to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>As books have provided much knowledge and skill, it is no exaggeration that books play a pivotal role in developing human society. Of course, knowledge gained from books has many advantageous aspects. It is easy to be delivered from people to people, because it has already been modified for the purpose of transmission. We can agree that the primary reason of writing a book is to transfer its content to readers and make them understood. <TR>In addition</TR>, knowledge gained from books is a efficient and effective to learn many things within a short period of time. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, just for a couple of days, people can learn many aspects about Japan even if they do not visit it.</EX> </IN>

<BO2><TS><TR>However</TR>, I firmly believe that knowledge gained from experience is more important than one from books based on two reasons addressed below.</TS> <MI1>First and foremost, knowledge gained from experience lasts for a longer time.</MI1><SI1> <TR>In other words,</TR> those who possess experienced knowledge are more likely to memorize and use it longer and frequently than those who depends on codified knowledge only. This is because people remember and use knowledge not only by using brain, but also using all senses. It means that people usually use all five senses, such as eye, nose, or ear to get knowledge derived from experience. The term 'implicit knowledge' clearly shows this point. It helps people embody their experienced knowledge to their memory and body, leading them to remember knowledge as long as possible. Many studies reveal that knowledge obtained from experience endure longer time to people due to the reasons addressed above. <TR>For instance,</TR> although people do not get skills how to drive a car by book, they can usually do well because of their knowledge gained by using all senses, from seeing to motion. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, a large number of requisite knowledge in a daily life is knowledge from experience, not from specialized books. </MI2> <SI2>I agree that mathematics skills, principle of physics and any subject which is complicating are crucial for improvement of human society. <TR>However</TR>, this is just for a few specialized scholars. I firmly support the idea that many basic skills from experience in a routine life is more important to common people. Because they are frequently used by many people and help them to live a happy life. <EX>For example, I really wanted to learn how to play tennis when I was fifteen. At that time, I read lots of tennis related magazines. <TR>However</TR>, to know from books is one thing and to play tennis is another. Only after practicing tennis with my friend could I enjoy playing tennis.</EX> Many skills in books were useless, all things that made me enriched were knowledge derived from experiencing it directly. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, I argue that the importance of knowledge gained from experience is huge and should not be neglected all time long. </CO>
column23: This is an extremely well-written essay.  I think if you move the first sentence from the first paragraph and make it the last sentence of your introduction, it would be better.  Your introduction reads like a main paragraph, and I am not sure what to think of that.  I would suggest writting just a little more for your conclusion.  Otherwise, excellent job!

column1: 954&Famous arthletes and entertainers deserve the million-dollar salaries they earn.
column3:
<IN>The disputable argument in hand is whether famous arthletes and entertainers deserve the million-dollar salaries or not. The answer of this question can be vary greatly according to individual perspectives. <TR>Thus</TR> the jury may still be out. <TS><TR>However</TR>,<TR> as I concerned,</TR> I agree with this statement.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reason to support my opinion as follows. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, everyone should attain salaries based on their efforts. This principle make people work more efficiently and diligently. </MI1> <SI1>Arttletes and etertainers usually have spent a lot of time, efforts, and money since they were young to be best at their own areas and become famous. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my older brother, a soccer player, never get rest even on weekend.<TR> Also</TR>, he should keep himself from delicious junk foods such as pizza or hamberger because he should stay in healthy. To receive reward, He has the right to gain million dollars salary.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, Many people include I love arthletes and entertainers because seeing them is absolutely stress reliving. </MI2> <SI2><TR>To be specific,</TR> as a student or a worker, people always get stressed out from heavy load of works so they need time to refresh my self, and recharge energy. Then sports game and TV programs like entertaiment and movie helps them manage their stresses. This approves that arthlets and entertainers are essential people in our life. In this sense, they deserve great amount of money. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, famous people should get a lot of pay because not only they are greatly hard worker, but also they make people relive stress. I know the verdict may still be out but I assure that I successfully approve my argument and win the symphathy of majourity people who support my viewpoint. </CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but it isn't very convincing.  Your points are that athletes work hard and make people happy.  Lots of people work hard and they don't make as much as athletes.  If your job doesn't make people happy, should you be paid less?  Think a little more about these arguments. Also, your thesis statement is very weak.  Think of it as a summary for your whole essay.  What are you going to talk about? Try to write it in one sentence, and it will be a great thesis statement.

column1: 955&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Young people enjoy their life more than older people. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>The disputable argument in hand is wheter young people enjoy their life more than older people. The answer of this question can be vary greatly according to individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR> the jury may still be out, <TR>but as I am concerned</TR>, I believe older people enjoy their life with easy than young people.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reason support my viewpoint as follows. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, older people have more resourse needed to enjoy life. </MI1> <SI1>Older people usually have more time and moneywhich can spent for their life. Enough money and time gives more oppertunities to experience variaty of leisure activities. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my grandmother spent her time traveling all over the world. She visited Hawaii last winter with her friends and enjoy sunny days while I fighted with my final exam in blizard.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, older people has more knowledge and wisdom to enjoy their life. </MI2> <SI2>Stacked experiences teach them to spent their life more efficiently. <TR>Moreover</TR>, older people has less problem such as choosing job or selecting a life partner beacuse they already went through them.<TR>To be specific</TR>, according a study of National Reserch Center of Korea, older people manage their stress 50% more easily than young people. <TR>In this sense</TR>, it is apprent that old are more happy than the young. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I agree with the statement that older people enjoy their life more than young people. I understand that the verdict may still be out, I assure that the two supports that I present are sufficient enough to persuade other people who have other point of view. </CO>
column23: This essay makes some very good, thoughtful points.  In fact, it looks like your second main essay could be split into two essays!  You need to say a little more about all your points, but this is a great start.  Good work!

column1: 956&Nowadays, students pay more attention to politics than in the past.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that today's students are less interested in politics than in the past. <TS><TR>On the other hand,</TR> I believe that they pay more attention to politics than in the past because politics can enable students to cope with their stress and succeed in career.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, having idea on politics allows students to learn to deal with stress. </MI1> <SI1>
This is due to the fact that learning politics can distract students from their worries and stress related to understanding their friends. <TR>Therefore,</TR> this informative and practical method may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as to recharge energy. <EX>According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010, there was a difference between two groups of high school students in managing their pressure on making new friends. Students in Group A who took politics in middle school and knew how to be a friend with new people were more satisfied with their school lives than those in Group B who did not learn about politics at all. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, those in Group B had a hard time to adjust to new school because they did not have a friend and felt lonely.</EX> This implies that the knowledge with politics serves as a safe and effective way to let out frustration and stress in relation with others. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> political skill has a direct correlation with success in career. </MI2> <SI2>This is attributed to the fact that students with good political skill make good suggestions, leading to the growth of company. <TR>Moreover</TR>, as modern society has become competitive and politically diverse, today's job markets require job candidates with such qualities. According to a study conducted by the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010, the employment interview was the most important component in hiring practice, taking up to more than 70 percent of the final call. The interviewers looked at the applicant's knowledge and skills of politics, mostly related to interacting with others. This implies that having good idea on politics is a secure way for students to prepare for their future. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In brief</TR>, the advantages that students can get from learning about politics far outweigh the disadvantages for the reasons I have mentioned above. <TR>All in all</TR>, this trend will continue and pass down to the next generation</CO>
column23: When I read the question, I believed it was asking if students pay attention to governmental politics or not, not whether or not they had social/political skills.  I think you defend yourself relatively well, but I'm not sure if you answered the question or not.  We will assume you did.

column1: 957&People today spend too much time on personal enjoyment-doing things they like to do - rather than doing things they should do
column3:
<IN>There are some acute conflicts whether people today spend much time on personal enjoyment or not. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> compared to the before, people today enjoy their time for entertainment more than do fundamental things that they should do. This is because people earn more leisure time than before and many jobs today are related to entertainment.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, since an available leisure time has been increased, people today have had enough time to enjoy themselves. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific,</TR> as science and technology have been developed drastically, factories and offices have various kinds of automatic systems so companies don't require their employees to work much time. <TR>To illustrate this</TR>, a 2012 report conducted by the Ministry of Labor in Korea shows that the annual working hours of an ordinary worker in 2010 is 3000 hours, while it was 3600 hours in 1960. The report also claims that due to the increase of a leisure time, people spend much time and money on things related to entertainment businesses such as watching movies, traveling, playing sports, and so on. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of the statement above</TR>, today in many cases, things that a person should do correspond to things that a person enjoys, which looks like that people just enjoy their lives without doing nothing important. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Specifically</TR>, as society evolves from uniform and hierarchical structure to individual and various one, individuals become freer of searching for jobs. It means that there are a variety of jobs out there and many of them coincide with entertainment. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one of my uncles, a skin scuba diver, spends most of his time on oceans. He teaches other people who want to explore under the sea and is in charge of guiding them there. Many relatives, especially the elders, considered him as unemployed, but the truth is that he makes a significant amount of money by enjoying his job.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I think that people nowadays use too much time on their enjoyment. This is because they become to have a significant amount of free time and jobs related to entertainment are in common in these days. </CO>
column23: For the most part this is a well organized essay, but I am confused about how you feel about this topic.  You say that people LOOK like they are doing fewer fundamental things because so many things now are related to leisure activities, so that sounds like you don't think people are wasting time.  However, then you say, "I think that people nowadays use too much time on their enjoyment." So, which one is it? What do you think?

column1: 958&Today, people's lives are much cozier and easier than the past.
column3:
<IN>As society crossed the threshold of a new millennium, humans have witnessed the advent of innumerable technologies and ideas that have enhanced the quality of our lives. <TS><TR>Thus,</TR> people are often under the impression that their lives have become better than the past. This common belief, <TR>however</TR>, is a misconception in terms of loss of traditional value and the dangers posed by the development of technology.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Looking back to Korea’s traditional community, a value that dominated our culture was collaboration and staying in unison with neighbors. </MI1> <SI1>With the emergence of a new idea, individualism, this firmly held belief was pushed out our way and people quickly took to the idea of living individual lives, less caring about others’ point of view or conventional values imposed upon them by society. The new phenomena seemed novel, since it freed people from having to work for the good of “the whole society” instead of pursuing personal interests. The enforcement of individual rights which was intended to make our society better, nonetheless, has backfired in that it has led to lack of empathy for others and the rampancy of apathy. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>It is hard to deny that the development of technology has furnished us with a number of benefits, including communicating with far flung families and friends through computer networks, and traveling overseas conveniently through means of airplanes. </MI2> <SI2>Nonetheless, if we shift our viewpoint just a little, it is easy to find that current technologies can be compared to a double-edged sword. To illustrate, the advent of communication technology which allows us great convenience has opened floodgates to new types of crimes such as identity theft and computer hacking. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, social networking service has also been taken advantage by minority to manipulate public’s opinions and perspectives on certain issues. </SI2></BO2>

<CO>The progress in technology in modern times has created a prevalent misleading idea that our lives are much cozier than the past. Although humans may be physically more comfortable, with traditional values on the wane and new dangers menacing our society, it would be hard to confirm the validity of this widespread proposition. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay. I'd like to read more.

column1: 959&eating home-made food is better than eating out in restaurants or food stands
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of discussion at hand is which is better to eat home-made food or to eat out in restaurants. The answer to this question can vary greatly depending on individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, the jury may still be out but, <TR>as far as I am concerned</TR>, I prefer to eat out.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, it is beneficial to eat out since we are able to enjoy various kinds of world’s food in restaurants. </MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR>, there are so many restaurants from all over the world such as Mexican, Spanish or Thai restaurants. Eating out has strong advantage to experience those sorts of world’s food. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my family decided to have dinner out at least once a month and try a variety of kinds of world’s dishes. Each time, one of the family members chooses what to eat and other members ought to follow his decision whether someone does not like his option or not. This policy proved beneficial because all of the members found that there are a lot of delicious and healthy dishes from all over the world. My family still maintains this successful plan and I am really sure that rest of my family members also anticipate the next surprising eating out.</EX> <TR>In this regard</TR>, eating out provides a good opportunity to experience a diversity of foods from other countries. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, there is no need to burden ourselves to do dishes or make foods. </MI2> <SI2>Most of mothers usually spend a large amount of time on preparing dishes for family. It could be irritating for mothers to make dishes for every day. <TR>Thus,</TR> eating out could be a solution for mothers since they do not need to worry about those burdensome works.<EX> According to a recent research from Oxford University, the families who eat out regularly shows a high level of sense of happiness while the families who rarely eat out presents relatively lower level of that. The researchers examined the reason for this and they found that the top rationale was that the family members feel doing dishes or preparing meals are quite boring and tedious. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the families prefer to eat out and it help for them to improve their sense of happiness</EX>. <TR>In this sense,</TR> eating out has a strong advantage to avoid boring things and it would be beneficial for family’s happiness. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again</TR>, although the verdict may still be out, I personally believe that two of my rationales are sufficiently convincing enough to represent the viewpoints of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim. </CO>
column23: Good job!  Your essay is interesting and well organized. Your thesis statement, however, needs to be strengthened.  It is 60% transition and 40% statement.  It needs to be 100% statement.

column1: 960&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The government should destroy old, historic buildings and replace them with modern buildings. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>A large number of people argue that historic buildings should be replaced with modern buildings by the government. <TS>Although I admit that building modern buildings has its advantages, I strongly believe that old, historic buildings should be preserved instead of destroying them.</TS> The rationales behind this are that having old buildings can teach history and attract lots of tourists.</IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, people can learn history when they visit historic and old buildings. </MI1> <SI1>Old buildings have their origin and stories of how they have been constructed. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people can have valuable experiences by visiting those buildings and learn about the buildings. <EX>From my personal experience, when I was a freshman in high school, I visited Empire State building in New York. I could learn about American history and how New York city was developed while visiting the building. I was very impressed about how it was built and the efforts of well-known American architect about 80 years ago.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, historic buildings can attract many tourists from all over the world. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, more people choose their tourist destinations where famous historic buildings are remained. They want to get out of their living areas where lots of modern buildings and monotonous apartments are filled with. <EX>According to suvey conducted by the Ministry of Tourism in Korea, about 40 percent of Korean tourists visited foreign countries which are famous for their historic buildings and architectures.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, I wholeheartedly believe that historic buildings should be preserved by the government. The reasons are that those buildings can teach history to people and attract tourists. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I recommend that we pay more attention to the old buildings around us that need to be preserved.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay.  My only thought is that is should be longer!

column1: 961&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The news media is a reliable source of unbiased information.
column3:
<IN>There are ongoing controversial issues that news media is a dependable or not. <TS>I agree that given statement that the news media can run with unbiased information these days because of following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the news media is affective and have powers to bring people’s attention based on trustworthy. </MI1> <SI1>Media’s first goal is giving new information that happen around the world. For a long time, without the news media, it is to believe that we cannot get anything what we want to know. <TR>However</TR>, recently many people have a negative view about a possibility of polluted fake sources from biased information in news media. Wrong information and distrustful source does not last people’s interest long as possible as can. This naturally many media keep focused on trustful sources and only the reason that compete each other, media should never have a biased view. </SI1></BO1>  

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, there are lots of organizations that control and regulate the news media keep away from having biased view. </MI2> <SI2>Several government offices and local agencies that build by citizen always watched news media’s way of broadcasting. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the cleanest media today, that the Korea’s non official agencies always maintain their view toward newspapers not to press biased news on. If some media have a biased view, this agency complains constantly, and make people not to reach that news. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO>I believe that only trustful news media always have power since there are believable agencies regulate news media not to having biased view. </CO>
column23: Your organization is good and your main points are good, but your supporting sentences are really hard to understand. Clean up your support and try to clarify your argument,

column1: 962&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their brids, cats, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationship good? Why or why not?
column3:
<IN>In this rapidly changing world, people often forget the truth how important love is. <TS>I definitely think that living with pets are a great way for many parts of people's lives.</TS> There are several reasons why I feel this way. <TR>For one thing,</TR> those activities with pets allows people feel more comfortable and safer and the other reason is that people can also learn how to love and treat others. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, I can say with full of confidence that people will feel more comfortable and safer. </MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, particularly for those of people who live themselves such as elderly or single women and men can have more benefits from their pets.<EX> Let me take my personal experience. I used to live in Canada for a year in a rented room. There was a dog that I didn't expect. I naturally spent most of my time alone without friends and family at home. <TR>As time goes by</TR>, I felt loney and feel homesick but whenever I felt that way, my dog, willow comforted me so I could get over the depression. <TR>Moreover</TR>, when I was at home alone I was not afraid because I could rely on my brave dog all the time.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another reason I would like to mention is that people will have a great chance to learn how to love and treat others with full of respectation. </MI2> <SI2>What I mean is that during the period getting along with their pets, peopel will be naturally accustomed to the way to socilalize with other people and also figure out the importance of life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one of my friend who really loves animals raise few dogs that she got on the street. The dogs were lost and got so many wounds. She originally got a dog. She said that she realized that it is important to love and care about all the creatures in the earth even it is animals or plants.</EX> After hearing what she said, I also learn the lesson that all the lives in this world is precious and valuable more than anything. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, raising pets are beneficail for people in many ways. <TR>First</TR>, pets make people feel better and realize that the importance of life and the way of how to love them. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I agree with the statement for the reasons I mentioned above. </CO>
column23: This is a very thoughtful essay.  Good job!  I would suggest getting rid of the "first" in your conclusion - it is unnecessary.

column1: 963&Some people say that success is the most important thing; do you agree or disagree that it is more important to remain in happy and optimistic when you fail.
column3:
<IN>Some people might say that people are happier when they failed in society rather than successes in the society. <TS><TR>However</TR> I personally believe people who achieved their goal get more satisfy than who don’t.</TS> The first reason is people can enjoy things, which requires much money like world trip, by using their high payment. The Second reason is people who failed to arrive at their goal are likely get stressed from their failure. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, there are more possibilities that people in high status can enjoy or do from their property and position in their society. </MI1> <SI1>In these days, parents who gained high payment job are likely give their children more enhanced educational background to their children by send their children to academy or offer high paid tuition to their children. This effort will make their children more competitive than other children who didn’t get opportunity of better education. In additional, I read book called Animal farm written by Gorge Orwell. In the book the pig called Napoleon get all authority to control whole farm and he use his power for his species to eat fully and oppress other animals. In other words Napoleon has achieved success which enabled him enjoy his authority for himself and his family. In conclusion the successes people in their society are happier than who don’t due to variety of enjoyment which can be done by their ability. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR> people who failed to success in their goal are likely feel depression and stress which make them unhappier than who successed. </MI2> <SI2>In recent days there are many news about people who failed in their society suicide due to the stress and murdered their neighbor who were rich in the society due to the jealousness. To clarify this, I read from science magazine that statistic on people felling unsatisfyness and depression on their lives came out 3 times bigger for people who failed their goal in the society than who achieved success. The statistic also include the rate of people who commit suicide and criminal due to heavy depression and stress from their failure much higher than people success and satisfying their result. In conclusion people must success in their society to prevent depression and stress from their failure for achieving success. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up with</TR>, people must success in their society for much authority they can use or enjoy and prevent criminal and suicide due to their failure. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, except that it didn't answer the question.  The question asked if it was important to be optimistic WHEN you fail.

column1: 964&Today's quickly changing world is making people less happy.
column3:
<IN>Opinion might be divided over whether modern quickly changing world is not good for people. people from different walk of life take different stance on the issue. <TS>I firmly believe that today advance development society is likely to make people unhappy, and there are two reasons that could be validated my position.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, quickly changing world, such as development of advertisement, makes teenagers reckless and aggressive. </MI1> <SI1>today, many commercial use sexual images and symbols to appeal to more consumers. teenagers are an easy target of the strategy because they lack a sense of molality and judgment. while constantly exposed to such difficulty, teenagers and young children are be likely to be impulsive in their thought and behavior. <EX>a study by conducted Ministry of Education showed that the number of suggestive scenes and violent images in television commercial has more than tripled over the past five year. more surprising was finding that the number coincided with increase in violence and teenager pregnancy for the same time period.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>And another reason</TR> is that abruptly changing technology advance in our society like car makes air pollution or unhealthy problem in our body. </MI2> <SI2>It will contributes to harmful effect for many people. In their invention, cars has become integral part of our life and something most of us simply cannot live without. they can moved me farther away from cities while still enjoying a convenience of city life. <TR>however</TR> on the flip side of the numerous benefits have adverse effect that should not be overlooked. <EX>For example, cars were under severe criticism for depleting our oil supply, with more than 60% of automobiles across the world using oil as fuel. with making noise and emitting exhaust gas, cars are one of the leading causes of environment pollutions and pose serious threat to our public health.</EX> this problem that made by technology development will make people unhappy and depressed. many people are likely to desire tranquility and no noise environment before changing by cars. It reveal that people feel unhappy since changing the world. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all</TR>, because of two reasons mentioned above, i strongly believe that today's quickly changing world is making people less happy. </CO>
column23: I think I understand most of this essay.  You have good ideas, but your writing is a little hard to follow.  Also, take out the part about advantages in the first main essay.  It doesn't help you.

column1: 965&Important decisions should not be made without others.
column3:
<IN>some people are very independent. When they are in a particular situation or are in time to make an important decision, they try to make up all of them by themselves. Because these people believe that nobody can perfectly understand their situation. So they thinks they do not need other’s help. <TS><TR>However,</TR> <TR>in my opinion</TR>, making decisions without others could be a little bit dangerous since people cannot see objective situation. <TR>Also</TR> people can make better decision with others knowledge and experience.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, people sometimes refuse to other’s help when they have to make an important decision since they think that they can make objective decision. However, most people obsessed with unbiased thought so they cannot see the big picture.</MI1><SI1> This unbiased thought and value distract people to make objective decision because they are involved in their situations. <TR>In other word</TR>, if people ask other people who are not involved, they can get more objective decisions. That is the reason why many people want to introduce their fiance to their close friends or family member before getting married. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to</TR>, with diverse experiences and knowledge, people can get better decision. </MI2> <SI2>when I was a freshman in high school, my computer broke down. I was frustrated because without computer I couldn’t do my homework and other important things. I decided to buy new one but I was not familiar with computer field. So I asked to my friend who well knows about computers. She gave very important information and tip to buy good computer. So I could buy good computer with reasonable price. Through this experience i realized that others knowledge and experience can be helpful when I make an important decision. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, although everyone may hold a different position on this issue, I am positive about this idea that important decisions should not be made without others. </CO>
column23: For the most part this essay is pretty good.  However, there are a few things that need fixing.  First of all, I think you mean people who make decisions by themselves have BIASED thinking, not unbiased.  Second, you should add a little more to that first paragraph in favor of bringing in other people.

column1: 966&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People should try several different jobs before getting a long-term job. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Many students nowadays try to experience a large number of jobs as much as possible before they finally settle down to a long-term job. They argue that trying several jobs before finding out a long-term job is helpful for their career as well as their life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I disagree with this argument and firmly believe that people had better search for a long-term job from the start.</TS> My opinion can be greatly substantiated by the reasons addressed below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it can be harmful for people who want to have a secured job if they habe tried many different jobs beforehand. </MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, people should search for a good job and stick to it otherwise they can give a bad signal to employers. <EX>In 2012, Harvard business school research team investigated Fortune 500 companies' human resource managers to find out what characteristic they really wanted for their potential employees. <TR>To our surprise</TR>, language proficiency or good grades were not their top priority. They regarded 'loyalty' as the most important factor when hiring workers. <TR>To put it in another way,</TR> they hated those who tried too many different jobs before applying for their company. They thought these applicants were not loyal to company, easy to go out voluntarily if they were unsatisfied with their job, and not patient to much stress in the workplace. <TR>Rather</TR>, they highly liked to hire who had no prior experience and possessed fresh mind.</EX> To avoid the possibility that regarded as a mistrusted person, people should not try several chances before getting a long-term job. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people can substitute taking several job risks with many internship programs. </MI2> <SI2><TR>These days</TR>, many colleges and corporations provide various internship programs for to-be workers. By experience internship programs several times, people can find out what their real interest is and what kinds of factors they consider the most for a long-term work. After knowing these things, people can apply for the most suitable job to them and it can help them not to move among many jobs. <TR>In addition</TR>, applying for an internship is easier to get a chance than trying to find out a real job. With a small effort, time and cost, people can discover their true interest and priority. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, I highly support the idea that people should not try several jobs, and had better stick to a first job. One legendary CEO in South Korea recollected his memory, saying that 'Although it was hard to figure out whether my first job was suit to me at that time, I finally can conclude that it was my best choice I have ever made in my life. The title of CEO shows why I am true.' People should remember what he said. </CO>
column23: A well written, well defended essay! Good job.

column1: 967&Children should spend their time studying or playing and should not be required to help their families.
column3:
<IN>It is important for children to study and play. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, those are not more significant than helping their families.</TS> This is largely due to the fact that helping families have positive influence on shaping the personalities in childhood. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>On top of that</TR>, helping families encourages children to take responsibility. </MI1> <SI1>If household chores are assigned to them, they will do that completely to make their words and to praise what they did from their parents. <EX><TR>From my experience,</TR> my parents let me do chores every day at an early age. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I could take responsibility for my tasks, so I could well in studying. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, helping their families gives them an opportunity to communicate with their family members. </MI2> <SI2>They will do everything hand in hand. It can develop the sense of community for children. The studies have shown that the more children spend quality time with their families, the more children are likely to shape right values. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, although children are good at studying, the most influential factor in childhood is helping their families. </CO>
column23: This essay has some good points, but it needs a lot more content.  You need to support your ideas with more than just a few sentences.

column1: 968&All teachers are required to update their knowledge every five years
column3:
<IN>An intriguing topic of discussion at hand is whether teachers ought to update their knowledge every five years. The answer to this question can vary greatly depending on individual perspectives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, the jury may still be out, <TR>but as far as I am concerned</TR>, I agree with the statement.</TS> In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my standpoint as follows. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, teachers should revise their knowledge following changes in the world. </MI1> <SI1>In a modern society, information and knowledge change so quickly that things believed to be true would be converted into false at even a day. <TR>Therefore</TR>, living in the era, teachers should be forced to update their knowledge. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was a high school student, I had a very old teacher and he was about to retire from his work. His class was so infamous since he taught students seriously old theories Students requested the teacher to deal with contemporary knowledge but he did not care at all.</EX> <TR>In the end,</TR> we were taught absolutely useless knowledge for a year. <TR>In this regard</TR>, teachers should be required to update their knowledge on regular period. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, if teachers are to be asked to update their knowledge and this policy is to be settled, quality of education would be improved significantly. </MI2> <SI2>Suppose this policy is settled firmly then teachers ought to try to improve their own knowledge. There is an adequate example for this situation. <EX>One of my friends’ schools adopted this sort of policy to its teachers. The teachers were provided proper opportunities and conditions to update their knowledge. Teachers were pleased at those chances since they also thought that they needed those opportunities. After several years, it is proved that the quality of teaching augmented dramatically and the school rewarded for “innovative school of the year.”</EX> <TR>In this sense</TR>, this plan would incline the quality of teaching and students will get benefits from it. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I strongly argue for my standpoint on account of two reasons mentioned above. <TR>Once again</TR>, although the verdict may still be out, I personally believe that two of my rationales are sufficiently convincing enough to represent of a majority of people who are in favor of my claim. </CO>
column23: This is a good essay, just watch your transitions.  You do not need to put two in a row.  Also, please take out the 'jury' and 'verdict' sentences.  The reader isn't concerned about the 'jury' - he or she only wants to know what YOU think.

column1: 969&Rather than helping school work, parents should encourage their childdren to work independently.
column3:
<IN><TS>In this dog-eat-dog world, When it comes to finishing their work, I believe that depending on their parents is more beneficial for children.</TS> <TR>In this regrad</TR>, some migh suggest children should do their assignment as it can develop their sense of independence. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>contrary to such a belief</TR>, I strongly argue that there are two merits if they rely on their parents. In this essay, I will be two reasons for opinion. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, helping from their parents helps the young people to get practical advices. </MI1> <SI1>Because parents underwent countless success and failure, they have insight into the world. <TR>In other words</TR>, they could gain an upper-hand in finishing their assignment. <EX><TR>To illustrate this point</TR>, when I was in high school, my homework was that choose to what kinds of major in university is better for me. I was so confuse that which major would be better for me between Business and Math. Although Business looks like more prospective but I was fasnated with Math. After carefully consideration, I turned to my father for help. As he told me that he had the same experience when he selected major. As he was go-better when he studiedMath, he decided to major in Math. <TR>As a result</TR>, he could get enjoying jobs related to the major, and he was highly-paid. <TR>After that</TR>, I determined to decide to major in Math. If I had not done so, I would not be able to finish my work completely.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, when it comes to getting stressed out, finishing their work alone is not beneficial. </MI2> <SI2>Thesedays, a number of the young people are stressed out because they are under pressure to have to complete their work just alone. From making food to getting a lot of information for assignment, it seems evitable to get stressed out. <TR>To be specific</TR>, if children get homework that they should make a variety of cookie, it could be stressful work to make it themselves. <TR>In addition</TR>, if children had little experience about finding books or using computer, it would be also desperate.<TR> On the other hand,</TR> if parents help these work, children could relieve stress. </SI2></BO2>
column23: Too many transitions, especially in the introduction. Also, your first main paragraph seems to stray from the topic a little.  I'm pretty sure this essay is only meant to talk about homework and projects.

column1: 970&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to complain in person than in writing.
column3:
<IN>Writing is a better method to express my opinion rather than speaking, since it offers me a time to prepare. <TS><TR>However</TR>, relating to complaining about some problems, it is better to speak in person than to write the letter. <TR>Thus</TR>, I agree with the statement and this is strongly substantiated by the points represented below.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, this is because the object that has been complained by me also has a time to prepare if I write a letter. </MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, I lose chance to satisfy my complain since I gave the object a time to ready. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, if I complain in person, I can examine all the details and rules that support my idea and there are more possibility to accomplish my requirement. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I had a problem with my cell phone recently. My phone was a little bit broken since I first bought it and it finally collapsed after 1 week I bought it. I wrote a letter to improve my situation. <TR>However</TR>, the corporation made plausible excuse that contradict my argument, and rejected to give a new one. After my visiting cell phone store I bought, they realized that it was not my fault, and then gave me a new one, saying sorry.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, there are more probabilities to socialize with the people. </MI2> <SI2><TR>To put it another way,</TR> by making a good relationship during complaining, it is more likely to solve problems in a desired way. <EX>There was a terrible accident recently, that a person who was not satisfied with the tone of the letter from his employer killed the employer. It would not have happened if they met each other and commuicate in good manner.</EX> There is also a research that justify my opinion. For the 300 neighbors in Seoul who are friendly each other, ther were no legal conflict. <TR>However</TR> in other places, which are also located in Seoul showed many problems and even sued each other. This shows how important to have a relationship with the people who have problems to be solved. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly support the idea that it is far much better to complain in person than in writing. <TR>In addition</TR>, there would be chances to be familiar with each other and have win-win results. Hope many people solve their problems by talking in person.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Great work!

column1: 971&One of the most characteristics of a good political or a business leader is the ability to accept responsibility for mistakes.
column3:
<IN><TS>Qualifications politicians and company managers should have can be various according to individual but I think that the most important trait of a good leader is to admit to their mistakes caused by themselves.</TS> There are several reasons I could discuss to support my argument so I would limit my discussion to the two that are the most relevant to the topic. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>All the people make a mistake when deciding something. We occasionally say that since we are a human, it is natural to commit mistakes. </MI1> <SI1> <TR>However</TR>, most of the people have an aversion on denying mistakes and errors arouse by their hands because denying their mistake is equal to telling a lie. Some might say that acknowledging the mistake have a harm effect on a person`s career and ability, which result in the loss of important advantages but, rather, to avoid can cause more serious result. <EX>Let`s give an example. A company which has made varied groceries for a long time and has been known for their taste was accused of dead insect within a noodle. She took photos and uploaded them on her internet blog. As the fact spread widely and rapidly between people, the company should take a step immediately. After a few days, CEO of the company admitted their mistake apologizing to consumers and promised retrieving all the grocery in the market and strengthening all procedures of making and checking a food. Even though initially, there are so many appeals, protests and reproaches from consumers, as time elapsed many consumers started again buying the company`s products. If the company`s leaders did not take action swiftly and shifted the responsibility, consumers would not purchase the product permanently. A leader who avoiding their fault can escape from a flying arrow and pass their mistake on to other, but ultimately, he will lose their crucial surrounding people. This is why leaders have to admit their mistake.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, it is a reasonable and wise step to acknowledge their mistake frankly considering a subsequent result, which is essential qualifications for leaders to acquire. <TR>In this regard</TR>, I agree with a given statement. </CO>
column23: Your first main paragraph is so impressive that I can't give you a low score.  However, you really should have at least two reasons to support and thus two main paragraphs.

column1: 972&Because environmental issues are very complex, individuals can do nothing about them on their own.
column3:
<IN>I agree that many environmental issues are sophisticated and need cooperation. <TS>However, I disagree that each person needs to do nothing for solving the issues. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, resolving the problems related to environment should start from tiny efforts of individuals because they have power to change and</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, aggregating small environmentally friendly actions of individuals can be transformed into a tremendous result. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, even though a tiny effort of an individual might be small and insignificant, a big change can be realized if each effort of individuals gathers. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a few years ago a small city in Korea had a serious air pollution problem. Since there was drastic increase of cars in roads in the city, the air pollution got worse. In order to solve the problem, officers of the city made a campaign to public about using less own vehicles. Since almost everyone was aware of this serious problem, many people took public transportation instead of using their own cars. <TR>Finally,</TR> the air pollution level considerably was reduced thanks to efforts of the every person in the city. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of the claim above</TR>, initiatives which are concerned with environment but do not require individuals to take any action are likely to be inefficient. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Specifically</TR>, since issues of protecting environment are complicated, many nations spend considerable money on there or cooperate together to control them. <TR>However</TR>, since people would do the same thing that they did before without motivation for changing their attitude or behaviors, plans lack of individual efforts can be failed. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, a decade years ago the government of Korea started a plan improving the quality of the Han-river in Seoul. It spent nearly thousands of million dollars on the plan. <TR>However</TR>, the problem was the citizen who passed by there and did not stop throwing garbage to the river. <TR>Frequently</TR>, people came out to the river and did their laundries. <TR>As a result</TR>, the plan cost a lot but the quality of the water did not get better at all. If the plan had made people behave well, the result would have been different. </EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I believe that without every individual's effort, environmental issues cannot be solved well because small actions of each individual aggregate and make a big change.<TR> Also,</TR> plans lack of individual's behavior is inefficient. </CO>
column23: Great job!  All you need to do is finish your thesis statement.

column1: 973&How do movies or television influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People these days enjoy watching TV and movies. Also most of families have Televisions in their living room and they have fun time watching TV shows sitting on the sofa. <TS><TR>However</TR>, although these media such as TV, movies have a lot of positive social effects, such as, family bonding, people need to focus on bad influence of TV, Movies on them.</TS> The reasons are presented below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, watching movies or television could trigger serious social crimes. </MI1> <SI1><TR>Especially</TR>, too much watching the movies that mainly include violent scenes such as murder, fights could be latent social problems, and even it might be cause of psychological disorders. Some studies have shown that most of serious crimes occurred by people who had usually enjoyed to watch violent movies. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On the top of that</TR>, spending too many times to watch television or movies could negatively affect on one’s health. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Especially</TR>, this could be cause of failing eyesight. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, <TR>to be specific</TR>, most of movies made of brilliant scenes, these weaken people’s eyesight. <EX>I take one example from my experiences. When I was 10 years old, I had excellent eyesight, approximately 2.0. <TR>However</TR>, after 15 years, my eyesight fall to -3.0 and main reason of this is that I had watched too many TV shows.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, even though, there are many positive aspects of watching visual media, I think that movies or television have negative influence on people’s behavior. </CO>
column23: This is a good start, but you need to make your essays longer.  You also need to look at your transitions.  There is no need to put two transitions together.

column1: 974&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High school students should be allowed to choose some of their classes. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that high schools should allow students to choose some of their classes themselves. They say that it has more advantages than a way to make students take designated classes for mandatory. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, it is a bad idea to allow high school students to choose their classes freely.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, schools would be in very tight schedules if they allow students to take classes they want. </MI1> <SI1>Today, high school students are even too hectic and stressed out to follow regular courses because they have to get high scores from the tests. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they have to prepare for entering to universities. <TR>Therefore</TR>, there are no extra times for teaching subjects students choose because schedules are saturated with basic courses. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, there are schools specialized in science and mathematics for gifted students in Korea. They have distinctive departments for each majors and make students accumulate credits by choosing classes freely. Since they are allowed to choose their classes themselves, they have to finish regular classes in a year. <TR>Thus</TR>, they say that they even feel too nervous when a clock sounds for a second even though they are talented in studying. <TR>Ultimately</TR>, students are in too tight schedules because they have to finish both regular classes and additional classes they choose. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, the classes could be declined as ‘playing classes’. </MI2> <SI2>Since there are some students who are not interested in studying, they would flock with each other and can distract the classes. Then all students of the classes would not be able to participate in classes well. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was in school, there were many club activities in my school. Students could choose the classes in their interests, so I chose a camera class and expected to learn many useful techniques. <TR>However</TR>, there were many students who came because they have to choose classes regardless of their eager to learn. <TR>Needless to say</TR>, they chatted all times and distracted all students in a classroom. <TR>Eventually</TR>, most of students including those who came to the class with their interests chatted or did other things during the classes.</EX> It will produce same effects if high schools provide students to choose classes in their own interests. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, teachers and students would be confused to take courses because all students over their classes are mixed together. </MI3> <SI3><TR>First</TR>, teachers would have difficulties of checking attendances of students because students in a class are dispersed to many classes. <TR>Second</TR>, students would be distressed because there are many students who do not know each other. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was in a school, there were many students, who went to their homes stealthily instead of participating in club activities. <TR>However</TR>, homeroom teachers could not know who went to homes or be late for classes because all teachers who instruct the activities were too busy to send attendance records to the homeroom teachers. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I think students should be only allowed to take same courses with their classmates. There would be more disadvantages over advantages if schools make students choose some of their classes themselves. </CO>
column23: This is a great essay, except for one part.  I'm afraid I didn't understand the third main paragraph.  The rest of it I understand, and you make some very strong points.  Watch your transitions.  Too many are a distraction.

column1: 975&The television has had a greater effect on people's lives than the telephone has.
column3:
<IN>Some people say that the telephone has had a great effect on people’s lives than the television has, because the telephone made us to easily keep in touch with our friend even though they live far away. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my perspective</TR>, we have been more influenced by the television for the following reasons.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the television can have a significant influence on our lives by providing myriads of topics to talk with other, thus assisting us to make many friends. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, any popularized shows to among our friends can offer new interest resources to talk about, which instigate people to lead better conversation. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was in middle school, all words from communication between my friends me was just basic greeting comment, such as “I” or “How are you”.</EX> <TR>However</TR>, since famous and issued audition program started to televised, our conversation shifted to better. <TR>Hence</TR>, I could make more friends. If I had not watched the television, I would not have had many friends. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Last but not least</TR>, people watch the television more than they use telephone, so the television has a more affect on our lives. </MI2> <SI2><TR>As one might expect</TR>, some people watch the television more than three or four hours in a day. The telephone, <TR>on the other hand</TR>, is used only an hour, which lack such influences. <TR>For instance</TR>, the television makes me lazy and provides many entertainments, and some movies or dramas can affect us. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, the telegraph is utilized only some cases: when people call me and if I need to call someone. <TR>Consequently</TR>, televisions have a strong influence on people’s lives. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Granted</TR>, the telephone also has an effect on us in some ways. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, it is televisions which can comprehensively affect our lives, due to the many topics to talks provided by the television and more time to watch televisions. </CO>
column23: Please use fewer transitions.  They are distracting. The example in your first paragraph makes no sense - I'm sure you can think of a specific example of something you and your friends talked about a lot on TV.  In the second paragraph, did you realize that you said telegraph?

column1: 976&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?　Television advertising directed toward children under the age of five should not be allowed.　Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that there in nothing wrong with letting young children watch advertisement. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, the advertisement that towards young children should be prevented.</TS> The reasons are that young children might injury and they will lose the interest of the object from advertisement after a while.</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, let young children to watch advertisement may lead to a serious incident. </MI1> <SI1>It is because the children would like to follow what they have seen. So that they really think that works in the real life. <TR>Hence</TR>, they follow what they have seen from the Television. <EX><TR>Long time ago</TR>, there was an advertisement of superman suit. Then young children wanted to be a hero so they bought the suit because they really think that if they wear it, they could fly. Hence they jump from the top of the roof. Instead of flying, they injured his arm.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, young children should be not allowed to see any advertisement until they are able to know the realism. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, children are willing to have everything what they have attracted. <TR>However</TR>, the problem is that they do not have enough patient so when they are bored with their objects they easily throw it away.</MI2><SI2> <TR>To be specific</TR>, nowadays many parents are too soft for their children so they buy everything what their children willing to have. <TR>However</TR>, when the young children got bored with the object, they will just put away in the corner or just throw it away. <TR>In fact</TR>, this is a great loss. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the parents should not allow their children to see the advertisement to prevent this situation until they are grown up enough to control themselves. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, It should not be allowed to let young children to watch advertisement as it could lead the serious injury and waste of money. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, It is not good for such a young aged children to watch attractive advertisements. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay.  Again, please watch your transitions.  You don't need to have one right after the other.

column1: 977&Technology has made children less creative than they were in the past.
column3:
<IN>It is often said that technology has hindered children from being creative than before. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, I disagree with the claim and believe that technology gives young ages useful ways of thinking creatively.</TS> This is because advanced technologies allow children to give various educational tools and also lead parents to share information related to education easily.</IN>
