<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, educational methods and tools raising creativity become various and popular as science and technology have been developed. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, thanks to the advanced technological development, many innovative materials and electronics are created and become common and inexpensive.<TR> At the same time,</TR> a variety of tools for education are emerged using those materials and electronics. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a portable gadget especially for children is in trend in Korea. With this machine, children can draw or write anything they want.</EX> Then the machine automatically transmits the drawing to teachers who specialize in the child education. After analyzing the drawing, the teachers give the children and their parent comments for improving creativity. This demonstrates a positive role of technology on improving children's creativity. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of the claim above</TR>, parents can easily access information related to education thanks to the Internet, which lets them know useful methods for raising their children's creativity. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Specifically</TR>, there are many practical websites and forums that parents share their nurturing know-hows and useful educational methods. From these communities, parents can get information about the way their children are more creative. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, last year, one of the parenting websites won one of the most honorable awards related to education in Korea. The website awarded it because it lowered the significant cost for education by giving parents inexpensive and practical methods of raising knowledge and creativity. After learning methods from the website, many parents apply them to their own children. They say that the methods are effective.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I think that technology gives children more opportunities to become more creative than they were in the past. This is largely because children can develop creativity by using interesting gadgets and parents learn educational know-hows from the Internet. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Great work!

column1: 978& It is better to work on one task at a time than to do several at the same time.
column3:
<IN>In the past times, people did not have to think about many things. Their life pattern was very simple and did not have occurrences to work on several tasks at same time. <TR>However in these days</TR>, the phase has changed. Do to Industrialization, people in these days live with huge amount of tasks and information. <TR>Thus</TR> the importance of multitasking has been highlighted in modern time. <TS><TR>However</TR> I think there are far more disadvantages than the positive aspects of multitasking.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1>Unfortunately, the human brain is not capable of doing several tasks at the same time. </MI1> <SI1>The truth is, our brains just aren’t equipped for multitasking tasks that do require brainpower. Our short-term memories can only store between five and nine things at once. This means the productivity’s efficiency is drastically reduced when a person do many works at the same time. There was a survey made by the famous magazine “the Forbes” proving that human’s brain loses up about 70% of their memory when they work on a task. If a person tries to do several tasks at same time, the person loses 90% of the memories related to the works in an hour. <TR>Thus</TR>, human was not born with the ability to multitask. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Human tend to finish a work efficiently because of the concentration, and the sense of accomplishment. People have hard time for completing their works in these modern days because there are so many things to do.</MI2><SI2> If they do many works at the same time, they are overwhelmed by the number of the tasks. They easily lose their will to finish the works, finally ending up most of their work undone. <EX>Because of these reasons, the UN security general Ban ki mun, focused on one thing when he was a teenager. His way of studying is very famous. When he studied, he only focused on a work with great concentration and finished it very quickly and thoroughly. By doing this, he felt a sense of accomplishment, and motivated to do the other works quickly as well as the previous work that he finished. His studying method shows us that it is much better to concentrating at a work, not several works.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>Although</TR> we are living in the period of information and technology, which compels us to do many tasks, I think focusing on one task at a time is much better for people because humans are not capable of multitasking and it is much more motivating to do one task at a time. </CO>
column23: Great job! You've written an excellent essay.

column1: 979&The best way to improve the quality of education is to increase teacher's salaries.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that changes in salary have minimal effect on the quality of education. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, I believe that increased salary is the best approach to enhance the education.</TS> This is because higher salary can motivate teachers, and because teachers can use added salary to provide their students more materials and information. </IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, teachers can stimulated by increased salary. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, if there is rise in salary, teachers would teach their students more ardently and are willing to teach more. <EX>According to a study conducted by Seoul National University of Korea in 2008, there were two groups of teachers observed with the different salaries to teach students: Group A received higher income, and Group B received lower income. Later both groups were interviewed and the result showed that Group A was more enthusiastic in teaching students, whereas Group B showed just a plain behavior and were not really passionate. This implies that higher salaries of teachers do have a large impact on the quality of education.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, higher salary can help teachers offer students more materials and better information. </MI2> <SI2>This is because teachers can buy some educational tools and can educate themselves by spending increased salaries. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my uncle was an English grammar teacher in the middle school. <TR>However</TR>, my uncle never practiced English speaking. <TR>Therefore</TR>, he could not speak English very well. As the world became more and more globalized, the school that my uncle work at increased his salary to train his English speaking ability. <TR>As a result</TR>, his speaking improved a lot. <TR>Therefore</TR>, he could teach his students not only grammar but also speaking. This resulted in providing more materials and information. Without increased salary, he could have not taught his students with high quality.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, increased salary is an effective motivation tool and can make teachers to provide students with more helpful and practical information. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly believe that increasing teacher’s salaries is the most efficacious way to improve the quality of education. </CO>
column23: This is a great essay!  Good job!

column1: 980&University students should be required to attend classes.
column3:
<IN>Since matriculating in college, I have seen many students frequently forgoing classes and others taking attendance seriously and observed the impact of this difference on academic achievement. Some maintain that regular attendance of class is not a critical component of effective performance but usually nothing is further from the truth referring to the testimonies of considerable number of students on college academics. Quite a few professors would accept it as undeniable truth that students taking classes seriously are more prone to succeed in class than those who are not. Besides what final grade implies, many other factors come into play in determining the characteristics of college students when it comes to attending classes. <TS>I will summarize some of the findings that suggest the importance of regular participation of classes to students who hope for success both in and out of college classes.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>Attending lecture teaches you basic responsibility as a student to be successful in academic and career life. </MI1> <SI1>Students encounters several obligations as a learner in classes such as arriving in class on time, submitting homework and assignment, preparing for tests and so forth. It is one of grading criteria striving to prove that students are qualified and diligent candidates for an excellent grade. To ensure excellent performance on those necessitates regular attendance of class to check back professor’s lectures and know what is going on and when is the due date of assignment. Completion of tasks in classes imparts students the basic characteristics of taking responsibility and working diligently to succeed in any job outside classes as constituents of society and workforce. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>One learns broad scope of knowledge that is not coming from books and other accommodations by participating in classes. </MI2> <SI2>I personally speculate that regular attendance of lectures foster better understanding of materials and provide vast information to be focused on that is not in books. <TR>Moreover</TR>, lecture component of classes is a panoramic view of what professors expect me to know and what the test questions will be like. Books usually contain comprehensive range of materials yet lack the ability to highlight vital information. <TR>In addition</TR>, through attending classes, one obtains valuable opportunities to participate in discussion with classmates and professors. By interacting with and asking professors inquiries, students come to learn what was previously unknown and confronts opposing viewpoints, which is not achieved through reading tons of books on class materials. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3>How attending lecture improves grade is simple yet multidimensional fundamentals. </MI3> <SI3>From my four years of college experience, I can confidently insist that there is no better strategy than attending classes regularly to be a good test taker. Unless I went through basic ideas of each lecture and set aside time for complementing this knowledge, I used to cram for the test night before and the test result was devastating when I did that. The best tactic is to study diligently every week, but I soon realized this is accomplished only by being in every class. I came to approach the topics easily and tackle information only when sit there to listen to lectures and take notes. Besides preparing me for exams, attending lecture improved my overall grade by helping homework problems and answering some of my questions. </SI3></BO3>

<CO>Whether it is generally agreed or disagreed, I think every story of students prove that attending class is essential to success in college classes. Along with teaching you fundamental responsibility as a student and job candidates, class participation provides information outside books and other viewpoints on issues. <TR>What’s more</TR>, attending lecture better prepares you for exams and improves your overall grade by accommodating academic performance. Although some professors do not integrate class attendance into students’ grade, I think it should be a universal requirement for college students. </CO>
column23: I would really like to give this essay a perfect score, but your third main paragraph seems like it doesn't fit.  The main idea isn't really clear.  Is there any way to move it into one of the other paragraphs, or to clarify the main idea?  Otherwise, it is a really excellent essay!

column1: 981&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? Nowadays people put too much emphasis on personal appearance and fashion.
column3:
<IN>Since the world is developing as time passes, people who fulfilled their essential needs began to concern about their external things such as personal appearance and fashion. <TS><TR>However</TR>, it is getting exuberant and people put too much emphasis on them.</TS> I totally agree with the statement, and this is greatly substantiated by the reasons presented below. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, some people even are taking risks to improve their appearance. </MI1> <SI1>To put it another way, even though they are aware of the danger they should risk, some people are still wanting and taking cosmetic surgery. According to the reasearch of science lab in Seoul National University, every cosmetic surgery has more than 1% of possibility that might lead to death of the object and the objects are told before the surgery begins. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, there are not much people who stop surgery and of course, 1% of people end up their lives doing the surgery. They just lose their lives in an attempt to be a little more attractive outward. This proves for what extent people are concerned about their appearance and that it is too much if think rationally. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, annually changing fashion trends also shows that people are putting too much concern on their fashion. </MI2> <SI2><TR>In other words</TR>, new fashion trends are altering old ones rapidly because people desire to be differentiated with others. <TR>Thus</TR>, in every season, completely different sorts of clothings compared to previous year are exhibited in magazines. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> almost all of my friends go to shopping when season changes, because clothings they have are already out of date.</EX> New arrivals are full in department stores, and there are filled with numerous people who want to buy new clothings. The formal presentation of Sinsagae Department store also shows that more than 15% of profit is gained by fashion-related products. This surely authenticate people are paying too much attention on fashion. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, there is a proverb that says, "If you want to know about a person, look at one's demeanor." Flourishing cosmetic industries and fashion industries testify that many people are paying too much attention on their personal appearance and fashion. To be a better society, it would be nice if they pay attention to both inner and outer portions. </CO>
column23: A great essay!  Excellent work.

column1: 982&Most problems which affect your society will be solved during your lifetime.
column3:
<IN>There is an argument over whether most problems in society will be solved in this century. People from different walks of life may take different stances on this issue. <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I believe that most social problems are likely to be solved in my lifetime, and there are two reasons that could validate my position.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1>The first point is that environmental pollution would be solved by worldwide efforts. </MI1> <SI1>This is widely accepted that environmental destruction is a serious problem that should not be over looked. Especially, the production and use of fossil fuels causes serious damage to the environment by releasing greenhouse gas and depleting the ozone layer. <TR>As this regard</TR>, many countries has concerned about such problem and made all-out efforts to reduce the leading causes of global warming. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, they have tried to pass a international law related to restriction on the use of gasoline and diesel fuel.</EX> <TR>In response to this</TR>, the global automobile industry make effort to develop cars that use echo-friendly energy. This kind of responses from industries and company have positive effects on recovering the environment. Also many people change the way of consumption, buying eco-friendly products I. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>Another compelling reason is that advanced technology would get rid of poverty.</MI2><SI2> It is no secret that food is significant matter for people to live. <TR>Thus</TR>, from past to present, I has tried to save people from poverty. <TR>Currently</TR>, scientist develop a novel technology which can distribute food sources effectively. According to a study conducted by Harvard University, more than two-thirds of people under the poverty get necessary ingredients from food made by new technology. Also researcher said that among this advanced technology, GM food is one of the significant invention that could reduce level of poverty because of its productivity and big size. <TR>Therefore</TR>, poverty, one of the main global problem, would be extinct by technological improvement in food industry. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All in all</TR>, because of the reasons that I mentioned above, I firmly believe that the problems in this society would be solved in decades.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work.

column1:
983&
Children should not make important decisions alone
column3:
<IN>Along with vast societal advancements, some issues are gaining popularity among the populace, one of which is whether children should be left to make important decisions alone. <TS>In view of today’s communal conditions, it would be inappropriate to let children make important decisions all by themselves; however it would be more suitable to guide them and oversee them to make right choices.</TS> Amidst the insurmountable bases which formulated my stand, seemingly there are two eye-catching facets. </IN>

<BO1><MI1>The initial motive for my stand that is exceptionally evident is that the problems that children face these days are too complicated. </MI1> <SI1>It is simply too hard for children to estimate what their choice would eventually turn out. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when children choose which subject to take at school they tend to choose a subject with less burden or simply follow their friends. <TR>However</TR>, there are some essential prerequisite subjects that they need to take in order to understand more difficult subjects to come. <EX>One of my friend, who wanted to become a software developer, stopped taking math classes after 7th grade because he found it very boring. He thought there was no connection between computer and math. Apparently he failed to get an admission for the computer science department and regrets his foolish decision greatly. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2>A further cause why I am for the same opinion with aforesaid explanation is that children do not have ability to be responsible for their decisions. </MI2> <SI2>Sometimes a wrong decision might cost thousands of dollars to others and the person who made such decision. <TR>However</TR>, children do not posses such amount of money or legal responsibility for the damage they have done. All aftermath will be left for their parents or guardians. It is very obvious that a decision should be left for the person who will be responsible for the consequences. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, it is not appropriate to let children make important decisions alone because problems they face are too complicated and they are usually not responsible for what they have done. Anchored on aforesaid evaluations and arguments we can conclusively say that children should not make important decisions alone. <TR>However</TR>, everything has two sides, it would not be wise to oppress children and tie their hands because they need to develop sense of self-esteem. We should practice caution and moderation. </CO>
column23: Good job! You make some very good points.

column1: 984&Playing computer games is a waste of time. Children should not be allowed to play them.
column3:
<IN>Some people argue that playing computer games is fun and get their stress out. <TS><TR>However</TR>, since there are more negative effects of enjoying computer games than positive ones, I think that children should not be allowed to play them.</TS> This is because computer games contain harmful contents such as violence or sex, and children can be addicted to the games easily, which ruins their grades. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all<TR>, many computer games have violent or sexual features, which give negative influences on children's personality development. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific</TR>, if children repeatedly play games related to shooting guns and killing others, they get used to those actions and can be confused between the game and the real world where they live. <EX>For example, last year a ten years old kid shot his friend with his father's bullet in U.S.A. The kid said that his friend made him angry for a tiny fault so he killed him. The police who investigated on him found out that he constantly played a cruel shooting game so he became aggressive.</EX> This example shows a negative effect of playing computer games. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, addiction to computer games causes children to get poor academic performance. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Specifically</TR>, many people can be easily addicted to computer games because the games have features that make people continue to play. Especially, since children in general have less ability to control themselves, they are more likely to be addicted and it leads to getting poor grades from their school. <TR>For instance</TR>, a report conducted by a famous psychologist shows that children addicted to playing computer games have lower grades from school than ordinary children. The expert explains that those game-addicted children easily fail to control their time and have less concentration skill on study. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I think that playing computer games gives children harmful effects. This s because playing aggressive computer games can alter children's characteristic negatively and leads children to get poor academic performance. </CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work.

column1: 985&The television has had a greater effect on people's lives that the telephone has.
column3:
<IN>Some people think that the telephone has affected on peole's lives much more than the television has. <TS><TR>However,</TR><TR> in my opinion,</TR> I believe that the television did gave a larger impact on people's lives. This is because the TV provides more reliable information than the telephone does, and because it has helped many countries to develop their economies. </TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1></TR>To begin with</TR>, the television has been one of the most essential way to obtain accurate information. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To be specific,</TR> the television offers us numerous information that were examined several times, whereas the telephone may offer us information that were not even be checked any at all. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I caught H1N1 when it was spread throughout the world. My friend called me by telephone and told me that some hospitals have medicines for H1N1. <TR>At first</TR>, I decided to go to those hospitals to get a medicine. <TR>However</TR>, I heard a news from the TV that a medicine for this disease is not discovered yet. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I could know the truth. IF I had followed my friend's direction, I would have wasted my valuable money and time. </EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, the television has stimulated the economies. </MI2> <SI2><TR>In other words</TR>, the television has affected a lot of fields of work and created uncountable jobs. According to a study conducted by Seoul National University in 2008, 10% of Koreans have jobs that are related to the television. Also, the television industry takes 13% of the whole Korean Industries, and the percentage is keep increasing. The experts anticipated that the television industry would grow up to 20% in 2015. This implies that the TV affects the economy profoundly. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, information from the televisions are reliable, and the TV can be a catalyst in economies. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I strongly believe that the television possesses great influence than the telephone does. </CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 986&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more advantageous for children to grow up in rural area that in big cities. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3:
<IN>Many parents, these days, support their children as much as they can, and some might agree with the idea of living in rural area for benefits to their children. <TS>I, <TR>however</TR>, believe that it is more advantageous for children to grow up in big cities rather than in rural area.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is easy to access to some places that provide educational benefits for those children who live in cities. </MI1> <SI1>The government spends lots money building public organization such as museum, art galleries, and theatre in urban areas nowadays. <TR>In this regard</TR>, children who live in the urban area can easily go to those places while those who live in suburban area can hardly visit such buildings. According to one survey held in 2002, 20 percent of children who live in countryside replied, "no" on the question asking if they have ever visited the museum and theatre. <TR>On the other side</TR>, 85 percent of children living in the city said, "yes" on the same question. Through this survey, we can easily find out that children living in urban area are the ones that have experienced more benefits. </SI1></BO1> 

<BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, children can readily get benefits by using the newest technology in the cities. </MI2> <SI2>As the technology has been developing, our lives have been convenient in many ways. The developed electronic devices has brought many educational benefits for many children and students at school. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, one school has started buying tablet PCs for their school students. One quarter after students used tablet PCs, their grades went up high, compared to their own grades of last quarter. Teacher finally noticed that many students have enjoyed studying by using these tablet PCs since it provides many apps that are useful and helpful on their studying.</EX></SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things concerned</TR>, I strongly believe that there are more benefits and boons for children who live in cities rather than those who live in countryside. <TR>Once again</TR>, they would have lots benefits from new technology developments and many educational places such as museums or galleries. </CO>
column23: Great essay!  Very thoughtful.

column1: 987&TV advertising directed toward children (aged two to five years) should not be allowed
column3:
<IN>Some people might say TV advertisement targeting children should be limited. <TS>However I personally believe TV advertisement made for children should not be restricted by following two reasons. The first reason is, TV advertisement will help children to enhance their language ability and the second reason Is, products made for children will be useful for children.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, as TV advertisements targeting children, directors will make easy for children to understand and memorize by using easy word. </MI1> <SI1><TR>In other word</TR>, children who are not used to language at 2~5 years old can learn it more easily. <TR>In these days,</TR> a lot of children keep watching TV in their routine life even hours and hours. At this point children can remember words through advertisement they see over and over again. <TR>In addition to this,</TR> I read from science magazine that child`s brain is very efficient to learn and acquire information which can be compare to sponge absorb water. What I mean is children can acquire language with less effort by facing advertisements targeting themselves again and again while they are watching TV. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, products aiming children are made for children which means the products are useful for children. </MI2> <SI2>In recent days many people have passion in invention for various aspects including for children. They think what will be helpful for children and what will be needed by children. <EX><TR>To clarify</TR> I heard from my uncle who has two sons that he decided to buy board with protection equipment from TV advertisement because he thought it will be healthier for his children to exercise also safe due to protection equipment. He added that it was not bad decision because one of his fat son succeed to decrease 5kg and none of his sons were injured. </EX><TR>In summary</TR>, product on TV advertisement targeting children is beneficial when children use it. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To sum up with</TR>, TV advertisements aiming children should not be abolished due to devotion to education on children`s acquire language and products on advertisements are advantageous for children. These are reasons why I personally assist TV advertisement for children should be encouraged. </CO>
column23: Your essay is good, but I can't help but feel that you are ignoring the negative aspects, like having kids beg for toys that they don't need.  It might be good to address that and show how it doesn't have to be a problem.

column1: 988&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading books about real events or people is more beneficial than reading fictional stories and novels. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>People living in the modern society definitely need some shelter to escape from the harsh reality, which is requiring, complicating, and sometimes even cruel. Reading fiction books can be one of many methods to ignore reality temporarily.<TS> Being indulged into this temporary pill, <TR>however,</TR> can get rid of problem-dealing capability out of a person.</TS> Anyone can be aside from the reality that everyone is facing. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First, reading fiction books can be described as drinking alcohol. </MI1> <SI1>At the very first moment of starting to read it, a person feels relieved as if all the problems that he was facing had finished. After finishing reading the book, left the feeling of emptiness, nothing has been done actually. Just reading fiction books doesn’t do anything for oneself, facing the reality and trying to handle things eagerly is more helpful. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, I was captivated in fantasy novels while I was in high school. The books helped me forget about exams, scores, and projects which were essential but stressful. After finishing the book, I found that there is nothing left for myself, creativity or talented imagination didn’t help me to deal with the school lives at that time. <TR>As a result</TR>, I realized that fiction books are the things for later days, and reality is always the first.</EX> </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, time is limited resource for everyone in the world. </MI2> <SI2>The efficient usage of limited time is the prime criteria which decide successful life of a person. In this point of view, it is no use reading fictions and wasting time in the fake world. It just deprives a few days out of a week, and make the reader turn around and end up seeing the worsen problems. Non-fiction books, <TR>however</TR>, let the reader be aware of the current issues, and motivate him to re-join the work that he was originally handling. The news about world famous figures, or economy, or society also helps the reader to get the grasp of reality and let him set up a new plan to improve himself. <EX>I have read about the newspaper article which states that a boy once a trouble maker in the school, had become first-leader in the school after keeping reading a newspaper and arranging his thoughts every day.</EX> Facing the reality is more than just painstaking, but fruitful and rewarding. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>As a summary</TR>, even the reality today looks harsh and painful; no one can escape from it. Especially reading the fictions is not recommended for two main reasons. <TR>First,</TR> it doesn’t change anything, and <TR>second,</TR> it is time-consuming. Reality is always on everybody’s back, waiting to be handled and arranged. Be brave and open the notebook, writing down “to-do lists” is the first thing a person has to do when feeling complicated, rather than knocking on the fake world’s door. </CO>
column23: A very good essay!  It brings up a lot of things I hadn't considered before. Good job!

column1: 989&Do you agree of disagree with the following statement? People should not be allowed to use cell phones while taking public transportation.
column3:
<IN>These days smart phones have become one of the most used electronic devices in our everyday life. Almost everyone we see in the public places have phones and use them in their own ways. <TS>Since using cell phones in the public places, including public transportation became such a common thing, I don't agree with the statement saying, people should not be allowed to use cell phones while taking public transportation.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people take phones with them for some kinds of usages. </MI1> <SI1><TR>Mostly</TR>, cell phones are used for communicating with other people who are apart from where we are. If people aren't allowed to use their phones on the public transportation, there's no point of taking phone for those of who use phone as communication method. Primary purpose of using phone on the public transportation is calling or texting someone. We are living in a very fast-moving world where everybody is busy. People want to save their time as much as they can. Using cell phone in the transportation is one of way of saving wasted time, when people need to make phone calls they'd rather do it while they are sitting on the bus doing nothing than take their important time to do it at work. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my dad is always on the phone while he's on the car. He told me the reason he does that is to save his time when he's actually at work</TR>. People have rights to use their time however they want to, therefore people should be able to use their phones on the public transportation as long as they're being appropriate and not bother others. <TR>In addition,</TR> cell phones keep you away from being bored on the transportation. In this society, people aren't very friendly to strangers. I often experienced feeling very awkward on the public transportation sitting next to someone I don't know. Phones can entertain you while you are bored and they also can save you from the awkwardness. </SI1></BO1>

<CO><TR>In summary</TR>, these days phones are not just phones, they are used as various purposes not only as for making phone calls, but also as music players, reading materials, they are even used as methods of studying. I believe that people deserve to use their phones and spend time on the public transportation in whatever ways they're pleasant. </CO>
column23: This is a great essay!  I think you could develop it even further.  Your main paragraph makes three points - why not separate them into three paragraphs and defend each one?  It will make for a stronger essay.

column1: 990&parents are the best teacher
column3:
<IN>Every people say that is there no more precious teacher like as our parents. <TS><TR>Of course,</TR> I agree that word and I absolutely think they teach everything, start from eating habit, and seat attitude and cleaning their around.</TS> <TR>However</TR>, from my perspective, I think every parents are not enough rise us more intellectual or academically. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, in my generation, parents spent hard time when they went to school, our`s economic status was very low, so they didn`t get a chance to learn more. </MI1> <SI1>So they have not enough intelligence for certain academic major or knowledge. as they suffered their childhood with work, not learning, we can learn that we have to learn and work hard instead of our`s parents who couldn’t as we do. <EX><TR>However,</TR><TR>for example</TR>, when I asked something my parents, they couldn`t answer anything. So I always inquire my curious to other teacher and people.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, as I said before, parents are not perfect teacher for us, in our country; here are many smart and knowledgeable people around me and my school. </MI2> <SI2>I get a chance to communicate with professional people and brilliant CEO because I am doing ‘mento’ program which is that I can receive counsel or advice from them. It makes me do any work more hardly and activate. I think they are my life teacher and they lead me to achieve more academic goal and for my career path. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>In the conclusion</TR>, parents are absolutely good teacher but in our life, more people can teach other things to us. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think we have to learn those thing from other people. </CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, it just needs some more development.  Give some more support and examples.  You are doing a good job!

column1: 991&Human activities have enhanced and improved the Earth. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
column3:
<IN>Earth is filled with many species of creatures and surrounding environments. In a short time, compared to long history of the earth, people made very impressive products and evolved if the topic is just limited to human. <TS><TR>In contrast</TR>, the whole earth has recessed and my argument is greatly substantiated by the reasons presented below.</TS></IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>To start with</TR>, this is because human activities are only zoomed in human, ourselves. </MI1> <SI1><TR>To put it another way,</TR> we human did not care about anything if it is related to our developent. Even in western society, they viewed nature as the products to use for their own establishment. It has not been so long that we began to care about nature, though it is little. There are distinct features that show how earth has affected by human activities. Many other creatures living on earth was just considered trivial. According to research conducted by UN, from 1900 to 1950, more than 20% of all the insects in the world extincted because they have no habitat to live in which is caused by human activity. Even more, 50% of remaining insects extinced in the period of 1950 to 2000 by human-related activities. It is obvious that human, only one sort of creatures are making whole earth devstated. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>On top of that</TR>, human activities are making serious changes regarding surrounding circumstances. </MI2> <SI2>In other words, the weathers and events occur in nature altered drastically in such a short term. There are so many things that have changed, so just crucial things could be listed in this page. This is also published on UN research, and its contents said that 40% more deserts were created since 1900. <TR>In addition</TR>, ozon layers are completely destructed in some realm, which can greatly effect on causing cancer or other serious diseases. <TR>Not only that</TR>, exotic events are happening all over the world including El Nino, tsunami and etc. I had an vivid experience, which would support my argument. <EX>In Korea, earthquake rarely happens because the location of the nation is in the middle of the plate which constitutes the Earth. <TR>However</TR>, from 10 years ago, the frequency of earthquake began to raise. Many scientists made a research to explain this phenomenon and the rationale they gave was 'the whole world environments are changing because of human activities'. Now, it is not so strange to listening the news announcing earthquake in Korea.</EX> </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, I believe human activities made an absolute change on Earth in a bad way. I even think that we should stop making a development by destructing environments. One hope is that, some people are making an effort to protect nature. They made an ally, association with who have smiliar thought. Hope this groups to be famous. </CO>
column23: Your supporting points for this essay are excellent. You have organized it well and it is obvious you have done your research.  You need to make your thesis statement a little stronger by mentioning that humans are responsible for the deterioration you see in the Earth.  Also, although I understand what your first main idea is trying to say, I think your next sentence says it better.  I'd use that sentence instead. Good job!

column1: 992&The opinions of celebrities, such as certain actors and athletes are more important for younger people than for older people.
column3:
<IN>It is evident that in our current society, one’s opinion has a tremendous importance in our lives. Some people think that the opinions of celebrities are more important for older people than for younger people, while others do not. <TS>I <TR>however</TR>, believe that the opinions of celebrities, such as certain actors and athletes are important for younger people than for older people.</TS> There are several reasons that I could discuss to support my argument so I will limit my discussion to the two that I feel are the most relevant to the topic. <TR>First</TR>, it is less stressful.<TR> Also</TR>, it is efficient. </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the most important reason for my feeling this way is that the opinions of celebrities give less stress for younger people. </MI1> <SI1>In current society, younger people are really stressed out. <EX>This reminds me of a time when I was sophomore in university. I was able to decide a candidate among several candidates because one figure I have respect presented his opinion on his Social Network Service. My parents read newspaper every morning, and watch the news whenever they watch television. I <TR>however</TR>, do not like watching the news because it is too much stressful, so it was pretty difficult for me to decide whom to be selected. <TR>One day</TR>, my favorite actor Kim posted his opinion about politician and I agreed with him. Eventually I choose one candidate whose politic philosophy accord with Kim’s opinion. If Kim were not to post his opinion about politics, I would not be able to decide a candidate and receive stress. </EX>As my experience shows, opinions of celebrities help younger people not be stressed out. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, another reason for my thinking this way is that the opinions of celebrities are more efficient for younger people than for older people. </MI2> <SI2>Success is very important in our lives. A recent newspaper article I read on the Korea Herald revealed some interesting findings. According to a survey, the amount of young CEO who are affected from celebrities has increased twofold in the past 5 years. The subjects mention that the opinions of celebrities are more efficient than those of their friends, and families. This is because many young people do watch television, use smart phone, and read books. <TR>In contrast</TR>, older people watch television, use smart phone, and read books less than younger people. Through these activities, it is easy to access to thought and opinion of eminent people. This result clearly shows that opinions of celebrities are more important for many younger people. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, with the reasons mentioned above, I believe that I have sufficiently and adequately explained my position on the matters regarding this topic. </CO>
column23: A very good essay!  Good job.

column1: 993&people learn more by watching television than reading books
column3:
<IN>It is evident that in our current society, media has a tremendous importance in our lives. Some people think that people learn more by reading books than watching television, while others do not. <TS>I <TR>however</TR>, believe that people learn more by watching television than reading books. There are several reasons that I could discuss to support my argument so I will limit my discussion to the two that I feel are most relevant to the topic.</TS> <TR>First,</TR> it is efficient. <TR>Also</TR>, it is convinient</IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the most important reason for my feeling this way is that to watch television is more efficient because it can save time. </MI1> <SI1>Commonly in society, time tend to be important. If people learn by watching television, they can get information more faster. <EX>Take my brother, <TR>for example</TR>. he can study World War more quickly because he watched a documentary. It only took 2 days to learn. <TR>In contrast</TR>, it took over 2 weeks when he study learn World War. This was because he could not understand the content on books of World War.</EX> This result clearly shows that it is more efficient to watch television. </SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, another reason for my thinking this way is that it is more convenient. It is difficult to set a time to read a book. </MI2> <SI2><TR>Thus</TR>, It can be said watching television is better because Reading books is hassle. A recent article I read on the Korea Herald revealed some interesting findings. According to the article, a suprising number of people claimed that they do not want to spend time for reading books. I found it interesting because this was due to stresses from reading books. Just last year, I was so stressed because I was too stressed out from reading books of college. As this outcome shows, watching television is better because people can relieve less stress. </SI2></BO2>

<CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, with the reasons mentioned above, I believe that I have sufficiently and adequately explained my position on the matters regarding this topic. </CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay.  Your thesis statement needs to be a little stronger, and I think you could make your main paragraphs a little longer. Otherwise, good job!

column1: 994&Some people say that computers have made life easier and more convenient. Other people say that computers have made life more complex and stressful. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
<IN>There are many people who says that computer made life more complex and stressful. Of course I agree with those opinions. <TS>However, I think computers made life easier and more convenient very much. So I think computer helped our life than making it bad.</TS> </IN>

<BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, it made our life easier to live. </MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, letters, writing, and other things. <TR>In the past,</TR> when we were wring a letter, we had to write it by our hand. I was very tired when we had to write it long. <TR>Also</TR>, when we write a writings for homework we had to write it very very long. Then our hand got very tired and hurt when we finishes the writing. And when we got a place that something wrong, then we had to erase all.</EX></SI1></BO1>

<BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it made our life convenient. </MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>, in the past, we had to find the information by reading books in the library. It was very irritating looking for the book for the information.</EX> <TR>However</TR>, if we use computers, we can find the information very fast and quick. Then we can finish our homework very fast. </SI2></BO2>

<BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, computer made our life more better. </MI3> <SI3><EX><TR>For example</TR>, computers made more working spots. There were lack of working place in the world.</EX> <TR>However</TR>, many working place came out such as profational game players. </SI3></BO3>

<CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, by using computer we can make our life more easier, convenient, and better. We feel easier to write with computer than writing with our hand, we feel more convenient by looking for the information by computer than finding a book for it, and we can live better by getting a job when you do not have a job. For these reasons I think we need computer to live our life. </CO>
column23: This essay needs some work.  I understand your first two points, but you need to defend them with more proof and examples.  Your third main idea needs to be more specific.  You are trying to prove that computers have made life better, so think of a reason that supports that!  There are many.  Please make your essays longer and think a little more about what you want to say.
